description: Diana and David Corona gave birth to their first child Xiomara Corona on April 10th 2018. As first time parents they were both excited and nervous to begin this new chapter in their lives. Unfortunately Xiomara has yet to see the outside of a hospital. She was diagnosed with a rare medical condition called congenital hyperinsulinism a condition that affects only 1 in every 50000 newborns. Medication proved unsuccesful and now Xiomara has been flown from Arizona to Texas where she is  facing the prospect  of surgery at just four weeks of age.  Few of us will ever experience the emotional rollercoaster Diana and David have been on recently so we want to help them by lessening their financial burden. Diana is currently on maternity leave and does not know if and when she can return to her fourth grade teaching position. David has also taken time off of work and will continue to do so to remain by his daughters side during this trying time. Therefore all donated funds will go directly to the Corona family to help alleviate the financial stress incurred from the hospital stays ambulance rides and helicopter flights.  Diana David and Xiomara need your love and support. Please use this page to donate or reach out to Daisy if you would like to help in another way. No donation is too small.  Every dollar donated is greatly appreciated and will go a long way in helping the Coronas successfully begin this next chapter in their lives.    Please share this page with all of your social networks.   Thank you!  Daisy and Mariana Sandoval

title: Corona del Sol Grad Night
description: Corona del Sol has always had a “grad night” lock-in at Kiwanis Park the night of graduation. It is a fun and safe way for the seniors to celebrate their graduation. This year due to a number of circumstances it was a cancelled. This is the GoFundMe effort to raise funds to get this night back for our seniors. If you feel like you can contribute to this CDS tradition and keep grad night safe and fun please do!!! This is NOT for registering students to attend. This is for people who want to donate money to offset some of the costs of planning the event on short notice.  Because I work in the tech sector  I offered by IT and technical skills as part of the leadership committee for the grassroots parent movement to save Corona del Sol Grad Night for the Class of 2018. I personally felt moved to start this GoFundMe campaign because of my son and his classmates (many whom I know in the community) deserve a fun and safe place to celebrate their graduation night.   The funds from this GoFundMe allowed the grassroots parent team to pay some of the costs to secure the Kiwanis Recreation Center Venue for May 24-25 rental.     Save Corona Grad Night

title: COVID-19 support for single mom
description: UPDATE: The reason this GoFundMe orginally started is written below. Along with her divorce still pending and now put to the side as courthouses have closed also during this time both her jobs have closed(shes applied for assurance other places but isnt sure on amounts and if or when those will be available. Shes been forced out of work her children are home from school and with social distancing child care is hard to find and limited for her to go apply at other places currently. Im hoping by switching this fund to COVID-19 support for the time being the community can help supplement some til shes able to get back to work to help her maintain the essentials for her and her children during this time. Shes wanting to leave food banks and meal handouts to those who are in worse shape than herself currently. Thanks to anyone who takes the time to readshare and donate. Stay safe and healthy out there  to read more about her story just scroll down to continue reading. Thanks Again!***************************************Orginal StoryHello everyone! My name is Susan and im here on behalf of my friend (who for various reasons we have left anonymous). She is a single mother and currently going through a divorce. This is an updated story to shortened whats happened  and currently going on. If youve visited before and donated thank you! If you are here reading and plan to donate thank you also. Please feel to share this also on facebook to help spread her story. She has 2 children and has been separated from husband during which hes given minimal aide to her while the children have been living with her and visiting him on occasional  weekends some holidays  and some extra time here and there pending on him. She juggles working multiple jobs school for the kids their homework and projects also their extracurricular activities which keep them on the go alot.  Due to her attempts to end the divorce quickly cheaply and peacefully hes decided to go the other route in which now unfortunately the children may be stuck in the middle of it despite her efforts to avoid that. I started  this page  awhile ago when i found out he stopped helping with support all together to help her with bills  she only  used it for awhile and i restarted it once things got moving  in the court system and he was running up her legal fees. Now months later with still no end in sight and the holidays  approaching i wanted to put it out there again to give her some aide to help with bills and hopefully allow her to make this holiday season a nice one for her children with everything going on. Thank you again for your help your consideration in helping and if you share this link to help spread her story to possibly allow further aide from others. Tis the season.... right?Happy Holidays Everyone!

title: Guillermina Corona Santana
description: (Spanish 1) Hola familia amigos estamos organizando este Gofundme a la luz de una desgarradora y desafortunada ocurrencia. Para aquellos que no lo saben el 23 de mayo de 2018 perdimos a una amiga cariñosa hija hermana madre prima y tía Guillermina Corona.  (English 1)Hello family friends of we are organizing this Gofundme in light of a heartbreaking and unfortunate occurrence.For those who dont already know May 23 2018 we lost a loving frienddaughtersistermother cousinand aunt Guillermina Corona   (Spanish 2 Guillermina era una madre soltera que trabajaba arduamente. Ella hizo todo lo posible para darle a su hijo todo lo que necesitaba. Era una amable y cariñosa miembro de la familia. Siempre pensó en los demás antes que en ella misma. Nunca le deseó nada malo a otra persona. En su peor momento momentos en que siempre tenía una sonrisa en su rostro y estaba lista para enfrentar sus miedos nunca la vi rendirse. Después de conocer a Guillermina Corona creemos que es fácil decir que tocó todos los corazones y almas que conoció. realmente un modelo a seguir alguien a quien honestamente admiraba.  (English 2) Guillermina was a hard working single mother.She did anything possible to give her son anything he needed.She was a kind and loving family member.She always thought about others before herself.Never did she ever wish bad upon someone else.At her worst moments she always had a smile on her face and was ready to face her fears never did i ever see her give up.Having met Guillermina Corona  we believe it is easy to say that she touched every heart and soul she met.She was truly a role model someone who i honestly looked up to .   (Spanish 3). Guillermina se encontró con muchas formas de adversidad a lo largo de su vida pero a través de su familia amigos Ella se esfuerza por convertirse en un gran modelo a seguir como madre hermana hija primo  y tía  (English 3)  Guillermina encountered many forms of adversity throughout her life but through her familyfriends She strives to become a great role model as a mothersisterdaughtercousinaunt   (Spanish 4) La tarea de recaudar fondos entre familiares y amigos es extremadamente difícil y lidiar con la pérdida de un ser querido es insoportable: por lo tanto genuinamente nos contactamos con sus amigos y familiares de Guillermina Corona para ayudar a donar. Si resulta ser eso en En este momento no puede brindar ayuda es completamente comprensible esperamos que pueda participar en el sistema de apoyo de alguien. Gracias   (English 4) The task to Fundraise in between family and friends is extremely difficult and dealing with the loss of such a loved one is unbearable: therefore we genuinely reach out to you her friends and family of Guillermina Corona to help donate .If it happens to be that at this moment you are not able to provide helpit is completely understandablewe hope you can partake in being apart of someones support system . Thank you  (Spanish 5) Gracias por su amor y apoyo nosotros la familia y amigos de Guillermina Corona estamos solemnemente agradecidos por sus generosas donaciones y su forma de apoyo.   (English 5) Thank you for your love and support we the family and friends of Guillermina Corona are solemnly grateful for your generous donations and form of support.  (Spanish 6) Descansa en paz Guillermina Corona estarás por siempre en nuestros corazones y recordado como una bendición para cada vida que hayas tocado.   (English 6) Rest in peace Guillermina Corona you will forever be in our hearts and remembered as a blessing to every life you touched.

title: Covid-19 Quarantine
description: On August 14 2018 I received a complete heart transplant at Strong Memorial Hospital in Rochester NY.Health wise it was a complete blessing. Im finally feeling better than I ever have. I am however on immunosuppressants. Its now dangerous for me to go anywhere. Post transplant I receive Social Security Disability as Ive been deemed unfit to work. Along with SSD they have assigned me to use Medicare for my health insurance. My cost for health insurance comes right out of my SSD and my medication copay has nearly tripled.Any help provided will help offset medication cost and help in obtaining life supplies through mail order as I must stay in place until this virus situation is resolved. Thank you in advance for your time and support.

title: Graciela
description: Gracie a mother of 3 has devoted her life to fighting for the rights of others. Now shes in the fight for her own. Gracie doesn’t think she’s a hero but to me and us she is. She’s using her director and leadership skills for good by creating programs for women and families. Gracie your generosity and humility inspires our entire team. It’s people like you who are changing the world one small act of kindness at a time. Gracie is fighting the biggest battle of her life.  She is staying positive with prayers and Gods blessing.      Gracie es una excelente madre de 3 jovencitos. Ella a dedicado su vida a la lucha por los derechos de otros. Ahora dolorosamente esta luchando por si misma.  Gracie no cree que es una heroe pero para mi y nosotros lo es ya que con su liderazgo crea programas gratis por la union entre mujeres  familias y ninos.  Gracie tu  generocidad pero sobre todo tu HUMILDAD nos ha a inspirado a las que formamos parte de este equipo a ser mejores Directoras y seres Humanos. Sin duda Gracie personas como TU son quienes estan cambiando el mundo con cada acto de generocidad por pequeno que sea.  Gracie dolorosamente para quien la amamos hoy está peleando la batalla más grande de su vida y aunque Ella se mantiene positiva necesita de nuestro apoyo emocional espiritual y economico asi que pido no sesen nuestras oraciones y apoyo para que  logre una pronta recuperacion y hacer de estos momentos tan dificiles para su familia lo menos pesado posible.

title: Delennys Funeral Fund
description: What was supposed to be a day of joy and happiness turned into a day of mourning. My sister-in-law and my brother were expecting to come home with their beautiful baby girl Delenny today but are now left with discussing funeral arrangements. I am making this goFundme to help them cover the cost of a funeral and burial to lay Delenny to rest. Anything helps... if you cant donate then please keep her in your prayers. Thank you..

title: In Memory of Jonathan Corona
description: In loving memory of my brave brother that fought cancer for long 10 years like a warrior. He was always very optimistic and positive spirit. One strong boy that care for his family no matter what his condition was. Jonathan a silly boy who would always spend hes birthdays at the hospital and never gave up his happiness and was happy for life no matter How hard it was! Even at hes worst times he would crack jokes and try to make us laugh. We lost a champion. He’s smile alway full of dreams!    En memoria de mi hermano tan valiente que peleó contra el cáncer por 10 largos años y nunca se dio por vencido! Siempre fue tan optimista y positivo. Venció el cancer varias veces hasta q su cuerpo no pudo más. Un muchachito con el espíritu tan fuerte que siempre veía por su familia y los demás. Jonathan a pesar de estar internado siempre daba por contar sus chistes y hacernos reír su sonrisa siempre llena de ilusiones.   Any help is welcome we highly appreciate.   Cualquier ayuda es importante hasta un dólar muchas gracias!

title: Surgery for Prostate Cancer
description: Hey everyone. I want to thank you for taking the time to click on this link. For about 6 months my dad was having excruciating pain in his groin and eventually we were told it is prostate cancer. Luckily it is in its early stages and it has not spread.  My dad’s surgery was originally scheduled for June 29th but was moved to the end of July because of my dad’s weight. He has been working hard for a couple months and has been doing great but our doctor wants him to lose more for his own safety and for the procesures chances of working to increase. While we are thankful for the early stage cancer we are struggling financially. My family has never been crazy rich but we also don’t survive off off every paycheck. My dad is self-employed which means he has to work to make money and doesn’t have a given “salary” each year- it all depends on his amount of work done. My mom works with the school system so we are down paychecks until school starts up again. My parents are both incredibly hard-working people who always put us her kids before them. Always. My parents don’t ask for other people’s help but lately the vibes in the house rough. We are tight on food and also have very very many animals to take care of (16 to be exact). We would really appreciate any donations we need every bit that we can get right now. Please share this link to everyone you know. Thank you so much for taking the time to read this; I appreciate it!

title: Support fund for Marilou
description: As many of you may know Marilou Corona-Wullstein was in a serious rollover accident earlier this week while she and her son Mitchell were in Texas on July 5 2018.  The man who witnessed the accident said the car was headed straight for a pole and by Gods grace the car avoided the pole which would have been much more serious for both Marilou and Mitch.  Mitch was not hurt during the accident (thank God) but Marilou had to be airlifted to a hospital where she underwent multiple surgeries for an open fracture of her arm with gross contamination and tissue loss broken back and other injuries and had a multiple-day ICU stay.  Unfortunately the expense of the transportation and treatment Marilou received were not covered fully under her insurance and is praying for some assistance to help with the substantial medical bills.  Marilou will be released from treatment on July 11 and is blessed to have a friend who will transport her to Colorado stopping every hour during the drive to minimize risk of blood clots.  Marilou is an incredible inspiration to those around her. She is a recent breast cancer survivor and through all of the treatments she remains positive and grateful for the blessings she continues to receive daily.  Those that know Marilou know she is giving and full of grace and shares her spirit constantly with those around her.  She is in need of all of our help now so please consider supporting Marilou.  All funds raised through this effort will be used to pay bills not covered by insurance. Please pray for a full recovery for Marilou!  Thank you for your support!  May God bless you!

title: Lets Make EROCK plumbing A Reality
description: Hello everybody! As I’ve been updating pics and my work status on social media I’m sure you have figured that I am no longer with my previous employer. I started off at that franchise 11 1/2 years ago with the intentions of never really leaving and working my way up the ranks.  At the time I was hired I started in the office as a customer service representative.  No positions were available in the field so I figured that I would make it out eventually. I worked my way up through the company as planned through out the years from data entry scheduling appointments and managing the Hawaii branch remotely from Orange County.  I was finally given the chance to be a technicians helper in the field after 5 long years of office work. This is when the hard work started and I figured out plumbing would be my life long career. I started by assisting in locating and repairing leaks on pool/spa systems.  After a couple of years assisting in pools I moved on to my apprenticeship in residential leak locating and repairs. I was given the opportunity to run my own truck as a technician after all the training. Within 2 years I hit the ceiling and became Orange County’s top producing technician but I didn’t feel satisfied with the limited knowledge of plumbing that I had gained.   My next step was to move on to another company which was much more versed in all aspects of plumbing from residential commercial industrial service plumbing repairs remodels and new construction. The pace was so fast and the days were so long that it felt as though I learned 5 years worth of plumbing within a 1 years span that I was with this 2nd company.    After some hardship due to the limited amount of time I had with my family I decided I needed to go back to my original employer in order to slow the pace down again and figure out my next move.  When I got back to my old employer I realized that the skill sets that I acquired throughout my career no longer fit in with the companies structure.  I was being used to train others such as helpers and senior technicians as to what I had learned without being compensated.  The company let me go because I didn’t agree to work for free.  Now suddenly I was left jobless and with a family of 5 daughters and a wife to provide for.  I took this as a sign and the opportunity to begin my own plumbing empire.  During this time it not only humbled me but gave me the drive to pursue my dream.  This is when EROCK Plumbing and Repipe went from being a dream to something I need to achieve.   The name EROCK Plumbing and Repipe is dedicated to my best friend Erik Ortiz that passed in a tragic accident in 2014. Knowing that he had always wanted to be a boss but never got the chance to do so this is my way of fulfilling his dream as well.   Since I’ve been unemployed I have continued with submitting all my legal documents to register my business namelicenseand tax i.d. # with the state. I have enrolled in school to gain my plumbing license so that once the legal documents are processed I can take my test to then become a legitimate company.   I intend on using my platform in the community to also support awareness of Substance abuse depression awareness and breast cancer awareness.   I’m asking asking for your help. I’m asking for donations to fund the purchase of a used utility truck any more business fees that may need to be paid equipment purchases and create a home office.    My wife will be the manager/ co owner and I also intend on bringing more family on board to create EROCK Plumbing.    Any amount of donation will be greatly appreciated and will be utilized towards the final goal of this business start up. You have all been very supportive in my mission to become a Plumbing entrepreneur and I want to thank you for being a part of my journey. You are all considered a part of the EROCK Plumbing family by donating.   This is definitely out of my character to ask for help but it definitely needed. Thank You!     Miguel Ortega

title: In-Vitro Fertilization Support
description: Hello!   You may know me online as Javanshir or beiua but if you were around even further in the past youd know that my actual name is Edgar Corona.  I have been with my wife Gabrielle since October of 2007 and we have been married since August of 2012. We recently bought our first home in Southern Oregon; a 3-bedroom home that I have been actively remodeling the interior myself with aspirations of starting a family. However it has been evident that we are unable to naturally start our own family...  In 2014 my wife Gabrielle had an ectopic pregnancy. That is a pregnancy that begins within the fallopian tubes instead of the uterus. This resulted in a very early-stage miscarriage. In 2015 she had an additional ectopic pregnancy however this pregnancy resulted in the need for emergency surgery. This surgery was when we discovered she had the said miscarriage in 2014---and now both fallopian tubes are scarred shut and we have been told attempts to repair the fallopian tubes is infeasible. She is no longer fertile.  That said we have been looking at the other options. We spent a weekend taking state-required classes for foster and/or adoption. We looked into adopting an international child. But in the end we still dream of the idea of conceiving our own children... however these are still a fallback plan just in case.   This is where the In-Vitro process comes into play. For those who dont know what In-Vitro is the simplest way I can describe it is a petri dish baby that is eventually injected for potential implantation.   ...if only it were that easy! We recently received our In-Vitro Fertilization schedule so the ball is now rolling and it is a daunting process of costly drugs carefully scheduled to be used for weeks on end along with regular medical consultations at an office that is hours away. We are only able to afford a small handful of these costs along with the inevitable cost of driving to and from the clinic and missing time from work. I work for Anheuser-Busch and my health insurance does not cover infertility procedures. My wife works in the banking industry and her insurance only covers the consultations.   The nature of using the drugs needed in the In-Vitro process is already scary enough... and to see the costs is even worse! We are both scared but very hopeful. The chances of In-Vitro working as intended is very slim and often requires repeated attempts... but the repeated attempts means higher cost. There may be a point when we run out of funds to try again and simply become hopeless.  Im not sure how to say this but we need help. From anyone. Any amount of donations would be beneficial for us no matter how small. I am reaching out to anyone because we have done everything we can so far. We have a home careers family but no financial assistance for In-Vitro Fertilization procedures.  If anyone can help us in this matter we will be eternally grateful. Our goal is $12000 because that is the initial quoted amount for a single attempt. Repeated attempts are said to cost less but we are hopeful on a first attempt being successful! But again any amount helps us more than you can imagine. Any questions are welcomed.  Thank you for reading!      [edit 8/5: We learned our insurance covers some of the basic medications such as the birth control required to put her on a more controlled menstrual cycle and antibiotics we both need to take prior to September. For this among other reasons the initial quoted amount has been reduced]

title: Shane Coronas Funeral Service
description: Everyone who knew Shane knows that he had a heart of gold. A rare person that would truly go out of his way for the ones he cared about. A father uncle friend teamster and free spirit who will live on in all of our memories. Please help contribute to raising money for his funeral services. Anything that goes over the costs will be donated to his daughter 12-year-old daughter Maia Corona in the form of a college fund account. Thank you.

title: Lori’s cancer treatment
description: Lori was diagnosed with Brain Cancer in May 2018. Since then she and her family have been working tirelessly to educate themselves on the management of such a hefty foe. This management includes medical costs that are not covered by health insurance. With several stints in the hospital this past year Lori has moments that are reassuring and at other times severe relapses. Through it all they have kept optimistic.   Lori and husband Tim both veteran firefighters have managed to stay strong through this ordeal; however the financial burden is becoming heavier with Lori unable to work and Tim currently a Paramedic serving San Bernardino County has had to take family leave to care for Lori full time. Their son Sammy has been a trooper in all this helping where he can and truly being the glue that helps to keep this loving family together.  As family friends we ask that you consider making a donation to the Korioth Family. Every contribution big or small helps to keep Lori Tim and Sammy fighting and moving forward. We thank you from the bottom of our hearts for any and all the help that may come our way during  this emotionally and financially stressful time.

title: In Memory of Jeff Murdock
description: In response to the outpouring of requests from people wanting to help weve set up this fund. Your support will help cover memorial and other expenses incurred by Jeffs family.

title: Help 2 Families Stay in Corona QNS
description: *****[En español abajo]*****  Help Two Immigrant Families Stay In Their Neighborhood of Corona Queens  We are a group of anti-gentrification activists and tenant organizers in Queens and we are trying to prevent the displacement of two immigrant families from their long-time neighborhood of Corona Queens.  We need your help to make sure they are able to stay in Corona.  The two families are related and have lived above the space occupied by IMI Corona for the past 11 years.  IMI Corona a valued community center and refuge for immigrant families recently received word that they have to leave the space where they have built a strong connection to the surrounding community.  Just like IMI Corona the two families above the space also suddenly received notices that stated they had until August 31st to move out or face going to housing court.  IMI Corona and the two families are being evicted by the same landlord Robert Gans who has a 17 building real-estate portfolio that includes Metropolitan Lumber   Hardware the old Scores strip club and a dozen other commercial buildings in Corona and Astoria one of which houses a senior center that is also being evicted.   With August 31st fast approaching the two families have been searching for affordable apartments to move into.  This has been made difficult by the wave of gentrification that has swept Western Queens and has caused rents in Corona to soar.  The donations collected through this campaign will help the two families pay for part of their security deposits or brokers’ fees—the total being split between the two families.  You can read IMI Corona’s public statement on the news they have to move out of their current space by clicking on this link:   IMI Corona public statement    Thank you and please share this with others so that we can meet our goal.  In solidarity.  ----------------------------------------------  Evitemos que el aburguesamiento expulse a las familias de Corona -- Necesitamos su ayuda!  Nosotros somos un grupo de activistas en Queens y estamos luchando en contra del desplazamiento con fines de mantener a estas dos familias en Corona. Estas familias inmigrantes han vivido en Corona por 11 años y están siendo expulsadas por su dueño de casa. Necesitamos de urguencia recaudir fondos.    IMI Corona es un espacio muy valorado en Queens y sirve como un centro communitario e un refugio para inmigrantes. Hace poco IMI Corona fue notificado que tendrá quedesalojar del espacio muy pronto. Tal como a IMI Corona a las familias tambien le dieron una fecha del 31 de Agosto para desalojarse o ir al tribunal de viviendas.   IMI Corona y las dos familias están siendo desalojadas por el mismo dueño de casa Robert Gans quien es dueño de 17 edificios incluyendo Metropolitan Lumber   Hardware un strip club Scores NY y otra docena de edificios comerciales en Corona y Astoria. Uno de esos edificios es un asilo de la tercera edad lo cual tambien esta siendo desalojado.   Con el 31 de Agosto en unos cuantos dias las familias han estado desesperadamente buscando departamentos asequibles sin suerte. En si esta busqueda por viviendas asequibles en Queens es parte de una ola de aburguesamiento que esta arrasando con la ciudad de Nueva York. Las donaciones seran colectadas a medio de esta campagna virtual lo cual sera compartido entre las dos familias. La plata recaudida ira a pagar el deposito de seguro y para un brokers fee.   Usted puede leer el testimonio de IMI Corona acerca de la situacion aqui:   Testimonio pública de IMI Corona    Se le agradece mucho! Favor de compartir esta campagna con su redes para llegar a nuestra meta de $2000.   Siempre en la lucha y en la solidaridad !

title: Diamer Basha and Mohmand Dam Fund
description: Prime Minister Imran Khan spoke to the nation in a brief televised address on Friday evening to appeal for donations to the dams fund set up by the Supreme Court.  There is no question that we are faced with several significant problems the prime minister said as he began the address. Our debt today stands at Rs30000 billion but the biggest problem we currently face is the water crisis.

title: Send 6 Local Leaders to UWDCongress
description: Somos Seattle is requesting community support to help send six local LGBTQ immigrants rights leaders to the United We Dream Congress October 5-7! Because after all LGBTQ rights are immigrant rights.   UWD Congress is the largest immigrant youth led gathering where leaders come together to craft the national and local agenda for immigrant rights. DACA (Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals) is one of the major victories achieved from UWD Congress.   Given the current administration we need WA State and our leaders to be present trained and energized! You can support local on-the-ground immigration efforts by making a donation today.   ----- Somos is an organization for LGBTQ Latinx folks. Our goal is to build an active community share resources and foster spaces for learning   growth. Your contribution is tax-deductible through our fiscal sponsor Rainier Valley Corps whose EIN is 47-4257834.

title: Help us raise money for our dad
description: On behalf of the Corona-Reyes family please help us raise money for our beloved father grandfather brother uncle and son. He was on his way home from Mexico to celebrate his granddaughters birthday but was called on by our Heavenly Father.  We are devastated by our loss. He was a great father and we miss him dearly. He is currently in Matehuala. We appreciate anything that will help us bring him back home.

title: Corona Transgender Project - TDOR
description: The Corona Transgender Project is raising funds to host the 2018 Corona Transgender Day of Remembrance.  The Corona Transgender Project will honor the memory of those whose lives were lost in acts of anti-transgender violence throughout the country.  Transgender Day of Remembrance (TDOR) is an annual national observance usually observed on November 20.  These funds will be used for the following: - Advertising - Book A Main Speaker - Candle Lights - Chairs - Sound Equipment    For more information or sponsorship opportunities:  Anisa Escobedo / Anisa@CoronaTrans.org / Cell 951.482.6256

title: Dario Corona Funeral Expense
description: Dario Corona  was killed by a hit and run driver on September 22 2018 while walking near Highway 99 in Fresno.  (Olive Ave west of Polk Avenue)  Tragedy hit the family last week and we are trying to help them raise some funds to assist in burial expenses. We thank you for any support you can provide and any amount is appreciated.

title: Jose’s Recovery
description: We need your Help. My cousin Jose had to have open heart surgery today. He had double Bypass surgery.  He is the hardest working person I know. He’s biggest worry is how fast he can go back to work so he can provide for his family. He has no Medical Insurance and will be out a work for a little while we he recuperates. He is a Truck Driver so he works for himself and has no income while he is out of work.  He needs  your help with these hardship. His medical bill is going to be astronomical.  He is the kindest funniest person I know.  Any donation will be greatly appreciated.

title: Help Corona Beat Cancer!
description: UPDATE:   Yesterday I went to get Corona a check up at the oncologist unfortunately I was given bad news...  Coronas cancer has come back and progressed. Its been approximately 6.5 months post operation and the news feels worse than the first time around...   After shaving her stomach (after all her hair finally grew back from the operation site) we found a large 5 cm growth on the lower part of her abdomen.  I dont know what I should do next the oncologist recommends that I switch to IV form of chemo (I have been doing oral for the last few months). However this change of treatment comes with a much higher price tag. If you could I hope you would consider donating even a little to help me cover the costs of changing over to the new treatment plan (per session it costs approximately $900). The oncologists believes that if we do this there will be a great chance of slowing down or reducing the size of the cancer and stopping its spread.   I hope you will considering helping support Corona through her battle with her transitional cell carcinoma cancer.   I thought that if the cancer came back that this time around it would be easier to face and deal with but after so many months of feeling in the clear (regardless of the complications that presented like kidney infections troublesome UTI complications etc) its hard to come to terms that Ill see her suffer and watch her health degrade aagain...      Thank you all for your continued support.          __________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________        This is Corona she is the love of my life.    Corona is a 7-year-old Chow Chow. She was diagnosed two weeks ago with  Transitional cell carcinoma  which is a  bladder cancer . When I first heard of her diagnosis my heart dropped. In my eyes she was the healthiest dog in the world.   I wasnt very optimistic at the time because after doing some reading online I learned that this cancer is very aggressive and animals generally do not live very long... All vets I saw were convinced the tumor had diffused throughout the entire bladder meaning it was one of the bad cases.   Some GOOD NEWS  was given to me yesterday! After running some more tests it turns out that what the doctors had thought was not the case. Her tumor was in the good area and had not been diffused and is not located by the urethra.  Her tumor is in an area that makes surgery and removing possible!   However my oncologist said I have to move quickly and have the surgery within the next 2 weeks before the cancer starts spreading to other organs and her kidneys look like theyll be the next place it will spread to.    This surgery is more complicated than other tumor removing surgeries because of the location within the bladder. The surgery alone is estimated to be within $4000-$5000 and chemotherapy is a must for after the surgery because of the aggressive nature of this type of cancer. Chemotherapy ends up being about $700 every 3 weeks.   I have come to GoFundMe in hopes that Corona will be able to have enough money to get her surgery. If Im able to generate even a little funds to help me cover the bill it will help me pick the best course of action for my girl.  The funds generated from this campaign would go towards Coronas tumor-removing surgery and chemotherapy treatments. The doctors think Corona has a chance to beat this cancer a chance that most dogs with this cancer dont have!   Being a student has made it hard for me to cover all the costs associated with getting her the care she needs. Up until this point Ive spent over $5000 on costs incurred along the way to this diagnosis. The doctors initially thought she had a stubborn UTI. She was treated for 3 months then they thought she had bladder stones (costing me $1200 in surgery) to then find out it was cancer :( During this time due to extreme discomfort she was experiencing she broke her canine teeth biting at the wall which resulted in having to do emergency dental work   getting root canals costing another $3000 on top of the treatments and tests for what they thought was a UTI. Currently I am extremely financially strained but I really want to do everything I can to make sure Corona will recover! She means so much to me and I made a commitment to her when I rescued her!  If you can help in ANY WAY it would mean so much to both of us!   If you dont know Corona I want to share with you her story (well Corona and Is love story).  My mother and I rescued Corona from a farm in Wisconsin she had been chained up outside and left with a very little amount of food during the winter months. Luckily shes a chow chow and has a warm coat.   When we first met Corona she was WILD she had become a scavenger and eating all the locals farm animals. Even though she was like this the moment she and I met we had a bond. She came right up to me and sat at my feet. I had never once in my life had an animal react to me like this before the pets my family had growing up usually favorited someone else in my family. She didnt bark or growl at me as she did to the other people around.  Thats when I knew I found the love of my life.    Its been about 5 years since we first met  shes gone from living wild on a farm in Wisconsin to moving to Canada and being a city girl in Montreal . Theres no other way I can describe our relationship other than what Ive said previously that shes the love of my life and I believe I am that to her as well.   If you are able to help me out in any way (even with just advice or your experience if youve had a dog go through this cancer) any contribution is greatly appreciated!    If you are or have gone through cancer with a pet I am so sorry. Its such a hard and confusing thing to go through.     Corona and her friend Sabrina!

title: Stanley Corona’s passing.
description: In lieu of flowers please support our family in this tremendous loss. Any donations will be accepted in gratitude and love.

title: Raul Corrales
description: This morning we woke up not knowing it would be the last day i would see my grandfather alive. He was a caring loving hard working person that i can honestly say did not have a bad bone in his body. He was murdered today on 10/09/18 in a drive by shooting on the west side of long beach. He was an innocent bystander hit by a stray bullet. He was watering his lawn and was simply taken from us an innocent life cut short. Never in a million years would our family have thought that this would occur to us. We are caught between walls here because our grandmothers diabetes treatment is expensive and we did not expect this to occur. He leaves behind family and friends who have not a bad memory of him a hard working honest man who achieved the american dream. Rest in piece TATA. All donations are greatly appreciatedthank you we cant express it enough.

title: 2019 Greater Corona PRIDE
description: The Corona Transgender Project is proud to present:  2019 Greater Corona PRIDE   The Greater Corona PRIDE mission is to promote the public education and public awareness of individual rights and civil liberties of the lesbian gay bisexual and transgender community and to promote the history diversity and future prosperity of the Greater Corona LGBT+ community.    For more information or sponsorship opportunities:  Anisa Escobedo / Anisa@CoronaTrans.org / Cell 951.482.6256

title: Help Piper march in the Rose Parade
description: I hate to ask for help but here is our story. Piper is crazy talented in this thing called color guard!! She just got a spot in the Tournament of Rose Honor Band and Color Guard. She is the first out of state student to be marching with this amazing organization in it’s 90 year history. But along will that comes a price. Piper will be receiving college credit for this but because she is out of state we have to pay out of state tuition which isn’t cheap. I have never been one to spoil my kids I know how to say no but one thing I will not say no to is her education and following her dreams especially when I see her talent. I work almost 6 days a week and when I’m not working I’m volunteering my time with school color guard just to be involved in her life. And I hate to say it but her father has pretty much turned his back on her and we get no help from him. I do all I can to make sure she can live her dreams even putting off my back surgery. See I already lived my dreams and now I want to see her live hers!!! Piper and I work as a team we have sold about 10 boxes of chocolates together to pay off her fall season fees and travel fees so trust me we don’t sit around just asking for donations and money. They say always ask the worst that happens is someone says no and there’s no better support then from your family and friends. So please find it in your heart not for me but for Piper to support her dreams even if it’s just $1. We both truly appreciate your kindness and generosity from the bottom of our hearts?????? Thank You!!!!!

title: Martha Aranda
description: Amigos con el corazón pezado les damos la noticia de que nuestra adorada Martha Aranda se nos ha adelantado al cielo para estar al lado de Dios dejando atrás a sus tres hijos Martha Cathy y George y a muchos seres queridos. El día Sábado 13 de Octubre fue el trágico día en que sucedió un horrible accidente automovilístico en el que Martha Aranda fue atropellada y el cual le quitó la vida. No hay palabras para describir lo que sentimos en estos momentos pero queremos pedirles a todos un poquito de su ayuda. El Último deseó de Martha fue ser enterrada junto a sus padres en Ahuisculco Jalisco y que no le lloráramos mucho si no que le celebráramos su vida y alegria con una buena banda sonando. Les pedimos su ayuda en esto para poder tener los recursos de cumplirle su sueño y que sea puesta a descansar en su tierra natal. Cualquier sea su aporte será agradecidamente recibido y le ayudara infinitamente a la familia Aranda.   Friends it is with a heavy heart that we bear the news of Martha Aranda’s passing. On Saturday October 13th tragedy struck our family when Martha Aranda was involved in a pedestrian accident which ultimately ended her life too soon. She has gone to heaven way too soon and has left behind her three loving children Martha Cathy and George. There are no words to express the pain that we all feel during these hard times and we want to ask for a little of your support. Martha Aranda’s last wish was to be laid to rest next to her parents in her hometown of Ahuisculco Jalisco. She would have liked to see us all celebrate her life with the same joy that she lived it with. We ask you all for your help in accomplishing this last wish of hers. Any little bit helps and will be greatly appreciated.

title: Abundance Farm
description: By understanding the wisdom of Nature we can heal the earth and in doing so we heal ourselves.    We are Alejandro Corona (Alex) and Audrey Thomas (Kali). Our passion for the environment and farming has led us to establish Farming for Abundance an initiative whose mission is to accelerate the transition towards regenerative agroforestry. We believe we can heal the earth through smart ecological farming practices.  In 2015 we started Abundance Farm in Raglan Victoria Australia. We are in the process of turning 97 acres of weathered sheep pasture into a diverse chemical free and regenerative farm using agroforestry and mixed animal systems. This has been the biggest adventure of our lives.   Kali and Alex storing hay for the cows with the help of Shanti and the cheeky chooks (Photo by Beatriz Corona)      What weve accomplished in the past three and a half years   So far we have fenced and planted a forest along the creeks and boundary areas. We also removed old fencing that was a risk of injury to wildlife.  With volunteers and friends’ help we planted 3500 native trees and shrubs that will provide wildlife refuge improve the waterways and reverse erosion.   Alex and Kali planting trees in 2016   We are grazing a small flock of laying hens on pasture. They live in mobile houses with lots of space to roam.   They eat vegetables that were rejected due to their shape or colour. By diverting them from landfill we avoid the methane pollution it would create. We also cook and ferment grains herbs spices and minerals to keep our hens healthy and happy so they can provide people with delicious and healthy eggs.   The chooks upcycling unwanted pumpkins (Photo by Alejandro Corona)   We started grazing a small herd of Angus cattle as well which we move regularly with the principles of rotational grazing. The cows eat the tall grass promoting the growth of fresh green grass for the hens as well as providing them with fresh and yummy cow patties that the hens scratch and spread looking for insects mycelium and undigested grass seeds…  We have recently started providing beef that is ethical and regenerative as an alternative for conscious omnivores.  Our rotational grazing mixed animal system helps maintain the pastures and forest healthy by cycling organic matter which feeds the soil micro-organisms and sequesters carbon.   Our complementary animal system: cows and chickens roaming the land  (Photo  by Marianne Khol)    We have been working on drought proofing the farm as much as possible by investing in small dams rain water tanks and pipes that reach the whole farm.  We have also applied regenerative earthworks that increase water infiltration in the soil and stop erosion.   One of the little dams that we built as part of our orchard system  enjoyed by farm and wild animals alike. (Photo by Kali)    We have planted an apple orchard that is maintained and fertilised by geese and ducks. We wish to extend the orchard throughout the farm with various other fruit trees to provide people with healthy fruit from many rare heritage varieties.   Weve planted more than 80 apple trees from 18 heritage varieties (Photo by Kali)   And we are just getting started…     The next step   We are currently building facilities comprised of two shipping containers and a shed which will allow us to wash and pack eggs fruits and vegetables and store them with refrigeration.  The shed will help us more efficiently organise the farm resources and divert valuable food waste from landfill. The facilities will provide a space that can serve as a resource hub and empower other farmers in the western districts of Victoria.   Kali packing eggs in the work-in-progress shipping container facility (Photo by Alejandro Corona)    We are planning on increasing the size of our flock of hens in a very near future so we can provide more eggs.  We are confident that we will achieve all our goals with hard work and thoughtful planning but with your help it would accelerate our project and allow us to have a greater impact faster.   One of our hens enjoying her mobile home (Photo by Sofie Holt)      What we need to achieve our goals   We are asking for your help to advance our project and inspire others in our region and the rest of the world.  Here is what we need:  1. If we raise 6000 AUD we can afford to build our own mobile brooding facilities. Brooding our own hens will allow us to:  ·      Raise healthy chickens on pasture from the day they are born ·      Increase our free range layer flock so we can be profitable ·      Breed heritage dual-purpose poultry  2. If we raise 30000 AUD we can also afford one more mobile free range house for 500 hens. This will increase our income and achieve financial viability for our project.  3. If we raise 39500 AUD we can also finish the farm facilities. This will allow us to:   ·      Pack and distribute farm produce and eggs more efficiently ·      Manage farm resources ·      Upcycle more food waste ·      Offer our facilities and resources to help other regenerative farms  4. If we raise 57500 AUD we can also afford a solar system to operate our facilities off grid and limit the use of a generator to a backup situation only.    Summary:  1. Mobile brooding house for raising 500 hens: $ 6000  2. Mobile chicken house for 500 laying hens: $ 24000  3. Shed roof refrigeration and permits: $ 9500  4. Solar panel array 7.28kv batteries inverter and generator: $ 18000  Total needed: $ 57500     With your help we can have more happy and healthy hens roaming our land  (Photo by Sofie Holt)     Come have a taste of the farm   If you are a farm supporter of $150 or more you will receive a full Abundance Farm experience with a guided tour where you will have the opportunity to meet our feathered and furry friends and learn about regenerative agriculture.  Join us and other farm supporters while we enjoy a feast made with local and farm produce as well as home made pizzas.  We will watch the sun set behind scenic Mount Cole while we enthusiastically taste our 2017 Shiraz wine made with local organic grapes cared for and picked by us.  There will be many dates available on Saturdays. You are also welcome to spend the night camping on the farm BYO. There is also the option to book luxury accommodation at Mount Cole Cottages which is only few kilometres away from the farm.  If you are unable to come to the farm we can arrange to deliver a farm gift pack within our delivery areas.   If you donate $100 or more you will receive a farm calendar and a t-shirt*.  If you donate $60 or more you can choose between a farm Calendar or a t-shirt*.  If you donate $30 or more we will plant and dedicate a tree in your honour.   There are many challenges faced by small scale farming. With your help we can achieve our goals and make a difference in the way we think about our food systems. Thank you for taking the time to read and share.  “The time has come to reclaim the stolen harvest and celebrate the growing and giving of good food as the highest gift and the most revolutionary act.”  Vandana Shiva    *for international or interstate orders postage fees may apply.

title: Sally Sal Memorial and Funeral
description: Sals humorous personality will be remembered through his daughter family and friends. He was a loving father uncle brother and son.  His generous personality and helpful deeds made him everyones friend.   He lost his battle with liver and kidney failure on Saturday 10/20/2018.  Any donation is greatly appreciated to help pay for the funeral and burial arrangements.  The De Alba Family greatly appreciates your love and support.   **Please be advised this is the Only Go Fund Me account for Sal.

title: Yetty nos necesita!!
description: Les contare un poco sobre mi.  Mi nombre es Georgette pero mi familia y amigos me conocen como Yetty. Yo y mi esposo Ricardo tenemos 3 maravillosos hijos Fer Gerry y Sofi. Recientemente recibimos una noticia que nos tomo por sorpresa y totalmente desprevenidos.   El día 05 de Octubre fui diagnosticada con Cáncer de Amígdalas (Tonsil Cancer). Los doctores indicaron que debo iniciar con quimioterapias de inmediato.       En este momento mi esposo no cuenta con los recursos económicos suficientes para un tratamiento tan costoso y lamentablemente yo no cuento con un SGMM que me cubra dicha enfermedad y tratamiento. Es por esto que nos vemos en la necesidad de pedir la ayuda de todos ustedes. Como todos saben el cáncer es una enfermedad agresiva y muy rápida. Por lo que el tratamiento es muy urgente.  Yo y mi familia estaremos eternamente agradecidos con todas las personas que nos puedan apoyar en esta causa que por mucho ha sido la batalla mas grande que hayamos enfrentado. No importa cuan grande o pequeña sea su aportación estarán en nuestros corazones el resto de nuestras vidas.

title: Martin Luna
description: https://youtu.be/ShJG2O85vbA   Martin tiene esta enfermedad hase 9 anos a tenido muchos tratamientos y ninguno le a funciondado. De 3 anos para aca el ah estado en un programa voluntario que le an dado diferentes medicamentos an sido anos muy dificiles para el ya que se la pasa en hospitales muy seguido su estado es mas critico esta ves ya que ningun medicamento le funciono y lo van a tener que operar para el dia 5 de Noviembre. Esta enfermedad tambien le sale por afuera en su pien. El nesecita nuesta ayuda ya que no va a poder trabajar y pagar sus medicamentos. Les pido que porfavor y ayuden a esta familia yo la conosco personalmente y se que estan pasandon por un momento dificil. Hoy por el y manana por ustedes! Les aggradesco con lo que puedan ayudarlo y que porfavor lo tengan en sus oraciones!   Martin has had Ulcerative Colitis for 9 years. Hes been on different types of programs where they have been experimenting with him but as of today nothing has worked. He is constantly in and out of hospitals and this condition is in the inside and out(as seen on pictures).  This time thing got difficult and he need to go into surgery of the 5th of November this is one surgery out of 3 that he needs. He needs help with paying his medication and everyday bills that need to be taken care of. Anything would be gently appreciated as I always say today for him and tomorrow for you. Thank you all I ask to keep him in your prayers!   https://youtu.be/QPolcKbTgIE   this is a video  explaining his conditon.

title: Father seeking to reunite with son
description: To whom may read this  First thank you so much for taking the time to read my message.   This all begins with me meeting Kristina towards the end of 2010 online ( we met on MySpace I believe). We started dating and not long into it 3 weeks or so she gets arrested for child neglect ( see link )  http://archive.tcpalm.com/news/fort-pierce-mom-arrested-after-tot-found-alone-on-street-home-filthyep-388567336-345582252.html/  . I decided to take the police report and news reports with a grain of salt and kept the relationship going while she was in jail. When she got out of jail (about 2 months later) she moved in with me since her mother moved during the time of her incarceration. Due to failure to show progress to the court her case worker and to myself not only had she lost her daughter to the father living another state away she lost a boyfriend who had seen her disregard for what happened.    It was Nov of 2011 when I bought her a bus ticket to live with her mother in TN (Crossville) about 5 months later I get a phone call from an unknown number that happens to be her on the other end saying I ruined her life and that shes pregnant. Given the amount of time we had gone without seeing each other I asked for proof like a picture of herself pregnant. She refused and I didnt hear from her after that. 2 months later she ends back up in Fort Pierce FL my home town. I notice she actually is pregnant and the time line fits. To make sure they both are OK I agree to take her to appointments buy her food etc.. but I wouldnt buy anything for the baby or give her money without a paternity test. In short I suggested that she save all the necessary receipts and Id gladly pay what I owe. Upset that I didnt want a relationship she began telling me things in spite i.e  He wont have your last name Im going to name him after your exs new bf. I will admit that she managed to make me upset to the point where I did tell her that if he is mine I will take him away. From there she leaves to a state unknown to me to have the baby.  Fast forward 6 months: she reaches out with an alias and a picture of a little boy that looks just like me. I get a couple pictures and short dialogue before she ask me for money. I told her we need this done right so I want to go through court and establish paternity and get her set up with child support. With that said the cycle repeats itself and now she is completely under the radar.    It has been 6 years since and during that time Ive contacted IRS DCF CPI everyone short of a private investigator to let them know a woman is claiming I have a son with her and I want to find him. No one would help me unless she filed for state services and since she could be anywhere there was no way to know where to begin. Nevertheless the search began although no one I could reach knew where she was or who she was with. I could only hope she would pop up and I left every social media outlet available to me open with full contact information in case she ever wanted to try contacting me again.   In July of this year through Facebook friend suggestion algorithm  I noticed a woman that resembled Kristina. I click on the page and sure enough it was her! I reach out to her with full understanding she could delete her account and disappear again. This time that wasnt the case. She was actually willing to talk saying that he (my son) already has a dad and my son is very well off. That he has a grandmother now and a family. I was OK with everything she was saying I just wanted to know he was doing well and wanted to build rapport with her again. A month goes by and she tells me after talking to her fiance they agreed to introduce me to Daniel and explain to him Im his father. Danny and I had a few face to face video calls it was great! he even got to meet one of his sisters on video and luckily I was able to screen shot them talking for the first time! After about a week of finally getting to that point things started to unfold with her situation. She began asking if I could take her in for a while because her fiance is mean to my son and grandmother is equally as mean and she cant take it anymore so I told her to let me think it over.      (The first time Danny and Destiny were met)  Out of nowhere I got a phone call from a number in Pennsylvania. My roommate is also from PA so I thought it was for him and answered the phone. An elder woman asks if Im Mynor to which I replied I was.   She says  Im Katie and Im the person your son has been calling grandma. We get well acquainted and she started emailing me photos of Daniel which was heaven sent but was shocked when I heard what she had to say which in summary was she is retired from school administration a Sunday school assistant and her husband Lee is retired NYPD. She had been looking into me and came to the conclusion the person Kristina was describing Dannys father to be was very much untrue that she believed Daniel was not in the best of care with her (Katies) son and Kristina ( now Chelsea) and began telling me all the ways she felt he was being mistreated. How prior to Kristina moving to PA she was living in a drug home that had just got busted according to her son that she called Lancaster child and youth services and welfare fraud to report her for what she called  neglect of Daniels well being and abuse of government assistance. Since Kristina found out what Katie had done after the visit from a case worker she sent Daniel away on which she called it a vacation and she followed shortly there after but not before blocking me from contact. Since reconnecting with her son Katie was able to have her son open up about things and he felt guilty about what happened so hes trying to help with information. With the information I have obtained I hired a private investigator to track them down. With amazingly quick results I now know she is back in TN and has a brand new fiance and a new alias ( now Michelle) on social media after less than a month from leaving PA and ex Fiance. With this I now have her address and I have to have documents served.   This is where you come in. I have exhausted all other resources at my disposal. My ultimate goal is to get full custody. This little boy my son has sisters aunts uncles a big family and support system waiting for him. He would have all the attention a growing boy needs and many willing to help me provide guidance for him as he grows but the longer I wait the possibility grows shell find out and once again leave and would have to start the search again.   Im begging you the reader to understand this is not for me. This is for Daniel. His future. The money donated to this cause will go towards legal fees and anything needed/related that would help Daniel and his family reunite.    Your patience for reading this understanding of the situation and contribution is greatly appreciated from the bottom of my heart and thank you for your consideration. If any questions concerns or words of advice feel free to reach out to me.  Mynor Corona

title: Funeral de Trinidad Corona
description: Mi abuelita Trinidad Corona nació el 20 de Noviembre de 1946 y falleció el 6 de Noviember de el 2018 a causa de un fulminante paro cardíaco. Que Dencanze en Paz. A toda la familia y amigos les pedimos de todo corazon una ayuda ecomonica para los gastos de el funeral. Gracias por su ayuda y que dios los bendiga.    My grandma Trinidad Corona was born on November 20 1946 and pasted away on November 6 2018 due to a Major Cardiac Arrest. Rest In Peace. To all the family and friends we need your help economically for  funeral expenses. Thank You and May the Lord be with you.

title: WINTER/CORONA-VIRUS HOMELESS CAMPAIGN
description: We have more people on the street than ever Winter is a time where the homeless are really affected its never nice not seeing your family or love ones and many of the homeless have not for years but we can bring some cheer along with food clothing and even a santa with presents for all. Your donation keeps us running it fuels our bus it keep us legal on the street where we can make a difference. It pays our gas and electric this allows us to cook and buy the extras we serve up to the guys ever week over 150 are having bellies filled. We do homedrops every week to those who get into accomodation but having spent months or years on the street they often have ilness ormalnourished. We give between £40-£50 in good food and even provide TVs and Radios...we are all volunteers we are all commited to bringing support and change to Homeless   Rough Sleeper.........but only with your help.  And some info on what we have provided in our last year   11000 meals 1300 food parcels 2 ton pf food per week most of which is waste or close to sell by date 4000 beds for the night given to 350 men 27 women 19 victims of abuse/violence 7 on the night Police brought or referred 16 people.  Streetvets service for Homeless Dogs part of our Sunday Street Kitchen. . 39 active Vets/Volunteers. They have seen   registered 131 dogs in the city.

title: Carmela and Jayden
description: On Wednesday November 14 2018 our dear friends Carmela and her son Jayden were victims of a collision that took place near their home at Keele Street and Finch Street in Toronto Ontario.  They were standing at the corner of Four Winds Drive and Keele Street when they were struck and pinned under a full-sized cargo van.     https://www.cp24.com/news/woman-child-struck-after-collision-in-north-york-1.4176543     Luckily quick-acting bystanders were able to lift the cargo van and free both Carmela and Jayden as First-Responders arrived at the scene. They both suffered severe injuries but we are extremely thankful and fortunate to still have them with us. Sadly they will have a long and painful recovery ahead.   Carmela is a devoted mom and wife who delights in providing Jayden with a healthy positive loving childhood.  Jayden is a kind-hearted young boy with much liveliness and charisma. They were inseparable before the accident. Now due to the severity of their injuries they are receiving the best care possible but in hospitals at opposite corners of the city of Toronto.   The family is doing their best to alternate their time between Carmela and Jayden.  Carmela’s husband is doing his best to split his time between his wife and son.  As one can only imagine his life was turned upside-down upon learning of his loved-ones’ accident.    Carmela and her husband are self-employed business owners. Now with Carmela’s hospitalization and her husband’s time spent in travel and visitation their retail business is temporarily on-hold.  Both Carmela and Jayden’s recoveries will demand a long hospital stay and require several surgeries and intense emotional mental and physical therapies.  We ask for your prayers for a speedy recovery and any monetary support that you can give. All funds received will be allocated to pay for medical expenses logistic expenses and lost income.  From the bottom of our hearts we thank you for your prayers and support. Please post and share; your invaluable support is very much appreciated.

title: COVID-19 Emergency Outreach &Relief Fund for Trans
description: $10 $30 $50 $100   Up      This is a urgent request for your donations   support due to this nation   International  COVID-19  aka coronavirus  Emergency Epidemic knowing that your donations   support will help save the lives of our most vulnerable Transgender Community.  Our Nonprofit Organization  is Strictly dedicated to the Safety Security Protection    Well-being of Transgender Individuals ages 18 25  65   Up.  By Supporting our Nonprofit Organization is saving the lives of the world most vulnerable.  ( Global transgender safety tasks force. USA inc (EIN 36-4910216 ) . your donation will help us respond Quickly in this  COVID-19  epidemic to our most vulnerable Trans youth Trans Elders    Trans Young adults  and keep our office doors open. Respectfully: Grace Lawrence. www.globaltrans-safetytasksforce.org

title: Final Arrangement Expenses For Dianne
description: On Friday November 16th we lost our beloved Dianne Akers unexpectedly due to complications of a car accident. Dianne was loved by so many people. She was born in Ohio and came to live in Hemet CA for the past 20 or so years. She is survived by 1 daughter; Cheryl 3 sons; Dennis Dwayne and son Daniel(who proceeded her in death) grandchildren great grandchildren and great-great grandchildren.   She did not have any pre-death arrangements and no life insurance or funds put aside for end of life expenses. With this being said the last thing that we want for the family to worry or deal with at this time is any financial burdens. The funds raised will go directly to Dianne’s final arrangement expenses.   With her sudden death we are asking for any support you can give to help cover her cremation/final arrangement costs. We understand that this time of year is hard for everyone with the holidays but on behalf of Dianne any assistance financially or service you can provide to honor her would be greatly appreciated.   We appreciate your thoughtfulness support and prayers during this difficult time.

title: Genesis Drum & Bugle Corps
description: It is a honor to join the Genesis Drum   Bugle Corps. If you help me out even with a $1 donation I would appreciate support towards living my dream.

title: Dream Chasers Holiday Equipment Fund
description: Hello Everyone  For this Holiday season we are asking for Donations to our kids’ baseball program the DreamChasers Academy. The DreamChasers are a Non-profit travel baseball organizations based out of Brooklyn New York who’s main goal is to Create Better Academic Opportunities through Baseball. Over the past 12 months our kids have enjoyed much success both on the field and off:  winning countless major tournament events and landing many of our roster players on the honor rolls in school. We are currently seeking to raise $7000 as an organization to help us with the purchase of equipment for the 100+ kids we will be serving in 2019. If you can find it in you to donate at least what you would spend on a cup of coffee today you can help us grow our program immensely. By helping us reach this goal you will also be helping us keep the costs down for the families of all our participants. Thanks for your consideration!

title: Supporting Brandy and Parents
description: Brandy Lino-Corona        On September 20th of 2018 driving back from my Rowan University I fell down a small hill near the blueberry farm in Hamilton Township. I thank God I only suffered a couple of bruises and a huge headache. It was truly a miracle I was able to climb out the car with no major injuries. At that moment the only thing I wanted to do was call my dad. The lady who helped me get out the vehicle lend me her cell phone. I did not know that making that one phone call would change our lives completely. While I was being taken to the hospital I overheard on the ambulance radio that there were multiple collisions with people in critical condition near the location where my accident occurred. It never crossed my mind that my sister and father were involved in that accident. I found out hours later when my uncle arrived at the ER. My father and I made it out from our accidents with no major injuries but my sister Brandy was hit the hardest during the impact. She suffered a severe traumatic brain injury. She was fighting for her life in the ICU. Brandy had to get multiple surgeries due to her brain constantly swelling. She is now considered a stable patient at an inpatient rehabilitation hospital. My sister who just turned sixteen in August and I share a wonderful sibling relationship. She is my best friend and my sunshine. Watching her in the condition she is in upsets everyone who knows her because there is not one day you do not see her with a big smile on her face laughing and making jokes. We would always go for ice coffee runs and sing every day at home. We had made plans to visit her dream school travel for winter break go to prom train for softball and so much more. The last thing I told her before leaving that morning was that I loved her and the last thing she texted me minutes before their accident was “Don’t be scared. I love you..” My family and I have been trying to raise money to help my parents and sister with any expenses they have to make. Even though you don’t know my sister I promise you that you would love to be around her. This will be a long journey for us but as a family we are taking it day by day. Thank you for your support.

title: Maria (Concha) Corona
description: Only the Best for the Gates of Heaven        When we lose a loved one we are often left with the why questions.  As well as the woulda coulda shouldas. One might take solace in knowing that our dearly departed is with the lord and that others who have preceded them in death will be there to greet them. However there is a special peace that comes with the notion that the Lord takes only the best first. Sometimes it might be true and others we simply only see the best.  For those good memories are what keeps the departed alive in our hearts.  For Maria Conception Corona that notion is the absolute truth.          On Saturday morning January 12 2019 Concha as family and friends called her lost her life and everything that represented her and her memory to a tragic house fire.  As the matriarch in her family she leaves behind 4 children 12 grandchildren and 3 great grandchildren.        We are reaching out to anyone who can help the family with funeral expenses.  In addition her husband and youngest son Michael who made it out of the fire are in need of basic items.  The fire was so overwhelming it consumed all they owned.        Mario and Michael Corona wish only to have Concha back.  On their behalf we humbly ask that anyone who has any clothing underwear shoes socks jackets new or used  would please donate them.  You may contact the person whom is responsible for your awareness of the situation or the family directly.  Anna Corona at (480) 888-5629 or Roy Corona at (919) 423-0156.           The irony? While the family only wants her back without thought of material items Concha the nurturer that she was would be asking for help to take care of her family if she could.      When you leave a donation you can leave a message for the family. This will help in their greeving process. Any donation is greatl appreciated.     -Thank you    Solo lo mejor para las puertas del cielo  Cuando perdemos a un ser querido nos queramos con el ¿por qué? Así como lo habría podría o debería haber echo. Uno puede sentirse aliviado al saber que nuestros queridos difuntos están con el señor y otros que han fallecido y que quizás estén allí para saludarlos. Sin embargo hay una paz especial que viene con la noción de que el Señor solo toma lo mejor primero.  A veces puede ser verdad y otras solo vemos lo mejor porque esos buenos recuerdos son lo que mantiene a alguien vivo en nuestros corazones. Para Maria Concepción Corona es la verdad absoluta. Una matriarca en su familia tiene 4 hijos 12 nietos y 3 bisnietos.  El sábado por la mañana 12 de enero de 2019 Concha como la llamaban sus familiares y amigos perdió la vida y todo lo que la representaba a ella y su memoria en un trágico incendio en su casa.  Nos estamos acercando a cualquier persona que pueda ayudar a la familia no solo con los gastos del funeral sino a su esposo y su hijo menor quienes lograron salir del fuego solo para encontrarse ansiosamente haciendo intentos peligrosos para volver a entrar a la casa para salvar  querida he’s posa y mama. El fuego era tan abrumados por fuera como por dentro.  No lo pudieron a lograr.   Mario y Michael Corona solo desean recuperar a Concha pero humildemente preguntamos si alguien tiene ropa ropa interior zapatos calcetines chaquetas usadas o nuevas para donar que se comunique con la persona responsable de su conocimiento de la situación o la familia directamente.  Anna Corona al (480) 888-5629 y Roy Corona al (919) 423-0156.   ¿La ironía? Si bien la familia solo la quiere de vuelta no importa el material Concha solo pediría ayuda para cuidar a su familia.  Cuando deja una donación puede dejar un mensaje para la familia. Esto ayudará en su proceso de codicia. Cualquier donación es muy apreciada.   -Gracias

title: Jais Gender Affirming Surgery
description: My name is Jai Lola Corona and Im a Transgender Mexican femme. Im 33 years old and have suffered from gender dysphoria ever since I was 14 years old. I was always afraid of becoming who I felt inside because I live in a world that doesnt give visibility to people like me. Transgender women are constantly being harassed or killed for being different. Our current president wants to make trans people invisible by taking away our rights. Were living in a very tense gender climate.   I came out as transgender last year because I needed to live my truth. I suffer from depression and anxiety all because of gender. Unfortunately I still have masculine features that prevent me from showing my true colors. When Im in public spaces I have the most anxiety about my gender and how people perceive me. Many times Im mistaken for a boy. These moments of anxiety are disabling and I often stay in bed fearing being misgendered in public.Ive been on hormone replacement therapy for 6 months. This does not affect some features testosterone has done so Im stuck feeling gender dysphoria when Im presenting femme in public.   Im starting this campaign to fund a very life changing procedure called facial feminization as well as laser hair removal. This 10hr procedure will create softer feminine facial features making my face recognizable feminine. The procedures are: rhinoplasty trachea shave brow lift hairline lowering brow bossing jaw/chin contouring. These all might seem like cosmetic procedures but this is meant to help my mental health around my gender presentation.   Many of you know Im an independent hairstylist and have to pay rent for my chair on top of paying rent to live in my apartment. Theres a 2 week recovery before I can get back to work. Part of the cost of this campaign will help me pay for my rent while Im recovering from my surgeries.

title: Long live Mario Funeral Services
description: Hello Dear friends and family    Mario of only 16 years old tragically lost his life and became and angel Thursday night Jan 31. From a traffic accident on El Segundo Blvd and Broadway.      Please help us help his family lay him to rest.    If you can’t donate please keep Mario in and his family in your prayers    Rest In Peace little friend.....ACTIVE CREW      ?? ?? ?? ?? ??

title: Corona Del Sol Grad Night 2019
description: Each year the Corona Del Sol PTO hosts a drug and alcohol-free party for our graduates.  This event takes dozens of volunteers and thousands of dollars to put on.  We rely on the generous contributions of alumni community members and parents to keep the cost low for our students.  Thank you for supporting Grad Night 2019!

title: Zachary Muñoz
description: Memorial Thursday March 14th 2019 12:00- 9:00pm Rosary @ 7:00pm Forest Lawn Memorial Park 21300 E. Via Verde Dr Covina Ca 91724  Mass  Friday March 15th 2019 9:00am St John the Baptist Catholic Church 3883 Baldwin Park Blvd Baldwin Park Ca 91706 Burial to follow at Forest Lawn  Reception Following Burial Heritage Neighborhood Center 7350 W Liberty Pkwy Fontana Ca 92336  Attire Viewing and Burial White or Beige Light colors    Zachary Devin Munoz was a loving son brother uncle friend and boyfriend. He leaves behind his parents siblings nieces/nephews aunts/uncles friends and girlfriend.   Zachary loved listening to music and enjoyed life to the fullest. He loved going outdoors whether to build his car or walk his dog. He enjoyed playing baseball since he was a young boy. He loved being surrounded by his close circle of friends and family. He has  a great smile that brightened everyone’s day. One could get lost in his amazing eyes and he has a heart full of love joy and selflessness. He liked experiencing new things and was always up to a new adventure.   Zachary tragically lost his life at the young age of 21 on Tuesday morning in a horrile car accident.                        “Angels always come early                knocking on the door to our hearts      allow us for the moment to know perfection                         and then suddenly depart     But I wish God would give me wings                        to Heaven I would fly”

title: Help send Nani to the Cornell Veterinary Program
description: My name is Ariana Rivera Corona and I am a sophomore at Copenhagen Central School in the small but beautiful village of Copenhagen N.Y. Recently I was fortunate enough to be accepted at an early college program for high school students Animal Science Sustainable Animal Husbandry at Cornell University. I have been dreaming to get into a program like this and I would never in a million years thought that I would be able to do it. However they loved my application and due to my grades and all my accomplishments at school  I was accepted.  The program will give me an opportunity to have 3 college credits from an IVY league university and to obtain an incredible experience for my future.
