Moreover I will be able to give back to my community by using my new knowledge to help farms around our town.   However in order for me to participate of the program I have to pay a fee of $6500 that will cover the college credits materials room and meals for the entire program. I was able to reach out to Cornell University and because they really see a potential in me they awarded me with a $1300 scholarship. They couldnt give me more because they have other students to help too. Therefore I am reaching out to all my friends family and community to request for donations that will help me be able to cover the rest of the cost.   This is a once in a lifetime opportunity and anything you can donate will help.   Thanks in advance for your help!

title: Jose Rangel
description: Dear family and friends  As you all may know we suddenly lost someone very special and dear to our hearts. We lost a beloved Brother Father and the best Tio anyone can ask for. After much discussion with the family we have come to the conclusion that what he wanted the most was to be buried with his beloved mother (Jesse Ubina). My mother Marina and I are fortunate enough to be able to cover his cremation and viewing but we are not able to cover the cost of burying him with his mother. Our family has had to grieve two losses within a week and has had to cover two funeral services. We are hoping with the help of our family and friends that we can lay my Tio to rest where he has so desperately wanted to be with his mother. We are asking for any donations to help assist us in giving my Tio his final wishes and resting place . Our family would like to thank you in advance for all your support well wishes and love that people have shown us.  With much love and gratitude  The Rangel Corona and Valenzuela family.

title: In need of a Riding lawn mower
description: We recently made a big move to Indiana after leaving the military.  Recently my third daughter Madeline being born has made things tight financially. With Spring  approaching quickly we are in need of a riding lawn mower since we are renting a house with alot of land. We have been searching for a used lawn mower but have had no luck unfortunately. So heres a shot in the dark to see if I can get just a little bit of help in buying a new one.

title: Tony Corona’s Funeral Arrangement
description: We are saddened by the untimely death of Tony Corona our beloved son brother  uncle and friend. A simple man who had a huge heart.  He was devoted to his family especially his nieces and newphews.  Due to this tragedy it has left his parents with unexpected expenses.  Juan and Ana Lucia Corona will appreciate any donations and help with the proceedings.

title: Kokua for the Sumalpong ?Ohana -  Used Car
description: I have initiated this GoFundMe on behalf of the Sumalpong ?Ohana (Lynette Corona Chris Sumalpong and Kiana Sumalpong).   They currently reside in Cazadero and are in desperate need of a reliable automobile. Their one reliable car was totaled in the recent floods of February 2019. Their home was damaged but remains liveable.  They have been experiencing some challenges in the past couple of years. They moved up from Hawaii to care for Lynette’s father.   The father lived in one of the Mobile Home Parks which burned in the Tubbs fire. He made it out but suffered major trauma and hardship. Sadly he passed not long after.   Lynette was recently laid off due to the company being sold after relocating from Santa Rosa to Cazadero.  Lynette and Chris are a hardworking and loving couple wonderful parents to Kiana who is in High School. They have so much aloha for the people they meet. We met several years ago at an event our Santa Rosa Junior College Hawaii Community Organization hosted. We have been friends ever since.  A donation of any amount would be greatly appreciated by me and the Sumalpong ?Ohana. They will have direct access to any and all funds. If you learn of a reliable car for sale please contact me.  Also please share through your networks.   Humbly and gratefully for your kokua Liko   Pictures of the family and damaged car

title: Loving Dad in need of help. Immigration  expenses.
description: We have a family emergency due to something that happened on the 31st of March. Our dad was arrested for being involved in a car accident now hes being held by Immigration and unfortunately hes the breadwinner of the household so now were faced with trying to pull together funds for his legal fees and trying to pay our bills and utilities. Im not very familiar with this page or with fundraising things but was pointed to it because well we need the help. Weve got no other way to pull this money together so every penny is appreciated.

title: Ayuda para Ayde
description: Hola mi nombre es Ayde tengo 42 años soy madre de 2 hijos y la mayor de una familia de 3 hermanas. Hace 9 años fui diagnosticada por primera vez con cancer de seno pase por quimioterapia  radioterapia y mastectomia radical de mama; ahora me encuentro con la sorpresa de que nuevamente se encuentra en mi cuerpo cancer pero ahora en el pulmon. Sinceramente y con el corazon en la mano no pregunto a Dios porque? Sino para que? Que se me esta olvidando aprender? Que estoy dejando de hacer? Pues solo quiero ver crecer a mis hijos y poder ver envejecer a mis padres y ayudarles en esa etapa de su vida acaso es mucho pedir no quiero dinero lujos joyas no solo quiero tiempo solo tiempo Dios.Pues cada dia que amanece lucho amo admiro y suspiro por un poco de salud para poder hacer y tener sueños para poder vivir para alcanzarlos cada dia abrazo la vida como los arboles extienden sus ramas tratando de alcanzar el sol solo tengo  esperanza y fe de poder lograrlo pero creo que mis fuerzas no me van alcanzar. No estoy derrotada estoy mas viva que nunca y el cancer me ha enseñado que las cosas y sucesos malos tambien tienen cosas buenas y enseñanzas de vida. Me falta mucho como a todos por lograr pero primero Dios y solo el sabra. Les doy infinitas gracias por su apoyo y pido mil bendiciones que dios les de mas y les multiplique. Attentamente Su amiga Ayde  Hello my name is Ayde and I am 42 years old. I am a mother of 2 amazing kids and part of a loving family of 3 sisters. 9 years ago I was diagnosed with breast cancer for the first time. I went through all available treatments like chemo and a full mastectomy. Now I find myself in this situation again but this time the cancer has developed in my lungs.   I sincerely and and with all the pain in heart ask God why? Why me again? What do I need to learn? What am I doing wrong? I just want to serve you and watch my kids grow up is this too much to ask for? I dont need money or luxuries I just want time.  Every day when I wake up I fight I love and I pray for health to live and reach my dreams of being with my kids to hug kiss and hear them laugh. I just want the opportunity to do so I will fight and endure what is necessary to beat this disease.  My doctors are not giving me much hope and tell me that the process is very costly and painful but I refuse to give up hope. I have not  given up and I am more determined then ever to survive. If there is one thing I have learned that for every bad thing that happens something good comes and there is always something to learn from the experience. I put my faith in God and I will not lose hope until my last breath. I thank you in advance and ask God bless you for your attention and any help you can give! My family and I will always be in your debt and you will be in our prayers. Sincerely Ayde.

title: Japan Trip
description: I have been selected to go on an EF Tours trip to Japan with my classmates from high school in the summer of 2020. This is an amazing opportunity for me to experience a new culture and will also be a great learning experience . Please help me fund this trip.  Any donations will be greatly appreciated. Thank You!

title: Grandma Walton’s Car!
description: Grandma Walton has proven herself to be an amazingly loving caring faithful and productive member of our community. She is contagiously positive despite living on a fixed income and not having much resources. Today I found out that she took a few buses to come to church. She usually serves in any manner she can and attends all services. While many are home sleeping she never misses our 6 am Tuesday morning prayer. She’s shown herself an amazing person... but her car died. She has no transportation yet still gets around promptly and never complains about her inconveniences as an elderly person. I felt led to buy her a car but many others asked me to allow them to be a blessing to her as well. So here we are trying out gonfund me. We’ve submitted this endeavor to be overseen by our Celebretion church governance and all funds will go directly to purchasing a suitable vehicle for our dear friend Grandma Walton. If you feel led to give please join us!

title: Penn Hills Odyssey of the Mind World Finals
description: Please help support our team of 6 high-schoolers from Penn Hills.   Chloe Campbell Sophia Corona  Logan Depew  David Lubawski Zoeie Morgan Katie Russell.    Odyssey of the mind is an international creative problem solving competition.  It challenges young minds using team work creativity and the ability to think outside the box.  Throughout this process they bring a variety of skills to use.  One day they may be working using computers and technology or power tools to build their set and the next day they are writing witty scripts and practicing their acting skills.  All the while using salvage materials and creativity as a team. The team has worked very hard over the last 7 months.   They competed in March at the regional level and moved on to the state level.  This past weekend at the PA state competition they were awarded the Renatra Fusca ( a very special award in the Odyssey of the Mind competition) which means WE ARE GOING TO THE WORLD FINALS!!     World Finals is a four day competition in Michigan with teams from all over the world where they will represent Penn Hills.  We are all excited and honored but it will be costly.  There are registration fees travel expenses room and board among other things.  Our team needs to raise $10000 in 1 month. Please help our kids get to the World Finals competition at Michigan State University.   Any donations would be greatly appreciated.

title: My Moms Funeral Expenses
description: We are short on my moms funeral plan and when she passes they will not take her unless its paid for we dont know how long she has you could be two hours it could be two days but anything anybody can donate would be really really appreciative thank you

title: Corona Entertainment Endorsment
description: raising money to support my girlfriend drop out of pointless work and go to school to be and engineer my big bro went to MIT I can too its my dream to be a cad engineer I love and appreciate any and all support!!!

title: Arturo Coronas Funeral Expenses
description: Arturo corona was an amazing soul to say the least his light shined when you needed it the most he was someone who you could always count on to make you smile or just even give you a simple laugh. On the morning of April 12th at 2:30 AM he was involved in a fatal car crash. He was a college student who worked two jobs and was dedicated to making his life better. As you all know it’s hard losing someone especially someone so young and full of energy that was ready to make a positive impact in this world but what’s even more tough is covering sudden funeral expenses on top of that.I am here to ask for financial help for Arturo’s family with covering the expenses anything at all is welcome and very much appreciated. Thank you from the bottom of all our hearts.

title: Jorge A Arreguin Rios
description: Con el corazon roto mis hermanos Alex Danny y yo Luis  decidimos crear esta cuenta. Hemos perdido a nuestro Papa Jorge A Arreguin Rios que  fallecio este Viernes 12 de Abril en Jacksonville Florida. Su alma abandonó este mundo pero siempre estará presente en nuestros corazones.  Les quisieramos pedir de su ayuda a nuestros familiares y amigos con una donacion para ayudar a nuestra mamá Dalia Corona con gastos funebres. Cualquier cantidad nos ayudará. De ante mano se lo agradecemos enormemente...

title: Please help our family out through hard times.
description: Hello everyone my name is Jaysalee Im a wife grandmother and mother of 3 wonderful boys. Im doing this fundraiser for a few different reasons. Times have gotten really hard this year for my husband and myself. And we are struggling to pay all our bills. Im sure everyones been here at one point in their life. But this is too much for me. Everything seems to be failing all at one time. I work but its not enough to make ends meet. Im looking for another job right now. My husband just had surgery he has been out of work. Without his income we dont know how we are going to be able to pay our rent and utilities. Please any kind of donations will help so much. Im also trying to raise money for my son graduation and college. This is something that I have to make great for him. My son has been on honors roll in school for years and hes graduating this year. Hes worked really hard in school and he does volunteer work  all the time. Im very proud of him. Hes a good boy. And he deserves to have everything for graduation. But right now Im struggling to make ends meet. A little help can go a long way. Every dollar helps.  Its hard for me to ask for help. I never want anyone to look down on me. Or to be embarrassed of me for asking for some help. But what would you do if all you do is cry and feel hopeless because your struggling  to make ends meet. I never thought that I would have to ask for help like this but I do. I would really appreciate any help. A little can go a long way. Thank you to everyone that helps. My family and I appreciate and are very grateful to you all.

title: Help save our Manteca Dojo
description: Valley Warrior Arts has been in business for 7 years. Sensei Jason has worked extremely hard to get our Manteca dojo up and running. Valley Warrior Arts is a wonderful place where kids can go to learn martial arts  fitness and discipline. Sensei Jason is humble kind and truly passionate about what he teaches. We hope you can find it in your heart to help with any amount you can donate towards keeping our beloved Manteca dojo open. Thank you from the bottom of our hearts.

title: Jessica Castro
description: Hello all  Please help support The Castro family in a time of need. Jessica Castro 22 passed away after a long and courageous fight against her medical illnesses. Jessy always had a smile and an outgoing spirit despite what she was going through. She taught so many of us what true bravery looks like and to always look at life with a positive outlook. During her many months of hospitalizations the burden of medical bills grew and we the nursing team who helped care for her want to help alleviate that stress from the family. Any little donation helps. We also do ask that you not share this link publicly but rather via text message or e-mail as the family wishes to have their privacy respected. From the 10 East Nursing team we thank you all.

title: Residency card for employment
description: My name is Karla iam a recovering addict trying to get my life together.iam only 28years old.  I am seeking employment but have been turned down several times due to the fact that i dont have my resident card to further my application to be hired. Iam a college graduate unfortunately i went down down the wrong path but am determined to get my life back in order attending my program weekly . iam a mother of 4 including a 3 month old. I want to be a great mother and be able to provide for my children . all i need is 540.00 for replacement of my card to get hired. I would really appreciate your help to make this possible. I love my children and they are my reason for living  i made a mistake but i came to my senses and realized how wrong i was to take the easy way out. I have realized how blessed iam with my beautiful children and wont let them down. I will finally graduate from my program in august and will be getting my children back in september but i need to be ready to provide for them and live in a safe environment. Which will be possible if i was working. Please touch your hearts to help me out you will not be disappointed. God bless you guys.

title: Hope For Yahir
description: Yahir Corona is a Warrior! Sadly Our Warrior Has Gained His Angel Wings Today At 8:35 a.m.. He fought his cancer bravely long and hard and we will forever miss his smile and his laugh. We know Yahir is With our Lord and Savior in Heaven and Free of Pain and Suffering. Fly High Our Angel and Welcome To Your Everlasting Glory.  Money raised will help Erika and Orlando with expenses and bills. We thank those who have generously and graciously donated already. God Bless.

title: Ewing Sarcoma
description: Hello everyone. As some of you already know my brother Alfredo Corona has been suffering with Ewing Sarcoma.  It is a cancer that affects all areas of his body. He was first diagnosed back in 2016 when he had just turned 16 years old. He was in remission for a whole year and now the cancer has returned. Both my parents agricultural workers who need  help taking care of my brother. We are trying to raise money for food and transportation. He has to do chemotherapy treatments for the next 6 months in Seattle. My mother has stopped working to be with my brother during this difficult time. Any help would be greatly appreciated. Thank you.   hola amigo este es mi hijo Freddy el esta padesiedo un canser muy agresivo y los m?dicos del hospital Seattle childrens ya ledijiero que eyos ya no pueden aser nada que suenfermeda yano tiene cora pero yo tengo muchafe en Dios y encotramos unedico en Tijuana M?xico y nos da muchas esperanza de vida para m? hijo el tratamiento no sale en beintemol d?lares les pido que sean generoso en esta vida todos seamos padres y no que remos que nestos hijos muera lespido sus orasones y su ayuda economica gracias.

title: The Corona Cleanup Charity
description: Corona Cleanup   is a nonprofit organization dedicated to promoting public awareness of responsible waste management. The goal here is to fund the website for at least a year to generate public interest and recruit volunteers. No amount is too small! We appreciate YOU!

title: Corona Girls Softball 8U Silver All Stars
description: We our proud to present our 2019 Corona Girls Softball 8u Silver All Star Team!  These 13 ladies have worked hard all year long and now they will spend their summer representing our League and City of Corona at various tournaments throughout Southern California.  We are raising money to help support their season and any donation will help make an impact. Thanks in advance for your contribution to these girls and their amazing journey.  More information about Corona Girls Softball: Promotes self confidence good health. concepts of team and sportsmanship courage and respect for girls from 5 to 18 years of age through Fast pitch softball.

title: Help For Baby Richie
description: Hello This is Richies story he was born 7 weeks early. Mom went through California testing and everything seemed good with baby and no reason to worry besides a little fluid in his kidneys. Mom was monitored weekly and the issue seemed to be resolving itself.  When Richie was prematurely born they told us the issue was still there along with 3 other defects. Since our baby had so many issues all together at once they called in a geneticist and took blood samples. We were interrogated and asked a series of questions after 3 weeks of emotional torture finally they had a result for us. The doctors said Richie has a very rare syndrome with only 300 cases reported in the world. By definition individuals with this rare syndrome have difficulty eating so automatically all efforts to teach my premature baby to eat by the nurses were diminished. They put a tube in his nose and my son was barely given a chance. Doctors insisted that we would have to leave the NICU with a Gtube in order to successfully feed Richie.  After weeks of arguing with rude nurses and being there for our son we proved to them that he didn’t need a tube in his stomach. We spent 7 weeks in an understaffed hospital with no bedside manner and gossipy nurses. They fed my baby cold breast milk and they also relied heavily on sugar water packets to calm down babies. It was a horrible experience and now my baby is suffering from all of it on top of the syndrome. He was repeatedly pricked on the hands and feet he was around nurses and doctors who lost hope in him but he will prevail.  I know Richie will move mountains and I will help him along the way. I want to be able to get Richie the best help possible but my insurance unfortunately does not cover the physical therapy my son requires for his age along with other services he needs. We visit several specialists he has started treatment for his surgery we have several copays and medications and as much as I would like to be able to cover this myself it has become a little bit hard. We need help for Richies pediatric therapies and surgery but above all we need your prayers for our little boy. Thank you for time and support any help we receive is greatly appreciated.

title: Family in sudden crisis; help a loving mother
description: I write to you all today on behalf of my mother Sandra. My hero an extraordinary mother wife friend and employee. I am starting a GoFundMe page to help her during this time of need. My mother was admitted to the hospital on Tuesday April 30th 2019 after enduring bouts of severe abdominal pain and fever. Upon admission they gathered lab work she underwent a pelvic ultrasound a CT scan and further examinations. The physicians at Banner Hospital were able to identify a ruptured cyst on her left ovary a tubo-ovarian abscess of her left fallopian tube and further infection that had spread to her organs. They tried multiple strong antibiotics and a drain to help the infection this failed to improve her condition. On Wednesday May 1st momma underwent surgery and had her left fallopian tube left ovary and appendix removed. As I write this on the 5th of May my mother remains in critical condition. The doctors suspect the infection is widespread and she will most likely need additional surgery. I plead that you all help us in our time of need. My mother and father the breadwinners are currently not working due to the nature of my mothers situation. Me their eldest daughter I am currently recovering from a recent Rottweiler attack to the face and my youngest sister is currently recovering from right hip surgery. We have had quite a tough few weeks. We just need the support of our friends family and our community to get through this. My mother does have medical insurance unfortunately she has quite a large deductible. If we can raise this money we would be able to cover her medical expenses and their lost wages for this week. We hope she will recover soon and I will update the page to keep you all posted. Thank you in advance for all of your help. All donations matter and are greatly appreciated.    We are a strong family unit and we just want to get past this and be able to return to our lives as normal.   -Brenda Corona

title: Violet’s Softball dream
description: Help Send Violet to Florida to represent LB!  Los Altos Youth Softball 10U Girls were invited to play in the Babe Ruth Softball World Series in Florida.  A try out was open to all girls in the 10U age group and our Violet was one who made the cut. This will be a chance of a lifetime for these girls.   This tournament lasts 10 days (July 25-August 3).  The players will have conditioning workouts friendlies and  games. With some time for a little sightseeing in between.   Costs involved:  Unfortunately the league does not cover the cost for the girls to go. They do help provide a uniform everything else is the girls/families responsibility.   Violet has to pay for round trip air fare ($1200) hotel for 10 days ($1500) car rental for 10 days ($600).  (This is for her and Jeannie)  Why give?  Violet has grown up to be quite an athlete and has  enjoyed learning softball for over 6 years (of course in addition to player soccer) She loves the game and is excited at the chance to represent Los Altos girls 10U.   This opportunity to travel to Florida with a group of her teammates would increase her knowledge of the sport and help grow relationships with her teammates who share her interests.   Her awesome parents are going to help her out with this trip and Violet is also doing additional fundraising however theres no way they can foot the whole thing.    Friends and family had asked if Vi had her own page so we decided why not?  Your support would mean the world to Violet and make a softball dream come true!  xo

title: Funeral expenses for Francisco “Padoo” Corona
description: As some of you may know my dad passed away yesterday unexpectedly. We weren’t expecting this loss (as no one ever is). However I’m asking family and friends to please donate anything they can to help with his final costs. My dad didnt have any life insurance. Anything you can help us with is greatly appreciated. Also I’m asking for lots of prayers for padoo to find the kingdom of our good Lord. He was a great man and I’m sure you all have lots of wonderful stories please share them with us. He loves his family dearly he loved his music and bbqing with his friends. He could talk your ear off with all kinds of beautiful stories of family and friends. He loved to dance. His 8 Grandchildren were his world. We love him endlessly and may he rest in peace??   Francisco pedro Corona (Padoo) April 2 1959-May 5 2019

title: Shanes Wedding
description: I would like to tell you about Shane. I’ve had heartache and worried about my son for many years. It took him a while but I’m so very proud to see the man he has become.  We all know the path he took and the mistakes he made. I was so heartbroken that I had to let go. It was the single most difficult decision I ever had to make in my life to walk away and let fate decide his future.  I can thankfully say today three years later that Shane has become the son that I can be proud of. He has held a steady job for the past three years and has led a clean and sober life. Every time I see him the tears well up in my eyes at my pride in this young man.  The reason I’m writing this is that Shane is planning on getting married this July 22. It is not going to be an extravagant wedding it will be held in the backyard of a family member in the afternoon after he’s done working.  It pains me that I’m not financially able to help out. I would so like to make this a special occasion for him. So hat in hand I’m beseeching friends and family to help out whatever you can afford be it one dollar or some sort of decoration or such thing. I’m trying to do an island wedding and am working with what little funds I have.  I am doing a fundraising and the link is listed below. No hard feelings whatever you can donate will be much appreciated.  Please  donate…thank you! And God Bless!

title: Surgery for gunner
description: As gunner grew up we always questioned why he was constantly breathing so hard and panting. We just figured he’s just a hyper dog but no. After 2 near death incidents the vet finally diagnosed him with laryngeal Paralysis where he basically suffocates to death. They gave us 3 options. We leave him be and continue to pay $700 vet visits to save his life every time it happens drive to Pullman and have a surgery done to fix it or put him down. We agreed putting a 1 year old puppy down was not an option. Therefore we need your help to make the surgery possible and save gunners life. Anything helps thank you.

title: Police Officer Natalie Becky Corona
description: I am raising money to travel to California May 23 2019 to sing my song tribute  I Pledge Allegiance  for the family of Davis Police Officer Natalie Becky Corona 22 who died in the line of duty January 10 2019. Officer Corona was a new rookie officer.  She is survived by her parents and 3 sisters. I would be truly grateful for your help. I believe the song will help with the healing process. God Bless you!!

title: In Memory of Giovanni Corona
description: Our beloved nephew Giovanni (yo-yo)  was taken suddenly from us last night. He was a  great person with a kind soul and an amazing  voice.   We ask you to make a donation to help cover his celebration of life. Anything given would be greatly appreciated by our family. We also ask that you pray for us as we mourn this great loss.

title: Senior trip cruise
description: Every child that graduates in my family my parents gift us with a senior cruise to Mexico . This year it’s time for my friends and I to go celebrate but my friend Andrea Herrel can’t afford to come on the trip. She is like a sister to me and the trip would not be the same without her. Please help her come with us it would mean everything to not only her but her friends attending the trip.

title: Geovanni Corona (coronita)
description: No hay palabras ni nada que podamos aser para ellos (nuestra familia mi familia) no ay nada q les quite este dolor tan grande pero si podemos ayudar con algo para que tengan una preocupación menos.  Jojo era la alegría de la familia el simpre con su guitarra  ....falleció el dia de ayer por la tarde en un terrible accidente el y su amigo fernando y les han dejado  mucho dolor a todos ... oremos por ellos y oremos x sus familias  que ocupan toda  la fuerza del mundo.... todo lo que se junte se ira a mis compadres corona/suarez

title: David-Martinez Corona
description: Our family was struck with a unexpected and devastating tragedy. On May 17th 2019 David was the victim of a drive by shooting. He was a loving and caring person a personality you could not envy. He left behind 7 children 5 siblings and numerous aunts uncles cousins and loved ones. He came from a very loving family who cared deeply for David. He had a wonderful spirit and a heart of gold. All donation are accepted and very much appreciated anything and everything will help. All donations will go to Secure stability for his 7 children. Thank you it is very much appreciated. Sincerely His family.

title: Celebrating Janina Vera
description: To all our loved ones   On May 13th surrounded by love and care Janina took her last breath on earth and her first in eternity. She battled 10 years of Huntington’s Disease which attacked her brain and nervous system. Although we are sad to say goodbye we know she is no longer suffering and is in the presence of her Heavenly Father. She leaves behind two sons her oldest being Johnny (19 years old) and her youngest  Joshua (8 years old). Janina valued family and most of all: faith. Through her long trial she had so much joy and peace knowing who was carrying her. She never failed to bring laughter love and life to others. She hugged you even if you were a stranger because she knew the importance of love. She would joke with you always remembering her purple Cadillac and was always down to earth. Janina was given grace was grateful and therefore graceful.   As we put together a day to celebrate who God shaped Janina to be from beginning to the end of her life please support us with whatever you can. Donations will also be going to her two sons who will continue to be supported by our friends and family.

title: Uber driver cant work with Asthma risk COVID-19
description: Hello This is a humbling experience asking for help. I have Asthma and currently I have a sinus infection. I am fearful about my health getting worse. I cannot work for Uber or anyone right now because I am in a high risk group. I dont have money in savings to wait it out. Im fearful of losing car/apt. I just need some help. I am usually the one to help others. I am a social worker by degree. If you can help that would probably make me cry out of gratitude. Thanks for taking the time to read this in the midst of this pandemic.

title: For Shantelle Vaklev Corona
description: Friends and family . To whom who have know Shantelle aka “CoCo” you know she had an amazing heart  loving kind personality. You know her admiration for her 3 beautiful children  her marriage and courageous individuality we crave . I have created this funding account for her family during this time of need and peace. Please do not fill comments with questions at this time. Give the family proper respect and Shantelle .   Thank you in advanced for all donations acquired to her family Jonny Corona  Taliah  Destiny and Asher!  Please anything helps!

title: Corona’s vet bill
description: Corona was attacked by another dog and her bone is exposed and if she doesn’t get treatment soon she will lose her leg unfortunately the treatment isn’t cheap and I can’t afford it on my own

title: Seeds For Future Memories: Make It Rain $60k!
description: Seeds For Future Memories: Make It Rain $60k!   #60KforCentro  #MonstritxsALaObra   Right now is a crucial moment for Centro Corona and we are calling on our people to support us in meeting our fundraising goal of $60000 by June 20th the minimum amount needed to cover our rent and the maintenance of our building for the full year. Centro Corona is a community center with a long history since 2011 in Corona Queens an intergenerational space that builds from the experience leadership and knowledge of working-class and immigrant communities to build a self-determined collectively-imagined future. In late 2018 unexpectedly we lost our first home base for eight years. In December 2018 we were able to relocate to a lovely new building that is quickly becoming home. Our monthly rent jumped from $1800 a month to $3800 and we need your support to keep our space.   Share our fundraiser and encourage your folks to donate something. Doesn’t matter the amount as long as they donate.  ? YOU CAN READ MORE ABOUT THIS CAMPAIGN AND OUR WORK BELOW ?  ***  Seeds For Future Memories: Make It Rain $60k!   #60KforCentro  #MonstritxsALaObra   Frequencies. Transmissions.  They said “ancestors listen.” and they were talking to us. Lighting candles. ‘Taita Mama we are your wildest dream’ we heard them say. They spoke with lights. “We have abandoned cages. No borders the land is back in our hands breathing. The people are resting and allowed.”  Affirmations. We are building the path and bringing them into existence. We feel it resonating within our bones.  Affirmations. We are sowing them. Into existence.  Frequencies. Transmissions. Messages from a liberated future.   Do you feel these messages too?  We are calling on our people who felt it and have witnessed it. Who witnessed how sharing a space groundless and precarious can begin to be enough for conversations to happen for answers to arrive and for future memories to foment. If you felt them too then you have witnessed what can happen when people share a place with purpose. When we are in community with each other we begin to take things back. We begin to give to each other. We create lead and defend. We transform ways of justice and solidarity that can be replicated in more homes in more neighborhoods. We sow seeds for a liberated future. Our descendents are speaking to us and we are listening.  If you heard these messages too we are calling on your help now to build and sustain Centro Corona for the long haul autonomously. The work that we do often does not align with funding mandates. This does not concern us. We know that to continue our work we must rely on the people who love Centro the most who will feel these transmissions from the future and recognize their own voices just as they imagined they could be.    Where are they coming from?  We believe they are coming from Corona many generations from now. The voices of our children’s grandchildren who are now leading the healing and sustaining the earth. Perhaps in this very same building.  The messages are from those who have carried on the work that is already happening today. Our community-led work from the past 8 years: education justice homework help and la Monstrita Justiciera; gender justice and Soy Yo: Sex Ed Camp for Families; community defense and political theater production “Por la Justicia y los Sorbetes.” Our work that centers key practices and methodologies using arts and culture popular education accompaniment generational leadership development and creates intergenerational and bilingual spaces for collective decision and art-making. The messages are from futures we have begun growing from seeds that have already been planted and we must continue to grow fiercely.     Why are we receiving them now?  This is a crucial moment for Centro. In late 2018 we lost the space that made so much of this work possible. With immense challenge in December we were able to relocate to a lovely new building that is quickly becoming home. Yet we are met with the realities of how the land is treated as a commodity as our monthly rent jumped from $1800 a month to $3800 with a $7200 deposit on our new lease. Our neighborhood is being gentrified and the people and places that make our community beautiful are being forced out. Today we are about to sign a lease to remain in our neighborhood and soon to become an independent organization. However as we stand right now we do not have the funds to stay past 3 or 4 months.    At Centro Corona we have made a community where lives of creativity and independence can be lived with joy. For eight years we have confronted the cultural and economic oppression facing working-class and immigrant communities. For eight years we have created safe spaces within our neighborhoods for people to rehearse a liberated future. We have turned violence into art education activism and over time slowly yet crucially liberation.    We are made to believe that our future is uncertain but we heard them speak to us. We feel new frequencies resonating inside us. They are transmissions from our liberated future sometimes vivid and sometimes faded never gone but never complete the voices strange yet familiar. They have never been stronger than they are now. It is up to us to make them true.    How do we honor them?  We accept their messages and believe they are real. We accept their affirmations that we are working towards freedom so we start sowing freedom now. Our struggles now bring great opportunity to stabilize Centro in this place as a permanent part of our future.  We decided on a raising goal of $60000 because it is the minimum amount needed for rent and maintenance of our building for the next year. We chose to do this large amount via people’s fundraising because it will support our agency to continue to create spaces of collective decision-making and action-taking with autonomy. We are committed to maintaining a space that is free and accessible by and for our people.  If you witnessed and believe in this future help us materialize all this into reality now by supporting this people-organized campaign. We have taught each other how to get to this point and have had lots of community advice and support. We hold no degrees on fundraising but we hold a trust in our people who will helps us get there!   We need your support! Email your friends make sure they donate something. Anything as long as they donate. Share widely. Ask us about how to become a monthly sustainer. Ask us about one-time large donations. Share knowledge with us. Support our self-taught processes all very DIC type of work (Do it in Community). Invest in our future memories!   ###  Centro Corona is an intergenerational community center that builds from the experience leadership and knowledge of working-class and immigrant communities from Corona and nearby Queens neighborhoods to build a self-determined collectively-imagined future. We see our community organizing work as a living ongoing process of building leadership and re-imagining what organizing could be: deeply intimate emergent organic and relational organizing grounded in arts and culture. DRUM (Desis Rising Up and Moving) is our fiscal sponsor.

title: For Tobi
description: My name is Tobi. I got an abscess. And I need to raise up some money to get the surgery. So I won’t be in pain anymore. If you guys can help me with a dollar donation to get my energy back. So I can run around and act silly again. I’ll be so great full.

title: Help Mauro Mena’s Family with his Medical Bills
description: Mauro Mena lost his battle with Leukemia on May 20 2019.  Mauro was known for his generosity and helping feed the needy in the Stockton community. This GoFundMe is to help his wife and family with the remaining medical expenses.  Please share this so we can help a great man’s family who put himself before others.

title: ayuda para estudiar la universidad en Francia
description: Hola Me llamo Samantha tengo 18 años y estoy terminando la preparatoria en el Liceo Franco Mexicano. Postule para varias universidades francesas y varias me aceptaron pero decidí quedarme en un IUT (universidad que dura 2 años) de ingeniería industrial y mantenimiento en Lorient Francia.  mi familia no cuenta con los recursos para poder hacer mi carrera allá ya que el vuelo simplemente cuesta al rededor de  681 euros ( 15000 pesos) más alojamiento que son 350 euros por mes comida etc. Sin embargo yo tengo la esperanza en poder cumplir mi sueño que es estudiar allá espero que me puedan ayudar a cumplirlo. La meta es de 5000 euros para el vuelo y poder vivir unos meses allá en lo que mis horarios se establecen y consigo trabajo. Quedaré agradecida con cada persona que aporto lo que pudo ya que esta es una buena oportunidad en mi vida y fue en parte a cada uno con su donativo. Adjunto la carta  de admisión de la escuela.

title: CSU T-shirt for RMC Auction
description: Want to join me in making a difference? Colorado State University Meat Science Department is raising money to benefit student activities within the American Meat Science Association (AMSA) specifically to support the Education Foundation. Any donation will help make an impact!  AMSA is a leading agricultural organization that is involved in shaping the youth of today into the leaders of tomorrow.   This year the shirt theme is Pioneering the Way; to support this our shirt reflects the journey west that pioneers made to establish the state of Colorado and our land-grant institution CSU. It is a reference to the popular computer game Oregon Trail. For a donation of only $25 or more you will receive a shirt as a thank-you gift for your contribution! Shirts will be available at the information booth on the Monfort Quad at CSU on Tuesday of RMC.  Thank you in advance for your contribution to this cause that means so much to myself CSU and an industry that fights to provide a safe and healthy product from farm to table.       More information about American Meat Science Association: AMSA is a broad-reaching organization of individuals that develops and disseminates its collective food and animal science knowledge to provide meat science education and professional development. The AMSA Educational Foundation is a set of endowed funds within AMSA that are used to support educational programs and scholarships for students and scientists in meat science.

title: Heathers impatient Therapy/Child Care Help
description: Heather fighter strong brave. My sweet friend had a cluster of Brain Tumors removed on April 29th. Unfortunately it has caused Cerebellum (part of the brain that controls Coordination to become inflamed). She has also been dealing with extremely painful nerve pain on left side of face that it causes her  to feel like her teeth are going to fall out. Her Dr recommended her going to impatient Therapy because the in home therapy/rehab just isnt  doing enough for her....Heather needs this so she can learn how to walk again without losing her balance. The only thing holding them back is Childcare. She really wants to start asap and not wait for her kids to go back to school.....Heather and her family would be Truly appreciative of any donations to get her on the complete road to Healing so she can love on her sweet Children.    God Bless everyone

title: Memory of Dora Sylvia Enriquez
description: In loving memory of a wonderful and beautiful lady that always put everyone before herself.    Dora Sylvia was a hard worker and dedicated to her family and friends.      She will be missed and loved by all who knew her.

title: Victims Of The Horrific Corona Costco Shooting
description: On June 14th 2019 our family’s life was forever changed. Uncle Russell Auntie Paola and their eldest son Kenneth French made one of their regular trips to Costco to prepare for a Father’s Day BBQ at their home. Little did we know Kenneth was never going to spend another holiday with our family again. This is the most horrific tragedy of our lives. This doesn’t even feel real. This is the kind of thing you see in movies. Kenneth was unarmed and was shot multiple times and now he is gone forever. Paola and Russell were also shot and are in critical condition. They will have a long road to recovery. Please help us to support Uncle Russell Auntie Paola Kevin and more importantly our angel Kenneth. This tragedy has destroyed their lives. Thank you in advance for the well wishes.   The outpouring of love and support for our family is amazing.

title: Getting teaching license
description: My reach appears to have exceeded my grasp so change of plans. I am going to get my NM teaching license and return to the classroom after 13 years. We will need to cover the fees for the licensing process as well as move to wherever I either receive an internship or end up going through the licensure process unpaid. If you have contributed previous to this change and need that money returned please let me know so I can keep everything on the level.

title: Keeping The Love Of My Life!
description: Our love story started with two strangers simply saying hi and will later convert to a  l love you.  We are happily married and so in love to one another sadly we have hit a rough patch. The morning of February 25 2019 I started my morning like an other day not knowing the tragic news Ill be receiving hours later. Around 9 in the morning I received a call from my wife Maria with her totally broken down. She informed me that she had been detained by ICE. I clasped in tears not knowing what to do. We are now in June and I can gladly say I have her by my side.  The storm is not ever just yet we still have legal fees and long journey ahead of us to safely say she is staying with me forever.  Im here today to ask for help to keep my wife and my future family together. I will appreciate it with all my heart any donation that comes forth. Thank you for having the time to read this and my God Bless you all.

title: Help Me Fill This Tub With Corona
description: My Birthday Is June 25th. The only thing I want for my birthday is to take a bath in a tub full of corona. The Sendo Nation team has figures we will need 3-4 kegs of corona to do this. I have dreams about bathing in the nectar of the gods. It is always Rona season and I have a theory that this bath will be the ultimate recovery tool for my running! Please contribute to the ultimate send! Another member of Sendo Track club will be there sipping Ronas while I soak in Rona to document! Any extra money goes to allowing more full sends!

title: Titty Toppers
description: A fabulous young lady named Sarah Phillips Hancock recently found out she had breast cancer. June 18th 2019 she had a double mastectomy. There will be at least 2 more surgeries but maybe as many as 4. She will have a reconstruction surgery soon but the one thing she will be missing is real nipples. She has a tattoo artist who is trained in this very speciality and his quote is $400. Our goal is $500 so that she is able to include a tip and have a little extra to celebrate her new completed CANCER FREE titties! Woot Woot!!!!    Any amount you donate will not only contribute to this fund but it will also assist in making a woman feel whole again after cancer stole so much from her.   Thank you for your time and prayers!

title: Family of Corona Virus whistle blower DR Wenliang
description: This man is a hero and his story touched many hearts.   I decided to do this because this man is a hero who risked his life to help spread information on the corona virus but instead was treated like a criminal. This money will  go directly to the remaining survivors of his family no matter what actions will have to take place.    I know this is going to be a difficult task to get this money changed  currency so Im asking for an organazation to help me get the funds to the remaining survivors or Dr li Wenliang. If not I will personally do it myself and will do whatever it takes!  If any money is collected their will be updates on this page on the transmissions of the funds to this family and proof and footage.    This man could of saved millions of lives earlier and is an online hero who risked his life and now is passed so this money will go directly to his family no matter WHAT actions need to be taken.   R.i.p Dr li wenliang

title: Jan Boyles Family Fund
description: Jim Boyle 51 passed away from cancer leaving behind his wife Jan and 3 children.  Jim was the sole provider for his family.  Jan is a stay at home mom in order to care for their disabled daughter Diana who has cerebral palsy and their other two children Julian and Victoria.

title: Help Put Romeo to Rest
description: Sunday 9:45 am my fiance was pronounced dead at my parents house where we have been living for the past 3 months. My mom found him in the bathroom. He had some heart issues and a blood clot. The coroner is doing a autopsy because of the history of drug abuse. Im broken and I need any help that I can get from his friends my friends or anyone that would like to help. Stephen was the best person I ever knew. Everyone who knew him can tell how genuine he was. This Sunday i didnt just lose my fiance I lost my best friend my partner and my protector. A huge piece of me left with him that day and life will never be the same..... Please give what you can every little bit will help

title: Help my daughter Keara get to the World Series
description: My daughter Keara Corona and her team the Lady Wolverines are heading to the International World Series Showcase Tournament in Deer Park Texas in July and we would like to help her raise money to get to the world series. She is a great softball player and loves to play the game and we are excited to see her out there on the field playing the game. The money being raised will help cover her costs for meals lodging and travel expenses. Your help is greatly appreciated. Thank you Richard Corona.

title: In Need Of A Car
description: I finally got a job but now its hard to travel to make it in time to my program to drug test and run back in time to make it to work. So far its been working out but theres only so much that my mother can help me with. My next goal is to try and purchase a car. Nothing major just enough to move me around. Having kids make it so hard to save. Im just trying to get back on my feet. God bless you if you can help me out with my transportation problem. Not having a car doesnt discourage me it just makes me work harder to achieve my goals. In my commute time i miss precious moments with my kids. I wanna be involved with wverything with my kids especially cuz theyre still so young. Time flies and i dont wanna miss a minute from it. God bless  love you guys.

title: Fargo Dreaming
description: My name is Jennifer Soto and i am asking for your support to help get me to Fargo. I started wrestling at the age of 9 and from the beginning  I knew i wanted to be the best in the world at this sport.  I set out many goals for myself at a young age and one of those was to win a Fargo title as a freshman. I have achieved many things and have met some of the nicest people thanks to this great sport of wrestling. I am not one to talk about my accomplishments in this sport because i know there is still more work to be done. My ultimate goal is to make the 2024 senior olympic team and bring an a Olympic gold medal to my country.  I have traveled the country and recently competed at the U 15 world championships in Budapest Hungary. My family does all they can for me. They prioritize my wrestling career but it can get expensive to travel. I would like to help them out in any way i can and make it easier on them financially. Any help will be greatly appreciated. Thank you.

title: Maria corona fund
description: Maria corona a loving and wonderful soul has unfortanately left us as cancer took a toll onto her and impacted her severely on July 3rd  she passed and went to a much better place so we ask for help from friends and family anything would help us and we would be so grateful no donation is to small. Thank you

title: Adan Corona (AJ) Funeral
description: AJ was a son a brother a friend a nephew a grandson a good man a hard worker a family man an all around good person. AJ was the type of person who would always make you smile would be there for you on your darkest day. AJ was a person you could always count on and who loved his family and would give you the shirt off his back if you needed it.  On July 7th 2019 AJ was in a fatal car accident. One that ended his young life far too short.    This go fund me is to raise the funds needed to properly honour and commemorate AJ. The life he lived and all the lives he touched with his kind heart. Anything you can donate for AJs funeral is greatly appreciated.  All funds will be directed to Angela Companioni Chirono for funeral/memorial expenses. Mother of Adan Jose Corona. We thank you for your donations and sharing this GoFundMe with your friends and family.  Rest in peace Adan Jose Corona.

title: Judy Corona
description: In May of this year Judy Corona was diagnosed with CUP – Cancer of Unknown Primary. This is a rare condition in which cancer cells are found in the body but the place of the cancer began is not known. The Primary Cancer can spread to other parts of the body. This type of cancer is terminal. At the time of her diagnosis she was informed that the cancer had spread to Pancreas Liver Stomach and Hip.   Unfortunately there is no specific treatment that can treat this type of Cancer. Since her diagnose she has been hospitalizing several time for various medical conditions. Recently Judy was re-admitted due to stroke (brain) and is under observation.  With this medical condition Judy had to discontinue her work and is now bed-ridden. This condition has forced Judy to be provided with a Nurse by her at all times. Those of you that know Judy she is a strong woman but she is now in the fight of her life. She has such a positive attitude even with the diagnosis she faces. Please keep her in your prayers.  Judy does have immediate family to take care of her; however she is fighting this battle all by herself and needs support from friends and family. That alone is difficult but this will also create a financial hardship. I am hoping that we can provide a little support by trying to get her a private care and help her with the medical expenses that are not covered. With Judy’s determination and our help we should be able to kicking cancers butt and getting her healthy again.  The money will go directly to Judy to help with her medical expenses and basic needs as she is no longer working. Please consider donating if you are able to every bit helps.  We thank you in advance for your donation. Your thoughts prayers and donations are truly appreciated.

title: Sick dialysis patient
description: Im a dialysis patient recently diagnosed with a cancerous tumor Im asking all my friends and family members if they can help me out with my monetary expenses recently I cant work do to my illness .please help me. Amigos y familiares Les pido de corazon que me ayuden con una donacion para poder pagar mis tratamientos  este ano a sido muy dificil para yo poder trabajar cualquier contribution son bendiciones gracias de corazon

title: Caseys camera gear
description: Hi Im Casey I am an aspiring actor and filmmaker. My goal is to make a living through freelance videography in order to support my way through this creative journey. Commercials realty adventure and short films are some examples of what I look to create. The funds I raise here will go toward camera equipment that will help improve my video quality. Any support would mean a huge deal to me. I am simply looking to make my dreams become a reality.

title: Help the Corona Family
description: Exactly a week ago today we purchased our puppy from an online breeder not knowing that this type of situation would happen.  Unfortunately our puppy has suddenly become ill over the past 2 days and is currently in critical condition at a 24 hr vet hospital. We would like to do as much as we could and don’t want money to be an issue to limit the help that we can do for him. My younger sister and I are the ones responsible for all the finances and would appreciate all the help that we can get. Thank you.

title: AYUDEMOS A FIRMO A CAMINAR NUEVAMENTE
description: ayudemos a firmo  El señor Firmo Corona un padre de familia de 56 años con antecedentes de Diabetes Mellitus tipo II diagnosticada hace mas de 15 años e Hipertensión Arterial diagnosticada hace 20 años.  El viernes 19 de julio del 2019 en horas de la noche mientras conducía su moto (trabajando) sufrió un accidente por negligencia de otro conductor de moto que se encontraba bajo los efectos del alcohol A raíz de este accidente sufrió un trauma en su pierna izquierda sus diagnósticos fueron :  *Fractura en meseta tibial izquierda ( sch III ). *Fractura de epifisis proximal de peroné izquierdo.  Para su recuperación se necesita realizar una cirugía ( REDUCCIÓN CRUENTA  + OSTEOSINTESIS ) sin la realización de esta intervención quirúrgica que tiene un costo de 2.500$ no podrá volver a caminar. AYUDEMOS A FIRMO A CAMINAR NUEVAMENTE.

title: Carlos Martin Alamo Memorial Fund
description: With my deepest sorrows I am asking for help. My father and hero passed away today unexpectedly. I am asking for donations on behalf of our family to pay for his funeral services and with any money that is left over we will use to help raise my younger sister who will be starting her freshman year in high school this year. If you can not donate please pray for our family because my dad was the glue that held us all together. Thank you for your time.

title: Carlos Alamo Funeral Cost
description: Dear Friends and Family  Yesterday my children  my mini me Hailey Kadee and Chris  Father passed away.  We are absolutely devastated this was sudden and unexpected.  We will need to cover all funeral cost and are reaching out to our friends and family for help.  Please consider donating if you are able to do so.  I truly appreciate it!  Anything helps.    Respectfully Silver

title: My mom’s funeral service
description: On July 22nd my family and I unexpectedly lost my mom Yolanda Lazares. It’s difficult to have to think of a new life without a mom sister daughter friend etc. She was a loving caring crazy but compassionate person and she will be missed by many. My mom had a voice of her own and she was never scared to use it. Our hearts are shattered. Last month my family and I lost our grandma so with the loss of my mom being so unexpected my family and I are struggling to find the funds to give her the service she deserves. If you’d like to help my family and I out we appreciate absolutely anything from anybody even if it’s just sharing the link. Thank you so much   let this be a reminder to always spread love.

title: Help With Funeral expenses For Rick Zuniga
description: On July 22 2019 A mother/ family got the worst call that her son Rick passed away and the family is taking it very hard at this moment. Rick was a 20 year old who’s life was just starting but was taken to soon! He was excited about this year because he wanted to have a big party to celebrate his 21 st birthday which landed on Christmas Day! We are asking for help with funeral expenses to lay Rick to rest! He is loved by so many and I ask also to pray for this family on this very difficult time.

title: Please Help with vet medical bills for our furbaby
description: . Please help our little Fur baby Girl. (COZY). We need help raising money for her overnight hospital care Medical labs along with Radiology expenses. Due to this we are now having to take her for follow up visits with a GI specialist and she needs weekly lab work and medication. The Vet said she must have consumed something toxic that may have affected her organs. We always keep our eye on her and are very careful We are Devastated and extremely  heartbroken that we don’t know how this happened.  Unfortunately we   have exhausted all our funds at this point. We humbly ask for anyone willing to help us. The thought of giving up our family pet who we look at as another family member fills our eyes with tears and pains our souls. Please help anything is greatly appreciated Thank you!!

title: Baby Victoria
description: During my pregnancy my baby was diagnosed with a rare heart condition. Through out the pregnancy I was told many heartbreaking diagnoses and prediction that might happen to my baby. After fighting all odds my baby Victoria was born on June 24th 2019. She has been a fighter since day 1. With every passing day she has been a blessing and has shown not only me but many medical staff how strong she is. Victoria spent 2 weeks in the Neonantal Intensive Care Unit.  She started off with a CPAP to help her breath and slowly as the days continued she was breathing on her own. When I got word that I could finally take Victoria home on the 2 week I felt so happy and scared at the same time. Victoria was sent home with a monitor to track her heart rhythm and oxygen.  Victoria has been and out of Texas Childrens Hospital since birth. Her open heart surgery is scheduled This December 13 2019. As a single mom our expenses and bills are adding up. Even if I do have a job medical expenses are way beyond my control. I ask for any help for my lil one and me. Prayers also help a lot. May God bless you and all that have helped so far. Anything helps. Thank you.

title: Family in need after fire and water damage
description: To all friends and family i never asked anyone for anything but last night a fire erupted in the building my love ones lived in. They lost all they had most of you may know them my brother Eduardo my sister Maria her husband Justin room mate angel and piery.. please anything would help them in this drastic moment.  Any questions feel free to contact me directly .

title: Heading to Maine!
description: I move in 7 days!  Please help me in any way you can raise the last bit of funds I need to take the opportunity of a lifetime. I believe that when you consistently put good in you receive the best life has to offer. I have accepted a 3 month position in Bar Harbor Maine that I am absolutely over the moon about. However because I went rogue this summer and spent my time working on my mind and volunteering I am in a position where I am hoping that the love I gave is ready to come back to me. Anything donated here is going towards my flight luggage and an Acadia National Parks Pass. In ANY way you can help me I will so appreciate it.  Sharing this post buying my furniture or clothes I’m selling donating if you have anything to give now and need it back later I will gladly accept that as well. Thank you all so much. Believe it into existence!

title: Emergency Fund For Don
description: The morning of July 31st 49 year old Don Damato was taken to an Iowa hospital by a coworker after complaining of arm pain. When Don arrived he was told he had suffered a heart attack the night before. Don is currently out of state for work and away from his family. Don does not have medical insurance and all expenses will have to be paid out of pocket. Hes also the sole income for his family.  It will be a long road of recovery for Don including getting healthy figuring out medical expenses and having to provide for his family.  Anything is appreciated if you are willing to donate the family thanks you in advance and if you are unable to the family asks for prayers.   Thank you!

title: Christinas All-American Rome Tour
description: Hello Family Friends and Supporters  My name is Christina Corona. This upcoming 2019-2020 school year I will be a Senior at Vintage High School. It will also be my 4th year on the Vintage High School Cheer and Dance Team. While at Vintage High School I have managed to be apart of the Cheer and Dance Team keep a 4.0 G.P.A and participate in numerous school activities.   This past weekend my team and I were fortunate enough to attend a 3 day NDA dance camp in Rocklin CA. At camp I was nominated and selected to be on the All-American team. With this selection I was also invited to perform in a New years day parade in Rome Italy! I am more than grateful to have been given this opportunity and would love to be able to attend.   Since I was little girl I have always loved to dance. It all started when I was 5 years old dancing tap at Pepperettes Baton and Dance Club. This sparked a fire in me a passion. Tap drew to me joining a Ballet Folklorico dance club at my elementary school Napa Valley Language Academy. I was involved in the dance club from Kindergarten all the way to the Fifth grade and I can definitely say It kept my feet moving. I would have practices after school and perform at different school events. This only made my passion for dance grow stronger.  After dancing for a few years I decided to try my luck with gymnastics at The Gymnastic Zone in Napa. And let me say this changed everything for me. I realized I not only wanted to dance but I also wanted to have gymnastics play a role in the way I danced.   My mom finally realized how much I enjoyed dancing and gymnastics and decided to look into cheerleading. She signed me up to join The Napa Raiders Football and Cheer Youth Club and this is the best thing my mom has ever done for me. I will admit at first I was quite nervous I had never done cheerleading or even tried to mix both dancing and gymnastics. But after practicing everyday after school having games on Saturdays in the scorching sun and competing on a stage in front of hundreds of people I realized I had fallen in love with the sport of cheerleading. I continued this journey with being apart of The Napa Bears and The Napa Valley Jets cheer teams. In total I was apart of youth cheerleading for 5-6 years and knew for a fact I wanted to continue this passion in high school.   I had always looked at the Vintage Cheer and Dance team as a dream. I knew one day I would be given the chance to try-out but didnt have much confidence in myself.  When my freshman year finally rolled around I was overwhelmed with jitters and excitement. I stepped into the try-out barely knowing anyone or what to expect. I gave it my everything on all 3 days of try-outs. On the last day we were to find out who was going to make the team. I can still remember all the emotions of knowing wether or not I had a chance. My phone had rigged later that day that the coaches had just posted the list of the 2016-2017 team.  I opened the page to see my name! I was beyond happy that my dream of being on this team was finally coming true. Since then I have loved my experience. This team has opened many doors for me taught me many things and helped me create lifelong friendships.   This trip to Rome is something I could have never imagined to be offered to me and it is a once in a lifetime opportunity. With that said it also carries a large cost to attend. Which is why I am reaching out to everyone I can for the help. I love what I am doing with cheerleading and dance and would be more than fortunate to be able to represent not only my team but my town outside of the U.S. .  Thank you to anyone and everyone who donates I am so appreciative for everything I am given and hope to snap a couple selfies in the historic streets of Rome Italy!  XOXO Christina Corona

title: Help Cristina Fire Recovery
description: Raising money to help support Cristina and her family during this difficult time after a fire destroyed their home and all of their possessions.

title: Help Rucca Beat Cancer
description: On Thursday July 5th my baby Rucca was diagnosed with a form of Cancer called lymphoma. We are deeply saddened by this news. Rucca is considered part of our family and we love her very much. She is only 6 years old. She is the biggest sweetheart. She has always been a very active  dog and seeing her in this condition is very painful I know she is trying to be strong for us so I want to give her the best chance to fight cancer I am not ready to say goodbye to my baby.    We have a few options for treatment and are currently working with her oncologist and a team of holistic healers to find the best treatment. Next week she will be starting her chemotherapy. The funds will be used towards testing and the chemotherapy treatment. We sincerely thank you in advance any donations will be greatly appreciated.

title: Fondos para gastos funerarios
description: An accident has claimed the life of Salvador. He was a son brother and uncle. He is survived by many loved ones. Unfortunately Salvador left us financially unprepared. Donations of any amount will be greatly appreciated. Thank you.

title: Road to Baja Portalegre
description: Soy Corona Carrasco. Desde que era pequeña el mundo del 4x4 ha estado muy presente en mi casa y esta afición viene de mi padre. El año pasado tuvo la oportunidad de participar en la Baja Portalegre (Portugal) y este año me gustaría poder correrla.  Esta carrera va a ser mi primera competición pero no solo me he propuesto acabar la carrera en el menor tiempo posible sino disfrutar haciendo lo que más  me gusta conducir mi Polaris RZR.  La Baja Portalegre 500 es una de las 8 competiciones que integran la Copa del Mundo de Bajas. Del 24 al 26 de Octubre se disputará la 32a edición de la Baja Portalegre 500 una carrera de casi 600 kilómetros de los cuales 423 kilómetros son cronometrados.   Al ser mi primera carrera estoy buscando patrocinadores/sponsors que me ayuden para poder participar.  Todos los patrocinadores podrán publicitar su negocio tanto en el buggy como en los vehículos de asistencia y merchandising del equipo. Asimismo todas las acciones realizadas por el equipo serán publicadas en nuestras RRSS con el objetivo de brindar una mayor visualización.  Si tienes alguna pregunta o te gustaría conocer la repercusión en medios de la carrera no dudes en escribirnos.  Muchas gracias de antemano :)

title: equipment for school
description: hellooo!  im trying to raise some money to be able to afford my school supplies .i start online photography classes at academy of arts in September but my family doesnt have the money to buy my equipment i need (camera books etc) so please donate ?? anything helps thank you!

title: Endy Morffi’s Camino A La Corona Mr. ULUSA19
description: Hello family! This is a fundraiser for Endy Morffi’s Camino a La Corona Mr. Universo Latino USA 2019 in Washington DC. Every donation will be appreciated and used towards the preparations that lead up to the competition. Every single donation no matter how big or how small will make a difference.    Hola familia! Esto es un recogido para Endy Morffi y su camino a la corona de Mr. Universo Latino USA 2019 en Washington DC. Cada donación es agradecida y será usada para las preparaciones necesarias antes de la competencia. Cada donación no importa la cantidad hará una gran diferencia.

title: For Robin Graham
description: Help for Robin Grahams Family   As many of you know our very good friend Robin Graham has been going through a very difficult time.  On July 13 2019 Robin’s former daughter-in-law Aubree Corona went missing on a camping trip with her children (Colin age 7 and Charlotte age 3) and friends in Wyoming.  She left the campsite to run a few errands but on her way back sent text messages that she was lost.  She never returned to the campsite.     The children went to stay with their father (Robin’s son Scott) while a massive search was launched by friends and family to find Aubree after the Sheriff called off the official search after 3 days.  Robin travelled from her home in Montana to assist in the search and watch the children.    If that weren’t enough on August 12 2019 Scott was arrested on charges he vehemently denies.  Robin again traveled to Wyoming to take care of the children at Scott’s request.  But no sooner had Scott been arrested than estranged members of Aubree’s family made a play to obtain temporary guardianship of the children despite Scott’s instructions that he wanted Robin to take custody of the children in his absence.    On August 18 2019 Aubree’s disabled truck was found on an untraveled road in a remote area about 25 miles from the campsite at the same time a judge was awarding guardianship of Aubree and Scott’s children to her brother.  Two days later Aubree’s body was found about a mile from where her truck was found.  The cause of Aubree’s death will not be released until an autopsy has been completed and may never be known for certain.    The whole experience has been devastating to Robin both emotionally and financially and she now needs our help to get her family back.  Robin remains in Wyoming trying to get her son out of jail in time for Aubree’s funeral and clearing the charges against him while fighting for custody of Colin and Charlotte.  Scott’s bond alone is $5000 and the family lawyer she spoke to requires a $4000 retainer to represent her and/or Scott in a child custody case.  If Scott remains in jail additional funds will be needed for the children’s care.    We are setting an initial goal of $10000 to cover bail legal fees and some of Robin’s expenses while she’s in Wyoming.   Robin has been a true friend to so many of us.  We’re asking your help her in her time of need.  If you can spare a few dollars it would mean a lot.  Robin has been reluctant to ask for money for herself but has authorized us to start this GoFundMe on her behalf.  All funds received will be delivered directly to Robin.

title: Marta Corona
description: En septiembre de 2018 diagnosticarón a mi mamá con Cancer de Hígado y Pancreás iniciando su primer tratamiento de quimioterapia el 26 de diciembre de 2018 el cúal consistió de tres días de tratamiento. Despúes de 9 meses y 12 tratamientos nos dan la mala noticia que el cancer se acostumbró al medicamento y el resultado fue que no había surtido ningún efecto causando que el cancer se esparciera a su costilla.                                  Despúes  empezó con los tratamientos de radiación por 2 semanas causando que su hígado y pancreás se inflamaran y que a su vez el cancer se esparciera hacia su matriz y pulmones. Aún con este diagnostico mi madre es una guerrera y quiere seguir luchando; esta semana estaremos llevándola a el hospital MD Anderson en la ciudad de Houston Texas; en donde estan los mejores doctores especializados en cancer.        Los costos de los tratamientos han sido muy altos y el costo de ir a Houston es aún más es por eso que pedimos ayuda con lo que ustedes nos puedan ayudar a seguir luchando por la vida de mi mamá.  De antemano gracias a todos sabemos que Dios está con ella y creyendo lo que no vemos como si fuese sanidad total sobre su cuerpo.           Bendiciones  Familia Corona.        In September 2019 my mom got diagnosed with Liver and Pancreas Cancer. Her first Chemo began December 26 2018 consisting in 3 days of treatment.  After 9 months and 12 treatments the Doctor gives us the bad news that the cancer became accustomed to the treatment and it had no positive effect causing the cancer to spread to her rib. After that she begins with radiation for 2 weeks causing her liver and pancreas to become inflamed furthermore spreading to her uterus and her lungs. Even though she’s had bad diagnostics my mom is a warrior and she really wants to keep fighting. This week we will be taking my mom to MD Anderson Hospital in Houston Tx where they have the best cancer doctors. The cost of the treatments have been high and the cost to go to Houston will be even higher which is why I’m asking for help. Any help you can give to my mom to  keep on fighting. Thank you beforehand!! We know that God is with her “the God who gives life to the dead and calls into being things that were not.” Blessings Corona Family

title: Funeral Fund for Aubree S Corona
description: For everyone who may not yet heard the news Aubree Corona was found yesterday August the 20th. Aubree went missing on July 13th and after a month of searching her family has closure.  Aubree was a loving mother daughter and sister and will be greatly missed.  Funeral plans are still being arranged and any updates regarding locations and times will be posted here. Right now we are hoping to raise money to transport Aubrees body from WY to UT for funeral services next week.  I am Aubrees cousin and Im working with Aubrees parents to organize her funeral.   Weve already had numerous messages from people asking how they can help so this campaign has been created as a way to keep everyone up-to-date with plans and also offer a place for messages and donations to be left.   Any money not used for funeral costs will be put in a fund to care for Aubrees two young children Cole and Charlotte.

title: Russell Bacas Recovery
description: On Friday August 23rd 2019 Russell Baca was involved in a freak accident in his home.  He was rushed to the hospital in extreme pain in his neck with no movement in his hands arms or shoulders.  The EMTs mistakenly sat Mr. Baca up instead of following proper protocol for a neck injury  possibly making it worse.  After two MRIs  it was determined that he broke his neck.  On Saturday Russ was operated on to repair the damage.  He is still in ICU as a precaution and in a great deal of pain. As far as we know the doctor felt like the surgery was a success.  It is unknown as to what his prognosis will be long term and recovery will look like.  If he continues to do well he should be moved to a Physical Therapy facility this week.  The truth is he has a long recovery ahead of him and so does his family.     We are asking for assistance in a few different areas at this time.  First and foremost they need prayer.  This entire family needs to be covered in prayer.  Russell and Susan are the proud parents to two teenage daughters.  Russell is the leader of his family  and Co-Owner of TriPlumb Plumbing LLC.  Right now he is down but not out. Susan is his helper and his beautiful wife.  Right now she needs people to come along side her to help her help. They really are a beautiful team. They also have family and friends that march along side of them. Please pray for them all daily.  Our God is big and mighty.  He is the Healer and Comforter.  Lets watch him move mountains together.
