Let Him use us all well to love on this family.      We are also asking for financial donations.  We do not know how much all of this is going to cost so this is just a base for getting started.  As hard as this all is regardless of how unexpected it all is the truth is bills do not care.  Mr. Baca is a small business owner.  He works hard everyday to take care of his family.  Susan also works very hard to help her husband.  With Russ being down this is not enough to keep the family afloat.  There are still mortgage utilities food gas phones and many other day to day expenses this family will continue to have.  That does not even yet account the Co-payments and astronomic hospital bills that will we showing their ugly faces soon.      We are asking friends and family to come along side the Bacas in big ways.  Please Share this campaign and ask your friends to share it as well.  You may not be able to give right at this moment. But maybe someone else can.  You can lift them up in prayer. You can Share this information.  The Bacas have come along side of many of us in some of these same ways.  They are in the trenches right now. Please join them by supporting them in the fashions listed above.  We all get to go home to our comfy beds in our comfy homes but our brothers and sisters are hurting.  They need help.  Please be the hands and feet of Jesus during this time.  Carry one anothers burdens by loving your neighbor as yourselves.  We thank you for anyone who can help in any way.  God Bless!

title: Celebration Church Burglary Recovery
description: With a heavy heart we regretfully report that Celebration Church was broken into last night. We pray for and bless whomever was involved in the burglary we completely forgive them and hope the best for them. However we are in need of instruments sound boards monitors and anything else that makes a church function. An estimated $20000 in theft and damages was incurred through this incident. We are trusting God to provide and help us recover beyond what we lost. If you feel led to contribute to our recovery we are eternally grateful and honor whatever donation you can make. We trust God will multiply your investment as we believe in the principle of giving. We love you and look forward to a great testimony! THANK  YOU!!!

title: Community Recycling trailer
description: Guffey is a small community that is located in the heart of Colorado and its members are passionate about recycling and reuse and being responsible humans on our planet. Unfortunately no waste company will bring recycling dumpsters to our community because we are so far out and the surrounding communities (25+ miles) will charge for dropping of recycling goods.   We have found a recycling facility that does not charge for the drop off of materials (approximately 35 miles) and have some people willing to drive to that facility but we need a trailer for separated items for the recycling. We have found a trailer ($4250) that will allow residents to drop recycling materials at a single location 24/7 and will allow us to take these materials to the recycling facility. The trailer for sale is in another state on a for sale site from a truck company and there is major interest in it. We are putting a deposit on it to hold it for us but they will only hold it for a few weeks and are offering to deliver the trailer to Denver CO (about 2 hrs away) for an additional $500. We would like to get the trailer by the end of September 2019.  We are wanting to create this program for our community as well as wanting to get our local community charter school (40 students) involved in recycling since they are the future of this planet and we ALL need to do what we can to help it.

title: COVID-19 RAFFORZIAMO LA TERAPIA INTENSIVA
description: Abbiamo deciso di indire questa raccolta fondi per dare un aiuto concreto a medici ricercatori e infermieri affinché le strutture per curarci siano più attrezzate oltre alla quarantena volontaria alla quale abbiamo aderito in questi giorni è decisivo l’aiuto di tutti e la collaborazione affinché non si propaghi il virus.In questi momenti così delicati il prezzo di una pizza se donato potrebbe essere decisivo nel salvare vite umane.Il devoluto sarà donato agli ospedali italiani.

title: Corona Virus Pandemic In Aid Of Keech Hospice Care
description: Due to the Corona Pandemic that has hit us all the charity which I work for has had to shut all of its shops indefinitely obviously this is a critical time for the hospice its patients and staff I am reopening this page from my last fundraiser in the hope of raising much needed funds. If you want to join me in making a difference? Im raising money in aid of Keech Hospice Care.Thank you ??Keech Hospice Care provides specialist palliative care for adults and children diagnosed with life-limiting conditions. Its adult hospice service looks after patients in Luton and South Bedfordshire and its childrens hospice service cares for children and their families across Bedfordshire Milton Keynes and Hertfordshire.

title: Emergenza ospedale urbino
description: In questo momento di emergenza gli operatori del nostro ospedale stanno cercando con ogni mezzo di dare una risposta all’emergenza denominata “COVID19”. Oramai da giorni il nostro Pronto Soccorso è l’unico nella provincia di Pesaro che sta funzionando  e per riuscire ad accogliere tutti i pazienti  abbiamo riorganizzato i reparti e aperto la Medicina d’Urgenza. In questo momento però siamo carenti di arredi attrezzature ed elettromedicali questa iniziativa è volta a raccogliere fondi da poter spendere immediatamente per approvvigionarci di quanto mancante. Noi operatori orami viviamo in Ospedale pur di cercare  di rispondere a tutto ma  la situazione cambia continuamente e evolve giorno dopo giorno. I caposala del DEA  Gabriele lani PS/118 Dini Davide Medicina D’Urgenza Pandolfi Roberta Rianimazione  e Ceccarini Sara Cardiologia faranno da garanti di questa raccolte ... ora tocca a voi fare il resto Grazie

title: Help for friends in China during coronavirus
description: Sacramento artist Lin Fei Fei went back for a visit to the countryside in China and has shared with us through Instagram (@linfeifeiart) the state of her home during the coronavirus chaos.  At this time she is requesting hand sanitizer and face masks because the stores are running out. They are running out of food at the local grocery stores and are told to stay in their homes for up to two weeks to avoid coming in contact with the virus. I cannot imagine being in this situation and would like to help in any way that we can.  While this issue seems scary and overwhelming we can come together as a community to help purchase supplies they are low on send them to her and she will distribute them.  Even the donation of a couple of dollars could help.  If you have any questions or suggestions about getting supplies there efficiently and quickly please message me

title: Single Mom Domestic Violence Victim Starting Over
description: I am raising money for my friend who is a single mother and recently escaped a domestic violence relationship. Both her and her daughter have gone through an extremely traumatic past few months. Scars that will unfortunately last forever. For obvious reasons I am keeping her name and image private. I am asking for a small donation that will go a long way in rebuilding her life brick by brick.  Ive helped as much as I am financially capable of. They literally left with the clothes on their back a carry on bag and her daughters blanket.  She is currently staying with a friend and actively looking for employment. However the basic costs of relocating obtaining a new state ID (required to enroll her daughter in school) food public transportation fees to seek employment etc. quickly adds up.  She also needs to protect her identity due to the severity of the situation hence applying for a name change is on her short list.  The funds will be used for the following: $65 for new state ID (required to enroll her daughter in school) $100 will go towards a new interview outfit $200 will go towards new work clothes $200 will go toward more school schools and new shoes for her daughter $200 will go towards food for 1 month Remaining funds will be saved for emergency funding until she secures employment.  She does not know I have up this Go Fund Me as I would like to surprise her but I know she will be extremely grateful for the help she receives.  She is very frugal and Im confident she will be a good steward of the financial help she receives. This is my first time trying a crowdfunding platform and am hopeful this story will reach someones heart.  Thank you for taking the time to read my Go Fund Me story.

title: COVID19 MUTUAL AID EFFORT
description: March 2020 - NEWS UPDATE - all our efforts are now focused on helping our community to get this difficult time. We are taking donations to help us give to those in need.  January 4 2020. We started to provide a healing space for young people in New York City. The events happen biweekly and are x invite only. Each week the lectures are posted online as video magazine articles. We are raising money for space to hold these events so we can continue to grow the community

title: Covid19-Aiutiamo la terapia intensiva di Polistena
description: In questo momento molto complesso per la sanità abbiamo deciso di lanciare un iniziativa di raccolta fondi per  supportare la terapia intensiva  dellOspedale Santa Maria degli Ungheresi di Polistena.   Il sostegno di ognuno di noi  può fare la differenza in un momento delicato come questo. Più volte si è detto della difficoltà che il nostro Sistema Sanitario si troverebbe ad affrontare in questa emergenza; per questo le nostre intenzioni sono quelle di migliorare lattuale terapia intensiva presso  lOspedale Santa Maria degli Ungheresi di Polistena .  Nel momento in cui il suddetto ospedale richiederà il nostro aiuto noi saremo pronti a sostenerlo.   Un contributo da parte di ognuno di noi potrebbe salvarci la vita . La salute è un diritto di tutti la Calabria può farcela.  Aiutateci a diffondere.  #sosteniamolapiana

title: Help BYSC Corona compete in Florida! (Boys 2006)
description: The BYSC Corona United Soccer Club Boys 2006 Team has earned the opportunity to compete nationally in the Super Y League Finals in Tampa FL (Dec 13th -17th 2019) by finishing undefeated in the Southwest region.   The team competes all over Southern California on any given weekend but this tournament is 2491 miles away.  As each player is valuable to the teams success everyone must make the trip. Many families make financial sacrifices so their child can play each season but this trip is beyond what many families can budget for.    Donations will be used for travel expenses lodging food and equipment to ensure each player can participate.  We need the communitys support so that every player can come and the team can compete together as one.  Support your Corona United team!

title: raising money for the family of Jose Corona
description: We are asking for donations to be able to lay our beloved Jose Corona Galvan to rest. Jose who was only 18 years old had his whole life ahead of him. He was supposed to be starting his new job in a few days and had dreams that were suddenly cut short. As many know he had a bright future because he was trying to turn his life around. He was working with F.L.Y and the New Hope for Youth program. These programs work with at risk youth to help them turn their life around and they were helping Jose get his life back on track. He had also signed up to go back to school to get his last few credits and graduate high school. His counselors described him as self motivated respectful and a hard worker. He has lost his life in terrible way because he was stabbed on October 6th 2019 as he exited Mexico Bakery on Alum Rock. He had gone to the bakery to get some bread for his mom and was never able to return home. He was only four blocks away from his house this should have never happened to him or his family. His family needs your help for his funeral services and to be able to lay him to rest. Anything helps god bless.

title: Warming The Streets: COVID-19
description: Warming The Streets is a project run by young adults aiming to reach out to rough sleepers in London by providing warmth food and conversation in an attempt to brighten up their winter.  Warming The Streets was started because of the very visible issue in the streets of London which is homelessness.  The number of people seen rough sleeping in London increased by 1371 in the past year and is now well over 8000 people. Figures from the Office for National Statistics show that an estimated 726 homeless people died in England and Wales in 2018. We see people struggling on the streets of London everyday and want to make a change in whatever way we can to make it a little less unbearable.  Warming The Streets aims to provide short term comfort to those experiencing homelessness in 3 simple and direct ways:  1) Food - Our packages will contain essential food and drink such as bottles of water granola bars fruit   veg sandwiches and dog food. 2) Clothes - Our packages will contain essential warm clothing such as hats scarves socks blankets and raincoats/anoraks. 3) Conversation - People experiencing homelessness are just that - people. They have the same need for interaction as anyone else; so our volunteers will aim to engage in conversation with the recipients and talk to them about anything that they deem appropriate. During this time we can also hand out optional extras such as maps to local services tooth brushes/paste and cleansing wipes.  Our objective is to be as direct as possible. We hope to receive donations in the form of items clothing and money and assemble our care packages. Our volunteers will deliver them straight to those experiencing homelessness.  100% of the donations will be going towards the assembling and distribution of the care packages and with your help we can bring a little warmth to those experiencing homelessness this winter.  Thank you so much  Warming The Streets

title: #WheredowegoBerk - COVID-19 Crisis - Please help.
description: Please donate to the #WhereDoWeGoBerk Campaign. We are raising money for tents and other winter supplies for the Seabreeze and the I-80 University Underpass homeless encampments.  Each of these encampments experienced increased and repeated Caltrans evictions where they lost tents storage tubs and their belongings. Tents provide shelter. Storage tubs provide food protection from the rats. Garbage and waste management mitigate health and safety risks. The residents of these encampments are being proactive by starting their own campaign to improve their living conditions and prepare for winter. We are asking you to help us please.   KC one of our elders who is disabled and cannot walk moved 7 times in 3 weeks. She lost her tent mattress and many of her belongings. After Caltrans evictions she had to sleep under a boat sail on a metal bed frame. Thanks to Todd Jersey a local Berkeley architect we purchased a new yurt for KC so that she could have shelter and get her wheelchair easily inside. We still need to weatherproof her Yurt and provide her with other needed supplies.   Thank you  Todd Jersey Architecture     There are similar stories throughout these encampments and we need many more tents donated. Patricia Moore another resident needs a Yurt as well because she cannot move her wheelchair in her tent. She needs daily wound care so we need to provide her with fresh bandages and medical supplies.   Patricia Moore in her current tent. She cannot walk and must crawl out of her tent to get into her wheelchair. She cannot roll her wheelchair into her tent so a yurt would give her accessibly and warmth in the winter months.   Winter is coming! These Berkeley residents need to be self-sufficient because city services cannot provide for all of their needs. They are asking the City of Berkeley for trash pick-up porta potties and drinking water. They would also like to purchase heavy duty trash bags and containers.  Help us help them to create a safe clean and weather proof environment.     Our goal is to purchase 50-60 weather proof tents. Unlike when a person goes camping temporarily these tents will be used as a temporary HOME to get someone through the winter and secure their belongings. The money raised will go toward the purchase of tents and other winter supplies including waterproof tarps. Additionally some of the money donated will go toward waste and trash management.   A portion of the money raised will provide 30-50 GoGirls to women so that they can easily use the restroom in uncomfortable spaces.   Find out more information on the  GOGIRL on Amazon.      The donated supplies will be distributed throughout the encampments equally.  At the request of the residents we will set up a donations tent so that other homeless individuals (throughout Berkeley)  can receive the supplies  they need. The donations tent will be run by the unhoused residents themselves who will work as volunteers keeping inventory and equally distributing supplies to all of the individuals living in the encampments.   Our new  Community Donations tent from Amazon.  Thank you Sarah W for this contribution!     The unhoused in Berkeley are uniting to demand an answer to the question: Where do we go? Until they  can find a lawful place to be please help them protect themselves and the most vulnerable in their community from the cold of winter. There are not enough shelter beds or housing. The most vulnerable are our senior citizens and disabled. These communities care and take care of their most vulnerable. They need our help.  The current solutions are not working. We need immediate solutions for this winter and community building. Please help us.    For a history of the Where do we go? movement see recent article by  JP Masser: An Intersecting Tale: Berkeleys #WhereDoWeGo Movement Stays Fast.    Please support  Street Spirit   and purchase a copy of the October 2019 edition from a homeless vendor in Berkeley.  Photo taken by Yessica Prado and Article written by Alastair Boone published in the October 2019 edition of Street Spirit.   Tent design and photo taken by Suzi Garner.   We LOVE you Suzi! I cannot wait until we get Where do we go? t-shirts with your tents as the photo.

title: Fear That COVID-19 Will Prolong My Unemployment!
description: I am legitimately undeniably depressed. I wonder if anyone who really knows me can say that I am a lazy person and that is why I have not worked since the beginning of october.I am suffering from a very real and severe mental illness. Everyday Im out of work it seems worse. In the past Ive was diagnosed with bi-polar disorder suffering hyper mania or manic depression.Its not easy dealing with life when the rug gets pulled out from under me. When Im working everything in the world is amazing. When a job ends I start to suffer from the side effects of my mental illness and I become temporarily disabled.I dont feel the government properly supports people with invisible problems. Ive tried so many times to get psychiatric help and medication though it never seems to work out. Often I just want to end it all.When these times come I hope that I can count on my family friends and community to help.Im just trying to make do keep up with bills and feel comfortable enough to leave my bed more than twice a week.Please help if you can and be a blessing until I can find my strength again. Thank you to everyone in advance and God bless you!

title: My family’s house fire in Corona  Ca
description: 10/18/2019 my Uncle Scott Simmons and Landon Simmons  house caught on fire around 4:30 5:00 am in Corona off green river. My uncle and his son lost everything they owned in it. My uncle he smelled something funny coming from his garage next thing you know he is running out the back of the house with only the clothes on his back. His son had already left for work which means all they left with was the clothes they had on. Please help us help them as now they have nothing. No food no clothes no car nothing left no place to call home. We thank god they are still alive. The money will go towards the things that they need in these hard times. Also will you please say a prayer for there family as they make it thru these hard times especially as the holiday are quickly approaching. Thank you very much anything will help god bless all of you. Also if you guys would like to donate any clothes there sizes are a 2x and a 1x in shirts  38 pants and a 34 in pants and for  shoes size 12 and a 10 shoe thanks for all the love and support just message me and I can pick them up for them or give you a address to send it. God bless all of you!!!

title: Help for the Willis Family
description: Eva and Zach’s daughter Zuriah who will turn three in November was diagnosed with Leukemia at the beginning of October and is undergoing chemotherapy treatment at Stanford Hospital. The diagnosis came after Zuzu had been to the ER in Santa Cruz with a seemingly unbeatable infection. After antibiotics failed to help her and she was having trouble breathing she was eventually airlifted to Stanford and the diagnosis came in the days that followed.    We are friends of the Willis family and we want to help them stay on their feet during this difficult time so they can focus all of their energy on helping Zuzu through her cancer treatments. Both Eva and Zach have been unable to work and as of now it’s uncertain when they will be able to return to “normal” life as they are spending all their time with Zuzu in Palo Alto.   Help us ease the burden for this beautiful family! Please donate what you can or just share some kind words. Any and all support is appreciated.

title: Drew Coronas’ Road to Recovery
description: Our friend Drew Coronas recently had a stroke on October 15.  He is currently in rehabilitation until November 15 to begin his road to recovery. Once he returns home he will continue rehabilitation. We know the burdens a sudden illness can cause on a family’s finances.  Drew will be out of work for an undetermined amount of time which will result in no pay during that time as well the additional burden of purchasing $1200 cobra medical insurance coverage to keep his insurance constant during all of his rehabilitation. The lack of pay the additional $1200 needed each month for his insurance and the medical bills from being hospitalized for one month and all of the medical testing transports etc. has created a hardship for his family. Please consider donating to help Drew and his family.

title: Always be remembered!
description: When you are not prepared for life changes it’s difficult to pay for extreme situations! Any donation will make a difference. .50cents or $1 $5 anything changes the future please help us raise money for my mom’s funeral. Thank you in advance for your cooperation!

title: April Follies: COVID-19
description: Would you like to join us in making a difference?   We are raising money to benefit April Follies the largest and longest running queer partner dance competition in North America. It  takes place in Oakland Ca. the last Saturday in April every year. This event stands as a beacon of joy and celebration and began as a direct result of mainstream  ban on same-sex couples in competition.   Our goal WAS to raise $8000 towards the costs of the event.  However since we have had to cancel our 2020 event due to COVID-19 we are now asking for your help to recover our losses.  e.g.  we are losing our $2000 deposit on our venue and we have spent a similarly large sum on publicity.  We have no paid staff.  We are all volunteer.  Your donation is tax deductible and with your help we will recover and be back bigger and better in  2021 (most likely April 24).   Thank you in advance for any contribution big or small that you can make to this cause that means so much to our community at large!   https://www.aprilfollies.com/   To glimpse the world of queer ballroom check out    https://www.hottotrotfilm.com/    All the competitors featured have competed in April Follies.  And this!     https://abc7news.com/entertainment/same-sex-ballroom-dancing-popular-in-bay-area/1317834/

title: Please help us give Ruth Jones a proper burial
description: Yesterday(Tuesday 11/5) morning my grandmother unexpectedly passed away. None of us are prepared. We are unaware if she had a life insurance policy. My siblings and I are looking for donations so we can give my grandmother  the woman who raised us a proper funeral. The total cost for the funeral is $8700. Before the funeral home can even bury her or proceed with the funeral we have to have the whole $8700 up front. Any little thing will help us at this point.   Thank you Hello everyone. As everyone may know Nanny went home early Tuesday morning. Shes been sick lately and struggling with her health and we werent prepared and she didnt ever tell us which direction to go or what to do in the case of her leaving. She tried to prepare us for life but we never expected this. I hate having to do this but please if anyone can help even if its a little it will help us get closer to putting her in her final resting spot next to my brother Nate. I know alot of people dont trust GoFundMes but this helped Nate and it was our last resort so if anyone doesnt feel comfortable with GoFundMe you could even call Geo. J Carroll funeral home and put money toward her funeral. Its a tough situation losing the woman who raised us and loved us so so unconditionally who was our guidance in life and now having to figure this out without her.. we dont know what to do.From the bottom of our hearts thank you.We love you Nanny.

title: Crona Strong! Please help Robert in his fight!
description: October 16 2019 everything changed for Robert Corona loving husband to Rachelle and father to Rae Joey Elijah and Nessa when they found out he had  Stage IV Colon Cancer  at the age of 36.   From that moment Robert has said he will beat this! Robert has a large extended family and friends who we know will be right beside him loving and fighting with him!    Hitting the ground running they decided to start curative treatment as fast as they could. With 3 months of chemotherapy surgery  and another 3 months of Chemotherapy. He and his family will need our support and love as he embarks on this journey. There are many ways we can rally around Robert and his incredible family: prayers meals love and financial support.     This means giving up a few things He loves and enjoys for the near future like his job and little league. Robert has been a loyal hardworking employee for Berryessa Union School District for the last 18 years a job which he has excelled at. He is well respected and loved at his job even being awarded employee of the year for all his hard work.     Robert has since stepped down from being President of Berryessa Little League a passion of his since his diagnosis.Robert has been an active part of little league since he first coached his daughter Rae in 2007 at North Valley.  In 2008 he started coaching for Berryessa Little League where he coached all of his kids his nephews and countless children.  His loving sprit was always noticed on the field from racing the kids around the bases with 60 of his work keys clipped to his belt. Maintaining the fields for the league and at countless board meetings. If you didn’t see him coaching or working on the field you could find him umpiring games .     Robert is one of the easiest people to love and friend in minutes.  He is the only person I know who makes friends every single place he goes. Robert can walk into a party not knowing one person and by the end of the night he has made friends with everyone there making plans to see them again. With his outgoing and joking personality who wouldn’t want to be his new friend. He would also give the shirt off his back and if you need any help he’s the first to volunteer without you even asking.  He has the ability to make you feel as if you’ve known him for years even after only just minutes of knowing him.    Robert also loves his wife Rachelle who he has been with for 20 years. He’s a family man through and through You see that love and devotion in his 4 children.  His family is the most important thing to him.  Cancer will not stop him from doing anything and everything he can for them.   Anyone who knows Robert knows how loved he makes everyone around him feel. Through this journey Robert Rachelle and kids will need our help. Robert and Rachelle will both be out of work during this (Robert being the main provider)and have lots of added expenses with lots of doctors visits tests medicines special diet gas and care along with their regular monthly expenses. All donations will go directly towards these things. Please help us make their next few months a little easier with one less thing to worry about.  Every little bit helps and we can’t thank you enough in advance for your love and support.     The road to recovery will have its ups and downs but we know that we will all rally around Robert Rachelle and kids with any and all support we can give!      Remember rule #1 from Coach Robert.  Have fun and always give 100%!!      THEY WILL BEAT THIS!      If you’d like to help support them in any other way please email chellelarae430@gmail.com   #CRONASTRONG   #YOURFIGHTISOURFIGHT

title: Jose M “Rey” Fregozo Funeral Expenses
description: It is with our deepest sorrow that we inform you of the death of our beloved friend Jose M “Rey” Fregozo 11-5-2019.He leaves behind his mother two sisters nieces and nephews. He was always there for family and many of his friends and now it’s time to return the favor. All proceeds of your donation will be going to his family in hopes to help with funeral costs and memorial services.  Es con nuestro dolor mas profundo que les informamos de la muerte de nuestro querido amigo Jose M. “Rey” Fregozo Noviembre 5 2019.El deja a su mama 2 hermanas sobrinas y sobrinos. Siempre estuvo ahí para la familia y muchos de sus amigos y ahora es momento de devolverle el favor. Todas las donaciones irán a su familia para ayudarse con el costo de lis servicios funebres.

title: Viva la Rasa
description: My dear family of friends  San Francisco is on lock down due to the COVID19 and the virus is affecting our dear City and community like nothing ever before. These are perilous times and we have yet to know when this will end but it will. To deter the progress of the virus the SF Bay Area govt has cancelled and banned events and ask for extreme health and precautions in public places. It is advised to stay in your homes as to not contribute to the problem but eliminate this incredible monster. The time it will take is yet to be known.  As a professional musician performer and artist for events in San Francisco and around the world 100 percent of my work as of February 21 and beyond has been cancelled without any available action to receive cancellation fees. My very survival is at risk. I need to be able to be able to pay for transportation cleaning and emergency supplies for daily living and disaster preparedness as well as healthy foods!  I am happy to say I am blessed with a place to stay at this time but I have zero income! Lovers and supporters of the arts  pleases love and care at this very concerning dire time. If our federal   local governments won’t give us Medicare-for-all or relief for lost wages it’s up to us to help each other!!  Other ways to support: Venmo: @rasa vitalia PayPal:  rasa@rasavitalia.com  Patreon:   http:///rasawww.Patreon.comvitalia   Thank you all so very much for your blessed help. Please by the grace of God may  you your friends family and all be safe healthy and blessed always.

title: Walter Zavala Funeral And Family Expenses
description: This is a Fundraiser for my brother Walter who unfortunately has passed away on Nevember 12 2019. While his funeral and casket have been paid. Catering and casket transportation to Marana where his wake will be help has not been covered. His wife and my mom have decided to take the week off for preparations. Regular expeses still need to be made and we will be reciving family all week and we need help to pay for food and drinks and everything else needed to sustain large amounts of family and friends who will be coming throughout the week who come and give their condolances and we just cant afford to cater on our own. Please if you can help us and make a donation it will go towards helping us get through the worst week in our lives without having to worry about Life Expenses. Also there will be an Envolope At the Desert Diamond Casino for those who can donate cash. Thank you for your help if you can.                                         Coraima

title: Baltazar Corona
description: Mi familia y yo hemos estado peleando una guerra donde mi papa era el jefe y nosotros su ejercito.  Lamentablemente hemos perdido una batalla pero la guerra la gano mi papa. Pues al morir El llego al cielo a la vida eterna y el enemigo se quedo aqui para convertirse en polvo... Una vez mas mi papa nos mostró que nunca se dio por vencido... Nos dejo con el corazón roto especialmente a mi mama. Por favor manténganla en sus oraciones...  Este 21 de Noviembre del 2019 Dios llamo a mi papá a gozar de una vida eterna junto a sus padres y hermanos.   “Le dijo Jesús: Yo soy la resurrección y la vida; el que cree en mí aunque esté muerto vivirá.” Juan 11:25  Les agradecemos inmensamente toda su ayuda en estos momentos.

title: Leo Corona (Funeral Service)
description: Leo Corona was 45 when his life was taken away. He was an amazing person and loved his family. He was a very hardworking and always helped out anyone who needed his help. Leo Corona was assaulted on 11/21/19 in SavannahGa in his home. He left behind his wife Olga Cervantes his son Ricardo Corona and daughter Ximena Corona. Were are asking  anyone that can help with a small donation to help out with the funeral. Anything you donate is helpful we will truly appreciate it. Thank you and God bless.   Leo Corona tenía 45 años cuando le quitaron la vida. Era una persona increíble y amaba a su familia. Era muy trabajador y siempre ayudaba a cualquiera que necesitara su ayuda. Leo Corona fue asaltado el 11/21/19 en Savannah Ga en su casa. Dejó a su esposa Olga Cervantes su hijo Ricardo Corona y su hija Ximena Corona. Estamos pidiendo a cualquiera que pueda ayudar con una pequeña donación que ayude con el funeral. Cualquier cosa que done es útil realmente lo apreciaremos. Gracias y Dios te bendiga.

title: Heal to Live Live to Heal --> BECAUSE of COVID-19
description: My Hebrew name is Rafael ( ??????? -- after the healing archangel ) and my living situation is urgently being challenged by recent disabilities caused by a rare immune disease and its treatment that include leg and foot damage and COPD.  I started this campaign because I believe I can earn my expenses and make a profit with the internet business of promoting and selling quality alternative health products through affiliate marketing--despite these challenges and COVID-19.   It is extra urgent as I have no income now as I used to set face-to-face meeting between real estate agents and property owners part time and only have a reserve of about 2-3 months before Im all out.  My underlying autoimmune disease putting me in the COVID-19 high risk group is called  EGPA   and causes severe daily sinus and lung infections--but  after researching and employing an alternative treatment using ozone gas infused into water and oil I was able to completely stop them and heal my tissues.   I also have progressive cardiomyopathy and COPD with lungs operating at 40%.  My disease ulcerates the arterial lining within organs and can make them fail and has attacked my colon retina middle ear (causing profound hearing loss) lungs and heart along with side effects of the steroids which weaken my muscle skeletal system resulting in ruptures of tendons and breaking of bones.  I now feel that I have not only been given a new lease on life but a compelling mission to help others who with standard medical practices might not be making good progress and who are loosing hope .    Since 1981 when I was lucky to be diagnosed properly I have prevailed despite the constant aggressive onslaught of this disease that has included 31 restorative corrective surgeries or procedures to keep me functioning. I know that by remaining persistent focused and full of faith and gratitude there is little that I can’t accomplish with your help. B”H  Any amount would go towards a suggested working ad budget used during a course I am taking that I already purchased with savings created by a top performer in this field who was written up in Forbes Magazine in 2015.  It will be also used to float me with paying expenses during the time it takes to hit financial independence which is about $1800/mo--my total personal expenses.    I have had a very rough time during the last promotion of my campaign through January where I had to overcome 2 bouts of lung infections so I need a budget again to launch this business.  I deeply appreciate the growing community that supports me.  Together we can do this.  $18 and multiples thereof receive a special blessing as it stands for life.    LChaim with Rabbi Yossi.     Studying and reading Torah after Shacharit with my dear friend Gil.

title: Jasiah Mayo Clinic Visit
description: For much of his adult life Jasiah has suffered from inexplicable health problems. This year his health has taken an especially bad turn. His condition has become so debilitating that he has been unable to work for months.  His doctors in San Diego have been unable to diagnose his condition or relieve his suffering. Going into 2020 he has been left with no choice but to go outside of his insurance network for better care.   In January he will be going to the Mayo Clinic. We know the first visit  can run between $15000-$20000 to cover multiple doctor visits and testing. Below is a rough breakdown of what we expect this will cost:  Flights: $700 (for two people) Hotel: $1500-2000 (for 7-10 nights) Car: $600-1000 Initial Visit: $500-1000 Testing: $10000-15000  Total: $13600-$19100  This holiday instead of gifts please give to this fund to help get Jasiah back to health. Please give for Jasiah his wife Stephanie and his 1yo son Jax. Medical bills and travel are expensive. Every little bit helps.   Thank you.

title: Moms&Children Enrichment Services in CoronaQueens
description: Greetings and thank you so much for taking the time to visit my page.  My heart is full and excited to share my business with the Corona/Elmhurst communities. With professional/academic experience working in Harlem Bed-Stuy along with out-of state experience in the Roxbury/Dorchester/Jamaica Plain communities in Boston I am truly proud and ecstastic to share my learnings resources and heart into my own local community.   With your financial support I will be able to provide workforce development to moms in the community due to a variety of societal circumstances are unable to secure FT/PT work experience and training to add financial support their families. I also provide AP/Honor Roll teen scholars and artists the opportunity to tutor and teach Arts enrichment activities ranging from Intro to Dance Intro to Vocal and Intro to Theatre/Improv.  In addition my business offers enrichment activities ranging from early childhood enrichment tutoring and school age afterschool and arts-based enrichment programs for the Corona/Elmhurst community.  All quality services are offered at low-cost affordable options with proven impact on the school readiness and future career success of our communitys children.   As a born and raises native to the Corona/Elmhurst area I can attest that access to quality and affordable enrichment and tutoring has and remains completely underrepresented. Leaving our children at tremendous academic advantage by the time they reach high school/ college level.  As both a parent and native to the Corona/Elmhurst community it is my intention goal and mission to provide much needed enrichment and social services resources into my hometown and broader historically underrepresented communities in Queens NY.  Having worked and volunteered countless hours over the past 20 years in the nonprofit /social services / education enrichment industries Im determined to be the change in the world I want to see.  Help me infuse opportunity and hope into the future of Corona/Elmhurst children and families. One Smile at a time.   Donate $5 Today! Thank you for your support in the movement.

title: Nevaeh Corona
description: RIP to our Beautiful Sweet Angel Nevaeh. You were such a healthy happy energetic and playful little baby. You’re only 8 months old   as much as this pains all of us we know God has bigger and better plans for you Baby Girl. Our hearts aches terribly knowing you are no longer with us. This is so unreal. Feels like a horrible nightmare we all cannot seem to wake up from. Instead of getting ready to celebrate your first Christmas with your family we will be planning your service. We are all sadden by this sudden and unexpected loss we are all heartbroken. Words cannot describe how we all feel. We love you so much and you will forever remain in our hearts.  ***April 09 2019 - December 14 2019***  We are asking for help. Anything will help any amount even a prayer. Nothing is too little or too small. Help us put together a proper burial for our Sweet Angel Nevaeh ??

title: A Helping Hand for the Coronas
description: Our dear friend Ambre Ojais Corona passed away last night unexpectedly. This took us all by surprise. She was a loving mom wife and friend. She will definitely be missed and we are terribly saddened to have lost her.   She’s leaving behind 4 kids (3 boys and 1 girl) along with her husband Val.   This fundraiser is to help her family with funeral and moving expenses. If you can please consider donating. If you can’t sharing this campaign will also help them greatly.  Thank you again.

title: AWAY Puerto Rico Relief Effort
description: AWAY Puerto Rico is a relief effort and enduring partnership between East Stroudsburg University and the rural areas of Puerto Rico that were hit hardest by Hurricane Maria; namely the municipios of Patillas Maunabo and Yabucoa. This relief effort will provide mental health first aid and will replace crucial damaged or lost signage. The AWAY Puerto Rico teams will also train Puerto Rican leaders in these areas with the goal of creating a sustainable relief effort.  Please consider donating so that we are able to acquire the much needed materials and resources for this mission.

title: Manuel Quezada (Papa)
description: Family and friends it’s with a heavy heart I am writing this.   This evening a great husband father brother and grandfather Manuel Quezada (Papa) our father was called home by our heavenly father. We were so blessed to have had such a beautiful man as a father and will cherish the memories.   I am setting up this Go Fund me page to help with funeral expenses. This is a difficult time for us as we prepare to lay our beloved Papa to rest.   Please keep our family in your prayer.     Any donations are greatly appreciate.   Thank you.  God Bless     Manuels Children:  Danny Rodriguez  Juanita Quezada  Josie Gomez  Virginia Gomez  Lisa Gomez  Ray Gomez  Christopher Gomez     And many grandchildren.

title: Emergenza Covid19 nelle comunità masai Tanzania
description: Siamo Cristina e Ilaria due amiche con la passione per lAfrica e legate sentimentalmente con due guerrieri masai della Tanzania con cui abbiamo due splendide figlie.   Trascorriamo mesi vivendo in remoti villaggi della savana e cercando di dare un contributo alla comunità masai locale portando vestiti in particolare felpe per le fredde notti del bush medicine di cui hanno bisogno e aiutando nellacquisto di beni di prima necessità.   Questa volta però abbiamo un progetto ben più ampio che da sole non potremmo realizzare: vorremmo creare 2 pozzi per lacqua e abbiamo bisogno di voi.   Ne vorremmo creare uno per ogni comunità dei nostri guerrieri che sono lontani dallaltra: la prima si chiama Msomera ed è un minuscolo villaggio remoto non facile da raggiungere se non in moto.   Cristina arrivò lì nel 2015 e rimase scioccata nel vedere la fatica dei giovani guerrieri e delle donne che si calavano in grosse buche scavate nel terreno per riemire i loro secchi e li tiravano su pieni e pesanti grazie ad un passaggio di mani.   Lacqua era marrone e fangosa e purtroppo disponibile disponibile.   Qualche anno dopo venne costruito un lago artificiale grandissimo e tutto è filato liscio fino a pochi mesi fa quando le abbondanti piogge hanno fatto franare parte del lago che adesso non esiste più.   Vorremmo creare un pozzo dove la gente può avere acqua pulita senza dover faticare e spezzarsi la schiena sotto il peso dei secchi.   Laltro pozzo invece lo vorremmo costruire vicino al meno isolato villaggio di Kiberashi dove la popolazione comunque dove camminare ben 30 minuti ed oltre per arrivare all   acqua sotto la calura del sole africano e portando sulla testa pesanti secchi.   Ci auguriamo di cuore e grazie al vostro supporto di poter aiutare concretamente queste comunità messe a dura prova dalla povertà e dalle sempre più frequenti calamità naturali dovute anche ai cambiamenti climatici.   Ci trovate su Instagram: @cri.ila_aroundafrica

title: Help LLP Expand the SHOP & Survive COVID-19
description: Welcome!  For those of you who may not be aware I quit my full-time job after quite a traumatic and emotionally abusive school year. I was completely shattered and disillusioned by the systems in place that often times push out educators such as myself. The educators who hold radical visions for our future and utilize art to reimagine our reality. Although it was a battle lost I have decided to continue fighting to win the war. I will invest my gifts and my energy in sustaining a business that is accountable grounded in truth is constantly shifting towards best practices and is invested in decolonization and the cyclical force of community.     Call to Action:   Please donate anything you can to support my business  LOVE. LIGHT   POETRY (LLP) by  MAR 31TH. Just before National Poetry Month!        2020 Fundraising Goals:     The goal for LOVE. LIGHT   POETRY (LLP) is expansion and abundance. We are working to construct a stronger and sustainable foundation for the growth of LLP.    Become an LLC      LLP will construct a sustainable foundation for LLP by becoming an LLC. February 1 will mark LLP’s 3rd year in existence fulfilling its mission to expose the world to the medicinal elements of poetry and to fortify the accessibility of poetry workshops that urge individuals to be in constant dialogue with their lifes purpose.      Expand the SHOP       We would like to expand the SHOP with new apparel exhibiting lines of poetry that further spread the mission of LLP.  Our apparel has successfully blessed individuals that come in reach with the radiating sun logo with love and light throughout the U.S and internationally.      Strides in 2019:          *  The video above is a peak into the Open Mic portion of a workshop *    - In 2019 LOVE. LIGHT   POETRY (LLP) serviced approximately 80 individuals in 9 workshops. LLP has hired two young women of color to intern experiencing first hand the functions of a business and have access to social/emotional development through our poetry workshops.   - Our apparel has successfully expanding beyond the 50 states and have been worn in Ghana the Dominican Republic Barbados and Indonesia.   - Furthermore we have been blessed to have run LLP with the support of our intimate communities and partnerships with organizations such as the People’s Forum May Day Space The Audre Lorde Project Children’s Art Carnival Survival Arts and more.          Closing Message:     Every morning I arise and see the quote on my wall “Everything seems impossible until it is done” by Nelson Mandela.     The only way our dreams come true is through the faith resting within ourselves and that of which is affirmed by the   communities    we create.  Anything  you can contribute is greatly appreciated! Please SHARE this GoFundMe within your communities to spread the word!    Many blessings to you in the new year. The world is all yours how you will you fill it with LOVE   LIGHT?     To learn more about LOVE. LIGHT   POETRY  visit our website  here   .

title: Una Mano Para Silvia
description: HolaMi nombre es Patricia la hija de Silvia Guanipa quién ha sido diagnosticada con Hemorragia Digestiva y se encuentra en un estado complicado en Valencia Venezuela. Ella necesita ser tratada a un hospital el cual requiere pago en dólares de una alta cantidad. Necesitamos de su ayuda con el aporte que Dios ponga en su corazón.Dios les bendiga.

title: Auntie Rosas Surgery
description: Hello everyone.  I am  seeking your support to raise funds for my Aunt Rosa Maria Rodriguez surgery for an abdominal aortic aneurysm.   The last few months have been a downhill battle for my aunt and our family. My aunt has been struggling with pain and discomfort since September 2019. Finally  on December 2019 she was diagnosed with an abdominal aortic aneurysm.   What has made the last few months even more difficult is the sudden death of her daughter and my cousin Marisela; who passed unexpectedly do to a stroke this last December.  Aunt Rosa is completely devastated by the loss of her only living daughter; whom she relied on as her main emotional financial and physical support.  What moves us to ask for your support is that Aunt Rosa lives in Venezuela; where there is an economic and political crisis that greatly impacts the cost of the procedure.  As a family we have done everything we can to financially help Aunt Rosa. Unfortunately we have maxed out our resources.   Aunt Rosa is in urgent need of surgery; the prótesis alone will cost $800 USD surgery and other medical expenses will cost $1500 USD ($3000 CAD).   We understand if at this time you are not able to make a monetary contribution; it will be greatly appreciated if you can help us by sharing this post on your social media outlets.   We thank you for your support and generosity.

title: Miguelitos Retinoblastoma (eye cancer) Treatment
description: Hi  my name is Miguel Zapien Corona and everyone calls me Miguelito (little Mike).  I am 1 year old from Guadalajara Jalisco Mexico.  Just few days before Christmas my mom took  me to the doctor because when she took a picture she could see on my right eye a strange light.    After the doctors appointment the nightmare started for my family....   We started performing some test and examinations with the ophthalmologist and they confirmed the diagnostic:  Retinoblastoma (eye cancer) in my right eye.  The tumor was large....... The worst fear that a mother could bear is to hear his baby has cancer and his life is in danger.   The doctors in Guadalajara wanted to remove my eye but we found the only clinic in Mexico (Hospital Zambrano Hellion) that can do a treatment with intra-arteriel chemotherapy (most likely 4-5 times)  to try to save my eye and my life.     However this treatment  is very expensive ($16000 usd each treatment) that is not cover by my insurance plus  travel expenses to Monterrey several times.       I need to start treatment as soon as possible due the tumor is getting larger and could spread very soon.  Im a happy kid and want to live.   There is still to much to discover and enjoy.   I will fight this battle against cancer beside God and my family.  Life can change in seconds.  Remember to Love with all your hearth and be grateful for every sunshine!  We thank you infinite for reading my story and helping us with your prayers and donation .  p.s. GoFundme donations are  dollars.    The fund for this campaign will be going to Miguelitos treatment: doctors appointments test chemio travel expenses.  Thanks for your kind support       ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~  Hola  me llamo Miguel Zapien Corona  todos me conocen como Miguelito.   Tengo 1 anio y naci en Guadalajara Jalisco Mexico.  Unos dias antes de Navidad mi mami me llevo al doctor porque vio una luz extrania en mi ojo derecho cuando me tomo una foto.  Despues de la cita con el doctor la pesadilla para mi familia comenzo.   Comenzamos a realizar examenes con el oftalmologo y lo confirmaron:  Retinoblastoma (cancer en mi ojo derecho).  El tumor era bastante grande......El peor temor que una madre puede esperar es escuchar que su bebe tiene cancer y su vida esta en peligro.     Los doctores en Guadalajara quireren remover mi ojo  pero mi familia encontro la unica clinica en Mexico (Hospital Zambrano Hellion) que tiene un tratamiento llamado Quimioembolizacion de Retinoblastoma.     Miguelito es candidato y necesitaria 4 - 5 tratamientos para poder salvar mi ojo y mi vida.  Sin embargo este tratamiento es muy caro ($16000 usd por tratamient) que no es cubierto por mi seguro y necesitamos viajar varias veces a Monterrey.  Necesito comenzar el tratamiento lo antes posible pues el tumor es muy grande y se puede esparcir a otras partes muy pronto.  Soy un nino muy alegre y quiero vivir!  Hay mucho que me queda por aprender y disfrutar.  Luchare esta batalla contra el cancer al lado de Dios y mi familia.  La vida cambia en segundos.  Recuerda Amar con todo tu corazon y agradecer por cada amanecer.  Te agradecemos infinitamente por leer mi historia y ayudarnos con tus rezos y donaciones.  Para donaciones en  Pesos  anexamos la cuenta.  O si gustar donar a traves de GoFundMe considera tipo de cambio de pesos a dollarses

title: AYUDEMOS A OSCAR
description: Hoy necesito de tu ayuda! Razón por la cual mi hijo OSCAR PALMAR Padece de una enfermedad mental llamada “Trastorno Bipolar” Requiere ser Hospitalizado en la ciudad de maracaibo aproximadamente 2 meses le estaría muy agradecida de su colaboración ya que el costo de la clínica y sus medicamentos es una suma alta de dinero por muy poco o mucha que sea tu colaboración me servirá de mucho para su pronta recuperación HOY POR MÍ MAÑANA POR TÍ Dios te bendiga y te lo multiplique ??

title: Prayers and Support for Cherice
description: To all friends and family Cherice Patterson from Redding  living in Las Vegas is currently in a Phoenix hospital fighting for her life. She had a major brain bleed. Two surgeries later she has opened her eyes however the doctors have said it will be a long road to recovery. Her family is asking for prayers. Please support Cherice in her fight.

title: Apoyo Contra el Cancer Tia Blanca
description: Familia y amigos esta recaudación es en beneficio para Sra. Blanca Maldonado (nuestra tía mamá amiga) para una operación que se necesita de emergencia para combatir el cancer en su vejiga. Ella tiene dos años pagando los tratamientos pero desafortunadamente el cancer regreso y la opción que le dan es remover la vejiga lo más pronto posible pero por desgracia la Familia no a podido recaudar suficientes fondos para el procedimiento. Por lo que de todo corazón hacemos esta colecta y se les agradecería enormemente su apoyo con lo que ustedes gusten cooperar en verdad muchas gracias y que Dios los bendiga . ——— Friends and family we are asking for help for Blanca Maldonado. She is a big part of our family a hardworking mother and a wonderful friend.  She was diagnosed with cancer in the bladder two years ago and needs to be operated. She’s been going to chemotherapy but the cancer keeps coming back.  The only option she has now is to remove her bladder.  The cost for this procedure is  $5000; however we are having trouble pulling these funds for her due to the medical bills she’s incurred these past years.  Those of you who know her know that she does not have funds for this procedure and we ask from the bottom of our hearts for any assistance. We are very grateful for any donations no matter how big or small. Any amount really helps.  Thank you.

title: Help us bury our loved one
description: On 1/09/2020 our dear son father brother uncle and friend was taken too soon from the Corona family. This death was unexpected to everyone therefore the family was not financially ready to assume burial costs which we all know are ridiculously high these days. The reason for his passing was due to lung failure which eventually lead to a heart attack. Our brother was admitted to the homestead hospital on Saturday 01/04/2020 he was in the ICU for a total of 5 days during which he fought his hardest to make it out of his coma but unfortunately his body couldn’t continue to fight and at 11:46 PM we lost a beautiful soul and gained an angel. Unfortunately our loved one was heavy set which makes the costs be even higher than usual therefore with a heavy heart we are asking for donations anything helps we are very grateful for anything that can be donated to our family in this traumatic event. Thank you.  ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~  El 1/09/2020 nuestro querido hijo padre hermano tío y amigo fue tomado demasiado pronto de la familia Corona. Esta muerte fue inesperada para todos por lo tanto la familia no estaba financieramente preparada para asumir los costos de entierro que todos sabemos son ridículamente altos en estos días. La razón de su fallecimiento se debió a una insuficiencia pulmonar que finalmente condujo a un ataque cardíaco. Nuestro hermano fue ingresado en el hospital de Homestead el sábado 01/04/2020 estuvo en la UCI durante un total de 5 días durante los cuales luchó con todas sus fuerzas para salir de su coma pero desafortunadamente su cuerpo no pudo seguir luchando y a las 11:46 PM perdimos un alma hermosa y ganamos un ángel. Desafortunadamente nuestro ser querido tenía bastante sobre peso lo cual hace que los costos sean aún más altos de lo habitual por lo tanto con un dolor en el corazón estamos pidiendo donaciones cualquier cosa ayuda estamos muy agradecidos por todo lo que se pueda donar a nuestra familia en este evento traumático. Gracias.

title: Funeral expenses for Constantino Corona
description: https://abc13.com/2-still-missing-in-galveston-after-deadly-boat-crash-with-tanker/5850570/     As most by now know my friend’s father was in a horrible boating accident Tuesday 1/14/2020 just a little after 3p.m. We are all having some trouble dealing with this sudden death in our family and I have come to our community to ask for any and all help with funeral and other unexpected expenses. Constantino Corona (Cacho) was born 03/11/1959. He had worked on shrimp boats for more than 30yrs. That was his lifestyle that is what he knew. He was the sweetest man you will have ever met. He did no harm to anyone.  Constantino is survived by his 2 daughters Desarie Gonzalez and April Corona upon many more family members.

title: Ayuda Para Alondra Corona
description: As some of you know yesterday Alondra posted a link de un ataque armado en donde sadly her cousin perdio la vida y sus 2 niños de 7 y 9 años fueron lastimados. She is driving to Ensenada this morning to be with her family in this really hard times. Alondra has asked for us to ask you guys for any donations or any help that you guys might be able to bring to her family in need at this time. Like many of us her family was not financially prepared for something like this to happen. I ask you to please keep her family in your prayers send good vibes but most of all any donations that you guys may be able to do.

title: Ac Sapphire music Release & corona cancels tour:(
description: Hello dear friends of the world!   I have been writing recording transforming and moving emotions around in my heart to release music into the world for quite some time now!   I have paid for everything thus far myself and need to recoup my recording costs as well as make physical copies of my music to sell at shows and other cool merchandise! I also need to get some work done on my car before I go on the tour and buy some new gear to take on the road with me! There are so many expenses on this music path!   I need to raise the money as soon as possible to get it all sorted before I go on tour in the middle of March with  Lauren Ruth Ward .  Its a dream come true to go on tour with her and I couldnt have gotten this far without your support.     Anyone that donates will receive a digital download of my upcoming EP Omni Present all of my releases for 2020 and a few other past releases.     If reach my goal of $7770 I will be donating  10% to the  Rock n Roll Camp for Girls.   This is an amazing nonprofit that empower girls and non-binary children through music.    I sing from my heart for the love of music and for the love of sharing something personal with people. I feel honored to be on the life path of being a musician and your contribution will help me stay on that path!   Thank you so much for your generosity love and support!

title: Fund to Assist Clients Affected by COVID-19
description: Valor House is sober living community for men located in Marietta Georgia that is committed to helping men live a life free of substance use disorder.   We believe that providing a safe comfortable and healthy environment is essential in promoting a life free from disease of addiction. Living in a community of men searching recovery  fosters connection rather than isolation we feel the chances of living a life free from addiction is considerably greater.                  Valor House gave me the foundation and community that was vital in my recovery. I was welcomed with open arms by brothers who could relate to my addiction. Valor House showed me that a life of sobriety was possible.          -John S.           Over the past 5 years since we were founded weve helped scores of men learn to live and a build a life in sobriety and now we wish to expand on that.    The money raised through this fundraiser will go towards paying program fees and other costs associated with keeping our doors open and our clients housed and fed during these times when people are getting their hours cut or getting laid off due to COVID-19. The majority of our clients come from jails county funded detoxes or from living on the street in situations that are not conducive to building  a life in sobriety.       In March of 2018 I was released from jail on probation and had nothing but the clothes on my back.  Jason the director of Valor gave me an opportunity to come into the program without anything.  He took a huge financial chance.  Without this gift I would not be where I am today.  The structure of being in a 12 step community and given a chance to work on my sobriety within a safe environment was monumental. Today with 2 years sober I have my life back restoration with my family and a huge recovery community that I am a part of.          -Jonathan W.      The men at Valor House are required to attend recovery meetings house meetings work and pay program fees once they get on their feet.  Our goal is to help these men get established in recovery and to live a productive and happy life free from addiction..  Valor House has helped many men who now are able to help other addicts who want to get clean.While offering high accountability Valor House is built on a strong  foundation of recovery and emphasizes the importance of community in promoting a sober life.         Valor House gave me a safe haven to heal from my addictions and provided me with a nurturing community of like-minded men who are also committed to living in the world as contributing members of society. In addition to accountability the staff at Valor House offered me the opportunity to participate in service projects and showed me by example that acts of kindness and charity are vital to my own recovery.          - Rich M.        We currently have 2 full time staff members that live on property provide recovery coaching and administer random drug and alcohol screening. All clients are required to attend daily recovery meetings and weekly community meetings.  We regularly do community service projects in and around Marietta as well.       Valor House changed my life like else could. the moment I walked in Christmas Day 2017 I was enveloped with love and compassion I had never felt before. Valor saved my life and gave my family their son back. Because of this place I have an amazing life that is so full and amazing. Valor House and its loving and compassionate leader Jason Rudra are not only the reason I am alive today but thriving.                      -Mike N.            A number of our guys come in with little to nothing in terms of finances. A lot of our guys are willing to do the work of living and building a life in sobriety and all they might need is a little support and somebody to believe in them. Wed like to help everyone but unfortunately we sometimes have to turn people away because they cant financially cover the costs associated with getting into recovery.With your help we feel we can help prevent another friend or loved one dying from this disease.  Connection is the opposite of addiction and with your help we can help more men get connected and stay sober.        I came to Valor in 2016 broken and homeless. I had no family left that was willing to help out and I was as the end of the road. If you truly want to get help Valor House is in the business to do just that. I was constantly pushed to do more be more and give more of myself. I will forever be grateful to Valor House and the program of recovery I learned to live there.          -Jeff B.

title: 10p Corona Water Damage Repairs
description: Hey everyone   As most of you know we were hit with an unexpected water leak that damaged some of the gyms equipment and flooring ( We have lost over 1500 sqft of mat). We are hoping to raise enough funds to help cover the costs of the repairs. We greatly appreciate any help you guys can give us. Those that donate to the fund will also receive 30 days free.  Thank you for your time and contribution.

title: Funding for Wuhan Coronavirus
description: The Wuhan Coronavirus is spreading quickly. There have now been more than 400 cases in China with 17 dead and a case has been detected in Washington State. Hospitals in Wuhan have been extremely full in the past few days. Fifteen first responders have been infected with the virus while trying to help others but despite the risk all the doctors in the respiratory department are working day and night nonstop despite the approaching Lunar New Year a time traditionally for family reunions.     If we do not stop this infection in Wuhan in China it may very well spread all over the world. Recently the Chinese Newspaper published a call to people around the world to donate to Wuhan to purchase much needed medical supplies to stop the virus. Please donate to these people fighting on the front line so that we have a chance to stop the virus before it becomes the next SARS.  I will take the money donated purchase the materials and ship them to hospitals in Wuhan

title: Help Control SARI-NovelCoronavirus  in Wuhan CHINA
description: Houston International Cultural Center (HICC) want you join us in making a difference!!  With the pandemic spread of a Novel  Coronavirus (2019-nCoV) in Wuhan China thousands of people there have been infected by this virus and suffered from the deadly pneumonia. It is predicted that this virulent virus may spread quickly in China and globally to many countries including the United States. In fact at least one patient in Texas was suspected to have the virus infection. We the Houston International Cultural Center (HICC) an 501C(3) non-profit community organization is raising funds and collecting protective medical supplies such as masks for people who are infected by 2019-nCoV in China. We greatly appreciate your donations and any donation will make an impact for the people who are struggling in sickness or in high risk of being infected. We thank you in advance for your generous contribution to this humane cause. Please join us to make a difference!   The Houston International Cultural Center (HICC) is committed to serve local communities in Houston and Texas through multicultural communications arts culture education and other services. We sincerely invite you to join this team effort we firmly believe that together we can make a difference for the world!  Masks and other protective medical supplies are necessity for peoples protection in such a serious virus infection. In many places of China masks are already sold out of stock. HICC is raising funds and the funds will be donated together with collected protective masks and other medical supplies to the hospitals in Wuhan China. We have arranged procurement and transportation of the supplies to the hospitals in need and proper measures are ensured that local doctors and patients have access to the donated supplies.   We are united to build up a better tomorrow!     Sammy Wang : 281-468-6368 Mary Zhu : 832 367 1534 Yan Liu : 832-212-5789   Address :  16300 Sea Lark Rd Houston.
