title: Coronavirus Fundraiser for Wuhan China
description: Hello everyone  My name is Vivian Hu and I am currently a senior at Laguna Blanca High School in Santa Barbara California. I grew up in Wuhan China. In fact many of my family and friends still reside there.  Sunday January 26th was the Chinese New Year – in our culture it is the time when people in China are the most lively and happy. It is our practice that everyone puts down their hard work and studies to return home and be surrounded by family and friends. But this Chinese New Year everything changed completely with the outbreak of a new deadly disease commonly referred to as the Coronavirus.   The Coronavirus is a new virus that has been transmitted from animals to humans. The mutation of the virus becomes stronger as it moves on from person to person. The person who is infected with the disease will develop a fever cough inflammation of both lungs kidney failure and the last stage which leads to death. According to official Chinese statistics more than 45000 people have been infected in mainland China alone. Approximately 1357 people have died from the Coronavirus worldwide a number that is expected to rise each day.    The Coronavirus outbreak particularly touches me as well as my friends and family. Most of the infected and diseased people live in my hometown of Wuhan. Due to the sudden outbreak the hospitals are at full capacity of patients and medical teams have not received any rest since the outbreak. This virus overlapped with the Spring Festival traffic causing a series of problems in the spreading of the virus with more human contact. As you may already know the government made a decision to shut down all pathways leading in and out of Wuhan. Therefore essentially shutting down my hometown. People will no longer have access to railways highways and airports until further notice. This official shutdown has caused the people of my hometown an even greater danger and inconvenience. The people of Wuhan know that the shutdown is not to seal the freedom of life of millions of citizens there but to prevent the virus from spreading out of Wuhan. The city of Wuhan is taking steps to prevent the spreading of the virus.  One being that the government has built two independent hospitals outside of the city—with the capacity to treat 3000 people.     Because of this nationally-known epidemic the demand for face masks and protective medical clothing is running critically low. In particular face masks are out of stock at nearly all of the drug stores in the city and many people are unable to purchase what can potentially save their life.   The money raised by this fundraiser will be used to buy SP Surgical Masks through Wing Sea Co. Ltd. in Japan. There is currently a shortage of face masks available worldwide but this supplier has agreed to work with me to ensure that medical grade face masks make it to Wuhan. All masks will be sent by the supplier directly to Hankou Hospital in Wuhan China where they will be distributed as necessary throughout the community. I am in direct communication with the supplier and will ensure that the money gets to them and that the face masks make it to the Hankou Hospital in Wuhan.  The citizens of Wuhan need our encouragement support and help immediately. I ask that you be mindful and show your appreciation as they are sacrificing their own health to ensure that the virus does not spread any further.  As a Wuhan native in the United States I can only put in my modest efforts.  PLEASE DONATE NOW TO THE PEOPLE OF WUHAN   Thank you in advance for your donation so that I can support my hometown of Wuhan from here.

title: Help Wuhan Hospitals Fight the Coronavirus
description: I am an eight grade student attending middle school in California and I am raising money to help the doctors and citizens in Wuhan China who are going through an virus outbreak crisis.  I would like to raise $3000 to help provide approximately 10000 disposable surgical masks to the city of Wuhan. Any donation is much appreciated and all funds will go towards the purchase and shipping of the supplies to hospitals and epidemic prevention centers. Currently doctors at some hospitals are only allocated one mask per day while on active duty and treating infected patients. Furthermore citizens are now required by the Wuhan government to wear face masks to prevent the spread of this virus.  A new coronavirus strain a pneumonia-like respiratory virus was recently discovered in China. The new virus is called 2019-nCoV and NBC News states that there is no specific treatment for the new virus and no vaccine to prevent it. In December of 2019 there was a huge coronavirus outbreak in the city of Wuhan China. CNN has confirmed that there are approximately 2000 infected while the death toll has risen to 56 people in China as of January 26th. The Wall Street Journal states that the virus has quickly spread throughout China and other countries in Asia and . . . U.S. Health authorities expect that it will spread even further.  Wuhan is located in the middle of China and is by no means a small city with an overall population of 11 million. It is also one of Chinas most important cities and is considered the political and economical capital of the country. Authorities have issued a citywide lockdown and all public transport services throughout the city have been suspended until further notice. Main highways leaving Wuhan have been shut down and airports and railway stations have been temporarily closed to departing passengers. The implementation of the blockade is an immense challenge to transport authorities and is also extremely difficult for people with relatives living in Wuhan. Chinese Lunar New Year is on January 25th this year but many people cannot visit or see their relatives. CNN describes the situation as akin to closing down all transport links for a city more than three times the size of Chicago two days before Christmas.  Thank you so much in advance to anyone who provides a donation regardless of amount.  My plan: After receiving each $300 worth of donations I will purchase as many masks as I can and send them to Wuhan Xie He Dongxihu Hospital in Wuhan Hubei China (Jing Bei Yi Road Wuhan Dongxihu Qu). My parents will also directly call the hospital to ensure that they will know when the shipment arrives. All purchased masks will be shipped to China via a global courier company.

title: CLOSED: Fight CoronaVirus in Hubei China
description: Thousands of people have been affected with CoronaVirus in Wuhan and nearby cities in Hubei Province. Medical workers are under great danger in fulfill their duty helping others. Raise funds of 20000AUD to purchase N95 masks and medical protective clothing locally in Sydney and ship for the doctors and nurses. They have raised request for help! Our hearts with the Doctors and Nurses in Hubei!  As per the request of GoFundMe I am providing more details about this campaign.  My name is Colin Hu (Zhichao). I am a Chinese expat working in Australia. My home town is Jingzhou Hubei a city around 200km away from Wuhan. Maybe as not as so known to people in Australia Jingzhou is suffering from the corona virus greatly. Til today (9 Feb) the city has 941 confirmed cases with 56 added to the list today. My sister works in Jingzhou No. 1 Peoples Hospital as a doctor in Department of Respiration. She has been in the isolated wards for the confirmed patients for the last 10 days. I am encourage by her and all the medical workers to have this fundraising to provide medical protective masks and  coveralls for them. The donation will go to Jingzhou No.1 Peoples Hospital through Hubei Charity General Society (official receipient).  We have purchased already 1304 pcs of DuPont Tyvek 800J coveralls and we are still seeking available stuffs from Australia and US. We now have a Wechar group and volunteers have been assigned to different tasks like sourcing materials logistics arrangements like cargo booking custom clearance dispatch and others while also work as team.  The 1st batch of medical coveralls have been shipped to China on 30 Jan and arrived in the hospital on early morning 2 Feb. We have received appreciation and gratitude from the hospital and Hubei Charity General Society.  Thank you all and we are still fighting against the corona virus.  We will keep you updated.

title: Fighting Coronavirus!People In Wuhan Need You Help
description: Wuhan is a city with a population of 11 million. Wuhan pneumonia has let the world know Wuhan!  Thousands are now infected with the virus and dozens have died. I believe there will be more deaths because most of them now have no safety and health precautions. They do not have enough safety masks and protective supplies. I initiated this.  To buy N95 masks and then transport to Wuhan by air!  Express companies have been found to transport to Wuhans major hospitals by drone after the masks arrive at the Chinese airport!  Let us help Wuhan!  Help Wuhan fight against coronavirus!  thank you all!

title: Fight Against Coronavirus Outbreak in Wuhan
description: Hello everyone   You may have heard of the recent outbreak of coronavirus in the city of Wuhan in China. It is a novel virus which is very contagious and causes life-threatening pneumonia in people of all ages.  Unfortunately there is still no cure for it.   - As of 1/24/2020 8pm local time it has been reported that  26  people died of this virus infection and  928  are infected in China.   - Numbers keep increasing  exponentially  as more cases were confirmed in Wuhan City and Hubei Province other provinces of China other Asian countries and the rest of the world.   - First case infected from this coronavirus in North America was found in Seattle 1/21/2020 and the second case was confirmed in Chicago yesterday 1/23/2020.    - A student of Texas A M University was suspected for possible coronavirus infection after his recent trip to Wuhan yesterday 1/23/2020.  - As of today China restricts travel of 30 million people in Wuhan as coronavirus death toll rises. City of Wuhan is currently cut off from the rest of the world. All transportation including flights trains subways even personal automobiles etc. have been suspended until further notice. There is very limited supply of gas in all gas station in Wuhan. All schools have been cancelled. For quarantine purpose no single Wuhan resident is allowed to leave the city.   Here are some reports from major media about this critical situation.     https://www.cnn.com/asia/live-news/coronavirus-outbreak-hnk-intl-01-24-20/index.html      https://www.cnn.com/asia/live-news/wuhan-coronavirus-china-intl-hnk/index.html      https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/22/world/asia/china-coronavirus-travel.html      https://www.houstonpublicmedia.org/articles/news/health-science/2020/01/23/358285/officials-investigating-suspected-case-of-coronavirus-in-brazos-county/    As a native from the city of Wuhan I am heartbroken about this situation. I am currently a biomedical scientist in Houston; both of my parents are doctors in a major hospital in Wuhan. They witness more and more patients as well as doctors are infected by this lethal virus. The only way that can effectively prevent this virus from spreading is as simple as Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) such as  surgical masks   N95 aspirators safety glasses and goggles and   protective coveralls . Unfortunately there are more than 11 million people living in Wuhan; currently PPE is extremely short of supply in Wuhan as well as in the rest area of China. Even worse  today is the Chinese New Year of Mouse . Millions of people are suffering and their lives are in danger. Production and supply of PPE in China has no way to meet the demand in a timely manner.  We are wondering if any of you can help in any ways such as funds donation and/or donation of any number of PPE and/or help with getting any PPE donation from major manufacturers in the States. I will then coordinate to have them shipped to China as soon as I can.    Earlier Better.  It will not only help people in Wuhan but provide further protection for people all of the world including your beloved ones from being infected by this contiguous life-threatening virus. I currently live in Houston. I am more than happy to coordinate and help by all means and make it possible.    Where the funds go and how the funds are used will be frequently updated here with all available validated documentation.   (Update 1/28/2020)  One of our local ambassadors in Wuhan Sibo (Bob) Hu took this video at his home in Wuhan today 1/28/2020. He sincerely asks your help for relieve this critical situation.    Here is the Youtube link:   https://youtu.be/xWtK_SjpcLI             Any help is greatly appreciated!  Happy New Year of Mouse! Wish you all the best!

title: Medical Supplies - Wuhan Fight Against Coronavirus
description: Virus has no borders   We have an urgent request for our concerned members of AMPSAA.  We are looking for donations so that we can purchase and send over medical supplies to Wuhan and nearby cities in Hubei province China.  As you all may have heard in the news the Coronavirus situation in Wuhan China is critical. Worldwide over 1400 cases have been reported since the virus was first diagnosed in Wuhan on January 15 less than 10 days ago.  These numbers are likely low as individuals who have sent texts and emails from the region have reported that in some cases because there are so many people going to the hospitals and there is not enough staff people are just being sent home. Hospitals are over flowing in cases  running low or have no supplies of to offer supportive care and are lacking protective gear to protective their medical staff and contain and isolate infected cases.   As of today Wuhan and many other cities within the province have been quarantined.   At least 17 cities within the province have been locked down. Individuals are not allowed to leave the cities by plane train or any other means.  Hospitals are overwhelmed and the Chinese government is building two emergency hospitals within the city. All public transportation within the city has been shutdown.  Starting Sunday use of private vehicles within the city will be banned.  Wuhan’s need for medical assistance is severe.  As the epicenter with over 11 million people the lack of adequate medical protection means that even those healthy individuals and the medical staff who are there to care for them are at great risk.  It may seem that this is a “China problem not a U.S. problem” but if the Coronavirus outbreak is not addressed now by the time it reaches the same level of urgency in the U.S. it will have already reached emergency levels around the globe.  We need to help China address the Coronavirus.  We are looking to send the following medical supplies namely surgical masks (N95 mask YY 0469-2010) goggles to cover the entire face disposable medical gloves medical caps shockproof eye masks protective clothing (3M 4565) medical protective masks (GB 19083-2010).  If you can donate these supplies or donate money for us to purchase them or have connections for AMPSAA to appeal directly such help will be greatly appreciated. Please forward this to whomever you think can help. Thank you!

title: Medical Masks for Wuhan Coronavirus
description: China is facing a major virus outbreak. Now the whole entire population have high demands for medical masks (3M). Not only does the public need these to protect themselves doctors and nurses are in need for these masks. Medical masks are selling out in China lets raise money to buy medical masks for the people who need them in the Wuhan crisis.  I am a high school student with a Chinese background. Having parents who immigrated from China almost 10 years ago I still have relatives and friends living in China. There is no doubt that I am worried about them with the highly contagious virus surrounding them.   With more people being admitted to hospitals the virus is spreading and doctors and nurses are in need for medical equipment. As doctors and nurses attempt to save patients masks are very critical to them as they can prevent the virus from spreading. 15 nurses have confirmed to be in contact with the virus due to attempting to save others but more have yet to come. These people in the medical field are spending time in the hospital saving lives rather than celebrating the 2020 Chinese new year they should be appreciated and also supported. Not only in the medical field masks are also worn by the public. These single use masks are bought and thrown everyday and the demand for these only increase. As many places are in need for masks I hope to raise money to support hospital facilities in China.   While normal masks are good we need to buy N95 medical masks. These masks are more safe and are used in hospital facilities. I hope to raise money to buy these masks then ship them to hospitals in China to save lives.   I hope to: 1) Raise enough money and reach our goal 2) Buy N95 medical masks  3) Ship to Wuhan XieHe hospital Wuhan Medical Treatment Center (JingYiTan Hospital)) along with other hospitals that need it.   It would be so kind of you for your support every penny counts. :)    https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/25/world/asia/china-coronavirus.html    Edit/Update: First batch ordered! Waiting for masks to arrive then I will ship them off!

title: DCG | Corona Virus Soforthilfe für Wuhan
description: Spendenaufruf der Deutsch-Chinesischen Gesellschaft für Wirtschaft Bildung   Kultur e.V.:   + + + CORONA VIRUS | Jetzt für die Bekämpfung   in Wuhan / China spenden + + +   Von unseren chinesischen Freunden Geschäftspartnern und Mitgliedern erreichen uns schockierende Nachrichten über die drastische Lage.  Aufgrund des Ausbruchs der Coronavirus-Lungenentzündung in China benötigen Krankenhäuser in Wuhan und anderen Städten sehr dringend medizinische Ausstattung. Das Medizinische Material vor Ort ist viel zu knapp. Wegen der sich rasant verschlechternden Lage und den exponentiell steigenden Fallzahlen möchten wir die Deutsch-Chinesische Gesellschaft für Wirtschaft Bildung   Kultur e.V. Sie bitten mit uns gemeinsam zu spenden.  Unter anderem fehlen in Wuhan ganz akut:  1. Medizinische Einwegmasken 2. Medizinische chirurgische Masken 3. Medizinische Schutzkleidung 4. Medizinische Einweg-Latexhandschuhe 5. Medizinische Schutzbrille  Ihre Spende wird direkt in die Beschaffung und den Transport des dringend benötigten medizinischen Materials Verwendung finden.  Sie können Zehntausenden von Menschen helfen indem Sie jetzt diese Kampagne mit Ihrer Spende unterstützen.   VIELEN DANK im Namen der DCG und aller unserer betroffenen chinesischen Freunde  Über uns:   https://www.facebook.com/dcg.wbk/      https://dcg-wbk.org/     Bilder aus Wuhan:

title: ????! Help Fight Coronavirus in Zhejiang China!
description: We are fundraising for medical supplies to support hospitals in Zhejiang China in their fight against the recent coronavirus outbreak.   3/5 Final Update: This campaign has completed.  Financial and delivery information are available at   https://onedrive.live.com/?authkey=%21ADRpcWPLDO%2DXxTA id=8802A5DE2E5AC593%214777 cid=8802A5DE2E5AC593   . Please also refer to campaign updates for more details.    Who are we?  We are alumni volunteers of Hangzhou Foreign Language School. We are working to support our hometown and our country in this Coronavirus outbreak.   How serious is this Coronavirus?  The recently identified Novel Coronavirus 2019(2019 n-CoV) a cousin of the SARS virus has infected thousands of people since the outbreak began in Wuhan China in December 2019. The virus has spread to a total of fifteen countries across four continents.   Wuhan and more than  14 other cities have been locked down and major tourist destinations have been shut down to contain the 2019 n-CoV outbreak. Despite the effort up to Jan 27 4581 people have been infected and 105 have died with 6973 suspected. 350000 people are estimated to be infected by the beginning of February. Hospital services were near collapse under the pressure of people flooding in to be diagnosed and treated. Medical supplies run dangerously low.   Why Zhejiang?  Zhejiang the province with the largest floating population is experiencing rapid development of the epidemic and fast growing  number of patients. At the same time its capital Hangzhou has received hundreds of Wuhan passengers returning from abroad in the past few days and carried out quarantine isolation and other prevention and control work. A number of hospitals have shouldered heavy responsibility of providing health observation diagnosis and treatment for Wuhan passengers as well as Zhejiang passengers who flew back on the same flights.  In the past several days the number of patients confirmed with coronavirus in Zhejiang Province increased dramatically. Zhejiang has become the third largest epidemic area in China. As of Jan 27 2020 173 cases of Zhejiang have been confirmed. Doctors and nurses are working around the clock with very little rest. The rapid growing outbreak has left hospitals in Zhejiang in urgent need of medical supplies such as protective suits N95 masks etc. We shall not leave the doctors and medical staff exposed in danger. Please join us to extend your love and help to them!    How will your donation be used?   Donate to help the doctors and nurses in the hospitals  get  sufficient medical supplies ! They are fighting to protect all of us  and let’s give our support to protect them!   Due to merchandise availability our volunteers will be making the purchase at their own expense to ensure we get the supplies then the finance officer (Beneficiary of the campaign) will reimburse the amount as the invoices indicate. As a result the withdrawal from the campaign will be going to our finance officers own personal bank account.    Your generous support will be first used to purchase  certified medical protective gears including   protective suits and respirators   and will be distributed to hospitals in Zhejiang such as First Affiliated Hospital Zhejiang University Second Affilated Hospital Zhejiang University and Sir Run Run Shaw Hospital.     Our Plan to get the campaigns donations to the intended recipients  Our volunteers are divided into multiple teams: Campaign Finance Supply Acquisition Appraisal Transportation and Hospital Connection.   Campaign Finance team is responsible for handling all monetary payment and reimbursement for the purchase.   Supply Acquisition team will purchase the certified medical supplies from merchants all over the world through our alumni network after appraisal and assessment by Appraisal team. This makes sure that we are only purchasing those that meet the hospital requirements and standards.   Hospital Connection team will reach out to hospitals in Zhejiang and collect their requirements on the specific protective gears and quantity needed while Transportation team will coordinate on the delivery of supplies from our warehouses to the hospitals.  Regular updates will be posted on the progress of our purchase orders until all of our orders have been delivered.     ??????????????????????????? ?????????????????????????????????????????? ????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????  ?? ??????????????????????? ???2020?1?27??????????????173?(????????: https://3g.dxy.cn/newh5/view/pneumonia )??????????????????????????????????????????????????N95?????????????????????????????????????????????????!  ???????? ?????????:   ???????????:     ???????:  ????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????  ?????????????????: ??????? ????????? ?????? ??????? ?????? ??????? ????????????  ???????????:          ?????   ????????????????????????????????????   ???: ?????????  ??? ella.as@gmail.com  ?????: ??      ??96? ??? ??05? ??? ??07? ??? ??07? ??? ??08? ??? ??09? ??? ??10? ??? ??10? ??? ??10? ??? ??10?  ??      ??11?  ??? ??11? ??? ??11? ??? ??12? ??? ??13? ??      ??13? ??      ??12?  ?????: ??? ??05?  ??????????????????????????????????????????   3?5???:??????????? ?????????????:  https://onedrive.live.com/?authkey=%21ADRpcWPLDO%2DXxTA id=8802A5DE2E5AC593%214777 cid=8802A5DE2E5AC593   ???????????????????    ???????????????????????????????????????????!    ????:?????????????????????????   ??: ?????????????????????????0????

title: safety equipment for doctors treating coronavirus
description: Doctors and nurses in China who have been treating patients infected by Coronavirus are in dire need of safety equipment such as laboratory gowns protective eyewear and N-95 masks to protect themselves against the virus. There has been a large shortage of this equipment in China and many medical personnel have been working without it. We have been in contact with hospital directors in Beijing who are asking for this protective equipment to be received as soon as possible. The virus is shared though the eyes so we are aiming to send a shipment of protective eyewear and N-95masks to Beijing during the first week of February.   Members of my family who were doctors during the SARS epidemic in 2003 almost perished working to save the lives of Chinese citizens and it would mean a lot if we could help safeguard our doctors and nurses who are risking their lives every day.my family will be matching donations up to $1000  Even if you are unable to donate please share this link and help us reach our goal within the next week as this is a very urgent situation!

title: Face-off Against Coronavirus
description: Residents of China have been suffering from the spread of the deadly Coronavirus. The disease has spread to many other countries with 1700 dead globally and over 69000 affected as of Feb. 16th. The residents of China have been experiencing a shortage on face masks which can greatly aid in the prevention of the virus spread. With this fundraiser we hope to raise funds in order to purchase face masks which we will send to organizations in Wuhan as well as other affected areas.  For more information you can read the following articles:    https://www.google.com/amp/s/www.nytimes.com/2020/01/23/health/coronavirus-surgical-masks.amp.html      https://www.reuters.com/article/us-china-health-usa-masks-idUSKBN1ZN2H4      https://www.cnn.com/2020/01/26/asia/wuhan-coronavirus-update-intl-hnk/index.html      https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/26/world/china-coronavirus.html

title: Students Helping China Fight Coronavirus Outbreak
description: Please consider donating ASAP as this is an urgent issue!  WHO declares the 2019-nCoV a GLOBAL EMERGENCY    Hi we are Richard Z. and Katherine H. from Mountain View High School in Mountain View CA. We are just students who want to help in an ongoing world issue.  As you may know already the China coronavirus known medically as the 2019-nCoV is currently spreading rapidly in China and hospitals in Wuhan the epicenter of this virus are flooded with patients while not having enough medical supplies. The image is a letter from  The Second Affiliated Hospital of Guangzhou Medical University  asking for help from the public to donate  N95 respiratory masks surgical masks as well as hazardous material suits  with a certified government seal. The president of the Chinese Medical Association who works at  the Guangzhou Medical University  Zhong Nanshan played a big role in controlling the outbreak of the 2003 SARS virus. He is also a leading scientist and researcher in this 2019-nCoV virus.  Currently the supply for these medical equipments in China are depleting quickly as thousands of people a day rush to hospitals just for basic flu-like symptoms. The government has also sent medical professionals from this hospital by military plane to Wuhan to help stop the surprisingly contagious pandemic. Hospitals are filled with chaos with not much to do and filled with patients to infect others some which may have no problem with them at all. Sadly the virus appeared during the Lunar New Year season which means that people in the city return to their rural homes. Wuhan a city of 12 million people may have had much more infected people than the numbers posted by the Chinese government and is most likely more widespread as 5 million people left the epicenter of the outbreak just before they locked down.  We will  use your donations to purchase medical supplies and ship them to this hospital (The Second Affiliated Hospital of Guangzhou Medical University)  which will either ship them to hospitals in Wuhan or use them as infection numbers increase. Richards mother Dr. Qiu works at this hospital and  the location is a certified donation point by the Chinese government . Anything is helpful. Please help us battle this virus together before it spreads to the places around you. Thank you.  For questions about this fundraiser please feel free to contact us using the contact button down below. We will give you a response as soon as we can.

title: Running for Wuhan China
description: Purpose:   I will be raising money to fight the coronavirus outbreak in Wuhan China by running 1km for every $50 donated while wearing a mask.   The money will be donated to Give2Asia who has partnered with leading Chinese public health organizations to support frontline health workers and hospitals responding to the coronavirus crisis.  _________________________________________________   Death has been everywhere lately.   In the news friends of friends the NBA community and everyones social media posts. I cannot escape it death they say it’s inevitable but Ive never had trouble forgetting.    Funerals and deathly illnesses seem so beyond my twenty-two-year-old life and surely the intellects would find a cure and everything will be fine. But these days death leaves no escape reminding everyone that life is short and death inevitable.   In recent news death has stacked up like coins slotting in connect four. Articles and videos scream for attention as hourly updates on the coronavirus create fear and confusion. Political agendas have started and fear uncovers ignorance as racist comments blaze blaming and burning the Chinese.    I sit in my home in Canada as I witness doctors fainting and family members shouting in desperation for their loved ones in lack of beds and medical supplies on the other side of the globe. At the same time patients are in isolation not knowing whether the new virus will claim their lives.   I wait for it to pass dodging coughs and sneezes while mumbling a simple prayer hoping my pack of face masks and beliefs will be enough to keep me from falling ill. Im thankful its not me who is quarantined.   Yet with each new death toll and hourly update my sitting here is not enough. I click another video and the desperation of those isolated and afraid force tears in my eyes.   A few fundraisers that have already popped up but I started this one for my community. If Im honest Im still hesitant in creating this as doubt forms silly questions “Will I meet or even come close to my goal?” I have decided not to let it stop me.    I will be raising money to fight the coronavirus outbreak in Wuhan China by running 1km for every $50 donated while wearing a mask.    If I meet my goal of $5k the money will be donated to  Give2Asia  who has partnered with leading Chinese public health organizations to support frontline health workers and hospitals responding to the coronavirus crisis.  For more information:    https://give2asia.org/donate-help-fight-coronavirus-outbreak-wuhan-china/       Your donations will be used for:  ·      Procuring masks protection suits goggles and other necessary medical equipment for the treatment and containment ·      Providing meals and lodging to the thousands of health workers traveling to areas most affected by the outbreak ·      Long-term training and support for medical workers working on the front lines of this and future epidemics

title: Fundraising for Coronavirus for Chinese hospitals
description: This fundraising is created for the Coronavirus in China.  It has already infected thousands of people in multiple cities. So far 24000 people have been infected and 490 people have been killed from the virus and many cities are quarantining their citizens to try and prevent the spread.                        We are fundraising in hopes to send masks and other medical supplies which are very much needed to the Wuhan hospital where the virus originated.  Your donation will help purchase medical supplies and ship them to Wuhan and other affected cities for those who need it.

title: Save Wuhan! Help China fight against coronavirus.
description: HELP! SAVE WUHAN FROM THE DEADLY CORONAVIRUS!   Coronavirus  a newly discovered illness that can evolve infect humans and spread between humans is threatening hundreds of millions of people’s life. Currently there is  NO  cure for this illness. According to the government’s report and the New York times  live update   the death toll and diagnosed infections increase rapidly every hour.   Even worse there is a shortage of medical supplies food and support to local businesses in China due to the speed of the spread of such virus. Tens and hundreds of hospitals all over China a running out of face masks protective suits and medical goggles. The chances of infection and treatment will increase severely if the shortage continues.   THE NEED IS REAL.  We plan to donate our money to  WeStar a nonprofit organization that is directly donating supplies money and support to China.   This is a fight without gunshots but with many deaths; We hope that people no matter their skin tone or nationality shall stand together with the Chinese citizens to fight against the deadly virus.    WE ARE GRATEFUL FOR ALL CONTRIBUTIONS NO MATTER BIG OR SMALL!

title: Wuhan coronavirus: Wirral and UK response.
description: We have all heard about the coronavirus outbreak in Wuhan China. After personally spending 15 years living and working in China and also having a 10year old son in the Country I know first hand the devastation this virus has caused people. With deaths rising every day and no sign of the virus subsiding the country is in short supply of vital medical equipment that could be used to save lives. With the elderly and children at greatest risk of developing pneumonia if they contract the virus.  It pains me that my son cannot go to school play football with his friends or even go to the local cinema but at least he can walk around outside because is fortunate enough to have a face mask. However there are millions of children and elderly who don’t have this option and they are housebound 24 hours a day.  Imagine your parents children sick relatives not having access to medical supplies that could enable them to leave their house. Simple tasks like buying food and drink are impossible without face masks or protective eye goggles. The risk of them contracting coronavirus are so high they are now housebound.  A simple facemask could help them safely go to the shops for vital supplies. Imagine being left with the choice of contracting a deadly virus or starving because of a huge shortage in simple precautionary measures .    China is known as super-power in the world this go fund me is not about money or financial needs its about supplying urgent medical supplies to areas in the most need. So at the risk of repeating myself this is not about sending money to China this is about helping the Chinese people who can not gain access to the most simple of protection equipment.  Schools are closed businesses have been shut down children are unable to leave their houses if they don’t have the appropriate protection.   All donations we receive will be used to buy face masks and protection goggles here in the UK and will be sent to Wuhan directly through the Chinese red cross to help children and the elderly immediately.  £2 can buy a face mask for a child which can help them to just go outside their home.    Please donate anything you can and know that you are enabling someone to live their life as normally as they can whilst living with the outbreak.  I personally thank you in advance and I am sure that the Chinese people would also like me to pass on their thanks for any protective equipment that they receive because of your donation.

title: Help Fight the Coronavirus!
description: Help Fight the Coronavirus! by Love   Care - North American Youth Group  (www.loveandcarenayg.org)  Co-Organizers: Yingtong (Annabelle) Yao Audrey Liu Xiaoyang (Amanda) Wang Andrew Jiang Delphine Zhou Wendy Chang   Representatives: Tse Kai (Kevin) Chan Andrew Guan Athena Nguyen    We are a group of high school students from across North America with a shared desire to show love and support for those in need around the world.   We are young but we have passion. We believe that giving is not just making a donation. It’s about making a difference. Alone we can do so little - together with you we can do so much more. Our contributions will have a significance for the people in China fighting to contain this virus and protect the world.  All proceeds will go towards the purchase and shipping of needed medical supplies.  Thank you for all your support!

title: Antiseptics for hospitals in Wuhan
description: Our goal (??????):   With the situation around the Coronavirus worsening daily the demand for safety supplies such as hand sanitizers and rubbing alcohol are increasing as you are reading this.  Every day more than a thousand people are diagnosed with the Coronavirus worldwide. Attached is a video a story of a doctor leaving his family to fight the Coronavirus. We are just a group of students from boarding schools in the U.S. and we are trying to help the situation at home.  We are becoming more and more concerned about the safety and well-being of our loved ones who are still in China.    With your help we hope to assist the process of developing a cure through purchasing antiseptics for hospitals in the epicenter of the Coronavirus.  We have already successfully reached out to a factory in Shandong province that manufactures antiseptics around 600 miles North East of Wuhan who is willing to manufacture extra antiseptics for the hospitals in Wuhan.  We assure you that all of your kind donations will go to the purchase of gallons of hand antiseptics crucial to the medical staff who are battling the Coronavirus on the front line.     Your kind donation will mean a lot to us our family members and those who are unfortunately under the grasp of the Coronavirus.    For any more questions regarding the situation in Wuhan please feel free to contact us and we will do our best to answer you.    Sincerely   Alesia Zhou - Stevenson ‘22  Clark Dong - Hotchkiss ‘22  Jeff Shan - Stevenson ‘23 Ethan Sun - Berkshire 23 Changyu Wang - Piedmont 20   Dr. Liu’s story:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IneFBNpi8MU   The outbreak of the n-CoV virus has already affected millions of people worldwide.  In search of cures for the Coronavirus doctors across China have volunteered to be on the front lines of the battle at the epicenter of this plague. In the video we have attached a forty-four-year-old veteran doctor from the SARS outbreak nearly two decades ago The Wenchuan Earthquake The Yushu Earthquake once-again left his family in Xi’an to battle another deadly virus.   The camera crew of South China Morning Post recorded the last breakfast and goodbye shared between the doctor and his wife before he enters the war zone.  In the video the horror in her eyes are visible and the fear in her voice is audible. She has already done everything she can to prepare her husband for his journey but she can only do so much.  We also accept donation through Wechat Pay (QR Code pasted at the end of the story) Thank you very much for your support!  ?????:  ??????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????  ????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????  ???????????????????????????????????????  ???????????????????????????????????  ?? title: Fund to help fight the New Coronavirus!
description: The new Wuhan Coronavirus is spreading at an unbelievable rate to numerous countries such as Thailand Korea Japan with some cases even in the US France and Australia. As of Wednesday there have been more than 6500 reported cases in China alone and more than 132 deaths. In light of the new cases many are on college campuses affecting students and younger generations. As a Chinese immigrant seeing all the immense pain and suffering of people this virus has caused I have decided to call out and do something anything to help! However only myself is not enough. I am urging everyone that is reading this; please help me raise money to fight against this terrible disease. 100% of the donations will go towards the Hubei Charity Federation for use in treatment and prevention against the virus. Since the Federation is in China and gofundme does not connect with International charities my mom Yanjuan Zhen would have to withdraw the funds to her bank account first  and then donate the money to Hubei. After completing the process I will send screenshots of the proof of the transaction through email. Thank you so much for your generosity and have a great day!  ?????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????!????????!

title: Donation Against Coronavirus for Er Zhou Hospital
description: This fundraising is for purchasing medical protective gear and donating them directly to Er Zhou No. 2 Hospital. Since the beginning of the virus crisis Wu Han has been the city that caught the worlds attention. However there are many other less known cities that also got effected and desperately need medical protective gear. Er Zhou is a small city thats 30 min away from Wu Han. Due to its close distance the city has diagnosed over 100 cases in less than two days. The Er Zhou No.2 Hospital is the official hospital for treating the coronavirus patients but will run out of medical protective gear soon. All the hospital staff is risking their lives in battling the virus and need all the help they can get from everyone else.    The Er Zhou No.2 Hosptial is the beneficiary of this fundraiser. We have a family member working at this hospital and staff are desperate needs the medical protective gear to help them dealing with infected patients.  The fund will be transferred to my banking account and will be used to purchase medical supplies then directly send them Er Zhou No.2 Hosptial.  The whole process will be transparent and updated as we progress through the campaign.   ??????????????? - ??!??????30?????!????????! ???????????????????100??????1?30?????123????2????????????????!!! ????????????????????????????????

title: Help Save Wuhan and China!!!! (Coronavirus Relief)
description: We know there have been other GoFundMe campaigns started but none from Southern CA. Lets show everyone that we care (not just Southern CA).   ***UPDATE***  The Organizer Team (made up of Real Estate Professionals) has received official endorsements from: China Institute of Real Estate Appraisers and Agents (CIREA) China Alliance of Real Estate Agencies (CAREA) and we are expecting multiple others. Endorsements can be viewed at:   https://www.dropbox.com/sh/jagcamh39kxt48y/AACdwoPNSU4K1qQqjrtHCIa7a?dl=0     ***UPDATE 2***  Our first shipment has been sent out on February 18 2020 and included 53x N95 Face Mask Respirators 825x Face Mask Respirators 24x Safety Glasses and 81x Sealed Safety Goggles. Purchased and shipped via Mexico and ETA February 28 2020. Shipments have been sent to Beijing in order to be distributed to Wuhan and Hubei region where it is needed the most.   WHY DONATIONS ARE NEEDED:  Now more than ever we all need to stand up and show our support to combat this Global Crisis that coronavirus has caused and continues to cause. This is not limited to just China/Asia and effects are starting to show around the Globe; socially culturally and economically.   OVER 70000 individuals have contracted the virus and while the bulk of cases are in China cases are spreading all over the Globe.  -Many cities in China are in lockdown mode with many residents afraid to even go outside (even to shop for daily goods). Posts floating around the internet show Beijing and Shanghai looking like a ghost town. Over 50 Million residents in Wuhan City and Hubei Province are in lockdown. -Chinese New Year Holiday (also known as Spring Festival) which is traditionally a time of celebration and visiting friends/family has been detrimentally affected. Many restaurants stores malls amusement parks (Both of Asias Disneylands) shopping malls etc have been voluntarily closed down until further notice to help reduce the spread of coronavirus. The CNY has officially been extended to keep part of the workforce from going back to work. Schools have been out and will be off indefinitely until the situation improves. -Multiple Global airlines have reduced or outright cancelled their China routes to help combat the spread of coronavirus some as far as May 2020 (Delta United American Airlines Cathay Pacific Air India etc). Chinese travel agencies were given a mandate by the government to cease travel bookings/operations until further notice with hefty fines if they continue business -Multiple counties have restricted access from travelers traveling from China.    HOW TO HELP:  Step 1: Donate here any amount will be a GREAT help in this time of need.  Step 2: We will collect the money raised to purchase N-95 masks surgical masks protective goggles gloves gowns and other in-demand medical supplies. -Supplies will be purchased both locally in USA and within China to be shipped directly to hospitals in need. -Funds will be disbursed to local Organizations/Associations within Wuhan and Greater Hebei Province (including Social Welfare Groups Medical Assistance Groups etc)  Step 3: We will ship the supplies directly to Wuhan China and/or surrounding areas! As well as work only with trusted and reputable organizations/associations. (FYI that Red Cross China unfortunately is NOT the most reputable and has been scandal ridden in recent years. They have a huge inventory of facemarks that they refuse to distribute sitting in warehouses).  Step 4: We will provide photo proof/receipts as funds are used or disbursed.  Dropbox link with photos/documentation:  https://www.dropbox.com/sh/jagcamh39kxt48y/AACdwoPNSU4K1qQqjrtHCIa7a?dl=0    VOLUNTEERS NEEDED:   -help spread this GoFundMe campaign -source local avenues to purchase listed medical supplies at wholesale price as well as locate cheaper options for freight shipping goods direct to affected areas in China -identify organizations/associations within China that can best disburse donated funds to assistance most needed in China -contact  spencer@thehoogroup.com  or  robertmiller@robertmiller.com  to inquire and be added to our volunteer team.   ABOUT THE CAMPAIGN ORGANIZERS:  -Spencer Hoo is a Global Real Estate Professional (some might say influencer) who has worked extensively with China and Greater Asia for over the last decade. Both bringing Buyer and Investors over to the USA as well as providing safe and stable investments within Asia (and soon Latin America). He is often invited to speak internationally or interviewed for publications (online and print) on Global Real Estate related topics. He is currently the Chair for the California Association of REALTORS (200000+ membership) Global Real Estate Forum and member of their Board of Directors. He has also served as Chair for the Award Winning Orange County REALTORS (OCR) Global Business Alliance Committee and past member of their Board of Directors as well as active member or leadership with National Association of REALTORS Asian Real Estate Association of America National Association of Hispanic Real Estate Professionals Chinese American Real Estate Professionals Association etc.  -Robert Miller is a Global Financier and Rainmaker who has advised individuals businesses and governments for over five decades on four continents and in two languages (English and Spanish). He is the author of “Rainmaking: Impacting the World Through the Power of Emotions and the Magic of Storytelling” and a frequent public speaker.. He is active in the local community as well as Asian Real Estate Association of America and National Association of Hispanic Real Estate Professionals.

title: Fundraising for Coronavirus Wuhan China!
description: The novel coronavirus outbreak is spreading quickly in Wuhan China and beyond. A scarcity of critical medical supplies such as N95 face masks protective goggles protective suits and other medical grade equipment is contributing to the increased number of people including health professionals exposed to this dangerous disease. Death tolls are rising and we must act fast!  As Chinese across Toronto Ontario Canada we are reaching out to all of our communities their friends and families to ask for a hand in aiding the efforts of Chinese medical professionals to combat this virus.   We have launched a fundraising for the City of Wuhan to prevent cross-infection and curb the spreading of the coronavirus. Funds raised will be used to buy necessary supplies for epidemic prevention or to be donated to other charity organizations to fight the coronavirus directly.   We will announce the fundraising amount in real time and personally ensure that all the funds received will be used to purchase the materials needed to prevent the epidemic. We will announce the progress and whereabouts of materials and fundraising every day.   Thank you for all your support and contribution! Every penny counts! Together we WILL win this battle!  ??????????????????????????????????????????????????N95???????????????  ????!?????????? ????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????  ?????????????????????????????!????????????!    *** Please note that this campaign is for pure donations only. Donors will NOT receive anything in return for their donations. ***

title: Battle Against the Coronavirus: Wuhan at Risk
description: The decade of the 2020s has finally arrived. In the first month of this year however a sudden outbreak of the  novel Coronavirus  turned the entire world into a mess and put everyone on alert.  This novel Coronavirus is a contagious virus originated from Wuhan China that can cause symptoms such as fever cough breathing difficulties pneumonia severe respiratory syndromes and even death.  It expanded rapidly after it was developed through  different ways of transmission including animals to humans and humans to humans  just like how common cold is spread.  Several countries around the globe including  China United States Japan Australia France Germany Canada Singapore Malaysia Korea and Finland  were already found to be infected with this lethal virus.   According to the Chinese government officials t his novel Coronavirus first appeared in a seafood market on December 12 2019. Within a short month the number of people who are confirmed to be infected with this coronavirus had already become 14628 along with 305 deaths.  The number has continued to climb higher and on January 30 2020 the  W.H.O (World Health Organization) declared the outbreak of this novel Coronavirus to be a global health emergency.  Starting from February 1 2020 t ravel to China was restricted  and this would lead to  huge economic downfalls   in every single country especially China.     Currently  tons of doctors and medical workers were fighting against the Coronavirus at the front line and many of them had sacrificed their lives . With a tremendous amount of infected patients  China and many countries were facing medical shortages.  Most of the hospitals in China  desperately need supplies including masks goggles and protective suits .  Without these types of equipment the medical workers can be easily exposed to the Coronavirus and this can make the situation worse.    So we need your help! We appreciate everyone that is willing to participate in this fundraiser and  all of the generous contributions from you will be used to purchase protective medical equipment including protective suits N95 masks and medical goggles.  They could also be sent to China and  help scientists in research for the cure to this lethal virus.  All of these were in  urgent need for those medical workers in the front line.  We will  ensure all funds that we received will be used to purchase these types of equipment  and we will update the processes.    Let’s all fight against the Coronavirus together and pray for Wuhan!

title: Fighting the Coronavirus Fund
description: Currently in Asia there is a growing epidemic called the Coronavirus that is spreading around and has infected many people already. I am trying to raise money to help spread awareness and help support the doctors nurses and scientists working on stopping this deadly virus. Any donations help and are much appreciated. Thank you!

title: Fight Coronavirus.  Hospitals In Need Of Supplies
description: As we are sure you are already aware the Corona virus is continuing to spread across the globe.  More than 34800 infected so far and is rapidly spreading through China at a rate of almost 20 % each day.  Due to the seriousness of this outbreak all major retailers and medical manufacturers  have been reporting medical mask shortages since the start of this week. We at Health Goal Intl. want to do everything we can to help our friends in China in protecting themselves against the Corona virus which is why we are creating a GoFundMe account to raise money for supplies to send over to hospitals in Wuhan and Xiamen China in attempts to protect those from contracting the virus.  So far we have been purchasing all masks and other supplies with our own money and have the hospitals and patrons in China taking care of the Air freight expense.  We have now helped supply 3000 surgical masks purchased from a hospital in Las Vegas.  Today we purchased 10000 surgical masks for $4000 and are sending them by air to hospitals in Xiamen China.  We want to do everything we can to help spread awareness.   Many hospitals are now treating victims of the virus with out having surgical masks or sub par masks.  We ask if you wouldn’t mind sharing our gofundme page with your followers so we can help gather supplies to send them over to China ourselves so people can keep themselves safe.  Our hope is to save lives even if only a few it is so important.   Thank you and we appreciate your willingness to help those in need   The team at Health Goal Intl.

title: Gabriel Lopezs Funeral Fundraising
description: I am deeply saddened to say that our beloved father brother son and uncle Gabriel Lopez has passed away. Even through his deepest battles he found a way to warm the hearts of everyone he loved and today my family kindly asks you to support us through this painful moment. Any donations are appreciated.

title: We will beat Coronavirus! Fight for Wuhan
description: We are SPARK Republic an organization of the Chinese American community. Our mission is to use Chinese culture as a carrier to promote social progress and build a spiritual home for Chinese Americans. Our three focuses are based on love inherit culture and focusing. The first focus is love which means we’ll be organizing social events-such as fundraising donation teaching children living in hills--in order to spread the love to the community. The second is based on culture inheriting. As Chinese Americans we also have projects and activities to promote Chinese culture and art. Thirdly we will focus our spirit and mission creating a welcoming and helpful environment/community for Chinese American students. In the future we will be reaching out to different states and China to help plan trips college applications and internships.   On behalf of our Spark organization our goal is to help Wuhan China and we have the responsibility to help those who have been affected by this deadly virus which is circulating all around the world. According to the New York Times in Wuhan there are already more than 14000 people affected and more than 300 have died from this severe virus. Not only in China but the United States so far has shown 8 cases with one of which hits in the bay area. With the severity of this disease we want to help by holding a Go-Fund-Me fundraiser to provide supplies for the affected people in Wuhan and their scarcity in medical supplies.   We will beat Coronavirus! Fight for Wuhan!  ?????????????????????!  ????!????!???????????!??????????????????????????????????????????????????!?????????????????????????????????????????????????!
