title: Coronavirus supplies are needed in XiangyangHubei
description: Chinese health officials reported on 02/13/2020 that there had been 1491 deaths from the outbreak and 64658 cases of the coronavirus in China. (cnn.com) Wuhan suffered a considerable loss China and the world focused on Wuhan. Lots of resources are shipped to Wuhan. However besides Wuhan the other small cities in Hubei province also suffered the impacts from the coronavirus. The growing number of patients and questioning cases put significant pressure on the hospitals of the smaller cities. Comparing to Wuhan these cities are in shortage of medical resources. They need help from us!  Xiangyang has 5.6 million population has confirmed 441 coronavirus patients. Because there are not enough testing equipment and medical resources a lot of suspected patients have to isolate themselves home. Now we are working with Xiangyang Integration of Traditional Chinese and Western Medicine Hospital which was appointed as the coronavirus patient treatment hospital on 01/25/2020. My friend Xinhui Gao and I (Zijing Zhu) contacted a medical worker in the hospital. They are still in the condition of lacking the essential medical supplies such as masks surgical goggles and protective suits. We want to do what we can to help the situation and your generous contribution will help the hospital to acquire the medical necessities. We hope that our donation will help beat the coronavirus!  Information about the account that we are donating to:    Heres a video of the current medical condition in China:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TCpQXza2mFs

title: [Emergenza COVID-19] Raccolta fondi CRI Trofarello
description: Siamo la  Croce Rossa di Trofarello  un comune nella provincia di Torino.  Nonostante il timore che circola oramai da oltre due settimane non è mai venuta a mancare la presenza del nostro personale e dei nostri mezzi. I nostri volontari sono sempre presenti e continuano a svolge attività in maniera costante senza riduzione dei servizi erogati.  Ora siamo davanti ad una  sfida  - per questo vogliamo fare appello alla vostra generosità.  Abbiamo e stiamo affrontando spese importanti per garantire la disponibilità dei presidi che vengono utilizzati. Migliaia di euro sono stati spesi in pochi giorni e molti altri saranno spesi nei prossimi giorni.  Questo perché vogliamo tutelare i nostri volontari impegnati quotidianamente  nell’emergenza e per poter essere a supporto delle fasce più deboli della comunità.  Il motto della Croce Rossa Italiana è  UN’ITALIA CHE AIUTA  ed in questo momento chiediamo di aiutarci a essere il cuore pulsante della solidarietà della nostra meravigliosa comunità.     Qualunque contributo seppur minimo per noi sarebbe di grande aiuto. Siamo grati a chiunque vorrà partecipare e ti invitiamo a diffondere questo messaggio.    Grazie di Cuore ??

title: Funeral services for Emilio Corona.
description: My son Emilio Corona tragically passed away on 02-10-2020. Emilio was such a kind loving person with a good heart.

title: Help Fight the Coronavirus
description: The Goal of the Funding is to Help Fight the Coronavirus.    Coronavirus was first detected in Wuhan City China but the virus continues to threaten many globally. There are 68594 confirmed cases and 1667 deaths reported as of 02/16/2020.  The first confirmed case in the United States was on January 30 2020 and 15 cases have been confirmed as of 02/15/2020.  The number of Coronavirus cases is growing globally. Countless medical teams from all over China are fighting in the primary battlefield and trying to control the expansion. Everyone is wearing masks and since travel is limited many people cannot go to work making a shortage of food. If you help donate to this cause your money will be sent to Beijing Chunmiao Charity Foundation. BCCF is in urgent need of funding to purchase masks and other protective equipment which are in a shortage in mainland China.  Let’s help Wuhan and China get past the Coronavirus.

title: International Student Stuck abroad due to COVID-19
description: My name is Ramone a medical student and an aspiring Pediatric Oncologist currently studying in China. I am a member of a core research team that focuses on Osteosarcomas Multiple Myeloma and the NK Cell-Based Immunotherapy together with the Tumor Immunology of various other cancers. I have co-authored and published several scientific research papers in a number of peer-reviewed journals. Towards the ending of January just before the Chinese New Year I left China for what should have been a short travel to Malaysia. Within two days I learned that there was an outbreak of a novel coronavirus in the Wuhan province. The worst was yet to come as three days later the now named 2019-nCOV had virtually spread to all provinces in China and resulted in several deaths. At this point my program coordinator had made contact and informed me that based on the worsening situation of the now viral epidemic I could not return to China and that I should extend my travel for a few more days until given notice to return. About a week later I again attempted to return but was informed that there were travel restrictions and a partial shutdown implemented by several provincial governments in addition to a number of airline cancellations and that I was not allowed to return under any circumstances until notified to do so by the University. Failure to abide by the preventative measures implemented by the educational department and the government to slow the spread of the viral outbreak would result in serious disciplinary action being taken.Since then I have been stuck alone in a foreign country waiting and hoping each day that the situation will somehow get better and I would be allowed to return to China as I was unable to travel elsewhere due to travel bans imposed by a number of countries. Already having spent several weeks here with still no clear sign as to when I will be able to return I again queried and was notified that courses would be conducted online for the period and I should return home until notice is given for the resumption of regular classes/rotations. Thereafter depending on the progress of the situation I can apply in advance to return providing that the outbreak is under control.Please if able to donate to help me stay afloat until I can return home as well as help with travel expenses I would be grateful. I have depleted all my resources and will try traveling to Jamaica soon. Thanks in advance. I appreciate your kind assistance.If you wish to see some of my published research articles you may visit  https://www.mendeley.com/profiles/ramone-a-williamson/

title: Help a Teacher during the Corona Virus Outbreak
description: Hello I am currently an elementary teacher in Hanoi Vietnam. It’s a very rewarding and exciting job- that is when the COVID-19 aka Corona Virus doesn’t force the schools to close. The information about the closures has come to the public schools within a days’ notice one week at a time. It has been proposed by Ho Chi Minh city that schools could stay closed until April. I am on forced unpaid leave and it is likely going to last 2 months.  During this time of uncertainty we don’t know until when as the information comes out at the last minute.   I really miss teaching my students and guiding them to enjoy learning English through games activities and prizes.     Since I can’t teach my students due to the forced shut down I would like to do something more useful and meaningful with my time. Instead of hiding from the Virus in my little apartment in Hanoi for another month I’ve decided to try and make the most of my time to go back to volunteering for a bit. So I am asking if anyone would like to help me make it to Nepal/ or the Philippines wherever the need is the greatest and cheapest to volunteer.                I am 100% committed to using my skills and time volunteering during this break so I will make whatever I get work! So every dollar penny dong like share or positive message you can share whatever you can throw my way counts! I have already been approved to go volunteer so now I just need to get there!!! Thank you for reading/sharing  3  Some of the cost include the transportation visa food/accommodations and some materials needed. If you have any questions please do not hesitate to ask!

title: COVID-19  Help doctors and nurses in Wuhan
description: Dear All  My name is Vanessa and I am a Chinese born Australian. I was born and raised by the very mothering land of China and my home town Wuhan as I feel the need to do something to help my motherland to overcome Novel Coronavirus – COVID19.  As of today there are more than 74576 people confirmed diagnosis and more than 2000 people died predominantly (over 90%) in my home town Wuhan. The hospitals in Wuhan are already OUT OF Surgical masks Protective overalls and Protective Eyewear/Goggles.  Doctors and Nurses are currently treating tens of thousands of infected patients using recycled (washed in disinfectant solution) surgical masks and lab coat or even rain coat………. as there are NO MORE protective gear left for use!  Your donations will be spent to purchasing Surgical Masks Protective Overalls for medical/surgical and Protective Goggles which I have already sourced from. With the existing amount funded I have already purchased (out of my own pocket for now until gofundme allows for withdrawal) 100 Surgical masks 50 Protective overalls. Note that there are still 450 surgical overalls 4900 surgical masks and 500 Protective Goggles available for purchase before they get sold out I need your support to ensure that our Chinese front line fighters are protected while they serve their patients.   Please chip in and help out to the first line Hero and Angels!   All purchasing medical supplies will be sent to HuBei Charity Federation located in Wuhan TianHe airport and they will distribute to the hospital(s) in Wuhan or other city in HuBei .  I thank you very much in advance!  Vanessa  Update:  Our team have already bought four cartons (180 suits) Type 3 protective overalls and sent to Wuhan on 24 of Feb with China Southern airline. Please watch 7News Sydney  China Southern Airline mercy plane carrying humanitarian and and bound directly for Wuhan has taken off from Sydney Airport on 24th of February  Update (10/03/20): there were 14 cartons Protective Overalls (420 suits) being bought and will be sent by China Southern Airline mercy plane on 16/03/20.

title: Georgetown Students Help Fight Coronavirus
description: Visit our website:  www.georgetowncovid19.com    We are a group of students from Georgetown University and we are fundraising for medical supplies and devices to support hospitals in China to assist patients infected by or under the threat of COVID-19.   Why are we doing this fundraiser?  The SARS-CoV-2 virus (previously known as the 2019 novel coronavirus) has permeated our news and conversations for the past month. Yet no news can rightfully communicate the fear confusion and helplessness of those that are infected or quarantined nor the courage and sacrifice of the doctors nurses and volunteers battling on the frontline. Many Georgetown students have families in China and Wuhan. They are worried and have contributed a lot of time and effort to help their families and others in China.   As students of Georgetown University we are guided by the Jesuit tradition of Cura Personalis -- “care for the whole person” and believe that it is part of our responsibility to help the members of the global community who are most severely affected by the COVID-19 global pandemic.   Therefore we are holding this fundraiser to achieve two goals: 1. To provide funds that alleviate the immediate medical needs of Chinese hospitals on the frontline of fighting the coronavirus.  2. To empower members of the Georgetown community in making an impact on the fight against this global pandemic.    Where are the proceeds going?  The proceeds of this fundraiser will go to  Beijing Chunmiao Charity Foundation . We chose them because of their demonstrated quickness to respond their proven ability to obtain medical supplies and devices to hospitals in need and their emphasis on operational transparency.  Links to learn more:  Description of Chunmiao in English   About Chunmiaos coronavirus project  (can be translated using Chrome browser)  Chunmiao is a Chinese non-profit founded in 2010 specializing in public welfare projects in caring for congenitally-ill children healthcare education elderly-nursing and poverty alleviation.  On January 27 2020 Chunmiao formed a Coronavirus workgroup that was able to raise roughly 40M RMB (roughly 6M USD) more than 25M RMB of which is already spent to provide medical supplies and devices to hospitals in Wuhan and surrounding areas.  Chunmiao will decide the specific usage of our proceeds as they see fit (e.g. masks vs. ECMO machines) to the circumstances of the hospitals they support.    Fundraiser disclosure  Given that Chunmiao is non-profit registered in China only (meaning it cannot register itself on GoFundMe) we will transfer the proceeds to a personal account first before wiring them to Chunmiaos account in China.  Stanley He   a current MBA student at Georgetown and the liaison between Chunmiao and us will receive the proceeds and then wire them out.  We will be disclosing all financial transactions and records related to this fundraiser and obtain a receipt from Chunmiao. Chunmiao will also provide us a report on the usage of our donation to us. We are in the process of setting up a website to disclose this information.    Members and friends of the Georgetown community we hope to get your support to come together and help fight this global pandemic by supporting the people who are fighting the coronavirus and saving lives on the frontline.

title: Help Wuhan and Other Cities Defeat COVID-19
description: Keep Helping China! Keep Saving Lives! Help Reconstruction!   The outbreak of the novel coronavirus (2019-nCoV) is sill under way in China especially in Wuhan and other cities in Hubei province. Wuhan and at least 15 other cities (including Huanggang Huangshi Jingzhou Yichang ... ) have been quarantined as China attempts to halt the spread of the coronavirus. Thats more than 50 million people on lockdown. Plenty of stress but shortage of everything else for these cities. There are not enough hospitals and not enough beds not enough doctors and not enough nurses not enough rubber gloves and not enough face masks. Millions of people are suffering from infections panic attacks and even death in these lockdown cities. Things are worst in many small cities.   Lots of families are faced with the difficult task of recovery and reconstruction after disaster. Many of them lost their family members during outbreak. Many of them have serious after-effects of a disaster especially for children and young people.  Many of them are devastated by the coronavirus . They need help. They need our support.   Lets help China defeat 2019-nCov.  We will continue to help persons in affected areas of China (Wuhan and other seriously affected cities) to overcome this crisis and build back their life. We believe unity is strength; we beliveve faith will overcome panic attacks; and we believe we can win the battle against the virus.   The donations will be used to purchase medical supplies for medical staff and people who are fighting against the 2019-nCoV in Wuhan and other cities. The donations will also be used for helping hard-hit families during the outbreak and after disaster.   This donation campaign is launched by our Chinese community from Greater Memphis United Chinese Association University of Memphis University of Tenenssee St. Jude Childrens Research Hospital Memphis Chinese Evangelical Church the Confucius Insititute at the University of Memphis and other organizations at Memphis.  Contact:  Xinhua Yu    xyu2@memphis.edu  Zhaohui Wu    zwu6@uthsc.edu  Liang Hong    lhong2@uthsc.edu  Fei Zheng    fei.zheng@stjude.org  Dan Ye    dye1@memphis.edu  Liang Zhang    lzhang13@memphis.edu

title: Fight COVID-19 Stand with Wuhan
description: Change a Life Today. Donate now.   Dear friends  COVID-19 doesn’t discriminate against our race age gender or nationality. Helping people in Wuhan the epicentre of the deadly coronavirus outbreak to contain the spread of the epidemic is helping ourselves.  A plague at such scale would be disastrous for any city in the world. All hospitals in Wuhan reported low stock on medical supplies as they are experiencing an unprecedented patients intake each day.  Frontline healthcare professionals and first responders amidst the lunar New Year holiday are working 24/7 to treat the sick save lives and bring this outbreak under control. They skip meals and washroom breaks in order to save on disposal of protective coveralls.  The emerging rapidly evolving situation touches the hearts of billions of people worldwide.  This coronavirus relief campaign aims to provide desperately needed medical supplies such as masks hazmat suits and gloves to the frontline healthcare workers and hospitals in Wuhan to help prevent the spread of the virus.  To date 40000 pairs of gloves and 10000 isolation gowns are en route to Wuhan. Protective goggles impact-proof masks and hazmat suits worth $25000 are being purchased.  We are proud to announce our partnership with the Crackup Ottawa Comedy Festival! A portion of their ticket sales for DASHAN AND FRIENDS on Thursday March 26 and CRACKUP OTTAWA FESTIVAL FINALE on Friday March 27 will be donated to our coronavirus relief. Details of the events can be found here -   http://www.crackup.ca/events  .  Crackup Ottawa will also be promoting our “GoFundMe” campaign with the goal of raising an additional $100000 in private and corporate donations from the Ottawa and Canadian comedy community.

title: Fundraiser for medical and living expenses
description: As some of you may or may not know my brother Alex Corona was in a car accident on Tuesday which resulted in him totaling his vehicle and shattering his pelvis. His job is cutting his insurance off at the end of the month due to the fact that he has not been employed with the company for a year as of yet .The Dr’s are telling him that it will be at least 6 months before he is able to work again he’s unable to afford COBRA and doesn’t qualify for any government aid at the time . MyBrother has worked so hard to achieve his goals of becoming an airplane mechanic and was finally beginning to reap the benefits of his hard work when this unfortunate accident happened . We are starting a go fund me just to help him with his medical and living expenses. If you are able to donate even a dollar it will add up. If you are unable to donate please  share this post  and keep him in your prayers as he is trying to adjust to this new way of living. Thank you

title: SUPPORT WHS BASEBALL (100-Inning Game TBD-COVID19)
description: **UPDATE** DUE TO THE CORONAVIRUS OUTBREAK AND THE SOCIAL DISTANCING PRACTICE THAT THE COUNTRY IS PARTAKING IN THE 100-INNING GAME WILL BE POSTPONED INDEFINITELY.  HOWEVER WE CAN STILL USE YOUR HELP TO REACH OUR FINANCIAL GOALS AS A PROGRAM AND APPRECIATE ANY HELP THAT YOU ARE WILLING TO PROVIDE FOR US!  The Westside High School baseball team carries a lot of momentum heading into the 2020 campaign.  With a year-old turf playing surface and a brand new state of the art indoor facility the Rams enter the 2020 season fully prepared to compete at the 5A level.  However there are still things that we are looking to add to our program and provide for our kids and we need your help to do so.  Last year we used the funds that we raised in our 100-Inning Game in order to purchase a brand new Hack Attack machine.  Since the purchase of that machine our players have become much more equipped to attack high velocity fastballs and have also been able to work on staying closed off and using the whole field on breaking balls as well.  This year with the new NOCSAE certification requirements we are looking to purchase some equipment that is essential for game day for our kids.  We need to purchase new catchers equipment at the Varsity JV and C-Team level due to the new certifications.  We also need new game balls for all levels.  Also with the new building in full swing we can now direct our attention to baseball specific drills that we feel are necessary for development and improvement.  We can spend money on making sure we have these materials.  We also hope to be able to buy more apparel for our players in the future and also have tossed around the idea of going on a team trip for the 2021 that would require sufficient funds.  Thank you in advance for your help!  We look forward to sharing the 100-inning game with everyone!  The packages are as follows (although any donation is appreciated).  Again thank you for your help!  $0.05 per inning- $5.00 (Single Package) $0.10 per inning- $10.00 (Double Package) $0.25 per inning- $25.00 (Triple Package) $0.50 per inning- $50.00 (Home Run Package) $1.00 per inning- $100.00 (Grand Slam Package)

title: Stay Strong PUMC  beat  COVID-19!
description: ????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????? ????????2?10?????????164?????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????24 ????? This is Peking Union Medical hospital Chicago Alumni Association. A lot of our alumni in China is fighting with COVID-19. Many of them are parents doctors nurses and all of them are sons and daughters. We need help on raising money to buy Personal protective equipment for our health care professionals and we will in charge of handling to China. We need to help our health care professionals  so that they are protected while they are helping us to prevent the virus spreading worldwide.  Any single dollar is appreciated!

title: Corona virus affected family member
description: Most of you may not realize this but I have a brother who still lives in China. We were separated when I was at a young age . God has always been gracious and faithful to me I was blessed with a new family and given a new home and was raised in a Christian environment. My brother Jimmy however was raised by my grandmother who later passed away leaving him an orphan raising himself at the age of 16. Even though we didn’t grow up together Jimmy always has a special place in my heart he is my blood he is my brother. The corona virus has hit his hometown pretty hard. ..He has not been able to go to work for almost a month now he’s getting down to barely any food in his apartment. Food and supplies are getting really low and his bank account is also dwindling down. Everybody is scared over there the government is even arresting people for not wearing their masks on the street. He has reached out to me for help and I was able to send him money via western union to help out but what I can do is limited as well. I’m not usually one to do this and I have never done a go fund me page before But Jimmy can really use all the help that he can get and if I can tell his story and get just a little bit a help sent a long his way I will be so grateful!

title: Life after displacement of the corona virus
description: My two children and were stranded in China. Thanks to God’s grace and your donations were able to flee the country of China and purchase three tickets home. I still cannot believe how much they were charging for tickets unbelievable! We have completed our quarantine and are forced to move along. We are currently homeless and are trying to get situated and back to something that reveals a regular life. We have been so lucky to have one friend that has allowed us to temporarily stay with them. When we were in China we had several friends offer to assist us. These friends are now afraid to allow us to stay with them because the corona virus has made its way to America and is currently devastating cities. We are trying to get back on our feet and back into the world. Any donations or job connections would be greatly appreciated.

title: Raising Funds for Corona Virus Supplies
description: My hometown Xinyang City is located 200 kilometers away from Wuhan the city were coronavirus had an originated.  Besides Wuhan this is the number one affected city. There are more than 6 million people who inhabit Xinyang  and there just isn’t enough supplies for everyone. Masks intended for one day use are being utilized for weeks due to the shortage. The money we raised will be used to buy supplies for doctors and the people of Xinyang.

title: COVID-19 SOSTENIAMO TERAPIA INTENSIVA DI TRIESTE
description: In questi giorni difficili  lOspedale Cattinara di Trieste  sta sostenendo larrivo di persone malate provenienti non solo dalla regione Friuli Venezia Giulia ma anche da altre regioni Italiane come la Lombardia il Veneto ed altre più distanti forse anche la Vostra da nord a sud.  I casi che necessitano di cure stanno aumentando ed il personale sanitario ha bisogno del nostro supporto concreto. Di tutti noi indipendentemente da dove  abbiate la residenza. Non cè differenza siamo tutti abitanti di questa penisola unica al mondo.    In questo momento  le attrezzature necessarie per la terapia intensiva e subintensiva sono:  - Ventilatori - Dispositivi di ventilazione non invasiva - Monitoraggio emodinamico - Monitor - Materiale di consumo o altro materiale sanitario  Anche una piccola donazione può fare la differenza.   I fondi raccolti  saranno direttamente devoluti all’Ospedale di Cattinara Trieste o ridistribuiti  sul territorio regionale (ulteriori 3 Ospedali) dalla  Azienda sanitaria universitaria Giuliano Isontina (ASU GI)   Mi chiamo Andrea Odoni vivo a Trieste e sono laureato in Scienze Motorie (facoltà di medicina) e sono uno dei promotori di questa campagna.  Del mio team fa parte Diego Martone anche lui residente a Trieste.  Siamo in contatto con la Direzione dellOspedale di Cattinara città di Trieste Con Luniversità di Trieste e con lassessore alla sanità della regione Friuli .    ***************  PER CREDIBILITA LASCIO SCAMBI DI MAIL CON LA DIREZIONE SANITARIA        In these difficult days the Cattinara Hospital in Trieste is supporting the arrival of sick people not only from the Friuli Venezia Giulia region but also from other Italian regions such as Lombardy Veneto and others more distant perhaps even yours from north to south.  Cases needing treatment are on the rise and healthcare professionals need our concrete support. Of all of us regardless of where you live. There is no difference we are all inhabitants of this unique peninsula in the world.  At this time the necessary equipment for intensive and subintensive therapy are:  - Fans - Non invasive ventilation devices - Hemodynamic monitoring - Monitor - Consumables or other sanitary materials  Even a small donation can make a difference.  The funds raised will be directly donated to the Cattinara Trieste hospital or redistributed on the regional territory (additional 3 hospitals) by the Giuliano Isontina University Health Authority (ASU GI)  My name is Andrea Odoni I live in Trieste and I have a degree in Sports Science (medical faculty) and I am one of the promoters of this campaign. Diego Martone is also part of my team and he also lives in Trieste. We are in contact with the Management of the Cattinara Hospital city of Trieste with the University of Trieste and with the councilor for health of the Friuli region.

title: Fight Coronavirus (CoVID-19)! Support Wuhan!
description: Please join Where Music Carries Us Inc. in making a difference in our global community. WMCU is raising money to benefit those who are affected by the Wuhan coronavirus. All donations will go towards medical supplies and other necessities in Wuhan China. Thank you in advance for your contribution to this cause.  All donations are tax-deductible and we provide receipts with our tax ID. All proceeds will go directly to the Wuhan University New York Alumni Association for the purchase and shipment of medical supplies to Wuhan and other infected areas in China.  To  learn more about the coronavirus outbreak visit  https://www.who.int/emergencies/diseases/novel-coronavirus-2019    More information about Where Music Carries Us Inc. Visit WhereMusicCarriesUs.org WMCU is a nonprofit organization based in Princeton NJ. We spread the joy of music in order to best serve our community with our passions and we seek to promote awareness and youth action. We welcome you to join us in our mission.

title: Fundraising For Corona Virus in Hubei China
description: As we all may know the COVID-19 (coronavirus) outbroke in the early December 2019 in Wuhan Hubei Province China. The incident has spread rapidly not only in China but also in the world. Until today the epidemic doesnt seem to be optimistic and has a high degree of chances to worsen as well as getting critical. Therefore as overseas Chinese students our Chinese Student and Scholars Association (CSSA) would like to take the lead to hold a fundraising event. It is our responsibility and obligation to contribute to our nation to fight against this epidemic. The purpose of this fundraising event is to advocate and support the medical supply shortage in China especially Hubei Province by donating money to the Hubei Charity Federation.

title: A student effort for Coronavirus Medical Supplies
description: With the rapid spread of the Coronavirus in China the students in Walt Whitmans National Science Competition Club are on a mission to raise money for medical supplies in order to relieve the pressures in Chinese hospitals. NSC is not only committed to scientific research and projects but also humanitarian efforts for those who are affected by medical epidemics. Both co-presidents of the club are children of Chinese immigrants so their relatives are the people directly affected by the disease. Please help us in our efforts to donate medical supplies to the people of China.  The money will be donated to Direct Relief a top 10 charity in the US. They will provide surgical masks gloves gowns and other emergency medical items.   Summary of our member’s research:  COVID-19 an enveloped RNA virus is spread primarily through respiratory droplets produced by coughing and sneezing. It is a beta coronavirus like MERS and SARS. It replicates through attachment to the host cell by binding to receptors and endocytosis. Then it uses its RNA strand to make copies of itself. Preventative measures need to be taken; this includes the usage of masks gloves and protective gowns to inhibit further spreading.

description: South Korea has emerged as a new frontline in the global fight against the COVID-19 pandemic.   ?? ????? ?? ???????? ???? ???? ?????.  Although Wuhan China remains the epicenter of the COVID-19 pandemic South Korea is experiencing an exponential rise in the number of confirmed cases of COVID-19 infection particularly in the city of Daegu.  ??? ?? ???????? ?????? ??? ?? ??? ???? ???? ???? ??? ???? ????.     As a result of the sudden and rapid increase in the number of infections doctors and nurses in the frontline are facing steep shortages of various medical supplies including surgical masks and hand sanitizers.  ????? ??? ??? ?? ???? ??? ?? ????? ???? ????? ??? ?? ?? ??? ??? ?????. title: Help Fight Coronavirus in South Korea
description: https://metro.co.uk/video/south-koreans-queue-buy-face-masks-covid-19-outbreak-2117030/?ito=vjs-link     Hello everyone!  My name is Sung Jo and my friends name is Katherine Ko. We were born and raised in the very mothering land of South Korea but we both study and live in the United States. Our friends (including Frances Chow part of this fundraising team) and my children (5 and 7 year old boys) would like to do something to help South Korea overcome the outbreak of COVID-19 ( Coronavirus).    South Korea is experiencing an exponential rise in the number of confirmed cases of COVID-19 infection particularly in the city of Daegu the fourth largest city in the country. South Korea just announced 334 new cases bringing South Korea’s national tally of the virus to 1595. (Feb. 26 2020)  As a result of the sudden and rapid increase in the number of infections in South Korea they are already out of surgical masks and protective gowns.    PLEASE HELP doctors nurses and other medical personnel working in the region and the citizens in South Korea.  Your donations will be used to purchase N95 masks procedural masks that have 99% viral filtration and medical/surgical gowns. Our goal is to raise enough money to get 1000 N95 masks 1000 medical gowns and 500 bottles of hand sanitizers. We will ship all of these supplies to South Korea via an express shipping company.  WE WILL REPAY YOUR KINDNESS. Thank you so much for your consideration.  Sincerely Sung Jo Katherine Ko and Frances Chow  ?????? ??? ??? ?? ?? ?????. ?? ??? ?? ?? ??? title: One glory one Corona virus
description: James and a small group of glory fans went to Korea for the ulsan champions league game only to find out it had been postponed when they had landed after just arriving in Perth unable to work before the game due to a back operation most of his money went to this trip they have been quarantined for the next few weeks unable to work or leave the house for two weeks .... any little bit will help

title: CRI - Comitato di Codogno - Emergenza Covid 19
description: Croce Rossa Italiana   Comitato di Codogno   opera incessantemente sul territorio dal 1897  conta oggi circa 200 Volontari che agiscono per il bene della comunità sempre seguendo i Nostri 7 Principi Fondamentali.  Sostieni il nostro Comitato in questo periodo di emergenza improvvisa dovuta al  virus Covid-19 ; il tuo supporto è importante per  aiutarci a fronteggiare al meglio i rischi  che i nostri Volontari e Dipendenti corrono ogni giorno.    La  tua donazione  sarà destinata allacquisto di materiale sanitario indispensabile per il servizio di ambulanza.  Puoi seguire altri aggiornamenti anche su  Facebook  .   Grazie  di cuore a chiunque decida di offrirci il suo contributo.                The Italian Red Cross - Committee of Codogno  has been working unceasingly on the territory since 1897 today it has about 200 Volunteers who act for the good of the community  always following Our 7 Principles.  Support our committee in this period of sudden emergency necessary for the  Covid-19 virus  ;   your support is important  to help our Volunteers and Employees your donation will be intended  for purchase of essential medical gear for the ambulance service.  You can follow further update on  Facebook     Thank you   to anyone who decides to offer us his contribution.

title: Farahans Corona Prevention Suits
description: My niece is a doctor at Farahans Farhang Khosravani hospital. This is to help this charity hospital buy suits that protect the hospital personnel against the Corona virus. All the donations (after the gofundme deductions) will be sent to the hospital.

title: Funeral expenses
description: We are kindly asking for any donations for funeral expenses for the passing of a sweet husband father grandfather uncle and friend Jose Eugenio Calderon.  He was a very strong man but his heart gave up and he went to heaven on February 27 2020. He will forever be in our hearts and will always be missed.  We would greatly appreciate any contribution for funeral expenses and your thoughts and prayers.

title: Coronavirus
description: Due to the coronavirus breakout in China many communities and towns are locked down to keep the virus from spreading. People from my hometown which is a small town in far northwest of China called Qitai are confined into their own homes like other cities for over one month. This has created great difficulties for people who have not much savings for emergencies like this. I just heard from my dad who is currently working as a security guard for the community center that a lot people called the center everyday because they dont have the basic necessities to get by each day food water money to pay for electricity gas and wifi etc. wifi is needed because kids are schooled via internet at home due to the emergency. The center is trying their best to help but its not enough. I am currently studying in the University of Leeds in UK so there is only so much I can do for the community I grow up in myself because I spend almost all of my money in this study. I am really grateful and sending enormous amount of love for anyone who could chip in to help my community and I am also grateful if you feel called to help but not be able to my love and gratitude goes to you all as well. The money raised will be used to buy flour powder rice cooking oil which are the most basic food people in my hometown eat everyday. Only the most basic food will be bought for them because I am thinking to help as many people as possible to survive first  and if I can raise more vegetables and meat will be bought to help them. I dont have photos or videos available at the moment due to the lockdown but I will try to post them to help keep you updated with the process as soon as possible. Thanks again for all the help and kind hearts out there and much love to you all.xxxxxxxxxxxx...

title: Help fighting  Coronavirus
description: Dear friends   As most of you know I am in Seoul South Korea with my family. While I have been focusing on the positive side that we are healthy I realize that Corona Virus has a more disastrous impact than we all expected. While South Korea has been handling the virus outbreak greatly so far patients and front line medical responders in high risk and quarantined areas still need supplies and continued support as the crisis unfolds. I setup a GoFundMe page and I’m hoping that all of you who know me or like my work can donate. I will start posting photos that I took through the years in different parts of the world or photos of things that touched me in a way or another.  When you see a photo you like please send me a message and I will send you the digital file in high resolution along with a link for you to print. Once you print it I hope this will be a memory of you making a small but big impact for others in this terrible crisis.  Any amount of dollars you can donate will help!! My hopes and prayers go out to all the families affected and especially to all the nurses doctors scientists who work selfishly to fight Coronavirus.  Let’s do this together!! Mari

title: Help my Dad live amongst the Corona Virus China
description: As many people are well aware the Corona Virus has spead from China and created a global issue. But in China itself its an epidemic! My Dad however who health is already in extremely poor condition is right in the middle of it in China. Hes 70 years old and is already on oxygen from a pulmonary embolism he had a year ago... at the moment hes told me that most shops have closed down and the streets are empty due to the virus and most people are choosing to confine themselves to their homes so as to avoid the spread. He and his wife have both lost their jobs and struggling to make ends meet... Hes a very proud man so hearing him admit this much terrifies me. Ive tried to offer my own financial support at times also but hes far too proud to ask for help... But Im not. Please help. Ive never considered making one of these myself and probably wouldnt if it were only for myself... but its for my Dad. Hes always worked so hard to make sure his family have always had everything theyve ever wanted despite being in a detrimental relationship that ended with him losing every cent to his name...  He has almost nothing to his name and I would give anything to have his last few years on this earth without the stress and worry of how to buy food for the week...  Thank you for absolutely anything you can afford to give...  3

title: Helping Devon
description: For this young man to have to go through a traumatic event like this which could have been prevented we as community should come together and help as much as possible. This is a page to help raise not only money to help the family with his medical expenses but to also help raise awareness and prevent other incidents like this from happening again and maybe shedding some knowledge to some that its ok to continue learning from those who are knowledgable and willing to help in certain areas. We want to help and allow Devon to experience life without restrictions. Please take the time to read this incredible young mans journey. He is wise beyond his years and stronger than most his age.     On the morning of January 15th there was an accident in the weight room at Academy High School which resulted in the amputation of my pointer and middle finger. As you can imagine this has been very traumatic for me and some days are worse than others and it will continue to get worse for me mentally for a little while. Actually varies moment by moment. I expect to return to school when I am released to do so. Due to the anxiety of this situation I am asking to please not ask me questions about the accident when I return it may cause me to replay the moment in my head and that won’t end well. I will open up and talk when I am ready please respect my privacy and space. I look forward to returning to my normal activities but I will be learning my new normal. While I am prepared this will take some time I will be very quiet and sad and at times very frustrated please just understand I need time but I know I will be stronger and better than ever before I know it. I will continue to be in athletics of course and this only inspires me to work harder in what I do but I do hope the school district does what they should do to make the weight room safer. I am grateful because it could’ve ended in worse circumstances. I am also extremely grateful it was me that it happened to instead of any of my fellow loved classmates this way it’ll bring the districts attention to the situation and they could easily prevent it from happening to anybody else. I’m very worried about everybody but I understand everybody is worried about me as well so thank you so much for your support and love during this extremely difficult time. It helps me during this time. The encouragement of family and friends that have visited and checked on me mean more to me then any of you will ever know. -Devon Hulsey

title: CRI Monza | Covid19
description: AIUTACI AD AIUTARE!  I nostri volontari lavorano per voi 24h/24h e 7 giorni su 7!   La  Croce Rossa Italiana  è attiva su tutto il territorio nazionale per rispondere allemergenza Coronavirus 2020 fin dai primissimi momenti dellemergenza.    La  CRI di Monza  con il lavoro dei suoi oltre  250 volontari e 7 dipendenti  sta garantendo i seguenti servizi.  1.  soccorso ordinario  (servizio 118) sul territorio di Monza e dei Comuni limitrofi 2. aumento dei  mezzi di soccorso  disponibili 3. attività di presidio sanitario presso gli  aeroporti  di Linate e Malpensa per lo screening dei passeggeri in arrivo 4. preparazione per il  pronto impiego  del materiale campale: tende brande materiale sanitario 5. attivazione dell unità di crisi  del Comitato per gestire e coordinare tutti gli interventi    La raccolta fondi è destinata alle seguenti attività:   * acquisto dei  dispositivi di protezione  individuale per i nostri operatori (mascherine camici monouso guanti etc...)  * acquisto di  materiale campale  da utilizzare in caso di pronto impiego: tenda pneumatica brande materiale sanitario campale   Se vuoi maggiori informazioni o vuoi essere sicuro prima di effettuare la tua donazione contattaci!  Croce Rossa Italiana - Comitato di Monza OdV via Pacinotti 2 - Monza 039 204591 Manuela Canato - Amministrazione CRI Monza

title: Project Corona Short Film
description: £300 Budget to be raised for location services      The year is 2025 COVID-19 has ravaged the uk and left the country in a state of despair.   22 year old Fern has learned to survive by travelling from settlement to settlement offering her services completing odd jobs in exchange for food medicine and shelter.   As She travels the country on her deceased fathers beloved bike she runs out of fuel and must make her way to the nearest military outpost in the hopes of finding her much needed fuel.   As she arrives at the checkpoint she discovers the place has been overrun with infected and she must deal with them before she has access to the fuel.    A Jamie Neagle Film.   Directed by Ruby Hamilton  Executive Producer Screen   Film School ‘ Creative producer Jamie Neagle  1st Ad Christian Garnes  Cinematography by George Baker   Danny Barker  Art by Paula Pindado Grajal  Sound by Ieuan Lowther   Lara Bertin     Once the funds have been raised they will be used to secure the location for the days filming.   Our whole crew will benefit from this project as it makes up 60% of our final first year grade. The project is ambitious but is the perfect opportunity to showcase our skills learned in the first year.   Funds to be secured by April 6th 2020

title: For homeless family of 4
description: No smiles for a while...as my heart breaks for my daughter Amanda Gomez and my 3 grandkids. Within hours their lives changed and now they are homeless waiting for the days to run out staying at a hotel the 4 of them. A huge tree toppled over their mobile home and almost took the lives of my grandbabies! Omg. We have been just trying to salvage whatever we can in bags and boxes. I humbly ask for prayers and akind donation of any amount so she can sustain her means of everyday living such as gas toiletries and such. This may seem small to some people but when it hits your home it turns into a grave situation. Thank you  for reading this and your prayers for this single mother will surely be appreciated. God Bless you

title: Fix our well
description: Story   In December our well pump died and we’ve been without running water ever since. Were raising $1500 to replace the well and $500 to survive until we can get it replaced.   We’ve been using bottled water but it’s expensive and hard to deal with. We’re both disabled and this a big hardship for us.   [Image by  Willfried Wende  from  Pixabay ]  Now people have been buying out all the bottled water stock at our local stores in preparation for a COVID19 outbreak and it will be much harder for us to source potable water.  The replacements we use in lieu of running water like bathing wipes dry shampoo bottled drinks and disposable utensils are not good for us our finances or the environment.    [Image by  Bilderjet  from  Pixabay ]  Please help us fix our well so we can go back to living more normal lives.   Thank you for your donations and for sharing our fundraiser! With your help we can get this done.   [Image by  Susanne Jutzeler suju-foto   from  Pixabay ]   Costs   We estimate that the well repair will be about $1500 including a new pump and labor. We’ve included an extra $500 in the goal to help us buy the things we need in the meantime which will be a lot of disposable utensils and ready made meals since we have no way to wash dishes.    Risks   It’s possible that the repairs will be more expensive than my estimate but that seems unlikely.   Its also possible that we wont raise enough money to replace the pump and we wont be able to make up the difference for a while.    Notes   Title Image by  Ron Porter  from  Pixabay .   I hope we can update the campaign with images from our own lives soon. I just wanted to get this live as soon as possible so that we can get water again.

title: Emergency Rental Assistance
description: At the end of February I was in the unfortunate position that many diabetics find themselves in  should I pay the rent or insulin? I was unable to obtain my insurance card from my new job in time and had to pay 1200 dollars out of pocket. I am in the process of recuperating some of the costs of my insulin with my insurance but I won’t get the full amount I paid and it won’t get to me in time to pay the rent. My rent bill with late fees is $1350. I have negotiated with my landlord an extension until March 12th otherwise they will file for eviction. I am able to come up with the remaining 750 via my pay check. I have exhausted all other avenues including social service agencies that might help with rental assistance. I would greatly appreciate it if anyone could spread the word or donate.

title: COVID-19: Connecting People with Chronic Illness
description: As we face the COVID-19 pandemic in the US and worldwide we all are wondering how we will get through it individually and collectively. And people with chronic illnesses need specific strategies.  Ill get to the point:   Im working with organizations and people across the country to help launch a powerful national network of people with chronic illnesses.    --  We need your support your wisdom and your love -- and if possible financial contributions.  --      What Were Doing:  For now were calling it Chronic Illness Leadership For Emergent Times (CILFET). But whats most important is what we have done and will do  --  We hosted a video meeting on Saturday March 7 thats now a  Healing Justice Podcast episode   ---  Thanks to: PeoplesHub AIDS United BEAM (Black Emotional and Mental Health Collective) Counter Narrative Project Health Justice Commons #MEAction Network Positive Womens Network - USA and The Reunion Project  And to our webinar speakers facilitators promoters strategists and producers Kate Werning of Healing Justice Podcast Evvie Ormon of EmergingPhoenix consulting Dr. Crissaris Sarnelli Elandria Williams of PeoplesHub Emily Szklarski Joan Dark Kate Sorensen Andrew Reynolds  and Daisy Becerra.  --  We have materials from the webinar and resources up at  bit.ly/cilfetstuff.    --  We will continue hosting and supporting mutual aid and conversations centering people with chronic illnesses and disabilities  --  Were planning and initiating a rapidly-scalable plan for this network based on emergent strategies and mutual aid. We need your support to move forward as quickly and effectively as possible.  Why We are Doing This:  As you know people living with some chronic illnesses and disabilities are at greater risk of acquiring a coronavirus having a more severe course of it and complications during or afterwards and higher mortality rates.  And those facing oppression marginalization and criminalization are most affected by heightened demands on health care systems and supply chains economic turmoil and rising stigma and bias.  (let’s all take a breath or a little pause…)  But queer and trans people have always had to find new paths for our survival. Our strategies for dealing with chronic illnesses like our communities themselves are diverse creative and take nothing for granted.  We are building a small but amazing team of network strategists health professionals and healers facilitators fiscal managers disaster response pros project managers and tech experts communicators and media producers. We want to situate this vital network in a stable home or formation so it can do what it needs to do.  Your support goes directly to help this team do what we need to do -- which are primarily queer and trans people living with multiple chronic conditions.  Thank you.   GoFundMe has asked for people raising funds about COVID-19 to provide this specific information:    1. Who you are: JD Davids    2. Where youre from: I live in Brooklyn NY    3. Your relationship to the parties youre raising funds for: They are for myself and a small team working on this effort. (see next question).    4. How the funds will be spent (be specific as possible): The funds will be used to donate to the small team of people who I am working with who are giving up time on other paid work or who are working with low pay to launch this important network. It includes me and a social media and communications manager who lives in New Jersey an artist and filmmaker in Utah a recent graduate school graduate in New Orleans with a degree in disaster response an organizer in Brooklyn who also works part time at a radical bookstore and will include one of two people in NYC I am talking to who are experts in creating networks and sustainable cooperative groups.

title: Save Flex Comics
description: Flex Comics is the leading bridge between Geekdom and Fitness. We create webcomics along with punny pop-culture parody geek and fitness apparel. We’ve made hundreds of FREE webcomics over the last 6 years. Our goal is to make you smile.       COVID-19 Coronavirus is Killing Our Small Business      Meeting our Flexers at Comic Cons Gaming Expos and Fitness Events are the highlights of doing what we do. We love and live for it. More than 60% of our revenue comes from these events.   The Arnold Classic was canceled this week due to the Corona Virus. This is our largest show we do each year. It takes months of preparation.  Airfare hotel inventory freight vendor fees and expo handling charges are so far all non-refundable. This unexpected turn of events has landed a critical blow to our small home operated business.  We are the little guys in the pond at a show like the Arnold Classic. We go up against multi-million dollar brands with our small pop-up booth.  We max out our credit to showcase alongside the best of the best in the industry.  The Arnold Classic happens each year at the beginning of our tour. The success from it paves the financial way to attend other expos throughout rest of the year.  Simply put we aren’t large enough to absorb such financial losses and survive very long.  Emerald City Comic Con just canceled their event over COVID-19 concerns. Which then pushes us out to Wondercon in a few more weeks.  We foresee more cancelations of large public events this year until the Corona Virus is contained. Although we understand and respect the decisions to do so it means we won’t make it to the end of the year without going out of business.   Our 2020 Tour:   LA Fit Expo CA Level Up Expo NV C2E2 IL Arnold Classic OH Wondercon CA AZ Womens Expo AZ Phoenix Fan Fusion AZ San Jose Fit Expo CA Anime AX CA Denver Pop Culture Con CO Anime Matsuri TX San Diego Pride CA San Diego Comic Con CA Game On Expo AZ Anaheim Fit Expo CA Mr. Olympia NV AthletiCon GA Tuscon Comic Con AZ San Diego Fit Expo CA Palm Springs Pride CA   Update - Arnold Classic Canceled: Puts  High Reps   out of business   Due to COVID-19 the Arnold Classic was cancelled. Our Father company Flex Comics (along with  TuffnTiny   and  Unicorn Muscle)   had booth spaces. We are a small home-run operation. It saddens us beyond words to have to close one of our growing ideas -  High Reps   - in order to try and stay afloat with Flex Comics.     Weve Paid It Forward    Weve given back along the way. Weve donated sponsored and helped countless causes aspiring athletes and events over the years. Weve funded Childrens Hospital visits with superheroes Womens Shelter contributions supported and worked with charities like Heartfelt Heros and Comic Care  sponsored and supported the Cosplay community and donated to many small and large lifting meets along with sponsoring many causes and fundraisers in the LGBT Community. All possible because youve supported us over the years with your likes comments swolfies and shares.   Action Plan:     Step 1     25% Funded  will help with our immediate financial setbacks:  - 8 incredible team members depend on us for income directly and an additional 6 crew members from our screen shop indirectly. Many of which have offered to work a few free days to help out (thats how amazing this crew is!).    Step 2     25%-50% Funded  will help us Pay off debts: - This is a takes-money-to-make money business. We have to front the costs of every expo we do months in advance.  Weve maxed ourselves out to do the Arnold Classic and this has left us unable to move forward not only with upcoming expos but with our everyday operating expenses.     Step 3     50%-100% Funded  will help us build a workshop warehouse at Flex Ranch (where we do all this at).  - Building a workshop has been our ultimate dream since we started this business in a 700sft apartment. Aside from the much needed space to grow it will help us add long-term stability to our brand. We wont have to rent a space and equipment for our screen printing operations. We can finally do it all in one place. We can also house all of our brands under one roof allowing for easier ordering online across brands (TuffnTiny Unicorn Muscle Flex Comics) and order fulfillment. Keeping our internal costs as low as possible is our primary way of competing with big business. This will make a world of difference for us.   Call To Action: Toss a coin to your Flexers   If we’ve made you smile if weve made fitness a little less intimidating for you if weve helped you to embrace your inner geek we ask that you help us continue putting that vibe out into the world.      ANY amount will help. Spread the word!    Lift Long and Prosperous   Jeremy Flex   The Flex Comics Team #savefc

title: Keep our Seattle area COVID-19 caregivers well fed
description: Seattle is currently facing the countrys worst outbreak of COVID-19. Behind every sick patient is team of amazing care givers putting themselves at risk as they help others.  The least we can do is make sure that these amazing individuals are eating well. Join us to send all kinds of yumminess to the incredible team at Harborview and beyond.

title: Gib Corona (k)eine Chance!
description: Willkommen zur nächsten Medis Massenveranstaltung! Corona hin oder her die letzte Party mit euch war zu nice um nicht noch einmal das Infektionsrisiko einzugehen.    Getreu dem Motto #Pécsworkfamily nehmen wir alle Feierlustigen auf die für morgen eigentlich andere Pläne hatten! #IE   Um das ganze so spontan auf die Beine zu stellen sind wir auf eure Hilfe angewiesen: Für die besten Beats sorgt wie immer DJ LagerFlow und die Medis-Orga kann die Kosten für Clubmiete Türsteher etc. vorstrecken. Wir hoffen aber auf eine Spende von 5€ pro Person für den Eintritt.  Wir hoffen auf euer Verständnis. Nähere Infos zum Ticketerwerb gibts morgen!   Die Realisierung des Events hängt noch etwas von eurer Resonanz ab da wir die Location bis morgen um 10 Uhr festmachen müssen.     Ziel ist es 300€ zu erreichen. Sollte uns das nicht gelingen und wir müssen die Party absagen bekommt ihr das Geld natürlich zurück! ______________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________  After an awesome Party on Wednesday we are ready to hit Guala Club for our next Medimeisterschaften mass event.  We wont let Corona destroy our Saturday evening plans!  To be able to realise the party on such short notice were hoping for your help!  To put your name on the guest list: 1) click on participate to our event 2) go to our Crowdfunding page  https://www.gofundme.com/f/gib-corona-keine-chance?utm_source=customer utm_medium=copy_link utm_campaign=p_cf+share-flow-1  3) donate 5€ with your name   Were hoping to see all you guys there tonight!

title: COVID-19 Virtual MaskerAIDE Ball
description: Please stay home for The MaskerAIDE Ball and have yourself a house party on April 12 2020 while helping people tragically affected by the coronavirus.   Your generosity will go directly to the American Red Cross which has been on the frontlines of the COVID-19 Crisis.  The American Red Cross shelters feeds and provides emotional support to victims of disasters supplies about 40 percent of the nations blood teaches skills that save lives provides international humanitarian aide and supports military members and their families.   Please post your stay-at-home party pics on April 12  so we can all get together  for this cause.   Im tossing what could possibly be the Worlds Best Party not one single person ever attends and that would be a smashing success for people who need our help against COVID-19! Thank you for not showing up while still being there.     @themaskeraideball   #themaskeraideball

title: Coronavirus emergency Northern Italy - Rotary
description: Rotary eClub Nuove Frontiere - Distretto 2050    Cremona (Italy) - A blue tent packed with masked medics in nylon overalls and rubber gloves greets patients outside an Italian hospital at the European epicentre of the new coronavirus epidemic.  Welcome to the sorting room: an urgently deployed army-style field hospital where people running a fever or showing other flu-like symptoms are tested for signs of COVID-19.  Due to the increasing of COVID-19 cases in north of Italy (3000+ cases and 100+ deaths) hospitals are in an emergency situations and they need additional equipments in particular  non-invasive mechanical respirators .  Please support our cause and donate to help our medical teams to fight this emergency.  Thank you! Rotary eClub Nuove Frontiere - Distretto 2050     http://www.recnuovefrontiere.org/      https://www.rotary.org/en/rotary-monitors-coronavirus-outbreak      https://tg24.sky.it/salute-e-benessere/2020/03/03/coronavirus-ospedale-cremona.html      https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nBXJnj9kHZo      https://www.bangkokpost.com/world/1872069/italy-deploys-emergency-field-hospitals-to-fight-virus

title: Help my Family in S.Korea survive Corona. V Crisis
description: Due to the spread of Coronavirus in South Korea the Korean government forced all the schools to shut down. Its been a month already but seems to prolong for more time since the chaos is only getting worse. Well.. my brother is a teacher and my parents own a small afterschool business in Korea as their only income source. Now they have no income out of no where with no warning they have no money to survive.. No money to buy groceries or masks which are only getting more and more expensive and their bills are hitting them left and right stacking up like crazy... It pains me to see them reusing disposable surgical masks which wouldnt do anything to protect them.. As I am the only one who live in the states Ive been sending them as much money as I can but its far from enough since I only make so much as Im new to the career.  We werent prepared for this.. This Coronavirus hit them with no warning.. Nobody saw this coming.. Can you imagine the whole family having no income or job out of no where especially during a disaster like this? Its so scary... I havent seen my family for 3 years and was planning on finally visiting them on May... I miss them so much but now thats my least concern. All I can think about all day is my familys survival back home... Please help them.. even if its not much every penny counts and your help will be very much appreciated regardless the amount. And most importantly please pray for them... every single prayer counts.. God bless you.

title: Reparto infettivi dellOspedale Maggiore di Parma
description: La vita si fa sentire forte quando non è piú al sicuro! Se potessi scegliere da chi farmi curare non avrei dubbi: in questo reparto deccellenza!Sono una ragazza di Parma che ha visto da vicino la grande competenza messa in atto nel reparto infettivi dellOspedale Maggiore di Parma.Mai come ora che la minaccia Coronavirus sta uccidendo anziani meritevoli di vivere al meglio ogni istante e sospendendo i progetti di tutti è fondamentale sostenere il SSN Sistema Sanitario Nazionale!In accordo con la dott.ssa Claudia Schianchi che seguí un mio familiare in questo reparto deccellenza ho ricevuto il C/C sui cui verrá fatto il versamento finale.Tutti uniti. Per tornare a vivere davvero!

title: Live Learning Through COVID-19
description: My daughter gave me an idea while quarantined due to COVID-19 to create a Live Streaming App platform dedicated to Learning. I would like to make this a reality!All she does currently is study study and study and many of her peers are doing exactly the same too!This Global crisis raised a huge problem and gap that I want to solve as she moves into her GCSE Exams year and A levels to follow.In a nutshell the app is designed by young pupils for young pupils with unique features for Live Innovative Uninterrupted Interaction. It hasnt got the noise and limitations that other contemporary live streaming apps have. Its literally a Students App for Learning Tutoring   Sharing!The App would focus on making it easier for pupils studying/learning together in a more interactive environment from the comfort of their home. The design of which we have wireframe sketches is specific for the needs of those Learning/Studying in a highly interactive way that no mobile app platform currently offer.The app will be FREE!Learners can study together and be tutored in a much more dedicated and interactive environment using all the unique features that will compliment this mobile application.Initially I would like to develop this mobile application for the Bedfordshire and Hertfordshire county as my daughters network spread across these 2 counties.However should this prove beneficial through popularity and testimonials that link to improved tests and exam results there is scope and a projected plan for scaling this to more counties nationally and even across Europe. With your help I can solve my daughter and her peers current problem and potentially help even more young pupils and tutors from the wider regions which could include your child or other relatives.We can do this!

title: Help Doctors and Nurses fighting Coronavirus
description: Dear friends as many of you know I am a doctor. [...] I have been working tirelessly day and night for the past two weeks alongside my colleagues at St. Anna hospital in Brescia. The hospital is full the intensive care unit is full. Every day we get more patients fighting Coronavirus but our resources are finished. I am not talking about face masks or hand gel. I am talking about oxygen and breathing machines for pneumonia and antiviral treatments.  [...] This means every day me and my colleagues have to choose. We choose who gets treatment and who just has to go home and wait. Like in wartime.This is part of a message shared by a friend at the forefront of the current outbreak in Lombardy Italy.  I am from a small town close to Brescia but I live in the UK. My whole family still lives there.I woke up last Sunday to the news that the whole region was quarantined. Nobody in nobody out.A couple of phone calls were enough for me to understand the severity of the situation and to feel the urge to help which is why I created this page.Over 5000 people tested positive to COVID-19 in the past two weeks in Italy including 10% of the health professionals who are working to contain the emergency.  In the most affected northern area 95% of the total intensive care beds are taken. More beds more medical equipment more medications are necessary to end this. The sooner this ends in Italy China and all worst-hit regions the smaller the chance the virus reaches your Country your City and your family. Please help with whatever you can today. All donations will go to Azienda Ospedaliera Spedali Civili di Brescia and will be used to purchase equipment and medications to treat COVID-19. Link below.  http://www.asst-spedalicivili.it/servizi/Menu/dinamica.aspx?idSezione=20471 idArea=20814 idCat=20474 ID=20474 TipoElemento=categoria    *Coronavirus is a global emergency and we can all contribute to contain it by following the suggested measures from the WHO ( https://www.who.int/emergencies/diseases/novel-coronavirus-2019  ) Thank you for your help   3#bettertogether

title: CORONAVIRUS CURE
description: Be part of ending the pandemic. To date the research has been primarily funded by government agencies for the treatment of Influenza coronavirus chikungunya and Venezuelan equine encephalitis virus. While great progress has been made due to this support additional urgent funds are needed to accelerate testing and development in order to prove its safety and efficacy in humans and ultimately bring it to the general population. This is a worldwide-problem needing the world to come together.  Anything helps! You could be next don’t regret not bringing the cure to families like yours and mine sooner.

title: EMERGENZA COVID-19 -METTITI NEI MIEI PANNI-SOCSER
description: Seregno Soccorso  è unAssociazione Volontaria di Pronto Soccorso e Pubblica Assistenza presente sul territorio della Brianza al servizio dei cittadini da oltre 25 anni. La nostra  attività  è da considerarsi  vitale  poiché avviciniamo ed aiutiamo le persone nei momenti più difficili della loro vita della malattia della vulnerabilità e del bisogno.   Ci viene richiesto un impegno continuo e rinnovarci costantemente è una necessità.  Sostenendo Seregno Soccorso potrete aiutarci ad acquistare materiale e altri presidi di tipo essenziale per limplementazione dei protocolli demergenza.   Ogni gesto  anche piccolo per noi  significa MOLTO!    Aiutaci a far del bene METTITI NEI NOSTRI PANNI !

title: COVID-19 Emergency in Parma
description: COVID-19  Emergency in Parma donations for Azienda Ospedaliera di Parma (Parma Hospital)   FOR ENGLISH PLEASE SEE BELOW  Ciao a tutti Sono Andrea parmigiano che vive in Olanda. Puoi trovare ulteriori informazioni su di me su  https://www.linkedin.com/in/andreamodenini/   Inutile dire che il Coronavirus (COVID-19) sta diventando unemergenza globale. A partire da ieri la mia cara Parma è entrata nella zona rossa. I miei genitori entrambi 60enni lavorano in ospedale e direttamente con pazienti affetti da Coronavirus. Ero senza parole quando mio padre mi disse per telefono:   Andrea in 35 anni di carriera non ho mai visto una cosa del genere. Non è una semplice influenza. Stiamo lavorando 12-14 ore al giorno 7 giorni su 7. Spero che usciremo da questa emergenza. Stiamo esaurendo il personale i letti per i pazienti e quantaltro.   e potete immaginare come ci si puo sentire impotenti a 1000 km di distanza. Ed è per questo che sono qui! Sto organizzando questa raccolta fondi per lOspedale di Parma appositamente per lemergenza Coronavirus ( https://www.ao.pr.it/chi-siamo/beneficenza/ ).  Gestirò tutti i documenti (in conformità con la legge) vi terrò aggiornatoie ovviamente una volta che avro raggiunto lobiettivo vi fornirò tutta la documentazione della donazione.   Se potete per favore aiutami in questa raccolta vi prego di donare e condividere con tutti i vostri contatti!   -------------------  ENGLISH  Hi all  Im Andrea an Italian from Parma living in Netherlands. You can find more about me on   https://www.linkedin.com/in/andreamodenini/    Needless to say that Coronavirus (COVID-19) is becoming a global emergency. Starting from yesterday my home city Parma entered in the red zone meaning no entry nor exit. My parents both 60 years old work at the Hospital and they are working directly in the division for treating patients affected by Coronavirus. I was speechless when my father told me with his own words by telephone the following:   Andrea in 35 years of career Ive never seen something like that.  Its not just a simple flu. Were working 12-14 hours/day 7/7. I hope were gonna get out of this emergency. Were running out of personnel beds for patients etc.   and you can imagine feeling 1000 km away powerless.  And thats why Im here! Im raising a funding for the Parma Hospital specifically for Coronavirus emergency (  https://www.ao.pr.it/chi-siamo/beneficenza/  ).  I will manage all the paperwork (in compliance to Italian law) keep you posted and obviously once reached the target I will provide proof of the donation.    If you could please help me in this please donate and share with all your contacts!

title: CRI Alte Groane: Aiutaci ad aiutare - Covid-19
description: La nostra storia in breve.   Il Comitato delle Alte Groane della Croce Rossa Italiana nasce nel 1984 come delegazione del Sottocomitato di Saronno e il suo territorio di competenza comprende i comuni di Lazzate (MB) Misinto (MB) Cogliate (MB) Ceriano Laghetto (MB) e Solaro (MI). La prima sede è messa a disposizione dal Comune di Misinto in Via Giuseppe Mazzini.  Anni di sacrifici portano allo sviluppo della Delegazione e alla concessione di utilizzo di una sede più ampia sempre da parte del Comune di Misinto situata in Via Domenico Padovan.  Nel 2003 viene istituito il Comitato Locale della Croce Rossa Italiana di Misinto del tutto indipendente e autonomo.  Pochi volontari molta buona volontà ed un notevole spirito di iniziativa caratterizzano il lavoro di questi anni.  Attività principalmente svolte durante i primi anni sono il servizio di continuità assistenziale ASL (Guardia Medica) ed il soccorso sanitario di Emergenza/Urgenza.  A Solaro comune in cui il Comitato dispone di una Sede distaccata peraltro anche attualmente è attivo il servizio di Emergenza/Urgenza con un’ambulanza a gettone che viene garantita sia nelle ore notturne che nei giorni festivi.  Con il passare degli anni il Comitato è cresciuto ha ampliato i propri settori di interesse svolgendo oltre allEmergenza/Urgenza anche molte altre attività tra cui:                    Servizi socio-assistenziali in convenzione con gli Enti Locali del territorio;                    Trasporto infermi;                    Distribuzione viveri CEE alla popolazione indigente;                    Protezione Civile;                    Assistenza ai senza fissa dimora;                    Attività formative ed educative per i giovani;                    Assistenza alle manifestazioni sportive  Per lo svolgimento delle attività il Comitato Locale si avvale da oltre un decennio di personale dipendente altamente qualificato e con grande esperienza e attualmente opera dal lunedì al sabato nelle ore diurne; si avvale poi della collaborazione di circa 170 volontari che tutti opportunamente formati e certificati nei giorni festivi e nelle ore notturne ( 20.00 – 06.00).  Il Comitato che ha successivamente assunto l’attuale denominazione ”Comitato delle Alte Groane” dal 2009 si è trasferito in un’ampia sede ubicata nel comune di Misinto in Via Guglielmo Marconi 15.    Aiutaci ad aiutare!   In questo momento di grande difficoltà in cui cerchiamo di essere sempre più vicini alla popolazione necessitiamo del Vostro supporto per continuare a svolgere il nostro servizio al meglio.  Raccogliamo quindi fondi per lacquisto dei D.P.I. (Dispositivi di Protezione Individuale) che verranno impiegati dal personale Volontario in ogni servizio.  La  Croce Rossa Italiana  è attiva su tutto il territorio nazionale per rispondere allemergenza Coronavirus fin dai primi momenti dellemergenza.   Croce Rossa Italiana  Comitato delle Alte Groane Tel. 02/96720990

title: CoronaVirus - Croce Rossa Italiana
description: Non abbiamo abbastanza posti letto in terapia intensiva.  Medici e operatori sono stremati per salvare le nostre vite e la Croce Rossa Italiana ha bisogno di soldi.   Abbiamo capito che non siamo immortali quindi oltre a rimanere in quarantena che tu sia di Milano o di Palermo oltre che adottare le misure  di sicurezza puoi fare la tua parte donando anche solo 10€ qualsiasi cifra ha valore.  Condividi la tua donazione non avere vergogna di chiedere soldi perchè lo stai facendo per una buona causa.  Tutto il ricavato andrà qui: IBAN: IT 77D 05696 01619 00000 3875X04 Beneficiario: Croce Rossa Italiana – Comitato di Milano Causale: Donazione Liberale  --  The target is challenging but together we can do it; we must help each other. We are thousands of people here can you imagine what we could achieve if everyone did their part?  Italy is affected by the coronavirus right now but it is a global issue. We are shaken and some still feel invincible but our Red Cross needs our help. They are working tirelessly to save our lives and we are ALL called to do our part.  Please donate €10. Share what you are doing and ask five of your friends to do the same. Share the donation link and raise awareness among those around you.  All the money will be transferred here: IBAN: IT 77D 05696 01619 00000 3875X04 Beneficiario: Croce Rossa Italiana – Comitato di Milano Causale: Donazione Liberale

title: COVID19 - DONARE KIT PER VALUTARE SIEROCONVERSIONE
description: È  disponibile un nuovo  test per la valutazione della sieroconversione nelle infezioni da COVID-19 .  Grazie allutilizzo di questo KIT in soli 10 minuti si potranno sapere informazioni importanti circa lo stato di salute del sistema immunitario del cittadino. Il progetto raccoglie fondi per acquistare KIT da donare alle strutture sanitarie e mezzi mobili di soccorso che in questo modo in pochissimo tempo potranno valutare la sieroconversione nelle infezioni da COVID-19.  La sieroconversione è il passaggio dallo stato di sieronegatività (assenza di anticorpi nel sangue) allo stato di sieropositività (presenza di anticorpi nel sangue). Quando un agente infettante esempio il COVID-19 penetra nellorganismo infatti vengono in genere prodotti anticorpi diretti contro di esso; ciò accade nel 70% circa dei soggetti quindi non in tutti.  La sieroconversione in generale NON avviene subito dopo lingresso dellagente infettante nellorganismo (momento del contagio in cui serve il test oggi in uso negli ospedali per il COVID-19 per fare la diagnosi se sei o non sei infettato dal Virus COVID-19) ma avviene a distanza di tempo (in cui serve il test per la rilevazione di anticorpi nel sangue ma dopo che sia trascorso un tempo sufficientemente lungo). Il test PCR oggi in uso negli ospedali sono test adeguati per la fase precoce dellinfezione (1-2 settimane dal contagio)  Il test anticorpale è un test adeguato per la valutazione della sieroconverisone da COVID-19 se cioè si sono sviluppati anticorpi adeguati anti-virus (  3 settimane dal contagio)  Il test si fa su una goccia di sangue come il test della glicemia per il diabete. Liniziativa è promossa da R4H dal Rotary Club ASSAGO Milanofiori da MEDnoTE s.r.l  da ULTRADENT inc. e da ARCO Onlus.  I primi KIT disponibili verranno donati a HSR e Humanitas.  R4H  è unassociazione senza scopo di lucro che si occupa di promuovere iniziative socialmente utili nel campo della salute prevenzione stili di vita ambiente.  sito WEB       Rotary Club ASSAGO Milanofiori è uno dei 49 Club del Distretto 2041 del Rotary International. Alcuni soci del Club sono anche soci fondatori di R4H    MEDnoTE s.r.l. è uno SPIN-OFF Universitario (UNI-TS) e START-UP innovativa e svolge prevalentemente attività di ricerca clinica e traslazionale (biologica applicata alla clinica). Il presidente di MEDnoTE è il prof. Daniele Generali    (f.f. Direttore di U.O. Multidisciplinare di Patologia Mammaria e Ricerca Traslazionale - ASST di Cremona) (Professore Associato in Oncologia Medica - Dipartimento Universitario Clinico di Scienze Mediche Chirurgiche e della Salute Università degli Studi di Trieste). sito istituzionale  R4H ha una partecipazione in MEDnoTE s.r.l.  sito WEB      ULTRADENT inc.  è unazienda SPONSOR   ARCO ONLUS è una Onlus impegnata nella raccolta fondi nellambito Oncologico    I fondi raccolti verranno spesi interamente per lacquisto dei Kit.
