title: Dogs Day Out Port Elliot cancelled (COVID-19)
description: Dogs Day Out event is a free fun family day out with furry friends.    Sadly we felt we had to cancel our 6th event on 15th March 2020 due   to the COVID-19 virus.   This means we wont raise the funds for the RSB Guide Dog Puppy Education program   as planned.  We felt cancelling was the socially responsible thing to do to help flatten the curve of    new COVID-9 cases in Australia so our health system will not  be overwhelmed.  Our community has a higher than average age group who are at risk.   Would you support our decision by helping us raise what we would have if the event  went ahead?    PROCEEDS TO RSB GUIDE DOG PUPPY EDUCATION PROGRAM Just $5

title: Croce Rossa Italiana Com. di Grandate - Covid-19
description: Croce Rossa Italiana Comitato di Grandate ha bisogno di te!   Questa campagna è a favore dell’acquisto di materiale sanitario per continuare a garantire i servizi sul territorio in risposta all’ emergenza Covid-19.   Aiutaci a sostenere anche con pochi euro l’ acquisto dei dispositivi  di protezione indispensabili per continuare lo svolgimento dei nostri servizi quali  mascherine monouso guanti monouso camici monouso  tute protettive monouso sanificanti per mezzi e ambienti e gel disinfettanti a base alcolica.    Dato il perdurare dell’emergenza il materiale sanitario a nostra disposizione diminuisce considerevolmente giorno dopo giorno.  E’ necessario reperire ed acquistare altri dispositivi di protezione indispensabili ai nostri operatori volontari e dipendenti per la tutela della loro incolumità personale quanto di quella dei pazienti.   Qualsiasi cifra vogliate donare sarà di grande AIUTO.   CON POCHI EURO POSSIAMO FARE LA DIFFERENZA.    Info Coronavirus

title: Lincolnshire’s poorly Children & COVID19
description: This is a very special plea in my role as Chair of Governors at  The Pilgrim School – the special schools that provide education to children in Lincolnshire age 4-16 who are too unwell to attend mainstream school – with an urgent special plea due to COVID-19.    The Pilgrim School has three bases serving the whole county in Lincoln Amber Hill and Louth and also an in-home service and we currently educate 150 children with a wide range of medical conditions from brains tumours to collapsed lungs. It is imperative that all schools are planning for COVID-19 however due to the additional vulnerabilities of the children we teach they really need your help now. Many of our students are having to self isolate and are not able to have home tutors visit nor come into one of the school’s bases.  We have a Virtual Learning Environment (online learning platform) that was due to be available for our students in September but our teachers have been working exceptionally hard to make it available as of now for the children to ensure that they will be able to access learning remotely.  And this is where they need your help.   We need urgent support through donations of laptops computers or tablets that can be able to gifted to the school or funds so we can buy them so that we are able to provide them to our children who don’t have devices at home.    Any additional funds will then be used to offer financial support to their families with the extraordinary pressures we anticipate for them due to COVID19.   Your help would be so very gratefully received and would enable the most vulnerable children in Lincolnshire to continue to learn and to access school all be it virtually.  If you’re able to share our plea with your friends colleagues or networks we’d also be incredibly grateful!  Please do let me know if you or others may be able to support them big or small every little really does helps.   Lizzie Jordan

title: Help Pomona students evicted during COVID-19
description: TLDR; EMERGENCY FUNDRAISING FOR EVICTED POMONA COLLEGE STUDENTS  Sign our Petition:  https://forms.gle/qgT2jzNrhAuCDZoQ9  Follow our Twitter:  https://twitter.com/OCCUPY_POMONA  TLDR; EMERGENCY FUNDRAISING FOR EVICTED POMONA COLLEGE STUDENTS ---- … Pomona FLI Scholars needs your support for Help Pomona students evicted during COVID-19   The GoFundMe will be used for: -Rent and subletting costs for students without a home -Food and basic necessities for students -Cleaning and sanitary supplies for students being displaced -Transportation to/from hospitals and medical expenses for displaced students in the case they become ill -Emergency storage for students finding a new living situation Thank you so SO much to everyone who has donated. We appreciate it more than you can understand.  ***Pomona College is currently asking people to donate to a fund through the college. This GoFundMe is completely separate from that and will go DIRECTLY to evicted students and students in need.***  The COVID-19 Pomona fund has been set up by the college for “student support and campus costs” such as reimbursements of room and board costs of flying students back to their home paying work study and staff as hours are cut etc. As a large majority of students have been denied permission to remain on campus we asked various deans during office hours whether this fund would be used to help homeless students or students with unlivable home conditions to pay for off-campus rent and subletting. One dean told us they “did not know what the fund was for” and three deans told us the fund will NOT be used to help students being displaced pay for their rent or off-campus living expenses now that they are being rejected housing at Pomona. It is clear that Pomona College does not have the intention of helping these students find or pay for housing with various deans telling students to just find family and friends to stay with or to “have a conversation” with family members in response to concerns about domestic abuse. Many students at Pomona College are homeless or cannot return to their permanent address and POMONA HAS FAILED TO PROVIDE HOUSING AND FUNDING for these students to have shelter. For this reason we have organized a direct fund that will go towards helping these students.  ----   Dear Community  As you may know COVID-19 has caused many universities around the country to shut down and send students home. For many First-Generation Low-Income international and homeless students as well as those who are survivors of domestic violence this is NOT a viable option. Initially Pomona admin seemed to understand these constraints and provided a petition for students who need to stay on campus for safety reasons. (Granted students were only given 250 characters to explain why leaving this campus would be detrimental to our mental physical and academic health). However it appears that the majority of these requests to stay on campus were denied. Those who were denied received a generic email and were told to give Dean Hinkston their phone number if they want more information.   TIMELINE  On Wednesday March 11th students were told that they are not to return to campus after spring break and were offered two links: one to petition to remain on campus and another to request funding for a flight home. Students were told to expect a response about staying on campus at noon on Friday March 13th. However responses were received intermittently throughout the day well past the deadline -- the majority of responses went out at 11:44 PM. Right now while there is no clear amount of acceptances or denials to remain on campus it seems that around two-thirds of students who applied were denied many of which who had the same reasoning as those who were allowed to stay (data found through a student poll) making the results and process arbitrary inconsistent and genuinely inequitable -- especially when campuses like Yale and Berkeley  -- and fellow consortium campuses such as Harvey Mudd -- are allowing any student the right to stay. Furthermore students who were told that their petition to stay on campus was approved were ALSO told that this decision is conditional and may be revoked. This commitment of support and understanding is representative of the diverse and equitable value these colleges have -- making Pomona’s decision that much more disappointing.    HOW CAN YOU HELP?  We are in need of both financial assistance and alumni advocacy. As members of the Pomona community as graduates we are accepting direct donations through a shared Venmo: POM-COVID19-1 POM-COVID19-2 POM-COVID19-3 POM-COVID19-4 (Please use any of the following Venmo Usernames -- there are four but all the resources will be pooled for the students being removed from campus).     If you have other ways to support us during these times (resources you know of recommendations for housing funding for storage and anything else that may seem helpful) please do not hesitate to email us.    Please think about what you would have done during these times -- think about the ways that we are continuously minoritized in this institution. Many if not most of us working to advocate for housing are students that have been denied housing and have nowhere else to go.    In solidarity   Occupy Pomona Team / Pomona College Equitable Housing Advocates

title: Fabián Carbone - Einnahmenausfall durch Corona
description: Fabián Carbone Signorelli  ist ein Bandoneonist aus Buenos Aires wohnhaft in Madrid. Als reinen Freelancer trifft ihn die Absage all seiner Konzerte darunter ein Festival bei dem er als künstlerische Leiter gleich mehrere Konzerte gespielt hätte besonders hart. Einen Teil der Konzerte hätte er mit mir im Duo in Deutschland und Belgien gepielt einen Teil in Spanien. Nun ist erstmal alles auf unbestimmte Zeit mindestens bis Mai 2020 abgesagt.   Ich ( Julia Carola Jech ) bin seit 2014 seine Duopartnerin. Ich organisiere unsere Konzerte außerhalb von Spanien. Während ich hier in Deutschland durch meine Verträge an Musikschulen abgefedert bin hängt Fabián komplett in der Luft und steht gänzlich ohne Einnahmen da. Damit Fabián über diese unkalkulierbare Zeit kommt möchte ich ihm gerne helfen zumindest die nötigsten Ausgaben seines Lebensunterhaltes bestreiten zu können. Ich gehe davon aus dass er frühestens im Juni wieder Konzerteinnahmen haben wird.  Und ich hoffe wir sehen uns bald wieder gesund und munter bei unseren Auftritten!    www.fabiancarbonejuliajech.com

title: Pandemia Corona Virus #nonlasciamoindietronessuno
description: Cliccate sul link qui sotto per sostenere gli ospedali piemontesi impegnati nel contrastare lepidemia da  Covid-19  un nome da film di fantascienza che trasmette limpotenza della modernità di fronte allessenza del morbo. La prima struttura che aiuteremo sarà il Nuovo Ospedale di Alba-Bra. Si tratta di un polo deccellenza. Lo abbiamo scelto perché è il nostro punto di riferimento e crediamo abbia bisogno di fondi per rafforzare la  terapia intensiva  e sub-intensiva e sostenere  medici e operatori sanitari . Una volta raggiunto questo obiettivo comunicheremo la prossima struttura sanitaria beneficiaria dei fondi raccolti.   Grazie e noi #nonlasciamoindietronessuno.

title: Coronavirus COVID-19 aiutiamo la sanità italiana
description: Raccolta fondi in favore della sanità pubblica italiana per emergenza coronavirus COVID-19I Gatti Randagi FC  di Barga (Lucca) organizzano una raccolta fondi tra i propri tesserati tifosi e simpatizzanti a favore della sanità pubblica italiana per lemergenza del coronavirus COVID-19. La somma raccolta sarà integrata da un contributo della società e sarà interamente devoluta.---Fundraising for the Italian public health service for the coronavirus emergency COVID-19Gatti Randagi FC  Barga (Lucca) is organizing a fundraiser among its members fans and follower in favor of the Italian public health service for the coronavirus COVID-19 emergency. The sum collected will be supplemented by a contribution from the club and will be entirely donated.

title: Corona Spendeaktion - Ricardo & Raquel
description: Ihr Lieben  als wir uns vor etwas mehr als 10 Jahren entschieden haben „Tango Argentino“ hauptberuflich auszuüben haben wir zwar Beinbrüche und Ähnliches nicht aber „Corona“ einkalkuliert… Gestern haben wir erfahren dass unser Unterrichtsraum im städtischen Bürgerhaus Stollwerck bis nach den Osterferien geschlossen ist… vielleicht auch länger…   Sprich bis auf Weiteres fällt sowohl unser regulärer Unterricht wie auch die Milonga La SuperClásica aus. Für Einzelunterricht könnt ihr uns gerne anfragen – wir haben einen kleinen Ersatzraum sowie Energie und Zeit…   In den letzten Jahren haben wir viele kleine YouTube Tutorials für euch gedreht – da kann man uns nebenbei beim Altern zuschauen ;-) Die Tango-Lehrvideos stehen euch frei zur Verfügung und vielleicht helfen sie ein wenig über den Tango-Unterrichts-Entzug hinweg:    https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCHlOM4NDAH0hHM3IyNyrnOA     Um die kommenden Wochen finanziell zu überstehen brauchen wir nun Eure Hilfe bzw. Eure Spende. Wir hoffen die „Tango-Quarantäne“ früher oder später „kreativ“ nutzten zu können… noch sind wir durch den Schock gelähmt… ruhig wird es hier zu Hause dennoch nicht… nebst unseren Töchtern werden ab Montag auch ein paar andere Grundschulkinder hier herumtoben…  Helft uns dass wir nach Corona unsere Tangoschule wiedereröffnen können! Herzlichen Dank  Ricardo und Raquel

title: Ospedale Civile Alghero - Covid-19
description: Fai sentire la tua vicinanza anche allospedale civile di Alghero dove medici e infermieri stanno lavorando per la comunità contrastando lemergenza Covid-19. Con una piccola donazione potrai dare un aiuto concreto ai nostri eroi che ogni giorno lottano per il nostro futuro!

title: Corona virus emergency supplies
description: We are trying to provide emergency food packs and electric and gas funds for elderly people and those with underlying health conditions.   We have partnered with Swan Minicabs to get the most vulnerable in the community emergency provisions while they self isolate.   We are also providing a contact number for anyone who is affected so there is someone there to speak to should they feel lonely.  It is important that we support the community as much as possible while this virus is affecting people.   We are taking all possible precautions not to spread the virus by wearing gloves and contacting the homes we will be supporting just before we arrive so that all support packs are delivered in the safest possible way.   We need tinned food packets of food microwave meals  personal care items.

title: Crofton Park and Honor Oak mutual aid (covid-19)
description: We are a local group of residents in Crofton Park (Lewisham) who are working together to help the local community through the Coronavirus/ covid-19 pandemic.  We need funding to pay for an ‘on call me mobile phone leaflet printing and other minor costs.     https://chat.whatsapp.com/BBw6zHu1G4ZG4F6jJ4njbf

title: CORONA & LA MILONGA VILLA KREUZBERG BERLIN
description: Leider werde ich meine Tangoveranstaltungen in der “La Milonga Villa Kreuzberg” und meine Unterrichtsaktivitäten unverzüglich absagen.  Schweren Herzens reagiere ich damit auf die gegenwärtige Situation in der ein kronenartiger Virus uns hinterhältig gesundheitlich schadet und uns aller sozialen Kontakte beraubt.  Ich zeige meine unbedingte Solidarität mit den bereits erkrankten Menschen Geschädigten und allen TänzerInnen ohne die ich niemals die Chance erhalten hätte meine Leidenschaft vor fast 30 Jahren zum Beruf zu machen.  Aber auch meine Solidarität mit allen betroffenen Veranstaltern DJs LehrerInnen die mutig und entschlossen zusammenhalten und die den Tango Argentino in Berlin weiterhin begleiten und fördern werden.  Da es mir derzeit unmöglich ist meine Tangos LIVE in der LA MILONGA VILLA KREUZBERG wie jeden Donnerstag aufzulegen werde ich es ab nächste Woche eben in einer virtuellen Milonga im Netz online streamen.   Bald wird jeden Donnerstag von 21h bis 2:30 h in der LA Milonga VILLA VIRTUAL Berlin  die Milonga ONLINE weiterleben bis dieses absurde Szenario ein Ende hat.   Bis dahin bitte ich Euch mich mit einer  LA MILONGA VIRTUAL Spende  zu unterstützen und mir dabei zu helfen die Villa auch nach diesen Krisenzeiten unbeschadet weiter zu betreiben.  Vielen Dank euer Felix Hahme.

title: Emergency Fund for Freelance Performers -Covid-19
description: Its hard not to be worried recently about the way Covid-19 is effecting so many people in so many ways and as a freelance performer   Stage Manager myself   most of my peers find ourselves in a position where we will likely lose ALL of our income due to cancelled gigs and performances during the next few months. I figured it was better to do something pragmatic to help others in similar situations rather than join the panic!! So I’ve set up the Emergency Fund for Freelance Performers aiming raise £10000 to cover hardship costs of other freelancers working in the Arts who have been affected by job cancellations insurance with no coverage health conditions no sick pay etc. So many artists performers and freelancers are the most vulnerable and underpaid with little protection. I’m gladdened to say that people have started to donate but the more we raise the more we can share with others in this time of uncertainty. I am eternally grateful for every ounce of generosity. So please continue to give so I can keep this growing. I’d like to see this spread as far as possible for as long as needed so please spread the word if you are able.. Sending love to everyone in this time of upheaval   chaos - stay safe wash your hands look out for and support each other

title: Wilton COVID-19 Support Network Fund
description: As some of us in Wilton face isolation over the next few weeks due to the COVID-19 pandemic community members have come together to provide a necessities collection/drop off service to those who need it. While this service is completely voluntary and free of charge the necessities themselves will need to be purchased. We assume younger people will have access to online payment platforms like PayPal but older residents may not have the same internet access or online payment options and those of us offering help may be unable to personally fund the food/medication purchases. Therefore any donation to this fund would be hugely appreciated. The money raised here will only be used to purchase essentials for those in isolation in Wilton over the coming weeks. Any money that is not used to help those in isolation will be donated to the Trussell Trust.  Thank you in advance for any help!

title: Aiutiamo lOspedale S. Maria delle Grazie Pozzuoli
description: Cari Concittadini è ormai evidente che siamo dinanzi ad una grave emergenza sanitaria economica e sociale. La storia però ci insegna che l’ora più buia in cui la solitudine e la rassegnazione sembra possano prendere il sopravvento è anche quella in cui bisogna stringere i denti e con la solidarietà vincere paura e individualismo: è in questo momento che bisogna fare rete sociale e mostrarsi Comunità.   Per tale motivo da ventenni napoletani abitanti dell’area flegrea sotto il nome di Discipuli Petronii “discepoli di Petronio” (per omaggiare il poeta latino che ambientò le avventure di due studenti squattrinati a Pozzuoli nel cuore dei Campi Flegrei) abbiamo deciso di lanciare questa campagna di CrowdFunding per sostenere l’ospedale Santa Maria delle Grazie.   Il reparto di terapia intensiva del nostro Ospedale ha solo dodici posti un numero forse carente anche in condizioni normali considerando la popolazione.   Oltre al potenziamento di tale reparto le donazioni serviranno anche all’acquisto di attrezzature e dispositivi di protezione individuale per chi come medici e personale sanitario sta combattendo in prima linea il virus.   Non è il momento delle analisi relative alle condizioni della nostra sanità né delle polemiche. È il momento di agire di fare la propria parte di dare cuore anima e corpo per uscire da questo momento tutti insieme.   C’è un pericolo di cui fino a qualche settimana fa nessuno aveva realmente coscienza. Il covid-2019 non è una banale influenza il covid-2019 uccide molto più dell’influenza. E non solo le persone che amiamo primi tra tutti i nostri nonni ma anche noi giovani.  È per questa ragione che in un momento storico come questo in cui siamo tutti in lotta con un nemico invisibile bisogna adottare misure straordinarie e dimostrare senso civico restando a casa.  Ma c’è anche un’altra cosa fondamentale che possiamo fare: aiutare il nostro Ospedale raccogliendo quanti più soldi possibile per l’acquisto di tutto ciò che occorre per salvare quante più vite possibile e non metterne a repentaglio altre.  Fino al 3 Aprile i BAR saranno chiusi mancano ancora 20 giorni questo significa niente caffè e cornetto la mattina. Se tutti noi donassimo 5 dei venti caffè risparmiati in questi giorni potremmo veramente fare la differenza mettendo le toppe ad una situazione di cui non siamo responsabili ma che ci riguarda tutti in prima persona. Per questo vi chiediamo di fare la vostra parte e di donare.  Per voi per le vostre famiglie per i vostri amici per tutti quelli che amate.  È molto importante anche condividere questo appello sui social dirlo a un amico mandarlo nel gruppo “Famiglia” su Whatsapp.   Uniti stando in casa possiamo farcela.  Matteo di Bonito Mario Galli

title: CRI Milano Est - Aiutaci ad aiutare - Covid19
description: In questa grave emergenza sanitaria anche i nostri  operatori  della  Croce Rossa Italiana di Peschiera Borromeo  sono impegnti a garantire il servizio di emergenza sanitaria a favore della comunità con la dedizione e lorgoglio che li contraddistinguono.  Durante lo svolgimento dei servizi il personale impiegato necessita di adeguate  protezioni individuali (DPI)  quali  camici tute mascherine occhiali e guanti.    Leccezionale utilizzo di questi dispositivi sta portando ad una rapido esaurimento delle scorte.   I costi di approvvigionamento  che dobbiamo affrontare per acquistare nuovo materiale sono decisamente importanti e abbiamo bisogno dellaiuto di tutti  per continuare il nostro operato.   Se volete contribuire allacquisto di questo materiale vi inviatiamo a effettuare una donazione al nostro Comitato.  Non servono grandi sforzi anche una  piccola  donazione per noi significa un  enorme  aiuto.  Noi non ci fermiamo mai Grazie di cuore ??

title: Croce Bianca Piacenza - Cacciamo il COVID19
description: CA  CCIAMO IL COVID19 da Piacenza   PA CROCE BIANCA PIACENZA    Cacciamo il COVID19 da Piacenza Dallinizio dell’emergenza Coronavirus che sta affliggendo l’Italia ed in modo particolare tutta la provincia di Piacenza alla PA Croce Bianca siamo attivi con equipaggi aggiuntivi rispetto alla quotidianità abituale. Il lavoro è molto duro ed oggi ci troviamo a dover fronteggiare anche spese impreviste per acquistare i dispositivi di protezione per i nostri volontari (mascherine camici guanti ecc.) sia sul mercato Nazionale che in quello Internazionale con costi molto elevati.  Vi chiediamo di fare una donazione a favore della PA Croce Bianca di Piacenza un piccolo aiuto per un grande lavoro.   Iban: IT22X0623012607000000951504  presso CREDIT AGRICOLE AG. D – PIACENZA Italia   Causale: Cacciamo il COVID19 da Piacenza #ilvolontariatononsiferma

title: Aiutiamo il Policlinico di Monza- Covid19
description: Ciao a tutti  come tanti altri ospedali anche il piccolo Policlinico di Monza sta affrontando questa emergenza. La terapia conta solo 16 posti letto quindi si stanno smantellando tutti i reparti per poter ospitare SOLO pazienti Covid. Il Policlinico sta ospitando (come altri ospedali) i pazienti Covid che arrivano da Bergamo dove sono in enorme difficoltà. Tutto il personale ospedaliero sta mettendo anima e corpo per garantire aiuto a tutti; la nostra parte (oltre a stare a casa per non aggravare ancora di più questa situazione) è quella di condividere il più possibile e per chi può donare. Anche solo 5 euro fanno la differenza!  Sono in contatto con lAmministrazione del Policlinico e lIBAN ufficiale per le donazioni è:  IT31S0569620400000003541X95  Per qualsiasi dubbio o richiesta di informazioni ufficiali potete scrivermi nei Direct dei Social o contattarmi per email a questo indirizzo:  debohprencipe@outlook.it   Vi copio qui il link dei contatti del Policlinico in caso in cui volete assicurarvi che sia una richiesta fondi reale:  https://www.policlinicodimonza.it/contatti   Basta poco da tutti noi per fare la differenza anche qui.   Grazie mille Deborah

title: Seniors Corona Support
description: Want to join me in making a difference? TAG  The Transportation Association of Greenwich Inc provides transportation for the elderly disabled and transportation disadvantaged individuals within the Town of Greenwich CT and the surrounding communities.   We are extending our services to help residents who are homebound during the Corona Virus emergency by delivering food and bringing seniors to critical appointments.  Please help us by donating to keep this service alive and help our neighbors in need.

title: Togliamo la corona al virus!
description: Che dire.. Il nostro intento è espresso in maniera forte e chiara nel nome della nostra campagna.. TOGLIAMO LA CORONA AL VIRUS!!  Siamo un gruppo di colleghi di unattività commerciale di Lecco consapevoli e convinti che in questo momento dobbiamo essere più uniti solidadi e compatti per sconfiggerlo e tornare più forti di prima!  Abbiamo deciso di donare a favore della regione Lombardia che risulta essere il territorio più colpito ma in questo momento speriamo che ognuno faccia la propria parte perchè anche se distanti vogliamo restare uniti!  #iorestoacasa #unpezzodinoi

title: COVID-19: SOMA Senior Support Fund
description: South Orange and Maplewood announce the COVID-19: SOMA Senior Support Fund   As our community takes necessary precautions to prevent the spread of the coronavirus we want to take special steps to support some of our older residents. Our older South Orange and Maplewood residents are the  most vulnerable to this disease  . In addition the many recent cancellations of activities and programs are meant to provide protections but this can also mean that our seniors are without the services they need including food shopping transportation and medication. We are also developing initiatives to address social isolation in a meaningful way such a “phone a friend”.   With your help we will be providing our SOMA seniors with financial and logistical assistance as we navigate this uncertain and evolving situation. A donation of any amount is greatly appreciated.    To help us get the word out please share the link to your Facebook or Instagram posts.    COVID-19: Senior Support Fund is a joint initiative undertaken by  South Orange Village   and  Maplewood Township   and administered by  SOMA Two Towns for All Ages  .  A special thanks to the Jewish Community Housing Corporation for their partnership in providing logistical assistance in launching an online fundraiser.

title: Insieme si può ! Emergenza Corona Virus
description: La Croce Verde nasce il 1º ottobre 1903 per iniziativa di un gruppo di lavoratori artigiani e commercianti sestresi. Nei suoi 116 anni di esistenza la Croce Verde è stata protagonista della storia di Sestri Ponente. Ha vissuto gli anni terribili delle guerre mondiali non si è arresa al fascismo; i suoi volontari hanno partecipato attivamente a tutti i momenti salienti del secolo passato e di quello presente ultima tra tutti l’emergenza che ci ha toccato da vicino il crollo di Ponte Morandi. Ogni giorno i suoi volontari e dipendenti si mettono in gioco sono pronti ad aiutare il prossimo ad essere vicini alla cittadinanza e a proteggerla.  L’emergenza sanitaria che stiamo oggi vivendo coinvolge tutti noi cittadini. Combatterla si può tutti insieme. Noi ci impegniamo come ogni giorno a proteggervi ma per farlo abbiamo bisogno del vostro aiuto. Per proteggerVI e proteggerCI nel migliore dei modi abbiamo bisogno dei corretti dispositivi da indossare quali mascherine con filtro occhiali e tute protettive dei detersivi per sanificare i mezzi dopo gli interventi oltre che dei detergenti per le mani dei nostri volontari. Uniti possiamo arrivare lontano. Grazie

title: Haus der Sinne unterstützen im Corona-Shut down
description: Unterstützung in Zeiten des Corona-Virus:   Liebe Freunde vom Haus der Sinne  mit den Einnahmen aus Konzerten Tanzveranstaltungen Open-Stage-Abenden und Theaterprojekten finanzieren wir neben notwendigen Fixkosten vor allem Künstler und einen Ort an dem Bands Theater- und Tanzgruppen sowie einzelne Künstler und Kulturschaffende ohne Miete zahlen zu müssen proben trainieren und sich künstlerisch entfalten können. Wir glauben daran dass es mehr als wichtig ist solche Freiräume zu schaffen und zu erhalten. Gleichzeitig lieben wir das was wir tun...Musik und Kultur jenseits des Mainstream oder einer bestimmten Szene die Tangotänzer schlurfen über den Glitter der Dragqueens vom Vorabend - es geht alle unter einem Dach! Und so wie die vielfältigen Künstler und Gäste ist auch das Haus der Sinne-Team ein bunter Haufen aus Idealisten und Illusionisten der mit viel Kraft diesen freigeistigen Ort am Leben erhält.  Der shut down der Berliner Kultur aufgrund des Corona-Virus trifft uns als Verein der das Haus der Sinne betreibt und unsere Künstler hart finanziell und ideell. Der Ort der uns am Herzen liegt muss nun geschlossen bleiben.   Einen Teil deiner Spende werden wir direkt an unsere Künstler Sänger Musiker DJs Bands und Chöre die jetzt nicht mehr auftreten können aber überwiegend auf jeden einzelnen Auftritt angewiesen sind weitergeben. Von deren Vielfalt und Engagement lebt das Haus der Sinne daher möchten wir sie gerne beteiligen. Der andere Teil deiner Spende wird genutzt um das Haus der Sinne über den Zeitraum des shut downs wo wir ohne Einnahmen sind am Leben zu erhalten. Unkosten haben wir weiterhin. Mit den Spendeneinnahmen können wir diese - auch ohne Einnahmen aus Veranstaltungen - begleichen und dann hoffentlich nach der Corona-Krise weitestgehend unbeschadet weitermachen. Dadurch können wir außerdem Theater- und Tanzgruppen sowie einzelnen Kulturschaffenden die Möglichkeit geben den Ort kostenfrei auch während des shut downs zum Proben zu nutzen. Damit du weißt was mit deinem Geld passiert werden wir die Zahlen veröffentlichen.  Wir nehmen die Corona-Krise ernst die Gesundheit unserer Gäste ist uns wichtig daher finden in den nächsten Wochen keine Veranstaltungen statt. Damit es aber irgendwann weiter gehen kann sind wir dankbar für jede Spende.  Wenn du uns anderweitig unterstützen möchtest kannst du das gerne tun. Sprich uns einfach an.  Herzlichst das Haus der Sinne-Team Juliane Hanisch-Berndt (Vorstandsmitglied des Vereins)

title: CRI San Donà di Piave - Emergenza COVID19
description: CROCE ROSSA ITALIANA  A neanche due anni dalla sua nascita il  Comitato di San Donà di Piave  si vede coinvolto nellemergenza Coronavirus insieme ai suoi Volontari. I casi di presunto o effettivo contagio da COVID19 sono sempre maggiori ma  grazie ai Volontari sempre in prima linea  ci stiamo prodigando per continuare a garantire il servizio con continuità. Per riuscire a dare risposta allemergenza sanitaria dovuta al COVID-19 siamo scesi in prima linea fornendo  supporto alla CO 118   controlli contagi negli aeroporti  e  supporto con consegna beni di prima necessità a domicilio . Per riuscire a rispondere efficacemente alle richieste è sempre più forte la necessità di dispositivi di protezione individuale (DPI)  senza i quali i Volontari non possono più   svolgere i propri servizi in sicurezza  e riuscire a reperire i prodotti sta diventando sempre più complicato (mascherine specifiche FFP2 FFP3 con filtro mascherine chirurgiche tute protettive tipologia III calzari gel igienizzanti per le mani e igienizzanti per i nostri mezzi ) Con questa raccolta fondi  acquisteremo tutto loccorrente per garantire assistenza ai nostri 10 comuni  anche tramite la consegna di spesa a domicilio e la consegna dei farmaci per chiunque ne abbia necessità. Questo ci permette inoltre di continuare a garantire anche il nostro servizio di  Mensa Solidale  che non si è fermata in questo periodo di forte crisi anzi ha saputo adattarsi e dare continuità al servizio ora in modalità asporto garantendo il pasto caldo ai bisognosi e ai senza fissa dimora del nostro territorio.

title: San Marco combatte il COVID-19
description: Il  Forum di San Marco dei Cavoti  è unassociazione giovanile che vuole dare un  contributo  al proprio  territorio  nella lotta al  C  oronavirus (COVID-19)  sostenendo  Ospedale San Pio di Benevento .  Un  particolare ringraziamento  va a tutti gli uomini e le donne che quotidianamente sono in prima linea nella lotta al Coronavirus.   #tuttiuniticelafaremo   #rispettiamoleregole   #stiamodistantioggiperabbracciarciconpiùcaloredomani   #RialzatiItalia

title: Leytonstone Covid-19 mutual aid
description: In response to the Governments action on Covid-19 and in light of the fact that we know there will be isolated people who need assistance there is a group set up for Leytonstone ward to collect food shopping etc and drop it off on doorsteps for people in need. In order to be able to do this we need some funds to be able to get going. We are not taking any money or other form of payment for our assistance we are just a group of concerned local people who have decided to fill in the gaps in the current government response to make sure our sick and vulnerable are as well looked after as possible.   All money raised will go to buying food and supplies for people in isolation with any remaining funds after the pandemic is over going to a local food bank.

title: #helpinghands
description: PLEASE JOIN (VIRTUAL) HANDS WITH US TO SUPPORT PEOPLE IN THE UK WHO CAN’T AFFORD TO KEEP THEMSELVES AND THEIR FAMILIES AS SAFE FROM CORONAVIRUS (COVID-19) AS OTHERS.  Every moment matters. As the virus spreads in the UK people living in poverty are among the most vulnerable to the worst outcomes of the virus because they:    - Can’t afford basic hygiene essentials like hand wash soap and hand sanitiser that will help protect them from infection.  - Can’t afford to stockpile essential everyday items  - Rely on food banks for their basic hygiene essentials and due to public stockpiling food banks’ supplies are dwindling fast   - Live or stay in crowded environments like homeless shelters refuges and safe-houses  - Live in densely populated areas  - Work in low-income jobs in highly populated public spaces  - Don’t have a home to live in  Beauty Banks the people-powered movement that supports people living in hygiene poverty in the UK has joined (virtual) hands with crowd-funding platform GoFundMe to support those who can’t afford to take extra precautions to help keep them safe from what has been labelled ‘the worst public health crisis for a generation’ coronavirus (COVID-19).   Your support will help us to provide emergency hygiene parcels that will help protect those at higher risk and more vulnerable to being infected by the virus.     YOUR DONATION WILL BE SPENT ON:  - SOAP (adult   baby) - BODYWASH - HANDWASH - HAND SANTISER - LAUNDRY DETERGENT  All donations will be shared with Beauty Banks’ UK registered charity partners that include food banks homeless shelters domestic abuse refuges youth centres NHS trusts and refugee centres across the UK.   We have two hands - one to help ourselves and one to help others. Please donate today.

title: COVID-19 -TENDA PNEUMATICA per Emergenza Sanitaria
description: Il MODAVI Protezione Civile organizzazione nazionale fondata nel 1996 che collabora con il Dipartimento Nazionale di Protezione Civile dal 2004 presente in diverse regioni italiane a seguito dellemergenza sanitaria in atto in Italia ha deciso di attivare una raccolta fondi  per mettere immediatamente a disposizione delle strutture sanitarie della regione Abruzzo impegnate nella lotta al COVID-19 una tenda pneumatica da dedicare a struttura sanitaria di primo soccorso ma che possa essere facilmente e rapidamente convertita in struttura di accoglienza per persone malate o per specifiche esigenze delle strutture sanitarie.  Il nostro obiettivo è raccogliere 43.50000 € cifra che permette lacquisto di due strutture collegabili tra di loro e lattrezzatura minima per la messa in esercizio delle tende. Tutto il raccolto oltre la cifra sarà sempre destinato allacquisto di ulteriori attrezzature sanitarie a corredo delle tende pneumatiche.

title: Emergenza Coronavirus: Noi ci siamo... e Tu?
description: Croce Azzurra Belgioioso è parte integrante del sistema che si sta occupando dellemergenza Covid-19 specie nel soccorso e trasporto dei pazienti affetti che necessitano di cure ospedaliere. Per poter gestire la situazione di emergenza senza correre il rischio di contagiarci a nostra volta (con ovvie ripercussioni non solo personali e familiari ma su tutto il sistema) abbiamo necessità di Dispositivi di Protezione Individuale che ci tutelino. I casi sono molti nonché in aumento... e le nostre risorse potrebbero non essere sufficienti a garantire il necessario approvvigionamento di DPI per tutta la durata dellemergenza. Fai anche tu la tua parte: stai a casa e se puoi dona! Aiutaci ad aiutare!

title: AMOR Community COVID19 Support
description: We are raising funds to support the AMOR community during this time.  We know that the COVID19/coronavirus pandemic will have a disproportionate impact on our community members that are already the most marginalized including people who are in prison and detention centers undocumented people refuggee houseless people elders domestic workers day laborers gig workers and people with chronic illness.  We are raising funds to support our community and are currently organizing our response to make sure that we are there for as many in our network as possible.  Funds will be used to purchase necessary items like cleaning supplies hand soap formula etc as well as to offer financial support for childcare housing and other basic needs that people will struggle with because of inability to work due to sickness quarantine or workplaces shutting down.    Were using this money both to cover expense for people in need AND to purchase supplies in bulk.  We hope you are taking care and staying well and staying connected-- we are all in this together.

title: Food for Cottage Grove Homeless Kids (COVID-19)
description: We need your help.  Two hundred and fifty one South Lane School District students are experiencing homelessness this school year. 251. Many of them struggle to eat.    Today times are extra hard -- we are in the midst of a global pandemic.  We are trying our best to slow the spread of the coronavirus. Our school district is closed. Employers are cutting hours or closing altogether. We are practicing social distancing. We are buying basic necessities like toilet paper and food.    But some students and families dont have these luxuries.  They dont have savings to live off while work is closed. They dont have a home to hunker down in. They dont have the funds to stock up on food.    Thats why we started this campaign.  Because together we can help.    Our goal is to provide a $50 emergency grocery gift card to every one of the 251 homeless students in SLSD.  Thats $12550. If we blow our goal out of the water well increase the amount we give to each student.   We realize this is a BIG goal.  But the Cottage Grove community is generous and we get great joy from caring for our own.    We can do this.  No gift is too big or too small.   On behalf of the recipient students and families  THANK YOU!    - SLSD McKinney-Vento Program      ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------   Questions:     Q: How long is this fundraiser open?   A: Until April 1st the date SLSD is scheduled to reopen.    Q: What if you dont reach your goal?  A: We can and we will.  A2: But if we do fall short of our goal we will prioritize gift cards to the most vulnerable students. The more donations we receive the further we can reach into our community and the more students we can help.   Q: How will you get the grocery cards to students?  A: SLSDs McKinney-Vento Liaison will deliver the gift cards to the right students/families.    Q: Do you need any help?  A: Yes. Our next step involves trying to leverage this money for discounted grocery cards. Please contact us if you have connections with Cottage Grove Grocery Outlet Safeway or Walmart.   Q: Who is coordinating this fundraiser?   A: SLSDs McKinney-Vento Liaison who works with all of SLSDs homeless students and families. This is not an official South Lane School District fundraiser.    Q: Whats the McKinney-Vento Program?   A: Visit the SLSD website for more information:  http://bit.ly/slsdmvprogram

title: Monticello per COVID-19 #andràtuttobene
description: Il  Rione Monticello  di Gallicano ha deciso di creare questo gofoundme per incentivare ed agevolare la comunità che ha piacere di fare una donazione allospedale di Castelnuovo di Garf. e di Lucca per lacquisto di materiale medico/sanitario necessario a fronteggiare l’emergenza COVID-19.  Con un piccolo gesto si può fare tanto per tutti!    # andràtuttobene  # forzalotta

title: Nothilfe für Prostituierte wg Corona
description: Liebe(r) Leser*in Ich möchte dich auf ein dringendes Problem hinweisen. In Gemeinden verschiedener Bundesländer gibt es aufgrund von Corona ein Prostitutionsverbot (zB. Mannheim Karlsruhe Kassel Berlin Saarland) . Das bedeutet dass Prostituierte von heute auf morgen keine Dienste mehr anbieten dürfen wenn doch müssen sie Zwangsgeld zahlen.  Die meisten Prostituierten tun dies aus Armut und mangelnder Perspektive und sind mehrheitlich Migrant*innen aus ärmeren Ländern.  Vanessa und Diana sind 2 Prostituierte die in Hessen und in Baden Württemberg tätig waren. Vanessa ist aus Brasilien und Diana aus Bulgarien. Prostitution war nie ein Traumjob für sie. Sie arbeiten seit Jahren in diesem Beruf weil sie keine andere Wahl hatten und hoffen dass sie irgendwann einmal aussteigen können und tun können was ihnen Freude bereitet. Sie sind beide aktuell in Mannheim in einem Erotik Studio tätig was ab sofort bis mindestens Ende April nicht in Betrieb sein darf.  Das Prostitutionsverbot kam viel zu plötzlich für beide der Coronavirus war natürlich nicht vorher zu sehen. Die Frauen stehen nun ohne Ersparnisse da (wann immer etwas Geld da war haben sie es ihren Familien in die Heimat geschickt) und machen sich Sorgen wie sie nun die laufenden Kosten decken können. Für den Monat April  müssten insbesondere die Mieten und Krankenversicherung bezahlt werden. Dazu etwas Geld zum Essen.  Vanessa überlegt wieder in ihren alten Job als Altenpflegerin einzusteigen aber sie könnte  wohl frühestens zum 15. April anfangen. Diana weiß noch gar nicht wie es weiter geht und möchte sich erst einmal  beraten lassen.  Beide sind nicht Anspruchsberechtigt für Hartz4 da sie nicht lang genug in Deutschland gelebt haben.  Wir hoffen dass die Frauen durch Spenden ihre dringenden Kosten der nächsten Wochen decken können bis sie wieder andere Einnahmen haben.  Miete KV und Geld zum Essen sind etwa 750 Euro pro Person für beide zusammen 1500 Euro. Wir haben diese Fundme Seite errichtet um Mitmenschen um Solidarität für diese Frauen in Notlage zu bitten. Ich selbst bin eine deutsche Freundin die den Text für die beiden schreibt da sie nicht so gut deutsch sprechen können.  Wir würden uns zwischendurch melden und Bescheid geben ob und wieviel Geld eingegangen ist.  Gern beantworte ich auch Fragen. Fotos möchten die Frauen nicht von sich hier posten da sie nicht als Prostituierte geoutet werden möchten.  Wir danken jetzt bereits für eure Hilfsbereitschaft.

title: Covid-19 un aiuto per il basso Lazio.
description: 4Graph da Spigno Saturnia lancia una raccolta fondi per aiutare gli ospedali di Formia e Latina a fronteggiare lepidemia di Coronavirus. #RESisTIAMOITALIANI a partire dal territorio in cui viviamo e lavoriamo.

title: Husband got laid off due to COVID-19
description: My husband was laid off from his full time job due to COVID-19. He has a part time job as an advanced emt on the ambulance however that job doesnt even pay half of what he was making.  He is picking up available shifts but that wont cover what we need.  Many people know we have horrible insurance and a lot of medical debt and two special needs kids that have different therapies. Were trying our best to make it through this rough patch.  Thanks so much to my friend for pushing me to ask for help. Its very hard to do. We are located in salt lake city Utah  USA

title: COVID-19 Relief Fund
description: Coronavirus disease 2019 is a new disease that causes respiratory illness in people and can spread from person to person. This virus was first identified during an investigation into an outbreak in Wuhan China (CDC).  During this stressful unprecedented time there are many families and individuals left in need as schools businesses and government services begin to shut down. Children are going without lunch students are stuck trying to get home small businesses are struggling and people are worrying about getting sick and being unable to work among many other struggles people are facing right now.  This is a general fund that will be allocated to families/individuals who are in great need right now. In a time such as this it is important to remember that we are all members of a larger community and it is still our responsibility to look out for each other. We greatly appreciate ANY AND ALL donations made at this time because it shows the positivity and light we can still find in humanity. Even if its $2 or $5 giving back to those in need is an excellent gesture in supporting the greater good of this country and this world as a whole.  Love and light to all Kassie Dunaj and Zoë Neugebohr

title: Aiutiamo le ASP del Sud-Est Sicilia vs Covid-19
description: AIUTIAMO LE ASP DEL SUD-EST SICILIA   UNITI VS EMERGENZA CORONAVIRUS   Non è tempo di egoismi ma di donare per la Vita!   La  solidarietà è larma più efficace contro il Covid-19 : basta un piccolo gesto per tutelare la salute e sostenere le strutture ed il personale sanitario impiegato in questa terribile battaglia.  Le donazioni saranno convogliate in misura eguale verso larea del Sud-Est al fine di permettere che la rete sanitaria sud orientale della Sicilia sia sostenuta in questa fase di emergenza: • ASP 7 Ragusa • ASP 2 Caltanissetta  • ASP 8 Siracusa  • ASP 3 Catania • ASP 1 Agrigento  L obiettivo   pertanto è quello di   supportare il Sud-Est Siciliano   nellacquisto di attrezzature dispositivi e di tutti i mezzi utili contro il Covid-19.    Donare è un atto di responsabilità nei confronti della comunità nonché di rispetto per le categorie più fragili che hanno necessità di assistenza e di cure soprattutto in una terra in cui la sanità risulta depotenziata di posti letto e strutture adeguate.   Fai la tua parte e sostieni le ASP del Sud-Est Siciliano contro il Covid-19!

title: DeWolff vs. Corona
description: Watch our free streaming concert with the Grand East here:  https://www.facebook.com/dewolfficial/videos/243211650172646/  0:00 The Grand East 56:30 DeWolff   Our story:  We just released our new album Tascam Tapes which we were about to promote on a tour through Europe. We dont make a lot of money from album sales; touring is our most important source of income. Most of the money we make we invest in more touring the recording of new albums paying our crew and yes we ourselves also have to earn a little money so we dont have  to work at McDonalds on the side.  We embarked on our new tour to promote the Tascam Tapes on March the 8th. After our first show in Prague Czech all of the other shows of this tour started being cancelled one by one. Budapest Vienna Graz... We drove to all these places but all to no avail: due to the Corona virus all of these shows got cancelled. Now all of our shows until the 1st of April are cancelled for sure and theres a big chance that our whole tour in April also gets cancelled. If this happens it will be disastrous for us: we will be broke.   Its only money; we understand theres people in the world that are in situations that are waaaay worse. But its aways good to help each other out in situations like these. We normally never do this kind of thing but given the situation were in we see no other option than asking for your help.  Were played a live streaming concert with the Grand East on 14th of March that you can watch for free here   https://www.facebook.com/dewolfficial/videos/243211650172646/   . If you like it a whole lot please consider making a voluntary donation so we can keep on bringing you new music and joy and good times even in these uncertain times!

title: COVID-19 Assistance Fund for Roaring Fork Valley
description: We know there is a lot of uncertainty right now when it comes to what is happening worldwide and locally. Many families and friends in our community depend on local businesses for their livelihood (food shelter medicine).  Some of our local children depend on school lunches that will not be provided over the next several weeks.  Please donate even the smallest amount will help so we can keep our locals fed and safe.

title: Feed hungry at-risk New Yorkers during COVID-19
description: I run a company called FoodtoEat - we partner with immigrant women and minority-owned restaurants in NYC and book catering jobs for them at corporate offices like Warby Parker The Skimm and Microsoft.  With everyone working from home during the COVID-19 pandemic our business - and by extension our restaurant partners - are taking a huge hit. No one in the office means no orders and no revenue.   OUR ASK   We are asking for individuals to either place large orders through us or for people to donate directly to us via GoFundMe. In return well place orders with our restaurant partners and donate ALL FOOD to shelters and food banks in NYC - the institutions serving the most vulnerable folks during this unprecedented time.   YOUR IMPACT   Every donation / order directly impacts three separate constituencies: 1) underserved vulnerable individuals; 2) our restaurant partners; and 3) my business FoodToEat.  With folks (rightly) working from home restaurants across the U.S. are seeing 50-90% declines in business forcing many to already shutter their doors for good. Were trying to help the food community - which touches every corner of our lives - survive these trying times.  Your contribution will directly help them offset the declines theyre seeing in their core business while also nourishing the life of someone else in need.  As a for-profit business these donations are not tax deductible  Thank you!

title: At Cost Meals For San Francisco  During Covid19
description: Bistro SF Grill at 1305 Castro St is fundraising to help provide at cost meals for the community. Starting March 17th at 11am people will be able to stop in and pick up boxed meals for $5.50.  (around the cost of a coffee in SF). The business will not profit from this service.   Vegan fish and chicken options will be on offer. All meals  are gluten free. Your donation will help us to provide meals for Covid-19 affected families and individuals.  Bistro SF Grill was started nine years ago by Seni and Hasim. They are doing this to help those who need it during this time. ??

title: 100.000 maaltijden voor ouderen in CORONA CRISIS
description: Met de donaties willen wij met deze coronavirus actie het nodige inkopen zo als verpakkingsmaterialen ingrediënten  en het inhuren van de nodige ruimtes en materialen zo dat wij uit eindelijk 100 duizend diepvries maaltijden kunnen bereiden en het kunnen afleveren bij de kwetsbare ouderen.DEN HAAG - Honderdduizend maaltijden om duizend kwetsbare ouderen vijftien weken lang van een maaltijd te voorzien voor het geval dat Nederland op slot gaat vanwege het coronavirus. Hagenaar Ben Lachhab is druk met het uitwerken van zijn plan. We moeten nu bewijzen dat we er als maatschappij voor elkaar zijn.Lachhab is sinds vorige week serieus aan de slag met zijn plan om kwetsbare ouderen van maaltijden te voorzien mocht Nederland in een lockdown gaan. De Hagenaar denkt dat het moment dat Nederlanders alleen nog de deur uit mogen om naar de supermarkt te gaan niet ver weg meer is. Ik zie ouderen die moeilijk ter been zijn niet uren in de rij voor de supermarkt staan. Voor deze groep moet er een oplossing komen.Het plan van Lachhab is gigantisch: honderdduizend ingevroren maaltijden moeten duizend kwetsbare ouderen in de Haagse regio vijftien dagen lang van een dagelijkse maaltijd voorzien. De voorbereidingen zijn in volle gang. Ik ben met verschillende partijen in gesprek. Maandag staat een overleg met de gemeente Den Haag gepland. Samen met een chef-kok ben ik op dit moment aan het inventariseren wat het meest praktische is om te bereiden en in te vriezen. Met een partner uit het bedrijfsleven zoek ik uit of medewerkers die niet meer op kantoor werken ingezet kunnen worden.Enorme uitdagingEen locatie om al die maaltijden te bereiden heeft Lachhab ook al op het oog met dank aan de maatregel om evenementen met meer dan 100 man te verbieden. Hierdoor heeft het World Forum zijn evenementen geannuleerd en kan Lachhab mogelijk gebruik maken van de keuken. Ook heeft hij contact met de RAI in Amsterdam om daar in de keuken maaltijden te bereiden.Lachhab beseft dat het invriezen van honderdduizend maaltijden een enorme uitdaging is. Ik ben nu het volledige logistieke plan aan het uitwerken maar we kunnen niet te lang wachten want als het virus doorzet zijn we te laat.Ouderen onrustigDoor zijn werk als manager van een Van Harte Restaurant - waar eenzame ouderen een maaltijd kunnen eten - merkt hij dat het virus de ouderen enorm bezighoudt. Ik merk dat ze onrustig zijn. Ze zijn al zo kwetsbaar op veel manieren en vaak eenzaam. Wanneer het voor deze groep niet meer lukt om voor zichzelf zorgen en ze niemand hebben die dit voor hen kan doen dan kunnen wij hier een begin mee maken.  https://www.omroepwest.nl/nieuws/4011604/Hagenaar-wil-tijdens-coronacrisis-100-000-maaltijden-invriezen-voor-ouderen

title: Covid-19 ROMA
description: Raccolta fondi a favore dell’Istituto Nazionale di Malattie Infettive Lazzaro Spallanzani.   In questo periodo di emergenza è necessario la partecipazione di tutti quanti.  Si è creata questa raccolta fondi affinché si possa dare un contributo a contrastare l’espansione del virus e donare il ricavato all’Istituto Spallanzani per dimostrare il nostro senso di comunità verso la nostra città e verso i nostri concittadini. La raccolta fondi è un esempio di unione  che ci permette di abbracciarsi anche se siamo lontani.  Dobbiamo agire con gli stessi mezzi con cui si muove il virus.  Contagiamoci di solidarietà  come non abbiamo mai fatto e vinciamo questa battaglia. Lo si fa per Roma per l’Italia e per il benessere umano futuro. Se non puoi donare condividi questa raccolta fondi così da permettere agli altri di promuoverla.   GRAZIE

title: Un Respiro per Olbia - Emergenza COVID19
description: Tutta lItalia sta attraversando una fase drammatica da un punto di vista sanitario sociale ed economico. A seguito di contatto con il direttivo dellospedale Giovanni Paolo II di Olbia in Sardegna abbiamo constatato che ha pochissimi ventilatori per poter affrontare lemergenza COVID-19.  Siamo molto preoccupati e il diffondersi del virus potrebbe significare non avere le attrezzature idonee per curarci tutti. Per questo abbiamo deciso di mettere a disposizione professionalità e contatti per raggiungere lobiettivo prefisso:  acquisto di ventilatori  a favore del reparto di rianimazione dellospedale Giovanni Paolo II di Olbia.   Tutti i fondi raccolti verranno devoluti allassociazione  Onlus Janasdia presieduta dal Dott. Giancarlo Tonolo direttore di Diabetologia della Assl di Olbia.   Anche un piccolo gesto può fare la differenza  _________________________________________________  Italy is going through a very difficult time concerning its health social and economic systems.  The Hospital in Olbia Giovanni Paolo II do not have sufficient intensive care resources. We need your help!  Please share this message with your contacts to help reach our goal to help our community and raise funds for Olbias Hospital.   Even a Small Donation can make a difference .

title: CRI Venezia - Emergenza COVID-19
description: La  Croce Rossa Italiana  è attiva su tutto il territorio nazionale per rispondere all’ Emergenza COVID-19  sin dai primi giorni di febbraio.   Il Comitato CRI di  Venezia  grazie al lavoro degli oltre  700 volontari  sta garantendo:   -       Un’ambulanza aggiuntiva h24 di supporto alla Centrale Operativa SUEM 118 sul territorio di Mestre e zone limitrofe -       Un presidio stabile di pre-triage all’ingresso dell’ospedale dell’Angelo per individuare eventuali pazienti sospetti ed attivare le necessarie procedure -       Screening dal 6 febbraio ad oggi di tutti i passeggeri in arrivo all’aeroporto Marco Polo di Venezia -       Consegna a domicilio di farmaci e spesa alimentare attualmente attiva solo nel Comune di Chioggia ma a breve anche per tutti i comuni del Comitato (ovvero il territorio dell’Ulss 3) -       Servizio di supporto psicologico per tutti i volontari che ne sentissero il bisogno e le loro famiglie   Siamo sempre al tuo servizio siamo con te ogni momento dell’anno adesso in questa fase di emergenza  abbiamo bisogno del tuo aiuto . Grazie alla tua donazione potremo continuare a garantire tutte queste attività di supporto e assistenza alla popolazione veneziana.

title: FOOTLIGHTS THEATRE COVID-19 Support
description: Dear Footlights Theatre Friends Patrons and Supporters  The Footlights Theatre has temporarily closed due to the coronavirus pandemic based on recommendations from the CDC Governor Mills and the Maine Center for Disease Control and Prevention. We are now completing our 7th year and this closure is devastating to us financially.   Box Office sales pay for 90% of our operating and production costs. Our monthly costs average $5000 with rent and utilities due on the 15th of each month and those expenses dont go away just because we cant open. Bottomline: No Cash Flow = Devastating Loss.   So if you are able- or know someone who is able -to help the Footlights Theatre during this challenging time we would greatly appreciate it. Like you we are taking it moment by moment... but we feel confident (we know!) we will be back on stage sooner than later and the show will go on once we get the official OK.   Stay Healthy Stay Safe and Love   Support Each Other... (from a distance) Oh... and WASH YOUR HANDS!   With many many thanks...   Michael J. Tobin Executive Artistic Director The Footlights Theatre  www.thefootlightstheatre.com

title: COVID-19 Keep the Douro Valley Alive (Ana & Marco)
description: Covid-19 has affected the tour industry worldwide especially our dear friends Marco and Ana from the Douro Valley well respected owners and founders of Douro Exclusives one of the top luxury tour companies in the Douro Valley of Portugal.  Douro Exclusive was founded in early 2012 after a deep concern for the tourist services in the Douro Wine Region of Portugal.  Both Marco and Ana live in the Douro Valley with their two children  Salvador and Clara.   They lead with true passion committed to excellence service  while sharing the genuine hospitality of the Portuguese culture.     Their livelihood depends on Douro Exclusive and as a result the impact of the Coronavirus outbreak has caused a tremendous financial loss uncertainty with all cancellations and no tours which has forced them to consider selling their means of transportation for both their family and Douro Exclusive and closing its doors.   With your support Douro Exclusives  will be able to continue on while also providing a livelihood for Marco Ana and their children.   The funds will help them get through the uncertainties of this year and keep their business afloat and provide a means to help them pay off their loans.  Not only will this impact them but it will keep the rest of the Douro Valley alive providing business to local winemakers.   Many of you may already know Marco and Ana from your previous visits to the Douro Valley and would be devastated to see Douro Exclusive close its doors. Their generosity and friendship has impacted your life as well as mine.  I believe its our turn to show them how grateful we are for them.

title: Bristol Covid-19 Mutual Aid
description: This is the fundraiser for the efforts of the Bristol community to help ourselves keep protected and provided for amidst the Covid-19 pandemic.  This is all about solidarity. The rich are able to shield themselves from the worst effects of the virus but the working class are struggling. We have to go to work when we are being asked to self isolate because if we dont we will starve.   Bristol Community Care was set up with the intention of making our self-sustaining possible along the lines of mutual aid and community networking.   Im times like this the government and local authorities are unable or unwilling to do what needs to be done to keep people safe and provided for this is why we must fight this together. This is not apolitical. What we see happening is a situation where the vulnerable elderly disabled immunocompromised and the poor are left to rot. We must gather our collective strength and show that we can run this ourselves. We do not need government or corporations or even many charities to manage our lives for us.   This is about solidarity and aid freely given to anyone and everyone who needs it.   Please if you have anything to spare in these times donate here. All funds will be accounted for and split between essentials that we cannot source for free.

title: Help A Minor Leaguer (Corona)
description: My name is Eric Sim a former Minor League nobody.  I’m raising money to help a few broke Minor Leaguers that could use some financial help while minor leaguers are getting sent home without pay during the Coronavirus lockdown.  Campaign runs from March 14th-end of Coronavirus lockdown and I’ll donate all the money to help minor leaguers.  •I will send $1000 each to every minor leaguer I can help •This is in Canadian dollars so the goal is to raise $5550 CAD which ends up around $4000 USD to help 4 minor leaguers •Low round picks or FA signings only •I will donate all of my earnings from Pocketradar Rotowear Foulpolesports  Any questions @ me on Twitter @esim69

title: Care Kits for Folks in Need During Covid-19
description: Hi folks  Yesterday I went to the store to grab a few items and got stuck in line behind a few people who were trying to stock up for the current crisis. Multiple of them ended up not being able to purchase the items because they dont have the credit or resources to buy extra  even in a time of need.   So Stevie Constance and I will be putting together packages for people in high risk areas/situations including: womens shelters LGBTQ centers homeless shelters and food-pantry places on school campuses.    The packages will include things like:  - Hand Sanitizer (we may end up having to make it and use airline travel bottles since everywhere is sold out.) - Sanitary Wipes - Bottles of water - Any pantry food items available - Socks - Disposable forks sporks spoons or whatever is available - Kleenex packs - Unused garbage bags (that can also be used as ponchos since the weather has also turned on us) - Tampons/pads feminine sanitary items - Rolls of toilet paper  And we are open to any other ideas you may have.  The plan is to raise the money to purchase the items and put them in packages but  we are also looking for anyone who may have extra of these items that they are willing to donate.    Thanks for being rockstars and helping out where you can! :)

title: Operación (RESPUESTA)
description: We are setting up a crowdfunding to be able to respond quickly and efficiently to the different needs that will be arising in the shelters and other centers that are serving the most vulnerable people due o the COVID-19 crisis.  Well be informing as we go along the responses well be providing.   Estamos lanzando una campaña de crowdfunding para poder responder rápidamente a las diferentes necesidades que puedan surgir en los albergues y o centros que están atendiendo a las personas mas vulnerables ante la crisis del COVID-19.  Estaremos informando de las respuestas que vayamos teniendo conforme vayan surgiendo.

title: Indifanten - will Corona überleben!
description: Hallo Ihr Lieben  mein Name ist Nora-Linn Päärmann und ich bin 28 Jahre alt. Im Mai 2019 haben mein Freund und ich unsere kleine “Indifantenboutique” in Mannheim eröffnet. Unser ganzes Herz hängt an unserem kleinen Traum. Ich möchte Euch kurz darstellen was wir machen und warum es im Moment etwas schwer ist.   Wir designen produzieren importieren in und verkaufen hauptsächlich Bekleidung aus Vintage Sari.   Unser Konzept basiert auf 4 Säulen:  Fairtrade (geprüft durch SA8000 Zertifikat und unseren eigenen Augen)  Nachhaltigkeit (upcycling) Einzigartigkeit ( aus einem Sari bekommen wir höchstens 2 Kleidungsstücke das bedeutet jedes unserer Produkte sind Unikate) Soziales Projekt (wir nehmen einen festen Bestandteil unseres Profits wieder mit zurück nach Indien und unterstützen damit junge Mädchen die Schule besuchen zu können)   Unser Konzept besteht aus dem upcycling von bereits getragenen Saris. Das bedeutet: Wir nutzen Saris (ca. 6 Meter lange Stoffe Wickelgewänder indischer Frauen die bereits getragen wurden)  für unsere Kleidung und Accessoires. In Indien gibt es Sammelstellen an denen die Frauen ihre bereits getragenen Saris gegen Geld wieder abgeben können und die Fabrik in der wir arbeiten kauft diese von den Sammelstellen aus ganz Indien an. Wir produzieren in einer Fabrik in Rajasthan die SA8000 zertifiziert ist (Fairtrade) und sind selbst 1-3 Monate im Jahr selbst täglich in der Fabrik um unsere neue Kollektion zu designen und zu produzieren. Anschließend importieren wir unsere Lieblinge und verkaufen sie in Deutschland. Wir kennen die Mitarbeiter Chefs und die Gegebenheiten in der Fabrik und sind meist die ersten und die letzten die dort vor Ort sind   Unsere derzeitigen Hürden:  Bis Februar dieses Jahres habe ich parallel dazu Soziale Arbeit in Mannheim studiert. Leider musste ich das Studium nun unterbrechen da es meiner Mutter gesundheitlich sehr schlecht geht und das auch nach Ihrem Krankenhausaufenthalt viel Zeit und Kraft kosten wird. Durch den Abbruch des Studiums fallen mir monatlich mein Bafög Anspruch und der Anspruch auf mein Studienkredit weg. Damit hatte ich eine Sicherheit mit der ich meine Fixkosten zahlen und meinen kleinen Laden in kleinen Schritten langsam aufbauen konnte.   Dadurch dass ich nun kein Student mehr bin ist auch der Mindestbeitrag meiner Krankenversicherung gleich mindestens doppelt so hoch.   In dem Haushalt meiner Mutter lebt auch meine 94 Jährige Oma die nun Situationsbedingt eine Kurzzeitpflege antreten muss die wiederum Geld kostet.   In Ca. 2 Wochen steht der nächste Import an doch mit einem Großteil des Geldes dass ich dafür angespart hatte musste ich nun in ein Auto investieren um bei Situationsbedingten Notfällen schneller agieren zu können.   Das nächste Problem liegt darin dass mein Freund aus Argentinien kommt und sich Visabedingt nur 3 Monate im Halbjahr in Deutschland aufhalten darf. Im Moment befindet er sich noch in Indien und so wie es jetzt aussieht müssen wir aufgrund der Corona Pandemie und der daher geltenden Einreisesperren seinen Flug nach Argentinien umbuchen was im Moment nochmal 900€ kosten würde.  Nun kommt dass Corona-Thema was uns auch betrifft. Durch Corona wurden Messen und Veranstaltungen abgesagt mit denen wir kalkuliert haben. Weiterhin haben uns Großkunden Bestellungen abgesagt da sie selbst Angst vor dem Kundeneinbruch haben.   Unser Laden befindet sich in einer Seitenstraße wo unter normalen Bedingungen schon wenig los ist.   Wir sind ein kleines Startup wo jeder Penny zählt und die derzeitige Situation wird/ist auch für uns schwerwiegend.  Da unser kleines Unternehmen erst seit Ca. Einem Jahr besteht sind wir für Banken nicht kreditwürdig und leider habe ich auch Privat nicht die Möglichkeit mir bei jemanden etwas Geld zu leihen.  Unser Traum mit “Indifanten” hat gerade zu wachsen begonnen. Wir stehen voll und ganz hinter unserem Konzept und auch von außerhalb bekommen wir sehr viel Zuspruch aber leider reicht das in diesem Moment nicht aus.  Gerade in der heutigen Zeit mit dem wachsenden Verständnis für Nachhaltigkeit Fairtrade und sozialen Engagement hat unser Startup soviel  Potential um weiter zu wachsen und zu gedeihen. Seitdem wir damit begonnen haben hängen wir jede Sekunde unser ganzes Herzblut und jeden Cent den wir zur Verfügung haben hier hinein. Wir können sehen dass es Früchte trägt.  Die Vorstellung dass dies wegen einiger zusammenkommender äußeren Einflüsse zerbrechen könnte will und kann ich nicht zulassen!  Um jede Spende wären wir von Herzen dankbar und würde uns ein Stückchen weiterhelfen.

title: EMERGENZA CORONA VIRUS
description: In questo periodo demergenza  le nostre risorse non sono più sufficienti e la nostra Pubblica Assistenza per garantire il continuo svolgimento h24 dei servizi sia di trasporto che demergenza ha bisogno di fondi per i dovuti dispositivi di protezione individuale .   Questo non servirà solo a noi ma anche per i pazienti che trasportiamo per proteggerli da questa terribile pandemia   che sta girando tutto il mondo .   Vi ringraziamo anticipatamente per questo sicuri di una vostra risposta positiva e una condivisione con amici e familiari. #aiutaciadaiutare #andràtuttobene

title: COVID-19 : UNA MONTAGNA DI AIUTI
description: Questa attività di raccolta fondi è stata promossa dal direttivo del CAI SEZIONE DI CARRARA.  COVID19  ormai tutti tristemente conosciamo questo termine. COrona VIrus Disease 19  o Coronavirus sta mettendo in crisi la nostra sanità  sta provocando morti e sta minando gravemente leconomia.  In questo momento servono tante cose e tanti si sono attivati e si stanno prodigando per aiutare chi ha bisogno. Noi come  CLUB ALPINO SEZIONE DI CARRARA  abbiamo riflettuto su come poterci rendere utili ed abbiamo deciso di fare due cose : 1) cercheremo di aiutare  gli anziani soli e tutti coloro che non possono recarsi  autonomamente a fare la spesa 2) cercheremo di aiutare  chi in questo momento non può permettersi di fare la spesa .  Per il primo punto sono benvenuti tutti coloro che vogliono dedicare un pò del loro tempo a questo tipo di attività per il secondo punto cerchiamo di raccogliere denaro che ci consenta di acquistare quotidianamente generi di prima necessità da veicolare alle persone più bisognose. Sarà nostra facoltà decidere di destinare parte delle somme raccolte anche ad altri interventi in tema di questa emergenza se le somme raccolte ce lo consentiranno. Per questa campagna non cè un limite alla raccolta noi come sezione cittadina del CLUB ALPINO ITALIANO facciamo la nostra donazione  e chiediamo a tutti soci e non soci privati cittadini ed imprese di contribuire per aiutare chi nella nostra città e nella nostra provincia è meno fortunato.  La nostra Sezione è chiusa è comunque possibile richiedere informazioni  via email a :  caicarrara@virgilio.it   Grazie di cuore a tutti coloro che parteciperanno.   La pagina sul sito ufficiale CAI CARRARA

title: Croce Rossa di Albiano Magra- Andrà tutto bene
description: Non possiamo mollare ma per non farlo abbiamo bisogno di tutti voi!!Eccoci qua ci ritroviamo a chiedere di nuovo aiuto a tutta la popolazione e alle istituzioni Stiamo facendo di tutto per garantire come sempre la nostra preziosa presenza sul territorio garantendo 24 ore su 24 il servizio di emergenza.??Stiamo esaurendo le ultime scorte di mascherine per i volontari. ?? Ad oggi stiamo garantendo il servizio di emergenza trasporto dializzati trasporti sanitari di cui alcuni non urgenti trasporto spesa e farmaci a domicilio. Ci dispiace dirlo ma qualora non riuscissimo a reperire tutti i dispositivi di sicurezza individuali necessari per svolgere tutti i nostri servizi dovremmo sospendere il nostro lavoro.Siccome non vorremmo mai arrivare a questo punto chiediamo sostegno e aiuti da parte delle istituzioni e dalla popolazione.Stiamo cercando di reperirli in tutti i modi ma non riuscendoci siamo costretti a rivolgerci a voi CREDIAMO IN VOI siamo sicuri che qualcuno ci potrà aiutare. RINGRAZIAMO TUTTI IN ANTICIPO NOI NON VOGLIAMO MOLLARE

title: Security for Mr. Rocky during COVID19
description: Mr. Rocky has been outstanding in taking care of our Red Road family now for several years.  Its our time to reciprocate.   While the kids are off from school Mr. Rocky will not be provided the opportunity to work. We do not know how long this period will last.  During this time of uncertainty lets all provide some security where it matters most.

title: COVID-19 & DawaNet’s HalalServe Food Bank
description: What if you Depended on a Food Bank for your Next Meal?    During these difficult times of increased fear and uncertainty surrounding the COVID-19 pandemic it is easy to worry about ourselves and our families stockpiling food   essential supplies in preparation for the worst possible all whilst forgetting the needy sick and vulnerable in our own neighborhoods.   The unsettling reality is that many in our neighborhoods and communities do actually depend on a Food Bank for their daily meals. At least 1 out of every 8 Canadian Households faces some form of food insecurity with more than half of these households consisting of single-income single-person the elderly and those living with disabilities. And these numbers are only expected to grow due to the Coronavirus (COVID-19) outbreak making it hard for those already underprivileged to afford essentials like groceries.    DawaNet’s HalalServe Food Bank is an important community initiative that provides free bi-weekly Food Baskets to needy   persistently poor families in the Mississauga (Ontario Canada) area also offering home delivery to those with limited mobility. Typical baskets include an assortment of fresh produce fruit rice/ lentils   legumes pasta cereals fresh milk   eggs Halal meats snacks and other healthy food items.   DawaNet would like to remind everyone to be patient stay optimistic take the necessary precautions to help protect yourselves and your loved ones against all harm but to also not forget about HalalServe that provides essential food assistance to the most vulnerable in our local communities.    During COVID-19 please help HalalServe ensure:   Our existing clients continue to receive the basic bi-weekly food assistance we provide them and  Any additional needy individuals and families in the Mississauga area can be provided assistance via our Urgent Food Assistance program.    Remember charity given sincerely never decreases wealth. Rather it helps to increase the blessings in our wealth and helps ward off misfortunes. Read more.       Notes:  HalalServe Food Bank   CanadaZakat are social welfare initiatives of DawaNet. DawaNet is a federally registered Canadian not-for-profit organization established in 2000. Learn more at www.Halalserve.ca | www.dawanet.ca |  www.Canadazakat.org    This campaign is eligible for Zakat Sadaqa and General Donations. If you would like to make an in-kind donation please contact us  info@dawanet.ca    Assistance is open for all needy families in the Mississauga area regardless of their faith/beliefs.  HalalServe is a grassroots initiative that totally depends on community support donations and volunteers to help sustain it.  More on Rising Food Insecurity in Canada.   If you know someone who requires food assistance they can submit an application here. www.canadazakat.org/halalserve | www.dawanet.ca | 1-905-514-1444

title: COVID-19 Aid: Tips for Kicks NYC
description: IMMEDIATE RESPONSE FOR INDIVIDUALS FINANCIALLY IMPACTED BY COVID-19 IN NYC.    Dear all I am starting this fundraiser to aid those financially impacted by the social distancing movement in NYC. I am grateful that I am able to work from home and still get paid at my job but its made me realize that others are not so fortunate.  Many individuals are unable to work from home because of the nature of their jobs but their hours are being cut regardless. Some of those immediately impacted are service industry workers salon industry workers and entertainment industry performers aka people who rely on tips.   I am calling on the community and beyond to donate a tip just for kicks. I dont have anything to give you in return but hopefully we can come together in this time and help each other out. Im not part of any organization Im just doing this on my own. If you are nervous to donate because you dont know me I guess youre just going to have to trust a stranger.   HOW IT WORKS:  Think about how much you tip for a coffee a meal a haircut or a live band playing at a bar. You donate however much you want. It goes into a pot and is divided among applicants who have been immediately impacted. Once its divided up it might not be a lot for them but its something.   HOW TO DONATE:  Donate through GoFundMe.   HOW SOON TO DONATE:  The campaign will run through Saturday March 21st to ensure that workers can get their tips ASAP.   HOW TO APPLY FOR AID:  You must be an NYC resident who relies on tips to supplement your income. You must apply by Wednesday March 18th to be considered.  Email the following to  tipsforkicksnyc@gmail.com  : • Proof of employment • A short description of the nature of your work • Your Venmo handle  All applicants will be notified whether they are approved through email.   Kind regards Ivy

title: Support our local NHS staff through Covid-19
description: Our front line NHS staff need your support!   The staff at Dorchester Hospital are already under a tremendous amount of pressure in dealing with the developing Covid-19 crisis facing the UK.  Doctors and nurses are working non-stop to help keep our loved ones alive. With no time to stop for a break sometimes for 13hrs straight!   Lets help keep them going!! Funds raised will go towards buying high energy nutritious foods to provide sustenance for the staff at DCH. (OK maybe some donuts and cakes too!) This will be delivered on a daily basis once funds are there to get it!  Im also going to be using our local businesses to source this therefore helping them to get through this difficult time too!   Any extra funding will go towards stocking up our local food banks!  Lets all dig deep pull together and show how much we appreciate the exhausting and relentless work they do!!   If anyone would like to support me with this or may have any ideas to help make it a success please contact me via Facebook or via the contact button below. Thank you!
