Inutile dire che in questo periodo di covid19 la tempistica è importantissima e quindi vi invitiamo subito a fare una donazione come farà la nostra Associazione Villa Rolandi ODV versando la cifra di 1.000€ Vi ringraziamo si da ora per quanto potrete donare (anche piccoli importi) e sarà nostra premura tenervi informati attraverso i mezzi di comunicazione sullandamento della raccolta dei fondi.

title: Covid-19 rafforziamo la terapia intensiva
description: Non ho mai sopportato il restare fermo a guardare soprattutto quando cè il mio Paese a soffrire.  Così ho pensato di avviare una raccolta fondi che ci faccia sentire tutti più partecipi seppure da casa. La raccolta fondi ha come obiettivo ben preciso rafforzare la terapia intensiva e subintensiva dellospedale Cotugno di Napoli.  In un momento così delicato al punto che sociale e sanitario si sovrappongono possiamo e dobbiamo fare qualcosa anche noi anche io anche tu.  Le strutture ospedaliere si stanno attrezzando per incrementare il numero di posti in terapia intensiva ma cè una carenza di attrezzature come ad esempio ventilatori e dispostivi di ventilazione non invasiva monitor e monitoraggio emodinamico.  I nostri medici ed i nostri ricercatori stanno facendo un lavoro rimarchevole e vorremmo supportarli concretamente ma ancora di più vorremmo essere vicini a tutti i pazienti ed a tutte le famiglie affinché possano sentirsi sostenuti.  Dobbiamo restare uniti.   Anche la più piccola donazione ci aiuterà a fare la differenza.  I fondi raccolti saranno direttamente devoluti allospedale Cotugno di Napoli.

title: Überbrückung der Corona Krise
description: Die Corona-Krise hat auch uns erreicht! Gerne würden wir hungrige und durstige Mäuler in der Grafschaft stopfen aus verständlichen Gründen sind wir jedoch alle aufgerufen alles zu tun um die Verbreitung des Virus zu verlangsamen. Das stellt uns vor fast unlösbare Probleme Probleme die leider finanzieller Natur sind: um Mitarbeiterlöhne und Fixkosten zu bestreiten brauchen wir Einnahmen ohne Öffnungszeiten können wir diese Einnahmen leider nicht generieren. Helft uns! Das Geld welches ihr in unsere Kampagne investiert wird euch  in Form von Verzehrgutscheinen zurückgegeben. Diese könnt ihr dann jederzeit bei uns einlösen sobald dieser Albtraum ein Ende hat.  In dieser Kampagne geht es darum das Hof Veldink liquide zu halten. Es ist den Medien immer wieder davon zu lesen dass unbürokratisch geholfen wird wo immer es geht. Bis diese Hilfen ankommen wird aber Zeit ins Land gehen und das bringt uns und unsere Mitarbeiter arg in Bedrängnis. Auch wollen wir für das Hof Veldink keine Spenden sammeln das dürfen wir auch gar nicht jeder Cent der von euch hier auf der Platform bezahlt wird wird in Form von Verzehrgutscheinen an euch zurückgegeben. Ihr helft uns quasi dadurch dass ihr heute bezahlt was ihr zukünftig konsumiert. Und das ist eine grossartige Hilfe von euch. Dementsprechend verkaufen wir quasi Gutscheine an euch und wie wir bereits in den Winter Monaten die Erfahrung gemacht haben besteht ein großes Interesse daran. Darüber hinaus werden wir natürlich mit To Go Bestellungen und unserem Lieferservice weitermachen! Vielen Dank im Voraus im Namen des ganzen Hof Veldink Teams!

title: Friends Stranded in Ecuador! Due to COVID-19
description: Derek Sullivan  and  Reese Jachetta  planned an amazing vacation months ago in Ecuador and the Galapagos. They left two weeks ago before the world started shutting down. Now the dream vacation has turned into a nightmare. Ecuador has shut down all air traffic in and out of the country due to the spread of the Coronavirus for another 3 WEEKS! Derek and Reese now have no way to get home and no place to stay. They certainly did not plan or budget for an extra 3 weeks in hotels/hostels in a foreign country especially if they get sick. They need our help. They need money ASAP!

title: SF Flower Mart Vendor Payroll Assistance COVID-19
description: The San Francisco Flower Market is a historical institution that was first established in 1912 in the Financial District in SF. In 1924 it relocated to 5th   Howard and proceeded to move to 6th   Brannan in 1956.  It is one of 5 total flower markets in the United States and the second largest next to the Los Angeles Flower Market. Vendors supply flowers plants containers and more as far north as Oregon as far east as Nevada and as far south as the central coast of California.  The customer base consists of event planners retail florists interior decorators caterers plant shops and flower wholesalers.  This shutdown affects an employment base of over 300 employees with many vendors being small local family-owned businesses. There are just under 50 vendors within the flower market that are facing a monumental loss due to the fact that the primary product that is for sale is highly perishable. Preserving any product is nearly impossible. The flower market is a unique institution that brings together an incredibly diverse group of people and contains many first generation micro businesses     The money collected will be evenly distributed to each vendor based on their number of employees to aid in payroll expenses.      About the San Francisco Flower Market:  A need for a centrally located market bringing together the three ethnically diverse groups of flower growers was fulfilled with the opening of a market located at 5th and Howard Streets in 1924. As flower growers expanded production areas outside of the Bay Area and as product from other parts of United States came in the need for a larger more modern permanent facility led to the design and construction of our current market at Sixth and Brannan Streets in the South of Market area of San Francisco.  The grand opening of the San Francisco Flower Terminal in September 1956 marked the establishment of an industry icon. Today officially known as the San Francisco Flower Mart we now have just under 50 vendors purveyors of cut flowers potted plants blooming plants and floral supplies.   Founded by Japanese immigrant flower growers at the turn of the century the story of the California Flower Market Inc. spans nearly the entire history of Japanese in America.  Through depressions earthquakes racial hostility restrictive legislation and internment during World War II the members of the California Flower Market have overcome adversity to serve the growers who built a thriving industry from the ground up.  One of the oldest and most successful Japanese-American-owned corporations in the United States the California Flower Market has been the center of the wholesale flower industry in the San Francisco Bay Area for nearly a century.  It is one of the few wholesale markets in the United States owned and run for and by flower growers.        *Photos credit to the SF Flower market instagram @sfflowermart  www.sanfranciscoflowermart.com

title: Emergenza COVID-19 -Raccolta fondi CRI Settimo Tse
description: Siamo il comitato di  Croce Rossa Italiana di Settimo Torinese  e ci troviamo in un comune della prima cintura di Torino e da   45 anni  serviamo costantemente il territorio.     A causa dellemergenza  #COVID-19   abbiamo dovuto sostenere spese necessarie per lacquisto di  dispositivi di protezione individuali  (DPI) atti a garantire la sicurezza ai nostri volontari impegnati tutti i giorni con i servizi di emergenza  118  e con casi sospetti  #COVID-19 .        Aiutaci ad Aiutare : anche un piccolo contributo può essere di grande aiuto   Grazie di Cuore ??    Il Presidente CRI Settimo Torinese   Marina Losco.

title: Allenati a casa per combattere insieme il covid-19
description: Anche noi vogliamo fare la nostra parte in questa situazione di emergenza. Vogliamo raccogliere fondi per lAzienda USL Toscana Centro. Il nostro obiettivo è quello di riuscire a donare 1000 euro ma speriamo di superare questa somma grazie al vostro aiuto. Con una donazione minima di 10 euro riceverete una scheda di allenamento di 4 settimane da poter svolgere interamente a casa vostra (mandate messaggio whats app al 3276151284 o scrivete in Direct su Instagram la vostra mail per linvio). Noi di Elevate ASD vi ringraziamo di cuore per aver partecipato insieme a noi a questa campagna. Sperando di potervi rivedere tutti il prima possibile vi salutiamo con affetto. Il team Elevate.

title: Atrapados en BARCELONA COVID19
description: Hola mi nombre es Luis Beltran soy de Colombia Tenía el Plan de venir a conocer Barcelona con mi hijo Paul y mi Esposa Marcela por 15 días de vacaciones los cuales sólo pudimos disfrutar 2 porque empezó todo el problema del COVID19 Las restricciones cuarentena etc. todo cada día se ha tornado más oscuro un ejemplo todos los restaurantes están cerrados sólo están abiertos los supermercados y nosotros como turistas alojados en una hotel es más difícil no tenemos cocina  el dinero se está agotando  para empeorar la situación Iberia nos canceló el vuelo de regreso a nuestro país y este lunes que viene se nos acaba los días de hotel que tenemos pago . el dinero que me queda no es mucho ya que por toda este problema todos los productos alimenticios están  escasos y aparte Barcelona es una ciudad muy costosa . la aerolínea no me ha confirmado para cuando me pueden cambiar la fecha del vuelo de retorno a mi país Por la alarma sanitaria qué hay en todo el mundo estoy preocupado por mi familia pronto no tendremos donde hospedarnos y la situación va a ser mucho Peor es la primera vez que hago una campaña pero es por el bien de mi familia especialmente por el bienestar de mi hijo cualquier donación que puedan hacerme estaré eternamente agradecido y recuerden que pueden contar con migo para lo que necesiten en algún momento de sus vidas . este dinero tengo pensado utilizarlo para alquilar una habitación comprar víveres para garantizar nuestra seguridad en estos tiempos difíciles que no se cuando terminen. Gracias a cada persona que nos está ayudando .  El dinero será Cobrado o enviado a la cuenta de mi amigo beneficiado Paulo Alvarado Martinez Quien tiene toda la documentación necesaria en España para poder hacer efectiva las donaciones y llegue a nuestras manos lo más rápido posible   GRACIAS A TODOS DIOS BENDICE

title: Diapers for Babies in Need During COVID-19
description: On the most perfectly uneventful day in the US 1 in 3 families cannot afford an adequate supply of diapers for their children.  When unexpected events like natural disasters and emergencies occur that number soars within the affected communities.  Today all of our communities are affected and more diapers and more support are needed to keep babies clean dry and healthy.   Like me you probably went to the grocery store at the onset of the COVID-19 crisis and were shocked to see empty food aisles and empty shelves and particularly no toilet paper anywhere. Why? Because we all recognize that toilet paper is a material basic necessity that we all require to maintain good health and hygiene.   The same is true for diapers. Diapers are a material basic necessity that all babies and toddlers require for good health.   Yet during this crisis more and more families are struggling to diaper their children leading them to seek emergency help from   National Diaper Bank Network (NDBN)    member diaper bank programs throughout the country.     We are experiencing an unprecedented emergency.     WE KNOW : Crises are inevitable and NDBNs crisis-response experience will help us navigate COVID-19.     Over the last 10 years the  National Diaper Bank Network   (NDBN) has been at the forefront of providing diapers to children and families in emergency situations.    NDBN:  - Works with federal state and local officials to respond quickly and efficiently; - Partners with local diaper banks to assess individual community needs;  - Coordinates with corporate supporters to get diapers to the areas that need help most.     WE RESPOND : The impact of the Coronavirus is unprecedented but NDBN is adapting to meet the increase in diaper need.  NDBN is:   - Initiating outreach to key government officials and commercial vendors to know what types of assistance can and will be available; - Providing up to date information to 200+ member diaper banks across the country to best assist them as circumstances change daily;  -  Communicating almost daily with our founding sponsor  Huggies   as part of our shared commitment to do everything possible to help deliver and distribute diapers during this unprecedented time.      YOU CAN HELP    Cant imagine a baby in a soiled diaper? Neither can we!   Want to help people in diaper need? We do too!    Your gift today will enable NDBN to best respond to the needs of our communities now and build the foundation for their eventual recovery.   THANK YOU!!

title: COVID19
description: We at Oz. Tap House are proposing a fund-raising challenge. We know that there are many families and individuals who may not be able to afford a good meal right now. So we are challenging anyone who feels called upon to donate a meal. Donate $20 $50 $100 or more. All of this money will go toward providing meals for someone in need. Alternatively if you have recently been laid off fired or cant work due to this health disaster we encourage you to call in place an order and pick up your meal with no questions asked. Just tell us you are ordering through the Oz. Tap House COVID19 Food Fund! We will have a donation wall displayed which we will update on social media daily. Four Points resident and Oz. Tap Houses own John Odette has decided to kick off the challenge by donating $1000. If you want to step up and help put food in the mouths of someone who has been hit hard or just help put a few people back to work please let us know! We are taking donations today.

title: UK 1/8th Tracks COVID-19 Support
description: Due to the COVID-19 limitations being cascaded to organisations around the world - we have created this gofundme to support those key1/8th tracks in the UK who we know will be loosing revenue due to closures. We are already seeing impacts and want to help   Can we suggest you put in what you would normally spend on race fees a week for the next 4 weeks and hopefully we can put aside enough to support the clubs WE as racers NEED to stay open !  At present the only fair way I can see to distribute the funds equally across the tracks below that have been identified as key to our scene so this will be the overriding approach - subject to ....  We are also aware some will struggle more than others and any tracks with a genuine concern (loosing a location etc - provided with evidence from the committee to back it up) will get preference in distribution - please DO NOT take the piss - this is for the sport as a whole not designed to favour anyone  I hope you see this as a proactive step for all our benefit - 100% of monies go to the clubs directly  I am doing this for the clubs will make the discretionary decisions on distribution to the best of my ability and consequently wont take any grief in this regard - I will personally underwrite the funds   NWN - Brookthorpe - Slough - HNMC - Ledbury - Kent - Pendle - South Coast - Deerdale - NDOR - Ledbury  Whilst this is one way to support the clubs please - DONATE DIRECTLY TO YOUR CLUB - JOIN YOUR CLUB membership really helps as well.

title: Protect US HCPs against   COVID19
description: Under the current Coronavirus crisis that is paralyzing our communities a team of Chinese american volunteers in DC-Maryland area is fundraising to protect our frontier healthcare professionals (HCPs) from potential transmission risks as posed by COVID19 . The fund raised will be allocated to purchase and deliver medical standard face masks and other protection equipments that our HCPs badly need in the  battle against this dire virus. Donations will be made to local hospitals and relevant healthcare facilities directly or via certified NPO.  ???????????????????????????????????????????????????????????COVID19?????????? ??????????????????????????????????????????????????????? ???????????NPO?????????????????

title: Covid-19 Fundraiser for Umass Memorial Doctors
description: Recently the World Health Organization (WHO) has declared the coronavirus (Covid-19) a global pandemic. As Covid-19 spreads across the world hospitals are actively trying to save lives and ensure the well being of their patients. However many hospitals across the United States lack the vital personal protective equipment like N95 Masks surgical masks gloves shoe covers gowns face shields sanitary wipes and hair covers. Without these materials it furthers the spread of the virus and puts both patients and health care workers at risk.  The situation has become so desperate that our Vice President Mike Pence has acknowledged the shortage of these supplies for hospitals and is asking the public for support. It is important for us to protect those serving us and fighting on the front lines against Covid-19.  One hospital in need is UMass Memorial which is located in Massachusetts. With Massachusetts being one of the states that has been hit the hardest by the coronavirus UMass Memorial is working hard to stop the spread of the virus and treat those that have been infected.   As social distancing has taken effect and large gatherings are dangerous it will be difficult for us to collect these physical supplies. So this Go Fund Me Page aims to provide UMass Memorial additional funds to purchase these supplies.  All donations are greatly appreciated.    More information about Umass Memorial Health Care Inc: Umass Memorial Health Care Inc. is committed to improving the health of the people of Central New England through excellence in clinical care services teaching and research.  For more information contact: give@umassmemorial.org

title: Spitfire Coffee Employees Virtual Tip Jar COVID-19
description: Dear New Orleans and to the rest of the world    We hate not being able to make your coffee.   The sad truth is that the vast majority of our local workforce is composed of hospitality and service professionals that are highly reliant on tipped income and will be left scrambling to make ends meet during the COVID-19 outbreak.   This fund is to meet the specific financial needs of the 5 Spitfire employees during this time. 100% of money raised will be split evenly among them.  Promise to make you some tasty coffees once we get through it all.   thanks we love yall  - Spitfire

title: Black in BC Community Support Fund for COVID-19
description: As we live through this quickly evolving time of transition there are folks who are experiencing unexpected financial harm that can not wait for governmental systems of aid. Black folks over represent these communities.   This Black community support initiative is a fundraiser for a low-barrier emergency micro-grant program for Black people in the Metro-Vancouver and more broadly the British Columbia Canada area.    The funds raised through this GoFundMe page will be distributed in one-time allotments of $150 to Black folks on a first-come first-served basis. There is no expectation that the funds will be repaid or that recipients will report back on how the money was spent. Our expectation is that the funds raised here will be used by recipients for their most urgent needs. We believe that if we work together we can help ensure that Black people in BC survive this time of crisis.   If you can support the fund PLEASE DO. Anything helps.    WHO IS THIS FOR?    - People identifying as Black; a descendent of the African/Caribbean Black diaspora; Black-mixed; Afro-LatinX; or Black Indigenous person WHO ARE ALSO   - People residing in the Metro-Vancouver BC area or British Columbia Canada more broadly.  -Anticipating that there will be a lot of demand priority will go towards the most vulnerable folks in our Black community. According to our collective values as team members in no particular order they are:  - Self-identified senior citizens and youths - Disabled community members - LGBTQ+ - Caregivers   guardians of children under 18 - Vulnerable self-identified women - Refugees     THE LAND    We acknowledge that we do this work as uninvited settlers and as stolen people on the stolen lands of the unceded ancestral lands of the s?l?ilw?ta?? t?m?x? (Tsleil-Waututh) Skwxwú7mesh-ulh Temíx_w (Squamish) Sólh Téméxw (Stó:lo¯) Stzuminus x?m??k??y??m (Musqueam) Nations.

title: IDOLA AGAINST COVID-19 ??
description: #INSIEME CONTRO IL CORONAVIRUS# INSIEME SI PUÒ !  In questa fase davvero delicata IDOLA SALOONun Team di Parrucchieri presenti su Napoli Roma Milanohanno scelto di donare il ricavo dei loro prodotti Idola tramite la piattaforma di donazioni GOFUND per aiutare e rafforzare la terapia intensiva dellOspedale Cotugnonostro punto di riferimento a Napoli. Il COVID-19 sta cambiando radicalmente la vita quotidiana di più persone e osare con un piccolo contributo non costa davvero nulla!  “RIMANIAMO DISTANTI OGGI PER ABBRACCIARCI CON PIÙ CALORE E PER CORRERE INSIEME PIÙ VELOCI DOMANI”. CE LA FAREMO ?

title: Raccolta Fondi Sicilia-Emergenza Coronavirus-
description: Hello Friends!   Sicily needs our help to fight this COVID-19 pandemic!  Healthcare professionals are working under dangerous situations with little resources to help their fellow citizens and I beg you any amount of money helps. Funds will go directly to La Regione Siciliana and hospitals.    “The funds will be collected by the Sicilian Regional Civil Protection which will allocate them to the purchase of individual protection devices hospital facilities and equipment for intensive care units. - Honorable Bernardette Grasso   I am a pediatric critical care nurse born and raised in Sicily who now lives in the United States being away from Italy during this tragic time knowing that they need medical professionals pushed me to start this go-found-me so that no matter the distance they can receive my help big or small. My family has been on mandatory lock-down for a week now people are struggling and healthcare workers need our help.  I know that the entire world is struggling today but any donation will help Sicilian healthcare professionals fight this pandemic.   Thank you from the bottom of my heart  #everythingwillbeokay  ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Ciao Amici    La Sicilia ha bisogno del nostro aiuto per combattere COVID-19!  Gli operatori sanitari lavorano in situazioni pericolose con poche risorse per aiutare i loro concittadini vi prego qualsiasi somma di denaro aiuta. I fondi andranno direttamente alla Regione Siciliana e agli ospedali.   “A raccogliere i fondi sarà la Protezione Civile Regionale Siciliana che li destinerà allacquisto di dispositivi di protezioni individuali presidi ospedalieri e attrezzature pr reparti di terapia intensiva.”-Onorevole Bernardette Grasso   Sono uninfermiera pediatrica di terapia intensiva nata e cresciuta in Sicilia che ora vive negli Stati Uniti essendo lontana dallItalia durante questo tragico periodo sapendo che hanno bisogno di professionisti medici e infermieri mi ha spinto a iniziare questo go-found-me per dare possono un aiuto grande o piccolo che sia. Gli operatori sanitari hanno bisogno del nostro aiuto.  So che il mondo intero sta lottando oggi ma qualsiasi donazione aiuterà gli operatori sanitari siciliani a combattere questa pandemia.  Un Grazie di Cuore a tutti Voi! #andra`tuttobene

title: Fondazione Benefattori Emergenza COVID-19
description: Siamo in campo dal primo giorno per proteggere i ‘ Nonni di cui ci occupiamo da sempre. Abbiamo aumentato i turni abbiamo potenziato tutte le procedure di sicurezza ordinarie e messo in campo misure straordinarie. Abbiamo visto molti del nostro team fermarsi a causa del COVID-19. Molti di loro però sono già tornati in servizio dopo aver sconfitto la malattia.    Da oggi ci attende però una sfida più grande: sostenere lOspedale Maggiore di Crema accogliendo in un apposito reparto che stiamo attrezzando pazienti che hanno ora bisogno di cure meno intensive e di riabilitazione.    Guarire una polmonite non basta bisogna rimettere le persone in piedi e restituirle ai loro cari e alla loro quotidianità. Così facendo ci saranno più posti liberi presso il nostro Ospedale per accogliere e curare i nuovi contagi.   Per portare a termine la nostra missione abbiamo bisogno di voi.     Ospiteremo fino a 20 pazienti  che necessitano di:  ·      Un reparto attrezzato e dedicato  solamente al trattamento di questi casi.   ·      Strumentazione specialistica e farmaci  di cui non disponiamo in quantità sufficiente (elettrocardiografici ecografi erogatori per lossigeno ecc.)  ·      Materiale di protezione  indispensabile per tutti i nostri Operatori (camici maschere guanti occhiali disinfettanti)   Ora più che mai chiediamo a tutti di supportare una realtà che è nel cuore di Crema e dei Cremaschi. Abbiamo bisogno di ‘dotazioni speciali per garantire la sicurezza perché professionalità responsabilità dedizione e coraggio non ci mancano.   Abbiamo una grande competenza non solo nel “prenderci cura” delle fragilità  ma anche nella riabilitazione e  non arretreremo fino a che le Persone che ci saranno affidate non torneranno a casa con il sorriso finalmente libere da questa malattia insidiosa!

title: Free/reduced care for those impacted by COVID19
description: Help me cover office overhead so that I can continue to provide care to those who truly need it.   On March 2nd 2020 I opened the doors to my private practice Body Liberation with 25 clients scheduled. Many of these folks are clients that I have been working with for almost a year (some even longer).   I opened Body Liberation to be able to offer inclusive social-justice oriented care to survivors of trauma and those struggling with disordered eating. To ensure that I was able to provide the level of care that I felt was necessary without intrusive oversight from profit-driven health insurance companies I opted to offer my services at a rate that is far below the going market rate for individual therapy sessions particularly specialized services like trauma through the use of EMDR.   When I shifted to my own private practice I was able to cut my fees from $150 to just $75 for ongoing sessions. This has allowed me to work with folks all across the board -- folks in the restaurant industry folks in retail nurses educators healers etc. It has felt like such a gift to be able to serve almost 30 clients over the past 2 weeks and work towards making ~$50000 a year before taxes (which is a big shift for me coming from nonprofit/social services work where masters level clinicians were lucky to be offered $40000 salary for our services but more often than not was much less than that).  I feel grateful that I chose the route of not paneling with health insurance so that I did not need to be limited in my ability to offer telehealth services (many providers out there are currently fighting with public and private health insurance companies advocating to have their client sessions covered via telehealth having to pause treatment for the sake of bureaucratic red tape that serves no one but health insurance executives at the top). Because of this I have been able to continue providing services without an interruption on my end because I am able to serve folks in the way that feels most ethically appropriate to me rather than what health insurance companies deem appropriate or more appealing to their bottom line.  COVID-19 has been devastating to the clients that I serve. They have been laid off without promise of relief and are now having to make the choice between being able to save their money for rent and access clinical support during this (I would argue traumatic) time.   My moral code requires me to continue serving these clients but I need to be able to cover my office expenses (like office rent even though Im not physically there as there doesnt seem to be movement in pausing rent collections) and have at least something left over to be able to pay myself.   I want to be able to offer reduced fee support during this time to my clients that have been most impacted by this crisis but I need help to do that. I am looking to my community for help (because the federal government continues to prove that they arent going to make the right choice by supporting workers and instead opting to bailout big businesses).  Please consider donating (any amount helps!) to support me in covering 3 months of overhead costs to keep my business afloat during this time so that I may be able to offer the discounted or free services that folks need (and deserve) during this difficult time. Right now I have the ability to cover 2 months of office expenses if I dont pay myself at all (which I havent done since I opened my practice since this happened).  Thank you for supporting me in finding a way to serve my clients effectively during this uncertain time. You have no idea how much it means to me.

title: Pennsport Barbershop Covid19 Community Support
description: 2020 has been a rough year so far. Between house fires and global pandemics everyone at Pennsport Barbershop has been suffering financial difficulties that will only continue to grow the longer this goes on for. We have no idea how long this Quarantine is going to last but what we do know is that we all need to be pro active in making sure that the buisnessesand people in our lives are taken care of in these times of hardship. This will end eventually and life will go back to normal. In the mean time all we can do is ask for the support of our friends family and a patrons to make sure that we can be of service as soon as we can open our doors back up to the public. Any and all contributions help. The goal is just an arbitrary number I needed to start this. The real goal is for us to be able to maintain our buisness through these difficult times. Thank you all for all the love and support throughout the years. We will see you again.

title: Coronavirus (COVID-19) Recaudacion Norte REP.DOM
description: WHO ARE WE : Loma los Pinos Foundation with the ID number RNC. 4-30-10392-6 is a nonprofit institution founded on March 10 2008. The provisions of the Law 122-05 Dominican Republic that regulates and promotes Nonprofit Associations.  The motivation to create the foundation was the need to protect the resources of La Loma Los Pinos located approximately 40 km from the city of Santo Domingo in the area of Villa Altagracia Jirbana birthing Streams and Sosua among others that are the main source to the aqueducts of Medina the Blade Loma Verde Dairy and soon to Brown.   CAUSE : we are needing basic products such as: purified water masks coronavirus test kits antibacterial gel to supply the northern part of the country that area of the country where we are located.   TIME : Time depends on you and as soon as possible your donations can be received to begin our beneficial work with the weights of scathers of resources.   BENEFITS : With the supply of purified water test kits antibacterial gel and masks we will prevent the contagion and spread of coronavirus in the northern areas preventing them from leaving their homes and taking advantage of the greatest of quarantine   OTHER WAYS : Everybody can contact us via email to make deliveries of items or cash which we will give them instructions later.   URGENCY : These donations depend on all of us to stop this pandemic as soon as possible and get on with our precious lives.   You want to donate?   The amount you want $10 $50 $100 $500 $2000 $5000 as much or little as you want! will be well received  Other ways to donate  (Applies only to Dominican Republic)   Do you have anything in good condition that you have? We welcome it and the Foundation is committed to it that it will reach the people who really need it.    Just contact us directly thru   GoFund ME ...  For more information about our foundation and all the charitable works we have completed you can visit our website.   http://www.fundacionlospinos.org.do/en/causes/succeed-stories.html     About us:   http://www.fundacionlospinos.org.do/en/about-the-foundation.html      Pictures:   http://www.fundacionlospinos.org.do/en/photos.html

title: Covid19 has Knocked  out my Work
description: Due to COVID19 my work as a personal assistant is at a halt.  I live paycheck to paycheck with a very small Soc. Security monthly payment. Therefore I will not have my April rent $885 and $299.31 car payment. For those who may consider donating $100 to me I can offer art in exchange. In particular I have 5 paper Artworks entitled “Scrolls”.  DENIM  6”wide x 6”deep x 14” long   In case there are Art Lovers interested in having a look at my work for purchase or commission consideration a good place to view my work is @lesley_haas on Instagram or  www.lesleyhaas.com    Any amount is welcome and I wish everyone Good Health and Strength!  With many thanks Lesley Haas

title: Kreem Team Covid-19 Survival Help!
description: To our amazing community! These uncertain times have us on our knees. The future is unknown the present is unsettling and life is just at a standstill. While business is still open (for now) most of my staff have second (sometimes third) jobs...all of which have shut down. And with now having to offer curbside pickup online ordering only the future for everyone at Kreems well-being may also be compromised...with shorter business hours comes a cut in working hours. Its becoming harder and harder to get supplies and people in the door so an inevitable closure (hopefully temporary) is foreseeable. I completely understand that each and every one of you is frightened for your future but Im reaching out with the hopes that there may be a handful of you out there that would be willing to lend a helping hand to my amazing girls! You have all been SO supportive throughout our two years (we turned two this past Monday- March 16th) of operation. And we want nothing more than to come back together as a team as a community once things get under control and the world is at a healthy and safe place!   Whatever money I raise here will 100% go to my staff members. Heres a little bit about them:  Marjorie and her  husband (they JUST got married) who has had his job at the ACE put on hold due to the situation depend on a dual income. Shes my one FULL-TIME badass employee whos hours will be affected. Also a cat mom to three!   Stephanie who is also the BEST aesthetician over at Grounded (who has also closed) is my mighty night-time shifter! She also JUST bought a house in Yucca with her mother and had big plans with this new step in her life!  Jessica also works at Smoking Burger who has also decided to close their doors. She just moved into a new apartment and has a beautiful BIG  dog (child) shes mama to.   Megan works two other jobs. Aveda in Palm Desert and the Street Fair every Thursday in Palm Springs. She JUST turned 21 and was finally looking forward to saving enough money to move out of her parents and be an independent woman!   And finally our newbie...Sammy! She drives out to Kreem allllllllll the way from Hemet where she had just moved in with her parents after having lived in LA for sometime but decided it was time to actually start saving some money. We all know how pricy LA can be and in the service industry...that can be a challenge.   ME Bianca Im not asking for a penny for myself just some help to keep my girls with me and ok!  I love my girls so much. This was the time of year we were all looking forward to making some money. Our busiest time of the season!! Of course I wish nothing more than health and well-being for the entire world but we also CANNOT WAIT to open back up hug you and THANK YOU for all your support and love!   And dont forget if you have other favorite places in town check in with them. We all have to get through this TOGETHER!    So much love  Bianca

title: AIUTA GLI OSPEDALI DEL VENETO CONTRO IL COVID19
description: Questa raccolta fondi è stata avviata dopo aver avvisato la regione del Veneto.    Durante la donazione è possibile azzerare la commissione destinata alla piattaforma GoFundMe selezionando “altro” e poi digitando 0€    Al termine della raccolta fondi avremo cura di condividere i documenti che certificano lavvenuta donazione alla regione Veneto.    ULTERIORI INFORMAZIONI    Chi sono  Mi chiamo Anacleto Comin ho 67 anni e risiedo in provincia di Treviso. Sono il fondatore ed il presidente del gruppo editoriale Sphera Holding.    SPHERA HOLDING  si occupa di comunicazione ed intrattenimento fanno parte del gruppo molte agenzie di comunicazione e diverse emittenti: -       Radio Company e Radio Company TV -       Radio 80 -       Radio Padova -       Radio Easy Network -       Radio Wow -       Radio Valbelluna   Assieme al mio team di lavoro ed alla fondazione  CASA AI COLLI ONLUS  abbiamo deciso di mettere in piedi questa raccolta fondi per aiutare le persone a donare in maniera più semplice delle somme di denaro alla nostra regione che si trova a fronteggiare la pandemia di Coronavirus una situazione senza precedenti.   Siamo convinti che alcuni potenziali donatori potrebbero preferire fare una donazione che sia garantita dalla radio con cui sono cresciuti e che ascoltano fedelmente tutti i giorni specialmente se chi è dietro al progetto si palesa come sta facendo il sottoscritto.   Ritengo che lunione tra la forza comunicativa delle emittenti (se siete ascoltatori avrete già sentito gli spot di questa raccolta in onda sulle radio) e lagevolezza delle donazioni fatte tramite carta di credito possa massimizzare il risultato per la nostra regione.     Questa raccolta fondi fa parte delliniziativa “ IOSCELGOVENETO ” di cui potete trovare i dettagli su www.ioscelgoveneto.com    Il nostro rapporto con le parti per cui stiamo raccogliendo i fondi  Prima di istituire la campagna il giorno 20 marzo 2020 abbiamo contattato a mezzo pec.  gli uffici preposti della regione per metterli a conoscenza del progetto.   Come saranno spesi i fondi  Le somma raccolta sarà utilizzata dalla Regione Veneto per sostenere le strutture ospedaliere che sono in prima linea per fronteggiare lemergenza.   Il nostro piano di prelievo per ottenere i fondi dalla campagna al beneficiario  La piattaforma GoFundMe applicherà le seguenti commissioni predefinite: tratterrà dal trasferimento il 29% del totale e 025€ per donazione.  Entro fine Aprile ci occuperemo di effettuare il trasferimento dei fondi sul conto corrente intestato alla fondazione CASA AI COLLI ONLUS la quale trasferirà a sua volta lintera somma ricevuta sul conto corrente bancario aperto dalla Regione Veneto per fronteggiare lemergenza Coronavirus   Completata loperazione renderemo conto dei documenti che attestano la donazione tramite questa pagina e tramite i social delle radio.

title: Catonium Corona Survival Fund
description: Catonium Corona Survival Fund  Wie viele von Euch wissen wurde das Catonium im Jahre 2007 als Heimat für unsere internationale BDSM   Fetisch Szene der wir auch selbst angehören gebaut um einen weiteren aufregenden Begegnungsort zu schaffen.   Zu Beginn war das Catonium nur zur Hälfte fertiggestellt und eingerichtet. Die andere Hälfte war im Zustand des Rohbaus. Vieles haben wir seitdem step by step fertiggestellt weiterentwickelt und verändert. Wir haben aus dem laufenden Betrieb immer wieder Neues geschaffen Altes renoviert und für unsere Gäste attraktiver gestaltet.   Die Überschüsse wurden somit über die vielen Jahre reinvestiert. Dadurch war es uns nicht möglich Rücklagen zu bilden und uns auf eine solche Krisensituation vorzubereiten.  Die Schließungsverfügung der Hamburger Gesundheitsbehörde für voraussichtlich viele Wochen vielleicht Monate  die wir mit einer Absage unserer letzten Party aus Gründen der Vorsorge für unsere Besucher bereits vorweggenommen haben  trifft uns hart. Der viel zitierte Rettungsschirm liegt noch zusammen geklappt in der Ecke die vollmundig angekündigten „Bazooka“  Hilfsmaßnahmen von Herrn Olaf Scholz stehen noch nicht bereit.  Kurz gesagt wir kämpfen ums Überleben. Wir haben insgesamt ca. € 15.000 -- monatliche Fixkosten die wir aufbringen müssen. Dazu gehören Baudarlehen Strom Energie Versicherungen etc. Dagegen stehen durch die Schließung keinerlei Einnahmen.   Wie ihr euch vorstellen könnt kämpfen wir mit all unseren Möglichkeiten darum das Catonium für uns alle vor allem aber für unsere von Arbeitslosigkeit bedrohten Mitarbeiter zu erhalten. Unser Herzblut steckt im Catonium dass in Europa einzigartig ist.    Wir wünschen uns dass wir das Catonium über diese große Krise hinweg retten können. Wir wissen nicht wann staatliche Hilfe greifen wird um uns vor der Insolvenz zu bewahren.  Es hat uns deshalb sehr berührt von euch nicht nur so viel Anteilnahme und Zuspruch zu erhalten sondern auch gefragt worden zu sein wie geholfen werden und ob nicht auch im Sinne eines „Funding Circle“ gespendet werden kann. Deshalb haben wir diesen Spendenfond eingerichtet.  Ob ihr € 100 oder mehr spendet alles kann uns helfen das Catonium und seine Mitarbeiter über die Monate der Schließung zu bringen und wieder da zu sein wenn bessere Zeiten kommen.  Bis dahin - bleibt bitte gesund! Folgt den Anweisungen der Regierung und haltet sie ein! Es macht trotz aller Sorgen Sinn.  Wir freuen uns auf eine hoffentliche Zeit danach und darauf euch alle bei einer Wiedereröffnungs-Party begrüßen zu können!   Euer Catonium Team

title: UKIM Madina & Neeli Masjid COVID-19 Relief Fund
description: Food for the Elderly   Needy  The government has advised elderly people to stay isolated and avoid leaving their homes because theyre particularly at risk from COVID-19. As well as vulnerable families who are struggling in this uncertain time.  This leaves millions of people alone and unable to get food and essentials – many dont know how to order food online or cannot afford to do so. Were supporting older people in the area who need food supplies during isolation.  Well be giving vulnerable elderly people food packs.

title: Support Your Local Barbershop
description: Well folks here we are asking our community for help. As some of you may know small businesses like ours run on very small margins and closing down for two weeks for the COVID-19 Virus would devastate us.  We would be eternally grateful for any donation at this time.

title: Desarrollo contra Covid19 (CSIC)
description: El Coronavirus en España nos esta causando uno de las mayores retos si no el mayor de toda la historia de nuestro país. Los médicos y científicos están haciendo un trabajo muy importante por ello nos gustaría ofrecerles todo el apoyo posible.   Desde el Centro Nacional De Biotecnología (CSIC) se está trabajando sin descanso en un fármaco que pueda ayudar a parar esta pandemia.   De esta manera la donación integra ira destinada para esta investigación y su desarrollo.   Somos un conjunto de dj productores residentes en España. Presentaremos cada dá nuestro  trabajo en la plataforma  Instagram . ( @yomequedoencasadj )  https://www.instagram.com/yomequedoencasadj   De esta manera queremos ayudar en la  lucha contra el  Covid19.   Tú también puedes ayudar.  Dona y comparte.     #YoAyudoDesdeCasa  #YoMeQuedoEnCasa #YoMeQuedoEnCasaDj

title: Relief for families and students amid COVID19
description: I am working to help fundraise money for the families of my students who are financially affected by the COVID19 pandemic. I am a 3rd grade teacher in a Title One school in SFUSD. During this time of uncertainty and financial strain many of my students families are struggling financially as their jobs have been suspended schools have been cancelled and rent and other necessities are placing strain on them. I feel it is my duty to try to assist these families in their time of need. I believe this distribution of funds will most likely look different depending on the amount of money earned in GoFundMe;    Tier 1 ($2000) : With your gracious donation I will assist all families with Safeway gift cards to make sure that families are able to stay healthy and well. We are working as a school to provide 13 students families with a $150 gift card for each family. This will be based off of the highest need at the school at this time.    Tier 2 ($4000) : I would be able to reach out to other teachers in my community to distribute more gift cards to the greater population. We are currently compiling information about families financial and sustainable needs at this time and will be able to support families with food household essentials and internet access during remote school learning.   Tier 3 ($6000+) :  With more money we will be able to reach more families within the communities! I will work with other teachers and my principal to bring financial support to families most in crisis at this moment. We are currently working on figuring out if we can get electronic devices for students who do not currently have one in their home. With your generous donation we will be able to supply some families with electronic devices so they will be able to keep up with their studies and education at home. Bringing electronic devices to students will also help to combat boredom many students face at this time of uncertainty.   I have already done some fundraising and have been able to give some gift cards to families and they have told me how much of a difference they have made in their lives. Most of my students live in single guardianship households who sometimes work up to three jobs to try to make ends meet. Some of my students live in transitional housing newly provided by the state. With the imminent news of further closures and school shut downs the fear and worry have set in that there is a possibility that families will no longer be able to make rent among other things. The students at my school who participate in the free lunch program usually dont eat lunch because they dont like the selections provided by the district. Even though there is free food distributed by the district I know that my families are not taking advantage of it because of the selections being minimal. With your help I will work to directly support families in most need at this time. While in this time of need gathering around the table for a home cooked meal and spending time with family without the worry of where your next meal will come from will make all the difference. Please consider helping the community and giving directly to families in most need at this time. Thank you for reading!

title: COVID-19: Medical elements: Ibagué Colombia
description: Hello my friends   Sadly Colombia does not have the same efficient health system as many of the countries facing this crisis. The virus just arrived to my home city and the medical staff unfortunately does not count with the protection required to protect themselves and stay safe while facing this emergency.   I kindly ask you for your help so we can help the public hospital (Hospital Federico Lleras Acosta) to provide them with the proper implements. I know this sounds crazy but sadly this is the reality in a small city in Colombia. I count on all of you to help me protect my dad and all the heroes from the medical staff.  EVERY LITTLE HELP HELPS :) !  Thank you very much for your support! God bless you all!  ------------------------  Hola amigos  Lamentablemente Colombia no tiene el mismo sistema de salud eficiente que muchos de los países que enfrentan esta crisis. El virus acaba de llegar a mi ciudad natal y el personal médico lamentablemente no cuenta con la protección necesaria para protegerse y mantenerse a salvo mientras enfrentan esta emergencia.  Les pido amablemente su ayuda para que podamos ayudar al hospital público (Hospital Federico Lleras Acosta) a proporcionarles los implementos adecuados y suficientes. Sé que esto suena loco pero tristemente esta es la realidad en una pequeña ciudad de Colombia. Cuento con todos ustedes para ayudarme a proteger a mi padre y a todo los héroes del personal médico.   Igualmente si alguien puede donarlos en Colombia por favor contacten a mi hermano o a mi!   - Tapabocas con válvula 3M: Ref 9332 - Trajes de aislamiento completo Tyvek: talla M L XL (Delta Plus: DT221)   malejandrapatino@gmail.com    andresfp30a@gmail.com    TODO PESO CUENTA  :) !   Infinitas gracias y que Dios se los multiplique !

title: Help AGAYD Survive COVID-19
description: A Girl and Your Dog has closed in response to the COVID-19 pandemic. We made the very difficult decision to discontinue regular schedules in an effort to help reduce our spread of this disease. As with everyone else we are experiencing an unprecedented situation where life as we know it has been completely and abruptly changed.   Surviving financially in the Bay Area is a challenge in the best of times and this time were now experiencing is beyond the scope of any adjective. Our highest priority are our employees who you and your dogs all know and love. We need them to be here with us through this horrific time and for them to be here for you and your dogs when this is all over. We have been working around the clock trying to figure out how to keep our team safe healthy housed and fed during this time of uncertainty and we need your help. The $30000 we are hoping to raise will help ensure our ability to keep Erika Julie Mai Melissa and Veronica financially stable while we make our way through the effects of this pandemic the timeline of which no one can predict.   It seems true that times of unimaginable crisis do have silver linings some of which are already starting to appear. Many of our current clients have been able to commit to continuing their tuition through this uncertain time helping guarantee that we will be there for all of you when we are able to resume. Many of our alumni clients have reached out to ask how they can help us during this crisis. Your ongoing sustaining support surpasses anything we could imagine and we are grateful beyond measure for your unparalleled generosity.   We cant express strongly enough how much we already miss your dogs and our gratitude to all of you for being a part of our family. Our most heartfelt thanks for any support you can provide our team through this emergency fundraising effort.   So much love and thanks ??   Charlie and Caroline

title: Help COVID-19 Coming Together - Vancouver
description: We are reaching out to the Vancouver community in light of the unprecedented impact that COVID-19 is having on our most vulnerable communities in the Greater Vancouver area.    As COVID-19 unfolds it has been highlighting the way pandemics disproportionately and unevenly impact different populations such as migrants racialized people people with precarious work or insecure housing poor people disabled people and elders. The current situation is creating an unprecedented threat to many of the most vulnerable community members in our beautiful city.   And so we decided to take action. We did so by creating a Facebook group to connect those in need with those able to offer help. The reaction has been overwhelming. We have already reached  20000 community members  ...in just 4-days. The group has seen vulnerable people from across the Greater Vancouver area post their urgent requests: requests for food and medicine delivery; financial assistance; need for sanitary products; asks for baby products; links to credible advice and government support services and posts from folks who are simply scared and asking for (virtual) companionship during this time. Their stories and testimonies highlight the ways in which people across our community are in need of our support right now.    We as members of this community have the power to reach out to our neighbours and help build community support going forward. Now more than ever it is important that we work to build networks of solidarity and support vulnerable and targeted communities.    Our platform is having an impact. We have been able to help connect thousands of neighbours in need with those able to offer support. We have also been involved in supporting the creation of 11 other similar groups across Canada and the USA using a Mutual Aid Framework that underpins this community work including groups operating in Squamish Victoria and New Orleans.   This GoFundMe campaign is a call to the Vancouver Technology sector for your support first given your ability to move quickly as we build messaging to widen the fundraising appeal to the general population.   Where will the money you donate go?  We will be funding up to $50 (per request) for grocery / supply home deliveries.  This is for immediate relief funding  and will supplement the governments recently announced  Emergency Care Benefit package  for individuals that  starts in early April 2020.  Our team will be assessing requests from the community group and making donations to Vancouver individuals and families in need.  We will be also directly giving cash support to undocumented and precarious workers who are bearing the brunt of this social crisis.   Who are we?   We are regular folks in Vancouver who have been active in various organizing campaigns mutual aid work and more importantly in community with each other. This is a result of love for community. We are a collective of volunteers not a non-profit. That means no overhead every dollar is going towards groceries supplies and direct support.  *Credit and Gratitude to the Seattle Mutual Aid Solidarity Network for providing a great fundraising framework for us to copy.  ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------   Example testimony from a community member served via COVID-19 Coming Together (Vancouver) - used with their consent     Chase Gray had their request resolved a few days ago:     “Hey yall hope ya doin ok!  So Im finding myself extremely anxious about food right now. Im an indigenous trans and disabled dad of 1 and were on disability and living in abbotsford which is far from a lot of community for me. My partner and I just spent a week in victoria so that I could attend a doula training workshop there ( because of the pandemic I have to pause so many of my career plans ) and before that we definitely didnt buy any food and we ate all the perishables and stuff so that we didnt leave anything behind to go bad. As soon as we got home (wednesday) we all felt like garbage and some of yall probably saw my post begging for baby tylenol so for a little while we didnt have much of an appetite so the lack of food wasnt a huge deal.  Well were on the mend now. Except for the fact that people are going absolutely bat shit with food hoarding. And the fact that we have like less than 10$ to our name until friday.  If anybody has some extra cash to spare so that we can hit up a butcher and produce store before child tax so that we actually have some food in this house it would be really appreciated we want to just wait until friday but I keep seeing pictures of empty shelves and imagining what its going to be like on friday. I wont even be able to go shopping with my partner to get the things we need Im coughing way too much and we really fear the crowds might give them sensory overload because of cheque day.  Luckily we are fully stocked for baby we have pretty much everything we need to last until next wednesday for him and even then well only need baby food pouches. But for us? Thats a whole different story I think we will need MAX $60 the butcher here has a really good pack of frozen food for 30$(some really good meats+eggs bread milk) so were definitely wanting one of those and the rest we would use for whatever non-frozen items we need.  Thank you for reading I hope everybody is doing well...  ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------   Who are we?  We are a group of concerned community members who have recently come together to help neighbours in need. The original members and fundraising lead are listed below but we acknowledge with gratitude the collective efforts of the many volunteers who are rapidly becoming a core part of this team.    Avery is an Autistic queer trans nonbinary Person of Colour youth who was adopted out of foster care. Avery is a multiply disabled wheelchair user who has been a lifelong advocate for numerous intersectional issues most recently in climate justice with Our Time: a national youth-led movement to bring an intersectional Green New Deal to Canada  Gabby is a first-generation settler on unceded Musqueam territories in her final year at UBC studying Environmental Science and Human Geography. She organizes with the UBC Social Justice Centre around housing justice environmental justice and community care.  Ishmam is a second-year student at the University of British Columbia. He organizes with the UBC Social Justice Centre.  Kate is a climate justice organizer born and raised on unceded Coast Salish territories. Alongside completing an undergrad in First Nations   Indigenous Studies at UBC Kate organizes with UBCc350 and Our Time Vancouver.  Ravi is a recent settler on these unceded stolen Musqueam territories. He is a Product Manager in the technology sector and has been living in Vancouver for the last 2-years.   Yolanda works between climate justice anticipatory humanitarian action and wilderness therapy. She welcomes any opportunity to build community and connect people to each other and to stories of social transformation.

title: COVID-19 Cancellation Relief - Matthew Timman
description: Hello everyone My name is Matthew Timman I am a Tucson AZ based percussionist who is a full-time music freelancer who works for orchestras throughout the American west. I am originally from Toledo OH and have lived in Tucson AZ since 2014. I received my doctorate of music in 2019 from the University of Arizona. I am a contracted player with the Flagstaff Symphony Sierra Vista Symphony North State Symphony and Rogue Valley Symphony. I additionally am a substitute/extra player for orchestras throughout Arizona.  I find myself in a situation which I never thought I would find myself. I never in my life thought I would be creating a GoFundMe asking for support in a time of crisis. I never thought I would be living through a global pandemic either.  Im sure youre aware that as a result of the COVID-19 pandemic congregations of large groups of people have been banned to stop the spread of the disease. For music freelancers like me that means a complete halt to work and a loss of all income. This hit me at a particularly vulnerable moment while I was trying to make a living and prepare for my planned wedding in June of 2020.  At this point it appears that I will be unemployed all of the way moving into the summer which is an Earth shattering loss for me.  I have set up this GoFundMe to try to assure that I would be able to pay my bills into May if cancellations continue.   At this time I have set the goal for $2750. If it were to somehow go past the goal which I have set I would work on trying to sending that money into larger relief funds for musicians and artists during this time.  Thanks for reading and considering giving. If you are unable to give please consider sharing this.  Best wishes -Matt

title: ATX Hospitality Relief Fund Amid COVID-19
description: Apply here for funds if you are a displaced hospitality industry worker    As we all come to terms with the health crisis here in Austin our vibrant and essential hospitality industry workers are also staring down the possibility of economic catastrophe.   Currently there is no 100% rent forgiveness and unemployment payments take time to arrive--and when they do the amount is often not enough to cover basic living costs in one of the most expensive cities in the nation. Folks who are laid off from jobs that also pay for their medical insurance may have to buy into COBRA or the open market which can be a devastating cost while relying on unemployment payments alone.    We have started a fund that can be accessed by workers whose hours have been curtailed because of this crisis and who are not being otherwise compensated.In order to distribute the funds weve created a short survey to help us prioritize those in our community most at-risk and in need. All information shared remains confidential. Our aim is to provide everyone who applies with emergency funds.     I think its important that all of you know who we are. Our names are Heather Emerson and Faiez Rana we are the owners of Prep to Your Door. Our team prepares and delivers organic locally sourced plant based meals to the Austin community week after week. The very core of our mission is community and responsibility.   This is the time for our community to step up and take care of our neighbors. In our best days Austin is a high vibration food and music capital of the world. This is our time as a community to live by our guiding values: to take care of those who take care of us every single day.   It matters how we survive this crisis--not only physically but soulfully and not only individually but as a community. Lets make sure wage disruption is minimal. Lets not let one group of people be the ones to pay the highest price for the well-being of our city.   Our country is looking to Austin to set the precedent for COVID-19 relief efforts. Lets show them how we take care of each other.  *We will not be using any of the funds to support Prep to Your Door costs. 100% of the funds will be used for emergency relief cash payments to those who need it most.   Our team includes Christina Lee Shane Kendall Yates Michael J Bird Nevia Lopez Katey Yurko and many more who are working incredibly hard to do what is right by our neighbors. STAY STRONG AUSTIN!

title: Roter Salon + Walzer + Rixdorf und Corona
description: Liebe Tango Community!    Auch ich muss leider unsere geliebten Tango Orte auf Grund der  Corona Krise schliessen!  Da heisst für mich:  Kein Tango im Roten Salon  Kein Tango im Walzer Linksgestrickt  Kein Tango im Ballhaus Rixdorf  Kein Unterricht mehr     Bis dahin bitte ich Euch mich mit einer  Spende zu unterstützen bis  wieder miteinander tanzen können.  Als Dankeschön plane ich eine virtuelle Milonga für die nächste Woche und halte euch natürlich mit Neuigkeiten auf dem Laufenden!  Euer Micha

title: Red Raven Espresso Parlor COVID-19 Relief
description: The Red Raven Espresso Parlor has been a worker-owned community hub coffee shop safe space and all ages music venue for going on 15 years now. Over the years we have done a series of events workshops festivals and more to benefit various causes and people. We care about community and we hope that has shown.  Due to recent events regarding COVID-19 we have had to close down shop for the time being and just like many small worker-owned businesses we are worried about costs. We have started this campaign in order to have a safety net for the time we will be existing without revenue and also as an outlet to attempt to pay our employees some amount while they cannot work.  We would like to offer you something in return upon reopening if you do opt to donate to us (please write your names on your donation):  -If you donate under $1-$20 we will give you a free coffee and monster cookie  -If you donate $20+ we will give you 5 free coffees and 10% off all coffee and drink purchases beyond that until Aug. 1 2020  Please consider us if you can. We greatly appreciate your support. Well see you as soon as we can. Stay safe.

title: Get Sahara Lounge Through This!
description: The City of Austin has closed clubs and bars for about 6 weeks until May 1.  We are looking at about $20K in overhead/expenses with no bar sales income during that time.     We know many of our customers and supporters are also in a stressful time financially. However if you are in a position to contribute it is much appreciated!! We look forward to re-uniting with our community in May.   Thank you for your love and support.  Eileen   Topaz

title: Virtual Field Trips for Covid 19 Captive Kids
description: With schools closed because of Covid 19 I am working to find ways to keep learning engaging for my 4th grade public school students as we move to distance learning. While they are home from school (following the Governors orders) Ill continue to provide instruction.   The majority of the students at my school come from economically challenged families. Despite dramatic growth in the last few years these children still lag behind students in other parts of the state in academic testing.  They are best motivated to work hard at learning through interesting activities and through personal relationships with their classmates and teachers. They trust me and rely on me to help make learning relevant.   Though we are restricted from gathering together it is possible for me to bring experiences to them. I plan to send videos of demonstrations and experiences with the students through Google Classroom. I want the videos to be engaging so that students will CHOOSE to connect with the learning in their homes where other activities may easily distract them. I am planning to connect traditional reading math writing science and social studies work to the videos I can create. There may be cooking demonstrations (with measurement and other math topics) visits I can go on where they can accompany me via video (nature visits community services and other places where one teacher can travel where a full class would be prohibited) and there will be video of me doing lessons that I can post to Google Classroom or a YouTube channel for them.  I am looking for funds for:  - a medium quality Go Pro Hero Camera        $399.99 - portable tripod and mounting equipment        94.98 - extra battery and charger                                          49.99 - cloud storage for videos                                              50.04                                                                       Total                $595.00  We are in unprecedented times. I take my responsibility to my students very seriously. I am working hard to find ways to motivate them as soon as I can. I am ready to begin providing engaging lessons as soon as I have the equipment I need!   Thank you for any help you can provide!

title: COVID-19 Crisis Fund to Save Bioparque Amaru
description: http://www.zoobioparqueamaru.com/   Bioparque Amaru is desperately trying to save its animals from starvation in the midst of the Coronavirus outbreak in Ecuador. The park stands to lose at least $36000.00 for every month that it remains closed during the COVID-19 outbreak. An average month brings $40000.00 in visitor entrance fees to support the park.   The animals will not survive if they do not have a minimum supply of food and medicine during this time. The situation requires action now because we cannot postpone feeding and caring for the animals that are being sheltered at the biopark. Without our help they will not be able to recover from the crisis later. There are more than 1000 animals at Amaru that need our help.     We know that everyone has been hit hard by COVID-19 and the associated shutdowns around the world. However we also have the unique opportunity to save this one-of-a-kind organization in Cuenca.   Bioparque Amaru is a wildlife rescue organization and sanctuary for animals who have been orphaned injured and victims of illegal trafficking. Amaru rescued over 482 animals in 2019. On average Amaru is able to return 17% of rescued animals to their natural habitats. Animals that cannot be returned to the wild are provided with spacious living areas on the bioparks 1000+ acre property in Cuenca Ecuador.      The veterinarians and zookeepers at the zoo could also use your support. For more information on supporting the workers during this time you can write to us directly at nbecich@gmail.com.  As a way of rewarding you for your support we will be creating short videos to show the positive impact that your donations have on the parks wildlife. ALL donors will be eligible to receive a video. Furthermore gifts of more than $39.00 will be rewarded with an honorary park membership active a year from the date the donation was made. Members will receive a virtual tour of the biopark that they can watch safely from home.   If you do make it out to Amaru in the next year your membership will be honored for admission costs.  For everyones information these are the costs of visits and annual mememberships. You can act as a virtual visitor or buy a REAL functional year membership for yourself or your family if you donate at least these amounts.   Annual Membership for Individual: $39.00 USD Annual Membership for Family: $99.00 USD Adult Entrance Fee (18-64 years) $6.00 USD  (399Zoo+201C.C.R) Young Adult (13-17 years) $5.00 USD (350Zoo+150C.C.R) Kids (2-12 years) $4.00 USD (299Zoo+101C.C.R) Senior Special Entrance Fee (65+ years) 300 USD  Other monthly costs for the zoo and all its animals:  Salaries of all employees: $23000 Lunch provided for all employees and volunteers: $1000 Government Employee Health Insurance Fees: $2000 Utilities:  $2500 Fruit (animal diets): $3000 Formulated Zoo Diets: $600 Meat for Carnivorous Animals: $3000 Assorted Other Dietary Items: $1200 Veterinary Drugs and Treatment Costs: $1000 = $35300 total average monthly operating costs        Thank you all for your help and support in these trying times. The animals rely on us to keep them healthy and well fed! Together we can help Amaru avoid the worst of this crisis.    All the best  Bioparque Amaru Zoo Team Nikki Becich DVM Noah Foster-Koth Zoo Collaborator and Publications Editor Ernesto Arbeláez Ortiz Director Ejecutivo y de Conservación Victoria Arbeláez Ortiz Directora Administrativa y Operativa Amanda Vega Toral Directorio Administrativo

title: Emergency Help For Our Employees Due to COVID 19
description: Due to the COVID 19 virus and the mandatory shutting down of all 6 of our restaurants weve been forced to lay off all of our employees. We are extremely worried about our lower wage employees (our cooks dishwashers bus people runners porters etc.)  and their ability to ride out this virus. These are people that show up each and every day and work hard with a smile on their faces. These are the most vulnerable among us and many of them have families to care for. We want to do what we can to make sure they have food to feed their kids when there are limited other resources for them to take advantage of at this time.  If youve ever come to any of The Mermaid Inn locations Sirenetta or JG Melon on MacDougal St. please consider chipping in any amount you may be able to afford. We would be forever grateful and we know our employees would be as well.  Please pass this on to anyone you think may be willing to help. Were all in this together.  Danny Abrams and Cindy Smith

title: Support GCB staff during COVID-19 shutdown
description: The GCB is an irreplaceable part of the community at Brown University and on the East Side of Providence. Due to COVID-19 and the response by the Rhode Island government the bar has had to close down for at least two weeks. I started this fundraiser to try to help support the staff of the GCB during this difficult and uncertain time.  I know there are lots of people hurting right now and there are lots of really important and worthwhile fundraisers going on including to support the hospitality industry in RI in general. I really encourage you to consider supporting those too. But the reason why I wanted to add this fundraiser is because the GCB is a special place to me and I wanted to try to help the amazing staff there in some small way. I bet that some other folks out there feel the same way.  If you are a current or former GCB customer please consider chipping in a few bucks. Think of the tips you would be leaving for your bartenders if the bar was still open---even a couple of dollars will help the GCB staff to support themselves and their families while they are missing their wages and tips. This time of year up to graduation would be the busiest time of year for the bar and so this is an especially tough time to be closed.  This fundraiser is organized by me in a private capacity and not the GCB or GCB staff. I was a grad student at Brown and I now teach at Providence College. For the past few years Ive volunteered to run a monthly pub quiz at the GCB but Im not on the staff so none of this money is for me. My plan for any money we raise is to send it to the manager of the GCB so that they can distribute it to the staff in way that they think is fair based on need and lost income.   Thank you so much for reading and I hope you consider chipping in.

title: El Barrio Employee Covid-19 fundraiser
description: The Birmingham community has been affected in many ways by the Coronavirus. El Barrios dining room was required to shut down in an effort to keep our employees and Birmingham safe. Thankfully El Barrio is still able to take carryout orders but staffing has been reduced by 90%. Because of this most employees are without income for the duration of this outbreak. We are made up of a supportive team that includes single moms immune compromised individuals homeowners college students and those who love to see your friendly faces on a weekly basis. Birmingham has supported our workplace and mission for over 8 years and we are endlessly grateful! Stay safe out there as we all navigate our current reality. We love our community and are ready to tackle this together!        Warmly      The El Barrio Family

title: Feed children and elderly in COVID-19 affected NYC
description: After COVID-19 reached to New York City schools and businesses were closed leaving many people jobless and children without access to childcare and school provided meals.   To help our community overcome these hard times and to keep our children well nurtured we are offering free meals and juice daily to every child in need.   We extended the free meals to our elderly as well as many senior citizens live alone or have nobody to help them with food or groceries. Right now it is very hard to find enough food or other basic supplies in our local stores.   SOFRA will continue to support the community for as long as we can although as a local restaurant we are the first ones to be affected by the business restrictions. Our doors are open only for takeout and deliveries and the free meals we provide.   The way we treat our elderly children and animals the most vulnerable tells a lot about who we are.  We set up this gofundme page for the many people who wanted to contribute as well for this cause.  We are all in this together.     About Us:   We are a family owned-family run restaurant located in The Bronx NY established in 2017.   Everyone here is family and our costumers are also treated as such. Weve always been happy to give back to the community which also rewarded us with the best feedback and reviews across all social media Google Reviews and Yelp.   COVID-19 is hitting small restaurants like us the most but we will try to help our community for as long as we can.   Instagram: @sofranyc website: www.sofra-restaurant.com

title: COVID-19 Employee Relief Funds
description: If the kitchen is the heart of the home restaurants are the heart of our community. This has been a very difficult week and probably one of the hardest times we will have to face in our lifetime.  It was not an easy decision to have to lay off all of our employees- to be honest it is utterly heart breaking.  At south+pine and central+main we really pride ourselves in having created a family which starts with our staff. In this industry we spend more time at the restaurant than we do at home- more time with our co-workers than with our own families.  One of the reasons why I love this industry the most is because no matter whose restaurant you are in you make a built in family many of whom become life long friends. These people our family  are the true backbone of this business and many of them are suffering right now.  The scary part is that we do not know how long this will last.  I am asking that if you have anything available you donate it to our incredible team to help them through this. I know many people are suffering through this pandemic but anything would help to put into the pockets of our beloved team whom some of which are living pay check to pay check.  100% of the proceeds will be distributed among our staff.  Thank you in advance for your generosity.  I have been so moved by many of you reaching out to see how you can help or check on us. We hope this ends as quickly as it came and to have you back in our home as soon as possible.  My staff and I cannot thank you enough through these dark times. Please help spread the light that we all desperately need to see right now.  food+peace+love Leia Gaccione

title: Struggling Freelance Artist in COVID19 Crisis
description: Hi everyone  First off thank you so much for taking the time to read my story. My name is Hayley 24 from Los Angeles CA. I am a freelancer i.e modeling and content creator. For almost 2 years now full time I have made my lively hood from modeling and being an influencer. The road definitely has its ups and downs but Ive always managed to make it up until recent.   In the middle of December 2019 my roommate held me hostage for a series of 5 days which lead to her attempting to physically harm and attack me multiple times and her posting on social media about how she was planning on  murdering  me. After countless police filings due to said harassment and assaults I filed for eviction and restraining order and had to give her her rent and utilities money back for the month to get her to evacuate the property which cost me my entire savings account with all the legal paper work involved.   After multiple bad roommate placements early January I took this as a sign to finally start my small business (a home recording studio) something I was planning on doing for a while but didnt think was possible. After help from a friend and completely maxing out all my credit cards over their limits I invested literally everything I had and launched my small business the middle of February! By the end of February I started expressing “strep throat” like symptoms which overnight became drastically different with fever chills and I could not get out of bed. From February 18th till March 14th I was in and out of the hospital being misdiagnosed and not medicated properly. March 14th it was declared that I had Bronchitis that was turning into pneumonia.   (A little before the COVID outbreak) I closed my home recording studio business during this time (two weeks after its opening) and had to cancel all modeling work because my unknown sickness. In that time in order to get money for medical bills I took out the only loan my banks would let me take out which didnt even cover all the medical costs or help me get by on bills. By the time I was properly diagnosed COVID19 was announced a pandemic and my inhalers and medications that cost me $5 with insurance now cost me $110 with insurance and that day I had to walk away without filling my prescriptions.   During this time I started noticing cancelations left and right and by March 13th my entire 8 weeks of bookings were canceled with all my businesses and I had already been out of work for 3 weeks between all my businesses whether it was modeling content creating and the home recording studio.
