You can call ahead to place an order (510) 479-3185. We are working on setting up a way to order ahead online by the end of this week.    Consider buying merch or a gift card!   Ale Industries curbside will be operating from 12-7PM as E10th Street will be well lit during this time window. We would love to see your faces (from a safe distance) and the immediate cash provides us with a bit of relief during this crunch.     Same day delivery or UPS shipping through Bevv   If leaving home isnt an option we have partnered with Bevv to provide same day delivery within Oakland as well as UPS shipping to CA WA AK and FL. Its easy and similar to your preferred food delivery service.    Visit  aleindustries.bevv.com   and check out our list of available items.   Once an order is placed a driver will come to our curbside for pick-up.  You will receive a confirmation once your driver arrives.   Please consider tipping your driver!  Shipping outside of Oakland will take 2 - 3 business days to package and ship.     Shop Ale Industries While Stocking Up   It is recommended not to leave home other than stocking up for essential groceries. If you find yourself needing to restock you can find multiple Ale Industries products in select Costco Whole Foods Safeway and Trader Joes locations. Reach out if you have any questions about the select locations.     Donate to our GoFundMe   For every contribution you will receive towards an Ale Industries gift card that you can use at our curbside the taproom and our event space (once we are able to operate the latter two).     $1-50 contribution:   **Gift card for the same amount to be used in our taproom    $50 contribution:   **You will recieve a $50 gift card  **Your name will appear on the label of a 16oz can release once we are fully operational. You will be cast a vote to choose the name style and ABV of this beer during a unique taproom event.     $100 contribution:   If you donate $100 youll get the same perks for the can release in addition to your name being added on a plaque to be proudly displayed in our taproom forever. You will be cast a vote to name this plaque during a unique taproom event.    $500+ contribution:   If you donate $500+ youll get the same perks for the can and the plaque in addition to actually collaborating on the beer with the team come brew day. We will take measures to make sure its a convenient safe healthy and fun learning experience. There will also be a special area of recognition with your name on the plaque we will display in our taproom.    Notes about this gofundme:   This gofundme is being run on part-owner Casey Cobbs gofundme account. Proceeds from this gofundme will go 100% to the operating costs of running our Oakland CA brewery and taproom through the COVID19 crisis.     Whats Next?   We take each day at a time and keep moving forward. Well announce a couple of collaboration projects with members of our community during the Shelter in Place in the coming days. Stay tuned! We will continue to take all necessary safety precautions and closely monitor the health of our team.  Please remain home stay safe and remember that we are all globally in this together. You are not alone and there will be an end to this. We will continue to follow our passion to brew for our community as long as we can and we are not done yet! Thank you so much for your time.    Sincerely   The Ale Industries Team

title: Material para combatir covid-19 Hospital Bellvitge
description: La falta de material de protección (también escasean guantes gafas batas…) está poniendo contra las cuerdas al sistema sanitario cuyos profesionales lamentan que no pueden atender en condiciones a los enfermos o a los sospechosos de estarlo. Hay al menos 455 sanitarios contagiados

title: She Lost Everything During COVID-19
description: This fundraiser is dedicated to a woman who lost everything in an unforeseen fire which happened when she was out of the house. Her belongings were burned in the fire and she even lost her beloved pets - as we know this can be like losing family members. She is not able to recover any of the financial or material costs effectively making her homeless. We are reaching out to you because we want to help this woman in a time of tragedy and distress especially considering the COVID-19 pandemic that is forcing people into lock-down. She does not have the ability to shelter herself from the virus or secure an income to improve her situation.  Shes a kindred spirit who thinks of others is humble and kind and is warm and loving as a friend.  She had cats and all her otherworldly possessions safely in her house. Imagine coming home one day and realizing you have lost everything including your pets. It is in crazy times like these that we need to look out for each other. Open your hearts and please donate whatever amount you can.

title: Help The Barber Shop Staff During COVID-19
description: About Our Campaign   Unfortunately due to the spread of COVID-19 the state of Colorado has shuttered all salons and barbershops until at least April 30th to limit the spread of infection rates.  This means that all of our staff have no income for the next six weeks maybe longer. Being a small business we have no vacation or sick time to fall back on. We also fall through the cracks of most government aid and subsidies.   We are hoping that during this time of trouble our community can come together and help keep our staff from financial hardship. All of your donations will go directly to our out of work staff so they can keep themselves fed and pay their bills until we are able to return to work. Please help us stay on our feet during this time of need if you are able if you arent able to donate if you would please share this we would greatly appreciate anything you can do to help.  Thank you so much and we cant wait to see you all again soon! Your help means the world to us right now.   The Barber Shop   The Barber Shop Ltd is situated on East Colfax Avenue in Denver Colorado. We are in the middle of the Park Hill Mayfair Hilltop Montclair Hale Stapleton and Whittier neighborhoods and provide hair styling and cuts for men women and children.  ?  The Barber Shop Ltd is a newer member of the community and believes its diverse culture is the perfect place to call home. We opened just over two and a half years ago and have come to love all of our clients and we are proud to call them friends and neighbors.   Once this crisis passes we are looking forward to being a part of the community for years to come.   Meet Our Staff        Dianna  graduated from the Paul Mitchel of cosmetology and barbering in Wisconsin. She did 2 years of full service and has done barbering ever since 2014. She loves doing straight edge head shaves and fades. She has been in the beauty industry since 2011 and owns her own business so she understands how important it is for the client to have the best service and experience. Diana loves to laugh so please dont come in without a sense of humor :)      Sammi  was born and raised in Colorado. Shes been licensed since 2016 but has been doing home cuts and color since she learned how to hold clippers. She loves the details. Creating the perfect cut is her obsession. Her favorite part of being a barber ise having great conversations and getting to know her clients. Its not just a hair cut; its an experience.       Casaundra  went to cosmetology school in Missouri and has been doing hair for almost ten years. She started doing hair at thirteen when it was hard to find professional cuts that focused on edgy/alternative looks for herself and her friends. Today she specializes in mens and womens cuts fades and unique cuts. She believes in helping clients own their look through all stages to help ensure minimal awkwardness. Casaundras goal is to find or help create the perfect haircut for you and your lifestyle.

title: Nourish hospitality workers displaced by COVID-19
description: Will you help me nourish displaced hospitality workers?   COVID-19 has had a devastating effect on the hospitality industry and many service and retail businesses have been terribly affected too. What this means in real human impact is that thousands of people in Sydney alone have lost their jobs literally overnight. These are low income workers with little to fall back on. They cant pay their rent they cant buy groceries and they cant get jobs. Their industry just disappeared. These are also the people who have been working tirelessly to provide you with the dining-out experiences you love. Theyve also been cutting your hair doing your nails making your coffee and baking your croissants and now their livelihoods have simply evaporated overnight in silence. So I want to feed them. It so happens that I have an empty restaurant premises in Sydney right now and I want to open her doors again this time to offer a free meal to anyone from any industry who needs it as a result of job loss due to COVID-19. And I need your help. I am asking for:  1. Monetary donations to purchase food and supplies to fund a (delicious) soup kitchen operating for an initial two days a week from the Hearth   Soul Sydney premises  2. Donations of food disposable cutlery and bowls and takeaway packaging - drop off only at this stage please email me to arrange this. Food-wise I am initially planning on serving hearty soups so pulses lentils beans barley pasta veges (tinned or fresh) onions and garlic and meat and bones would be very welcome but really Ill take anything! Let me know what you have  - email me at hello@hearthandsoul.com.au  3. Volunteers to work for any amount of time you can on Tuesdays Wednesdays Thursdays or Fridays to help me whip up lovely nourishing pots of love for those who need it. We will need help with prep cooking serving and packing down/cleaning.   If you can help in any of these ways I would be so incredibly grateful. When I was caught up in the NYE fires I desperately wanted to do something to help the communities that were devastated (see my post a few days ago for THAT story). But the reality was that I was there on holiday I wasnt part of the local community and I could (and had to) leave. Of course I donated to all the relevant charities and we offered our assistance to every one of the locals we met in the evacuation centre. But there was very little practical help we could actually offer. This time its different. These are my people whose lives are being turned upside down. Several of the beautiful ladies who worked at Hearth are now facing incredibly uncertain futures. Weve opened our home to those that we can (and yes its that bad you try saving enough to fund an unknowable number of months rent on the average hospitality wage). And now I want to open my restaurant too.  Anything you can contribute will make a huge difference to these beautiful people who have nothing to fall back on. Please share this post with anyone in your network who may be able to assist and in any and all relevant COVID support forums. I will post an update on when we will open in a few days time - this will obviously depend on what we have to work with so Im putting the call out and well go from there  —— Obviously we will comply with any government and council food-service requirements for COVID. Im currently working through these: our service may be takeaway only although I am hoping to be able to accomodate people in-house too as there is a desperate need for community connection right now.  —— If for some reason announcements are made in coming days or weeks that would mean a soup kitchen is not viable any funds and supplies collected will be donated to a charity that is assisting people who are affected by COVID.

title: Covid-19 Emergency Funds for DTES
description: I am a volunteer and I have started this fundraising campaign in support of the organizing efforts of Carnegie Community Action Project.    Carnegie Community Action Project (CCAP) is raising funds for emergency COVID-19 support at Oppenheimer Park Tent City and other unhoused people in the DTES.   The funds will be used for:  -Food security for those impacted by closures of DTES services and food distribution networks -Communication and information distribution -Outreach + peer support -Hygiene and sanitation supplies -Storage + driving for donation pick up/drop off  Please keep reading to get an idea of why these emergency funds will save lives:    How can you self-isolate when you dont have a home? How do you wash your hands when you dont have a sink? Homeless residents and advocates are calling on government and public stakeholders to immediately and urgently provide a measured appropriate culturally-safe response to the COVID-19 pandemic to those who are unhoused and overlooked by current pandemic protocols.  Over a hundred people live in a tent city in Oppenheimer Park and many more visit daily. The last City of Vancouver Homelessness Count showed that there are over 1200* homeless people in the Downtown Eastside including 600* unsheltered (*an undercount). The City of Vancouver has just declared a Homelessness Emergency in the City of Vancouver.  In Oppenheimer Park there is no soap or hand sanitizer in the washrooms — and sometimes no washrooms at all. Running water is limited. Tent city residents and other homeless people often rely on crowded drop-in centres food line-ups and shelters with shared washrooms and showers. Many are immune compromised with chronic disease and disability and a high percentage are seniors. The vast majority dont have phones to call 811 for testing or help.  Existing resources are not equipped or prepared to meet pandemic-level needs and demands. Vancouver Coastal Health does not currently offer any formal services or outreach in Oppenheimer Park. Shelters and drop-ins are already overwhelmed and under-equipped to offer additional shower laundry and washing facilities. Other DTES programs are scrambling to pandemic-proof existing services especially for those who are most at risk.  Also please read this article by the Tyee:   The Ticking Time Bomb in the DTES

title: Youth-Link COVID-19 Fundraiser
description: As the world grapples with the unprecedented rise of novel coronavirus (COVID-19) cases medical professionals have struggled to find resources to care for patients. At hospitals all over Oregon shortages of face masks swabs and other protective gear leave doctors and nurses risking their lives to provide adequate treatment. The crisis has gotten so dire that Providence hospitals are resorting to asking volunteers to sew medical masks by hand for caregivers.   Youth-Link a student-led group striving to provide online education services for our local community during this unprecedented time has stepped forwards to lead the effort in supporting our doctors and nurses in this critical time of need.  Our goal is to raise $8000 to purchase 2000 surgery masks 2000 face shields and 2000 KN95 masks. We need your support more than ever. Already Oregon has more than 115 cases of COVID-19 and 3 deaths. Money and facemask donations during this time will allow doctors and caregivers to continue administering treatment to those in need.   Please help us spread the word by contributing today and by sharing this GoFundMe. Were all in this together.  Connect with Youth-Link on Instagram Facebook and Twitter: @youthlinkpdx

title: Meals to ER staff during COVID-19 crisis
description: The idea started small - support medical staff on the front lines provide business to struggling restaurants and rally the community together to boost morale. Our goal was to send 20 meals to the local ER for St Patricks Day and we needed $250.00 to reach goal. We reached out to friends family and Facebook groups in our community and first met then exceeded our goal within hours. To date we have sent over 250 meals and were not stopping now!   Mr. Rogers always said look for the helpers. Well this is a chance to BE the helpers. $24.00 sends (2) meals to medical workers on the front lines. Help us help our community! BE the helper and donate today.

title: Covid-19 relief fund for Bakes Place employees
description: Please join us in helping our hard working and dedicated staff at Bakes Place to get through the tough times! Thanks for being a loyal and faithful patron to Bakes Place - we wouldnt be where we are without you. Due to the devastating effects of Covid-19 and the  service industry shut down we have temporarily suspended operations in order to uphold our social responsibility. Unfortunately we had to lay our entire staff off due to the circumstances. We are helping them through the difficult times the best we can but for every day were closed their financial struggle gets worse. We know how much you all appreciate their amazing service smiles tasty food friendliness and commitment to providing all of you with great experiences when you visit Bakes Place. So we ask you to please consider donating whatever you find appropriate to help our staff through the struggle of unemployment. We know everyone is facing hardship right now so every penny matters - any amount of donation is greatly appreciated. 100% of the donations will be equally distributed among kitchen and service staff.

title: The Casual Cat Cafe: Covid-19 Support Fund
description: Hi Im Cindy Pennington the owner of The Casual Cat Cafe and Im reaching out to you guys for help.    The Casual Cat Cafe has been a place in the community where rescued cats can live cage free and enjoy a plethora of visitors to keep them company while waiting for their forever home for close to 3 years now. In that time we have been able to find loving forever homes for  234  kitties. We also provide a great public space for people to come chill and spend some stress-free time in the company of some of DFWs most eligible kitties! About a year and half ago we also expanded our services to include cat boarding. Being the cat lovers we are we opted to only open 3 kennels in order to allow them to be large and roomy (6ft x 4ft x 6.5ft - much larger than the average boarding kennel with dimensions around 2-3ft) and invested in kitty cameras so not only will kitty be as comfortable as possible during their vacation but pet parents can check in on them as often as theyd like.   Many may not know this but we have never turned a profit and with all the hours of love and elbow grease Ive personally poured into the business I have never paid myself a paycheck. For me it was never about money and it has always been about the cats and people. I always make sure my employees are paid our rent is on time and that there is no shortage of toys beds scratchers climbers and quality food for the kitties bellies.   However with the recent coronavirus outbreak we must close our cat lounge to the public and in doing so cut off our main source of revenue. The cat cafe operates with over $6000 a month in business expenses alone. This is in addition to the food litter toys and vet care expenses which are mostly covered by the nonprofit Casual Cat Charities. Below is a list of our monthly expenses to be as transparent with you as possible. It takes a lot to keep running and with little to no income coming in we wont be able to meet our ongoing expenses.        Here is where we ask for your help!     If you have ever visited our cat lounge and we were able to help bring a smile to your face if you love cats and  appreciate  what we do to help those in need or if you just like to support small local businesses please consider doing one of the following:  1. Support us with a donation to this Go Fund Me to help us keep up with our expenses in this very difficult time. Ive currently set the goal for $6000 or around 1 month of expenses  2. Check out our online store we are currently revamping it so you can purchase great cat themed products from a trusted local source.  Meowchandise    3. Donate to Casual Cat Charities whose funds are used specifically on cat care. However the charity currently has enough funds to keep up with the cats needs for a few more months  4. Sign up to volunteer with Casual Cat Charities to help us keep up with daily care of the cats.  Volunteer    5. Share share share! Please share our campaign so we can reach as many cat lovers as possible.   We love of community and all the sweet kitties we have been able to help so far. Your support means the absolute world to us!  Thank you!  Cindy The Catsociates and of course The Kitties The Casual Cat Cafe   Donations are not tax deductible

title: COVID-19 ENTRAIDE | COVID-19 SUPPORT
description: Le français suit.   COVID-19 COMMUNITY SUPPORT GROUP   Coordinators:    Lyse-Pascale Inamuco (Orléans)  Ray Chenier (Ottawa-South) Rashka Berrigan (Ottawa-Vanier)   Our target:  Vulnerable members of our community in Ottawa.   Marginalized newcomers low-income families single parent families people living with disabilities and seniors.    About us   This group was created when each individual realized that their efforts to raise money on their own to meet the needs and high demand in their community was not enough and was becoming overwhelming for one person to take on.  Lyse-Pascale Ray and Rashka decided to combine their efforts and asked others to join them as days go by so they could be more efficient and better organized.   Since their bi-weekly paycheck and retirement pension cannot allow them to meet the high demand in the community of Orleans Ottawa-Centre and Ottawa-Vanier mainly they are turnin to crowdfunding so that members of the community can have the opportunity to participate in this incredible show of kindness and solidarity.  Ray and Lyse-Pascale have been able to deliver food to approximately 30 people in two days.          Rashka has delivered more than 10 boxes. There is a waiting list of more than 15 people right now and we need your help to get these boxes out to them.      How do we proceed?    1.     Our new policy is to wear gloves and masks (we have not found enough for all of us).     2.     We do home deliveries but do not come to physical contact with the person we serve.      3.     We are also happy to accept gift certificates to put towards purchases. Please contact us on this page for pick up or drop off.  4.     We are happy to accept your nonperishable food donation.  5.        The cost of 1 box is $50-$70    depending on the size of the family. So if you choose to donate via Gofundme  THANK YOU! This will help us a lot.  Note that we keep a healthy distance with those we serve and leave the boxes at the door. Those of us who have masks wear them when delivering and shopping. We are trying our very best to look after our own safety.  Thank you very much for your support.   Managing Team   L R   R   ****  Voir les photos partagées ci-dessus.    GROUPE DENTRAIDE COMMUNAUTAIRE COVID-19   Coordinateurs:   Lyse-Pascale Inamuco (Orléans) Ray Chenier (Ottawa-Sud) Rashka Berrigan (Ottawa-Vanier)   Notre cible:  Les membres de notre communauté qui sont les plus vulnérables et qui résident à Ottawa.   Marginalisés nouveaux arrivants familles à faible revenue familles monoparentales personnes vivant avec un handicap et aînés.    Qui sommes-nous?    Ce groupe a été créé lorsque chaque individu sest rendu compte que ses efforts pour collecter de largent par lui-même pour répondre aux besoins et à la forte demande dans sa communauté ne suffisaient pas et devenaient lourd pour une personne.   Lyse-Pascale Ray et Rashka ont décidé dunir leurs efforts et ont demandé aux autres de se joindre à eux au fil des jours afin quils soient plus efficaces et mieux organisés.  Étant donné que leur salaire et leur pension de retraite aux deux semaines ne peuvent pas leur permettre de répondre à la forte demande de la communauté dOrléans dOttawa-Centre et dOttawa-Vanier ils se tournent principalement vers le financement participatif afin que les membres de la communauté puissent avoir la possibilité de participer dans cette incroyable démonstration de gentillesse et de solidarité.   Ray et Lyse-Pascale ont pu livrer de la nourriture à environ 30 personnes en deux jours. Rashka a livré plus de 10 boîtes. Il y a une liste dattente de plus de 15 personnes en ce moment et nous avons besoin de votre aide pour leur envoyer ces boîtes.    Comment procédons-nous?     1. Notre nouvelle politique est de porter des gants et des masques (nous nen avons pas trouvé assez pour nous tous hélas).  2. Nous livrons à domicile mais nentrons pas en contact physique avec la personne que nous servons.   3. Nous acceptons également volontiers les chèques-cadeaux que vous pouvez acheter et nous offrir en don. Veuillez nous contacter directement sur cette page en nous écrivant pour quon les ramasse ou pour arranger votre livraison de cartes.  4. Nous acceptons volontiers votre don de nourriture non périssable.  5.    Le coût dune boîte est de 50 $ à 70 $    selon la taille de la famille. Donc si vous avez choisi de faire un don via Gofundme  MERCI!  Cela nous aidera beaucoup.     Veuillez noter que nous gardons une distance saine avec ceux et celles que nous servons et laissons les boîtes à la porte. Ceux dentre nous qui ont des masques les portent lors de la livraison et de lachat de la nourriture. Nous faisons de notre mieux pour assurer notre propre sécurité.   Merci beaucoup pour votre soutient.   Équipe de coordination  L R   R

title: COVID-19 Aiutiamo la Medicina di Dolo (VE)
description: Dal 15 marzo 2020 lospedale di Dolo in provincia di Venezia è diventata un COVID-Hospital.La Medicina dispone di 67 posti letto per pazienti positivi al virus o sospetti. Il nostro obiettivo è quella di raccogliere fondi per supportare il reparto. Il sostegno alla gente che si prende cura dei nostri cari malati è importante.I fondi saranno tutti devoluti direttamente al reparto di Medicina di Dolo.Grazie a tutti coloro che vogliono offrirci il loro aiuto!

title: Fronteggiamo il nemico invisibile Covid-19
description: Un semplice gesto di solidarietà può fare la differenza!  Fronteggiamo insieme il nemico invisibile Covid-19    Fai una donazione anche tu! Anche 5€ possono fare la differenza   Aiutiamo insieme gli ospedali italiani!  Tutti i soldi raccolti verranno devoluti in parti uguali ai seguenti ospedali: -Trento ospedale  S.Chiara   -Milano ospedale  S.Raffaele  -Roma ospedale  Spallanzani   -Napoli ospedale  Cotugno   -Cagliari ospedale  Santissima Trinità    Stiamo affrontando un momento catastrofico il mondo combatte incessabilmente contro un nemico invisibile. Il suo nome è Covid-19 sembra inarrestabile!   Tante le vittime  tante le persone che stanno lottando contro la morte.   Il sistema sanitario viene messo a dura prova incessabilmente! Servono nuove risorse!    Tutti i medici gli infermieri e i nuovi laureandi in medicina stanno combattendo in prima linea con tutte le loro forze!  Tutti loro sono  I NOSTRI EROI!   Ognuno di noi può contribuire!  È arrivato il momento di lottare contro il nemico invisibile!   In quale modo possiamo contribuire?   -Stare a casa  -lavorare a distanza  -prendere tutte le precauzioni come indicato dalle disposizioni nazionali    questo può bastare per salvare il nostro paese?  Forse non è abbastanza!    Il sistema sanitario ha bisogno al più presto di nuove attrezzature per fronteggiare lemergenza!     Contribuisci anche tu!     Insieme ce la faremo! Grazie a tutti voi per la vostra generosità Marcello Marotta      Thx to  IGS Powerful Life Per ogni articolo sportivo venduto tramite  www.igssport.com  verrà donato 1€ a questa speciale raccolta fondi.   --------------------------------------------------------    You can make the difference  with just a small gesture of  solidarity . Lets face  together  the invisible enemy Covid-19   Donate! ...even just 5€ can make the difference    Lets help together the Italian hospitals !   All donations will be shared between the following hospitals: -Trento Hospital S.Chiara -Milano Hospital S.Raffaele -Roma Hospital Spallanzani -Napoli Hospital Cotugno -Cagliari Hospital Santissima Trinità   Thx for your help  Marcello Marotta    --------------------------------------------------------  ¡Un simple gesto de solidaridad puede marcar la diferencia!  Nos enfrentamos juntos al enemigo invisible  Covid-19  Haz una donación!    Tambien 5€ puede hacer la diferencia.   ayudamos juntos a los hospitales italianos!!!  todo el dinero recaudado se destinará en partes iguales a los siguientes  hospitales : -Trento Hospital S.Chiara -Milano Hospital S.Raffaele -Roma Hospital Spallanzani -Napoli Hospital Cotugno -Cagliari Hospital Santissima Trinità   Gracias por tu ayuda  Marcello Marotta

title: Corona Care Packs
description: #CoronaCarePack     #togetherfortassie  Dear friends  The corona virus has affected us all.  It has changed the way we travel the way we work and the way we socialise. It has forever changed the way we live.     As difficult as these changes will be for us for many others the consequences will be far worse.  Even the most optimistic estimates are that this pandemic will claim the lives of tens of thousands of people in the coming weeks.   For my family one of the most dispiriting aspects of this is that the people most at risk of serious sickness or even death include the older members of our society.  These include all of the grandparents and great-grand parents in our community.  - our Nanna and Grandad - your Grandma and Poppy - the lady who has lived in your neighbourhood ever since you can remember.    We all know that washing our hands frequently using social distancing and wearing masks in high-risk environments are some of the most effective preventative measures that we can do to reduce the risk of infection.  And these measures are even more important for the vulnerable members of our community!   But with shops often selling out of soap and sanitizers and with the supermarkets frequently being very crowded places even this seemingly simple advice is often extremely difficult to follow.  In such scenarios young millenials might simply jump on the internet and buy these products online. But such technological options are not always so easy or viable for older people. And even for those who are able many of the online stores across the country are now frequently out of stock of these critical products.  Also despite many health professions now offering tele-health options it is inevitable that the elderly will still need to physically leave the house for the occasional essential appointment. These activities might involve waiting in long queues or being in environments with many potentially high-risk people for sustained periods.  It is critical in such situations to offer these people appropriate personal protective gear such as face masks in order to minimise infection in these high-risk environments.  Currently it is almost impossible to buy face masks locally.   So our family has embarked on a initiative to make Corona Care Packs for the elderly in our community. These packs will include critical hygiene products such as soap sanitizers and masks. And they will be delivered for free right to their doorsteps.  #CoronaCarePack     Last year our parents (Nanna and Grandad to the kids) celebrated their 50th wedding anniversary. Help us to help more elderly couples live to see their 50th.    As we began developing a pack for our own parents (and grandparents) we realised that although each person might only require a few masks  buying them from interstate or overseas often required ordering products in bulk packs of 10 or 20 or sometimes even 100 at a time!  This got us thinking that we could buy these bulk packs and then separate the contents in order to make lots of individual Corona Care Packs that could serve not just our own parents and grandparents but those of hundreds of other families in our city.  And maybe even around all our state.  Now that some of the products that we ordered have already arrived we have the confirmation that some supply chains are still currently working.  We would now desparetely like to make and distribute more Corona Care Packs to people in our community.  The flatten the curve health campaign is built upon the hope that everyone has plentiful access to soap sanitizers and where necessary masks.  Therefore the faster we can ensure that the elderly have access to personal hygiene supplies the safer it is for all of us.    Every. Person. Counts.     Based on consultation with health professionals including a Director of ICU  the initial #CoronaCarePack will include a generous supply of soap sanitizer and a few face masks for essential trips.    The current purchase cost for this is $12.  So for less than $50 you could fund four (4) Corona Care Packs which we will distribute for  free  to the at-risk and elderly in our community.  (The precise contents and cost may change as there is currently high volatility around the world in the price and availability of these products. In all cases we will try to find the best value-for-money products that assist in reducing the risk of the Corona virus being transmitted).   Every. Dollar. Counts.      The speed at which the corona virus is spreading is almost beyond belief. In almost all populated countries deaths are doubling every 3-7 days. And the majority of these are elderly.  Today we all have a chance to slow down the spread and reduce the burden on our health systems. And ultimately this is an opportunity for all of us to play our part however small in saving peoples lives.  This is a time and privilege for all of us to give generously.  The campagin will predominantly focus  on offering a #CoronaCarePack to those who are living independently rather than those in residential aged care homes or hospitals.  This campaign will be completely not-for-profit. Every cent of every dollar donated will go into the purchase and distribution of the Corona Care Packs.  It will only be run by volunteers.  Initially we will try to distribute the Care Packs through a network of  family and friends (who all have current Working with Vulnerable People checks). However we are more than happy to discuss with existing local community organisations (eg. City Mission Red Cross Rotary Lyons ... )  if they are able to assist in either identifying elderly people in need and/or distributing the Corona Care Packs.    Every #CoronaCarePack counts.    So please help us to help the grandparents!    Sincerely thanking all of you in advance   the Roberts family Martin Alex Emily Sam (and Casper the dog). 0401350509  Hobart Tasmania AUSTRALIA        Because Every Grandparent Counts.    #togetherfortassie #CoronaCarePack

title: Diamo una mano al Moscati di Avellino covid19
description: Vorrei raccogliere fondi per il nostro Ospedale di riferimento. É  un momento nel quale non é  semplice guardare al domani se il nostro sistema sanitario affanna un pò. Insieme possiamo uscire da questo brutto sogno insieme ogni cosa può  assumere una giusta forma.Lintero importo sarà versato sul conto dellospedale:Banca popolare di Bari  IT32C0542404297000000000207Causale: emergenza COVID  Basta poco quello che potete.grazie.

title: Save our gym on lock down because of covid_19
description: SAVE OUR GYM.  We are nobody but I want to believe that we – at Box Fit Dogs Barcelona - help our members by making them healthier happier and that all together we are a big crazy family.  We opened our gym on the 13th of March 2019 and exactly on our 1st year anniversary- Friday 13th March 2020- we entered a lockdown here in Spain because of the coronavirus.  We are allowed to go out for grocery shopping or if we need to go to the pharmacy.  We keep supporting our members and anyone who follows our story on Instagram with daily workout that you can do at home with literally anything (bag pack water bottle milk bottle broom etc.) and we also organize challenges.  It has been a week now and the situation is gradually expanding and we fear that we wont be able to financially survive this. Being a new and small business we barely break even and will not have support from our government.  This is a heartbreaking moment where our love for sport and people may come to an end and where we may close permanently if we dont have the necessary funds.  I am not much for big words and I will be damned if I dont put my pride aside and ask for your help to survive the next couple of months before we can reopen stronger than ever.  Please help us to stay open and spread energy motivation laughter and love to our community and family. We have set up a go fund me page…. Anything you can means everything to us.  Please share this message.  Thank you -

title: New Generations Against Covid-19
description: As CoronaVirus (CoVid-19) has now spread all around the world taking thousands of lives away from Earth it is now the moment to react and demonstrate that we as the youth community can give a powerful help through the effectiveness of communication and social media our generations peculiarities.   By safely donating to the “Lazzaro Spallanzani National Institute for Infectious Diseases” located in Via Portuense 292 00149 Rome we can contribute to the  Research and Development  activity of the Hospital against CoVid19.   Even small donations can make a big impact as it will not only help Italy but the entire world.  The hospitals project aims to:  • the study on the biology of the virus with two-dimensional and three-dimensional in vitro culture models;  • the study of pathogenesis by infection and severity marker;  • Modernization of laboratory equipment and biological bank.

title: La Mezza unita contro il Corona
description: Ciao ragazzi noi membri dello staff della Mezza in questi giorni segnati dalla grave emergenza sanitaria che stiamo vivendo abbiamo riflettuto su cosa si possa fare in concreto per aiutare le persone che amiamo e la terra che ci ha cresciuti e a cui tutti noi siamo profondamente legati. Abbiamo pensato di fare un semplice gesto  a favore degli ospedali della Regione Veneto  dove ogni giorno medici e infermieri lottano in prima linea. Come ormai sapete benissimo cè assoluto bisogno di posti in terapia intensiva e respiratori nel nostro piccolo cerchiamo di renderci utili vi invito ad unirvi a noi in una donazione piccola o grande che sia per aiutare chi in questo momento ne ha estremo bisogno. Un saluto da tutto lo Staff  #Restaacasa #Andràtuttobene

title: COVID-19 Fundraiser
description: Im going to be doing some livestream online gigs/workshops. A lot of people have been financially rocked by the virus lockdown particularly freelancers and people like myself within education community engagement arts culture and events. Right now im doing alright and very lucky to have employees who are looking out for me and keeping me a float financially but I know not everyone is in the same position. Telling everyone to get a loan or sign up to UC isnt a solution. Id like to try and raise some money to support people who need it from food banks local charities key workers and vulnerable people. Everything I do digitally ill attach this link. If you enjoyed my material workshops and can spare a couple of quid please feel free to donate.

title: Help AWW Wrestling Survive Covid-19
description: Alternative Wrestling World  was established in 2003 in Birmingham and since that time we have provided West Midlands wrestling fans with 100s of top quality shows.  In 2011 we created the AWW Wrestling Academy  a permanently set up wrestling school to help train the next generation of wrestling stars.  We have trained 100s of wrestlers some of whom have gone onto international success.  In January 2019 we moved to new premises which was twice the size of the old unit. Obviously with the rent also increasing.  The AWW Wrestling Academy now boasts a 16ft ring crash mats 16sqft matted area treadmill weights TRXs exercise bike vibration plate cross trainer kettle bells. Everything you need to stay fit and healthy whilst also learning the art of pro wrestling.  Due to the recent Covid-19 outbreak we have had to cancel all of our upcoming shows as well as closing the school.  The entertainment and hospitality industy has been hit hard by this pandemic.  The shows and training work hand in hand without one we dont have the other.  We currently run 3 training session a week and without this money coming in as a small not for profit outfit we are going to find it impossible to pay the rent and other outgoings like electricity water rates insurance and service charges.  As it currently stands it look like we are going to be closed for 1 month but that could easily change to 2 or even 3 months.  So were putting this out to make sure that AWW doesnt have to shut up shop permanently.  If youve ever enjoyed  the AWW wrestling product whether thats training with us attending our live events or even just watched us online please consider donating to the cause to help us continue what we love doing.

title: Chug for Corona_Feeding America
description: All proceeds go to Feeding America to provide hunger relief across the country during the COVID-19 outbreak.     Donate chug a beer share with friends and feel good about supporting your community.  Lets make this more viral than the virus!   —  Feeding America is the nations largest domestic hunger-relief organization. Every day there are millions of children and adults who do not get the meals they need to thrive. We work to get nourishing food - from farmers manufacturers and retailers - to people in need. Every $1 you give helps provide at least 10 meals through the Feeding America network of food banks.

title: Help Italiaanse zwerfhonden de corona crisis door!
description: Vanwege het coronavirus heeft  Claudia Costa Masser  in Zuid- Italië het zwaar om haar asiel met  zeventig honden en veertig katten op een dierwaardige manier draaiende te houden.   Door corona worden er geen honden en katten meer geadopteerd in Italië... maar mogen de honden ook niet op transport naar Nederland of Duitsland waar hun een gouden mandje wacht. Ondanks dat er geen uitstroom is komen er nog steeds zwervertjes - waaronder pups en kittens- binnen. Daarnaast zijn er in Zuid- Italië raodblocks waardoor veel vrijwilligers niet kunnen helpen.  Het asiel is nu volledig afhankelijk van donaties om het voer en de medische kosten van alle dieren te kunnen bekostigen. Vanwege geldnood krijgen de honden nu al oud brood in plaats van brokken.    Laten we in deze moeilijke tijd de zwerfdieren niet vergeten ... ook zij hebben onze steun hard nodig.   De Italiaanse zwerfdieren en vrijwilligers zullen u dankbaar zijn!

title: Help Orford House survive COVID-19
description: Orford House Social Club was gifted to the people of Walthamstow in 1921. It has survived for nearly 100 years as a place for people to meet socialise bowl and more. Its also an important part of the community - hosting weddings community groups local fundraisers and entertainment.  Due to COVID-19 Orford House has had to close for the foreseeable future. The club already runs on a small margin to cover the upkeep of the building and keep prices low for members. So this closure is temporary but there is a very real chance the club could close for good.  COVID-19 has hit at a particularly vulnerable point for Orford House. The winter months are always quieter at the club and many bills are due at the beginning of the financial year on 1 April.  This is a tough time for so many people but if you are able to donate to help the club weather this storm any amount helps. We hope the club will be able to open again in time for the busiest summer period but the health and safety of members and staff is our first priority. You can keep up to date with developments at the  Orford House Facebook page   or email any questions to info@orfordhouse.org.

title: Bed-Vyne Staff COVID-19 Relief Fund
description: Im going to get straight to the point. Due to this coronavirus pandemic many people who are employed in hospitality will have no access to funds to buy groceries and some other basic necessities. Bartenders and other employees who depend on tips and bars and restaurants being open are going through a rough time. As a small business with three locations (Bed-Vyne Wine Bed-Vyne Brew Bed-Vyne Cocktail) we ask that you help us by donating any amount you can so that we can help our employees cover some basic needs. The money collected will be distributed evenly among our bartenders who have been displaced and currently not working. I was inspired to start this gofundme by my friend Victoria who reached and volunteered to donate $50.00 to any bartenders who may need groceries. We already planned on doing this as a business but once I heard from Victoria I figured maybe there are others willing to help. Hence this platform. Thanks for your help. Everyone please be safe. We will get through this with help from God and everyone taking the necessary precautions. Thank you from all of us at Bed-Vyne   rotimi  ayo pete damone mike

title: Ich möchte weiter Dtsch-Frz. Austausche begleiten
description: Hallo mein Name ist Jacques Sateu   ich bin 40 Jahre alt und wohne in Saarbrücken. 2005 bin ich aus Kamerun nach Deutschland gekommen und habe hier Germanistik studiert. Da ich Französisch als Muttersprache sprechearbeite ich seit 10 Jahren für Pro Tandem(ehemals Deutsch-Französisches Sekretariat) in Saarbrücken.Es hat mir immer viel Spaß gemacht die französischen und deutschen Schülergruppen in ihren Auslandspraktika in das jeweils andere Land zu begleiten. Als Sprachbegleiter und Sprachlehrer konnte ich dazu beitragen die Sprachkenntnisse in Deutsch und Französisch zu erhöhen die Sprachbarrieren abzubauen und dürfte erlebenwie sich freundschaftliche Beziehungen zwischen Deutschen und Franzosen entwickelten.   Es haben sich langjährige berufliche und freundschaftliche Beziehungen z.B. zum HANSE-Berufskolleg Lemgo und deren Partnerschule in Pontivy sowie  städtische Berufsschule lV Augsburg Theodor-Heuss-Schule OffenbachBerufskolleg West EssenBbs1 MainzBerufsbildende Schule Soltau Berufskolleg für Wirtschaft und Informatik  NeussOberstufenzentrum 1 Forst und die Steinbeisschule Stuttgart.     Für mich persönlich bedeutete die hohe Reisetätigkeit jedoch auch dass langfristige Beziehungen zu Hause nur sehr schwer zu realisieren waren. Das habe ich für die Tätigkeit die ich sehr liebe immer auf mich genommen. Mit dem Coronavirus kommt jedoch jetzt eine ganz andere Herausforderung dazu.    Schon Ende Februar ist die erste Reise abgesagt worden und auch bis Juni sind alle Aufträge gestrichen. Pro Tandem(ehemals Deutsch-Französisches Sekretariat) kann keine finanzielle Unterstützung bieten da die Verträge immer nur auf Honorarbasis abgeschlossen werden. Außerdem habe ich keinen Anspruch auf Kredite und Sozialhilfe.  Wenn Sie also möchtendass ich auch nach der Krise noch als Sprachbegleiter und Sprachlehrer zur Verfügung stehebenötige ich jetzt Ihre Hilfe.  Ihre Spenden nutze ich dazumeine monatlichen Kosten wie MieteVersicherungen Essen und Kleidung zu decken.   Ich möchte weiter Deutsch-Französische Austausche begleiten. Bitte!  Vielen lieben Dank.   Jacques Sateu

title: Abarth Club Roma contro il Covid19
description: Abarth   Club   Roma  è un associazione sportiva dilettantistica senza scopo di lucro che in questo momento storico e sanitario molto particolare ha deciso di aprire una  raccolta   fondi  per donare un aiuto concreto  allOspedale   Spallanzani  sempre in prima fila per combattere il contagio da  Covid19 .

title: Die RheinBühne in Corona-Zeiten
description: Liebe Leute  die RheinBühne euer Kulturwohnzimmer in der Bonner City ist durch die Corona-Krise in ernsten Schwierigkeiten. Wir erhalten als kleiner Kulturbetrieb bisher keinerlei staatliche oder städtische Unterstützung und/oder Förderung. Wir finanzieren uns komplett aus den Ticketverkäufen. Die ja nun erst einmal ausbleiben.   Zudem haben wir auch keine Aussicht auf Mietminderung unserer Spielstätte eine Nachfrage wurde negativ beantwortet.  Das heißt: Die Miete und die Nebenkosten müssen in voller Höhe weiter gezahlt werden.   Zurzeit bieten wir auch RheinBühne-Retter-Gutscheine an. Heute kaufen im Herbst zu unseren Veranstaltungen kommen  3  Das wird aber nicht reichen. Deshalb unsere Bitte an euch: Wenn ihr ein bisschen Geld für die Kultur in Bonn übrig habt freuen wir uns sehrsehr über eine kleine Spende!   Natürlich geben wir darüber hinaus weiter Gas um unser geliebtes Kulturwohnzimmer zu retten.  Danke fürs Lesen danke für eure Unterstützung  3  Eure RheinBühne

title: Twice as Nice Uniforms COVID-19 Masks
description: As we all know the COVID-19 virus is everyones main focus right now. Many in the medical field — as well as those on the front-lines of our communities — are not able to get masks and other protective gear. In addition to staying home we all have to do our part to help slow or stop the spread.  I am Debora Carrier Founder and CEO of Twice As Nice Uniforms.  We are a small family-owned business operating at a minimal profit margin but we want to do our part. Heres how we plan to help.  First we are temporarily stopping the production of scrubs and lab coats and producing only masks and protective gowns. The masks will be made with various materials depending upon availability.  Two we are donating a portion of our masks to individuals and for small community needs. Continue reading to hear more about these donations.  Three for larger institutional needs we are taking orders for masks and gowns and will sell them at discount wholesale pricing. Our pricing is set at a level that will enable us to keep our factory running as well as keep our workers paid fairly and most importantly provide working conditions that are as safe as we can make them.  Heres how you can help.  For our community donations we have set up this GoFundMe account in case you want to support our efforts. Each mask costs between $2-4 to produce and ship. Any funds you choose to donate will be used exclusively to produce and ship masks for donation. Again our donations are for INDIVIDUALS and small community needs - such as those handing out school lunches volunteers at food banks and many other heros. If you have a need for masks that fits this description please contact us at info@twiceasniceuniforms.com.  If our ability to produce masks cant keep up with demand we will re-purpose.  For larger institutional orders please contact us at admin@twiceasniceuniforms.com  Well keep you updated on how things progress with this effort from Twice as Nice Uniforms.  Debora

title: Pickle Barrel Family Relief Fund
description: Hey guys we are asking for donations to help  relieve  our Pickle Barrel staff who are facing a long financial recovery ahead.   Many of you already know restaurants and bars everywhere have been ordered to eliminate dine-in services due to rising concerns of COVID-19. So for now we are left with carry out or delivery  only  to stay afloat and avoid closing entirely.   In this industry we  rely  on the public and if  days  shutdown turn into  weeks  or  months  the impact will be  devastating  for many lives in our Chattanooga community.   Any donations received will be split amongst employees for aid in paying their bills rent/mortgage feed their critters and to keep the damn lights on until its safe to come out of hiding during the Corona outbreak.   So If you are missing your favorite local bar during these scary (and lonely) times and want to help some of the many lives affected by COVID-19  please  donate here to give Pickle Barrel a fighting chance to survive this crisis and continue serving the great city of Chattanooga for  another  37 years.   We love you all! Take care help spread the word and wash your damn hands!

title: Grasshopper COVID-19 employee relief
description: As we step into unprecedented times Id like to provide this outlet to our customers family friends and the amazing city of Ferndale Michigan (downtown ferndale) to show their appreciation and generosity to The Grasshopper Underground employees and give them your best wishes encouraging support and donations.  We have a staff of over 10 people and are looking for ways to help them get through this difficult time. Many of our staff live paycheck to paycheck and are dependent on tips to make ends meet. Some staff members have student loan debt rent medical bills transportation expenses child care and much more. For most of the staff Grasshopper is the only source of income and with the limited hours (weekends) as well as income heavily based on tips unemployment checks will be next to nothing if anything. As a company we will get through this but our hearts break for the employees.  At this time we have not received any direction from local state or national government on when we will be able to reopen. We recognize that many are facing financial struggles of their own in the wake of this crisis but any and all donations help and are greatly appreciated. If you dont have the funds to donate (as many dont) please do not feel bad but for the financially fortunate and stable people it would be greatly appreciated.   We are coming up with other creative ways to help this cause from live streams at the venue selling grasshopper merchandise and much more. Any donation of $30 or more will receive a free complementary Grasshopper Underground t-shirt mailed directly to your doorstep (email us with your name home address and shirt size). When government officials grant us permission to reopen or if we achieve our goal the Grasshopper COVID-19 employee relief account will be discontinued.   Please be assured 100% of donations will go directly and evenly to our Grasshopper Underground employees. Nothing will go to the owner or for any other purpose. This fund is completely for them to make it through this difficult time. Please feel free to reach out with any questions and thank you for your consideration. We look forward to serving you again in the near future.      Stay safe strong and more importantly calm.

title: 30.000  MASCHERINE da DONARE all AslCOMO e AslTO4
description: PRIMO OBIETTIVO: 30.000  MASCHERINE DA DONARE ALL ASL COMO e ASL TO4 (IVREA - CIRIE - CUORGNE)    Lemergenza sanitaria  ci obbliga a sentirci parte di un tutto. Fa riscoprire le cose che contano ci catapulta al centro di storie incredibili di vite impegnate in prima linea nel tentativo di salvare quelle di tutta la nazione. Ci fa rendere conto ogni sera della situazione estrema in cui si trovano e nonostante la quale continuano ad operare senza sosta. Sui social via telefono ci chiedono aiuto disperatamente  soprattutto per quanto riguarda i presidi medici di protezione . Dal divano di casa nostra dove ci sentiamo confinati incominciano i primi timidi Whatsapp degli amici e dei colleghi di sempre che non sopportano di sentirsi impotenti.  Cosa fare si può fare lo stanno facendo facciamolo.   Siamo italiani siamo abituati facciamo cose impossibili in tempi impossibili sempre e da sempre. Noi nella moda poi di questo ne abbiamo sempre fatto dellironia.  E il momento di dimostrarlo.  Abbiamo tutto per partire. Nessuno dei fornitori a cui abbiamo chiesto aiuto ci ha detto di no. Un sì grande a questa chiamata che ci ha dato la forza per scommettere e far arrivare il materiale. Siamo pronti a produrre  30.000 mascherine chirurgiche e altri presidi sanitari  fondamentali per poter continuare questa battaglia. Le doneremo agli  ospedali di COMO  e dell  ASLTO4 (IVREA - CIRIE - CUORGNE) con cui abbiamo un contatto diretto.  Seguiamo personalmente la produzione e la spedizione di tutti i presidi e ce ne facciamo garanti.   Unisciti a noi: o  gni piccolo o grande contributo servirà a dare una mano.   Fai crescere la nostra raccolta condividendo il link della campagna tra i tuoi contatti e sui tuoi social.   Insieme ce la faremo!

title: Donate to Aid the Battle against COVID19 @ Memphis
description: COVID-19 pandemic is threatening the US; in Memphis TN the community spread will put our first responders (e.g. policemen fire fighters and medical workers) in great danger.  The local Chinese American community is raising money to support their battle against the pandemic. Any donation will help make an impact. Thanks in advance for your contribution to this cause that means so much to us as a united community.   Donations are collected monitored and distributed by the Greater Memphis United Chinese Association. Special thanks to local Chinese grocery stores and restaurants for their generous donations and contributions.

title: Baja Joes Mexican Cantina COVID19 Relief Fund
description: We are a family owned an operated local restaurant with over 45 employees in Mesa AZ ( Baja Joes website)  .  Over our 10+ years weve grown from 8 employees to where we are today.  Most of our employees have been with us for more than 5 years and many at least 8+.  Most of our employees are supporting their families and many have multiple small children.  Having to close our doors to dine-in service is putting 90% of our employees and their families without income (and potentially all if we take-out and delivery cannot support those few hours we are trying to keep).  We are trying to create hours for them...beginning in house delivery cleaning sessions work projects and more but with so many of our employees surviving not only on hours but tips this is devastating for all of us.  100% of the funds raised will go directly to the employees and their families.  This support means these families can put food on their tables keep the roof over their heads and have the ability to take care of their children that are not at home with schools being closed.  We are hoping and praying for this to end swiftly but the reality is it will be weeks or months before normal exists again.  Thank you so very much for your consideration and generosity in this critical time of need.  We have such wonderful families that work for us and are part of out family we are blessed for that and can only hope we can return a gift to them that they give us every day.We are pledging to match every dollar donated back our employees. Thank you again for your consideration!!!

title: Epoch  Studio Salon Covid-19  Fund
description: Well here we are.  We want to say that we sincerely hope that you our client family are safe healthy practicing social distancing not hoarding TP maximizing Netflix screen time and enjoying the onslaught of Covid-19 memes. Hey we need to laugh to keep from crying.   First and foremost Epoch is a family over all else and we always strive to take care of our employees in the best way possible. They are the heart of it and thats what makes this so hard.   Due to the shelter in place mandate and us wanting to follow best practices to keep everyone safe Epoch has to close its doors until April 7th. But if we are being realistic I have a feeling it will be longer.   Yesterday we had to make the very hard decision to let 14 of our employees go. It was like getting the wind knocked out of you over and over again. Everyone took it as best as they could and we were even able to joke at times and laugh at the ridiculousness of all of it. But it was very inspiring to see each of them offer to help each other navigate this and even ask us after we just laid them off how we are doing with all this.   Its awkward and uncomfortable to ask for financial help for a for-profit business. But it feels even worse to ask for help when people we know and love are losing their jobs closing their own businesses  experiencing loss and at the end of the day going through something that we just dont know how it will shake out.   We believe in full transparency with our staff and thats why I believe its only fair to be transparent when we are asking for support. While we do have reserves the fact of the matter is that we still have to pay our rent insurance utilities with no income currently coming in.   Our biggest goal with this ask is to support our staff. We want them to be able to most importantly cover their health insurance which is supercritical as we have a few immune-compromised and a very soon Mother to be (surprise everyone). We also want to be able to help them keep a roof over their head and food on the table. If all else fails theyll move into the salon and will try to sell the concept as a reality television series. (kidding...).  So here it is. We are asking for anything you are able to donate. Every dollar helps. If you are unable to donate we are also taking on words of encouragement and if youve been in before a review  wouldnt hurt.   We hope to see you on the other side of this where we will pay you back by always doing our best to make you feel your best self provide great life advice and provide a safe welcoming place for you to get away and decompress. We all know we are gonna need it.  To our staff - we adore you. We are going to get through this.  To our clients - we adore you. We thank you in advance and cannot wait to have you back in our chairs.    Cheers Ben + Beth - Co-Owners

title: COVID19 - Pneumologia e Medicina Interna Pordenone
description: Buongiorno a tutti mi chiamo Francesco Monisso e sono un ragazzo pordenonese di 25 anni.  Nelle ultime settimane si sono susseguite una serie di donazioni alla Terapia Intensiva dellOspedale di Pordenone. Mi è però parso che si sia trascurato lapporto che i Reparti di Pneumologia e Medicina Interna stanno dando e daranno alla risoluzione di questa situazione di emergenza: sono infatti questi ultimi ad occuparsi della degenza dei pazienti positivi al Covid-19 prima e dopo la transizione in Terapia Intensiva.   Essendo tali Reparti come purtroppo gran parte della nostra Sanità Pubblica mancanti di diversi mezzi ho pensato di creare questa raccolta fondi per loro.   Ringrazio tutti coloro che vorranno lasciare anche un piccolo ma prezioso contributo!

title: On The Way Cafe Rye Ny (Covid-19 relief fund)
description: https://facebook.com/onthewaycafe/     We are a family owned and operated business in Rye. Due to the world pandemic of Covid-19. This virus caught us all completely off guard. It has devastated the hospitality business. We are trying our best by staying open and trying to pay rent payroll and  utilities.  Unfortunately we had to lay off 95% of our staff in order to keep the lights on. We are asking for your help in this tuff time. Hopefully we can still be a part of the Rye community after this virus passes.    I want to that the community of Rye and the surrounding community  for your support for the past  10 years     Thank you  On The Way Cafe

title: Help Regan get through COVID-19 as 1099 employee
description: This is a hard time for a lot of us and for those of us lucky to still be working at full capacity Im hoping we can join together to help our friend who has been affected by losing 100% of her income almost overnight.   Due to the nature of her business it doesnt appear she can apply for unemployment (she is self-employed aka 1099).    Regan is a very kind and generous person who never thinks twice about helping out a friend or animal in need.  She never asks for help and I had to convince her this was ok to do.  So if you are fully employed and you can spare a few dollars please show our friend that weve got her back   If you can donate thank you.  If you cant maybe you can share.  Every little bit counts.

title: Ayuda a Gambasse frente al impacto del COVID-19
description: Somos una pequeña fundación que se llama SILO   http://www.silogb.com/    en la que todas las personas que cooperan lo hacen desde un abordaje totalmente voluntario. Nuestra implicación con la ONG comenzó hace más de 17 años en un pequeño poblado del interior de Guinea Bissau llamado Cambasse en la región de Bafatá.   Ante la rápida propagación que estamos sufriendo a  nivel mundial del COVID-19  estamos empezando a experimentar los impactos negativos que está sufriendo toda la población de Cambasse.  Ahora mismo empieza la campaña de recogida del cajú este trabajo dura 3 meses y es la única fuente de economía en todas las zonas rurales del interior.   Debido las estrictas medidas que ha decretado el gobierno Africano para frenar la propagación del virus se ha parado toda la venta de alimentos que no sean de primera necesidad cierre de fronteras prohibición de vuelos…   Nos estamos preparando para abordar diferentes escenarios  teniendo en cuenta la poca falta de recursos de las que disponemos nuestra mejor opción para reducir al mínimo el impacto que causarán estas medidas a toda la población es la siguiente:   En Gambasse hay un total de 52 familias; si conseguimos hacer una recogida de 2.000 euros podremos cubrir con 50 kg de arroz a cada familia durante un mes.   Sabemos que no es un proyecto muy ambicioso pero sí es realista.  Para toda la gente que formamos SILO nos han unido desde siempre lazos muy fuertes con la población de Gambasse así que significa mucho para nosotros cualquier ayuda que podamos recibir.   De parte de todo el equipo queremos darte las gracias por ayudar sea cual sea el importe; gracias por formar parte de esto.

title: Kuya Jas COVID-19 Employee Relief Fund
description: We had worked so hard to get this place open and could not have done it without the support of all of our amazing customers the following from our pop up days and our staff. We have made the difficult decision to close our doors effective Sunday March 22nd. It was a really hard decision to make. Being in the service industry we pride ourselves on serving the community and giving them what they want and need. However we cannot allow our staff to risk exposure to COVID-19. We cannot allow ourselves to risk getting our families sick. We have a 6 year old daughter and a 2 year old daughter as well as parents with pre-existing health conditions. We cannot afford to risk their lives staying open. We know that we will reopen again but we cannot do that without a completely healthy team. We dont know when we will reopen.   Operating on margins as thin as ours this means that our employees dont know when they will get their next checks. We are starting this fund to help support all of our employees. All of the money collected will go to staff and will not be used for the restaurant or the owners benefit. We understand that it is a hard time for everyone but if you have anything to spare no amount is too small. It breaks our hearts that our staff have to figure out how to pay for their rent utilities groceries etc. and many of them have children to support as well.   Please if you havent already reach out to your local congressmen and state government. Restaurants are in dire need of help. #toosmalltofail   We appreciate all of the love we have received thus far. Thank you for making our dreams reality and supporting our small mom and pop. Its not goodbye its see you later.  With love Chef Javier Fernandez and Jennifer Fernandez Owners

title: Lone Star Gymnastics COVID-19 Assistance
description: Lone Star Family Some team parents reached out to us this morning encouraging us to set up a gofundme page.  It is extremely humbling to be in this position as a business.    Whats going on?  The Corona Virus has closed Lone Star Gymnastics until further notice.  This is especially difficult for us because we just came back from a week long gym closure for spring break.    Gymnastics businesses have one REALLY large expense which is the cost of gym space.  As you can imagine 18000 feet of gym space isnt cheap and unfortunately this cost will be continuing to add up over the length of this crisis.   Lone Star has frozen all of our clients accounts until we can reopen which means there is $0 coming in.  We are working to preserve full time coaches salaries but that can only last so long.   We are doing all of this to make sure that we can reopen when the virus clears.    How will this money be used?  Any funds raised will go to preserving the salaries of our coaching staff and paying for the gym space and its expenses.     When do we need the money?  Our lease payment is due on the first of the month. The next payroll date is on March 4th.    What this means to us?   It would mean the world to us! Lone Star has been serving the children of the community for over 30 years and this is the first business interruption that has risked the livelihood of the gym and its coaches.  Any relief that will enable us to get back up and running or would help ensure our coaches financial well being would be amazing and appreciated by our staff.  We have several coaches  who have dedicated their whole lives to educating children through the sport of gymnastics.    Please share!  If Lone Star Gymnastics has made a difference in your life or your families life please take a minute to share this and write a quick message to our staff.

title: Covid19 Victim.
description: My name is John and i am establishing this Gofundmepage for my friend Antonio. As some of you may know Antonios partner Richard lost his fight to the corona-virus which is effecting all of us in some way or another.. Richard lost his brave fight on Thursday March 19th at the age of 57For those who knew Richard you knew that he was a beautiful person inside and out. He was intelligent smartfunny caring loving and just full of life. He was a wonderful human being with a real dedication to giving back to others especially those in the LGTB community. And now its our chance to give back for Richard.Antonio recently lost his job as so many Americans have since this pandemic began and needs our help.I know things may be tough for all of us right now but i ask if anyone can donate to help Antonio no matter how small it would be greatly appreciated. All money will be used to help Antonio to get through the next several weeks.Thank you . Please stay safe and healthy..We are all in this together.Darkness cannot drive out darkness: only light can do that. Lets go out there and be a light to everyone we come in contact with today and everyday.

title: Cava de Tirreni Covid19: mascherine ai sanitari
description: Lassociazione  Farma e Benessere  di  Cava de Tirreni  insieme ad altre associazioni del territorio lancia questa rapida raccolta fondi per  lacquisto di 200 DPI (mascherine) FFP2 da destinare con urgenza al personale medico ed infermieristico della città . Tale raccolta fondi è necessaria per dotare il suddetto personale di questi dispositivi fondamentali durante lemergenza  Coronavirus  stante la scarsa disponibilità  degli stessi.  Supporta attivamente la nostra campagna. Prima raggiungiamo lobiettivo e prima possiamo dare una mano!

title: CocoView Resort Covid-19 Crisis Fund
description: CocoView Resort is a small SCUBA destination on Roatan Island in the country of Honduras.  The abrupt discontinuation of travel and tourism caused by the world-wide Covid-19 pandemic has especially impacted our family of employees on the resort.  Without the patronage of the guests and the income they provide the staff at CCV has no source of income.  These hard-working honest and friendly people will need all of our help to ensure they and their families have funds available for basic support during this crisis.  CocoView will need to maintain security and the upkeep of the buildings and boats to protect this unique and amazing facility so the workers will have a job to return to when normal travel conditions resume.  We humbly ask that you show your love for the CocoView family by donating what you can to help us help our Roatan employees and their families weather this storm.  Together with the generosity of our friends we will be able to take care of our beloved staff and we will return to this paradise that means so much to us all.

title: Covid-19 Guna Yala/San Blas Relief Fund
description: The Guna need your help right now! Im teaming up with  Localinpty   and  Anmar Dule   (non-profits in Panama) to make a huge difference.  For those of you who have traveled in Guna Yala and made friends with the Guna you can imagine how the Covid-19 crisis is impacting this vulnerable and remote community. For you and for those who dont know the Guna please read on!  You can make a huge difference with a donation. Were stronger together. Thank you gracias and nuedi!     The Guna  are a semi-autonomous indigenous group who live on the Caribbean side of Panama in Guna Yala (aka San Blas Islands) an archipelago of 365 islands of which 44 have communities on them. There are another 6 communities on the coast in Panama and 2 more in Colombia for a total of 52 Guna communities spread out along 230 miles (373 km).  Approximately 30000 Guna are in these communities right now waiting out the Covid-19 quarantine essentially shut off from the rest of the world.      Guna do not have the luxury of grocery stores  but only small window shops in peoples homes which are quickly running out of necessities. All supplies need to be bought and transported from Panama City no less than a 2-hour drive to a port which then need to be transported in boats to the communities.    Your donations will help buy and transport basic necessities such as water rice beans canned food lentils pasta soap toilet paper medical supplies cooking fuel etc.  They also need gas for their boats to deliver supplies and transport people who need medical attention. Once the basics have been met there is plenty more that we can help provide such as school supplies so students can continue with schooling and kids can continue playing.     These communities are already vulnerable due to the environmental changes of climate change ; the rising sea levels are inundating many island communities to the point that they are making plans to move to the mainland a project which is now being put on hold. Meanwhile there are efforts to minimize the devastating impacts with community projects to reinforce breakwaters and build new ones to mitigate flooding by  Anmar Dule   (Our People in Guna dialect) a non-profit created by Guna for Guna to support the entire Guna community in managing the impacts of climate change.    In addition tourism comprises the majority of Guna income to provide for their families. Guna Yala which has blossomed into a popular destination for foreign and Panamanian tourists is yet another remote area in the world where  income has been completely cut off. Your donations will also help supplement income for families so that they can continue to provide for one another.      How your donations will get to the Guna in Guna Yala:  I will transfer 100% of donations to my Guna co-organizers in Panama City who will work with others to purchase the basic goods. Through a network of helpers we will organize the land and sea transportation of the goods for delivery in the communities.        Backstory: My personal connection and dedication to the Guna  comes from  sea kayak guiding  with them since 2010. Many have become like family for me (there is even a Guna baby named after me little Aylin) and Guna Yala is like a second home. Thousands of tourists have enjoyed Guna Yalas crystalline waters palm tree-dotted islands and white sandy beaches. Those who took the time to get to know the Guna and their fascinating culture quickly discovered how  friendly hard-working fun and resilient  they are. Guests on my trips ALWAYS commented on how  open-hearted open-minded quick to laugh and dedicated to sharing their culture  they are. Theyve shared their islands and culture with me and thousands of visitors and  now is the time to do our part in giving back to a community in need.     With utmost gratitude love and compassion for everyone especially those struggling during the Covid-19 Pandemic I thank you. Were ALL in this together.

title: Il Volley Club G. Callipo nella lotta al Covid19
description: In un periodo di grande sofferenza come questo abbiamo pensato a come può un club di tifosi del volley dare una mano alla comunità. Siamo il club ufficiale dei tifosi della Volley Tonno Callipo Vibo Valentia e proprio abbiamo deciso di fare una raccolta fondi per essere vicini allospedale della nostra città in una regione in cui il sistema sanitario messo a dura prova potrebbe crollare.  Tutti insieme possiamo dare una grande mano

title: SeaLevel Hot Yoga Relief Fund Amid COVID-19
description: Right now we stand together by standing alone.  Like so many small businesses in our city and around our nation Sealevel Hot Yoga is temporarily closed due to the COVID-19 crisis. While we remain closed we are working to provide online access to our classes so we can help our community stay connected and in practice. We plan to continue offering online resources for you to practice your yoga where you want when you want.  If you have been positively impacted by Sealevel Hot Yoga and our amazing community we are humbly asking for your financial support during this challenging time. If you are on a membership and able to keep it active we ask that you do so knowing that your support will enable us to continue to operate as a small business once this crisis passes. As a family-owned and run yoga studio we would like to be able to financially support our teachers who bring their skills knowledge experience support and love to our yoga community.  We also need to be able to keep our doors open to welcome you back to the studio when this crisis passes.  To do these things we need your help. Any and all donations given will go directly towards our studio and teachers.  We want to be here for you both during this difficult time and when it is over providing a place to practice the yoga you know and love.  We are grateful for your support.  And stay tuned for more classes online!  In good health  Kathy Kevin and the Sealevel Hot Yoga Team

title: Covid-19: Ospedale di Asti Malattie Infettive
description: Il reparto Malattie Infettive di Asti e il laboratorio di farmacologia associato alle malattie infettive saranno i beneficiari di questa raccolta fondi. La ricerca farmacologica e lapplicazione dei risultati ottenuti in laboratorio possono fare la differenza adesso contro il Covid-19 e domani contro innumerevoli altre malattie.  Le strutture sanitarie e i laboratori hanno bisogno di noi adesso più che mai; purtroppo iniziano a mancare gli strumenti fondamentali per la cura dei pazienti anche quelli in condizioni meno critiche per cui è doveroso sostenere tutti insieme questa grande sfida.  Il reparto di Malattie Infettive di Asti e il laboratorio di farmacologia ad esso associato sono allavanguardia nella ricerca e nella clinica pertanto tutto ciò che sarà ricavato verrà DIRETTAMENTE impiegato nel migliore dei modi per progredire nella scoperta e nella lotta contro questo microrganismo.  Donare qui significa donare a tutto il Piemonte e un domani a tutta Italia: i laboratori sono gestiti dai docenti universitari di Malattie infettive e Farmacologia che operano ogni giorno nei reparti/laboratori astigiani e torinesi e sono costantemente in contatto con la comunità scientifica nazionale e internazionale.   Diamo la possibilità a chi ha le giuste competenze di svolgere al meglio un lavoro arduo difficile ma appassionante e proficuo.  Grazie uno studente di medicina

title: Wilkies Martial Arts F*ck Covid-19 Fund
description: This is to fund Alex Wilkies Martial Arts Academy through the Covid-19 Crisis.  This is led by Big Als students for his benefit and the benefit of our school.  Big Al has never asked for a contract from any student and has always been there for members of the school community when they needed help.
