We want to help as many people as possible and will be distributing funds based on the emergency nature of the request. If we dont have cash funds available for your request we will contact you and do our best to connect you with resources and services that can help.   Please donate and share our campaign so we can once again prove that Pittsburgh is a city of bridges which we cross to help and support each other.  To apply for aid please  fill out the form.   Please note that funds will not be shared until raised.

title: Fabric for washable COVID-19 hospital masks
description: Were sewing fabric washable face masks urgently needed for staff at North Central Baptist Hospital in San Antonio.    We need to make a lot of them and are recruiting more volunteers with sewing skills to join us.  This GoFundMe is just to help buy more fabric and elastics.  My sister Goldie has volunteered at this hospital taking communion to patients every Friday for 20 years.  Their group cant do that right now because of the Coronavirus.  The hospital volunteer desk has asked us to make urgently needed fabric face masks for their staff as a replacement for the disposable masks that are in short supply everywhere.  This will give those medical  staff who are right there working directly with sick patients in our community critically-needed face masks that can be washed sanitized and reused on-site.  We can sew we have some fabric and were happy to do it.   This request is just to help us buy more fabric for other volunteers we know we will be able to recruit to help us.  We sure appreciate even a dollar.  Thanks so much! What we really need are volunteers who sew to help make masks.  We have the easy pattern and the requirements from the hospital.We may be able to provide fabric and elastic if this gofundme gets support and we can even pick up what you make if youre local and take it to the hospital so you dont have to go out.Please share!

title: The Walk In Stylist and Shop Corona Relief
description: Hello my fellow social distancers.  This is such a hard time for everyone and I hope you are healthy and safe wherever you are reading this. I know yall are being inundated with fundraising requests but Im going to join the chorus to ask for your support for the Walk-In and the amazing people who work out of the shop.  The Walk-In and the Record Shop are closed for the foreseeable future as are so many of our beloved businesses.   I built the Walk-In to be a place where I and my friends could work without having our labor exploited. As a place where there are no bosses the shop has afforded us a lot of freedom and happiness and beauty and community. In short: the Walk-In is a pretty magical place.  But there is a downside: each of us only makes money when we are physically in the shop working behind the chair. And stylists and barbers who are classed as self-employed contractors are not eligible for unemployment benefits. In short:  no work means no money and theres no clear pathway to access the limited and insufficient relief programs that do exist.  We are incredibly fortunate to have landlords who are kind generous and loving. They are willing to work with us as much as possible but they are not independently wealthy and cannot possibly float us forever.  And there are other bills that still need to be paid.  This all leads me to this place (most everyone who knows me has heard me rant about how I do not like online fundraisers because I think we should have a robust social safety net to care for people) and to ask for your help to offset your favorite Walk-In hair cutters loss of income and to pay the bare minimum needed to keep us from defaulting on shop bills.  Four years ago when we were building out the shop and wearing masks to protect against all the scary things falling from the drop ceiling we never could have imagined that our shop our community our city our world would be thrust into crisis by a global pandemic.    With love from a minimum distance of six feet and all the handwashing  Chelsea

title: Catrachos Unidos COVID-19 (Coronavirus)
description: Creemos que el lema #yomequedoencasa se queda corto apoyemos para que el nuevo lema sea #unidosnosquedamosencasa #COVID19CatrachosUnidos    Tenemos poco tiempo para actuar!!!!!   En estos momentos de crisis mundial por la Pandemia COVID-19 hoy como Hondureños y solicitando también apoyo a la personas solidarias de otros países DECIMOS PRESENTE nos unimos para apoyar al que más lo necesita aceptando la realidad de la mayoría de nuestra  población  día que no se trabaja no se come”   y apelando a la buena voluntad  y corazón de aquellas personas que tiene el privilegio de contar con alimentos en su mesa y un techo en sus cabezas nosotros un grupo de jóvenes hondureños decidimos iniciar una colecta de fondos para proveer alimentos de primera necesidad y apoyar a barrios/colonias inicialmente Distrito Central en las cuales tengan las mayores necesidades alimentarias.  Extiende la mano al que más lo necesita desde la comodidad de tu hogar.  Familias que se esperan Beneficiar: inicialmente a 100 Familias. Se publicará un informe de liquidación de los fondos para asegurar la transparencia.

title: Mask For America : Join the Fight Against COVID19
description: It is time for all of us to unite together and join the fight against covid19.    MASK FOR AMERICA  Project Highlight:  -  Hospitals in the US are running out of medical supplies  such as face masks cover gowns and other personal protective equipment (PPE) due to a nationwide shortage caused by the Coronavirus outbreak.  -  Doctors and nurses who fight against Covid19 at the frontline are desperately need our help!   -  We are asking you to join the fight together  with our medical workers help them get those PPE they need to keep them safe healthy and well-protected.  -  MASK FOR AMERICA is a donation-based program  all your donations are going directly to the sourcing and distribution of masks and other PPE for US hospitals and clinics. Were asking for your help in supporting this cause.  -  We hope to distribute throughout the US as more funds come in.  We are based in Chicago IL and will start by providing PPE to Chicagoland hospitals and clinics.   ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------   Our Goal   Commitment    With this project we are looking to procure as many N95 and surgical masks as we can for donations. Our goal is to protect the health of as many healthcare workers across Illinois and the US as possible. If we are going to stop this virus in its tracks we will need our brave healthcare professionals in good health.  If we hit our initial goal of $40000 we will be able to purchase approximately ten thousand each N95 masks and surgical masks from the vetted suppliers and ship them to hospitals treating COVID19 patients.  We are committed to donating the equipment we acquire through this initiative to hospitals and doctors that need them most urgently. We plan to make our first donations to hospitals in Chicago starting with  University of Illinois Hospital.    If you or someone you know works for a hospital/clinic that treats COVID19 related patients and is in need of PPE please have them fill the form below so we can arrange our donations.    https://forms.gle/9KJ8TfQqTqWaiKsw9     Please keep check back in with us as we make progress towards our goal.   Why are we doing this?   When I first moved to the United States people often asked me how I like it here. I always share my opinion about I love the strong sense of community that US people have. I always wanted to be part of it and show my gratitude to my community by being helpful.  When the coronavirus outbreak first started in China there was a huge shortage of medical supplies in almost every hospital. As someone who paid close attention to the matter I quickly contacted my friend Lizaa in China and helped finding medical resources. We spent several weeks trying to source available PPE from overseas to help in Chinas fight against the coronavirus after weeks of effort Lizaa told me that finally the local supply started to catch up with demand.  Unfortunately one month later and now the virus has spread across the whole world.  Over the past few days Ive come in touch with several people in healthcare that indicated urgent need for personal protective equipment.  I first saw my neighbor who is an ICU nurse posting on NextDoor to urge people to please stay home. She emphasized that we desperately need to slow things down because hospitals are already becoming overwhelmed.  Another friend of ours a wife and mom works as an ER nurse and her hospital is running very low on masks and they do not know what to do.  I knew I have to do something to help my community. I keep asking myself besides quarantining myself at home what else can I do? How can we help? And then it occurred to me that we may be able to find PPE supply from China to bring back to the US. Sure enough our friend who has helped Chinese hospitals acquire these items locally has introduced us to the suppliers. These masks are produced by FDA-approved suppliers and are willing to sell them at a reasonable price. (This is very important because many of the available masks for public use are not properly vetted or certified and some of their price is just crazy.) Upon making this connection we felt it was our responsibility to open this channel but we cant do it alone.  I view our situation like a war against coronavirus and our healthcare providers are fighting at the frontline day and night. The rest of us need to join them and fight together against the virus. We cant treat patients but there are still lots of things we can do to help and to contribute to get ourselves involved to tell doctors and nurses “you are not alone we are in this together!”  That is why I am starting the project “Mask For America”.  These are tough times for everyone as business has slowed down and in some cases stopped altogether. For those of you who are able we greatly appreciate any contributions you make to this effort.   How Can You Help?   As China ramped up its fight against COVID-19 national mask production also increased tremendously. At this moment US mask production has not yet caught up with demand.  We have identified manufacturers in China with surplus of N95 and surgical masks as well as other PPE but no way to distribute them where they are most needed currently (here in the US). For the cost of a cup of Starbucks coffee we will be able to protect a medical care provider a whole day. Literally no donation is too small! Thank you all for your contribution!   FAQ    What is the current situation in IL?   Like much of the nation testing is just ramping up here in Illinois. Already hospitals are expressing concern with shortages of proper PPE such as masks and gloves. As of March 22 there are 1050 confirmed cases in Illinois including 298 new cases over nearly 150 more new cases than reported on March 21. We should expect for confirmed cases to continue increasing as testing becomes more widely available. This means the supply of PPE is only going to become more stressed over the coming weeks.   Hospitals all over the state  are in jeopardy of potentially running out of critically needed protective medical supplies IHHSA President A.J. Wilhelmi said. With continuing uncertainties about global and U.S. supplies of face masks we urgently need to find alternative supplies no matter where they are so our hospitals can continue to provide life-saving care to current and future COVID-19 patients.  “We desperately need to slow things down. The medical system in our region is markedly stressed by seasonal viral infections in real time and area hospitals are already seeing multiple COVID19 cases” – ICU nurse in Lincoln Square posted on Nextdoor 17th March 2020   Where are all the masks?   As the healthcare system strains to accommodate the unprecedented challenge of the coronavirus outbreak many medical professionals on the front lines do not have adequate protection. Some are reusing masks and gloves. Others have taken to social media with public pleas for help using the hashtag #GetMePPE an acronym for personal protective equipment. Without proper covering every new bedside visit might prove fatal especially for older physicians and their families. And already dozens of health care workers across the country have fallen ill. Hundreds more have been forced into quarantine.  “The sky is falling” one doctor wrote in an opinion piece for  The New York Times.     “Were heading into the abyss” wrote another.  The short supply of masks in particular is dire.

title: Sea Girt 5K - Feed the Shore! - COVID-19 Fund
description: The Sea Girt 5K will match your donations up to the first $5000 raised to help those affected by COVID-19 that are unable to afford food   basic supplies. Many at the Jersey Shore have lost their income overnight and are already struggling to make ends meet. We will be partnering with local restaurants and food banks to assist in providing meals and other necessities. Now is the time to help each other out. Thank you for you support!

title: Suite Staff COVID-19 Relief Fund
description: The COVID-19 Pandemic has severely crippled us all economically. The hospitality industry is one of many. As you know our industry is dependent on incoming revenue from our patrons. However we have closed our venue in order to protect you and our staff; as well as follow the mandate of our Mayor.   We at Suite Food Lounge want to help our staff through this difficult time. While the owners are diligently working on resources to supplement income for our employees we are requesting that if you have enjoyed the services and events provided by Suite Food Lounge and if you have a favorite Suite employee that you contribute to this fund. Nothing is too small as I am sure that the staff will greatly appreciate any contribution you can and as soon as you can.  Thank you for any consideration!

title: COVID19 Closure Ladybrid Bakery Staff Salary
description: Ladybird bakery is a neighborhood classic its morning scones and birthday cakes. We see you each morning and celebrate your big events with you.    Ladybird bakery is a business run on the hard work of dependable and long serving kitchen staff although you dont see them everyday cakes and sconesdont happen without their tireless hardwork day and night.    Donate now to support this small business in covering the salary of their staff in the wake of business closures due to COVID 19.    you will make it possible for these dedicated workers to feed their families and be prepared to get back to cake baking once this difficult time is over.

title: Fundraiser for Medical PPE in BD against COVID-19
description: Bangladesh is going to face a severe outbreak of Coronavirus. We are not ready to fight. Our medical staff dont have enough PPE(Personal protective equipment). Also it is a matter of 2/3 weeks now that hospitals will run out of ventilators. The purpose of this campaign is to collect fund from all non-residential Bangladeshis to help our hospitals buy more ventilators and PPE for medical staff.

title: Protective COVID-19 Equipment for NHS staff
description: Exhausted nurses at overwhelmed London hospital wore bin bags to protect themselves from coronavirusThis headline really got to me. How can we let them work in those conditions?? Its inhumane!!If the government cant help lets raise money to buy the NHS the protective equipment THEY need to stay safe.Its a huge target but lets at least try!!*pictures are not my own...taken from article in Telegraph. See full article at https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2020/03/20/exhausted-nurses-overwhelmed-london-hospital-wore-bin-bags-protect/ here is a link to the hospital that most needs our help https://www.lnwh.nhs.uk/lnwh-charity/  proceeds will initially be sent here.Should the government bring in measures to support the NHS all donations will still be sent to the LNWH charity to halt the spread of COVID-19 within the most affected London hospital.

title: Support for dbar staff effected by COVID-19
description: On March 17th in response to the COVID-19 virus breakout all restaurants in the state had to close their doors to dine in service.   The order has left the dbar staff without the paycheck/tips they rely on.     dbar  has been a staple in Dorchester now for almost 15 years. The staff have become some of our closest friends parts of our family. They have watched our families grow throughout the years celebrating our biggest triumphs. They have been there for us when just needed someone to talk to or a shoulder to cry on. Many of us that live in the area all have a great story or memory that comes from dbar and its staff. Throughout the years they have hosted amazing fundraisers for the LGBTQ community stunning wine dinners tea dances and of course the epic nightlife. Were asking you to make a donation to help support the staff in our time of need.  Any amount would help them 102050100 whatever is doable. Perhaps leave what you would spend on your weekly trip to dbar. Every dbar team member will benefit from this support! (both front of the house staff and back of the house).   If you cant donate all we ask is that you please share this with the community. Weve truly enjoyed being been there for you through everything throughout the years....snowstorms elections celebrations you name it. This is our time of need help support us with the same love weve shown you. No one  knows when this will end so please try and help out during our time of need.  You may also show your support by purchasing dbar shirts/hats from our website. 100% of the money goes to the employees whove been laid off. www.dbarboston.com/shop.  We cant thank you enough from the bottom of our hearts.                                                             www.dbarboston.com

title: Help our Local Community Hospital in Summit NJ
description: Want to join us in making a difference? We are raising money to directly benefit the Doctors Nurses and Other Staff members of Overlook Hospital in Summit. All funds will be donated to the hospital and will be used to procure the PPE (Personal Protective Equipment like gloves masks scrubs etc) for their staff. Ekam USA Inc is honored to step in and help out during this time of need.  Any donation will help make an impact.... thanks in advance for your contribution and God Bless you all!!!  More information about Ekam USA Inc:  www.ekamusa.org

title: FREE FOOD FOR LONDONS - NHS & VULNERABLE (COVID19)
description: In this time of crisis we here at Desi Dhaba have set up this gofundmepage to support our community especially those who are vulnerable and our brave NHS employees who are working on the frontline to battle the COVID-19 pandemic.    Our motto at Desi Dhaba has always been to serve wholesome home cooked style food to our customers bringing the essence of ‘Dhaba food here in London. We are a family run restaurant and take away who strongly believes in supporting our community and doing something that makes a difference. Everyday we are seeing our friends family members of our community Working tirelessly against COVID-19 for us all and this is our way of helping.  With your support £10k would be able to provide up to 4000 meals to those in need.    100% of the donations received would go towards the stock packaging staff equipment and transport and prepare 4000+ meals of food. Please follow us on our social media pages (Facebook and Instagram) for updates on our ‘Meals Milestones so you know how far we have gotten to reach our goal.   We have a large commercial kitchen based in Wembley which is ideally located between our two local hospitals Central Middlesex Hospital and Northwick Park Hospital and an array of GP Practices.   All we need to get going is your love and support. Together we can overcome any adversity please assist us in supporting those in need and those working hard for us all!   Anyone that donates money to the cause we promise to give 20% off your bill in our restaurant takeaway throughout our re-opening period.   Thank you for taking the time to read our food campaign and we really hope you can support us.   Desi Dhaba Family X

title: COVID-19 PROTECT OUR MEDICAL PERSONNEL
description: Our first GoFundMe was a wonderful success but our medical community still needs us!  850 masks are not enough and we need to raise more funds to get them as many masks as possible.  Lets put a smile on their faces  Our medical personnel is fighting the battle with COVID-19 better known as the corona virus.  We are raising money to purchase necessary n95 masks for their protection because at this point they are running low and are being forced to use unsanitary masks or creating masks with rubberbands and towels!!!  Please donate and help your neighbors......    DISCLAIMER: In case we are not able to get enough masks then all funds will be returned or donated... We will post receipts of our purchases as well....

title: Help Philippine COVID-19 Frontliners!
description: Hello Pinoys abroad!   Im Claudia Altavas and Im raising funds for the frontliners of our hospitals in Metro Manila and other provinces of the country. Im on quarantine in the comforts of my apartment in NYC and I feel like its necessary to do something for our health workers while they sacrifice their lives on the frontlines. Im more worried for the Philippines and would love to help out in any way I can. Im sure a lot of the people who live away also feel the same and would like to help out but dont know how.  The majority of the cases are in the National Capital Region (NCR) and test kits arent available in any other parts of the country. Theres not much we can do for now to acquire these test kits so Im asking for your help in providing the frontliners the proper personal protective equipment (PPE) in handling COVID-19 cases.    Hospital frontliners:  doctors nurses med-techs rad-techs nursing aids pharmacists janitors administrative assistants security officers - anyone who is in close contact with COVID-19 positive patients and PUIs. If we can extend at least the masks to ALL hospital workers why not?   PPE:  masks goggles  gloves face shields shoe covers protective suits etc. These might require more improvisation and creativity as demand is high everywhere in the world.  Im in coordination with two people who can help in mask shoe cover and protective suit production - a young designer named  Pia Alviola  who is currently creating PPE prototypes that will pass the health guidelines required by hospitals in treating COVID-19 patients and  Jay Caluag  whose family owns a  patahian  in Bulacan. Both have already distributed masks for hospitals and health centers in Manila and would like to extend distribution to other provincial hospitals that will need help.  Jonas Tamayo     another schoolmate from Ateneo is also helping us secure face shields for our frontliners.  We just need funding!  Were also still looking for other PPE suppliers we could tap.  If you can direct us to any let me know.   For distribution well start with hospitals in Manila Roxas City (Capiz) and Dumaguete City (Negros Oriental). If we get more donations well continue to help hospitals and health centers in other provinces.   METRO MANILA:   Philippine General Hospital Lung Center of the Philippines Jose N. Rodriguez Memorial Hospital    WESTERN   CENTRAL VISAYAS:   Saint Anthony Provincial Hospital Roxas Memorial Provincial Hospital  Siliman University Medical Center  Negros Oriental Provincial Hospital   We will add to the list as we receive more requests for help.  After allotting a portion of the funds for PPE production well be sending monetary funds directly to these hospitals.  For other ways to send your donation aside from this gofundme page:  VENMO:  @tulongpinoy  (Please put a note #TULONGPINOY donation for documentation purposes)    Any amount would do.    Lets find ways to help. Shoot me an email (claudialtavas@gmail.com) if you have other ways youd like to donate ideas comments suggestions questions and well figure it out.   International funds will be transferred via the XOOM app to suppliers and hospital focal points which I will fully disclose in this link once we get this going:   http://tinyurl.com/tulongpinoyupdates     Rest assured Ill be as transparent as possible on where exactly the funds go by providing the exact amount weve gotten after collection and proper documentation and updates after weve released them to the respective beneficiaries.  Please share this initiative. Lets all help our country. Salamat po!

title: Face Shields for COVID-19 Frontline Workers
description: Hello friends!  The last few months have changed the world. Our economy has ground to a halt and most of us are at home under quarantine. I was laid off from my job as a computer programmer last Friday March 20th and joined the already millions of unemployed.  But the heroes are still out there working in our hospitals and clinics! And they have run out of personal protective equipment (PPE).  This is an opportunity for all of us to help!  Ive designed a simple plastic visor that can be 3D printed to create face shields. Face shields are not meant to filter air; they are meant to keep droplets from the eyes nose and face (both ways). They are usually worn in addition to goggles and a face mask. Frontline health care workers are not only running out of masks and goggles they also need these face shields!  I think we can produce 100-200 of these per day but we need help with supplies. To make these shields we need:  * Plastic filament for 3D printed visor * Clear plastic binding covers * Elastic band * Backing rod (mini pool-noodles) for head comfort  Ive created an Amazon wish list and linked to it below. We currently have enough supplies on hand for about 200 of these face shields but we will go through those supplies by end of weekend so we need your help to continue producing them. All face shields will be donated to front line health care workers. I already have a few contacts but feel free to contact us if you know healthcare workers  in need of these shields.  At the same time I also need to support my family.  Money collected through this GoFundMe will be used to pay for bills and food while my wife and daughters and I concentrate on this project full time. We will keep making these shields and donating them until there is no more demand!  To sum up: If you would like to support this project by purchasing supplies please use the Amazon wishlist link below. If you would like to support me and my family directly during this time while we build these masks please donate to this GoFundMe.  Thank you for your help! Stay safe!   https://www.amazon.com/hz/wishlist/ls/1BMRW7TFRRNA7?ref_=wl_share

title: Covid19 hot food aid
description: Covid19 has raised many sad situations and challenges for everyone. BBQ King Restaurant would like to humbly do whatever it can to provide food for those in immediate need.  We will be donating this food served hot in take out packages around Dallas Area.  Type of Food: Pakistan American   Indian Cuisine (Provided by BBQ King Restaurant-Garland) Delivery Available: YES (10 Miles) Pick is preferred especially for bulk orders. Those who wish to donate for this cause are welcome and those who know someone who needs immediate assistance for food please contact us and donate generously.

title: COVID-19 Barber Disaster Fund
description: Due to the most recent tragedies involving COVID-19 the barber industry has been shut down. We as barbers depend on the community to help us stay in business and support our families. Many of the industry is made up of independent workers and dont have access to unemployment.  I know what your thinking business owners can get loans well if we get loans the shop will be in debt and may now be able to get out. The whole world is hurt by this and we as the barber industry need you more now than ever. The point of this fund is to put a little bit of money in barbers pockets across the state for at least 30 days until we can get back to making Coloradans beautiful again. Every little bit helps and we hope you can help us stay in business.

title: Face Masks: Fight the Spread of COVID-19
description: We are making safe reusable masks to make an impact.   NOTE: These masks will be given out for FREE to individuals who are at risk and medical professionals on the frontlines.    Did you know doctors nurses and healthcare workers are seeing COVID-19 patients without proper protection?    This is unacceptable. We have to help.    The CDC updated its guidelines saying that if no mask is available that a homemade mask (bandana/scarf) can be used. Hospitals around the country are DIYing masks or using the same mask everyday?   Upcycle it Now  is a design and manufacturing company that turns materials destined for the landfill into beautiful and functional products. As a small business we were struck by the immediate economic impact of this societal shift. We paid our employees for two weeks and shut the doors. We have been researching to find areas where we can make an impact to help our community and the wider world during this trying time.   Our mission is to increase the availability of quality reusable masks for those in essential businesses and for individuals that are the most vulnerable. With this effort we can give the general public the protection they need while reducing the demand on hospital supplies outside the hospital.  Our Co-Founder Christina Johnson     We have researched the CDC guidelines and developed a process to develop these reusable masks.     Our first day of production        Contact UpCycleItNow Directly

title: Pilsen Vencera COVID-19
description: (Ingles abajo)   La pandemia de COVID-19 está cambiando las condiciones en nuestra ciudad y vecindario cada día. Cada dia que más gente pierden el acceso al trabajo las opciones de alimentos asequibles se vuelven más escasas y la movilidad se vuelve cada vez más difícil de hacer de manera segura los voluntarios de Chicago se unen para aligerar la carga y reducir el riesgo para los miembros de nuestra comunidad más vulnerables.  En Pilsen una red de vecinos ha formado un colectivo de apoyo mutua compuesto por diferentes organizadores madres maestros y personas autónomas que están dispuestas a echar la mano. Inmediatamente proporcionamos entregas de comestibles y provisiones y estamos preparando para expandir servicios para incluir otro apoyo muy necesario como cuidado de ninos apoyo de salud mental hacer mandados y recoger prescripciones.  Necesitamos su ayuda para garantizar que esta red de ayuda mutua sea un esfuerzo sostenido y exitoso en Pilsen. Le pedimos que done lo que pueda se inscriba para ser voluntario o si usted o alguien que usted conoce necesita ayuda infórmenos.  Tenemos la oportunidad de apoyar de diferentes maneras nuestra comunidad en este momento. Tenemos la oportunidad de llegar en amor y solidaridad a nuestros bloques y a nuestros mayores. Tenemos la oportunidad de defender y elevar a nuestros vecinos indocumentados discapacitados y sin hogar.   ¡Cuidémonos unos a otros! Hecho por el pueblo para el pueblo!  +-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-  Quiere ser un voluntario?  por favor mandenos un correo electronico-  pilsensn@gmail.com  **SI USTED ES DUENO O MANAGER DE UN RESTAURANT Y PUEDE DONAR COMIDA POR FAVOR MANDA UN EMAIL**   Necesita ayuda? Diganos en que le podemos ayudar aqui:  https://forms.gle/cReuD6vtuBmKmoop9            CADA DOLAR QUE SE RECAUDA VA DIRECTO A APOYO MUTUO para miembros de la comunidad de pilsen  Su donación es deducible de impuestos gracias a nuestro patrocinador fiscal Pilsen Alliance TAX ID 36-4486055     English  The COVID-19 pandemic is changing conditions in our city and neighborhood every day. As more people lose access to work affordable food options become more scarce and mobility becomes harder and harder to do safely volunteers across Chicago are coming together to lighten the load and reduce risk for our most vulnerable community members.   In Pilsen a network of neighbors has formed a Mutual Aid collective comprised of different movement organizers and autonomous people who are willing and able to lend a hand. We are immediately providing grocery and supply deliveries and we are preparing to expand this to include other much needed support such as care-giving mental health support running errands and pharmacy pickups.   We need your help in making this mutual aid network a successful sustained effort in Pilsen. We urge you to donate sign up to volunteer or if you or someone you know are in need of support please let us know.   We have the opportunity to show up in different ways for our community right now. We have the opportunity to reach out in love and solidarity to our blocks and our elders. We have the chance to defend and uplift our undocumented disabled and houseless neighbors.    Lets take care of one another! By us for us!   +-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-  Volunteer sign up: please email  pilsensn@gmail.com  ** IF YOU ARE A RESTAURANT AND ABLE TO DONATE GOODS/FOOD PLEASE REACH OUT!**   Request support:   English:  https://forms.gle/bgUyB6NCy7miCu8J6   Spanish:  https://forms.gle/cReuD6vtuBmKmoop9    ALL MONEY RAISED WILL GO TO DIRECT MUTUAL AID SUPPORT for PILSEN community members  All donations are now tax deductible thanks to our fiscal sponsor local non-profit Pilsen Alliance! TAX ID 36-4486055  ANY QUESTIONS please reach out pilsensn@gmail.com

title: Lets help Italy to fight Corona Virus
description: Italy is the worst hit country by COVID-19. In the last 24 hours alone almost 800 people died due to Coronavirus and God knows how many more deaths are yet to come.   I have decided to shave my head to support Fondazione Comunita Bresciana Onlus (an Italian association helping hospitals in Brescia) to provide the medical staff in Brescia with the medical equipment (e.g. ventilators) which they will use to cure the patients.   Therefore I am raising funds which will not be possible without your help. I am requesting you all to come forward to donate with your open hearts so that we can support Italy to stand back on its feet.  Should you wish to donate to the association directly you can use the following details:   Account name : Fondazione Comunita Bresciana Onlus  BIC : BLOPIT22  IBAN : IT76Z0311111238000000001390  Payment purpose : AIUTIAMOBRESCIA   If you would like more information you can go to  GiornalediBrescia  or get in touch with myself.   NOTE: I will personally be responsible of managing the money and will transfer all the funds raised to Fondazione Comunita Bresciana Onlus on Friday 27th March.   Thanks for your contributions!!!  Usman

title: Protective Equipment for Medical Personnel COVID19
description: Hi everyone! Were 3 daughters whose parents both work in hospitals as doctors during this COVID-19 pandemic. During this time protection for physicians and healthcare workers should be the biggest priority...but its not. Look at the news talk to people you know working in hospitals—there is a HUGE shortage of protective gear. Were trying to help 3-D print and create plastic shields for the face and to purchase N-95 masks for the people who need it most!!! With this amount of money we can make 2000 shields and buy 2000 masks to distribute. Hospitals are not willing to spend excess money to protect their own employees so lets take matters into our own hands. HELP US HELP THE PEOPLE WHO HELP YOU!!! :)

title: Making Sanitizer to fight COVID-19
description: We are raising money in order to continue our production of hand sanitizer and surface cleaner for the heros who need it!  Everything is donated! So far we have produced and donated hand sanitizer and cleaner to 10+ high risk organizations.  We are not donating this to the public instead we are donating to organizations such as hospitals police and first responders who are on the front lines against this deadly virus.    Right now the demand that is needed is more than we can afford to produce and donate.  We are a small family owned business and do not have deep cash reserves in order to buy the raw materials needed to produce these critical supplies.  Every penny that is donated to us will go towards buying high proof alcohol glycerin isopropyl alcohol hydrogen peroxide and the containers.  We will produce as much as possible and plan to ramp up production over the coming weeks.  It costs about $1.50 in raw materials to produce a 4 oz bottles of sanitizer.    $150 - 100 bottles  $1500 - 1000 bottles $15000 - 10000 bottles  We need to get this money raised as soon as possible so we can get it to the brave men and women who are on the front lines fighting this virus!

title: Help International Students in Ontario  COVID-19
description: COVID-19 has effected every aspect of life around the globe. International students not just in Ontario Canada but all over the world are facing extreme hardships during the unprecedented  COVID-19 pandemic.  Due to the COVID-19 precautionary measures business are closed and 1000s of international students in Ontario are now without jobs.         While the government provides  funding and assistance to support citizens and Permanent Residents International students have no support. They are away from their families alone during these turbulent times. This campaign is to  support international students in Ontario with basic food items  for 3-4 weeks during these extraordinary times.  We are distributing food bags this weekend in Toronto   Kitchener Waterloo. Hoping to organize food bags for distribution in other cities/provinces.   Request your support to help international students in other!   Gautham Kolluri 1 647 833 5257

title: Care kits for COVID-19 staff at RCH
description: Hi everyone   What a week this has been for our communities provinces countries and globally! A time in history that no one had ever imagined.  We hope that all of you at home are staying safe practicing social distancing hand-washing and are healthy.    We wanted to share that we are a team of Psychiatric Nurses who would like to collect donations towards Arbonne baskets and gifting them to our fellow colleagues that are directly working with Covid-19 patients at Royal Columbian Hospital. They are constantly putting their lives at risk to protect the public and save the lives of our loved ones. These gift baskets will demonstrate our gratitude as a community and we would like to continue to uplift their spirits during these unprecedented circumstances.   100% of the proceeds will go towards health care professionals at Royal Columbian Hospital. Your generosity is greatly appreciated. Your donation will be anonymous unless you are wanting it noted in the thank you card (e.g. Sharon B from Coquitlam).  Please note we will be closing the go fund me on March 30th  Thank you Sheila   Romy

title: COVID19: El Corazon/Funhouse Staff Virtual Tip Jar
description: Help Your El Corazon / Funhouse Staff During the COVID-19 Outbreak   The COVID-19 outbreak in Seattle has been devastating for Seattles small businesses and the workers who depend on them for their income.   Since 2005 El Corazon (and later the Funhouse) has provided a welcoming lively place for killer concerts memorable events and delicious drinks for music lovers of all ages and interests. Unfortunately due to guidance from state public health agencies and mandates from our state leadership El Corazon and The Funhouse have been forced to close temporarily until this unprecedented public health crisis has passed.   In the many years that we have been open El Corazon and The Funhouse have attracted an incredible crowd of people built a fun supportive community and provided a safe space for everyone - and that is all due to its incredible staff.  Mandated business closures due to the COVID-19 crisis hit workers like this the hardest. I started this venue because I believed in the dream of a small group of incredibly passionate and talented people working together to make sure tons of music lovers of all ages could be entertained and have a good time. The community embraced this space in a way that I never expected - and I know that we wouldnt be anywhere near as successful without our incredible staff making it the amazing place that it is.  For our 15th Anniversary this year Im asking you to send a few dollars to our El Corazon / Funhouse staff to help them get through this difficult time. If youre having a drink at home and wishing you could be rocking out at our venues and/or bars watching   listening to some kick ass concerts tip your bartender security person sound engineer and/or Janitor to let them know youre thinking of them and youre grateful for what they do.     All funds raised will be split among El Corazon/Funhouse staff.

title: Hand Sanitizer for Saskatchewan!
description: We have been doing everything we can to help front line workers in SK stay safe during this COVID-19 Coronavirus pandemic. We have been donating our Cre8 Vodka – Emergency 70% Ethyl Alcohol to clinics police departments EMS Fire Departments and other first responders throughout the province but its become painfully clear that we cant keep up with the demand without your help!  We have spent over $100000 in acquiring enough supplies to be able to produce 30000 liters of this 70% rubbing alcohol substitute as well as a hand sanitizer that we are launching later this week however our limited production space is hindering our output capacity. We desperately need to expand our production space to be able to utilize the extra equipment that is currently lying dormant in cold storage.  Weve already got the facility we just need your help to finish it. We need to pour a 3500 sq ft concrete slab upgrade our electrical service and install a natural gas steam boiler that will enable to us to supply Saskatchewan with the sanitizing products it desperately needs. After the expansion is complete we expect to not only have the capacity to give the healthcare and emergency service providers what they need but also to supply our fellow Saskatchewanians with quality hand sanitizer at reasonable prices or even for free if possible.  We welcome all donations whether it be in the form of cash building material labor or equipment to help us get this job done as fast as possible. Everyone who donates will be added to our backorder list in order of their contribution amount and will get first dibs on our hand sanitizing products as soon as they become available to the public near the end of the month of which all proceeds will go towards our continuing our donation efforts to keep first responders supplied.  If youre a healthcare or emergency service worker and cant get access to rubbing alcohol or hand sanitizer through your normal supply chains then please reach out to us at sacha@smooth42.ca and well get you what you need absolutely free of charge! Please share this with as many people as you can so that front line workers all over Saskatchewan know that they can reach out to us for help if they need it.

title: Nabugabo COVID-19 Relief Funds
description: Hi everyone   I hope youre all safe and healthy wherever you are in the world right now. Truly extraordinary times were living through. Eve and I are currently at the field station in Nabugabo and are reaching out to folks who have lived and worked here in the past. COVID-19 was detected for the first time in Uganda last night and it will likely spread quickly throughout the country. We are brainstorming ways to help prevent the spread of the virus to and through the village.   The cost of hand sanitizer has soared in the past week so we are looking to make some (using the  WHO recipe ) and distribute it to shops the borehole the fish landing and (hopefully) households in the area. The ingredients are basic and easy to source in Masaka (ethanol glycerol hydrogen peroxide sterilized water) but the costs will add up! We are setting up a fundraiser in hopes that people can assist us with donations.   Our target of 210$ will allow us to make 2 jerrycans of hand sanitizer but it is very likely we will need more (*due to an outpouring of generosity we have increased our target to 315$ to allow us to make a 3rd jerrycan). Any excess funds will be used for more sanitizer and/or cover other COVID-19 related costs incurred by community members (masks are also very expensive). I know that financial situations are tedious right now but anything you can give will go a long way! Please keep in mind that GoFundMe takes 2.9% of all funds raised and 0.30US$ for each individual donation. So for every 20$ donation we will get about 19.12$.   We would appreciate if you could share this with any friends or colleagues you have with ties to Nabugabo and the people living here!

title: COVID-19 Fund relief forJulie Myrtille Bakery
description: Help Julie Myrtille bake for the community.    Julie Myrtille has been hard hit by the COVID-19 coronavirus shortly after opening her first brick-and-mortar which was the culmination of 4 hard working years serving the Austins community at the farmers market in Austin.  As you know this is a tragic time for small businesses in the restaurant industry as the customers practice quarantine and social distancing: a lot of people staying home in order to prevent the spread of this virus.  Considering the hard hit especially for a newly open brick-and-mortar Julie Myrtille needs a little help from you to go through this global crisis .     How can you help ?   Today you can support a small woman business and donate now for this relief fund and/or share this to your friend and Family.    With all our love and gratitude ? Julie Myrtille and the bakery team

title: NATURUN TEAM per ASL 1 - COVID-19
description: Vogliamo raccogliere fondi per riuscire ad acquistare un respiratore da poter donare allAsl n° 1 Imperiese oppure attrezzature per la rianimazione. Oggi vogliamo correre per la vita.

title: Masks for Life - Fight Against Corona Virus
description: SHORT VERSION:  We are sending free surgical and KN95 masks to any organization/hospital/clinic/essential worker that needs it.    LONG VERSION:  We are fighting the corona virus by sending FREE surgical and N95 masks to community organizations health care workers and  essential workers  who are in most desperate need at this moment. We are targeting the most vulnerable and needy organizations who dont have the funds or have run out of masks. Our team members have been working in the health field for decades and so far many of the organizations that are receiving our help are from LGBTQ Asian   Pacific Islander and Native American communities. We are donating to any organization/hospital/clinic that needs these masks. If you need them tell us! 100% of the funds raised goes to buying and directly shipping them from China and our warehouse in Hayward.  We are NOT here to make a profit.  We are providing masks to anyone who needs them. Free. Fast. Its now or never.  We have found several reliable and trusted suppliers of masks and weve been ordering them non-stop to fill the need. We are buying FDA certified surgical and KN95 masks. One surgical masks costs around $0.45 each and the KN95 mask costs $1.70 landed here in the USA.  So far we have shipped out 8K masks in 5 days 6K going out this Tuesday and we just ordered 30K surgical masks and 7K KN95 masks. In 5 days weve raised enough to buy 51K masks!   There are many essential workers in community organizations and shops who dont even have 1 mask. We all have been to our markets and found no one wearing masks because they just dont have any.  Even CityMeals on Wheels NYC workers and volunteers dont have any mask. We were able to ship them masks and in 2-3 days! Why cant the government move any faster? THIS IS RIDICULOUS!!!!! We need to get these masks to all essential workers NOW!   PHASE 1 ( COMPLETED MARCH 23 2020)  We were able to secure 2000 surgical masks from China. Each mask costs $0.50 and the total cost is $1000 plus shipping cost. We already received enough to pay for these and weve already shipped to these 6 organizations/individuals :  Asian Health Services in Oakland San Francisco Community Health Center Kalihi Palama Health Center in Hawaii Valleywise Health Medical Center in Arizona HOAG Hospital in Newport Beach Maya-Scott-Chung in Oakland who will deliver to hundreds of nurses and to LGBTQ people with disabilities and the elders       PHASE 2 (COMPLETED MARCH 27 2020)  We received enough money up to now (March 25) and ordered 6000 surgical masks from a very reliable and well-known Chinese brand Sanqi. We have shipped out to these 19 organizations on March 27.   Meals on Wheel SF   Meals on Wheel NYC   Landmark Health LA   Winslow Indian Health Care Center AZ   Navajo Police Window Rock District AZ   Hawaii Health   Harm Reduction Services HI   APAIT - Special Service for Groups LA   ICHS Seattle   Glow Fund in the UK (Refugee Camps)   North East Medical Services  Daily City   HOPE Clinic TX   Crescent Care Louisiana   West County Health Centers Sonoma County   First Nations Community HealthSource NM   Russian River Health Services Sonoma County   SF Free Clinic   HealthRIGHT 360 SF   South of Market Health Center SF   BAART Turk Clinic SF   BAART Lynwood Clinic Southern CA         PHASE 3 (IN PROGRESS)  We ordered another batch of 6000 surgical masks with the money weve received thus far (March 26). Will receive this new batch on Tuesday (March 31) and will ship out to those on the wait list. So at this point we already bought a total of 14000 masks and 8000 have already been shipped. We are delivering in record speed time. Here are some of the organizations receiving from this batch:   NY Presbyterian Weil Cornell - NYC NY   Mount Sinai - NYC NY   NY Proton Center  - NYC NY   IHS/Navajo Nation - Chinle AZ   Mission Neighborhood Health Center - SF CA   Chiricahua Community Health Centers - Sierra Vista CA   University Of Chicago Medicine - Chicago IL   Cascade AIDS Project - Portland OR   CSL - Northern CA   ...and the list keeps growing.     PHASE 4A   4B (IN PROGRESS)   A - We have found a reliable and trusted supplier of hospital and KN95 masks who is FDA certified. We placed an order of 3000 yesterday (March 26) and they will arriving around April 3.   B- MAJOR NEWS! With todays (March 27) donation reaching over $32K we just placed our biggest order yet!   30000 surgical masks and 4000 KN95 masks! They are scheduled to arrive around April 6. Thank you all for the donations. Its really making a difference.        PHASE 5 (Just more of everything)  We have also had a huge demand for hospital gowns and face shields and were outsourcing them right now. And if we can raise another $20000 we can continue to order more masks. Just keep on donating so we can order what everyone is needing at this moment.    HOW WE DO IT  We are ordering directly from a large distributor in Beijing who only sells top brands like 3M and SanQi a well known brand in China and also directly through a major manufacturer who is FDA certified. For Phase 1 2 and 3 we can only ship a maximum of 4.5 lbs of surgical masks through DHL for $40 (which is an amazing price until April 15). The reason is that the Chinese government is trying to prevent people from selling and making money from these PPE products overseas.  So basically with these constraints weve been able to ship small batches directly from China to these organizations. But we realized this was a short term solution. Now we are ordering in bigger quantities directly from a FDA certified supplier and they are shipping directly to Maxs company located in Hayward. Now well be able to receive the masks here and ship to anyone who needs in the USA.     ORGANIZATIONS IN NEED?  If you know of one or are a community organization clinic hospital or essential workers who needs them desperately please contact us directly by email to  maxlau72@gmail.com . We will put you on a list and will deliver them as we have them available. Notice that we want to prioritize those in serious need who no longer have any mask left. If you still have stock please dont request at this moment. Please provide the following info:   Contact Name   Organization Name   Delivery address (no PO BOX)   Telephone Number   Email address   Amount of masks requested (Limit of up to 300 masks but can provide more)   Send this info to: maxlau72@gmail.com.     PLEASE DONATE IF YOU CAN    100% of your donations will go directly  into buying these masks and shipping to them. Its a small thing we all can do to help. We need the funds asap so that we can ship/mail/drive/walk/run them to the organizations and hospitals. So we dont have much time to waste. Our hospitals health workers and essential workers need them now.  If you are an organization and have the funds to pay for them please donate. We will ship them to you!   We truly appreciate your generosity and support. And stay healthy and stay at home.   Max Henry Chris Cesar Prescott Dan Aaron Steve   Mira   Uncles Social Club + Friends    ________________________________________________   ACCOUNTABILITY TRUST   TRANSPARENCY   A Note from Max  This is my first gofundme campaign and many know and trust me. Thats why you see the amount raised so far. But for those who dont know me (you can read my short bio below) I want to be fully transparent with the financing and show you the proofs. I will post all the money payments that weve done. I am also very weary of these types of fundraisers and only donate to people and organizations that I know and trust. And I am sure you do too. And were experiencing something really freaking scary and no one should prey on anyones emotion and vulnerability much less profit from tragedy. I am not here to make one cent. I am just doing this to help.  My staff member and cousin in China and myself have paid for all of this so far and thank goddess for credit cards. For  Phase 1  my staff paid on his credit card the first 2000 masks and shipped 7 packs. My cousin transferred him this money and will get the transfer note and will post it later here. For  Phase 2 and 3  my cousin is helping us with this effort by spending her own money first to buy all the masks. She bought 6000 surgical masks twice. Shes the one going to DHL sending them to all the organizations here in the USA.   For  Phase 4A   4B  Ive shown all the Proforma Invoices and Paypal payments Ive made. I WANT FULL TRANSPARENCY. I EXPECT FULL TRANSPARENCY from any fundraising campaign.  And I know you do too. So below is the proof but I did black out some stuff for privacy.         ________________________________________________   UPDATE SUMMARY   MARCH 27 - Maya Scott-Chung received our masks and had friends deliver to people in need. Amazing job!    MARCH 26 - Both Asian Health Services in Oakland and Kalihi Palama Health Center in Hawaii received our masks!!!        MARCH 25 - Shipment already arrived at HOAG HOSPITAL in Newport Beach.   Max we received the masks and they look identical to the surgical masks we normally wear. Thank you so much !! I was seriously looking into how to make home made masks... C. Chang M.D.      MARCH 25 - SF Community Health Center (formerly known as API Wellness Center) also received their masks today! (Dont forget we started this gofundme page this Monday and they received these masks on Wednesday!)      ______________________________________________________   FAQ    What is the difference between face masks N95 KN95 KF94 FFP2 respiratory face masks?   They are basically all the same. They stop 95% of particles  0.3 microns in size. The N95 is the USA Code KN95 is China code KF94 is Korea code and FFP2 is the EU code this includes the UK. KN95 KF95 and FFP2 face masks are N95 face mask alternatives   N95 equivalents. They are all the same.  ______________________________________________________   Organizers from the Uncles Social Club   Friends:   Max Lau - Lives and works in Emeryville CA. Works with his sisters at Ficcare Hair Accessories and Clip-rite with over 15 years of extensive experience and knowledge in outsourcing and shipping products globally. Hes also been a Queer API community activist organizer and fundraiser for many organizations like the Jade Ribbon Campaign at Stanford Hospital and AIDS Relief Fund for China. He was the publisher and editor-in-chief of Noodle Magazine in the early 2000s a Gay API Lifestyle Magazine. Sometimes we feel so helpless; so rather than just feel helpless I decided to do something about it. Help me get these masks to the most important people in the front line against this virus especially from the marginalized communities.   Henry Ocampo - Lives in Fremont CA and has worked for over 20 years in social services profession with extensive experience addressing minority health health disparities non-profit management organizational development community mobilization group facilitation and trainings budget management and community relations. More than 17 years working closely with local state and federal agencies and offices working with minority health disparity issues. Worked to bring attention of disparities and assisted in the planning of action steps to address community challenges.   Christine Lee - Lives in Los Angeles CA after being a Bay Area resident and doctor for 20+ years. She is a board-certified Ob/Gyn having recently retired from a busy private practice in Oakland/Berkeley/Lafayette for Alta Bates Summit Medical Center and UHA a division of Stanford Healthcare. She is a graduate of Harvard University NYU Medical School and did her residency at UCSF. In my field of medicine I was used to emergencies all the time and would go into crisis mode. As we shelter-in-place I felt helpless as I was unable to do what I used to do help others in crisis. So I decided like Max to help those who are on the frontlines by getting them what they need to do their jobs safely.  Mira Kwon - A high school junior at Marlborough School in Los Angeles. She is very active in her community from volunteering at non-profits like Liberty in North Korea and Alexandria House to pushing for greater Asian representation at her school by creating the first Korean language class. After feeling helpless just sitting at home she decided to work with her mom Christine Lee to get involved focusing on reaching out to the younger generations through social media and networking. Her ultimate goal is to help raise awareness and empower the youth through this campaign to help fight.   Daniel Chin - Lives in Berkeley CA and is the VP/CFO at Ghilotti Bros.Inc. Dan has co-founded the AIDS Relief Fund for China (ARFC) a public charitable organization dedicated to supporting broad-based HIV/AIDS prevention care and treatment efforts in China. Through fundraising and effective grant making ARFC support individuals and organizations in China in fighting HIV/AIDS. We stand in solidarity with global efforts to end HIV stigma and to empower people and communities living with HIV.  Aaron Deemer is the founder and director of the Glow Fund. The inspiration to start the Glow Fund came on a trip to Sichuan in 2003 when Aaron met Dolma a seven-year-old girl with scoliosis.  Seeing how difficult her life would be with this condition he decided to try and help her. Almost 15 years on Aaron is still in regular contact with Dolma this healthy intelligent hard working young woman.  She is the inspiration for this work.  She reminds us of what is possible if we reach out and help a stranger. Alongside his volunteer work with the Glow Fund Aaron lives in London and works as a Five Element Acupuncturist.   Cesar Cadabes - Lives in San Francisco CA and is program management specialist possessing more than 20 years of experience within a diversity of institutions including; public health departments academic and research institutions and nonprofit community-based organizations in both clinical and non-clinical settings and a strong strategic planner with effective leadership skills to motivate colleagues and varied stakeholders.  Prescott Chow has worked in capacity building in the healthcare sector both domestically and internationally.   Steve Lew - Leadership and management in nonprofit organizations nonprofit consulting training and coaching. He specializes in fund development board development multicultural organizational development and strategic planning.  Uncles Social Club is a quarterly gathering of Gay and Queer Asian and Pacific Islander men 40 years and older. This group was created to provide a social cultural spiritual re-connection with our community and to honor what weve built these past 2-3 decades. Weve come to learn that the work is never really done in contending with stigma isolation ageism and discrimination. Our response to that is to be proactive in nurturing the connections and friendships that were born out of our personal coming out journeys our finding and building community together and our fighting against AIDS. We will do that by providing gatherings on a quarterly basis organizing social excursions and having conversations on matters that are important to us all.

title: Reitverein Niederanven Unterstützung Corona
description: Unterstützung des Reitbetriebs Niederanven  Grenzüberschreitend hat Kim Zwally in Niederanven mit Ihrer Familie einen Reitbetrieb. Reitunterricht für Gross und Klein Pony Spiel und Spass.  Hier werden Kindergeburtstage Kinderreittage Springen Western Dressur Ponyverleih und vieles mehr angeboten in dem Kinder und Erwachsene das Reiten und den Umgang an Pferd und Pony erlernen.  Dies tut die Familie mit ganz viel Herz und Verstand.  Leider ist Sie nun durch die z.Z. stattfinden Umständen des CoronaVirus gezwungen den Reitbetrieb   Veranstaltungen wie z.b. Kindergeburtstage einzustellen wodurch natürlich auch die Einnahmen fehlen die zur Versorgung der Pferde notwendig sind. Zu zahlen sind Stallmiete der 13 Pferde und Ponys sowie HeuStroh und Kraftfutter. Da ich in diesen schwierigen Zeiten nicht reiten kann aber trotzdem meine Reitschule unterstützen möchte habe ich diese Spendenaktion gestartet und hoffe somit einen Betrag von 8000 Euro zu erzielen.  Dieser Betrag würde die nächsten 3 Monate sichern und nun hoffe ich auf viel Hilfe und Unterstützung .  Fühlt euch gedrückt und bleibt Gesund .   Liebe Grüsse   Martina Weber

title: Help Italy- Covid-19 Emergency
description: Ciao Amici   Marco Salzillo and Jonathan Djerbi here just two of the many Italians living abroad and suffering to see our country on its knees in the current CoronaVirus emergency.   We live in Israel and like many of you we have family and friends in Italy who are currently struggling through this pandemic which has affected us all.   In our own small way we thought of raising funds to support our fellow citizens and specifically to help the Italian healthcare with the necessary medical equipment and supplies needed to fight this plague.   The funds raised through this campaign will be donated to the  Italian Civil Protection  which is currently building field hospitals to help the health system which is overloaded and on the verge of collapse.   We are far away but we can still help. Together we will come out of this even stronger.   LETS HELP OUR ITALIAN FRIENDS!   LETS HELP ITALY! __________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________  Ciao Amici  Ci chiamiamo Marco Salzillo e Jonathan Djerbi e siamo solo due dei tantissimi Italiani che vivono allestero e soffrono nel vedere il proprio paese in ginocchio nellattuale emergenza CoronaVirus.  Viviamo in Israele e come tutti abbiamo in Italia famiglia amici e conoscenti che data la distanza fisica e la quarantena non possiamo aiutare.  Nel nostro piccolo abbiamo pensato di fare una raccolta fondi per sostenere i nostri connazionali in particolare modo aiutare le strutture sanitarie con lequipaggiamento e la strumentazione necessaria.  I fondi raccolti con questa campagna verranno donati alla  Protezione Civile Italiana  che sta allestendo in questi momenti ospedali da campo per aiutare il sistema sanitario al collasso.  Siamo lontani ma possiamo ancora aiutare e come sempre da italiani ne usciremo ancora piu forti.  AIUTIAMO IL NOSTRO PAESE!   W LITALIA!

title: Hellas Grill Corona Gutscheine
description: Sehr geehrte Gäste  wir alle durchleben gerade eine turbulente und schwere Zeit. Für uns Gastronomen und vor allem unsere Angestellten ist es ganz besonders erdrückend.   Ich weiß dass auch andere Branchen genau so schwer unter der aktuellen Lage zu leiden haben wie wir jedoch bin ich zunächst einmal darauf bedachtmeinen 25 Angestellten und Ihren Familien weiterhin eine Lebensgrundlage bieten zu können. Da wir im Moment vorübergehend durch die behördliche Maßnahme für einen Monat geschlossen sind belaufen sich unsere Einnahmen z.Zt. auf 0€.  Wir haben bis jetzt auf etwas Hilfe von der Bundes- oder Landesregierung gehofft mussten gestern jedoch ernüchternd feststellen dass die neu beschlossenen Soforthilfen nur für Unternehmen bis zu 10 Angestellten gEltern. Alles was darüber liegt soll aller Voraussicht tatsächlich auf Kredite zurückgreifen. Nur wie sollen wir diese Kredite zurückzahlen wenn wir kein Einkommen haben? Bitte verstehen Sie mich nicht falsch: Ich begrüße diese Maßnahme sehr sind doch unter unseren Gästen auch eine Vielzahl an Einzel- und Kleinstunternehmer.  Aber was ist mit uns die mehr Leuten über Jahre und Jahrzehnten Arbeit geben?  Aus diesem Grund habe ich mich zu diesem Schritt entschlossen. Aber: wir wollen auch etwas dafür zurück geben. Abgesehen davon dass wir in unserem Eingangsbereich eine Liste unserer Unterstützer bis zum Ende des Jahres aushängen möchten wir für alle Spenden einen Gutschein über die gleiche Summe des Spendenbetrages  ausgeben. Wir werden nach der Aktion alle Namen die durchihre Spende einen Gutschein bekommen sammeln und für jeden einen dementsprechenden Gutschein zum Abholen vorbereiten. Sollte jemand von zu weit außerhalb einen Gutschein bekommen so schreiben Sie uns einfach eine Nachricht auf Facebook. Diesen Gutschein schicken wir auch per Post. Für alle Wuppertaler: Bitte holen Sie den Gutschein unter Vorlage des Ausweises und der Spendenquittung bei uns ab sobald wir wieder geöffnet sind.  Bitte beachten Sie: der Gutschein kann nur ausgegeben werden wenn Sie bei Ihrer Spende ihren Namen angeben.   Ich danke Ihnen von ganzem Herzen und hoffe dass wir uns ganz bald wieder sehen. Und wer weiß vielleicht bringen Sie ja einen Gutschein mit!   Ihr Alexander Tsiflidis und das gesamte Hellas Team!

title: Misericordia Castel Del Piano  Emergenza covid-19
description: Misericordia Castel del Piano Emergenza Covid-19Come tutti ben sappiamo lItalia  sta affrontando la battaglia contro il COVID-19. La Nostra  Misericordia si sta impegnado in prima linea contro il Virus questa lotta si va ad aggiungere ai servizi svolti normalmente di EMERGENZA / URGENZA ED AI SERVIZI SOCIALI  che offriamo normalmente H24 a tutta la  popolazione del comprensorio e consegna di farmaci e spesa alimentare porta a porta ( per pazienti anziani o con difficoltà motorie o affetti dal virus o in quarantena) Abbiamo bisogno di dispositivi di protezione individuale per i nostri volontari e per i pazienti dispositivi che però sono difficili da reperire e che hanno costi molto alti.Inoltre i criteri di sanificazione dei mezzi degli ambienti e delle divise con cui effettuiamo i servizi sono più elevati e frequenti. Questo richiede spese straordinarie per lacquisto del materiale necessario. Chi volesse sostenere la nostra Associazione e facendo così tutta la nostra comunità può aiutarci  inviando un contributo su GoFoundMe Oppure al nostro conto corrente bancario IT90L0311172190000000000270 Il vostro aiuto sarà indispensabile per noi e ve ne ringraziamo già da ora. AIUTACI AD AIUTARTI... INSIEME SAREMO PIÙ FORTI#andratuttobene

title: Emergenza COVID-19 Lecce - S.E.U.S 118
description: Buongiorno Salentini (e non)  vi scrive un salentino ormai trapiantato da tempo a Roma e barricato a casa come spero stiate facendo tutti voi.  Vorrei rivolgere un appello a tutto il mio network per uniniziativa che darebbe un contributo importante alla mia terra di origine: il Salento.  In questi giorni stiamo combattendo una guerra contro il peggior nemico che le persone della mia generazione e quella dei nostri genitori ha mai affrontato e al fine di sentirci partecipi e per una buona volta davvero patriottici vi invito ad arruolarvi con un piccolo contributo.  Come vi sentireste se non aveste le gambe e aveste la necessità di essere portati in ospedale per una polmonite da COVID? Ecco ora non pensate a voi e pensate ai vostri genitori o ancora peggio ai vostri nonni. Non potete certo accompagnarli voi rimarreste contagiati e purtroppo che ci crediate o no anche gli angeli del 118 avranno difficoltà a farlo o forse saranno impossibilitati.  Cerco di riassumervi di seguito la situazione interventi COVID e DPI (Dispositivi di Protezione Individuale) in possesso del S.E.U.S 118 Lecce ad oggi:  ·       Soccorritori impegnati in interventi COVID per i quali si ha bisogno di DPI:  135 al giorno ;  ·       Tute EN14126 B4 B5 B6 necessarie:  135 al giorno ;  ·       Mascherine FFp3 necessarie:  135 al giorno ;  ·       Tute EN14126 B4 B5 B6 disponibili ad oggi 22/03/2020:  0 (Zero) ;  ·       Mascherine FFp3 disponibili ad oggi 22/03/2020:  0 (Zero) ;  ·       Tasso medio di crescita casi COVID in provincia di Lecce:  25% al giorno .  Inoltre vengono forniti alla centrale 118 camici EN14126 a norma ma che secondo i soccorritori non si avvicinano allefficienza delle tute sopracitate.  Naturalmente gli angeli del 118 continuano e continueranno a soccorrerci anche cercando di arrangiarsi ma il rischio di contagio per loro è molto elevato e rischiamo di trovarci…senza gambe.  Vi riporto di seguito un virgolettato del  Direttore del 118 Maurizio Scardia  che ha fornito i dati che vi ho prima citato: “Siamo circa 400 guerrieri in campo per combattere una lotta che vinceremo ma con una corazza bianca ci riusciremo prima. Spesso una tuta fa la differenza !!!”  Questo sarà un gesto del tutto simbolico perché la somma che vi ho indicato garantirebbe lautonomia solo per qualche giorno quindi diamoci da fare anche perché un KIT DPI completo (mascherina + tuta) costa meno di 10 euro..meno di un biglietto allo stadio o al Blubay.  I fondi verranno indirizzati alla Onlus di Don Gianni Mattia Cuore e mani aperte verso chi soffre esclusivamente per lacquisto di tute EN14126 B4 B5 B6 e mascherine FFp3.  Grazie infinite  Luca

title: The Coffee Cat Corona fonds
description: Kattencafe The Coffee Cat moet net als veel andere horeca tijdens de coronacrisis haar deuren sluiten. Echter naast een doorlopende huur en loon voor het persooneel zijn er ook gewoon nog steeds onderhoudskosten voor de lieve katten van het Kattencafe. Wij (Rita Matt Stephanie Sarah Sam en Sjoerd) willen hen met deze campagne helpen om deze moeilijke tijd door te komen. (Deze campagne is in overleg met The Coffee Cat samengesteld)

title: Broadbottom Covid19 Fund
description: A group of volunteers have set up the Broadbottom Mutual Aid Group to practically support vulnerable members of our community during the coronavirus emergency.  We are setting up this fund in order to respond to immediate financial need during the period of isolation and uncertainty.  Please donate if youre able. Every little will help.  Many thanks xx

title: Apoyo al Personal Sanitario (ÁLAVA) frente COVID19
description: Ante la difícil situación actual que estamos viviendo en nuestro territorio y en especial el personal sanitario de la OSI ARABA la ciudadanía tiene dentro de sus posibilidades la oportunidad de minimizar el impacto negativo de la infección por COVID-19 (nuevo Coronavirus) en distintas formas o canales de ayuda.  Esta campaña de movilización y recolecta ciudadana es de INICIATIVA PROPIA no vinculada a ninguna entidad privada y dirigida ÚNICAMENTE al personal sanitario de OSAKIDETZA y a sus pacientes principalmente del Hospital de Txagorritxu y/o Santiago Apóstol lugares donde se concentran los casos ingresados. Queremos destinar a ellos un fondo extra para apoyarles en su misión de proteger la salud tanto de la población afectada como la de su seguridad.  Nuestra intención al tener la posibilidad de contacto directo con nuestros compañeros y compañeras que se encuentra en primera línea de batalla en esta crisis en áreas de urgencias UCIs plantas de hospitalización consultas externas centros de salud etc es servir como un canal alternativo de ayuda desde la ciudadanía para cubrir necesidades insatisfechas; haciéndoles llegar directamente material y/o herramientas con el dinero recaudado para cumplir con la PROTECCIÓN y AISLAMIENTO frente a este agente infeccioso como compra de material para impresión 3D para mascarillas etc u alguna necesidad no cubierta que nos sea solicitado tanto por parte del personal sanitario como de  los mismos pacientes para aliviar su situación incluso de aislamiento así como también tratar de minimizar el impacto negativo en su labor diaria y que dada la situación actual se extenderá por más tiempo.  La provincia de Álava es relativamente pequeña pero una de las más afectadasdesde el inicio de la epidemia por lo que cualquier gesto de apoyo tendrá mayor repercusión que en otros territorios por lo que esta en nuestras manos poder sumar para superar la guerra que nos ha tocado vivir. Cualquier idea constructiva o sugerencia será bienvenida  -Dr Orlando Pompei F. Servicio de Reumatología. Hospital Universitario Araba y Unidad de Cirugía Artroscópica Hospital Vithas San José.  -Dr Jorge Guadilla. Servicio de Cirugía Ortopédica y Traumatología. Hospital Universitario Araba y Unidad de Cirugía Artroscópica Hospital Vithas San José.  -Equipo Administrativo Enfermería Médico I+D y todo el personal de la Unidad de Cirugía Artroscópica Hospital Vithas San José.

title: Ayuda Sanitaria COVID-19
description: Pensando en cómo podía aportar mi granito de arena desde casa en esta catástrofe que estamos sufriendo se me ocurrió qué mediante pequeñas aportaciones de todos nosotros podemos crear una un poquito más grande y así ayudar a nuestros sanitarios y pacientes proporcionando material y camas para que puedan atendernos en condiciones humanas    ??Ayudemos y agradezcamos a los que más lo necesitan! Nuestros sanitarios Fuerzas y Cuerpos de Seguridad del Estado farmacéuticos trabajadores de la alimentación logística...     ?? Recuerda que tú aportación se dirige directamente desde la fundación a los hospitales! La prioridad ahora mismo en La Paz y Puerta de Hierro.  Y lo más importante ?? MUCHÍSIMAS GRACIAS POR TU HUMANIDAD SOLIDARIDAD Y GENEROSIDAD EN EL MOMENTO QUE MÁS LO NECESITAMOS ??   ??Mucho ánimo y fuerza para todos  Acabaremos con él    #quedateencasa #solidaridad

title: Sostieni la CRI di Sori  - Emergenza COVID19
description: In questi giorni di  emergenza coronavirus (COVID-19)  anche nei comuni di Sori e Pieve Ligure i volontari della Croce Rossa sono impegnati  per proteggere la salute dei cittadini.   Il servizio di emergenza sanitaria è quello sicuramente più in vista lambulanza che passa con lampeggianti e sirene accese è unimmagine oramai troppo comune.  Ci sono però molti altri servizi necessari per la popolazione che continuano a funzionare grazie allinstancabile lavoro dei volontari: i trasporti di disabili ed infermi per le visite e terapie non rinviabili la consegna di pasti e alimenti agli indigenti e attivato proprio in questi giorni  la spesa a domicilio e il servizio di pronto farmaco.    Il lavoro dei volontari e dipendenti è senza sosta e non ci sono parole per descriverlo per una comunità come la nostra è un vero e proprio tesoro. La passione e il senso si umanità è sono al primo posto!   Per garantire lo svolgimento dei servizi e permettere al personale di lavorare in sicurezza sono necessari urgentemente dispositivi di protezione individuale prodotti per la sanificazione e strumentazioni sanitarie che stanno diventando sempre più introvabili e costosi.   Tutti i fondi raccolti verranno devoluti alla Croce Rossa Italiana - Comitato di Sori per lacquisto di materiale sanitario.   Anche un piccolo contributo può fare la differenza. Aiutaci ad aiutare! Condividi questa raccolta fondi con i tuoi conoscenti!

title: Emergenza Covid19 San Felice a Cancello
description: Il comune di San Felice a Cancello ha deciso di aprire una raccolta fondi pro “emergenza COVID-19” dove saranno versate le somme che imprese e cittadini intenderanno donare per contribuire a far fronte al coronavirus.  Con questa iniziativa vogliamo offrire alle imprese e ai cittadini della nostra comunità un aiuto concreto per affrontare la guerra al coronavirus. I fondi saranno destinati ad attrezzature sanitarie di prima necessità igienizzazione supporto alle famiglie bisognose e alle persone in queste settimane più colpite e tutto ciò che sarà necessario perchè possiamo affrontare al meglio questa battaglia.

title: FEEDING ABERDEENS HOMELESS DURING COVID19 PANDEMIC
description: Hello  For those that dont know us Street Friends Aberdeen are out four evenings a week feeding the homeless and vulnerable of Aberdeen. Our numbers since the start of the COVID19 pandemic have grown so much that keeping the supplies going has been challenging. We dont only have homeless to feed we have seen families coming to us for food families with very young children  This is breaking our hearts. Our street friends are some of the most vulnerable people right now. We will do everything we can to continue our support for them but we really need your help. Please donate anything you can to keep our funds going at this time. I understand that a lot of people are struggling right now. If you cannot donate can you please share this so that others can see it.  Thank you so much in advance. From the whole team at Street Friends we really appreciate it. You are saving lives!

title: Ospedale San Giuseppe di Empoli - COVID19
description: Raccolta fondi per emergenza COVID19 da parte del circolo MCL Il Gabbiano di Spicchio.

title: Help feed front line of COVID19
description: Nurses and Doctors in the Emergency rooms are in need of good food while on the front line fighting for us one less thing for them  to think about.   We need to do our part to help them while  they help our mothers fathers neighbors and friends.. our fellow humans.   Will purchase from local restaurants who  also need our help  at this juncture to stay open.   This will include All metro operating  hospitals that are seeing COVID19  patients.

title: Equipamento Proteção Contacto Covid-19
description: A rede da APT3D composta por mais de 300 voluntarios que partilham a missão de imprimir em 3D o equipamento de combate pessoal ao Covid-19.  Constituindo-se numa rede de ajuda 360º entre voluntarios de impressão 3D parceiros e utilizador de equipamento.   Todo as doações são diretamente para ajudar nos custos de produção dos nossos voluntarios bem como nos custos de envio para todos os intervenientes no combate ao Covid-19.     Os produtos fornecidos são entregues a custo 0.   A Plataforma APT3D é o motor de entreajuda comunitaria e organizacional.
