Setores da Plataforma:          Plataform de management : -Contactos administrativos entre superiores desta rede com centros de distribuição e montagem espalhados por Portugal (Estes centros de montagem e distribuição irão receber as peças impressas e fazer montagens finais necessárias esterelização vácuo e embalagem)       Plataforma de submissão de stock : -De forma a assistir todos aqueles que produzem precisamos de ter um track de peças produzidas por cada um de vocês terão de entrar numa plataforma onde vão dando um update do vosso stock.      Plataforma de pedidos : -Para todos os pedidos de hospitais bombeiros lares ou outros foi criada uma plataforma de tickets para submeterem o pedido de peças que precisam. Plataforma de distribuidores: A criação de distribuidores que irá assistir a ir buscar a casa de quem produz e a vazar stock dos centros de distribuição.   Queremos ajudar todos os intervenientes independente da escala que representam! Daí a criação desta estrutura!   Diretiva Geral APT3D :   https://bitclever-my.sharepoint.com/:b:/g/personal/dlopes_bitclever_pt/EYlHQRutM8VAl8RyalTCdPkBFAQ7DQXemwxXtqiUJPYvww?e=3QlfWT     Website:   http://www.apt3d.org     Plataforma:   https://apt-d.outsystemscloud.com/Manage    (Pedidos Produção e Distribuição)  Facebook:   https://www.facebook.com/APT3D-102574091389633/     Distribuição de Produtores:   https://www.google.com/maps/d/edit?mid=19kEaGZJQk9me-N3MEW3bWmD9mYpg1RRT ll=37.16463454171661%2C-9.706305449999945 z=6

title: Avvocati e Praticanti under 35 Milano vs Covid-19
description: Milano - Giovani praticanti e avvocati con il Policlinico contro Covid-19!   Siamo giovani praticanti e avvocati under 35 che vivono a Milano e che vogliono fare la loro parte per supportare concretamente chi ci sta aiutando giorno dopo giorno: medici infermieri personale tecnico e quindi gli ospedali in particolare le terapie intensive.  Il territorio lombardo è drammaticamente colpito con un numero altissimo di persone contagiate.  Per aiutare concretamente le terapie intensive servono tra le altre cose:  - ventilatori; - dispositivi di ventilazione non invasiva; - monitoraggi emodinamico.   La campagna è organizzata dai giovani ma è rivolta a chiunque!!  Tutti i fondi raccolti saranno direttamente devoluti al Policlinico di Milano (con cui siamo già in contatto) per il rafforzamento della terapia intensiva .    1 2 10 20 Euro: ogni donazione è importante e può fare la differenza!     ***   Milan - Trainees and lawyers under 35 fight with Policlinico against Covid-19!   We are trainees and lawyers under 35 based in Milan who want to do their part to concretely support those who are helping us day after day: doctors nurses technical staff and therefore hospitals especially intensive care.  The Lombardy area is dramatically affected with a very high number of infected people.  At this moment the equipment necessary to triple the intensive and subintensive care beds are:  - Fans; - Non invasive ventilation devices; - Hemodynamic monitoring.   The funds raised will be directly donated to the hospital Policlinico of Milan to strengthen intensive care.     1 2 10 20 Euro: even a small donation can make a difference!

title: Nähen gegen Corona - Wir nähen Mundschutzmasken
description: SCHNELL MASKEN FÜR COVID-19-HELFER*INNEN  Engpässe bei Mundschutz: Suere hilft schnell Masken zu produzieren und diese denen zu geben die sie am dringendsten benötigen. Ob beim Seniorenheim einer Suppenküche der Obdachlosenhilfe bis zu Zahnärzt*innen. Immer mehr Menschen nähen zu Hause Masken und wollen helfen. Wir möchten vor allem durch das ehrenamtliche Nähen die Lieferengpässe ausgleichen schnell koordiniert und effizient.   Suere will jeder ehrenamtlichen Näherin/ Näher ein Paket mit 1m (kochbaren) Baumwollstoff Moltonstoff Draht und Gummibändern/Schrägband zur Verfügung stellen -- genug für 20 Masken. Wir benutzen hierfür Materialien die gut vor Tröpfchen schützen und davon abhalten sich selbst ins Gesicht zu fassen.   Wir benötigen zügig Geld für den Kauf von diesem Material und für die Lieferung des Materials an die Nähenden wie auch für die Lieferung der fertig gemachten Masken an die Einrichtungen die sie benötigen -- das Nähen selbst die Kosten für die Nähmaschinen Garn und vieles mehr wird ehrenamtlich von uns bzw. den Nähenden übernommen.   Im zweiten Schritt wollen wir Masken für die Flüchtlingsheime in Moria (Griechenland) und andere nähen.   Suere unterstützt Menschen die kreativ sein und helfen wollen. Wenn ihr nähen wollt oder Anfragen für Masken habt dann schreibt mir eine Email.  Ich danke Euch von Herzen für Eure Mithilfe.  Annett Kaplow von Suere- Fashion with a Mission   https://www.instagram.com/suere.fashion/?hl=de

title: Covid-19 Face Shields for front line healthcare
description: Vector Injection - COVID-19 support    Local front line Covid-19 healthcare workers need to be protected and they need our help.  In cooperation with a team from the University of Guelph I am allocating my companys resources to manufacture face shields that will be donated to local hospitals.  We will design and manufacture an injection mold and produce in excess of 5000 parts per day.   I am committed to this support effort regardless of the success of this campaign. We will start Monday March 23 and hope to produce our first parts in 2 weeks.  The costs will exceed our $5000 fundraising goal but any money raised will allow us to do more.  Stay safe stay healthy  Evan Goodwin President Vector Injection

title: Covid-19 Relief funds
description: Myself and others have been laid off due to the pandemic spreading all around us. I am hoping to raise money for myself and applicable staff at Little Kings and Queens a 501c3 charity. Any donation will be greatly appreciated. Thank you and stay safe and healthy!

title: Rexs Family COVID-19  Employee Relief
description: Rexs Familys focus from the beginning has been to build a company that creates success for our people so the necessity of restaurant closures and valued employee layoffs has left us utterly gutted.  Our employee needs are a priority to us so we are reaching out to our guests friends and family to help!   100% of funds raised will be going towards covering our employees health insurance expense in order to maintain all coverage during closures. Any additional funds will go towards other essential needs of our employees.  We thank you for your continued support and want you to know that every little bit goes a long way for our staff right now.

title: Food & Necessities for JC- COVID19
description: We are raising funds to purchase food and necessities to our local hospital workers homeless shelters police department and to anyone who may need any help during this time. With the funds we raise we will use it to buy food from local businesses to also help support them during these difficult time.   Anything helps!   Thank you!

title: Covid19 Ospedale Vibo Valentia-Tropea-Serra
description: EMERGENZA COVID 19L Associazione di promozione sociale il Fiore della Solidarietà di Vibo Valentia per far fronte alla drammatica emergenza covid 19 ha avviato una raccolta fondi da devolvere ai presidi ospedalieri di Vibo Valentia Tropea e Serra San Bruno

title: Equip ER staff for COVID-19 crisis
description: Hospitals around the country are facing unprecedented supply shortages including essential equipment needed to protect medical providers from infectious diseases like COVID-19. At Highland Hospital a large county hospital in Oakland California that serves a wide array of patients medical providers are facing a shortage of PAPRs (pronounced pappers).  PAPRs are filtered masks that completely cover the head  and they are essential for intubating patients (placing breathing tubes) with COVID-19 a procedure that is necessary for serious cases.  Currently the Highland emergency department only has 3 which means that only one unstable COVID-19 patient can be safely resuscitated at a time. The shortage places patients and medical providers at risk since the  high likelihood of having multiple critical COVID-19 patients guarantees that staff will be dangerously exposed or patients will be treated less effectively.   From my sister a doctor in the emergency department at Highland Hospital:   I fear that we will have to choose between life-saving resuscitation measures for our patients and protecting ourselves. I dont want to have to make that choice and I dont think we should have to. Our low number of PAPRs is unreasonable given what were expecting. Ideally I think we should have 9-12 but right now we only have 3.  There are requests in place and people at the frontlines are voicing their concerns. But given that our public hospital is already strapped I think we need to explore other avenues to keep doctors nurses and respiratory therapists safe in face of this pandemic.  I came home last night and thought now that were no longer out of hand sanitizer what would it take for me to feel safe at work? What do I need to face this crisis? I need for my whole team to be adequately protected and having PAPRs (these protective respirators for everyone who is resuscitating and intubating unstable victims of the COVID19 pandemic). I am asking for 9 more so we are well equipped which would be $15000.    local news coverage  - hear Highland nurses concerns here  A pic of my sister Rebecca SIL Tara and their 2 yr old Naya - protect these three and all the other medical professionals and their families who are putting themselves in harms way to keep us safe!    More pics of Highland staff and their families - lets keep these people safe they are risking their health and safety to take care of us in this time of crisis!

title: AIUTI COVID-19 FAMIGLIE IN MAROCCO
description: In paesi come lItalia paese dove vivo il Governo sta cercando di prendere misure economiche per fronteggiare lemergenza Covid19. In campo aiuti per medici lavoratori famiglie e imprese uniniezione di sostegno alleconomia con agevolazioni e investimenti. Tutto ciò è molto più difficile da gestire in altre realtà economiche di altri paesi dove la situazione sanitaria finanziaria è compromessa e non pronta ad affrontare epidemie che riducano ulteriormente la macchina produttiva ed economica del paese uno tra questi il Marocco; ora con la quarantena molte padri e madri di famiglia devono stare a casa non avendo più modo di guadagnarsi il pane per sfamare figli soprattutto perché lo Stato non aiuta queste famiglie che vivono alla giornata; il mio pensiero va a queste persone e vi chiedo di aiutarmi a fornire loro un piccolo supporto finanziario che dia loro protezione e sostentamento che dia loro le forze per affrontare questa epidemia che sconvolge tutto il mondo e che rende i poveri molto più vulnerabili e dimenticati di quanto già lo siano. Siamo già in contatto con 4 famiglie e contiamo di aumentare il numero se ce lo permettete con il vostro supporto.

title: Emergenza Covid-19 #RoccapalumbaSolidale
description: Parte #RoccapalumbaSolidale iniziativa di solidarietà nata da un gruppo di ragazzi e rivolta a tutti gli abitanti di Roccapalumba.  Stiamo attraversando un periodo drammatico e il pensiero corre subito a chi è più fragile e a chi in questo momento sta affrontando forti difficoltà : agli anziani a chi abita in solitudine alle famiglie con difficoltà economiche a chi è a casa perché non può più lavorare ai bambini che non possono uscire a giocare agli studenti che non possono andare a scuola.  E giusto fare qualcosa per il nostro paese.  Per questo motivo abbiamo deciso di:  a) dar vita ad una raccolta fondi.  Una donazione libera che chiediamo ad ognuno di voi per costituire un fondo di beneficenza a disposizione di tutti coloro che ne faranno richiesta e che ne hanno bisogno per affrontare gli acquisti alimentari E un piccolo contributo che può dare un po di sollievo alla nostra comunità! Non tiriamoci indietro.  B) sappiamo che è difficile trovare in commercio mascherine e gel igienizzanti: proveremo a fare un ordine consistente e a mettere i prodotti a disposizione gratuitamente e senza alcuna limitazione per tutti i cittadini che ne faranno richiesta

title: URGENT: Prepping for COVID-19 With Food
description: Most of you know I support an animal shelter in Curitiba Brazil. We need your help. We are navigating uncharted territory with the COVID-19 virus and are unsure if our supply chain will be disrupted or stopped in the upcoming weeks. To be proactive we need to purchase one months worth of extra supplies and feed for our 320 rescued dogs and cats. Here are just a few of our monthly costs:  - Food - $1600 per month  *You can donate to this fundraiser on Venmo (@LucianaCalvin) on PayPal (jane.cucatto@gmail.com) or at bemviralata.org  We are dedicated to providing a safe and happy environment for abused and neglected animals that have nowhere else to go and their health and well-being is our top priority. Thank you so much for continued support during these trying times. We cant do this work without you and we are always humbled and grateful for your support.

title: One Bourbon Staff COVID-19 Relief
description: Due to the extension of closures until April 13th we are now in a pickle. One Bourbon relies on our VERY small team and their passion and education around whiskey and comfort food.  We are grateful for the MI and Federal government on releasing aid for businesses such as ours. Unfortunately those processes take time and our kids need help now.  We have 19 staff members most of which are mostly full time and many have been with us for years.  We are asking for donations to help them through until we as their employer can support them as is our responsibility and pleasure.  As an effort to connect in this time feel free to post whiskey or food questions to our staff! We will make sure they can access and reply.   We miss serving you!!!

title: NYC COVID-19 Front-line Support
description: Lets support the healthcare professionals at Memorial Sloan Kettering that are working around the clock to care for those fighting COVID-19 while still treating patients battling cancer.   All funds from this page will go directly towards nutritional and immunity support to keep their bodies strong and brighten their day.   We will be sending healthy food and immune boosters from local small businesses in NYC.  Any dollar amount will help us reach our goal.  If we surpass our goal we will broaden the support to other hospitals in NYC.

title: COVID-19 (Coronavirus) N95 Masks
description: Hospitals are running low on one-time use N95 masks that will protect them from COVID-19 (Coronavirus) when dealing with patients so in an attempt to help solve this issue  a few friends and I have been 3D printing masks to make up for this lack of masks. One hospital-issue N95 mask can be cut up into small circles and placed in the small screw-in filter capsules for a longer use period and a more efficient mask that can be cleaned and is durable enough to withstand wear for long periods of time. Any donations will be used to purchase printers and filament to continue printing and sending masks out to those who need them the most. Each mask takes about 3-4 hours to print in good quality. Each filter capsule takes about 1.5-2 hours to print so more filament and printers are needed to continue this effort. Thank you for your support and donations!

title: Spider Kellys COVID-19 Staff Relief
description: Not even two weeks ago we celebrated the 10 Year Anniversary of Spider Kellys. Just five days after that we closed our doors indefinitely (with the exception of take out!) for the safety of our staff and our community laying off 30 staff members in the process.   Thats 30 people - many with families - whose rent utilities groceries  tuition and health care is now on the line without a reliable source of income. Despite this the SK team has been INCREDIBLY supportive of each other offering links and connections to resources available donating carry-out tips to the laid off staff and providing regular updates with additional resources as they surface among other measures of support. The sense of community within this group of people has been remarkable!  Im now reaching out to our family outside of the SK staff and asking that you show the same love! I am painfully aware of the impact COVID-19 has on everyone across the globe but I know for industry people - my SK family specifically - their livelihoods are in jeopardy with no guaranteed or  foreseeable relief. Whatever you can do to help - if not through financial contribution then by sharing this GoFundMe campaign with anyone and everyone you know - would offer some relief to the SK staff that you know and love.   Thank you so much! Stay safe and wash your hands!  Love Justina

title: LA TERAPIA PER IL COVID-19 NON PUO ASPETTARE
description: Lemergenza Covid-19 ci mette davanti ad una sfida contro il tempo.  E il momento di dare il nostro supporto alla ricerca scientifica perché è la nostra unica chance per vincere contro il Coronavirus.  Ho deciso di avviare una campagna di raccolta fondi in collaborazione con lIstituto di Ricerche Farmacologiche Mario Negri da 60 anni eccellenza scientifica non solo in Italia ma nel mondo.   I fondi raccolti serviranno per sostenere le 4 linee di ricerca per la terapia contro Covid-19. Sono impegnati 40 ricercatori supportati dai 600 colleghi dellIstituto che collaborano con gli ospedali Sacco Niguarda e Papa Giovanni XXIII di Bergamo.   Il nostro gesto è indispensabile. Ognuno può contribuire secondo le proprie possibilità e condividendo questo messaggio.  Comincio io so che anche voi tutti amiche e amici lo farete.   I fondi raccolti saranno direttamente devoluti allIstituto di Ricerche Farmacologiche Mario Negri IRCCS.   __________________________________________________________________________   The Covid-19 emergency presents us with a race against time.  Its time to give our support to scientific research because its our only chance to win against the Coronavirus.  I decided to start a fundraising campaign in collaboration with the Mario Negri Institute for Pharmacological Research a pillar of scientific excellence for over 60years not only in Italy but in the world.   The funds raised will be used to support the 4 lines of research for a therapy against Covid-19. 40 Researchers are involved supported by 600 colleagues of the Institute who collaborate with the hospitals Sacco and Niguarda in Milan and the Pope John XXIII hospital in Bergamo.   Our support is crucial. Everyone can contribute according to his or her own means and by sharing this message.  I will do so and I know that many of you will do so as well.  The funds raised will be directly donated to the Mario Negri Institute for Pharmacological Research IRCCS.

title: COVID-19 Frontline Community Fundraiser
description: Our Mission: Raise Money for PPE / Frontline Supplies / Sewing Materials (Fabric   Filters)  As you may know supplies for healthcare workers at this time are unbelievably scarce putting our frontline workers and their patients in danger of falling ill passing along symptoms and creating the risk of being unable to staff the hospital during this public health crisis.  Currently local hospitals are in dire need of supplies. Over the past week frontline workers have been directed to buy and make their own protective gear -- bandanas as face masks ski goggles as protective eyewear and rags and towels instead of sanitizing wipes. Healthcare workers are scrambling to get PPE (N-95 masks surgical masks face shields gloves surgical scrub caps etc) in every and any way possible.   We have started a community fundraiser to help in order to help frontline workers procure PPE as well as materials for alternative protection measures and we are asking for your financial help in this time.    If you have supplies to donate:   Please consider donating supplies. Anything that is not being used currently at (your place of business school worship construction site brewery etc) could be helpful and greatly increase the level of care these hospital workers can provide. In order for this to be effective we need a large community effort immediately.    What do we need?  We are asking specifically for items including but not limited to: N95 respirators surgical masks disposable gloves face shields goggles shower caps cleaning supplies canisters of disinfectant wipe cleaning rags hand sanitizer etc….  Be creative. There are no limits as the hospitals need all the help they can get and it is our citizen responsibility to help protect them.   If you have supplies or questions please send me a message through the GoFundMe platform and I will get back to you.   Thank you all in advance!

title: Help OTF Laguna Niguel Staff During Covid19 Crisis
description: OTF Laguna Niguel family   As you know due to the tragic COVID-19 epidemic and pursuant to the recommendations of state and local authorities we have had to temporarily close our beloved Orangetheory Fitness Laguna Niguel studio on March 16th.    To ensure that we can sustain the viability of the company through this crisis the owners had to make the very tough decision to temporarily layoff more than 80% of our staff which they intend to rehire as soon as we can reopen.  While the company generously offered to pay the wages for all hours and classes scheduled through the end of March we know now that this crisis will last for weeks beyond that and state unemployment benefits will not come close to fully replacing their income.  Many of you have generously asked what you can do to help.  We are not asking for nor do we expect donations but we also realize that many of you have personal relationships with our team so if you are feeling generous and would like support your coaches and staff you can make a donation to our GoFundMe page. No donations will go to the company.  All donations will go directly to the laid off employees and be split equally between them and dispersed out every 2 weeks.  Any gift however big or small will make a meaningful impact to your studio team during this unusual time of need.  We promise to return the generosity in the days ahead in our way when we can.  Thank you for your continued support. We miss you all so much!

title: Covid-19 Special Appeal
description: Join me in making a huge impact in our community.  Were raising money for WINNIPEG HARVEST.    Help us feed vulnerable neighbours at-risk older adults children and families!  *Your donation is tax receiptable.   Winnipeg Harvest is the principal distributor of food to Manitobans through more than 300 food banks and partner organizations across Manitoba.  In a normal month they feed 70000 people including 25000 kids.  Since the COVID-19 crisis struck Manitoba there has been a spike in the number of people who need food.  Why?  Schools and daycares closed ending access to weekly meal programs for hungry kids.  Also stopped Breakfast2Go weekend food for hungry kids. Businesses closed or reduced hours ending jobs or reducing wages for many and causing incredible stress for families already living cheque to cheque. Government assistance packages are not expected to flow until at least May which means people will lose at least 3-4 pay cheques.  Coping with this pandemic is the greatest challenge we have ever faced.  We need to come together as a community and get through this upheaval.   You can help right now by chipping in whatever you can!     Experts across the country are encouraging us to have a 14-day supply of food—enough to last the quarantine period if needed.   Winnipeg Harvest is making large pre-packaged hampers for distribution to families in need.  The hampers will include standard non-perishable items like pasta sauce canned vegetables and meats as well as baby food formula bread and other main food staples.   * Your gift of $25 will buy 10 lbs of food for a child or at-risk adult. * Your gift of $60 will buy one large hamper to feed a family of four. * Your gift of $250 will feed 4 families one large hamper each.   Be a Harvest Hero.   We need your support now more than ever to keep food flowing to those who need it most.    Thank you in advance for your incredible and much welcome generosity!

title: Helping the Hungry on the NW Side of Chicago
description: Our Facebook page    The Joined Hands Food Pantry serves over 120 families every week on Wednesday at St. Johns Lutheran (4939 W Montrose). We do not limit people by zip code and everyone with a need for food is welcome. We will be able to distribute food on Wednesday March 25th at 5 PM in the parking lot - please note that this is different from our usual hours and location.  The COVID-19 crisis has had a huge effect on our ability to provide food to our hungry neighbors and friends. To keep up with expected increased demand for our services and the fact that some of our normal sources of donated food have been disrupted we are turning to the community for financial support. We will need funds to meet our goals and continue to serve people weekly.   Any support you can provide is greatly appreciated. We will be sure to provide updates if our pantry time and locations change. If you have any questions please email us or message us on Facebook.

title: Cut Club Corona Hilfe
description: Sehr geehrte Kunden wir alle durchleben gerade eine turbulente und schwere Zeit. Für uns Friseure und vor allem unsere Angestellten ist es ganz besonders erdrückend. Ich weiß dass auch andere Branchen genau so schwer unter der aktuellen Lage zu leiden haben wie wir jedoch bin ich zunächst einmal darauf bedachtmeinen 8 Angestellten und Ihren Familien weiterhin eine Lebensgrundlage bieten zu können. Da wir im Moment vorübergehend durch die behördliche Maßnahme für einen Monat geschlossen sind belaufen sich unsere Einnahmen z.Zt. auf 0€.Wir haben bis jetzt auf etwas Hilfe von der Bundes- oder Landesregierung gehofft mussten gestern jedoch ernüchternd feststellen dass die neu beschlossenen Soforthilfen nur für Unternehmen über 10 Angestellten gelten . Alles was darüber liegt soll aller Voraussicht tatsächlich auf Kredite zurückgreifen. Nur wie sollen wir diese Kredite zurückzahlen wenn wir kein Einkommen haben?Bitte verstehen Sie mich nicht falsch: Ich begrüße diese Maßnahme sehr sind doch unter unseren Gästen auch eine Vielzahl an Einzel- und Kleinstunternehmer. Aber was ist mit uns die mehr Leuten über Jahre und Jahrzehnten Arbeit geben?Aus diesem Grund habe ich mich zu diesem Schritt entschlossen. Aber: wir wollen auch etwas dafür zurück geben. Abgesehen davon dass wir in unserem Eingangsbereich eine Liste unserer Unterstützer bis zum Ende des Jahres aushängen möchten wirfür alle Spenden einen Gutschein über die gleiche Summe des Spendenbetrages ausgeben.Wir werden nach der Aktion alle Namen die durchihre Spende einen Gutschein bekommen sammeln und für jeden einen dementsprechenden Gutschein zum Abholen vorbereiten. Sollte jemand von zu weit außerhalb einen Gutschein bekommen so schreiben Sie uns einfach eine Nachricht auf Facebook. Diesen Gutschein schicken wir auch per Post. Für alle Wuppertaler: Bitte holen Sie den Gutschein unter Vorlage des Ausweises bei uns ab sobald wir wieder geöffnet sind.Bitte beachten Sie: der Gutschein kann nur ausgegeben werden wenn Sie bei Ihrer Spende ihren Namen angeben. Ich danke Ihnen von ganzem Herzen und hoffe dass wir uns ganz bald wieder sehen. Und wer weiß vielleicht bringen Sie ja einen Gutschein mit! Lui Leverè und euer Cut Club eleven Team

title: Raccolta fondi emergenza  ospedaliera Covid-19
description: Noi ragazzi del Rotaract Club Bolsena e Ducato di Castro abbiamo creato questa campagna con lo scopo di raccogliere fondi per lattuale emergenza sanitaria che tutto noi stiamo vivendo. In particolare vogliamo sostenere i presidi ospedalieri della Tuscia.

title: Ride for the Mid-South Food Bank
description: This Saturday March 28th I will be riding my bicycle (carefully) from Memphis TN to Oxford MS to raise money and awareness for the Mid-South Food Banks Coronavirus response efforts.  In addition to their ongoing fight against hunger in the Mid-South the Mid-South Food Bank is packing 14-day food boxes with nonperishable food to help low-income and vulnerable populations during the Coronavirus outbreak.  Visit their site for more info:   https://www.midsouthfoodbank.org/coronavirus-response     The ride itself is 96 miles so I will start with a personal donation of $96 to kick things off.  This ride was born out of an effort to shake off the hopelessness of sitting around at home while we wait this thing out. I want to lend a hand and also have a shared goal with friends and family especially since most endurance races are being cancelled or postponed.   Every bit helps. I will post updates of the ride on Instagram and Strava.  Thanks for your consideration  Pete

title: Meals for hardworking ICU doctors during COVID-19
description: www.loulounyc.com    Loulou is a new French Bistro on the corner of 19th Street   8th Avenue in Chelsea. We unfortunately had to shutdown shortly after opening due to the COVID-19 outbreak.   During these difficult times we decided to help hospitals by cooking and delivering hot meals to ICU doctors throughout the city in partnership with @ilanaleighbrown  @joelwish and @sevenrooms.   Doctors are at the forefront of the pandemic. They are working tirelessly to keep our friends and family safe and healthy. These doctors dont have time to get a proper meal. You can help by donating any amount. 100% of the proceed will be directed to preparing and delivering hot meals to these doctors.      Thank you for your help! Together we can get through this!

title: COVID-19 Medical Mask Fund - Ann Russo Tech Design
description: Due to the COVID-19 crisis our medical professionals do not have the medical masks and equipment they need putting themselves at risk for the sake of others.  They need our help. NOW.  With your help we can provide them 500000+ medical masks made of tightly woven cotton fabric.  We need donations to source 25000 yards of cotton fabric from the only USA-based cotton mill.  The fabric will be sent to a Fall River MA - based factory and they will manufacture these 500000 masks asap.   Any donation you can provide is so greatly appreciated! We are all in this together.

title: Doylestown Neighbors United - COVID-19 Response
description: Funds will be used for Community response efforts related to the     COVID-19  Pandemic.     We are currently assisting:  - Families facing food instability  - The stocking of local food pantries  - Local hospitals and health facilities and their attempts to source much needed supplies and personal protective equipment  - Victims of Domestic Violence in need of support/resources

title: Portugal contra Covid-19
Quarantäne ohne Einsamkeit     COVID-19
description: Unser Kampagnenziel:   Wir organisieren und verteilen kurzfristig und effektiv iPads mit Videochatfunktionen an Krankenhäuser die aufgrund der steigenden Anzahl von Corona-Infizierten ein strenges Besuchsverbot aussprechen müssen.    Warum?  Die Patienten in den Krankenhäusern die aufgrund der steigenden Anzahl von Corona-Infizierten eine strenge Besuchersperre aussprechen müssen sind komplett isoliert. Sie benötigen dringend einen regelmäßigen Kontakt zu ihren Angehörigen um ihre Situation besser ertragen zu können. Betroffen sind sowohl Corona-Infizierte als auch alle anderen Patienten die mit ihren Erkrankungen in den Krankenhäusern „gestrandet“ sind z.B. auf Kinderstationen in Palliativbereichen auf der Onkologie oder der Geriatrie. Einige Patienten sind zutiefst verängstigt können von sich aus keinen Kontakt mehr zu ihren Angehörigen aufnehmen und leiden sehr unter der extremen Isolation durch die Quarantänemaßnahmen. Mithilfe der iPads und der Videochatfunktion kann ein naher lebendiger Kontakt hergestellt werden. In einer kritischen Situation hat eine gespürte Nähe für alle Betroffenen eine beruhigende Wirkung und sie kann den Genesungsprozess positiv beeinflussen. Europaweit müssen immer mehr Corona-Infizierte medizinisch betreut werden und es ist daher absehbar dass immer mehr Krankenhäuser aufgrund von Vorsichtsmaßnahmen ein strenges Besuchsverbot aussprechen müssen.   Ausschlaggebend für unsere Kampagne ist ein Bericht von der italienischen Ärztin Francesca Cortellaro Chefin der Notaufnahme des „San Carlo Borromeo“-Krankenhauses in Mailand im  „ Il Giornale  “.    Zitat : „Wissen Sie was das Schlimmste ist? Zu sehen wie die Patienten alleine sterben. Zu hören wie sie bitten sich von ihren Kindern und Enkelkindern verabschieden zu dürfen. Die Corona-Patienten würden alleine im Krankenhaus liegen. Kein Verwandter dürfe sie begleiten. Zuletzt habe ich das heute Abend erlebt. Es war eine Großmutter. Sie wollte noch einmal ihre Enkelin sehen. Also habe ich das Telefon rausgeholt und sie per Videocall angerufen. Sie verabschiedeten sich und kurz darauf ist die Frau von uns gegangen. Inzwischen habe ich eine lange Liste von Videoanrufen. Ich nenne sie die Abschiedsliste.“ Für ihre Patienten wünsche sie sich einige iPad mini sagte Cortellaro. Damit die Patienten engeren Kontakt mit ihren Verwandten halten könnten. „Drei oder vier würden ausreichen um sie nicht alleine sterben zu lassen.“   Wer sind wir?   Ulrike Schüchler  ehrenamtliche Sterbe- und Trauerbegleiterin im ambulanten Hospizdienst  Sönke Schüchler  Geschäftsführer der netconnect GmbH IT-Projekte im health-care und in Krankenhäusern    Wir sind für jede Art von Unterstützung dankbar. Unser Ziel ist es so schnell wie möglich die ersten iPads an isolierte Patienten in den betroffenen Kliniken ausliefern zu können.   Wenn Sie spenden möchten können sie es mit Namensnennung oder anonym vornehmen. Ein „Trinkgeld“ für die Crowdfunding-Plattform ist nicht erforderlich und kann mit dem Button „Anderer Betrag“ auf 0 gestellt werden.     Gelder die über das Kampagnenziel hinaus gesammelt werden gehen direkt an die WHO (u.a. Impfschutz Medikament etc.)

title: Support Philly Homeless Shelters Amidst COVID-19
description: In light of the COVID-19 pandemic those who are homeless are experiencing difficulties reconciling cries for social distancing with the inevitably close quarters of shelters and meal sites.   Philadelphia shelters and meal sites are adjusting operations to prioritize the health of their guests. Shelters that provide sit down meal services are now transitioning to providing to-go meals which are posing monetary burdens to their operations. More can be found  here  on shelter responses.   The Shelter Health Outreach Program (SHOP) at the University of Pennsylvanias four partners Feast Incarnate at the University Lutheran Church Bethesda Project Chosen 300 and Sunday Breakfast Rescue Mission are  in need of donations for water bottles sanitizing products to-go containers and food.  We hope to make a monetary contribution as they help those who are homeless at this difficult time.   The Shelter Health Outreach Program (SHOP) at the University of Pennsylvania provides free blood pressure screenings hypertension awareness and primary care access information to visitors of Philadelphia homeless shelters and meal sites. SHOP recently paused its volunteer operations in light of the COVID-19 pandemic following University closure.  Your donation will be directly transferred to SHOPs partner shelters and meal sites.

title: COVID-19: A Million Masks Support Fund
description: Ontario hospitals  are running out of supplies for Frontline Workers including Doctors Nurses   healthcare staff who are treating  COVID-19  patients. Our friends who are working in some of Ontarios hospitals have told us that there is a severe shortage of masks and other Personal Protective Equipment (PPE). The Provincial Government has pleaded with every member of the Province to assist in any way that they can (see  www.ontario.ca/OntarioTogether ). We are answering the call in a big way but we  NEED YOUR HELP AS SOON AS POSSIBLE   We have a supplier but we need funds in order to ship large quantities to Ontario Hospitals faster than the Government can move as they are overwhelmed with the fallout from this Pandemic.  We spoke with medical professionals to identify that their greatest needs are masks.  WE ARE ABLE TO SECURE A LARGE SUPPLY OF N95 AND SURGICAL MASKS  to be shipped to Ontario (and potentially the rest of Canada). We will do the work we just need your charity and generous donations.  Ontario Health Care Workers are todays Frontline troops and WE NEED to supply them with the best tools in this fight.   ALL DONATIONS  will go directly into the purchase and delivery of N95 masks surgical masks and Personal Protective Equipment for frontline healthcare workers in Ontarios busiest Emergency Rooms and Intensive Care Units.   As  CANADIANS  we cant just sit around and watch Netflix. As a former member of the  Canadian Armed Forces  I understand the need to keep our Frontline troops sustained so that they can keep up the fight.  IT WILL TAKE ALL OF US  to play a role.     WE ARE ALL IN THIS TOGETHER      OUR GOAL     $500000  will acquire the first  1 Million  surgical masks   to arrive we are aiming to do this as soon as possible. (Timelines will be updated Regularly)   Ontario  has  14.57 Million  people if everyone in the province donated  $1-$10  we can raise anywhere between  $14570000  to  $145700000!!!  This would be more than enough to and arm our Frontline Workers throughout this difficult time.  Our goals are more conservative  If we go beyond our goal we will acquire additional mask shipments to assist across the entire country to help our loved ones Medical and non-Medical Essential Workers. Our goal is to raise enough to purchase and donate a million masks to Frontline healthcare workers.   Hospitals have told us that they are going through approximately 30000 masks a day . With a million masks we can help supply many of Ontarios major hospitals with enough masks to last the next few months during the peak of the Pandemic.  New York has started a GoFundMe and has managed to raise $100k in 3 days we can hit our goal if everyone contributes. Big or small your donations matter. By contributing YOU are assisting our Frontline workers to EFFECTIVELY take care of you and your loved ones in the event that you/they are in need of medical assistance during this time and in the near future.     WHO WE ARE    Ivan Korobkov  is a  Registered Nurse  at  North York General Hospital  with a  Bachelors of Science in Nursing  he graduated from the  York university - Seneca College  collaborative program. He became a nurse because to save lives and make a difference in the world. Currently furthering his knowledge to work in the Intensive Care Unit where he can truly perform to the best of his abilities under pressure of patients deteriorating in critical condition such as the current COVID-19 outbreak.   Randy Singh  is a former member of  The   Canadian Armed Forces  a former  Forensic Technologist  at the  Centre of Forensic Science  and is currently an Entrepreneur. He has a  Bachelors of Science (Honours)  from  Ontario Tech University  (formerly known as  University of Ontario Institute of Technology ).     OUR COMMITMENT   To ensure that funds are spent exclusively on acquiring and distributing masks and other PPE to Hospitals Frontline workers and any other Essential Service Workers who may not be Medical (Delivery Groccery Transportation etc).  Once the masks are delivered we will make content (video and photo) so you can stay updated on where the donations are going.       FAQ         How will the funds be used?     100% of the funds will go directly to the purchase and delivery of masks and other urgent Personal Protective Equipment for Frontline healthcare workers in Ontarios busiest hospitals. The donation will not be applied to any administrative fees and we make sure that our suppliers are giving us competitive rates. Should we raise enough money and have enough access to supply we hope to expand our donations to other hospitals and workers in need across the country.   Why arent the hospitals   government ordering these masks directly?    Hospitals as well as government agencies are trying their best to procure masks. However due to supply chain limitations and global competition they are currently experiencing extreme shortages. We are fortunate to have close relationships with many of the factories producing masks.     Why Ontario First?    Ontario has the second highest COVID-19 cases in Canada. We hope that we can help Ontario first and expand outwards with our efforts but ideally we would like to help the whole country. We are a team of Canadians from Ontario and we have established relationships with several members from hospitals in the area.      Ive seen other charity efforts related to COVID-19. How is this one different?    Your donation will go directly to support the acquisition of masks   other urgent PPE for Ontario healthcare staff at the Frontlines of COVID-19. Because of the global shortage of masks   PPE your funds will be able to get equipment that is in great need and out of reach for hospitals currently. Unlike other charities ours is related directly to the supply of masks   PPE because we believe that protecting our Frontline healthcare workers is the most important thing to do right now. We will be sharing photos   videos of healthcare workers receiving the donated equipment so you can see your impact on the health care community in the province.   How much are you paying for the masks?     We are getting manufacturer pricing on the mask (between $0.40-0.50 for Surgical and $2.40 for N95). As pricing depends on order quantity shipping rate (in this case the faster the better to protect our healthcare workers) and competing demand the number may change. However we have spent our time comparing prices across multiple manufacturers to get the best possible price per unit while making sure that each manufacturer has the right certification and approval.     How do you prioritize who receives the mask?    The healthcare workers on the Frontline of COVID-19 are those in the Intensive Care Unit (ICU) and in the Emergency Room. We try our best to donate masks to ICU   ER Units within Ontarios busiest hospitals as they are the ones who are likely to have the highest quantity of cases.     Are donations tax deductible?    Currently donations are not tax-deductible. We have realized that the need is so urgent that we must move forward and hope that you will donate.      Aside from donations how can we help?    If you have  extra packaged  and sealed N95 masks and live in Ontario you can  email  us with a subject headline  “Ontario Mask Donation”  and we can coordinate drop-off.  If you are a  ER and/or ICU  Frontline healthcare worker or a hospital supply administrator you can  email  us with a subject headline  “Hospital Professional: PPE Requests”.      If you want to  volunteer  to help us with Ontario distribution you can  email  us with a subject headline  “PPE Distribution Help”.      If you are have a  direct relationship  with other  PPE manufacturers  that can provide equipment at market costs you can  email  us with a subject headline  “PPE Equipment Manufacturer”.     If you are a member of the  Press  or would like to connect us with a member of the Press you can  email  us with a subject headline  “Press Contact”.       Our e-mail: OntarioMillionMasks@Gmail.com

title: Mewsic Kitty COVID-19 Relief Fund
description: Mewsic Kitty Cafe is approaching our 2nd anniversary at the end of April. Since then we have adopted out over 200 kitties into loving forever families. We are immensely grateful and proud for the work we do and appreciative of the community who supports us and families who adopt.  On Sunday March 22nd Mayor John Cooper announced all non-essentials businesses shut down for 14 days. Like many small businesses we run on very tight margins. The COVID-19 crisis is hitting us and our crew especially hard during these difficult times.   Our primary concern is our purrduction crew who joyfully and dutifully come in to scoop litter boxes feed cats give medication take meticulous notes on their behavior and well-being while acting as gracious hosts to all of our visitors.   Unfortunately we cannot afford to continue to pay our crew while the doors are closed. We know for our small team this income is imperative and are heartbroken to not be able to do more.  Other bills will still need to be paid too. We can get by for a couple of weeks but anything beyond that will make an uncertain future for Mewsic Kitty re-opening when all this is over.   So far the only relief being offered to small businesses are loans. We cannot afford to take on debt to get through this crisis.  The first portion of our fundraising goal will provide a small cushion to help our crew make up for lost wages during this time (up to half of our fundraising goal depending on how long we are closed.) The remainder and any additional funds raised will offset some of the bills that will continue to come in while we are closed such as rent and utilities plus makeup for some lost sales over the passed couple of weeks.  We truly appreciate your support and care during this time. We are grateful for all Mewsic Kitty means to our community and the cats we care for. We do understand many will not be able to give right now. We know your hearts are with us and are thinking of you as well. We appreciate the thoughts and prayers sharing this campaign and all those who are practicing social distancing so we can get back to our regular lives sooner.    What about the cats?!   We anticipate this mandatory shut down will last longer than the 14 days announced by the Mayor today because it has lasted longer in other cities and countries.   We are doing our best to get all Mewsic Kitties in temporary foster homes during this time. Given this may last longer than two weeks this is the best option to help them live enriching lives with plenty of people and family while we are closed. We will continue to care for any kitties atMewsic Kitty during this time though we anticipate finding foster homes for all of them within the next week.

title: Bank Shot Waitstaff Corona Virus Aid
description: With Bank Shot being closed due to the corona virus I am starting this fundraiser to help take care of the servers who always take care of us. I know some of you might be in the same boat but to those of us who are fortunate enough to still be working please consider chipping in. Maybe start with the league fees we are saving. I am going start this with $200. Bob and Cindy are on board in a big way as well. Stay well and thank you in advance.

title: Please Help Paramedic Cadet as she battles Covid19
description: Christell Cadet is an amazing young woman sister daughter co-worker and friend who has been selfless in her career as an FDNY Paramedic.   Recently she has become ill and has been hospitalized in ICU/ Isolation from Covid-19.   She is on Oxygen 24/7.   She is in for a long battle: to recovery and life during her after care.   There is no word yet on when she will be discharged out of the hospital.  Let me tell you more about her:  Christell joined the FDNY as an EMT in January of 2012 nearly 2 years later she became a Paramedic and is currently stationed at Sta 47.  Christell is charasmatic resilient funny and incredibly kind.     She understands the need for EMS during these difficult and trying times. She knows what being on the front lines of the fight against Covid-19 entails. She has always loved being the 1st line of defense and care in emergency medicine.   She wants all First Responders to know: Take care of yourselves first. Make sure you go home whole at the end of the day.   She wants the world to know: Everyone is fighting the virus differently. Many thousands are recovering from it but its still a serious issue to be taken with precaution around others.  Christell joined EMS out of love. Love for her community and strangers alike; making a difference in patients lives and helping all those she has come into contact with while working as an EMT and now as a Paramedic.   Please lets band together as a community near and far young and oldEMS and civilians and help Christell during her battle against Covid-19 and her continued battle when she is released as her fight wont stop there.

title: Glamour House - Covid19 #SmallBusinessRelief
description: We are all devastated due to the disaster of Covid-19 please help us help our independent stylist and boss babes during this time by donating to our go-fund me account. All funds will equally be distributed towards their studio Rent and remains will also be distributed to them for their personal use. During this clientele has dramatically declined therefore our stylist and boss babes arent able to make a living.   Each donation will be rewarded 25% off service of choice or purchase from Aesthetic Glam. Any donation over $175 will be offered 4 hr rental of our studio for a social event gathering.    Thank you Electra -Glamour House Studios Andrea - @lashglamby_drea Angie - @diamondlashbeautybar Gabby - @thegspottt Melissa - @Aestheticglamusa Carina - @whimsy_glam Carmen - @enchancedbeautybycarmen Liz - @lizluxemua #SmallBusinessRelief

title: COVID-19 PATIENT CRITCAL CARE
description: Fighting for his life-COVID-19 patient  John Giarratano 42 was experiencing a fever and labored breathing when he drove himself to the ER one early morning. He was admitted into the hospital on Friday 13th 2020 diagnosed with pneumonia and was being treated. Little did anyone know that COVID-19 was ferociously attacking his lungs his breathing became more labored with every day that passed and he was in critical condition by Monday 16th.   John is a charismatic loving funny and a compassionate man that works as a freelance television producer. He was waiting for his 90 day period to be eligible for insurance coverage to be over. However he never got to that 90 day mark and didnt have insurance when this nightmare began with COVID-19 pandemic.  Critical care patients needs continual care around the clock and without insurance and with hospital costs averaging around $10000 per day medical costs are growing. If you would like to assist with this financial burden any donations would be greatly appreciated. All funds raised will go directly to Johns medical costs and related recovery treatment. John and his partner Brian Zupanick appreciate the outpouring of love prayers and support during this difficult time. Everyone is holding onto the hope that John will continue to fight for his life.    https://www.pix11.com/news/coronavirus/he-kept-getting-worse-one-queens-mans-battle-against-coronavirus

title: COVID-19 Humanitarian Migrant Fund
description: Last year at this time we were working at the border with Al Otro Lado (AOL) to prepare and support migrants for their Asylum Credible Fear Interviews. At the time there were approximately 2500 migrants living in squalor in Tijuana waiting for their interviews. As a result of the Stay in Mexico policy that number has jumped to 15000 in Tijuana alone. Many of these people including families have no money food or even a tent. When COVID-19 hits it will be devastating.   In response to the threat posed by COVID-19 to this vunerable population AOL started a Humanitarian Migrant Fund. We were very impressed with AOL and the people we helped and want to do what ever we can to support AOLs Humanitarian Migrant Fund.  The COVID-19 Humanitarian Migrant Fund will provide emergency funds to migrant families impacted by US government policies including asylum seekers deportees and migrants who are currently stuck in refugee camps and shelters without access to medical care and basic necessities. The fund will support AOL and key frontline serving organizations to cover unexpected costs due to unforeseen humanitarian impacts of the ongoing pandemic.  Since its adoption last year Remain in Mexico has forced close to 65000 asylum seekers and migrants to wait in border cities under grossly dangerous border cities to have their case heard before a US judge. Many families and migrants live in shelters or on the streets with little to no access to healthcare financial and social support and during this pandemic we know the consequences of this will be beyond description.  The migrant humanitarian fund will directly support temporary emergency shelter and housing food and nutrition care medicine diapers formula cleaning supplies basic survival necessities and phone and internet costs to help migrants communicate.  We must move swiftly and strategically to protect the health and safety of immigrant families amid COVID-19!  Thank you Francine and Allison

title: Gs COVID-19 Fund
description: This fund will help offset additional expenses for two vulnerable disabled people during this time of Covid-19 crisis and self-isolation. Groceries have come in at three times the cost and more of what we would normally spend because not in a position to shop sales or cheap and prices change by time they are delivered. And because of shortages and stockpiling by others we have been forced to order from multiple sources and thus pay multiple delivery charges. It would also be helpful at this time to order a humidifier and some additional towels and undergarments as laundry is less frequent. Thank you for any support you can provide.

title: Support West Oakland  food access during COVID-19
description: As economic and mobility impacts of the COVID-19 outbreak increasingly jeopardize vulnerable residents of West Oakland  Community Foods Market   and  Fresh Life Foundation   are mobilizing emergency initiatives to provide safe and reliable access to affordable fresh and nutritious food.  Community Foods Market currently serves the 25000 residents of West Oakland many of whom already have difficulty getting to grocery stores or incurring the added costs of food delivery services. An independent grocery store with a small team weve remained open during the California shelter-in-place order and have had to adapt in unprecedented times to keep our community nourished as an essential service.    We have received seed funding  to support the short-term implementation of two key initiatives by the end of March 2020 -- EBT/CalFresh discounts and West Oakland Senior Delivery. We are seeking funding from our broader community to extend the availability of these initiatives for an additional month in anticipation of the ongoing impacts of COVID-19.   __________  EBT/Calfresh Discount  Community Foods Market currently provides a 10% discount on Wednesdays on purchases made with CalFresh/SNAP benefits. Now more than ever with immense job loss in our community we are expand this program in the following ways during the COVID-19 crisis period:   • Increase the discount to 50% • Make the discount available every day of the week • Using direct mail and phone bank support to get the word out to CalFresh/SNAP recipients  With an additional $25000 in funding we can extend this increased EBT discount for an additional month.   __________  West Oakland Senior Delivery  Seniors are high risk if exposed to COVID-19 and have been strongly advised by health officials to not leave their homes . There are 4 low income senior housing sites located within a mile of Community Foods Market with a collective total of 406 units.   According to census data at least 10.95% of our community is considered “high-risk”.  Older adults and people of any age with underlying health conditions such as diabetes lung disease or heart disease are at greater risk of severe illness from COVID-19.   With funding Fresh Life Foundation will have the capacity to extend the availability of free low- or no-contact deliveries during the COVID-19 crisis to elders of our community in the McClymonds Clawson and Hoover-Foster neighborhoods.    We would like to ensure that vulnerable members of our community continue to receive access to fresh food without risking their health and that West Oakland residents can also be empowered to support their neighbors. Our three-pronged strategy is :   • Setting up 3 stipend positions for delivery personnel impacted by recent job loss due to COVID-19 • Running free grocery delivery each day of the week during shelter-in-place • Using direct mail phone bank and community alliance support to get the word out to seniors age 65 and older  Weve already established our protocol for safe deliveries to mitigate risk on elders volunteers and grocery store staff and anticipate the cost of extending this service for an additional month to be $15000. __________  We understand the importance of loved ones safe during the COVID-19 crisis and are asking for $40000 to cover the costs of extending these new and vital initiatives in support our vulnerable neighbors over the next two months.  Thank you for your support. The teams at Community Foods Market and Fresh Life Foundation believe that together we can uplift community through difficult times.    __________   About Community Foods Market:  Were an independent locally-owned and mission driven food market specializing in fresh produce perishables foods staple groceries and delicious prepared foods at affordable prices. We have a full-service meat and seafood counter a deli and a cafe. www.communityfoodsmarket.com #SmallBusinessRelief #SmallBizRelief   About Fresh Life Foundation:  The Fresh Life Foundation (FLF) is a nonprofit organization uplifting the health well-being and economic advancement of the West Oakland community. www.freshlifefoundation.org

title: Forum dei Giovani di Volla - COVID-19
description: ATTENZIONE! ATTENZIONE!    E appena partita una raccolta fondi del  Forum dei Giovani di Volla  il cui ricavato sarà donato interamente per aiutare la  Regione Campania  a combattere questa grave emergenza sanitaria causata dal COVID-19.  Chiediamo il supporto di tutti voi. Aiutateci a far girare questa raccolta fondi solo tutti insieme possiamo fare davvero la differenza.  Contiamo su di voi!    Chi vuole può seguire il link sotto a questo post e donare direttamente sul sito GoFoundMe è facile rapido e soprattutto sicuro! Vi terremo costantemente aggiornati sullevoluzione della raccolta!!  #forumgiovanivolla#crowfunding #iorestoacasa

title: COVID19 - Unidos para quedarnos en casa
description: ¡La unión hace la fuerza!  Quedarnos en casa nos protege de contagiarnos y de colapsar el sistema de salud para afrontar la crisis mundial por el COVID-19. Sin embargo no todos somos privilegiados y en Colombia hay miles de familias que dependen del comercio diario para conseguir su sustento desempleados y trabajadores informales se verán afectados y vulnerables al no contar con recursos económicos suficientes para mantenerse en medio del confinamiento.  Como la unión hace la fuerza y en tiempos de crisis debemos trabajar juntos  hemos forjado una alianza de organizaciones sociales para unir esfuerzos y recolectar recursos que den un alivio a estas personas para no dejar todo en manos del gobierno.  -          Encontrarás un abanico de organizaciones donde podrás apoyar a distintos actores como: desplazados migrantes niños adultos mayores comerciantes emprendedores etc.  -          Estarás enterado de lo que sucede con los recursos y tendrás acceso a un reporte final de la ejecución de los mismos.  Con tu ayuda vamos a apoyar a familias necesitadas en diferentes territorios del país. Con solidaridad humanidad y amor marcaremos la diferencia.  ¡Juntos es posible!    Organizaciones:     Join a Town  ONG francesa que busca promover el desarrollo sostenible en comunidades en condiciones de vulnerabilidad en Colombia.   Link:    https://joinatown.org     Grupo vulnerable objetivo:  familias de trabajadores informales o personas que no pueden trabajar por el confinamiento y se encuentran en condiciones de vulnerabilidad.   Zona:  Bogotá  Acciones:  garantizar sustento a trabajadores informales o desempleados que no tienen soporte al no poder trabajar por la emergencia sanitaria. Join a Town actúa como articulador con las iniciativas de todas las otras organizaciones.    Centro Coworking   Descripción:  Centro COWORKING es el punto de encuentro en Riohacha que promueve la relación de profesionales y emprendedores  Link:  www.centro-coworking.com  Grupo vulnerable objetivo:  Indígenas wayuu pobres históricos  Zona:  La Guajira  Acciones:  Donación de elementos sanitarios a poblaciones con poco acceso a agua potable y donación de mercados a población de trabajo informal y personas vulnerables de La Guajira   Puente Digital  ¡Apoyaremos más de 270 familias de trabajadores informales! Por medio de entrega de mercados y elementos de aseo especial enfoque a adultos mayores y a la población vulnerable por la situación actual  Link:    https://www.puentedigitalap.com/     Grupo vulnerable objetivo:  270 familias vulnerables de Soacha Cundinamarca   Zona:  Soacha  Acciones:  Compra de mercados para las familias   Bambalinas Co  Somos una articuladora del sistema del emprendimiento y el desarrollo sociocultural. Co-diseñamos investigamos   co-creamos junto a organizaciones públicas y privadas: servicios estrategias y experiencias extraordinarias a través de la innovación consciente y la creatividad con sentido.  Instagram:  @bambalinasco  Grupo vulnerable objetivo:  Indígenas wayuu migrantes venezolanos pobres históricos  Zona:  La Guajira  Acciones:  Donación de elementos sanitarios a poblaciones con poco acceso a agua potable y donación de mercados a población de trabajo informal y personas vulnerables de La Guajira    Coalición por Venezuela  Es la unión de organizaciones de la sociedad civil en el continente americano con el fin de integrar y articular acciones en defensa y promoción de los derechos humanos las libertades y los valores democráticos así como para enfrentar la emergencia humanitaria compleja que atraviesa Venezuela y el fenómeno de migrantes y refugiados venezolanos en Colombia.  Link:    http://coalicionporvenezuela.org/     Grupo vulnerable objetivo:  Migrantes y refugiados venezolanos en Colombia  Zona:  Cobertura nacional (25 Departamentos)  Acciones:  Adquisición de alimentos medicamentos elementos de bio-seguridad higiene y aseo personal   Fundacion Fiat Gaudium (Tiza coloreamos el mañana) Link:  www.fiatgaudium.org  Grupo vulnerable objetivo:  50 Familias de las zonas rurales de Cajicá conformadas por 4 miembros en promedio. 150 Familias del barrio valparaíso Ciudad Bolívar Bogotá. Formados entre 5 personas en promedio.   Zona:  Cundinamarca municipios de zonas rurales de Cajicá y barrio valparaíso Ciudad Bolívar Bogotá.  Acciones:  Entregan de canasta familiar para sostenimientos durante la crisis fortaleciendo la seguridad alimentaria para cada familia. Canasta familiar valor aproximado $50.000 - $70.000   Con el apoyo de:   #TogetherPodemos  Conectan emprendedores y changemakers alrededor del mundo que desean sumar acciones para hacer un mundo mejor.  Link:  http://togetherpodemos.org/

title: COVID19 Quarantine Food Assistance
description: Your donation to the COVID19 Quarantine Food Assistance supports the mission of local volunteer groups to provide URGENT DAILY SUBSISTENCE to the poorest residents in targeted areas in the Philippines (Iloilo Bacolod   neighboring provinces depending on the amount we are able collect). This targeted residents comprise families and individuals living day-by-day the homeless those who do not have regular jobs and daily wage earners and many more.   For this targeted residents: NO WORK FOR A DAY MEANS NO FOOD FOR THAT DAY.   The uncertainty of COVID19 Quarantine (lockdown)  could last weeks or even months so it is not difficult to imagine the very heavy toll this lockdown is affecting them every single day hanging on to survive; the big question however is for how long they can keep holding on?   Preparation is key. There is a real urgent need to act quickly before the situation become out of control because these families will reach a point with no option other than evade the lockdown directive to find food to survive thereby compromising efforts to contain the spread of Covid19.   “We may not die of corona virus but we will die of hunger if we do not have food to eat” quoting one affected resident.  PLEASE HELP! Your $50 donation would mean more than two weeks worth of food supplies. No amount is too small or too big. Thank you together we can make a difference!

title: Emergenza Covid-19 SALEMI
description: La raccolta fondi “Un aiuto per il G.O.E” con lobiettivo di creare una modalità attraverso la quale si possa concretizzare laffetto e la voglia di collaborazione che in queste settimane da aziende e cittadini.Per questo abbiamo deciso di far confluire la solidarietà delle tante persone che ci contattano in un conto che possa sostenere le attività di questa associazione per lacquisto di attrezzature e per la sanificazione del mezzo di trasporto utilizzati in questi giorni anche per la fornitura a domicilio di generi di prima necessità e di medicinali per anziani disabili e persone in isolamento.www.emergenzagoe.it

title: FABRICACIÓN CARETAS PROTECTORAS COVID19 CANARIAS
description: ¡Hola a todos! La alarma provocada por el covid-19 ha  generado un desabastecimiento a nivel  global en cuanto a material sanitario  se refiere.    Canarias no queda exenta de esta crisis la  cual nos ha llevado a una   situación delicada  que nos afecta a todos. Especialmente   a  nuestro personal sanitario que  día tras día lucha y se expone al virus en los hospitales  canarios totalmente  desprotegidos ante una pandemia mundial con el consecuente  riesgo que esto conlleva.     En medio de este panorama la empresa de  rotulación tinerfeña ARPRO: acabados y  rotulación profesional  comienza a fabricar    unas caretas con las que  reforzar al  personal sanitario ante el riesgo de  contagio por gotas y aerosoles las cuales  ya están siendo donadas a enfermeros/as y demás profesionales del sector.         Necesitamos fondos para costear los    materiales necesarios para fabricar más  caretas ya que hasta el momento han sido  pagados por la propia empresa y algunas donaciones recientes.  Dichos materiales son:     - Planchas de tereftalato de polietileno de  200 x 150 cm  (material de la careta en sí)  - Ollado para sujeción y movilidad de careta. - Elástico para sujeción posterior.       Nuestra campaña tiene como objetivo   recaudar la cifra de 4.000 euros   con los que podremos fabricar 4.000  caretas más para seguir donando a los  centros que las necesiten.          clica aquí para ver las redes sociales de  ARPRO    Enlace a página de facebook de la empresa  ARPRO      Enlace a perfil de instagram de ARPRO    ¡CON LA AYUDA DE TODOS SALDREMOS  ADELANTE!

title: Lotta contro COVID19 Aiuti in MAROCCO
description: In questa fase molto delicata anche noi possiamo fare qualcosa.  Il governo del Marocco ha chiuso molte porte di mantenimento a piccole famiglie famiglie che  guadagnavano a giornata e che in questo periodo di Pandemia non hanno più un entrata. Hanno un affitto da pagare dei figli da mantenere e anche dei medicinali da pagare.  Sono in contatto con 5 famiglie veramente bisognose famiglie che avevano una solo entrata e ora lhanno persa.     Anche una piccola donazione può fare la  differenza.   Facciamo la differenza tutti insieme uniti.

title: Holliston Mask Drive For Covid19 Frontline Workers
description: Hello neighbors! It all started when my sister-in-law from Wisconsin posted a picture of herself with a box on N95 masks on the family photo stream. She is an Amazon seller and have been running her successful business for many years now.  I laughed and told her You guys are crazy! Where did you get all those masks?! She said she found a supplier and planned on sending me some. I was not sure if I really needed them but I figured why not right?! Better safe than sorry!   That same day a post from a nurse at Newton-Wellesley Hospital asked the Holliston community for help in donating masks. I thought about my sister-in-law and texted her. Can I buy some from the supplier? I asked. Nurses and doctors at the front line here are pleading the public to donate masks and I liked to order and donate. She said no need. She will donate what she has and she immediately overnighted me 500 masks at a shipping costs of $120 - crazy! I told her I would pay the shipping and it arrived at my front door the next day.  By the 3rd day 500 N95 masks have been divided and donated to nurses and doctors in 9 area hospitals and the Holliston Fire Department.  Thanks to neighbors who offer to come by and picked them up and drop them off!!  Many people have asks since how they can help. I tried to connect hospitals administrator to my sister-in-law but she said no one from the hospitals called but plenty of individual doctors nurses and their family members wanting to buy masks to protect their love ones called.  I asked the doctors and nurses that came by to pick up the masks why not just call and order and get the supplies ASAP? The answer was always the same - too much bureaucracy and red tape. Any new vendors must fill out paperwork have them submitted and approved before any orders can be made - I was told. Meanwhile nurses and doctors work without masks. One drove over an hour from Wincester to pick up 25 masks from me.  I couldnt believe it.  So now I am starting a GoFundMe page to help our nurses doctors EMTs and anyone at the frontline trying to keep all of us safe. If you can donate my sister-in-law will purchase the masks for us to donate to area hospitals. We are still working out the most affordable and efficient method as it is hard to buy just a few masks from suppliers/manufacturers. So I have set a modest $2100 goal to try and see if we can get1000 masks ($2 per masks) delivered by the end of the week.    Please donate if you can. Thank you.

title: Lets help our community during COVID-19
description: In this difficult time when we are facing a global pandemic we are asking the community to come together and help support our frontline workers and those in need. Believe In Life is asking everyone who can to chip in and help those that need it most. The collected money will go towards purchasing face masks gloves for our frontline workers and food basic supplies for these people in need. Believe In Life is partnering with food stores and delivery services that will be able to deliver and distribute them.  We will get through this and come out stronger but right now our priority is caring for those that are unable to care for themselves.  Every Dollar Counts!   Join our cause and lets make a difference!   If you or anyone you know needs assistance during this time please feel free to reach out to us we will do our best to help in any way we can.   Click here to contact us through facebook!

title: Support Furloughed MSP Staff Due To COVID-19
description: Our beautiful school is closed due to COVID-19 and almost everyone is furloughed. Please help support our wonderful and beloved staff in their time of need. If we all stick together we can pull through this. Donations will be shared equally among the furloughed staff only.

title: Caps & Taps COVID-19 Employee Relief Fund
description: Never in our wildest imaginations did we ever think a day like this would come yet here we are.    Due to the unfortunate circumstances surrounding the outbreak of COVID-19 Caps   Taps has been forced to close its doors other than for take-out orders only.  This in turn has forced us cut WAY back on the hours that we are able to offer our bartenders at the moment.  Which in turn practically eliminates any and all tips that they are accustomed to as part of their normal income.  And as most of you are probably well aware tips make up a majority of income in the service world.  Therefore we have created this GoFundMe account for our employees with 100% of the proceeds going directly to them.    We understand that times are tough for everyone at the moment and most people are stretched pretty thin financially right now.  But if you do have the means we ask that you would graciously consider our amazing staff in this time.  If youre not able to donate we ask that you would possibly help us out by spreading the word.  Either way we THANK YOU.  We know well get through these tough days together and come out better on the other side.  And we CANNOT WAIT to serve you again soon!  THANK YOU from the entire C T crew!

title: GANDIA UNIDA  #COVID19
description: El hospital de Gandía no dispone de los recursos materiales para luchar contra el COVID19 que desgraciadamente se está llevando por delante la vida de tanta gente y que está limitando a nuestro personal sanitario.  Por esta razón proponemos lanzar un crowdfunding cuyos fondos irán destinados a ofrecer soporte al Hospital San Francisco de Borja (Gandía) para que puedan contar con más material y más equipos.   En este momento es prioritario acabar con la escasez de medios materiales. Por eso hoy más que nunca se necesitan:   1. Equipos de protección (EPIS): guantes batas mascarillas gafas de protección.  2. Geles desinfectantes.  (Entre otras muchas cosas)  Si conoces o formas parte de alguna empresa que pueda ofrecer estos recursos por favor ponte en contacto con nosotros para agilizar el proceso.  #juntssommésforts  #juntossomosmásfuertes  Ahora más que nunca todos podemos ayudar.     DONA Y COMPARTE.   ______________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________  Gandías Hospital does not have enough resources to fight against COVID19 which unfortunately is taking lives of so many people away and limiting our healthcare staff.  For this reason we propose to launch a crowdfunding whose funds will be used to support the San Francisco de Borja Hospital (Gandía) so that they can have more material and equipment.   At this moment it is a priority to end the shortage of material means. This is what is needed:  1. Protective equipment (PPE): gloves gowns masks goggles.  2. Disinfectant gels.  (Among many other things)  If you are part of a company that can offer these resources or you know somebody who can provide them please contact us to speed up the process.  #staysafe #stayhome  Now more than ever we can all help.     DONATE AND SHARE.

title: Help feed the elderly in West London amid COVID-19
description: Our ageing population is amongst the most vulnerable in society. The recent COVID-19 pandemic has left many of them worried and isolated. Shortages in supermarkets closures of public facilities people self-isolating and families unable to visit or care for their parents grandparents or neighbours.   WE PROVIDE FRESHLY PREPARED NUTRITIOUS MEALS DAILY TO WEST LONDONS ELDERLY COMMUNITIES DURING THE CORONAVIRUS CRISIS.   www.peardrops.co.uk     Together we can ensure no seniors go hungry! We are relying on volunteers local churches communities and charities to make this possible.  The more money we raise the more people we can feed so stay connected to and support during the COVID-19 crisis. Please support our cause today.  **********  WHO WE ARE  Set up by the established Pear Tree Pub and catering company in Fulham and a group of local volunteers Pear Drops emergency food delivery was created to help local communities in West London cater for the elderly.   Each day we create freshly prepared nutritious meals from our kitchen at HTB Holy Trinity Brompton.   Our efforts are made possible by the generous support of our local churches communities and charities.  Our community hubs are located across West London and include Holy Trinity Brompton Age UK Hammersmith St Saviours Sudbury and more are being confirmed on a daily basis.  We are set up to cater for thousands of people in need and are relying on volunteers and appealing for your support to help where you can.  **********  HOW YOU CAN HELP  Your support will help us prepare package and deliver meals to the elderly in West London.   We have a kitchen a team of chefs and incredible coordination team ready to get stuck in and an amazing community network to help us identify those who need this service most and deliver the meals to their door.  We have the resources and the team - we now need your support to feed as many people as we can!   100% of your donation will be spent on:  ·        Fresh ingredients to make the meals - 1 meat or vegetarian daily fish   chips Fridays and roast dinner on Sundays  ·        Staff to produce the food  ·        Packaging    ·        Refrigerated delivery vans - to deliver the food to the local community hubs  No funds will be used towards rent / rates / overheads or management of our kitchen.   We will be providing updates on our social media channels and website ( www.peardrops.co.uk )  with how many people we have fed and how people have benefitted from these meals.  **********  We need to raise £30K - so we can pull this off.   Please donate what you can there are many vulnerable elderly at risk as a result of this global crisis.  Your donation will help to feed people in need.   We need each other now - lets come together to make this happen.    If you cant afford to donate - sharing it on social media is free.   Thank you for your support!  The Pear Drops team

title: Housing Relief (COVID-19)
description: Unemployment rates are expected to rise to 20% and there are individuals living at PodShare that are asking if there is any relief for them. As a small business we are indebted to our landlords and bills so we are not in the position to offer free housing.  If you have the means to sponsor a person on a nightly weekly or monthly basis then you are preventing homelessness in the city of Los Angeles during a pandemic.   Any amount helps! Consider donating the amount you would spend on a cocktail or a night out to keep folks safer at home.  With your contribution you may remain anonymous or be connected with the housed individual through email for a personal thank-you.  Remember that you are “buying” people time to stay indoors weather this storm and resume the workforce when appropriate. These are real people of all ages seeking support during unstable times. They are losing their restaurant jobs cannot travel and have no one to turn to and will wind up homeless if we dont help.  If you are able to make a larger donation or seeking a tax-deduction unfortunately our 501c3 is still pending but we have amazing partners in Downtown Womens Center and Safe Place for Youth who can house their members in our pods with your contribution. Contact for more info.

title: Dyeing my hair for COVID-19 relief
description: As we all know many people have lost their incomes due to COVID-19 and need our help. So heres how Im doing my small part... if I raise $2000 by April 3rd Im going to dye my hair. For every $10 you donate you get one vote on the new hair color.   Moreover  I will personally match the first $500 in donations . Mostly thats to give me an opportunity to vote for a more sensible hair color so youre going to have to make your votes count!  Money that you contribute will go to one of two places: (1) the first $500 will go to tipped workers who are not getting paid due to the corona virus using “virtual tip jars” in  Pittsburgh   and  Washington DC ; and (2) the rest will go wherever the greatest need is as the situation evolves. To start it will be contributed through GiveDirectly one of my favorite charities which is arranging cash transfers to the neediest Americans.
