Please contribute what you can; and dont forget to indicate in a comment which hair color you are voting for! (Note: theres an opportunity to comment  after  you submit a donation).  Finally hope you are all social distancing and taking care of  yourselves  amidst this craziness. Here are  some resources for not going crazy in quarantine .  All the best  -Alex

title: Eight Sushi Employees hardship COVID-19 Fund
description: As the world slow down and Eight Sushi Lounge   E Ramen+ close our doors to the public the need for us as a community to look out for and support each other becomes even more important. We are proud to contribute our part in limiting the spread of the virus; however this decision has left many of our employees without a source of income. We consider our employees as family and we wish to be there for them during this stressful time.     Donating to this fund helps support the people that crafted a phenomenal welcoming and entertaining atmosphere to accompany your dining experience these past 4 years. 100% of this fund goes to them as they face the dire situation and uncertainty of navigating COVID-19    The spirit of Eight Sushi Lounge   E Ramen+ lives beyond these walls. Please consider helping our family in their time of need. Any donation no matter the amount is deeply appreciated and we humbly thank you in advance for your support.    We hope that this temporary crisis will blow over soon so we can return to serving our community and seeing your lovely faces again.    Sincerely  Eight Group  (Eight Sushi Lounge   E Ramen+)

title: URGENT: digital health solutions to fight COVID19
description: Urgent Appeal to support the development of new digital health solutions (through the creation of an interactive App) to fight COVID19.      CURRENT SITUATION:   Evidence from the World Health Organisation (WHO) shows the rapid spread of COVID-19 in Australia and overseas amongst children adults and the elderly. There is unsustainable growing pressure on the health system in containing and managing this unprecedented pandemic. Alarming reports from countries like China Italy and Spain show that not only patients and their families are impacted but also a large number of medical personnel have been infected. This is placing further constraints on the workforce available at hospitals and health care centres.    In order to effectively manage the early phase of the disease patients and healthcare professionals must regularly monitor a range of health indicators but current processes that support this pose many lengthy challenges. Health data is traditionally collected during face-to-face appointments. During these appointments patients are often relying on their memory as they are assessed by different health screening processes to determine the gravity of the situation. Clinicians then have to invest considerable time and resources to manually transfer the outcomes of all these assessments into a patients medical record whilst also being at risk of exposure to infection.    As the COVID-19 situation evolves at a rapid rate we may still have a short window of opportunity to introduce easily accessible digital technologies (via any smartphone/ tablets) to support Australian health providers.    OUR APPEAL:   Our Research team at ‘ InteractiveClinics   will develop a multi-modal online platform (available for FREE on Apple Store and Google Play) where COVID-19 health diagnostic data can be collected daily and results will become available in real-time to clinicians and their carer/ family members. The InteractiveClinics platform (developed at the University of Newcastle (Australia) Manresa University  (Spain)   BitGenoma (Spain) will be able to be adapted from its current state to address COVID19 delivering a range of unique benefits such as:    (1)   real-time COVID19 health assessments  outcomes that will become remotely accessible to their clinicians and even family members  (2)  the ability to  inform health care providers  with reliable data that will facilitate making  timely clinical decisions .  (3)  the possibility to  educate patients  with the aim to improve self-management of their conditions by accessing from recognised clinical guidelines (ie: World Health Organisation).  (4)   reducing the need to travel  to seek medical assistance and/or overloading emergency departments at hospitals for low to mild cases.     HOW ARE WE GOING TO USE THIS CROWDFUNDING?   We seek to raise  $275000.    The chief investigators  Dr Andrea Coda  and  Prof Xavier Girones  would like to declare no conflict of interest. Our IT team has been donating their time working tirelessly on a volunteer basis for weeks already getting the necessary App modifications done. Therefore the App can be deployed within a matter of days once the crowdfunding target is reached. The funding will be used for:  -        Essential IT support (e.g. App development procuring secure servers with enough capacity to enable fast data transfer between patients and clinical staff anywhere across the country and abroad).  -        Enabling secure and stable telehealth functionalities irrespectively from the network provider (ie: Telstra etc)  -        Ensuring reliable synchronisation between smartphones (iOS and Android) and tablets.  Our research team cannot guarantee that we will be successful in this critical research and innovation endeavours. As clinicians researcher and academics we have a duty to do our very best to help the community. The resources raised from this crowdfunding appeal will be entirely devoted to develop a rapid response to serve the community and support the health system during this global health crisis. If the crowdfunding target is not reached we will still continue to volunteer our time and resources to support a possibly significantly smaller group of people in the community.   Thank you in advance for your generous support and contributions we genuinely really appreciate it. We would be grateful if you could please share this page with those you think may be interested.  For more info please feel free to email us at hello@interactiveclinics.com   Stay safe.    InteractiveClinics Team            General disclaimer:   InteractiveClinics.com will provide resources to assist you in improving you manage your health and improve communication with your healthcare team. While the website and associated App resources have been developed by extensive research that has been subject to academic peer review it is not intended to be and should not be relied on as a diagnosis or treatment advice for specific medical conditions. The information provided through the use of the App or the website is not a substitute or replacement for the independent advice of a qualified healthcare professional. Nothing contained in the Service is intended to be used as medical advice and the Service is not intended to be used for medical purposes. You are encouraged to seek the advice of an appropriately qualified healthcare professional before and after using the Services. We disclaim all liability and responsibility arising from any reliance you place on the Service in making medical or clinical decisions or otherwise diagnosing treating or managing a health condition.

title: Kabab and Curry Covid-19 Relief
description: Starting Tuesday March 17 Kabab and Curry will be giving food to anyone having a hard time during the coronavirus Pandemic.  Please contact us and share our message. The more people we reach the more lives we can help at such a tough time.  We ask you follow our guidelines to insure the safety of our staff and your own well being.  We were not planning on doing a fundraiser but many great people from WNY have asked to donate to our cause. All proceeds will go towards paying for groceries and additional employees needed to provide meals to anyone in need. We will keep everyone posted on our Facebook page with a menu every morning for the dishes provided for lunch and dinner. Please let anyone know who can use our services to help themselves their family or someone in our community. We will would like to help in as many families as possible. I ask you share my message and we start a chain reaction so no one goes hungry during this time. I would like other restaurants to join me. We will Hit a point in which we will not be able to feed everyone requesting a meal as numbers increase everyday.  #bettertogether  Thank you and God Bless  Best wishes: Maninderjit Singh   Kabab   Curry Restaurant  8445 Main Street Williamsville NY 14221 716-565-3822  . https://m.facebook.com/story.php?story_fbid=3355663101114826 id=147553858592449 _rdr

title: Blo-No COVID-19 Response for Frontline Warriors
description: There are doctors nurses and many other healthcare professionals that are fighting  COVID-19 on the front lines in order to protect the rest of us. Like all of us they are having to discover a new normal. That new normal involves extra caution and tough decisions. Many even have to make family decisions about living arrangements.  While the rest of the world figures out how to get face masks and respirators we decided to tackle another issue–housing for healthcare workers. After a week of streaming movies and refreshing for virus updates we wanted to do more to help. With Deans healthcare background and Mikes fundraising background we decided this would be the best fit for us to help out.   The money raised will go to help alleviate lodging costs for healthcare workers. We have started communications with the major health care facilities in McLean County to determine how we can implement this. You can help by making a donation or helping us spread the word.

title: CFBP COVID-19 Closure Coachs Fund
description: Hi Friends-  As you all know our beloved CFBP is closing temporarily to help flatten the curve. The unexpected pause in income will likely cause hardship to our coaches who have worked so hard to keep us all fit and healthy. This fund will go to helping them out during this difficult time. As an idea Im donating what would have been my monthly membership fee. Donate what you can every little bit counts and is appreciated.   Go fund me has some extra requirements to help limit fraud so I need to include the following: I am Lizzie McDermott from Chicago raising money for the coaches at my temporarily closed CrossFit box. The money will go to pay their day-to-day expenses while their income is on pause.

description: Our beautiful school is closed due to COVID-19 and almost everyone is furloughed. If you can please help support our wonderful and beloved staff in their time of need. If we all stick together we can pull through this. Donations will be shared equally among the furloughed staff only.

title: Cheryls Cancer and Covid19 aid
description: My sister and her family are going through a really hard time right now. I know many are but she lately has been getting bad news after bad news. My sister was diagnosed in January 2020 with breast cancer. It has spread through her lymphatic system now and she has remained strong and focused. She continued to work and care for her two young girls as well.Now after finishing her first round of very aggressive chemo she was diagnosed with covid19! They have used all their savings just to get her this far and with more medical Bills yet to come they are facing a very difficult road ahead. Add to that due to covid19 the whole family is quarantined and their work is closed for at least two weeks which means little to no money coming in.If you can find it in your hearts to spare a few dollars to help get them through I know they would be eternally grateful as would all of her extended family.

title: LFCC Employees COVID-19 Fund
description: Dear Members  We believe that assuring the safety and welfare of our members and staff is the most important thing we do.  Prior to Governor DeWines order to close restaurants and bars we had decided to temporarily cease operations at Lake Forest Country Club.  His announcement accelerated that closure.     Our staff is the backbone of Lake Forest.  Their smiles and hard work fuel your fun at the Club!  They are the people who help us accomplish our mission – making sure that our members their guests and all events have a great time whenever they use the Club.      During these strange days they are among the people hit hardest by our temporary shutdown.       Many of our members have reached out to us asking how they can help.  Toward that end we have started this Go Fund Me page.  If youre able to give please do.  It doesnt matter how much.  Anything is appreciated.  Well divide it up amongst our hourly staff to cover lost gratuity earnings.      Were all looking forward to seeing you soon!     Thank you for thinking of us!

title: Jezabels Employee Fund - COVID19
description: To our dear Jezabels friends near and far   I made the decision to reduce all operations today Sunday 03/22. This team of bakers baristas and customer service associates is made up of the most dedicated hard-working staff some  of who have been with us for a few years.  I have every intention of bringing them back to our home on 45th street however at this moment without the commitment of government relief Im turning to our community to help provide a safety net for our staff during this uncertain time.   100% of all donations will go directly to our team members the people who have helped bring joy to all on a daily basis.    I know we - the food service industry - are not alone in this. All small businesses are suffering right now and we will all get through this together. In the meantime Im  working behind the scenes and doing everything humanly possible to keep this business alive and ready for when we can be back to full operations and reunite our team members.  As a thank you our top 5 donors will receive a dozen Jezabels empanadas as soon as as we are back up to full operations.  With love and gratitude Jezabel.

title: HOPE during COVID-19
description: As two high schoolers from Plano Texas we have taken on the initiative of fundraising for the  North Texas Food Bank  and  Meals for Wheels  in North Texas that help provide meals to those who need it.   Amid the worsening COVID-19 outbreak thousands of families across North Texas are struggling to access food resources. 1 of 6 people in North Texas are already battling hunger and numbers are only increasing due to the virus. But these people are not just numbers they are stories. The organizations working to provide assistance to them food pantries and food banks currently lack sufficient resources. The Dallas Morning News further articulates that “typically grocery stores will donate surplus items to pantries but as many stores run out of basic items the pantries shelves do as well.” With shelves and stomachs empty the situation has never been more dire.  With social distancing limiting our ability to volunteer in person we want to find other ways YOU can make a positive difference. Through our campaign by assisting the North Texas Food Bank and Meals on Wheels with monetary donations YOU can help these organizations increase their ability to purchase nutritious food for families in need.  We hope you can contribute to this fundraiser! All funds will be split evenly and donated directly to the  North Texas Food Bank  and  Meals for Wheels . Our goal is $5000 and ANY amount you can contribute will help us get closer to reaching our goal. We would also appreciate it greatly if you could share this fundraiser as well. Thank you so much!  For more information and initiatives on COVID-19 in our area that we compiled please visit:   https://tinyurl.com/covid-19-dfwinfo       https://www.dallasnews.com/news/public-health/2020/03/17/our-shelves-are-going-bare-north-texas-food-pantries-remain-open-amid-coronavirus-outbreak/       https://www.texasobserver.org/10-ways-to-help-your-fellow-texans-endure-the-coronavirus-pandemic/       https://www.nbcdfw.com/news/coronavirus/9-new-cases-of-coronavirus-reported-in-collin-county/2335700/

description: COVID 19Raising money to purchase food from local restaurants in the Bay Shore area to feed our Frontline (Nurses Doctors   Hospital Staff)   continue to help support our local restaurants   mom and pops !

title: COVID-19 Kids Hunger Support Fund
description: Want to join me in making a difference? Im raising money to benefit Share Our Strength and any donation will help make an impact. Thanks in advance for your contribution to this cause that means so much to me.  More information about Share Our Strength: The No Kid Hungry campaign connects kids in need with nutritious food and teaches their families how to cook healthy affordable meals. The campaign also engages the public to make ending child hunger a national priority.

title: Fight COVID-19: LA Startups for LA Hospitals
description: List of Participating Startups (in order of donation time)  - ProspectWise   (Robin Liao) - Ruggable  (Jeneva Bell) - Outer   (Terry Lin) - Fernish   (Lucas Dickey) - Honey   (Drew Tennenbaum)    Updated on March 25 2020  Confirmed with Lauren Ploch Development Officer Advancement at Cedars-Sinai for the need of N95 masks:  (Warehouse address masked due to safety concerns)   If ever there was a time to accelerate acquire or lead.     To make a difference and be the difference:    Nows the time.     Mission  To rally the LA startup community around the purchase of 30000 readily available N95 masks for donation to UCLA Cedars-Sinai and other LA hospitals in need.    Background  Due to a surge in international demand LA hospitals are in dire need of medical masks and hazmat suits; every day they remain uncertain as to when federal government medical supplies will be made available to one of the hardest-hit parts of the country.   For now: help is in our hands. We have identified and intercepted a batch of 30000 N95 masks slated for an ecommerce platform. The masks have FDA certification and are available in an LA warehouse at $2.00 each. The effort to source more masks is ongoing should the demand continue. Weve already spoken to one manufacturer in China who claims they can produce 200000 masks on a daily basis starting March 30.  This GoFundMe campaign will make ALL 30000 masks instantly accessible to those most in need. Multiple startups are already involved in the project and we hope to get many more onboard. Together we can be the difference. Nows the time.   *Please: Share with your teams! **Reach out. Conversation inspires action.   Contacts  Jiake Liu 310-695-5421 (text for fastest response) jiake@liveouter.com

title: Materials fund for 3D printed Covid-19 masks
description: My name is Tom Diaz and I own a small 3D printing shop located in the South Bronx. A few days ago I was informed of a shortage on PPE for hospital staff throughout the nation and that our city has been severely impacted by the virus.   Amongst other things I realize there is a large demand for masks that can be disinfected and reused to limit exposure of Covid-19 so I have been 3d printing masks for friends and family working at hospitals.  The mask displayed here can house third party filtration materials such as non-woven propylene clothing sponges or textiles.This novel filtration system includes several layers with different geometries to provide an effective fine particle filtration. I can produce 28 masks with a 2kg spool of PLA filament which is biodegradable. There is also an anti-microbial PLA filament but its out of my price range being that Im out of work.  Ive received an overwhelming amount of support for printing and distributing the masks due to the dire need for PPE. Based on the fact that I am a small shop owner my resources are also limited as I have recently stopped working due to this pandemic and refocused my endeavors on providing assistance and support to medical staff by manufacturing these masks. I would love to be able to fund this project on my own but I have materials and operating costs to keep my machines running.   I understand that the material used isnt a replacement and shouldnt be used as a replacement for n95 masks and concerns associated with the anti microbial properties of the process itself but this should be used as a last resort option. Im also aware that within a few days hospitals in NYC will run out of PPE to provide to staff and that currently doctors and nurses have to wear a single mask for their entire shift which is something no healthcare professional should be subjected to.   With your help I can obtain the antimicrobial filament needed to effectively produce and distribute reusable masks to healthcare professionals in need of protective equipment.   All funds will be used to keep this project running  until the curve is flattened. Any and all help is greatly appreciated.

title: Corona Krise - Spende für Tango El Rojo
description: Liebe Freunde des El Rojo   liebe Freunde des Tango Argentino   liebe Freunde des Tanzes der Musik und der Leidenschaft   Als kunstschaffendes Gewerbe ist das Unterrichten von Tänzen eines der ersten  die in der Corona-Krise untersagt werden mußten.   Das ist nötig doch bedeutet dies dass die Einnahmen die für den Unterhalt des schönen Studios unabdingbar sind vollständig und         ersatzlos wegfallen.  Bereits einige Zeit vor dem Katastrophenausruf in Bayern sind die Umsätze schmerzvoll eingebrochen.  Auch mein zweites Standbein (Tourismus und Stadtführungen) ist aus dem selben Grund zeitgleich  betroffen und auch hier kann ich bis auf weiteres keine Einnahmen erzielen.  Nun ist mein Lebensunterhalt nicht mehr gesichert und es ist ungewiß  ob und wie es mit der Schule weitergehen kann.   Deshalb bitte ich Euch um Spenden  damit ich die kommende Zeit überbrücken und  die laufenden Kosten zahlen kann.     Die guten Nachrichten sind: Eine Online-Tangoversorgung für Euch befindet sich in Arbeit!   Ich danke Euch  vielmals für Eure Unterstützung!!! Ich wünsche mir dass wir uns schon bald wieder sehen  3  Mil abrazos Christina Tango El Rojo   www.el-rojo.de

title: Dobsons Bar &  Restaurant Covid-19 Relief Help
description: On March 16 2020 we made the difficult decision to temporarily close our restaurant in response to the global health crisis surrounding the novel coronavirus (COVID-19). As you know throughout our 36 years of service we have gone through difficult times and bounced back to serve our loyal patrons. However this global pandemic presents our most difficult challenge for us.   Our commitment to our guests and employees is priority number one since we first opened in 1984.  Throughout the years Dobsons has served as a special place in San Diego for great food cheer celebrations and camaraderie.  We have 22 employees many who have worked at our establishment for many years.  Our employees are like family and dear friends to us.  Dobsons closure will impact all of our employees ability to survive and provide for their families.     Many of you have asked how you can help us? And the simple answer is to help support Dobsons during this difficult time by donating to our Gofundme campaign. Please consider making a donation to help support our Dobsons family. Every dollar matters.  On behalf of the Dobsons Bar   Restaurant Team we are grateful for your consideration and generosity and eagerly await the day we get to serve you once again.

title: COVID-19 Mask Fund Raising Team
description: Healthcare professionals are operating without Personal Protection Equipment (PPE). Hospitals fighting COIVD-19 have run out of masks. Healthcare professionals are making their own masks if they get sick we do not have a second line of defense against this virus.  Long story short. This is a coordinated effort of 100s of people across Alameda   Contra Costa County and beyond to organize seamstresses and sewers and to provide them resources to make masks at home. These masks are being built as per specifications received from John Muir Kaiser and various county hospitals. First batch of masks has already been delivered. We need to scale up and make hundreds of masks to tide over next few weeks till the critical supply is restored. We have 20 seamstresses working tirelessly making masks.  Our team has been asked to create about 1500 masks this week. Masks specifications - size material etc are provided by the hospitals. We need $6000 to buy cloth linings elastic and other material to make masks. We have an external auditor to ensure funds are handled properly. Any remaining funds will be used for COVID-19 related support activities.  We owe it to our doctors nurses and various other healthcare workers. They have families too… yet they are not sitting at home but risking their lives fighting for us lets do our part!  Thank you! COVID-19 Mask Production - Fund Raising Team (Carol OKeefe Vish Kris Clara Nitin Lavanya Shurti)

title: Sewing machine to make Covid-19 PPE Masks
description: Hi everyone  Ive been furloughed from all of my gigs in NYC and I would like to help with the mask shortage. If you would like to help out there is a great effort that is being organized by Open Jar Studios here in Manhattan.   BROADWAY RELIEF PROJECT: COVID-19 The Broadway Community unites to help in the COVID-19 crisis creating PPE (personal protection equipment) for the medical community. Open Jar Studios is opening its doors to lend assistance in this time of great need.   I will be sewing masks from home but I dont have a sewing machine. If you would like to help out I would greatly appreciate a couple bucks so that I can buy a machine. Lets do this!  Thank you so much!    https://www.openjarstudios.com/broadwayrelief

title: The Crown COVID-19 Emergency Fund
description: The Crown Bar and Venue has operated as a close knit collective since opening its doors in 2013 and since then have tirelessly dedicated their time to organizing and maintaining a space that accommodates a wide range of performances.  The staff comprised of 15 employees are currently unable to work and earn a wage until at the least May due to the effects of covid-19. As practicing artists and musicians with a mission to support other artists we are now asking for your help to ensure the livelihood of our hard working staff.  This fund will be divided based on need keeping in mind that Tony   Terry our hard working security staff do have families that they still need to support during this time.   We cant wait to see you again and thank you for your generosity during this time of uncertainty.

title: Support 25 Educators During Covid-19 Crisis
description: Our Story   Our beloved daycare Kiddie Academy of Williamsburg had to close abruptly due to the pandemic. As such the teachers staff and administrators are suddenly without income. For the foreseeable future they will need to max out sick and vacation days as income and rely on unemployment which can take many weeks to process and is only a fraction of regular pay.  We are raising an emergency fund that will be an income buffer for 22 teachers 2 administrators and 1 kitchen staff. All funds raised will go directly to these educators. Our goal is to get to an initial $15000 with the help of our parents friends and families who are willing and able to given everyones current resources. Once we meet it we will increase the goal.  The deadline is Tuesday March 31st so we can disburse the funds on April 1st.    Kiddie Academy of Williamsburg   *Howard Chen had a difficult time finding placement for his own small children and decided to open up Kiddie Academy of Williamsburg in 2018 to meet the growing demands of the community.   *There are 7 classrooms ranging from infants to toddlers. The teachers and staff are very involved and loved by the children and parents.  I always believe that children learn best when the learning environment is designed to meet their developmental needs; one that encourages exploration creativity and independence. -Chandler (teacher)  Working with kids is a true blessing. -Eve (teacher)   Logistical Details   *All funds will be transferred into a bank account that was opened specific for these purposes and managed by Kristen (Madisons mom in Sharks) to then be disburse to each educator via Venmo Paypal or check. Funds will be distributed across all 25 staff members for them to use at their own discretion as an emergency buffer from having no income for some time and then partial pay when unemployment insurance is available.  *My name is Carolyn (mom to Ryan in Sharks and Cameron in Bees). I live in Williamsburg and am organizing this campaign with a team of parents across Kiddie Academy of Williamsburg including Kristen Lanthy Rad Maria Nate Michael and others. We are in direct contact with the staff of the daycare via email and phone.  Thank you for your support! Parents @ Kiddie Academy of Williamsburg  Facebook Page:   https://www.facebook.com/KiddieAcademyofWilliamsburg/

title: Family with disabled son stranded due to Covid-19
description: We hate to set this page up but we are truly trapped and dont know what to do.   My family (Mum Dad brother and sister) travelled to Melbourne from Scotland to attend my wedding which has since been cancelled. They tried to bring their flights forward/book new flights to get home safely when travel restrictions began due to the coronavirus. However there arent any flights available before planes are grounding (most airlines have already cancelled all flights). We have been to the airport and nobody is able to help us.  My family have spent all of their money to get here and really have nothing left. My mum is my brothers full time carer and my Dad has sarcoidosis so hasnt been able to earn much money. They are booked into an Airbnb until Monday 30th March but after that they have nowhere to go and no money left to book alternative accommodation.  My fiancee and I are helping as much as we can financially but we have also just lost all of our savings on a wedding that didnt happen.  My brother Joshua has cerebral palsy and is completely reliant on his wheelchair unfortunately my apartment isnt wheelchair accessible so he isnt able to stay with me. At this time the embassy havent been able to help us and we are extremely worried as to how they are going to live. We just need to have enough money to find some wheelchair accessible accomodation and food to keep them alive until either the British embassy are able to help or flights become available again.   This is a very scary time for us anything that anyone can do to help us would mean the absolute world.   Thank you   The Rowe Family

title: COVID-19 World Relief Campaign
description: Together we are stronger!   COVID-19 (Coronavirus) was declared a global pandemic by the World Health Organization on March 11th reaching more than 350000 cases and 15000 deaths.  Being students in highschool  we want to provide support and care for the doctors and health care workers who risk their lives every single day while being away from their loved ones to care for us the people of our society.   We have successfully contacted various health care providers in China to supply us with mass amounts of medical equipment (respiratory machines COVID-19 test kits masks gown/coveralls medical goggles face shield etc.).  We ask that you support our society during these times of conflict in  any way possible whether that be  donating even 1$ towards medical    equipment  or  sharing this with friends and family  so that we can together  as human beings in our society stop this Virus once and for all.  Thank you for your generosity!

title: Toowoomba Support for Covid-19
description: We are setting this group up to have funds readily available to buy products and distribute quickly.  Currently Trams are needing non-perishables for refugees in isolation.  Our Domestic Violent Action Centre are needing to deliver care packs to women who cant get out.  If we go into lock down we may have women needing to get out of current living situations fast so we want funds to get them into safe hotels etc.  And Im sure many other needs will come up. We are wanting to get on the front foot in this crisis.  Thanks so much for your generosity.

title: Help Support The Roost Staff during Covid 19
description: The Roost Cafe   Bar like the rest of the world has taken a pause from our business normality to do our part to help flatten the curve of the Covid19 pandemic.   Our dedicated team has made a conscious effort to participate in the recommended health precautions to keep themselves as well as our local community safe.    With that our humble establishment is running on thin air with limited hours and staff while still trying to serve a hot cup of coffee and a smile to our fellow neighbors daily.     Our wonderful staff have been so loyal in severing our local East Village and Hoboken communities over last 5+ years and are now in need of receiving a little support in return.   Our hourly paid bar and cafe staff live off the generosity and gratuity of The Roost customer base.  With the current business regulations in place and stay at home orders - our staff are completely out of work and will be out of money too soon.   Help us give back to our Roost staff members with a little gratitude.  Please donate a tip to our loving staff and lets help them fight through this time so they can continue to do what they do best.    All donations will be equally split among the entire Roost Staff to help them pay their rent buy groceries or needed supplies during this difficult time.    Thank you for all your support.     Sincerely  The Roost   www.theroostnyc.com    Email:  Holler@theroostnyc.com   Follow: @theroostnyc   or   @theroostoutpost

title: Shield Up Against COVID-19
description: A friend and co-worker of mine Felishia Powell has been working with hospitals in need of face shields and masks. She has been using a 3D printer to create masks and shields that can be used and reused in the midst of the current COVID-19 pandemic. Many hospitals urgent care centers and elder care facilities have reached out to her for help but SHE IS IN NEED OF MORE MATERIAL to meet their urgent requests. Your donation will go towards 3D printing material that will be made into reusable masks and shields for our medical personnel whom are in dire need. All products created are being donated not sold to hospitals across Texas. Any help is appreciated. Were all in this together and itll take all of us to get through it.

title: Support Refugee Women from Myanmar during Covid-19
description: Tanma Federation is a cooperative run by refugee women from Myanmar in Malaysia.   We stand together to develop our projects and activities through handicraft fair trade empowerment and livelihood programs.   In times of crisis those most vulnerable are hit the hardest.   Whilst we all play our part to prevent the spread of Covid-19 we can not neglect the heightened struggles refugee face during this period.  Our refugee women rely on daily wages and do not have any savings. Without these daily wages they cant afford to buy food or other essentials.   This lack of pay is one of the issue facing vulnerable communities during the movement control order.  Help us to support our 14 women and their families in their essentials as well as in the rent of their homes and our 4 centers.  Their precariousness already started to grow created very depressed and stressful feeling for them. We will need your support as soon as possible.   A big Thank you!  Tanma Federation is hosted by Tenaganita Sdn Bhd.  Visit our facebook page : Tanma Federation Visit our instagram page: Tanmawomen Contact us by whatsapp at 0169587782 or at  tanmawomen@gmail.com

title: I have corona. Help
description: I have the corona. Help

title: Game Changerz wants to help fight COVID-19
description: Hey everyone. This is Michael over at Game Changerz. We need your help.  COVID-19 is making its way through Utah and Im sure youve noticed that were still open. We know that the responsible thing to do right now is to close our doors for a while and help to stop the spread of the virus. Game Stop Best Buy and other big retailers have closed up for the same reasons. Many of you already know but Jeremy our Salt Lake store manager has a compromised immune system. If he gets the virus hes going to be in serious danger. But theres a problem. He also has 4 kids that he needs to feed. I have my son to care for and everybody on our team still need to pay our rent pay our bills and buy gas. Unlike Game Stop and Best Buy we dont have emergency money set aside to cover a disaster like this. If we close our doors right now we may never be able to open them again. After over a decade of serving our community this isnt how we want to go out.  So now were stuck between a rock and a hard place. Do we do the right thing for our community and close our doors for a while or do we do the right thing for our team and help them keep food on the table? We dont have a way to do both. Not without your help.  In order to pay rent for our stores and payroll for our employees it costs us around $7500 a week. Government aid and emergency help for small business right now only comes in the form of loans which require long waits interest payments and better credit scores than our team have. If we can get your help to pay our rent and our employees we can close for a little while confident that well be able to open back up again on the other side of all of this craziness.  We want to do our part for the community but we cant abandon our people. Please help.

title: Support Metro Dog COVID-19 #Small Business Relief
description: SUPPORTING OUR COMMUNITY THROUGH COVID 19   Metro Dog Day Care and Kennels has been in business for 18 1/2 years.   We are so proud  be part of this amazing community and to have been able to love their dogs for so long.  We are here to help you and your pets in any way can thru this unprecedented time.   As Metro Dog struggles with a devastating loss of business due to this pandemic several of our clients suggested and encouraged us to open a Go Fund Me account so they can help.  So we thought we would give it a try.  Metro Dog and its staff need your help and support.  We have felt a major impact from Covid-19 very quickly.   Business and pleasure travel has disappeared.  A  great number of people are working from home and as a result are not bringing their pups in for daycare.   A similar situation is present for dog walks from home.  With it looking like it will be some time before the situation resolves we are reaching out to our Metro Dog family and beyond for help .  If you are not feeling a financial burden from Covid-19 please consider donating to support us through this time.  We have an amazing crew at Metro Dog and want to keep them as part of the MD family.  We are bracing ourselves for the long haul.  As Covid 19 continues to escalate and spread it is becoming clear that this new norm of social distancing and staying home could remain in place for months.   Another aspect to add is the fact that we are still in process of relocating the business.  The relocation has been a long journey with plenty of delays.   The financial effect of Covid 19 is devastating on so many levels but as we are paying rent in two locations and our current reduced business level cannot support even one location we are not sure what the next step holds.  The funds raised here will cover rent in both locations support the staff and help cover some operational cost over the next two months.  We are hopeful things will be looking up by then.   We Are So Grateful For You   Thank you so much for all your support and love not only during this difficult time but over the past 18 ½ years!  While we adore the dogs we are also incredibly grateful for the wonderful people who bring them.  We appreciate you all so much.  We will get thru this together and will stay in touch with each other even if it is from more than six feet away.    Warmest wishes during trying times   The Metro Dog Team

title: Please Help Support My Mastiff Sara During Covid19
description: Hi there! My name is Priscilla. Im sure just about everyone is aware of the pandemic were having.Most of you may already know I live in a converted van in California where all non-essential businesses are closed for a month  like the gym where I happen to shower. Some of you know that because of all this people are losing their jobs and I unfortunately happen to be one of those people. And because of all this my smartest and safest move is to drive across the country to be with my family in New Jersey until I figure everything out. Sara my English mastiff has been sick for the past two weeks. She had a very important appointment this weekend to get tested for cancer but had to cancel for financial reasons. In the past two days Ive noticed a substantial decrease in her energy mobility and appetite. Its been really hard to witness and I am honestly extremely concerned. Ive never witnessed Sara not being able to walk up a flight of stairs or even reject food. Shes always  happy to be in the snow playing but today she didnt even react with the excitement she normally has when she sees snow. I can tell something is going on with her. I want to get her to the vet as soon as I can but I wont be taking her to the vet in Colorado since its not the smartest choice to risk staying in a cold and snowy state. I will be leaving Vail Colorado till morning tomorrow (03/23) for my next stop. Im hoping there I will be able to get her into a Vet to get the proper treatment and examination for whatever she has going on. It really breaks my heart to know that I cant really help pay for my own dogs medical expenses but I could really use the help from those that are able to help me with some her medical finances during this time I dont know what is happening with my girl but I do know she needs the vet as soon as possible. All I have right now is money for food and gas to travel across the country. So I created this page to accept any donation anyone is willing to give. I dont really know exactly how much it will all be but I do know these tests are not cheap so I will have my go fund me goal from at least $500-$1000 range. If you own a beloved pet you know veterinarian treatment can be really pricey. If you have read this post so far thank you and please consider to help me find the right answers and treatment for my best bud.  Your love and support would help tremendously through this unknown journey of ours. Thank you.

title: Pregnancy emergency visa due to covid19.
description: Hi everyone So on the 14th of March we were told my wife had to fly back to Singapore as her graduate visa was expiring and we had just planned to have the baby their as we couldnt afford the Permanent  Resident visa for her at this time. 4 days in singapore i get a message saying all Australians fly back home so then and their got her tourist visa up and running and we flew back to Perth and decided no matter what we arnt giving up we on day 4 of quarantine together and now the government is putting us in a situation to come up with $7715 for her to stay in Australia and get the benefits of having the baby here so it doesnt cost us thousands weve reached out to family however family is tough with money to right now due to this pandemic my business and work is down hill at the moment Im at the end of my rope.Every donation that goes towards this funding covers the cost of my wife to stay here at home and covers the cost of the delivery of our baby girl.Our baby is due in 10 Weeks now Thank you for having the time to read this we really appreciate it. Thanks Luke and Kin

title: We need a mechanical respirator to face Covid-19
description: We want to be prepared for any case of the pandemic Covid-19 and we need at least one mechanical respirator for our Hospital in Danli El Paraiso since it is a hospital with low resources lets help each other out and lets save our people lives. Help me save a life Danli...  Honduras need you!Queremos estar preparados para cualquier caso de la pandemia Covid-19 y necesitamos al menos un respirador mecánico para nuestro Hospital en Danli El Paraíso ya que es un hospital con bajos recursos ayudémonos unos a otros y salvemos la vida de nuestra gente! Ayudamos a salvar vidas DanliHonduras te necesita !

title: Please Help the Provini Staff
description: COVID-19 has hit all NYC restaurants hard and here at Provini were no exception. Everyday more and more businesses are forced to shutter their gates but were doing our best to stay operational for as long as possible. Currently we have a small crew at Provini working to provide an abbreviated  menu for delivery and takeout  .   Restaurants like ours are a labor of love and operate with very small profit margins. Unfortunately right now we simply dont have the resources to be able to keep on all our staff. Weve created this go fund me campaign to help raise funds to assist our loyal and dedicated employees in getting through these tough days.   To our friends patrons regulars and family we know that these are tough times for everyone but were reaching out for your help. If you are able please give what you can. No amount is too small. All donations will go directly to Provini staff.   Thank you so much for your support. Stay well and see you soon.

title: Corona-Hilfe für unsere Schulpferde
description: Wir die Mitglieder des  Resser Reitervereins sammeln Spenden für einen sehr sozialen Reitbetrieb der durch niedrige Preise jedem Kind aus jeder Schicht und ebenso auch Kindern mit Behinderungen das therapeutische Reiten auf Schulpferde ermöglicht. Diese Schulpferde haben jahrelang wertvolle Arbeit geleistet und nun ist ihre Futter-Versorgung in Gefahr da durch die Corona-Einschränkungen keine Einnahmen mehr reinkommen wovon schließlich Kraftfutter Heu und Stroh bezahlt werden.   Daher die Bitte um zahlreiche Spenden  damit die Versorgung und Existenz der Tiere in dieser Notlage gewährleistet werden kann und in naher Zukunft die Kinder alle wieder zurück zu ihren liebgewonnen Pferden und Ponys können.   Vielen lieben Dank

title: 3D Print COVID-19 Healthcare Faceshields
description: Hi. My name is Aditya Indla and I am a Sophomore at Bellarmine College Preparatory in San Jose CA.   Healthcare workers are facing a severe shortage of protective equipment as they deal with the COVID-19 pandemic.  I am partnered with Maker Nexus a 501(c)3 non-profit organization to deliver HOSPITAL VALIDATED MEDICAL FACE SHIELDS to the healthcare workers in need of PPE. With dwindling PPE supplies Maker Nexus is rallying a diverse set of volunteers with 3D printers at home to print these face shields.  The face shields cost $10 each to manufacture and my goal is to raise $4000 to purchase the supplies for Maker Nexus volunteers to make 400 shields.   http://makernexuswiki.com/index.php?title=3D_printed_face_shields    Please help support the Healthcare professionals at the forefront of the COVID-19 fight.

title: Covid19 - Vouch for Non-Citizen Casual Workers
description: To help and assist members of our community who have been impacted by the fall of the Hospitality industry due to the Coronavirus. We achieve this by providing funding for the basic living needs in the form of vouchers for workers who have lost their jobs in Hospitality and have zero access to government funding.   These are people who meet the below criteria:  Non-citizen and  Non-Residents of Australia  Industry of work - Hospitality   Tourism and related industries such as Commercial Cleaners Does not have access to government funding   How we got started  My best friend recently saw her entire industry collapse in one night resulting in the loss of hundreds of jobs (across hospitality hotels etc). It was incredibly confronting witnessing this firsthand   in her heartbreak she came up with a brilliant idea to help support those in need.   A lot of these people have come from overseas and arent PR/citizens with access to government funding   a lot of them are unable to travel home due to travel restrictions.  So with a handful of good friends we decided to pool some funding together to create a few short-term relief care packages to cover their groceries for 2 weeks while they figure out their next best steps. So far weve given away 5 of these! Well be sharing some of these stories shortly in a video release.   And the list is GROWING! Theres so many more that need support AND with your help we can scale this up to reach an even greater amount of people in need.    Where will the funds go?  The funds will go to providing a 2 week essentials grocery list to cover all meals for the individual. If you have made a contribution – we will let you know how many people / meals it covers. AND we will also let you know the name   a bit of a background of the person you have decided to help via a Thank you msg directly from them J   What happens to any additional funding that doesnt go towards these short term packages?  The funding page allows full visibility of all contributions and we will continue to update everyone with the number of people weve been able to support through this initiative.  Any additional funding will be contributed to the following fund of your choice (i.e. we will reach out to ask you if weve raised enough to cover the community were reaching out to)  -          Food Bank Australia -          OzHarvest -          Citylife Community Care    What about if I know someone who is going through this at the moment?   Flick us an email at esther.tie@hotmail.com . Obviously were still trying to figure out the best way to manage this with social isolation etc!   How are the pacakges dropped off?  Safety is a priority for us so my friend   I will pack it and drop it off at the front of their place (while it is safe to do so). If government regulation requires us to stay home completely we will mail them a Coles / Myer voucher   a list of purchases they will require to cover all grocery expenses for the 2 weeks including recipe cards! J

title: COVID-19 - SOSTENIAMO CHI STA CON I PIU DEBOLI
description: EMERGENZA COVID -19 SALVAGUARDIAMO LE RESIDENZE PER ANZIANI E DISABILI   Siamo una  cooperativa sociale ONLUS  che gestisce oltre 100 servizi socio sanitari e assistenziali in 10 regioni italiane.   Ci occupiamo di anziani disabili malati terminali  fornendo servizi assistenziali sanitari (medici e infermieristici) sia residenziali sia domiciliari. Le persone che assistiamo rientrano nelle fasce più deboli della società e  sono quelle più a rischio in caso di contagio COVID-19.   Stiamo cercando di evitare di far entrare il COVID nelle nostre strutture in cui altrimenti la mortalità sarebbe altissima. Purtroppo non è sempre possibile.   Nella foto di presentazione ci sono alcuni nostri operatori mentre sono in attesa di essere tutti sottoposti a tampone in uno dei nostri servizi più in difficoltà…  anche in questi giorni troviamo la forza di sorridere   ci hanno detto inviandoci la foto ed è ciò che ci chiedono i nostri ospiti a volte con lo sguardo quando non hanno altri mezzi di comunicazione.   CIÒ CHE È URGENTE  I nostri operatori sono  allo stremo  alcuni sono stati fermati  non abbiamo quasi più mascherine e altri DPI  fondamentali in caso di positività non solo per questione di costi ma perché introvabili. Stiamo facendo ordini ovunque ma non arrivano.  Necessitiamo di  40.000 mascherine  a settimana il cui costo medio è di 08€ a fronte di costi medi che in tempi normali si aggiravano su 008€ per ogni mascherina.   Stiamo sostenendo costi altissimi:  ogni mascherina costa oltre 10 volte il costo normale gli spostamenti di personale da una regione allaltra a sostegno dei colleghi sono onerosi.   Abbiamo bisogno di sostegno economico?.    I COSTI  Ogni settimana di emergenza il costo delle mascherine è di 32.00000€. Tali costi aumentano progressivamente in quanto a seguito di casi di positività non bastano più le mascherine e i DPI standard. Per le prossime  4 settimane  stimiamo una spesa di  200.00000€  per far lavorare  in sicurezza  i nostri operatori e garantire la massima sicurezza degli ospiti e utenti dei nostri servizi.   ALTRE FORME DI SOSTEGNO  Potete sostenerci anche con una donazione sul nostro conto corrente bancario  (IBAN: IT18K0100510000000000220203 ) indicando “emergenza coronavirus” e i vostri dati “nome_cognome email o cellulare” (per ricevere la certificazione di detraibilità è necessario inviare la distinta di bonifico con nome cognome indirizzo di residenza e Codice fiscale a  comunicazione@elleuno.it  ) a oppure facendoci pervenire  mascherine chirurgiche mascherine FFP2 e FFP3  presso le nostre sedi disponibili sul  sito elleuno .   ENTRO QUANDO   Abbiamo bisogno del vostro aiuto subito  raccogliamo i fondi fino ad agosto 2020 ma è oggi che è urgente un sostegno economico  dobbiamo garantire la sicurezza economica e dare tutti gli strumenti necessari per la loro incolumità a chi si sta prendendo cura dei nostri anziani dei nostri disabili dei malati terminali non possiamo fermarci non ora...   è lappello della presidente della nostra cooperativa che inviamo a tutti voi.

title: Mill Hill COVID-19 Support Group
description: Mill Hill COVID-19 Support Group  is a volunteer group helping people across our community during a short or extended period of isolation. We are providing free food and essential supplies to those in genuine need. Our team of volunteers also help with shopping prescription collections and even posting mail for the vulnerable.  Together we can support each other in this time of need!   Where will my money go?    This fundraising account is solely used to help support the elderly vulnerable and those in genuine need living in Mill Hill (NW7) and for the staff at Barnet Hospital to purchase food and other supplies.  Please if you can give generously as there are so many people in desperate need and the longer COVID-19 is here the more requests we are receiving.  If there are any funds left at the end of this period they will be distributed equally to NW7 based charities.

title: COVID-19  Kleine Freuden Friseurstudio
description: Liebe Kundinnen und Kunden Freunde Kleine Freuden Friseurstudio Fans und auch alle anderen die uns in der Coronakrise unterstützen möchten  wie viele kleine Unternehmen sind auch wir nicht davon verschont worden unseren kleinen Salon schließen zu müssen.  Auch wir nutzen jede Option die uns vom Staat ermöglicht wird um über dir Runden zu kommen um nach der ganzen Krise wieder für euch da zu sein.  Da mich schon einige von euch gefragt haben ob sie mir mit Spenden/Schenkungen helfen können und mir von einer guten Freundin das System des Crowdfunding empfohlen wurde habe ich mich entschieden diese Seite einzurichten.  Somit kann jeder wenn er möchte und die Möglichkeit hat schnell und einfach einen auch wenn nur kleinen Betrag an unseren Salon spenden und somit unsere Existenz sichern.  Ihr würdet mich damit Unterstützen meinen kleinen Salon den ich vor 15 Jahren übernehmen durfte zu retten. Wir sind noch in der Aufbauphase des Salons und wünschen uns dass wir so weiter machen können wie zuvor um für euch da zu sein.  Ich bin jetzt schon unfassbar Dankbar für die vielen Nachrichten die mich erreichen und der Angebote mich zu Unterstützen. Ich hoffe ich kann es euch mit dieser Plattform erleichtern.  Viele dankbare Grüße das Kleine Freuden Team Ela und Melli

title: LOTTO contro il Covid-19
description: LOTTO contro il Covid-19  Noi rappresentanza studentesca dell Istituto   Lorenzo Lotto  di Trescore Balneario abbiamo deciso di aiutare l Ospedale   Papa Giovanni XXIII  cercando di dare un nostro piccolo contributo segno della nostra vicinanza a seguito di questo momento così delicato.  In questo momento di difficoltà per tutto il Paese e soprattutto per la nostra provincia (la più colpita al mondo dopo la città di Wuhan) chiediamo agli studenti ai genitori ai professori del  Lorenzo Lotto  e a chiunque voglia contribuire di aiutare la nostra città.  Tutto il denaro sarà utilizzato per  sconfiggere questo virus  e poter tornare finalmente alla normalità.  Con la speranza che possa  finire tutto presto  e che tutto  andrà per il meglio !     FORZA BERGAMO E FORZA ITALIA!  E ricordate: LOTTO contro il Covid-19!  Informazioni sulla raccolta dei fondi   I fondi raccolti verranno prelevati dalla Presidente del  Comitato dIstituto  e dalla Presidente del  Comitato Genitori  che provvederanno a trasferirli interamente all Ospedale PapaGiovanni XXIII.

title: COVID-19 Nursing Support
description: We are raising money to help support the staff at TriHealth during the COVID 19 pandemic. 100% of the money donated will go to our staff. We hope to start with providing food during their shifts but if we raise enough we will think bigger. Lets show our front line worker some love.

title: No to  Quarantine Hungry Covid_19 Relief Fund
description: https://www.themanifestationacademy.org     During this universal pandemic Yolande and Mass Bidew decided to create this fund to assist countless families in Senegal and other African Countries affected by the Covid_19. No one should stay home hungry.  With the Funds we will raise together we will be able to open our first Food Bank.   As we know many of them cant afford to stay at home as they live and work daily to make as little as 10$ to feed their families.  We will be planning to open the first food Bank in Senegal and distribute food vouchers from the local supermarket.  65$ can help us feed a family and quarantine for a month and help stop the spread of the virus.  Please  donate money or non perishable goods that we can distribute to assist these families during the quarantine.  We send you love and light and we all keep our mind positive . #bettertogether we will defeat this .  Thank you  Yolande and Mass

title: GOL SUR 1907 PLANTA CARA AL COVID-19
description: Si de algo sabemos los béticos es de crisis y momentos duros. Y si somos famosos por algo es por no rendirnos nunca y salir de los agujeros más profundos ayudándonos los unos a los otros.  Por eso desde GOL SUR 1907 queremos hacer un llamamiento de solidaridad a todos los béticos y a todo aquel que está dispuesto a colaborar y no sabe cómo. No es momento de rivalidades o disputas. Es el momento de que todos arrimemos el hombro sin que importen los colores las siglas o los escudos.  Estamos ante una situación jamás vista anteriormente y que ha desbordado nuestros hospitales y a nuestros profesionales sanitarios. Por este motivo hemos organizado una campaña de Crowdfunding en la que queremos recaudar fondos para ayudar a los hospitales y sanitarios de nuestra ciudad en todo lo que necesiten.  Creemos que una de las mejores forma de ayudar es recaudando fondos. Es la manera más fácil y segura para que pueda colaborar todo el mundo desde casa sin asumir riesgos innecesarios. Todo el dinero recaudado irá entregado de manera íntegra al Hospital Virgen del Rocío y al Hospital Virgen Macarena de nuestra querida ciudad. Lo pondremos a su disposición para que ellos lo empleen en lo que necesiten.  Paralelamente estamos trabajando con la Plataforma  Andaluza de Voluntarios a la que hemos ofrecido la bolsa de voluntariado que hemos creado para que en el caso de que sea necesario se pueda desarrollar cualquier actividad de manera correcta y segura.  También animamos al Real Betis Balompié a que si en algún momento tenía previsto devolver la parte correspondiente del abono de los partidos que no se van a disputar busque la fórmula adecuada para que ese dinero pueda ir destinado a seguir ayudando a los hospitales y sanitarios de nuestra ciudad.  Estamos seguros de que entre todos conseguiremos revertir esta situación y salir adelante.     ¡SOLO EL PUEBLO SALVA AL PUEBLO!

title: COVID-19 - Maidstone NHS: Lets help!
description: Do you want to join us in making a difference?   We are raising money in aid of MAIDSTONE AND TUNBRIDGE WELLS NHS CHARITABLE FUND and every donation will help to support the intensive care department during COVID-19 emergency.  Thank you in advance for your contribution to this cause that means so much to us!

title: Protect The COVID-19 Staff (UK & Ireland)
description: Due to the current climate I like many festival and event freelancers find myself out of work but also in a position where Id like to be helpful and offer my skillset to the COVID-19 pandemic in UK   Ireland.   Having spoken to many friends who are health workers the scariest part (that we can control) seems to be lack of PPE and facilities on-site to shower/clean clothes and avoid staff getting contaminated or bringing it home to their families (in particular my very amazing friend who is a respiratory nurse has to sleep in a separate bed to her fiancé who shes due to marry in June because of his medical risk level).   I figure with the black book of freelance contacts all now idle because of the inevitable closure of our main event season and the list of suppliers we normally use for creating ‘mini cities in a field teamed with the ability to transform spaces no matter how big or small we should try and support these workers and help them feel a little safer at work each day.   I appreciate this is not the best time to ask for funding for many but if you can well put it to good use in one of the following forms and equally if you cant please just comment share on social media   show your support!   Funding Resource will go towards;   PPE   Wed like to look at ordering as much quantities small or large of PPE (Nitrile Gloves   Masks) and collate for distribution.  This also potentially includes contacting multiple closed stores like tattoo parlours who would naturally have stock and buy it out if thats a quicker method!    Toilets   Shower Facilities   Weve contacted major hospitals affected by COVID-19 today (staying London focused for the moment until we pick up additional interest) and offering Toilet   Shower Trailer Units which can be parked outside for staff use.   These units will need power source   waste resource as well as the logistics behind delivery   cleaning so there are costs attached to the supplier bookings but were working to downsize all costs to make sure the funding gets stretched as far as possible.    With the solid Project Management team who are fuelled by cabin fever and a bit of budget I know we can do some good here.   If this takes off Ill share daily updates on what we are achieving so were all a part of this together.    **Suppliers  - if you want to get involved please get in touch.    **Health workers  - if you need anything in particular or want to add your location to our database please get in touch and well do our very best to support as much as possible!   Thanks everyone for your time  With Love   Festival Freelancers x  (Incredible artwork provided by the talented  @sazzleshark_tattoo )

title: Firenze for Covid-19 First Responders
description: 100% of the money will be used to pay our staff so we can deliver free of charge sandwiches to our healthcare   workers that   are working around the clock to fight this horrible pandemic.   Covid-19 has affected everyones daily lives but none more than our healthcare workers and those in the service industry. Being a small business especially in the service industry at this time has its challenges but it also has one major benefit.  We can be nimble in how we operate.    When news of the store closures broke to the public our leadership team instantly thought “What can we do?”  “How can we help?”  That is when the idea to start a go fund me to deliver food to our healthcare workers came to fruition.  With your donation not only would be able to put smiles on the faces of our Heroes in the healthcare system but we would also be able to put much needed money in the pockets of our amazing staff.   Firenze also recognizes the extraordinary safety measures that must be taken to ensure the safety of all the healthcare workers we are delivering to as well as our staff.  We are taking every precaution necessary to make sure our prep surfaces are sanitized once every hour.  All deliveries will also be non contact.   Heres how you can help:   1.  Please donate or spread the word about our mission. Whether it is $1 or $100 dollars it doesnt matter.  Anything helps.  2.  Act in a responsible manner while our country and the world is handling this global pandemic.  Only go outside when it is an absolute necessity and if you do please practice safe social distancing.  It is too important and our great healthcare workers will become even more overwhelmed if you dont follow the proper guidelines.  We are all in this together and Firenze is here to do whatever we can to help.   Stay safe and thank you for your consideration in donating to our Page!

title: Help Homeless Neighbors during COVID-19
description: During COVID-19 many drop-in centers and places that had been centers for resource-sharing for people on the street are closed. Even many soup kitchens and pantries are not able to stay operational. Clothing closets too are closed. This impacts the homeless community tremendously.  We are raising money to benefit North Ave Mission led by homeless and formerly homeless people PeeWee Nine Trillion Sharonda New York Brenda Kenny Kitten and Blackface to supply resources to our street community which is extremely vulnerable right now. We are raising money to purchase through Maryland Food Bank and as deliveries through online sellers allow  gloves sanitizer masks shelf-stable foods protein bars socks underwear and clothing to distribute to the community in our white outreach bags which also contain information on how to keep safe during COVID-19 and where to go if youre feeling sick. We will also purchase food cards from Save-A-Lot and Shoppers which remain open. As a community we purchase food together and share it.      North Ave Mission is a creative and strong holy and humorous fellowship of people from differing yet intersecting social locations and backgrounds. We come together to hear and know that we are children of God. We are food and housing insecure people people experiencing homelessness people in recovery people living with addiction disability and mental illness. In our ranks are artists advocates activists mothers fathers and intercessors. We are community leaders who are formerly homeless and passionate about making conditions safe and healthy for people on the street. And we are people from around Baltimore and beyond who feel called to presence with our citys most vulnerable neighbors- artists activists students and social workers retirees and clergy. We are a community because we want to walk together as we advocate for justice safe housing care for each other and seek a sacred space where we can bless each other and heal as a people.   Thanks in advance for your contribution to this cause! Your support will have a huge impact.

title: Support Ethiopia Health Workers Combat COVID-19
description: The shortage of Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) monitoring devises ventilators critical care drugs are severe. With your generous financial support through EADFund we can provide tangible and meaningful contribution during this health care crises.  Just imagine what we could collectively achieve if each EADG member or those in the general public contributes $1000 (or less as any amount is welcome).  This is an extraordinary time of hardship and we should all act now and it cannot wait. This is the time to show our collective generosity good citizenry and compassion. Please give now.

title: COVID-19 Emergency Fund for Cambridge MA
description: Christie and I have been thinking through ways to support the greater Cambridge community through this time of uncertainty and heightened anxiety.   Weve decided that we want to raise money for the  Cambridge COVID-19 Emergency Fund   set up by the  Cambridge Community Foundation   in partnership with the  City of Cambridge  .   How does it work?  The emergency fund will deploy grants (up to $1000) to Cambridge residents   workers experiencing financial hardship related to COVID-19. In addition grants of up to $10000 will be awarded to nonprofits that directly work with low-income populations and that have the capacity to make money transfers to the constituents they serve.     http://cambridgecf.org/COVID-19-emergency-fund      http://cambridgecf.org/two-new-funds-launched-in-response-to-covid-19/      https://www.cambridgema.gov/news/2020/03/mayorscovid19fund      How much will we raise?  Were aiming to raise $2000 between now and the end of the month. Christie and I are planning to match donations up to $500 and our friends Ezer Lee and Eric   Kelly Dearing have also graciously offered to match another $500 each. Thats $1500 in matching donations!   Pilates Mat Class on Instagram Live  As a part of our fundraising efforts  Christie will be hosting a charity Pilates Mat class on Instagram Live  this Thursday (3/26) at 7:30 AM (which will then be live for 24 hrs)   https://www.instagram.com/fitwithchristie/     //   Would you consider making a contribution of $10 or $25 to support those who have been hit the hardest by the COVID-19 pandemic?   If youve been blessed with financial security and youre looking for ways to be generous would you consider making a contribution of $50 or $100 or even becoming a matching donor?  If you cant make a contribution at this time please help share this effort with those you know especially those who live work or play in Cambridge!  //   FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS    Why is this a personal fundraiser?  Setting up a GoFundMe fundraiser to go to CCF directly would mean that the funds wouldnt actually get to them until April 30th because of GoFundMes payout timelines. We believe that getting the funds raised as quickly as possible is worth the associated trade-offs.   How will you get the money to CCF?  When the fundraiser closes on March 31st we will donate all the proceeds  directly to the CCF on their website   and share the donation details publicly. The online donation goes through  Network For Good which will send the funds to CCF on April 15th  .   What if I dont want to give through GoFundMe?  You can venmo Emmanuel-Runes or Christie-Wang-3 and we will donate to the GoFundMe on your behalf.   Is my donation tax-deductible?  Unfortunately one of the trade-offs of speed is that these donations are not tax-deductible. If thats important to you we recommend  donating directly !  https://cambridgecf.networkforgood.com/projects/95764-cambridge-covid-19-emergency-fund    Are there fees?  Unfortunately another one of the trade-offs of speed is that these donations incur a 2.9% fee + $0.30 USD.   //   CHARITY PILATES MAT CLASS ON INSTAGRAM LIVE    What will the Pilates Mat class be like?  This will be a 45 minute bodyweight full body Pilates mat class. Pilates originally invented by a man named Joseph Pilates during the 1920s is a low impact form of conditioning - working the full body especially the core.   What do I need for the Pilates Mat Class?   - Yoga Mat or Towel to pad your knees/tailbone  - Phone or device to access Instagram    Any tips for taking the Pilates Mat Class?   - Place the device at the front of your mat for the best angle.  - Use the largest device you have (iPad) or consider mirroring your screen to a TV   - Make sure to listen closely to cues and instruction as visuals can sometimes lag - Although the class airs at 7:30 AM it will be available for 24 hours after. If you do decide to take the class after its live we hope you still consider donating!   - Have fun!   //   CAMBRIDGE COVID-19 EMERGENCY FUND    Where can I find more information about the Cambridge COVID-19 Emergency Fund?    http://cambridgecf.org/COVID-19-emergency-fund      http://cambridgecf.org/two-new-funds-launched-in-response-to-covid-19/      Who can apply for grants?  Individuals/households who live or work in Cambridge can apply to the fund and receive a grant of up to $1000.    What organizations can apply for grants?  A limited number of special grants of up to $10000 will be considered to nonprofit organizations based on the following criteria:   - Track record of working with low–income families   - The ability to make cash transfers to individuals and families for a range of needs such as rent shortage food utilities medicines/medical supplies  - Evidence of 501c3 status   When will funds be available?  The CCF is looking to deploy this money immediately to offer relief to those in desperate need. Grants will be provided on a rolling basis with the first allocations expected to be made as soon as possible.    Whats the selection process?  The CCF has a grant review process whereby community reviewers are invited to help Foundation staff review the applications and make recommendations. Each application will be reviewed by one external reviewer and one Foundation staff person. As the fiduciary agent responsible for the use of these funds the CCF will have the final decision on all grants.   How is the CCF Fund different from the Mayors Disaster Relief Fund?  The City of Cambridge and the Cambridge Community Foundation have a long-standing tradition of working together.  These funds are complementary allowing the CCF to deepen their reach and enabling many more people to be part of collective giving with the aim of supporting as many people as they can who need help. The CCF can support people who make their livelihood Cambridge who may not necessarily live here. The CCF can also support nonprofits and faith-based organizations that have deep reach into the community.    https://www.cambridgema.gov/news/2020/03/mayorscovid19fund

title: Good Spirits staff assistance from Covid-19
description: I have had several of our amazing Good Spirits friends and family reach out to me asking what they can do how they can help.  We have 15 employees that are being severely impacted by this Covid-19 shutdown of our business.  For many of us Good Spirits is our only source of income and now we have no income for the foreseeable future.  If anyone wants to donate all of the donations will be distributed to our employees to help them pay their rent feed their families and hopefully stay afloat during this trying time.   Any amount helps and is so appreciated.   We love our Good Spirits family and are so grateful for each and everyone of you that have called and messaged us just to check in and make sure we are ok.  We are strong and we will all get through this together! Thank you!

title: ULSS7 vs Covid19
description: La nostra ULSS7 sta chiedendo un aiuto concreto contro lemergenza sanitaria Covid19. Con 10000 euro potremo acquistare confezioni di guanti usa e getta mascherine ed altro materiale da donare direttamente allospedale. Siamo tutti giocatori in questa partita e nessuno deve stare in panchina! Dateci una mano donate quello che potete! Grazie

title: Emergenza COVID-19 CRI Castelfranco di Sotto
description: Lemergenza COVID-19 sta mettendo a dura prova le nostre comunità. Ti chiediamo di sostenerci in modo da poter garantire una sempre più ampia risposta di aiuto alla popolazione. Aiutaci ad aiutare.

title: COVID19 - IT Dept Furloughed Co-Workers Fund
description: Dear Generous and Kind Friends  Due to the COVID-19 pandemic our coworkers have been furloughed due to the mass shelter in place orders. Our company (like many others) had to adjust staffing in response to the dramatic change in business volumes.   Our hearts go our to each and every one of them and we want to try to help them through this financial hardship with our donations.  I have never done a Go-Fund-Me Page before but i think this crisis warrants such a page. Our hearts and prayers go out to every person affected by the Covid-19 virus.     Whatever you can do to help someone pay a mortgage rent car payment food etc.  Thank you in advance for your generosity.

title: 18 caballos en tiempos de COVID-19
description: Natura Equus es un centro ecuestre que lleva en activo 5 años en el que viven 18 caballos (en su mayoría rescatados y rehabilitados) que se dirije desde el amor a los animales y se financia a tarvés de actividades ecuestres enfocadas a mejorar y manener su estado físico y mental y promocionar formas respetuosas de educar interactuar y relacionarse con los équidos. Debido al coronavirus estos 30 días (hasta el momento) no podemos llevar a cabo las actividades que dan de comer a los caballos y mantienen los gastos de la finca. Necesitamos una oleada de generosidad para salir de este bache. Puede ser en forma de forraje pienso para caballos dinero o bonos de clases o contrataciones de nuestros servicios por adelantado hasta poder reanudar el trabajo. Y por supuesto cuando el mundo se limpie de coronavirus os esperamos en la finca para conocer nuestra labor. ¡Muchas gracias por la comprensión!

title: Indy COVID-19 Service Industry Relief Fund
description: As we all are learning to navigate through the Covid-19 health crisis our energetic and indispensable hospitality industry workers are also staring down the possibility of economic hardships.  Effective March 17th 2020 the governor ordered all restaurants bars and night clubs to be closed for an indefinite amount of time. This order has had significant financial repercussions for thousands of people employed in the service industry in the Indianapolis area.  Service industry/hospitality workers can apply for unemployment and state officials are working to pass a ban on evictions during this time.  Despite these reliefs there is no 100% rent forgiveness unemployment payments take time to arrive--and when they do the amount is often not enough to cover basic living expense.  Folks who are laid off from jobs that also pay for their medical insurance out of pocket which can be a devastating cost while relying on unemployment payments alone.   We have started a fund that can be accessed by workers whose hours have been cut or lost because of this crisis and who are not being otherwise compensated.   In order to distribute the funds weve created a short survey through Survey Monkey that will help us prioritize those in our community that are most in need. All information will remain confidential. Our aim is to provide everyone who applies with emergency funds. Applicants will be asked to also sign up for unemployment coverage to get a full scope of what support is needed. We are in direct contact with each applicant and recipient of funds and will be sending funds directly through a third-party app (Cash App PayPal Venmo) or check.   Please apply for emergency funds here:     https://www.surveymonkey.com/r/Z2WCFP3    If you have any questions please email ncampbell6224@gmail.com   It matters how we survive this crisis--not only physically or individually but as a community. Lets make sure that those who have taken care of us at some point are taken care of when they need help the most.   Please consider donating or sharing if you are unable to give at this time. Thank you for your support.

title: The Saint Austere COVID-19 Relief fund
description: Please support! Closing the restaurant and laying off 9 wonderful people was the hardest thing weve ever had to do. As its become clear that this shutdown will last a while we are asking for your help.  All proceeds will go to our staff as well as essential bills to hopefully get us to the other side of this thing. Thank you for your generosity.    Stay safe. Love The Pirolo family

title: Helping Community - COVID19
Covid19 - Lavoriamo uniti per la terapia intensiva
description: #BASTAPOCO    LAVORIAMO INSIEME PER AFFRONTARE QUESTA EMERGENZA.
