We hate to ask and we would have happily avoided doing so if we had any other possibility to turn to.    We ask reluctantly but knowing that in these hard times no contribution can be too small or superfluous or insignificant and we would be forever grateful to you for helping us out if you can do so.  To us it could make the difference between success and defeat. And it goes without saying we would love to be there for you again on your next visit to Rome!  If this call for help succeeds we plan to use half of whatever funds we manage to gather to shore up our company finances and half to be distributed between our guides.   Please stay well and stay safe  Your TopBike Team  ---  (some of our guides)  Our Akram (lower left) on the Via Appia   Our Elena in the back-alleys of Rome   Our Edoardo just after a punchline (right)   Our Klaas just before starting on a tour

title: Material for 3D Printed Face Shields for COVID-19
description: I am currently using my 3D printer at home to print face shields for KU Medical Center 24/7! I am part of a group working to print 800 masks for front-line healthcare professionals. While material is not expensive we need a decent amount of it and I do not have enough. One $20 spool of PLA filament can make 20 masks that can save lives and prevent the spread of the virus to our critical healthcare personnel. All funding from this campaign will go toward more materials to continue making masks.     If you want to learn more about the project you can read about the design here:    https://blog.prusaprinters.org/from-design-to-mass-3d-printing-of-medical-shields-in-three-days/#_ga=2.115328135.148275893.1585047939-714479431.1585047939    And the group I am working with to deliver these masks here:    https://www.facebook.com/KCPPEProject/?hc_location=ufi

title: CONFECCIÓN MASCARILLAS
description: Queridos amigos  Hace unos días desde el perfil de BIMANI compartimos con vosotros nuestras ganas de colaborar confeccionando el máximo número de mascarillas.   Además de contar con la colaboración de nuestra red de talleres os propusimos que colaboraseis con nosotros fabricando mascarillas desde vuestras casas. ¡ Miles de gracias por la grandísima acogida sois más de 500 personas las que queréis ayudarnos!    A raíz de esta iniciativa nos contactaron para coordinar la distribución de tejido entre diferentes talleres voluntarios.  La cantidad de mascarillas que vamos a poder confeccionar con nuestros recursos es insuficiente  (el Hospital La Paz por ejemplo necesita 30.000 mascarillas diarias según informan los medios). Además nos ha encargado batas cuya confección es mucho más compleja.   Necesitamos contar con más talleres la mayoría tienen que seguir haciendo frente a sus gastos mensuales y sólo podrán ayudarnos si al menos consiguen cubrir esos costes.  A través de esta plataforma nuestra intención es  recaudar fondos tanto para pagar a los talleres que quieran unirse así como adquirir otros materiales (hilo gomas sobres de envío) y gestionar los envíos del tejido cortado a los diferentes domicilios y talleres.     POR SUPUESTO EL IMPORTE RECAUDADO IRÁ DESTINADO ÍNTEGRAMENTE A ESTE PROYECTO.    ¡Ojalá este mensaje se extienda mucho más allá del universo BIMANI y demostremos la solidaridad y ganas de ayudar de esta COMUNIDAD!   Os iremos informando   ¡MILLONES de gracias de todo corazón!   Un fuerte abrazo  Laura Corsini   Si quieres colaborar confeccionando puedes escribirme a lauracorsini@bimani13.com

title: Quattordio per gli Ospedali di Alessandria COVID19
description: Cari Quattordiesi  in questo periodo il senso di appartenenza si rinsalda e ci rafforza sul tema della volontà a superare lemergenza  Coronavirus-Covid19  visto soprattutto le difficoltà a reperire mascherine camici strumentazioni e materiali che la struttura sanitaria necessita in questo difficile  momento.  Come Amministrazione Comunale abbiamo deciso di contribuire alla causa devolvendo 2.500 € dal bilancio comunale alla raccolta fondi  “UN AIUTO per gli OSPEDALI della Provincia di Alessandria”  promossa da  ASL Alessandria  e  Azienda Ospedaliera Alessandria  per aiutare i nostri ospedali di competenza.  Parallelamente abbiamo deciso di avviare questa raccolta fondi per permettere a chi volesse contribuire alla stessa causa di farlo identificandosi allinterno della nostra generosa comunità.  Esistono già iniziative finalizzate alla raccolta fondi ma mi piacerebbe lasciare traccia della generosità della nostra comunità avviando questa raccolta che si identifica nello slogan  “Quattordio per gli Ospedali di Alessandria”.                                                                                                            Il Sindaco                                                                                              Alessandro Venezia

title: Five Year Mission COVID-19 Quaranstream
description: In this time of COVID-19 quarantine Five Year Mission had decided to do a live stream of an acoustic show at Hero House Comics. Since an order for non-essential travel has been put in place well be doing solo songs from our various quarantine locations and answering fan questions to all of those that tune in. Weve decided that well be splitting the money up between 2 charities for this show: One global (WHO) and one local to Indianapolis (Gleaners Food Bank). Below is a list of songs that YOU CAN REQUEST! Simply make a $5 donation and make your request in the comments. Well take the top voted songs and perform them from 8-10 PM EST on Saturday March 28th on Facebook Live. If you are not a fan already simply search Five Year Mission on FB and youll find us. ----Patrick songs: And the Children Shall Lead Spocks Dog  I Mudd Happy Birthday George Takei Tomorrow Is Yesterday This Side of Paradise Charlie X The Gamesters Of Triskelion ----Chris songs: The Omega Glory The Squire Of Gothos Dagger Of The Mind The Menagerie II Space Seed Metamorphosis Eymorg Is There In Truth No Beauty? ----Mike songs: The Cage Mudds Women  Errand of Mercy Operation Annihilate  The Doomsday Machine Catspaw My Directive Is Prime Ultimate Computer ---- Noah songs: Where No Man Has Gone Before What Are Little Girls Made Of? The Galileo 7 The Trouble With Tribbles The Apple Obsession Hey Kara! The Paradise Syndrome   Five Year Mission Facebook

title: Scout per Tor Vergata contro Covid-19
description: “Uno scout non sta mai con le mani in mano” e visto che in periodo di quarantena possiamo aiutare solo a distanza abbiamo voluto avviare questa raccolta fondi per il Policlinico di Tor Vergata. Molti ospedali in questo momento si trovano in difficoltà a causa del Coronavirus: la nostra Associazione lASDI ha deciso di fare da tramite  per aiutare una delle strutture più vicine a noi.   I fondi raccolti verranno destinati alle necessità che la fondazione PTV Policlinico Tor Vergata sta affrontando per fronteggiare  il Covid19.  Vogliamo agire subito per aiutare chi si trova in corsia!

title: The Corona Arm - Quiz Fund
description: During this period of lockdown and isolation people are struggling to survive more than ever. All entry donations from The Corona Arms quiz will be used to help those in need. Our chosen Charity it  St Georges Crypt   - a Leeds based charity working with the homeless the vulnerable and those with addiction problems.  Please donate whatever you can.

title: Croce Bianca Varigotti per lOspedale Santa Corona
description: Siamo la  P.A. Varigotti  una Pubblica assistenza di una piccola frazione del Comune di Finale Ligure;  abbiamo deciso di creare questa campagna per essere più vicini a chi è in prima linea e sostenerli con lunica cosa che possiamo fare da casa:  donare dispositivi e attrezzature essenziali per lincolumità di quelle persone che stanno lavorando allo stremo delle forze con lobbiettivo di fermare questo virus !   Il territorio Ligure è profondamente colpito con oltre 2000 persone contagiate ed il numero è destinato inevitabilmente a crescere nei prossimi giorni. I medici e tutto il personale del  Santa Corona di Pietra Ligure  stanno lavorando senza sosta. Possiamo aiutarli rinforzando il pronto soccorso e la terapia intensiva dellOspedale Santa Corona. Servono:  -Ventilatori -Dispositivi di ventilazione non invasiva -Monitoraggio emodinamico -Cuffie camici  occhiali monouso. -Mascherine ffp2 e ffp3   Ognuno di noi può fare la sua parte !!   Tutti i fondi verranno versati al Santa Corona di Pietra Ligure ad eccezione di una quota destinata al servizio assistenza territoriale G.SAT  dedicato allemergenza epidemiologica da Covid19.  _____________________   We are the  P.A. Varigotti  a public assistance service of a small district in Finale Ligure.  We decided to create this fundraising campaign in order to be closer to whom is on the front line in the Covid 19 emergency situation  supporting them from home in the only possible way: donating devices and other equipment that are essential to the safety of those worn-out people who are working in order to stop the virus!   The Ligurian territory is being deeply hit by the virus: there are more than 2000 infected people a number which is expected to increase in the next days. Doctors and all the staff of  Santa Corona hospital of Pietra Ligure  are working non-stop. We can help them by strengthening the emergency room and the intensive care of Santa Corona hospital. They need:  - ventilators - devices for non-invasive ventilation   - hemodynamic monitoring - caps scrubs disposable goggles - FFP2 and FFP3 face masks    Everybody can play a key role!  All the funds are going to be donated to the Santa Corona hospital of Pietra Ligure except for a part destined to the local assistance service “G.SAT” which is handling the epidemiological emergency Covid19.

title: Help Stillwater Medical Center Fight Pandemic
description: ??????:  ???????????????????????????????????????  ?????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????Stillwater Medical Center ??????????????????  ?????????????????????????????????????GofundMe???????????????????????????????????  ????????????????????????????????!????????????????????????????????   ?????????????  Due to the  severe shortage of personal protection equipment  (PPE) at Stillwater Medical Center the Stillwater Chinese Community led by the  Oklahoma State University Chinese Faculty and Staff Association  and  Stillwater Chinese Baptist Church  is setting up this fundraiser to encourage donations from the entire Chinese community and beyond to help with the purchase of medical supplies in fighting against the coronavirus outbreak.  We all know that medical workers are on the front line of OUR BATTLE against this invisible enemy.  With a dramatic increase in the number of confirmed cases of COVID-19 nationwide and statewide the severe shortage of protective gear for our frontline fighters has significantly imperiled their ability to fight coronavirus and put their own lives at risk.  The raised funds will be used to pay for the purchase of PPE for medical professionals at  Stillwater Medical Center  as well as other medical clinics in the area.    Link      Link       Link       Link

title: Funding For Artists affected by Covid 19
description: The artist community is one among many that have been affected by Covid19. Cancelled performances and classes as well as shelter in place mandates have led to sudden change in sources of income to those who are solely dependent on the arts for their livelihood. We at Kala Vedika are collecting funds to help a few selected artists tide over this difficult time. It is a small drop in the variety of needs of the hour and we hope you will find it in you to donate generously so that we may reach our modest goal at the earliest. Artists will be selected based on a simple application process. Interested artists please contact Kala Vedika directly.   DONORS: Please enter your donation amount of choice and payment details. You will receive a receipt for tax deductible as we are a 501(c)3 organization and this campaign is for a cause.  Thank you all!

title: Mascherine e dispositivi di protezione COVID19
description: Cari Amici Dear Friends in questo tragico momento il Gruppo Otologico si impegna  personalmente in una lotta contro un virus che minaccia la tenuta dellintero sistema sanitario.  Le due Case di Cura Piacenza e S.Antonino  sono state riconvertite integralmente in strutture per la cura del Covid-19 e tutto il personale si sta impegnando nella lotta contro il virus. Piacenza è una delle città più colpite e mio papà avendo sempre collaborato con il Dott. Mario Sanna è partito per dare il suo contributo come medico.  Chiediamo il vostro aiuto per sostenere la Fondazione Onlus Mario Sanna che sostiene economicamente la struttura e nello specifico fornisce DPI- Dispositivi di Protezione Individuali e strumentazione.  La situazione e molto critica mancano mascherine tute e guanti oltre a strumentazione e respiratori. Tutto il personale medico e sanitario sta facendo un lavoro straordinario aiutateci a proteggerli e salvare vite umane.  Grazie Gruppo Otologico e collaboratori  www.gruppootologico.com/it/istituzionale/fondazione-mario-sanna    --------------- Dear Friends In this tragic situation Gruppo Otologico is working to fight the virus which is threatening the healthcare system in Italy. Two clinics Casa di Cura Piacenza and S.Antonino have been fully converted into structures for the treatment of Covid-19 the entire staff is employed in the battle against the virus.  We ask for your support to the Fondazione Onlus Mario Sanna which helps these clinics supplying materials for individual protection and medical equipment.  The situation is critical doctors do not have enough face masks and gloves; also ventilators and other materials are scarce. Medical doctors and staff are doing an incredible job: please help us to protect them and save patients lives.  Thank you for your contribution  Gruppo Otologico and Associates  www.gruppootologico.com/it/istituzionale/fondazione-mario-sanna

title: Catrachos solidarios por el COVID19
description: Honduras nos necesita. Honduras te necesita. Es el momento de demostrar de que estamos hechos ante una emergencia no nacional sino que mundial.  Sabemos de las carencias de mas del 50% que se enfrenta nuestra querida población que ha sido golpeada por años y no podemos dejar que se les golpee mas a causa de esta epidemia. El COVID19 es el enemigo invisible y que acecha a nuestra querida Honduras.   Es ahi donde entramos nosotros los Catrachos Solidarios. Un grupo de personas preocupadas por la situación del país y cuyo objetivo es crear un muro contingente para nuestros médicos que serán los heroes que atenderán cientos de pacientes y también con la idea de salvaguardar la vida de los mas necesitados que sabemos que son mayoría.   Lo que se donará con tu aportación: Guantes de latex Mascarilla cubre boca Gel de manos Jabón Batas Víveres entre otros.   Por eso yo Michael Fallas en nombre de todo el equipo de Catracho Solidarios pedimos tu colaboración sea cual sea de granito en granito vamos a servir de mucha ayuda. Te invito a comprometerte hondureño sensible a esta crisis que estamos viviendo y que solo juntos podremos vencerla sin olvidar la ayuda del mas grande y todopoderoso nuestro Dios que nos cubre y nos protege sobre todas nuestras ideas y proyectos para el bien de nuestra gente. Seamos solidarios con todo nuestro corazón y es tiempo de unirnos con la fe puesta en Dios sin importar tu preferencia política religiosa tu raza o color de piel. Todos somos iguales.   Se ira informando y siendo lo mas transparentes posible con todos los avances hechos con sus donaciones a traves de la cuenta oficial de instagram.  —————————————————————————  Honduras needs us. Honduras needs you. Its our time to show what we are made of during a world wide sanitary emergency  We know about the shortages of more than 50% that our beloved population has been facing and it has beaten it for years we wont allow this pandemic to hurt our society anymore. COVID19 is the invisible and stalking enemy of our beloved Honduras.  Thats when us “Catrachos Solidarios” come in: A group of people concerned about the situation in the country and whose objective is to create a contingent wall for our medical field specialists who will be the heroes and who will care for hundreds of patients and also with the idea of ??safeguarding the lives of those most in need which is the majority of our population.  What will be donated with your contribution?: Latex gloves Face masks Hand sanitizers  Soap Surgical gowns Food among others.  That is why I Michael Fallas on behalf of the entire Catracho Solidarios team ask for your collaboration all donations regardless of the amount we will be very helpful. I invite you to commit to Honduran sensitivity to this crisis that we are experiencing and that only together can we overcome it without forgetting the help of the greatest and almighty our God who covers us and protects us over all our ideas and projects for the good of our people. Let us be in solidarity with all our hearts and it is time to unite with faith in God regardless of your political religious preference your race or skin color. We are all the same. Michael will inform and will be as transparent as possible with all the progress made with his donations through the official instagram account.

title: Material sanitario COVID19 HGUGM MADRID
description: Hola! Soy enfermera del Hospital Gregorio Marañón y necesitamos con urgencia material sanitario. Sobre todo batas impermeables y mascarillas con filtro FFP2 para poder atender a todo el mundo  en esta emergencia sanitaria!!! La idea es recaudar fondos y ponernos en contacto con empresas y distribuidores que nos puedan facilitar este material.  Muchas gracias

title: Ankara International Students Housing COVID-19
description: 6 international students in Ankara lost housing as dormitories closed due to COVID-19.   Raising funds to cover 1-3 months in rent

title: Combattiamo Insieme il COVID-19
description: La Croce Verde di Corridonia chiede alla cittadinanza un piccolo supporto economico per poter continuare tutti insieme la lotta contro il COVID-19. #andràtuttobene

title: Get our Healthcare Workers PPE for COVID-19
description: On March 11 the World Health Organization declared the outbreak of COVID-19 a global pandemic reaching 197 countries and territories and affecting hundreds of thousands of people.  Currently the medical professionals who are fighting on the front line are working tirelessly but now hospitals are quickly running out of Personal Protection Equipment (PPE) for their workers and many of them have no choice but to re-use their masks protective garments and gloves. Theres even been a movement from these workers under the hashtag #GetMePPE as they turn to social media for donations.    My mother (pictured) is one of these nurses who have been working non-stop at the Robert Wood Johnson Hospital in New Brunswick New Jersey. She is already resorting to reusing her N95 for a few days now because they are running out of supplies and she has to conserve what little she has left. Thousands of medical workers are resorting to the same method of washing their masks and blow-drying them for re-use. This is not safe but they have no choice left.   We know how highly contagious this virus is and these doctors nurses technicians pharmacists etc. are all putting their lives on the line to save others.   Please join us in helping donate more PPEs to the medical community. 100% of these donations will go towards purchasing and delivery of N95 equivalent masks and protective gowns and gloves for donations to any hospitals that will take them in the Bay Area as well as the healthcare workers who have requested for additional PPE in New Jersey. In addition we will help support and provide PPE in the most requested areas by people who support this fundraising.   The supplier I was able to contact is able to provide KN95 masks. They are the Chinese equivalent to US N95s. These masks are also approved as alternatives by the CDC as detailed on their website:  https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/hcp/respirators-strategy/crisis-alternate-strategies.html    QA Test Report here (for those who can read chinese):  http://www.gttc.net.cn/m/QRDecode.asp?code=3c12ce61a85fda4281a8cbaaa1818d1e65cf no=200028308 suffix=    Cost Breakdown below:   Masks are about $1.25/piece. Minimum shipping qualification at 1000 pcs/shipment.  Shipping is going to be about $80 or more depending on the weight of the shipment.  1 minimum shipment will be $1250 not including taxes and potential custom fees.  Gofundme also charges a transaction fee of about 2.9% of the total and $0.30 of every transaction.   Depending on how much funding we can get were going to ship as many shipments as possible as we continue to accrue funds. Were hoping to get the first $5000 to allow us to send close to 3000 masks over to our healthcare professionals.

title: Masks for Nurses in Poland against COVID-19
description: English below   Polski na dole  Esta mujer sin mascarilla es mi madre Halina. Es enfermera en el Hospital Biziela en Bydgoszcz Polonia. Tiene 62 años y apenas le queda un mes para jubilarse. Debería estar en cuarentena como todos nosotros pero no se quiere quedar en casa porque ayudar a los demás es su vocación. Siempre lo ha hecho durante toda su vida y no solamente con los pacientes del hospital.  Ahora es ella quien necesita tu ayuda. Y es que en Polonia no hay recursos en los hospitales ni siquiera mascarillas para las enfermeras. Y mi madre debido a su edad se encuentra en el grupo de alto riesgo.  ¿Nos ayudas con tu granito de arena para que ella pueda seguir ayudando? Todo el dinero se destinará a la compra de mascarillas y material de protección para ella y sus compañeras de batalla. Muchísimas gracias!    This woman without a mask is my mother Halina. She is a nurse at Biziela´s Hospital in Bydgoszcz Poland. She is 62 years old and has one month of work left to retire. She should do quarantine like all of us but she doesnt want to stay home because helping others is her vocation. She has always done this throughout her whole life and not just with hospital patients. Now is her who needs your help. There are no resources in hospitals in Poland not even masks for nurses. And my mother due to her age belongs to the at-risk groups. Will you contribute with your grain of salt so that she can continue helping others? All the money will go towards the purchase of masks and protection material for herself and her companions in this coronavirus fight.  Thank you so much!  Ta kobieta bez maski to moja mama Halina. Jest pielegniarka w szpitalu im. J. Biziela w Bydgoszczy. Ma 62 lata i zostal jej miesiac pracy do przejscia na emeryture. Powinna jak kazdy z nas odbywac kwarantanne ale nie chce zostac w domu poniewaz pomaganie innym jest jej powolaniem. Przez cale zycie pomagala nie tylko pacjentom szpitalnym. Teraz to ona potrzebuje Twojej pomocy. W szpitalach polskich nie ma srodków ochronnych nawet masek dla pielegniarek. A moja mama ze wzgledu na swój wiek nalezy do grupy wysokiego ryzyka. Pomozesz nam by mogla dalej pomagac innym?  Wszystkie pieniadze zostana przeznaczone na zakup masek i materialów ochronnych dla niej i jej towarzyszek w bitwie z wirusem. Z góry bardzo dziekujemy!

title: COVID-19 Sanitation Kits for our Homeless Shelters
description: Hello family friends and neighbors!  My name is Vaishnavi Rao and my sisters name is Vasuki Rao.  We both attend Dublin High School in Dublin California. We have been blown away by the rapid growth of the  Coronavirus or COVID-19  in our state and in our San Francisco Bay area communities!  We realized the community that needs most of our help the homeless have not been receiving the necessary resources  items like  hand soap hand sanitizers gloves  lotion facial tissues and facemasks  due to either lack of supplies or the cost. It is important now more than ever that they have access to these products in order to keep themselves as healthy clean  and protected as possible from COVID-19.  We created this page to fundraise for the cause which will help the community during this COVID-19 epidemic.   1. Based on the needs of the shelters listed below we are working towards putting together 500 to 700  1 months supply sanitation kits which include hand sanitizers hand soap protective face masks gloves and hand lotion.    2. The cost of each kit is anywhere from $15 to $20  and supplies hard to find.   3. Since the epidemic could last for a few more months we are ensuring that we continue to supply these shelters for the  next few months until Covid -19 is well under control in our community.   We sincerely thank you in advance for supporting us raise enough money to fund our goal below!    Our goal is to donate 500-700 kits in total as a one month supply and to replenish them monthly until this epidemic has passed.    Shelters:  Tri-Valley Haven Food Pantry-Livermore   Trinity Center-Walnut Creek   Jordans House Homeless Shelter-Oakland   Sanctuary Homeless Shelter-San Francisco     Stay inside and stay safe! Vaishnavi Rao and Vasuki Rao

title: Help de Kamper horeca door de corona-crisis
description: Help de Kamper horeca door de corona-crisis      DE MAATREGEL   Op zondag 15 maart jl. om 17:30 uur ontving de horeca in Nederland het bericht dat zij allen hun deuren moesten sluiten om 18:00 uur tot in ieder geval 6 april a.s. vanwege de uitbraak van het corona-virus.  Een klap voor menig horecaondernemer minimaal drie weken geen enkele inkomsten afgezien van enkele creatieve ideeën die de schade zo goed als mogelijk proberen te beperken.   AANGESLAGEN EN VERSLAGEN   Ik woon in Kampen en ga altijd graag een wijntje biertje of kop koffie drinken bij diverse horecagelegenheden in Kampen. Ik zag die zondagavond ontredderde gezichten aangeslagen ondernemers maar ook teleurgestelde horecabezoekers. Een aantal horecaondernemers in Kampen verkeren nog in de opstartfase zijn net een jaar open of zelfs pas enkele maanden!   OPROEP AAN JOU!   Deze horecaondernemers sluiten hun deuren om ons horecabezoekers te beschermen! Vindt jij ook niet dat wij voor hen dan iets terug kunnen doen?  Daarom richt ik mij tot jou! Jij die graag een terrasje pikt op de Plantage jij die graag even in het zonnetje geniet van een heerlijke cappucino jij nippend aan een goed glas wijn op de IJssel jij die s avonds graag een beetje bij kletst aan de bar. Kortom jij die de Kamper horeca een warm hart toedraagt!   HULP GEVRAAGD    Help deze Kamper ondernemers zodat zij niet kapot gaan. Laten wij ervoor zorgen dat wij na deze corona-crisis weer ons stamcafé kunnen bezoeken. Dat zij weer “high wines” “high teas” of “high cocktails” kunnen aanbieden dat zij weer wijn- en bierproeverijen kunnen verzorgen en weer die gezelligheid kunnen bieden die wij nu al meer dan een week moeten ontberen.  De huidige maatregel geldt tot 6 april maar de kans bestaat dat die maatregel verlengd gaat worden. Als dat zo is zal voor veel horecaondernemers dit het einde betekenen. Daar wil ik niet aan denken. Dat verdienen zij niet. Denk aan de organisatie van de (extra) bandjesavonden Irish Pub Festival en diverse café-eigen initiatieven om ons horecabezoekers te entertainen. Ook bandjesavond van 28 maart is gesneuveld voor de horeca een goede inkomstenbron. Dus inwoners van Kampen horecabezoekers meelevenden doe iets om te helpen en geef! Geef wat je missen kunt.   DOEL EN BESTEMMING   Het doelbedrag is gemiddeld € 1-- per inwoner van Kampen dus circa € 50.000--. Maar ik hoop persoonlijk dat wij daar dik overheen gaan. Het zal de gederfde inkomsten voor velen niet dekken maar ik ben opgevoed met “alle beetjes helpen”.  Het totale opgehaalde bedrag zal overhandigd worden aan het bestuur van  Stichting Horeca Kampen  . De datum van overhandiging laten we nog even afhangen van het einde van deze maatregel. Maar wil je graag zelf aanwezig zijn bij de overhandiging van het opgehaalde geld laat mij dat dan even weten bij je donatie.

title: Cowbell Cafe COVID-19 RELIEF FUND
description: COWBELL COVID-19 RELIEF FUND - We hate to do this but The Cafe needs help as we are awaiting relief or something to happen. The SBA and loans or relief from the local level will take weeks at least and we may not make it in the meantime. We remain open during this situation with delivery and carryout but at this time we can not cover bills to get us through this. Most people know our story and how the Cowbell was saved from the IRS. The horrible winter we had in conjunction with the virus hitting right at spring break has caused the perfect storm for us. We are losing thousands a day right now. This was revenue that was going to get us back on track. We are in real trouble now and if we close our employees will be out of work and we will not be able to reopen ever.

title: Assistance for COVID-19 layoffs
description: DW Family  As all of you know by now two of our own had to be laid off yesterday since their jobs cannot be done remotely.  I dont want them to feel abandoned at a time like this.  Unemployment (pending any actual changes to the law by Congress) doesnt recover 100% of lost wages and even if it does it wont be right away.  I was thinking about collecting donations to buy them gift cards for groceries or something similar in case this drags out longer than expected.   The money raised will be used to buy gift cards for those effected by the COVID-19 layoffs.    Thanks  Greg Nowak

title: Modistas en acción COVID-19
description: Antes esta terrible situación que estamos viviendo nos hemos lanzado con el ánimo de una persona extremadamente solidaria cuatro modistas a coser y confeccionar todo lo que podamos para tener a las personas protegidas. Comenzamos trabajando con diferentes materiales y haciendo prototipos que han ido probando diferentes sanitarios. Hemos encontrado el tejido adecuado y nos gustaría poder adquirirlo para proporcionar la mayor cantidad posible de mascarillas batas y demás protecciones. Los destinatarios finales son los trabajadores de servicios públicos. Hemos empezado por supuesto con el Hospital de Guada así como Policía Nacional Guardia Civil y alguna residencia. Seguiremos buscando personas que lo necesiten y aquellos que puedan aportar su granito de arena.

title: COVID-19  Manos A La Obra
description: ENGLISH  Corona virus (COVID-19)  is currently attacking the entire world in an uncontrollable and unimaginable way. While everyone is experiencing struggles and challenges some communities are even more affected than others especially those who do not have a fixed source of income.   We as Peruvian students at Stanford University are working together to actively support vulnerable populations in Peru by providing them personal or family-size kits with essential supplies including food water and personal prevention equipments (PPE). The personal kits cost S/.75 ($21) and the family-size kits cost S/.150 ($42). We will prepare these kits and deliver them to those who need them.   Our kit is prioritized to the communities listed below all of whom are particularly impacted by this crisis.  - Low-income undocumented workers - Low-income single mothers - Low-income elderly people - Low-income people with disabilities - Low-income people experiencing homelessness  Peru is a developing country in South America. It is recognized for its beautiful landscapes such as one of the world wonders Machu Picchu and its exceptionally rich culture that has flourished since the Inca civilization. However about 6.9 million Peruvians earn less than 338 soles ($102) per month and clearly do not have enough money to survive in this desperate situation we are currently facing.   Furthermore similar to many other countries around the world Peru has imposed forced quarantine on its citizens. People from low-income communities are risking unemployment and a termination in their daily income due to the strict ban on transportation and the lay-off of businesses.   We are supporting the people who do not have access of internet people who live in isolated and remote towns in the corners of Lima and in rural areas of provinces who do not have any other source of support.   This is a time when we all have to come together to collaborate. A time when we have to support each other as global citizens.  A time when we can defeat this pandemic by putting our hands together.  We appreciate your time reading about our initiative. Now we need you to help us to help these people.   ESPAÑOL  En la actualidad el Coronavirus (COVID-19)  está atacando al mundo entero de una manera incontrolable e inimaginable. En estos momentos  todos estamos experimentamos dificultades y desafíos sin embargo algunas comunidades están incluso siendo más afectadas. Comunidades que no cuentan con una fuente fija de ingresos diarios.  Nosotros estudiantes peruanos en la Universidad de Stanford estamos trabajando juntos para apoyar activamente a las poblaciones vulnerables en el Perú. Nuestro trabajo se basa en proporcionar kits personales o familiares con suministros esenciales que incluyen alimentos agua y equipos de prevención personal (PPE) a estas comunidades. Los kits personales cuestan S/ .75 ($ 21) y los kits de tamaño familiar cuestan S/.150 ($ 42). Prepararemos estos kits y se los entregaremos a quienes los necesiten.  La prioridad para la entrega de nuestros kits es para las comunidades enumeradas a continuación todas las cuales se ven particularmente afectadas por esta crisis.  - Trabajadores indocumentados de bajos ingresos económicos - Madres solteras de bajos ingresos económicos - Personas mayores de bajos ingresos económicos - Personas de bajos ingresos económicos con discapacidad. - Personas de bajos ingresos económicos que experimentan falta de vivienda.  Perú es un país en vías de desarrollo en América del Sur. Es reconocida por sus hermosos paisajes como una de las maravillas mundiales: Machu Picchu y su cultura excepcionalmente rica que ha florecido desde la civilización Inca. Sin embargo alrededor de 6.9 millones de peruanos ganan menos de 338 soles ($ 102) mensuales y claramente no tienen suficiente dinero para sobrevivir en esta situación desesperada que enfrentamos actualmente.  Además al igual que muchos otros países en el mundo Perú ha impuesto cuarentena forzada a sus ciudadanos. Las personas de comunidades de bajos ingresos económicos están enfrentándose a situaciones de desempleo y a la terminación de sus ingresos diarios debido a la estricta prohibición del transporte y el despido de empresas.  Estamos apoyando a las personas que no tienen acceso a Internet. A personas que viven en ciudades aisladas y remotas tales conocidas como en los conos de Lima y en las zonas rurales de provincias. Personas que no tienen ninguna otra fuente de apoyo.  Este es un momento en el que todos tenemos que unirnos para colaborar. Una época en la que debemos apoyarnos mutuamente como ciudadanos globales. Un momento en que podemos vencer esta pandemia uniendo lazos.  De antemano agradecemos su tiempo al leer sobre nuestra iniciativa. En este momento necesitamos que nos ayudes a ayudar a estas personas.   ¡Muchas gracias!

title: COVID19 Fond de Urgenta  pt  Spital/Zalau
description: Facem apel catre  toti Salajenii din diaspora sa ajutam Spitalul de Infectioase din Zalau care preia cazurile de coronavirus. Am vorbit cu medici si asistente medicale de la Infectioase si de la Spitalul Judetean au fost emotionati de initiativa noastra. Cadrele medicale si pacientii sunt prieteni din copilarie colegi de scoala vecini parinti etc.  Cativa prieteni din Chicago am trimis deja $2000 pentru achizitionarea unei masini care proceseaza un numar mai mare de teste trebuie sa-i ajutam cu fonduri pentru achizitia de echipament protectiv. O sa dam update cu tot ce s-a cumparat

title: COVID-19 Cafe Temps Care Fund
description: Please help us raise money for the less fortunate workers who are not going to receive money in the next payroll.  Without access to health care paid sick leave or job security they are being forced to navigate through the world wide crisis alone - without a safety net.  All funds will support the workers and families who cant receive government aid(food stamps unemployment Medicaid pending cash payments etc) during the COVID-19 health crisis and lockdowns. All funds will be distributed directly to our community members in need. The money is a show of solidarity not a charity with our workers. It will assist in paying rent buying food accessing transportation and any other basic needs.  This is an unprecedented time for all of us and we can only get through it together.

title: Help CAARPR Fight During the COVID-19 Crisis
description: Please consider giving to the Chicago Alliance Against Racist and Political Repression (CAARPR). We know times are tough for everyone right now. Our own ability to do our work is being impacted because we are a movement for and by the working class and oppressed peoples who are disproportionately suffering the economic effects of the coronavirus.   Yet we must continue to do our work especially in the face of this pandemic because of how its affecting Black and Brown communities and exacerbating our oppression.  If you can please consider giving a donation of any size. Every bit helps and helps us organize against this pandemic including fighting to depopulate the Cook County jail and to provide treatment testing and release to the incarcerated population including torture survivors and the wrongfully convicted.  Thank you and be safe.

title: Covid-19 Zimbabwe - ZimThrive
description: Zimbabwe needs YOU! Every donation counts .  You and I are the people we need so help us to raise the resources needed to kick out Coronavirus. Join us in this fight !    Covid 19 Zimbabwe in collaboration with ZimThrive is a group of citizens advocating for risk management and community engagement of Zimbabweans to fight the Coronavirus COVID-19 pandemic.  We want to raise resources to achieve the following:  - to support the running of call centres and online platforms to effectively communicate with the Zimbabwean community. This will help to minimise and manage the myths and misconceptions and to provide support.  -buying of personal protective equipment (PPE) for our dedicated health professionals who are going above and beyond their call of duty to save our lives.  -secure more test kits to allow community / home testing and the availability of dedicated ambulances that will ferry people suspected of having Coronavirus. Allowing people suspected of having Coronavirus to use public transport is dangerous as it will allow many people to get infected.   What do we need from you?   1(Make a financial contribution  We urge all fellow Zimbabweans and friends of Zimbabwe to come together at this time to support our fellow friends and family on the ground. Time is of the essence - lets do our part as citizens both in the diaspora and local Zimbabwe to win this fight.  2)Share the link with all your friends and follow the Facebook group Covid-19 Zimbabwe where a group of Zimbabwean doctors and professionals keep up to date on Covid-19.  Our Commitment:  We are committed to being transparent and accountable with the funds received.  We have on board financial professionals that will ensure that the appropriate controls and books of accounts are in place before any funds are allocated and spent.  Baker Tily Chartered Accountants have agreed to be our auditors and our financial reports will be of public records to ensure accountability.  We at Covid-19 Zimbabwe and ZimThrive wish you safety and sound health.  The Team:   Dr Brighton Chireka - UK Dr Grant Murewanhema - Zimbabwe Kudzai Midzi  - Zimbabwe Abby Brooks Ernest - South Africa Mike Tashaya - UK Rumbidzai Bvunzawabaya - UK Farai Madziwanyika - South Africa

title: COVID19 Treatment Centre  Zimbabwe
description: COVID-19 has changed the world as we know it. Most countries are faced with a looming medical crisis and have had to take drastic measures to flatten the curve allowing for the health systems to cope with the increasing number of patients requiring emergency medical attention. As with everything some countries are better prepared than others and some countries are grossly unprepared for the impending carnage that will take place if we sit back and do nothing. One of these countries my land of birth is Zimbabwe. Based on recent events it is clear that as a country Zimbabwe is not prepared  to face the days ahead and will need ALL of its people to unite to beat this looming disaster. The country depends on our solidarity now more than ever.   Zimbabwe needs a COVID-19 Medical Treatment Centre YESTERDAY! What seemed absolutely ludicrous and unimaginable was done - China built two COVID-19 specific hospitals in TEN DAYS.  I am proposing we take a lesson from that and create a COVID-19 Medical Treatment Centre in Zimbabwe. The plan here would be to  rehabilitate  an existing PRIVATE medical facility or building that could allow for this. This could be running or non running. Realistically construction of an entirely new medical facility from the ground up is not feasible from a cost and time perspective. The  rehabilitation  would include structural renovations to provision for as many ICU beds as we can spare vital medical equipment and apparatus procurement of drugs PPE testing kits and anything else required for operations   I do not have a project proposal RFP finalised building plans contractors or details of land that can be used. I have consulted with a doctor based in Dubai who has shared with me rough blueprints of work they have done in the past to create Medical Centres for pandemics. These are below.  I am appealing for assistance from anyone with this experience to assist with their skillsets. I am appealing to everyone be it architects land developers construction companies lawyers bankers trades people nurses doctors cleaners EVERYONE who can use their trade/skill to get this project to become a reality. While that is happening the fundraising will continue as time is of the essence here and we cannot afford to waste a second.      We are in the process of setting up and registering a charitable trust domiciled in Zimbabwe with clear and transparent TORs (terms of reference). As soon as this becomes available these will be uploaded to this page for you reference. The TORs will include clear governance and accountability protocols which should ensure all donors that their contributions have been put to the intended and best use. The beneficiaries of the trust will be all COVID-19 patients in Zimbabwe with NO discrimination of any basis as to who receives treatment if capacity allows. The board of trustees is a carefully selected group of individuals from a multitude of backgrounds with strong experience in their fields.   As with all campaigns potential donors want to know who is behind the campaign and the legitimacy of it. We have formed a team/task force to make  this a reality. However I am the founder so a bit about who I am. My name is Langa Mlalazi and I am first and foremost a Zimbabwean born and raised. I know nothing about building medical centres or the healthcare system. I was born in Mbuya Nehanda hospital a public hospital next to Parirenyatwa. As a baby I remember it being a great experience and a very clean hospital :). I currently live and work in the Netherlands.  LinkedIn    To conclude Look to your hearts and the love for your nation and its people. Let us restore the pride we all share for that beautiful country in the south of Africa. Even if we begin with 5 beds that is 5 potential lives saved. That could be someones mother father sister daughter son brother grandparent. A donation no matter how small can go a long way to getting us to this point.     thanks  Langa Mlalazi

title: Covid19: support for Doc César and colleagues
description: Offrir de bons repas et autre soutient matériel de nécessité aux médecins personnel soignant et staff du Centre Hospitalier de Saint-Palais - Service des urgences en cette période de grande difficulté.  Avenue Frédéric de saint Jaymes 64210 Saint Palais France   Provide free good meals to doctors and other critical support materials nurses and all staff and helpers of the emergency unit of the Hospital Saint Palais during this very difficult time.  Avenue Frédéric de saint Jaymes 64210 Saint Palais France

title: COVID-19 DeLand Restaurants Employees Fund
description: **Please hit submit payment only once**  HELP SAVE OUR DOWNTOWN RESTAURANTS   We all recognize that DeLand Florida is a special place to live and we are blessed to be able to call it home. Not the least of DeLands many attractions is its wide variety of excellent locally owned restaurants. Unfortunately many of these are now closed or on a reduced schedule due to the coronavirus pandemic. None of us knows how long circumstances will prevent us from again sitting down with a cold beer or a glass of wine to enjoy an extraordinary meal served by one of the many wonderful waitstaff who have cheerfully and efficiently fed us over the years.  Until that time it is important that we show our support by helping restaurant employees who are furloughed or on reduced hours pay their ongoing expenses. We can make a habit of ordering out and tipping generously. That will help some. But the need is much greater.  We hope that if you have been a beneficiary of DeLands unique culinary culture you will be inspired to contribute to a GoFundMe account to be used to assist these deserving members of our community weather this unexpected storm.  We look forward to your support. Distribution decisions will be made on the basis of the following criteria:  1.      Restaurant must be in the DeLand Downtown Area. 2.      Local Ownership of Restaurant. 3.      Demonstrated Financial Need of Individual(s). 4.      Restaurants who will/are/have benefitted from existing or prior fundraisers will have lower priority. 5.      Individuals who qualify: Cooks Dishwashers Restaurant Servers Other Restaurant Support Staff. 6.      Individuals must have worked at the restaurant for a minimum of one month. 7.      Restaurant or Individual seeking assistance must fill out an appropriate form to be made available. 8.      No individual may receive assistance more than once from this fund.  If contributed funds are in excess of the needs stated above they will be used to subsidize distribution of locally grown produce to needy communities.  We thank you from the bottom of our hearts. Please give from your heart and we will continue to cook for you and serve your dining needs from ours.   Judy Thompson DeLand FL   Hari   Jenneffer Pulapaka (Cress Restaurant) DeLand FL

title: Help Your Gym Survive COVID-19
description: Help Your Gym Survive COVID-19    Your Gym is temporarily closed due to COVID-19 and Ill be honest it is going to be rough and I could really use your help. During this closure currently at least one month I will not be charging members. Its just the right thing to do. That means we will not have any membership revenue coming in. I will still be doing some limited tele-training but overall revenue is going to fall over 75%. Ive worked with my awesome landlords and vendors to try and reduce my fixed and variable costs during this time but there is only so much you can do and I am not sure what kind of support or aid is going to be offered to small businesses such as mine. This is why Im asking for you help and I wouldnt ask for it if I didnt think Id need it.   You guys are awesome and make Your Gym the amazing place that it is. Some of you have offered to let me keep charging your during this time which is extremely generous. The logistics of that are a bit tricky so Ive opted for using a fundraiser instead. I know times are tough for a lot of us especially the other small businesses whove suffered closures or lost business and those among us who have found themselves without a job. If you are able I ask that you donate what your membership would have been during the month well be closed. Even a little will go a long way towards ensuring that Your Gym survives these difficult times.  Im asking you to help me make sure Your Gym sees the other side of this.  I cant tell you how much all of you mean to me. Some of you Ive known for only a few months and others for many years. Your loyalty and support continues to amaze me. Im going to miss you guys.  Stay home stay healthy and stay sane.  Thank you Lee  #SmallBusinessRelief

title: Mackenzie Health Hospital PPE Donation Drive
description: Frontline medical professionals are just like us. They are mothers fathers brothers sisters children and friends. They are risking their lives in this fight against COVID19 to protect you and me. What we can do to help them as well as help ourselves is to stay home and provide as much support as we can.  We are the families and friends of Mackenzie Health in Richmond Hill. We are raising money to purchase Personal Protective Equipment to help the frontline medical staff in our hospital. Our frontline heroes need to be well equipped in order to win this fight. We dont want them to worry about the dwindling supply of PPE in the hospital while the number of patients increases exponentially. We want to take away any worries they may have about the lack of protection while they help others. We are all in this together. We CAN get through this if we work together. Please help them help us!  Thank you!  If you have PPE (such as masks face shields gloves gowns etc.) to donate please send details to  PPEforMackenzieHealth@gmail.com   we will facilitate pickup or drop off.  Please check our FB page for updates:   fb.me/PPEforMackenzieHealth     ???????COVID19?????????????????????????????“????”???????????????????????????????????Mackenzie Health??????????Mackenzie Health??????????????????????PPE???????????????????????????????Mackenzie Health Foundation??????????????????????????????????  *Please note we are not a registered charity and therefore cannot provide tax receipts for any donations.  **At the end of campaign all remaining funds will be donated to Mackenzie Health Foundation.

title: Families in Crisis due to COVID19
description: Want to join me in making a difference? Im raising money to benefit Centro Latino and any donation will help make an impact. Thanks in advance for your contribution to this cause that means so much to me.  More information about Centro Latino: Our Mission is to work for the inclusion of Spanish speakers in Central Kentucky communities and to work for the acces to education health-care and to advocate for social justice. Our vision is envisioning people of all backgrounds working together to build a strong economy and safe community. Our overall goal is for individuals and families to be empowered to reach their full potential.

title: COVID-19 Salviamo i cavalli del Centro Equus!
description: In Sicilia esiste un luogo dove  il bene dei cavalli  è un valore imprescindibile e il cavallo è trattato con il rispetto e con lamore che si dà ad un amico o ad un compagno di vita: è il Centro Equestre Equus.   Esso è più di un centro equestre classico: offre anche un servizio sociale indispensabile  lippoterapia per persone diversamente abili . E tutti i cavalli usati a questo scopo sono cavalli salvati da morte certa; Giuseppe Cimarosa direttore del Centro li ha riscattati da chi li aveva condannati al macello e sono diventati degli angeli per moltissimi bambini disabili che hanno trovato nel rapporto con questi animali un modo per liberarsi dallemarginazione e per valorizzare la propria diversità.  Larrivo del  Coronavirus  ha messo in ginocchio tutti anche e soprattutto il Centro Equus le cui attività sono sospese da settimane ma non così le prime necessità dei cavalli! Le risorse economiche ormai scarseggiano Giuseppe è rimasto solo a prendersi cura di questi cavalli dolci e pazienti che  rischiano di morire di fame.      Aiutiamoli con una donazione per garantire il cibo e le cure veterinarie necessarie! Con la cifra che ci prefiggiamo come obiettivo possiamo sostenere le spese necessarie per 10 cavalli per 3 mesi.      https://www.facebook.com/centrodiequitazione.equus/?__tn__=%2Cd%2CP-R eid=ARBGRaXPP7jo-R8pOoq6APGd6BsCOXIFeGWo_VOeqD78v6ATOo9n4GK1MNtThYlzp26-FQ5hZefjvA-C      http://www.teatroequestrecimarosa.it/it/centro-equitazione-equus

title: Captain Cookie Employee  Relief Fund
description: Captain Cookie   the Milkman is proud to to be built on a team of truly amazing people. Theyre committed to delivering the best possible customer experience and baking the perfect cookie every time. Right now through no fault of their own our beloved cookie crew is really hurting. COVID-19 has hit the service industry very hard and very quickly. We love our staff and are taking every possible step in our power to see that they are protected during this time. So we ask you our loyal fans and customers if youd be willing to be part of our staffs support network now.    As we are sure everyone is aware food and beverage establishments have been ordered to switch to takeout and delivery models during this time. We absolutely support these public health measures but the reality of so many of our customers leaving the area (students have been sent home and professionals are working remotely) is a massive decrease in orders for our establishments. Inevitably weve been forced to cut hours for many of our folks and furlough others entirely.    Though we appreciate the citys effort to extend unemployment benefits for these folks that process takes time and replaces only a portion of the previously earned income.    Your support in whatever amount you can give will help our staff feed their families keep the lights on and pay rent until things get back to normal and we can bring everyone back to work. From the bottom of our hearts we appreciate any assistance you choose to provide to show your appreciation of these folks who come to work to make the world a better place every day.   #SmallBusinessRelief  *Note: all funds contributed here will be given to our staff proportionately to lost income.

title: The Rail Athens COVID-19 Tip Jar
description: Alright yall.   After many suggestions from our regulars and much consideration the time has come for me to open up a GoFundMe account to try and provide for my employees and myself the best way that I possibly can. Our staff will be out of work for three weeks maybe longer. We tried to stay open as long as we could so that our staff could earn enough cushion as possible but unfortunately it just will not be enough.  Weve heard time and again just how wild incredible and unprecedented this virus is. It has left us struggling confused and unsure of how we will make ends meet for now. I wish that there were endless funds available to support my very special hardworking and lovable staff--there just isnt.   We do however have the best customers and regulars in the world who genuinely care about the health and well being of my staff and myself. So many have already reached out to me wondering what they could do and how they can help. Thank you thank you thank you.  Time and again we have come together to make things happen and help out when and where we can. It has always touched my heart put a smile on my face and left me knowing that the bad in the world does not overtake the good.   So here I am humbly asking for your support and generosity. It is the last thing I know to do to keep my Rail family afloat.   We are starting off with a goal of $1000 to be split between our staff according to their normal hours. If we reach this goal we will bump it up but want to make sure that our goals are reasonable and attainable.  Thank-you in advance and always for your continuous kindness love support and patronage. We will keep all of you in mind and cant wait to throw down with you for our re-opening and my ten year anniversary party.   We will come back stronger and better than ever when this ends. In the mean time we will work together and I will do what I can to support the people who make The Rail Athens what it is. Thats a promise.   With gratitude  Sandi Teet

title: Support Copper Mine Brewing Co through COVID-19
description: On March 17th Bars and restaurants across Tucson were ordered to close their doors to in-store patrons and only serve to-go orders to help promote social distancing and prevent the spread of COVID-19.  This included our favorite brewery in Tucson Copper Mine Brewing Company.  As patronage has slowed they like many others were forced to reduce their hours of operation to just 3 hours a day.  As a result theyre struggling to pay their employees and their bills.  Please help support this amazing crew get through this unimaginably difficult time.  Your donation will ensure that their employees continue to get paid and the worlds greatest beer keeps flowing.  @copperminebrew   #KeepCopperMineAlive

title: COVID-19 Relief Fund for BierWax Staff
description: COVID-19 has impacted so many communities across the globe.  In NYC restaurants and bars are reeling from the recent mandates.  Like countless others  we had to make the difficult decision to lay off our entire staff.  Many of our incredible bartenders are dependent on BierWax and other service industry jobs to pay bills and survive in NYC.  Now that we can no longer support them financially we are asking for your help!   We ask that our generous BierWax community consider adding funds into a tip jar for our bartenders during this very challenging time. Many of you have asked how to support and this is a very important way to support the individuals who were so vital to our success over the past 2+ years.  100% of the funds raised will go to our most recent staff members. We will be making the first contribution to the Relief Fund and hope you can join us in supporting.     Thanks for your continued patronage and support!

title: HSC COVID-19 Relief Fund for Our Staff
description: We are Hyper Strength   Conditioning a small gym in San Jose CA where we turn nerds into superheroes!   In 2015 we started from nothing bought used equipment on craigslist and earned our members one session at a time.   In 2020 we grew to a company that has 7 staff members who thrive each day coaching 100+ members to level up their lives.   and then....BAM!  Due to COVID-19 and the priority of keeping our members and their loved ones safe we had to close our doors until further notice and not be able to provide certain levels of service our membership is used to.   A huge part of why we were able to thrive as a small business for 4+ years is because of our All-Star Coaching Staff.   However when our coaches arent teaching classes or coaching clients physically its felt financially.   We are doing everything we can to make sure we are pushing forward and keeping our staff a float;  servicing our clients through remote coaching hosting live workout classes and checking in with each of our members to see what other ways we can best serve them and provide value while keeping their membership dues uninterrupted.   I also cut my own salary by half to make sure we are using every part of our resources to take care of the team that takes care of our community.   This fund is to assist us in making sure we are paying them close to 100% of their wages during this time of uncertainty.    Every dollar will go towards the budget of paying our staff during the duration of being physically closed.   We truly dont know how long this will last and we are preparing for the long haul.  One of the ways that will help us get through this is making sure our team is taken care of.   We appreciate any support you can give us even just by sharing this post to your inner circle who deem us worthy of a quick level up!   Lets go beyond together! #hscsquad

title: Mariana Corona Virus
description: I was laid off due to the Corona virus. After being in palisades and meeting so many wonderful people at Cornell I am asking for whatever help you can assist with. I have my mom here from Colombia and Im the sole income provider. Will need the money to make car payments rent and food until all this  is over. I dont want to lose everything.  If you can help with a job that would be great as well. I dont know what else to do.   Thank you and God bless

title: COVID19 - PHILIPPINES
description: Hello  I want to reach out to our brothers sisters friends and benefactors in North America and other countries. I appeal to your good heart and to your benevolence. I believe all of us understand the dire situation in our old country and want to help. The front line health workers are the most in need of support. We can take care of them as they take care of us.  UP APO AA is currently involved in emergency service projects like procurement and distribution of PPEs to 5 hospitals. Other projects are also being contemplated.   Our association had initially remitted $1000 from the foundation funds but much is still needed. We are well too aware of the dire conditions in the Phils and whatever financial assistance each one of us can provide will go a long way.  SERVICE TO THE COMMUNITY SERVICE TO THE NATION  Maraming salamat po!  Danny Ang APO ETAANA President 2020-21 Eta 79-C

title: Help Zimbabwean families during COVID-19 lockdown
description: The govt of Zimbabwe has put a directive with measures to fight Coronavirus (COVID-19). Some of the measures include closure of all borders to human traffic (except for returning residents) and instruction to  stay at home and only essential travel is permitted . These are very commendable measures and our best chance at winning this war against the virus considering our limited medical resources.     However Zimbabwes current economic performance and dependence on the informal market sector will make the implementation of the anti-coronavirus lockdowns seen in countries such as China and the West a huge challenge. According to data from The World Bank  extreme poverty in Zimbabwe was estimated to have risen from 28% in 2018 to 34% in 2019 and this is was an increase from 4.7 million people to 5.7 million people living under extreme poverty . This has been due to several factors such as sharp rise in prices of food and huge reduction of agricultural production which was caused by the El Nino induced drought. Additionally Zimbabwe was recently hit by Cyclone Idai which affected 3 major provinces that account for almost 30% of the agricultural output of country.     Zimbabwe is in a situation where voluntary isolation or shutting down of cities will almost be impossible because majority of the people are informally employed and  they depend on daily earnings for survival.  The  lack of paid time off sick pay or safety net  for the majority of Zimbabweans will weaken the quarantine measures imposed by the govt and make it challenging to convince people to stay at home.     This is a time when our STRENGTH and SOLIDARITY as a country is being challenged and I believe we are capable of rising above this trying time.  I am kindly asking all Zimbabweans across all corners of the country and the world to help in supporting some of our fellow citizens who cannot afford to stockpile essential food during the Quarantine or Isolation period.       I am personally pledging ZWL 8200 to buy essential food such as mealie-meal and cooking oil for 25 Zimbabwean families that are struggling during this tough time.              You can reach me on this WhatsApp: +1650-850-9195

title: COVID-19: PW Residents Need Our Help NOW
description: So many people are asking how they can help their Port Washington neighbors most in need.  Contributions to the  Port Washington  COVID-19 Community Response Fund  will allow us to rapidly give out  flexible resources for food needs housing costs and other expenses related to COVID-19.   We are making  COVID-19 emergency grants  to existing community and faith-based organizations that have strong experience supporting local families particularly those that are disproportionately affected by this global pandemic and its economic consequences including our frail home-bound senior citizens.  100% of GoFundMe donations received by the Community Chest will be distributed to organizations helping Port Washington residents.  This GoFundMe campaign is a  Certified Charity Campaign  and donations to it are tax deductible.  Your receipt will be from FirstGiving (GoFundMes charity partner).  The optional tip can be changed to 0.  GoFundMe is a free platform and uses the tip for costs.  The  Community Chest of Port Washington   is a not-for-profit organization established in 1949 to raise funds for distribution to local charities dedicated to improving peoples lives. Community Chest funds support these charities programs in Port Washington including services for children seniors families and everyone in our community exemplifying the spirit of The People of Port Helping the People of Port.
