title: Covid 19 Relief - Malaysian Students in UK & Eire
description: On the 11th March 2020 the World Health Organisation (WHO) had characterised the Covid-19 outbreak as a pandemic. In light of the Covid-19 outbreak this unprecedented situation has created a challenging and stressful period to Malaysian students in the UK and Ireland collectively due to the uncertainties pertaining to the situation. A vast majority of students cannot afford one-way trips from the UK/Ireland to Malaysia under the current average prices across different airlines. The cost of those flights back to Malaysia will place a significant financial burden on the students.   The Covid-19 pandemic has come abruptly at an extremely frustrating time. For Malaysian students in the UK and Ireland this has come in the midst of ongoing seminars and lectures a few months prior to summer examination and graduation. With the total number of cases in the United Kingdom rising beyond 8000 majority if not all universities have allowed and advised international students to head back home.   However for some Malaysian students a flight back home is a luxury they simply cannot afford potentially leaving them stranded. Based on a welfare aid scheme survey distributed by UKEC we have gathered that some of the applicants who are in financial predicaments have family members with pre-existing health conditions and are in urgent need to return home; a few who have lost their part-time job in the UK and Ireland and can no longer support their tuition and rental fees resulting in them being evicted from their accommodation; some whose parents have lost their jobs as a result of this pandemic and others who simply cannot afford to pay for the ridiculously priced flights (150-300% price hike) back home.  In collaboration with KPUM GenCorporate KBR EMAN UKE BPN UK MPUK The Kalsom Movement The Charisma Movement and The Hubb Movement we are launching this peer-to-peer crowdfunding campaign to help raise money and provide welfare assistance in the form of a partial subsidy to those who have been enduring hard times amidst this outbreak. Funds raised will be directed to help 25 severely affected students filtered from a pool of 195 applicants. We are aiming to raise £5000 in total by the 1st of April 2020 to help aid the deserving students who are stranded in the UK and Ireland to relieve their plights. Nevertheless we would like note that even with the partial subsidy some of the recipients may still struggle to purchase a flight ticket to return home. Therefore the received aids are permitted to be used in other areas of necessities such as rent-paying or buying food supplies. The list of recipients are stated below:  1. Tan Ai Shern (University of Nottingham) 2. Su Yi Low (Swansea University) 3. Reenadesh Kaur (Aberystwyth University) 4. Syahmi Izzuddin Samsudin (University of Manchester) 5. Edmund How (Plymouth University) 6. Ainul Nadirah Izaharuddin (University of Glasgow) 7. Ng Wei Jie (University of Southampton) 8. Lynn Chiam Hui Theen (Letterkenny Institute of Technology) 9. Ian Chiam (Limerick Institute of Technology) 10. Ong Zhen Jin (University of Sunderland) 11. Wan Hua Teoh (City University of London) 12. Wan Yi Teoh (University of Liverpool) 13. Connie Ho (University of Leeds) 14. Pei Xuan Chan (Birmingham City University) 15. Cheah Shu Wei (University of Surrey) 16. Benjamin Koo Wei Jie (University of Manchester) 17. Wan Jamilah binti Hj Wan Yussof (Dublin Business School) 18. Devanesh Gunasingam (University of Dundee) 19. Daniel Chung Jau Ying (University of Southampton) 20. Michelle Tiong Mei Zhen (Queens University Belfast) 21. Muhamad Haziq Bin Abdul Hadi (University of Edinburgh) 22. Choong Shu Wan (City Law School) 23. Low Sze Ling (University of Manchester) 24. Marzarith Sofea (University of Essex) 25. Lyana binti Norhan (University of Strathclyde)   Extra funds raised will be donated to other NGOs fighting for the same cause. Lets extend our thoughts and assistance to those in need during these tough times together! #kitajagakita     * UKEC - an acronym for the United Kingdom and Eire (Ireland) Council for Malaysian Students is a non-profit student organisation that acts as the umbrella body and national coalition of all Malaysian student societies across the United Kingdom and Ireland. Currently over 79 Malaysian societies are its constituent members with UKEC serving as an integral platform representing the collective interests of over 18000 Malaysian students in the UK and Ireland. Our mission is to contribute towards nation building by championing student activism and looking out for the welfare of our students.  ** UKEC will transfer the financial aid to the recipients listed above through its UK bank account in advance of drawing out the donations raised via this Gofundme campaign due to its ability to rollover larger monetary amounts. UKECs Treasury Office has also authorised Christopher Lim Khai Min the Vice-Chairperson of UKECatalyst to withdraw the donations upon the campaigns conclusion. All donations shall be strictly channeled towards the financial assistance programme (additional funds raised will be donated to other NGOs fighting for the same cause).

title: pushups for corona virus
description: Want to join me in making a difference? Im raising money to benefit Canadian Red Cross and any donation will help make an impact. For every one dollar donated here I will being doing one pushup on ig live

title: Fondo alimentare-farmaceutico emergenza covid-19
description: Raccolta  fondo  alimentare-farmaceutico  per  persone  o  famiglie bisognose  emergenza  covid-19 IL ricavato  verrà devoluto  al  Comune  di  San lucido  ufficio  Servizi Sociali

title: Support Young People in Galashiels during Covid-19
description: TD1 Youth Hub   During the Coronavirus crisis TD1 Youth Hub are continuing to provide a vital service delivering food art   craft boxes support for mobile phone top ups support for gas/electric top ups to young people and their families.  This crisis is affecting everyone however we know that some are struggling more than others and it is those we want to help.  We have already spent over £500 of our own money providing supports to these groups we cant sustain this for the weeks and months ahead so we are asking for your help. But only if you can.  We know our community and we are making this support immediate access and on the basis of trust. We dont need evidence to know who needs support so we can provide it easier and quicker.

title: Ayuda al Hospital de Getafe contra el COVID-19
description: El mundo entero vive momentos complicados a consecuencia del COVID-19 y por desgracia Madrid es donde se reúnen la mayoría de casos en España. Los hospitales están saturados y sufren la falta de material imprescindible para luchar contra el virus. Entre ellos el Hospital de Getafe. La situación es conocida por todos: UCIs improvisadas chubasqueros bolsas de plástico esparadrapo... Ante la falta de EPIS los enfermeros tienen que utilizar lo que tienen a mano para crear su propia vestimenta. Por esta razón queremos lanzar un crowdfunding cuyos fondos irán destinados a ofrecer soporte al Hospital Universitario de Getafe  para  que puedan contar con más material y más equipos. Somos Alicia Bermúdez Alicia Velilla y Vicente Domínguez. Tres amigos que tras experiencias de familiares y amigos que trabajan en el Hospital decidimos unirnos para crear esta iniciativa.  Estamos en contacto directo con el hospital para que nos informen sobre el material necesario para la protección tanto del personal como de los pacientes. Y sobre todo hacerlo de forma segura y eficaz. Nuestro fin es recaudar la mayor cantidad posible de dinero para comprar recursos y donarlos al hospital. Recalcamos como hemos hecho hasta ahora que no sabemos exactamente qué va a pedirnos el hospital: mascarillas guantes... Cualquier ayuda que necesiten se la daremos.Una pequeña donación puede marcar la diferencia. Ahora más que nunca todos podemos ayudar.   DONA Y COMPARTE. ¡Gracias de corazón!

title: Support Ethiopia against Covid19
description: My name is Kinfe (Babi) Tesfaye and I am from ethiopia but live in Stockholm Sweden. My wife is a medical doctor and together we want to raise funds to buy PPE (personal protection equipment) for medical health professionals in Addis Ababa.   We will make our primary donation in form of purchased PPE to the staff of Tikur Anbessa/ Black lion university hospital. If we can reach beyond our goal we will also make donations to rural hospitals where the demand is highest.   Personal protection equipment which we are focusing on allocating is FFP3/FFP2 masks long sleeved gown and safe waste bags.   The number of PPE be  strictly correlated to the total funding raised. We are paying for transportation and packing ourselves so that all of the donations will be used to purchasing equipment.   Thank you for all your help! Together against covid19!

title: The Wonder Kid Project: GUAM COVID-19 Relief
description: BACKGROUND   Over the past weeks Guam has experienced major lifestyle changes due to COVID-19 from abrupt cancellations of work/schools to rush purchases of food and supplies. While many of us have the affordability to stay at home unfortunately there exist a large number who have to make daily sacrifices to make ends meet-- such as our frontliners and families facing extreme poverty. And this is where YOUR HELP comes in. The more we can donate the more days we can sustain the project.     PURPOSE  This is a crowd funding project for our local community on Guam who are heavily affected by the COVID-19 pandemic. And through your generosity you can provide for the purchases of supplies like masks disinfectants PPEs and food.    Our current beneficiaries include:   1. Guam Memorial Hospital -Funds gathered will be donated to assist our local doctors nurses and GMH staff.  2. Harvest House Guam -Donated funds will be utilized to assist the purchases of foster kids food and supplies.  3. St. Dominics Senior Home  -Donated funds will be utilized to assist St. Dominics seniors staff and volunteers.  4. Any family seeking assistance (For families seeking assistance feel free to email us at   info.thewonderkidproject@gmail.com )    TERMS AND CONDITIONS  All gathered monetary donations from you will be allotted solely to the listed beneficiaries. Donations and funding breakdown will be posted at all times for transparency. For the safety of everyone  only e-wallet transactions are being accepted.   By making a donation to this campaign you understand that your donation is going towards the beneficiaries listed above. You understand that your gift to The Wonder Kid Project becomes property of The Wonder Kid Project and that The Wonder Kid Project has ultimate control authority and discretion with regard to its assets. Beneficiary donation breakdown may change depending on the number of families and/or organizations seeking assistance. You understand all changes donations funding and transactions will remain transparent at all times.  We thank you for extending your help in these trying times! Every amount is a big help to those in need. Keep safe everyone! Thank you!  For more information feel free to contact us at  info.thewonderkidproject@gmail.com.  Follow us on Facebook and Instagram: @thewonderkidproject    WHO WE ARE: THE WONDER KID PROJECT TEAM   The Wonder Kid Project Team  is a collective of six undergraduate students on Guam and the US mainland working towards serving our local island community during vulnerable situations.  With COVID-19 taking a large toll on Guams healthcare system and affecting the lives of many the team has figured that this would be a great first start-up project in getting our mission towards helping our island community.   The Wonder Kid Project Team:  1. Eries Jay D. Moreno Project Coordinator  2. GenaraAnjulie Montevirgen Finance and Logistics  3. Maria Seanna Minas Family Assistance Lead  4. Alanna Gabriele Fegurgur Social Media   Engagement  5. Steven Maynard Kho Finance and Logistics  6. Keanu Ray Masga Social Media   Engagement  You can reach us through the following:  Email:  info.thewonderkidproject@gmail.com  Instagram: @thewonderkidproject Facebook: The Wonder Kid Project    FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS:  1. How will the funds be split between each beneficiary?   After all donations have been collected funds will first be allocated to families who sought for financial assistance. Once that is settled and agreed upon by the team the remainder of the donations will be divided equally amongst the rest of the listed organizations.    Example: Total Donations Collected: $2000.00  Families seeking for assistance: 4 Donation to Families: $400.00 ($100.00 per family)  Remaining Beneficiaries: 3 Donation to Organizations: $1600.00 ($533.33 per org)   2. Why is the listed beneficiary in the Donation Page under the Wonder Kid Project Team member GenaraAnjulie Montevirgen?  To manage incoming funds properly all donations will first go through our team members account. Once achieved we then proceed with organizing the funds and separating them for online transfer to each beneficiary listed. For transparency ALL receipts transactions and other actions will be made public through our updates tab.    3. Does The Wonder Kid Project Team take any portion of the proceeds obtained from this crowd-funding?  No! The Wonder Kid Project Team does not take any portion of the proceeds from this crowd-funding.  ALL of your donations will solely reach the organizations and families listed under beneficiaries.    4. Will I the donor get notifications regarding updates on the donations?   Yes! The Wonder Kid Project Team will post updates daily regarding the following:  a.  thank you messages to the donors b. receipts and transactions c. communication with the beneficiaries

title: Unical vs COVID 19
description: Unical vs Covid19 al via la raccolta fondi per sostenere i nostri ospedali   LUniversità della Calabria avvia una raccolta fondi finalizzata al potenziamento dei reparti di Malattie infettive Terapia intensiva e Rianimazione dei nostri ospedali per lacquisto di respiratori e dispositivi medici necessari per lemergenza epidemiologica. La campagna è aperta al contributo di tutti: chiediamo a docenti personale studenti dellateneo e associazioni studentesche cittadini spin-off dellUnical e aziende del territorio che da sempre dialogano con lateneo di offrire il proprio sostegno.  Ora più che mai vogliamo che si avverta forte il senso di comunità:  insieme possiamo sostenere il lavoro dei medici e del personale sanitario impegnati ogni giorno a curare e assistere i pazienti affetti da Covid-19.   Gli interventi specifici saranno concordati con le autorità sanitarie e destinati ai Centri Covid-19 del territorio a partire dallOspedale dellAnnunziata.  Verrà data rendicontazione pubblica sia dellandamento della raccolta che dellimpiego di tutti i fondi.  Dai il tuo contributo piccolo o grande che sia. Insieme tessiamo una rete di preziosa solidarietà!

title: Caretas de protección contra COVID-19
description: 800 caretas  de protección contra COVID-19   Buenos días!  Somos Mad Cut una empresa dedicada a la venta de productos de madera personalizados. Queremos poner nuestro granito de arena contra el COVID-19 ayudando a esas personas que estos días están más expuestas.   Tenemos una máquina de corte láser y con ella hemos conseguido cortar caretas de protección hechas de PET de 250 micras como las que veis en las imágenes. Las vamos a enviar a hospitales instituciones penitenciarias y otros colectivos que nos están llamando para pedirlas ya que algunos ni siquiera disponen de mascarillas.   El objetivo: recaudar 450€ para cubrir el coste de la bobina de PET y los envíos a cada centro. El trabajo de corte láser corre de nuestra cuenta.   Si conseguimos recaudar más del objetivo compraremos más material para poder aumentar el número de caretas enviadas.  Y por último si perteneces a algún colectivo o centro que necesite este tipo de caretas de protección llámanos al 652056338 o escríbenos a  holamadandcut@gmail.com.   ¡Haz tu donación y ayúdanos!

title: COmpañeros de VIDa 19 -  COVID-19
description: Hola a todos. Posiblemente este sea unos de los momentos más difíciles que nos ha tocado vivir sino el más difícil. Por ello desde diversas marcas queremos ponernos manos a la obra y aportar nuestro granito de arena .  El mundo esta en jaque a nivel social y de salud y  por desgracia España no está exenta de dicho problema. Nuestros  médicos enfermeras científicos  etc. están haciendo un  trabajo encomiable  y creemos que es nuestro momento que podemos hacer más que quedarnos en casa mirando la televisión y esperando a que pase todo.  En  Madrid  es donde está el mayor foco y por ello la  totalidad de los fondos recaudados  irán destinados a los hospitales de dicha comunidad.  En este momento es prioritario acabar con la escasez de medios materiales por eso hoy más que nunca necesitan:  Mascarillas guantes batas gafas trajes geles desinfectantes equipos de ventilación etc . Es nuestro momento para hacer algo más que esperar es el momento de apostar por los nuestros.   A veces sentimos que lo que hacemos es tan solo una gota en el mar pero el mar sería menos si le faltara una gota Madre Teresa de Calcuta.  La totalidad de los fondos irán destinados al  Hospital San Francisco de Asís.   Contacto:  Darío Vallano: 678-02-18-79 Diego López (Hospital San Francisco de Asís):  627-68-01-57  #YoMeQuedoEnCasa

title: Masks for Barcelona COVID19
description: Hello all The situation is going to get a lot worst in the next few days and I have decided to personally buy about 800 masks from China to be distributed to hospitals and elderly homes here. The masks  will be delivered directly into the central distribution center from the government. The cost is inclusive of shipping. Any amount is appreciated and I will provide the donors proof of purchase and proof of delivery.

title: Corona kann uns mal!
description: Wir bei Lemminger   Lemminger Steuerberater starten diesen Spendenaufruf weil wir Soloselbstständigen und kleinen Unternehmen helfen wollen. Solidarität in Zeiten der Corona-Krise leben möchten. Trotz aller Hilfen und Zuschüsse gibt es bei uns lokal genügend Unternehmer die trotz dieser Gelder (wenn überhaupt) um ihre Existenz kämpfen. Tatsächlich geht es hier ums nackte Überleben. Wir sitzen hier an der Quelle und seit dem Ausbruch der Corona-Krise spüren wir es täglich in zahlreichen Telefonaten und einer Flut von Mails. Verzweifelte Unternehmer die sich nicht mehr zu helfen wissen die keinen Ausweg sehen. Die nicht wissen wie es morgen weitergehen soll. Vielleicht ist es deine Lieblings-Eisdiele dein Lieblings-Restaurant dein Lieblings-Geschäft welches es sonst nach der Krise nicht mehr gibt.  Warum starten wir diesen Spendenaufruf und nicht der Unternehmer selbst?  Weil die Unternehmer selbst oftmals nicht die Möglichkeit haben einen eigenen Spendenaufruf zu starten weil sie sich nicht in Sozialen Netzwerken vertreten sind oder sich einfach nicht trauen oder schämen.   Genau diesen wollen wir hier helfen. Und du als Spender kannst dir sicher sein dieses Geld kommt bei den wirklich Bedürftigen an.  Gemeinsam sind wir stark.   CORONA kann uns mal!

title: ZIMBABWE COVID19-EOMG HOMELESS SUPPORT FUND
description: COVID19 PANDEMIC  RESPONSE TO HELP THE  HOMELESS   COVID19 is destabilising economies and threatening humankind it has been declared by World Health Organisation as a global pandemic. Zimbabwe is not spared having recorded our first case rising to 3 As we post this. We have one confirmed death and one death is already one too many. We believe the numbers are more than this and its just a matter of time before the situation explodes. Our health system is broken and definitely not ready. But again we are called to ACTION to help wherever we can. In most cases the homeless community is always ignored as already experienced. There has not been any awareness amongst this community soup kitchens around town have closed down they dont have any access to healthcare facilities. With the lockdown being effected by the government - do we even think of where they will go? What they will eat? And how will they get treated if they contract the virus.   As EatOut Movement and our big following of volunteers in Zimbabwe and globally we are stepping in to do something no matter how small.   We are asking you to please donate to our fundraising campaign WE ARE ONE! We chose this name because this disease has no boundaries race religion or status. We are in this together and lets do our best to help those most vulnerable especially the homeless.   ~We also appreciate the frontline workers they are amazing we call them angels because of the sacrifice they are putting by risking themselves. Across the world Doctors nurses have died whilst helping those affected and our team in Zimbabwe is not spared. They need protective gear essentials to use and food to eat on this time. WE ARE ONE campaign aims to provide essentials for both our the homeless community and frontline workers. ~  Food (ready to eat) Sanitizers  Gloves  Masks  Headcovers  Water Temporary Shelter for the Homeless  Others   Visit our Facebook page  for more info   https://www.facebook.com/eatoutmovement/    EatOut Movement Global is a social impact organisation dedicated to ending homelessness one life at a time both locally and globally. We are registered in Zimbabwe as EatOut Movement Trust 123/2019 and EatOut Movement Global C.I.C Reg.12016161.

title: COVID-19 3D Printing of Medical Supplies
description: With the continued spread of COVID-19 and the diminishing medical supplies that hospitals so desperately need I can start to 3D print some useful items for the benefit of those in need. I will be making respirator venturies and face shield head bands to start. As the needs for supplies evolve so will I. To increase production I will need to add more printers and buy consumables to make these items. Your generosity will help fulfill this goal. Any funds not used for this effort shall be donated to support other charitable needs. Thank you for your support!

title: BridgeBurma for COVID19
description: Please help us support Myanmar(Burma)s healthcare workers in the Coronavirus Pandemic.   The COVID19 Pandemic has wreaked havoc worldwide. Originating in Wuhan China and now spread throughout the rest of Asia Europe and the United States many first world healthcare systems have become stretched in fighting this pandemic. For low to middle-income countries the impact can be much worse.   This is why we need your help. The BridgeBurma community is a group of students from across the world who founded the platform to a supportive community of Burmese students living abroad and local people by two way job offerings freelance work project-based local training programs and pathway to global opportunities. And in the time of COVID19 we have come together to fundraise for Myanmars doctors nurses and healthcare professionals on the frontline to have sufficient protection - N95 masks and Personal Protection Equipment (PPE) as well as ordinary masks for the general public to help contain the speed of transmission and support Myanmars healthcare system.   All our proceeds will go to the Ministry of Health and Sports (MoHS) and local medical organisations such as Khit Thit Foundation (more details to follow). Every penny counts!  With Many Thanks BridgeBurma Mentors  www.bridgeburma.com     Main Photo Source: Source: Phyo Maung Maung - AFP/Getty Images

title: Tutti insieme per la croce rossa di Millesimo.
description: Ciao a tutti MillesyWoodesiin questo periodo così difficile per la nostra comunità abbiamo deciso di fare qualcosa di serio.Il team di MillesyWood nel suo piccolo ha deciso di lanciare questa raccolta fondi da donare interamente ai militi della Croce Rossa di Millesimo un piccolo grande gesto per chi ogni giorno e sul campo per garantire un servizio di vitale importanza.Abbiamo la fortuna di vivere in un paese bellissimoabitato da persone meravigliosemettiamoci una mano sul cuore e tutti insieme aiutiamo questi angeliuna piccola donazione per dare a loro la forza e a noi la speranza.Forza Millesimo!!!??

title: Twisted Roots Chicago - COVID19 Relief
description: Touch - the first sense that we acquire in life.    The power of touch and human contact is what keeps many people going daily. Its also what helps us continue building our business futures and lives.  Massage skincare and acupuncture are our passion. It is what keeps us going.  As a result of whats happening in our world today we are unable to provide for our amazing clients. Helping people manage their pain and stress and feel great has been put on hold until further notice.  Human contact has been put on hold.   Our ability to generate revenue has also been put on hold. Our rent and other business expenses have not.   -----   Twisted Roots Chicago   is a small wellness spa in Chicagos Loop and we are completely shut down for the time being.  We will be here for you when the time comes that we are able to provide you with our passion talent and magic hands but  ONLY  if we receive the financial support we need  right now .  #SmallBusinessRelief  Thank you for helping us keep our business careers and passions alive.  Warmest regards and cleanest hands Beth Owner Twisted Roots Chicago LLC      AS A THANK YOU   Donate $50-$100 and we will mail you a set of Simply Earth Essential Oils (roller and matching  bottle of oil)  Donate $100+ and we will send you a $50 gift card to use on a future service    :: All Thank You gifts will be sent out as soon as were able to safely get back into the spa. ::

title: Emergenza Covid19- Ospedale Pescara
description: L associazione di Pescara Sporting Adriatica 2012 organizzatrice di eventi sportivi  Forzapescara League  Pescara street soccercage nel territorio pescarese promuove una raccolta fondi a favore dellOspedale Santo Spirito di Pescara. Con i nostri fondi Sosterremo la   struttura sanitaria i medici gli infermieri  del reparto Covid 19 ( acquisto di mascherine ventilatori e altra attrezzatura) e tutto il personale che in questi giorni sta combattendo una durissima battaglia per curare i cittadini pescaresi e sconfiggere il virus.  Basta un piccolo contributo per dare una mano  Torneremo presto a divertirci insieme  Io Donato Giampietro  presidente dellAssociazione preleverò personalmente i fondi raccolti al termine della campagna e documenteremo il tutto  con  una rendicontazione dettagliata.

title: Cov19  Killinchy Churches Together Emergency Fund
description: The Coronavirus Covid-19 has plunged our community into difficulty and things will only get worse as the virus takes its course over the next weeks and months. We are aiming to raise £10000 to alleviate poverty and distress amongst individuals and families.   Killinchy Churches Together which includes all of the various churches in the area are responding by setting up this Fund.   It is OPEN TO ALL MEMBERS OF THE LOCAL COMMUNITY.  The area stretches from the edge of Saintfield Comber and Killyleagh to the lough shore and includes the villages of Ballygowan Killinchy Kilmood Lisbane Ardmillan and other hamlets.  We want to help people in their isolation and vulnerability  as they fight off the threat of Covid-19.   We want to support ongoing needs of people to ensure that their well being is maintained.   We want to enable people to keep warm by accessing home heating oil or warm clothes.  We want to enable  people to access a nutritious meal by connecting them to services providing groceries and/or ready made meals.  We want to enable and encourage  people to use and access technology to keep them connected to the outside world.  We want to reach out to isolated people by telephone and befriending if possible.   The United  Parish Killinchy Kilmood and Tullynakill - The Church of Ireland - Charity Number 102533    https://www.facebook.com/killinchyandkilmood/     Killinchy Non-Subscribing Presbyterian Church - The Non-Subscribing Presbyterian Church - Charity Number 101372    https://www.facebook.com/killinchynspc/     Carrickmannon Catholic Church - Catholic Church in Ireland - Charity Number 103983  http://www.downandconnor.org/parishes-ministries/parish-details/?parishID=84

title: Covid-19 Quarantine Fundraising for Devotee Family
description: Dear devotees and well-wishers.   Please accept our humble obeisances.   My name is Nimai Nitai dasa and my wife and son are Lila Nandini devi dasi and Krsna Sudham.      We have been trying to preach Sanatana Dharma (Krishna Consciousness) in the tough land of China since 2015.   We recently went to Malaysia to stay in a temple/farm with other devotees. As we came back to China we had to go through many inspections and processes to assure that we had not been infected with the Coronavirus.   Our son happened to develop a fever at the airport which led the authorities to escort us to a quarantined hospital room wherefrom I am now writing this message.   After a 24 hours wait we finally were found to not have the Coronavirus thanks to Lord Nrisimhadeva.   However we will still have to be in quarantine for another 14 days. The cost of being in quarantine in a hospital is very expensive for the following two weeks we might be quarantined in a hotel which will also be costly.  Our son only likes prasadam prepared by my wife we are now forced to eat outside food. Our son now barely eats and has lost 1.5KG. We are struggling to keep him fit and healthy.      My wife and I opened a temple in Henan province in 2017 due to my having gotten tuberculosis we had to stop our preaching activities and I soon had to find a part-time job despite my poor health conditions.    I was working part-time in a kindergarten to maintain my family. Since this Coronavirus started I didnt get any income since all schools are closed. Due to all these events we did not manage to save enough money to cope with our current situation. We are therefore humbly begging for the mercy of all who wish to help.   Thanking you very much for your kindness and praying to Sri Sri Radha Madhana Mohan to shower Their merciful glance upon you all.   Hare Krishna

title: Moonlight Vulture Cafe Support during COVID-19
description: Though vultures are incredibly resourceful there comes a time when even the most frugal birds must ask their flock members for help....  Moonlight Vulture aint too proud to beg :) If you can help us we are SO appreciative of any gift.    This fund is being setup to assist with restaurant expenses like rent utilities etc. as our business declined over 90% the first week that the COVID-19  shut down dine in business in Chicago and has not recovered.  The money donated will only be used for direct business expenses.  We have taken this week to regroup revise our menu and we expect to be open again with a more limited menu on April 1st for delivery.    More than anything we want to continue to be here for the Avondale community and create great casual dining experiences for years to come.   Weve decided not to incur more debt and are hoping were able to get through the next couple months!  Were lucky to be physically healthy and are so grateful for our community members and families during this awful time.    Thanks for thinking of us!  Adam   Alan (the workers/owners of Moonlight Vulture)   #SmallBusinessRelief

title: Help donate protective gear to COVID-19 fighters+
description: About the Organizers:  Hagen Zheng is a high school student at Newton South High School. As the COVID-19 epidemic increases its hold on the world there have been multiple social consequences that have taken place as a result. He believes that the world needs to come together so that it can fight off this adversary. Recently however the many hateful actions of violence and discrimination against the Asian American community have created a social divide in society. He is disheartened seeing the overwhelming number of such stories and knows how much fear is being stoked by these incidents.  In response he believes that being part of the solution is the best way to quash irrational beliefs and motives.  Yankun (Andy) Zhang is a high school student attending Newton South High School and the founder of the Kids and Knowledge Learning Society (KNKLS). There have been rumored cases in Newton and school has been completely canceled.  Recently at the local drug store he noticed that all the employees had different masks meaning that they were bringing masks from their OWN supply so that they can continue to work. He also noticed many people out without masks at all. He worries for those people and believes that along with professionals the average people should also receive masks.  _______________________________________________________________________________________________   We understand that there are many GoFundMe campaigns for donating masks to hospitals however we have connections to factories in China that produce high quality CE certified and FDA registered protective gear. If we get more support we would also use some of the surplus funds to donate masks to essential personnel who are not as well supported. This includes people who work in grocery stores food pantries and other food providers.   Below are the valuations for the different supplies and pictures of the products and the certificates:    $1000 + Shipping fee -  500 Goggles           $1000 + Shipping Fee -  60 Protective Gowns          $1000 + Shipping Fee -  500 KN95 masks             $1000 + Shipping Fee -  3200 regular masks

title: Dean Shore COVID-19 Relief
description: I think all Wake Forest Students whether you ever received a haircut in Dean Shores Barbershop or not would agree that Deans consistent and optimistic presence at nearly every Wake Forest event was sure to bring a smile to your face and almost certainly a new profile picture or Instagram post. His position as a campus institution was even acknowledged in Stephen Colberts 2015 commencement address.   You people also have campus traditions that are people. I want to give a shout out to Mr. Dean Shore the University barber. There he is. Right there. Dean actually contacted me first by sending me a Facebook request the minute my plane landed. He is a friend to so many students and a real throwback to a simpler time because when your biggest local celebrity is a barber youre basically a medieval village.  With the outbreak of the Coronavirus Deans income has been hit hard; March 25th marked the last day to get a haircut from Dean and business has been down since students had to leave campus.  In his own words Weve basically been out of work for the last 2 1/2 weeks. Starting today the State has closed down all barber shops for at least 1 month and it could be longer. Either way our shop is in a very different situation than other shops. Once we get the word barber shops may reopen other shops in town will have their customer base immediately returning. Its scary for our shop to think that when we reopen our true customer base may not be returning till August. Im pretty sure Wake wont have the first summer school. So even when we reopen well probably have a very small customer base....I have always counted it a blessing and a privilege to serve the students and the WFU community. The greatest benefit has been the fact I consider many of you more than customers but also friends.   If Dean Shore has a special place in your heart and you have a couple of bucks to spare please consider donating. Please pass this link along to other Wake Forest alumni friends and family who have enjoyed his haircuts photos friendship or all the above.

title: Guitar Works LTD Covid-19 Employee Relief Fund
description: Friends and fans of Guitar Works LTD we have been serving the Evanston community for over 40 years and our livelihood is being threatened by the Covid-19 virus.  It is with great humility that we ask you for help - to pay our staff pay our bills and reopen our doors once things return to normal.    We have worked hard over the years to be a staple of the community and take pride in the fact that we pay our employees a living wage and that many of them have been with us for decades.  This is something thats hard for us to ask but we feel this is necessary to stay afloat.  Were grateful for your years of support and anything you can give would be of great help and appreciation.    As thanks anyone who makes a donation of $50 or more will receive a Guitar Works T-shirt.  Donations of $100 will get you exclusive early entry into our legendary Closed Door Sale once were open again. Thank you!  #smallbusinessrelief

title: Support Studio Nails COVID-19 Relief
description: In January of 1998 Hanh (Anna) Bui moved to Connecticut to start a new life for her family. She took over Studio Nails from her sister and has been working for the past 20+ years to serve her loyal patrons and support her family. Studio Nails is truly a family business with Annas children and friends staffing the salon. In the wake of the COVID-19 pandemic Studio Nails closed it doors on March 20 2020 until further notice from the Connecticut governor. With the loss of business the salon will not be able to cover its rent and business expenses. Full-time employees also lose their means of supporting their family and livelihood. GoFundMe Yelp and Intuit Quickbooks have collaborated to launch the #SmallBusinessRelief Initiative. Please help Studio Nails reach our goal of $500 which will make us eligible to receive an additional $500 grant from the initiative. Studio Nails would like to thank the town of South Windsor and the Greater Hartford Area for your support and for allowing us to be a part of your wonderful community for the past 20+ years.

title: Support the NHS through COVID-19
description: NHS Charities COVID-19 Urgent Appeal   Our amazing NHS staff and volunteers are working tirelessly to care for COVID-19 patients. We are so proud and in awe of the NHS staff and volunteers as they work tirelessly to save lives! This means staying away from their homes and families working day and night to treat as many people in need of care.  Help them help us before its too late! Lets show our gratitude and respect for the frontline NHS and together beat this virus.  Donations will go direct to support;  1) Funding well-being packs/gifts for staff and volunteers on wards/departments  2) Cost of travel parking accommodation for NHS stand and volunteer expenses  3) Other items as requested by the NHS Charities that enhance the well-being of NHS staff and volunteers caring for COVID-19 patients.  Thank you in advance.

title: A gift for Addenbrookes staff during Covid-19
description: Hi everyone. All of us at Cambridge Crepes hope you and your families are managing to keep safe and well.  We would like your support in helping the frontline workers at Addenbrookes Hospital during these tough times so today we are launching our GoFundMe appeal.  Having recently closed our business for 3 months to help contain the spread of Covid-19 we wanted to find a way to support the amazing doctors and nurses working at Addenbrookes who we regularly see at our food truck in town.  So today we are launching the Cambridge Crepes VIRTUAL CREPE STORE!!   Every penny raised will be given to the Addenbrookes nurses and doctors (via the Addenbrookes Hospital Charitable Trust) in the form of vouchers to use at Cambridge Crepes as soon as we are open again. Every little helps at times like this and we hope this small gesture will help show  how much we all appreciate them.   We have started the ball rolling by donating £500 of VIRTUAL CREPES ourselves and would love you to help us reach our target of £1000. Simply purchase a VIRTUAL CREPE or simply make a monetary donation instead. 100% of everything received will be going to the hospital workers.  The COVID-19 pandemic has hit everyone hard but please spare a thought for the Addenbrookes staff that are currently working night and day to keep us all safe and well. Hopefully we can put a smile on their faces.   PLEASE SHARE THIS LINK WITH YOUR FRIENDS AND FAMILY SO WE CAN GENERATE AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE FOR OUR AMAZING NHS.   This is our virtual cafe menu so please select your favourite crepe(s) or simply donate what you wish. Thank you!  1 x Lemon   Sugar = £2.50 donation  2 x Dark Belgian Choc = £5.00 donation 3 x Nutella Banana = £7.50 donation 4 x Strawberries White Choc = £10.00 donation  Or any donation from £1.00.

title: Nagi Hair COVID-19 relief fund
description: *??????????????????   Hello.  My name is Kei Sadayasu owner of NAGIHAIR  Currently in New York where the company is located the influence of the new coronavirus has resulted in a temporary  store closing order effective March 22.  Our job is salon work  While closed sales are completely lost.  And we have no idea when we can resume business.  We have also applied for financial support from small businesses of NY City.  There is support from the federal government but at this time The guarantee from the government is not clear for staff working as a foreigners in a Japanese company.  Now I cant do this job  I want to keep the salon alive no matter what for the shop and the staff and family who work for it.  Since opening NAGIHAIR in 2016 we have managed to get here thanks to our customers and various people.  The number of new friends has increased and we want to make more customers happy.  Any help donation or share this link would be very helpful.  Thank you for your cooperation and support.  Kei Sadayasu Nagi Hair  280 Mulberry street NY10012    https://nagihairny.com/     ??????NAGIHAIR????????????  ????????????????????????????  3/22?????????????????????????????  ????????????????  ???????????????????????  ???????????????????????????  ???????????????  ?????????????????????????????????????????  ??????????????????  ???????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????  2016??NAGIHAIR???????????????????????????????????????  ??????????????????????????????????????????  ??????????????????????????????????????????  ???????????????????  ?? ? Nagi Hair  280 Mulberry street NY10012

title: Support The Nest through COVID-19 Closures
description: Like the rest of the small businesses in our area and around the world I have closed to try to slow the spread of COVID-19. Small local businesses dont have the resources that bigger corporations have to weather storms like these but we are feisty!   GoFundMe has teamed with Yelp Intuit and Quickbooks to match donations up to $500 until their grants are depleted.    Now its not my style to ask for a handout so whatever amount you donate here I will honor as a gift certificate  to be used for inventory at the shop when Im able to open or through my online store. Please be sure to leave your name and a way for me to contact you so that I can fulfill my end of the bargain!   Thanks in advance for supporting the small local businesses that form the distinct fabric of our community!   #SmallBusinessRelief

title: Whistle Punk Covid-19#SmallBusinessRelief
description: Just as many restaurants and small businesses we have had to close our doors for an indefinite amount of time as we wait for this to pass.  While we love our sleepy little town nestled in the mountains of WV it comes with its own set of challenges. The winter months are much slower for us our business was just ramping up with spring weather so this closure comes at a terrible time.    We are raising money to help with expenses to be matched with the generous grants and support from Yelp Go Fund Me and intuit.  If you can donate we appreciate your help if not we get it.    Above all use this time as a reflection on how you shop and eat support small businesses and local food economies as best you can.    Update: our friend and artist Chet Lowther is going to donate a matted photo print of Richwood to anyone who donates $50 or more to help us reach our goal. We appreciate his kindness and support.   #SmallBusinessRelief    Stay safe be kind!

title: Green Shorts Covid-19 Challenge
description: Green Shorts COVID-19 Challenge Over the years it has been our pleasure to dive with Ocean Frontiers and stay at Compass Point. We have come to feel as if each member of the staff is part of our family. They have watched out for us and kept us safe. Now its our turn to make sure they are safe. During the COVID-19 pandemic our Ocean Frontier family members are facing uncertainty. Tourism on the island has been halted indefinitely. The company hopes to pay staff but with the very recent lock down things are even more uncertain.  As repeat guests we know that the staff relies on tips as well as their wages to cover their day to day living expenses.   It is with this in mind we ask those of you that have enjoyed the care humor and efforts of the OF staff help make up for the loss of those tips and potential unemployment.  All the money raised will be divided equally between current staff of Ocean Frontiers and Compass Point. If there are funds that are not accepted or needed these will be placed in a hurricane fund. These are unstable economic times.  If we can all pitch in a little it will mean so much for all. With some compassion we can all make it through.  Wishing clean hands calm seas and bubbles as soon as possible. PS Theres no shorts at the end of this challenge only the good feeling you will get from helping others.

title: Slackers COVID-19 Relief
description: Effective 3/18/20 – Considering the Coronavirus pandemic the Mayor of San Antonio has decided to shut down the bars for 30 days. While this is a commendable step toward the protection of health and safety of the citizens the financial security of the workers has taken a big hit. Needless to say that the staff members that have been behind the running of Slackers are left to pay the immediate price. Many of our workers were relying on the income that was going to come from St. Patricks Day and other upcoming events.  This brings us to announce a fundraiser program for the laid-off workers by the name ‘Gofoundme. It is a humble effort to try to get them enough money to buy grocery pay rent and fulfill other necessities until the Coronavirus pandemic winds down. We want to make it clear that it is for the helpless workers who are facing financial woes in these challenging times and NOT for the stable business owners.     While monetary assistance from the state is inevitable it will not be nearly enough for the workers to survive the lockdown period. Slackers management respects and is deeply grateful for the workers to have played their parts in making the bar a big hit. It is because of them that we have been able to expand our business to three locations with the fourth one already on the way. Many of the girls who currently work at the parent outlet have been with us since the first day of the launch while several others joined the family along the way.        With all of this extra time in quarantine to ponder we hope that youll find it in you to take a moment to think about these bar workers and their families. Lets spend a moment to reflect on some of the best memories that you have shared with your favorite bartender. As you dig into your virtual pocket and toss a crumpled bill or two across the pine this little effort would mean the world to the workers in need.   That being said we assure you that 100% of the proceeds of this fundraiser will be divided among our very close-knit staff members in order to help them get through these difficult times. Thank you in advance for your compassion and support.

Covid-19 ???????? ???? ????????? ???????? ??? ????????? ???????? ??? ?? ????? ???????? ???????? ???????. ?????? ???????? ???????? ???? ?????????? ?? ???????????? ????????? ????? ?????? ???????? ??? ????? ?????????? ? ???????? ????????? ??? ?? ??? ??? ???????? ???????. ?? ??? ???? ?????? ???????? ??????????? ?????????? ?? ????? ?????? ??? ?? ????? ??????? ?? ???? ????????? ?????.   We appeal to all indifferent people who are abroad. Due to the very difficult situation in our Monastyrysky district today - the rapid spread of Covid-19 your financial assistance is needed for the purchase of IVL devices and other protective medical equipment. It is a great request to show your consciousness and not indifference to help our relatives fellow countrymen who are again left with a terrible epidemic face to face without the help of the government. Once again a very big request to get involved in the fundraising as much as possible every minute for the weight of human life.

title: Support Pinewood Kennels #SmallBusinessRelief
description: In 2017 my family and I reopened Pinewood Kennels in Breckenridge MN. Our dream was to have a family friendly hobby farm and kennel business. We allow community members and groups to visit the kennel and farm including summer school and youth groups. The past two years have been extremely successful! The kennel has been busy and people love bringing their young kids to visit with the animals! We have also rescued and successfully rehomed several dogs....we even kept a few rescue animals ourselves.   COVID-19 has hit us hard as the majority of our business was kenneling dogs while people are at work or vacation. We went from housing 20+ dogs  every day to one or two.   Being located in a small community we strive to be affordable and flexible for our customers. The majority of our profits have gone to major improvements in the buildings such a new heating/cooling to keep the dogs more comfortable and increase air circulation.   We are not looking to make money off this campaign but rather to stay afloat during this uncertain time. The cost of maintenance and heating the kennel alone is around $1000/month.  The funds raised will be used to maintain the kennel buildings while our income has slowed down excess funds will be put back into the kennel for more improvements.   Our family would be very grateful for any donation no matter how small. We want to keep our dream alive and still be in business after this pandemic is over.  Go fund me and Intuit have started a #SmallBusinessRelief initiative to match donations for businesses that raise at least $500. Thank you to everyone that got us there!

title: Save the Creative Labs from COVID-19
description: Hey there Brandon here! I hope you are staying safe during this unprecedented event in our modern history. It is only through our vigilance and discipline that we can halt the spread. Because of the nature of this pandemic and safety guidelines laid out by the CDC we are indefinitely closed for events. The problem with this beyond the fact that we miss you is that events represent a significant portion of the labs income. In addition the money generated by the events goes towards subsidizing the rent for our resident artists.  That is why WE NEED YOUR HELP!        If you are a fan of the Labs a patron of the arts or just a fan of the DIY Baltimore Scene please consider supporting us in our campaign. Our goal if reached will go directly towards our operations costs. These total about 10000 per month so this would represent 2.5 months of breathing room for us to come up with some new ways to support the artists of Baltimore.        This virus will only be around for a matter of months whereas we intend to be here for the duration of our 14 year lease and would hate to lose such an important fixture of the Baltimore art scene.   HELP THE CREATIVE LABS OUTLAST THE CORONAVIRUS TODAY!  If you are not familiar with the labs please check us out  here  !

title: Airbnb For Homeless Families During COVID-19
description: Philadelphia is in a state of emergency. There are NO shelter beds available for families in the entire region.  Please donate for AirBNB stays so these babies and their parents have someplace safe to sleep during this pandemic.   More information about Student-Run Emergency Housing Unit of Philadelphia: SREHUP works to end homelessness for people and their pets. We provide housing and the services and community that people need to thrive.

title: Covid19 - Rufino García
description: Voy a intentar pinchar en Directo en mi perfil de instagram ( Rufino Garcia ) durante 24h seguidas para recaudar dinero para comprar material medico que se necesite el hospital Vva - Don Benito con respecto al Covid 19 Gracias a todos ??

title: American Sandwich Impacted by COVID-19
description: My name is Jaemin Hwang and I am raising money on behalf of my parents small business.  Since 2006 my parents have operated American Sandwich  located off of Campbellton Road in Southwest Atlanta.   In the past 14 years they have managed to make it through the recession foundation issues with the  restaurant and multiple robberies-now they face the trickling economic effects of the global  pandemic.  My parents like many other restaurant owners at  this time are struggling to keep their doors open.  As the infection rate in Atlanta continues to grow exponentially and city restrictions become tighter my parents will be forced to close their doors soon.   I know this is a difficult time for everyone and if you are unable to donate I ask that you please share this with your friends and family. If we are able to  raise a minimum of $500 GoFundMe will match a $500 grant. So please help us get to $500!   The money that is raised will go toward paying  employees restaurant supplies and rent.   Thank you once again for all of your help.  #SmallBusinessRelief

title: Covid-19 shut down
description: In the last month my salon has been shut down due to covid 19. I will be out of work for  a month as of April 6th. Ive had to cancel over 56 clients with most of those being chemical services. Im not asking for help to get what Ive lost in wages. This will go towards personal bills and for the business bills. Im not one to ask for help EVER.  After brain surgeryunexpected death in our family and now this. Ive had a lot of time Ive had to be out of work. I had money put away to cover my time out after brain surgery. Now with an additional month and possibly longer shut down Im draining my accounts.  So please dont feel like you have to donate. A simple share would be nice! Anything will heIp. If I get more then what I asked for I will be donating it to the other girls in the shop to help them out. They are both single and one is a single mom of two kids. This has really affected us having to close the doors to help stop the spreading of the covid 19 virus. Thank yall for your support. Stay safe and God bless.

title: Covid19 Diamo respiro alla Sanità tarantina
description: Lemergenza Coronavirus oggi vera e propria pandemia che lItalia sta affrontando con grande coraggio e tenacia e che abbraccia ormai il mondo “tutto” ci richiama ad una corresponsabilità dalla quale non possiamo esimerci. Come donne come cittadine come parte attiva di una società in evidente sofferenza.  Per questo motivo abbiamo creato la campagna di raccolta fondi:   “COVID 19 - diamo respiro alla sanità tarantina” che mira ad acquistare apparecchiature utili per lOspedale Moscati Hub di riferimento della ASL Taranto.   Il metodo scelto è quello della raccolta attraverso il GoFundMe con versamento libero e con obiettivo di 15.000 euro. Aiutaci ad aiutare! Abbiamo visto quanto la sanità settentrionale ed in particolare quella lombarda allavanguardia e molto ben strutturata stia soffrendo per il numero troppo alto di richieste di posti letto nelle terapie intensive. Attraverso questa pagina a cui spero tu vorrai contribuire anche con consigli e condivisione degli obiettivi vogliamo aiutare il reparto di Terapia Intensiva.   Pe me per te per i nostri cari. Grazie!

title: Help Common Ground Battle  COVID-19
description: Common Ground continues to provide 24-hour crisis services to the public during the COVID-19 pandemic. Dedicated to helping runaway and homeless youth victims of crime people with mental illness adults and others in critical situations Common Ground has become a lifeline for Oakland and Genesee County residents.   Michigans Gov. Gretchen Whitmer signed an executive order effective on March 24th ordering non-essential businesses to temporarily close and Michiganders to stay at home in response to the spread of the novel coronavirus and its related disease COVID-19 effective through April 13. Common Ground is deemed as an essential business which means we will continue to serve the public during these uncertain times. To help us keep our employees and those we serve safe we need your help!  As we continue to serve more people our supply of Personal Protection Equipment (PPE) decreases. If youre able to spare as little as $5 please consider donating to Common Ground your donation can help us purchase necessary items such as sanitizers wipes gloves etc. The more were able to protect our employees the more we will be able to serve. Thank you for your support!  #SmallBusinessRelief

title: Art Bags for students during COVID-19
description: The Eastern Iowa Arts Academy is a non-profit in Cedar Rapids IA. We are currently collecting donations to help purchase supplies for art bags that will be given to K-12 students at no cost. The bags will contain items such as paint canvas and drawing supplies in hopes of keeping their creativity flowing during such a trying time in our country and around the world. We started with 20 bags that were funded by a grant from the Variety - The Childrens Charity of Iowa. Those bags were gone in less than two hours! Since being featured on KCRG-TV9 the morning of March 25th weve had over 50 additional requests and we would love to fulfill them all! Thats where this fundraiser comes in. We anticipate requests to keep pouring in as word spreads on social media and we want to ensure we are able to provide a bag for any student that requests one. Please share this with your friends and family so we can continue to provide some color in these kids lives.  For more information about our organization visit our website at  www.easterniowaartsacademy.org    Check out this article from KCRG about this specific project:   https://www.kcrg.com/video/?vid=569088882     #SmallBusinessRelief

title: Salon de Cheveux Employee Releif during COVID-19
description: Like so many people and small businesses our family at Salon de Cheveux has been hit hard by the COVID-19 crisis. To help slow the spread of the virus like so many businesses and to do our part by helping the safety of our community we have closed until it is safe to re-open. These are uncertain times for everyone and because we are unsure what the near future holds or how long it will be until we are able to open our doors. This crisis puts our salon family in times of need to help support their loved ones.   We have started this GoFundMe to help the amazing stylists we have to continue paying their bills and feeding their families. 100% of the money raised through this fund raiser will go directly to our team!  Another way we ask for support is buying gift cards from our website online to service you once we are able to re-open.  We thank you for your help and hope everyone stays safe!  #SmallBusinessRelief

title: COVID-19 Crisis Response for Mathare
description: Overview  Every month we host a MaSCA Childrens Lunch where we provide lunch and games for 80 children. This month we are suspending the program due to the government directive to avoid large gatherings and contain the spread of the COVID-19 Virus.  We have been talking about how we can support these children during the COVID-19 crisis. With many people off work and being told to stay home many families will not be able to buy food and helping these families feed their children feels like a natural and important extension of our Childrens Lunch Program during this difficult period of time. For more information on access to food and water in the Mathare slum read  this article  .    Proposal  With your support we will be able to give a food package to families in need in the Mathare Bondeni informal settlement. Each package will consist of 5kgs of maize floor 2kgs of rice 2kgs of legumes 3 liters of cooking oil hygiene pack (hand soap) and 0.5kgs of salt which will be sufficient to sustain a family for 3-4 weeks. Our Nairobi team is able to source food at a very low charity cost and would work with our local field reps to reach the children that we invite to our childrens lunches.   Cost : $20 CDN / 1400 KES / US$15 per family  Goal : Feed 80 families (note that we plan to work with other charities to meet this goal)    How Can We Safely Purchase Food and Create the Food Packages?   MaSCA Nairobi found a supplier who is able to provide all the supplies needed at a low cost for a good cause. The supplier has also agreed to deliver the goods directly to our team so that no one on our team would be exposed when purchased on collecting the supplies. We want to avoid asking our field reps to travel or go out shopping.   How Can the Families Pick up the Food Packages Without Risk?  As per recommendations from the Government any sort of social gatherings pose a risk including people grouping together to pick up food or water. After consulting with the UN we propose the following as a safe method for the families to pick up the food package:  Packages are being prepared and stored at a common location. Each family is given a defined time slot for picking up their package staggered. For example one family comes at 10am the next at 10:10 the next at 10:20 etc. One person from the family comes social distancing is enforced at the pickup site and our volunteers coordinate an organised controlled food pickup.   Thanks for your help and solidarity in this time of global crisis. We remain dedicated to supporting the at-risk Mathare community.  You can donate here using a bank card. However if you would like to avoid the transfer fees taken by the GoFundMe platform you can transfer directly to:   1. MaSCA  Nairobi  Treasurer (MPESA to Lucas Odhiambo 0717400534) 2. MaSCA  Ottawa  Treasurer (Canadian bank account transfer - ask us for details) 3.  U.S.  fundraising lead (Venmo account: @katherine-cashman) 4.  French  fundraising lead (French bank account transfer to Milena Beekman) 5.  Australian  fundraising lead (Australian bank account transfer to Ariana Magini)

title: Face Shield Fund - Help Vidant Fight COVID-19
description: Healthcare workers are on the front lines of the COVID-19 Pandemic and they are facing a massive shortage of personal protective equipment (PPE).  Our small business  Simple   Sentimental  typically creates personalized gifts but we are stepping up and using our resources to create face shields for healthcare workers at  Vidant Medical Center  in Greenville North Carolina. We are also sending donations to hospitals around the country please continue reading to learn how you can send our face shields to your local hospital!  The primary hospital we are donating to Vidant serves 29 counties in Eastern North Carolina. They are asking for donations of face shields and other PPE to protect nurses doctors and other vital healthcare personnel working to take care of COVID-19 patients. Because Vidant serves so many counties they are also a distributor to other hospitals and medical facilities. Any donations we take to Vidant are sent to the area with the most need.  We estimate our cost of creating a face shield is $8 per shield so  for every $8 donation we receive we are making and donating 1 face shield to  Vidant Medical Center.      If you donate more than $100 we can ship the face shields produced by your donation to the hospital of your choosing (must be in the continental United States).   If you donate $100 or more we will message you via GoFundMe to see which hospital you would like them to be sent to. Please have their shipping address ready :) All other donations will be sent to Vidant Medical Center in Greenville.  We are able to produce up to 400 face shields per day and we would love to fulfill Vidants and Eastern NCs growing need of PPE. Below is a photo of what our face shields look like! We make them in our office in Greenville out of plastic.     I hope you will consider donating to our GoFundMe so we can support the people who are putting their health and even their lives on the line to save others!   Please reach out if you have any questions! We can also be reached on social media:  Instagram    Facebook

title: Kula Yoga Shala COVID19 #SmallBusinessRelief
description: Kula has been the yogic heart of our community for 10 years!    Please consider offering a donation to help our beloved studio with the loss of business due to this pandemic. If a donation isnt possible please share this fundraiser if it is in your heart to do so.    In deep gratitude for the Kula Tribe.    https://www.kulayogashala.com     A note from our brewmaster Scott Feinberg...   After much consideration of many different angles and giving deep thought about what constitutes most authentically embodying the teachings we collectively cherish Ive made the decision that the most responsible way for us to support the health of our community is to temporarily close our shala for the time being beginning this Tuesday. In the spirit of ahimsa (the foundational yogic principle of non-violence) its important that we do not contribute to the unintended spreading of the coronavirus within our community. While in many ways this is a difficult decision I believe it is the right one.  Yoga comes in many forms. So does community. This is an unprecedented time in our lives and calls upon our capacity to recognize that the most powerful way to support our community is by staying home over the coming days and curbing the spread of the virus. It is simply too much risk to even have willing students and teachers share a practice space when non-symptomatic carriers may spread the virus and in turn impact the lives of others in our community especially our highly vulnerable elders.  I do not have an exact date that we will re-open our doors as we will continue to monitor the situation and make the wisest decision based upon the fluid nature of this crisis. If we can all stick together through this and do our part we will hopefully be back practicing together sooner rather than later.  We are looking into online options for Kula classes and as we progress in our research we will of course keep you informed. Lets be creative in how we can keep sewing the threads of conscious heart-centered community in new ways. Lets continue to support one another even as we may have different views in regard to what constitutes appropriate action. Lets help one another through this time as we will need that more and more and in varied forms in the coming weeks and months. And most of all lets continue to stand with integrity and in loving kindness as we make our way through this together.   With Community At Heart     Scott

title: Covid-19 Help Volunteers help Health Care Workers!
description: Testing 1000 Health Care Volunteers for antibodies against the virus ASAP.   Massachusetts needs these Volunteers to assist hospitals as the supply of PPE dwindles.  Healthcare professionals are now becoming infected.  They will need relief especially as the numbers of coronavirus patients go up.  Previously infected people may be immune to catching the virus again.  Hospitals and researchers are trying to prove this now and commercial tests for immunity may be available within weeks.  But we need it sooner.  How many tests will be available and who will be the first to get them?  McNeil Scientific Consulting is rapidly developing this test at their own expense.  With some funding we can test some people.  But if we reach our  gofundme  target we can provide a large team of Volunteers in time to help our major hospitals before the spike of patients.  And the system and equipment will be in place to do it again in any state at any time.  And it can be duplicated.  Please be generous if you can! Thank you!  - Smart Animal Inc. (SAI)  This effort is being supported free of charge by individual volunteers by Smart Animal Inc. and by McNeil Scientific Consulting LLC.  ***We expect to conclude this study within a month***   Would you like to Volunteer to make this happen?   Please review the COVID19 presentation on our website   http://smartanimal.net/     or contact  gmcneil@smartanimal.net  or call/text me at 774-249-1566.   We need you NOW!   Openings and updates are provided below.   Volunteer Positions Needed for Development of the Study (March 30 - April 12).  Some positions can be done from home!   1. Reagents for the assay -  Filled (MSC)  2. Assay Development -  Filled (MSC)  2.5. Assay Qualification - Not required but highly desired!  We need a lab/hospital/company to support.  Please contact us. 3. Equipment - Sourcing and acquisition maintenance testing and setup.  3 positions. 4. Site Prep - 6 positions staff to setup 1 position site coordinator 1 person to acquire the proper licenses and permits etc.  Marlboro MA 5. Sample Kits - 1 position for sourcing and acquiring the components of the sample kits.  2 people to assemble kits using sanitary techniques. 6. Tracking - at least 2 highly talented volunteers who can create and manage spreadsheets and barcode readers.  This is a very technical position. 7. Status ID - 2 people to design and maintain the Volunteer submission file.  2 people sourcing wristbands for easy identification this is a challenge and may require multiple vendors. 8. OTHER - Please let us know of a gap that you can fill.  We are moving quickly and your input is important.    Volunteer Positions Needed for Execution of the Study (current target April 13-16).  Some training will be required in advance.   1. Parking lot : Traffic flow information cleaning refreshments (8 positions).  Police/security in addition but separate.  2. Registration : Data Entry ID check (5 positions). IT support for Laptops with barcode scanner and WIFI  (1 position) 3. Sampling Stations : Instruct and visually verify self-sample technique.  Training required (8 positions).  Runner to deliver samples (1 position). 4.Sample Inactivation :  Monitor temperature controls track and document inactivation time by barcode (2 positions).  This is a critical task and will require a full-time supervisor (1 position). 5. Sample Testing : Receive inactivated samples and complete entire assay flow (4 positions).  Includes a Runner and reagent supply tech (1 position). 6. Data Security : Observe collection of data to ensure it is complete and accurate. Probably the same individuals who designed the software (2 positions). 7. Exit Registration : Verification of results and status. Prep wristbands.  Distribute to Volunteers.  Takes place 2-3 days after screening begins. (4 positions) 8.  Host/Hostess : These are heroic volunteers coming in to be tested! Treat them well! Ideas welcome.  (4 positions) 9. OTHER - Please let us know of a gap that you can fill.  We are moving quickly and your input is important.  NOTE - If a position that you are suited for is filled please let us know.  People assigned may require support or complete replacement.  The COVID 19 virus does not support this study.  This list will be updated as this 3 day old endeavor unfolds.  Thank you for reviewing this list and if you are able to Volunteer we love you. Even if you cant volunteer and you made it this far we love you! - updated March 27 2020

title: EMERGENZA COVID19 Aiutiamo lOspedale di Bozzolo
description: Aiuta lOspedale di Bozzolo a combattere lemergenza sanitaria del Coronavirus con una piccola donazione!  Il Presidio Riabilitativo Multifunzionale Don Primo Mazzolari di Bozzolo centro di eccellenza nazionale per la cura delle sindromi Ehlers-Danlos e Charcot Marie Tooth ha aperto un reparto destinato ai malati Covid-19 fornendo un importante supporto al sistema sanitario lombardo in questa fase di emergenza.  Ognuno di noi è chiamato in causa per aiutare lOspedale nellacquisto di apparecchiature e presidi adeguati permettendo a medici infermieri e personale sanitario di operare con la massima efficienza e in assoluta sicurezza.  LOspedale di Bozzolo ha bisogno anche del tuo aiuto; anche una piccola donazione diventa di vitale importanza per supportare il personale che lavora allinterno della struttura.  I fondi raccolti saranno direttamente devoluti allOspedale.   I fondi saranno raccolti sul conto corrente del Fondo di solidarietà San Vincenzo Comune e Parrocchia di Bozzolo.  Ognuno di noi può fare qualcosa: - donare anche solo 5€; - rimanere a casa e rispettando le regole del Decreto ministeriale;  - adottare comportamenti responsabili e preventivi divulgati dal Ministero della Salute per non creare ulteriore contagio;  E possibile anche contribuire tramite una donazione sul conto corrente utilizzando le seguenti coordinate bancarie: IBAN: IT 32 N070 7657 4700 0000 0407 144 Banca: Banca Cremasca e Mantovana - Agenzia di Bozzolo.  Causale: Ospedale PRM Don Primo Mazzolari - Bozzolo  **************************  Help the Bozzolo Hospital to fight the Coronavirus emergency with a small donation!  The Don Primo Mazzolari Multifunctional Rehabilitation Facility of Bozzolo national center of excellence for the treatment of Ehlers-Danlos and Charcot Marie Tooth syndromes has opened a ward for Covid-19 patients providing important support to the Lombard health system in this area. emergency phase.  Each of us is called upon to assist the hospital in the purchase of adequate equipment and devices allowing doctors nurses and health personnel to operate with maximum efficiency and in absolute safety.  The Bozzolo Hospital also needs your help; even a small donation becomes vital to support staff working within the facility. The funds raised will be directly donated to the hospital.  The funds will be collected on the bank account of the San Vincenzo Solidarity Fund Municipality and Parish of Bozzolo.  Each of us can do something: - donate also only € 5; - stay at home and respecting the rules of the ministerial decree; - adopt responsible and preventive behavior disclosed by the Ministry of Health in order not to create further contagion;  It is also possible to contribute through a donation to the current account using the following bank details: IBAN: IT 32 N070 7657 4700 0000 0407 144 Bank: Banca Cremasca and Mantovana - Bozzolo Agency. Reason: PRM Don Primo Mazzolari Hospital - Bozzolo

title: GNYHA COVID-19 Emergency Relief Fund
description: #ProtectOurProtectors      Get protective medical supplies to the front lines of the Coronavirus crisis in New York City   Many of us have seen and heard the harrowing requests on social media and in the news from doctors nurses and other frontline health workers to  #GetMePPE  the personal protective equipment that protects them from becoming ill themselves.  This campaign answers their call for help. Please donate today to  #ProtectOurProtectors.   Your donation will be used to buy the masks gowns gloves and other protective medical supplies that are in very short supply but are critically needed by the brave health professionals working selflessly on our communities behalf.   100% of the proceeds from this campaign will go to the Greater New York Hospital Foundations COVID-19 Emergency Relief Fund  which was specifically created to assist financially challenged New York hospitals for COVID-19-related purposes.   The Greater New York Hospital Foundation is the charitable arm of the  Greater New York Hospital Association  (GNYHA) whose members include familiar institutions like New York Presbyterian Mount Sinai and NYU Hospitals. But GNYHA also serves hospitals you may not be as familiar with such as the hospitals of the  NYC Health + Hospitals   system which includes Bellevue Elmhurst Harlem Jacobi Kings County Metropolitan and other hospitals that together make up the largest public hospital system in America serving over a million New Yorkers every year. At these large city hospitals  the need is particularly acute  as they serve large numbers of uninsured and under-insured patients. Because of the surge in demand for hospital care they lack the financial resources and private donor network to acquire critical supplies and personnel.   You can help bridge this gap with your donation to this Fund. No amount is too small. Even $1 can purchase a mask that has the potential to save numerous lives.   Thank you for your support and please share this with your friends and help us #ProtectOurProtectors.       Greater New York Hospital Association (GNYHA) is an association of hospitals throughout New York City and New York state that provides its members with health care advocacy and expertise. For a full list of the hospitals that are part of the GNYHA please go to  www.gnyha.org/hospitals .  This Fund is operated under the auspices of Greater New York Hospital Foundation Inc. (GNYHF) which is GNYHAs not-for-profit 501(c)(3) charitable organization. Please note that 100% of all contributions will be dedicated to GNYHAs hospital members and no monies will be retained by GNYHF.

title: Ayuda para salvar a nuestros Abuelos #Covid19
description: Amlul + Gala González necesitan  vuestra ayuda para auxiliar a NUESTROS MAYORES  quienes más  están sufriendo los efectos del COVID-19.      Durante las últimas semanas todos estamos experimentando una situación nueva e inesperada desde el punto vista social y sanitario y  ahora más que nunca podemos ayudar a los que más están sufriendo.      El cuidado de los mayores se está complicando por falta de recursos y contagio del personal.   Los jóvenes tenemos la responsabilidad de actuar ahora mas que nunca  y cuidar de todos nuestros abuelos con  un pequeño gesto de generosidad.     Los fondos recaudados irán a Asociación Benéfica Geriátrica Ibérica  voluntarios que llevan más de 20 años trabajando por los más ancianos y tiene su sede en Madrid.    A través de su proyecto “Abrazos Solidarios”   buscan cubrir todas las necesidades de nuestros abuelos  y mayores  durante la situación actual que estamos viviendo en España.     Se necesita más material sanitario:    -Vespiradores  -Guantes  -Batas  -Mascarillas  -Calzas  -Gafas de protección  -Alimentos para aquellos que viven solos  -Asistencia    Y todo lo necesario para la atención y asistencia de pacientes y trabajadores.   Necesitamos ser muy rápidos  ¡Muchas Gracias!  *****************  Amlul + Gala Gonzalez need your help!     We all have parents grandparents and elderly ones and they NEED US .  They have been the most affected by #covid19  Everyday Its becoming increasingly more difficult to be able to assist everyone without sanitary equipment making care givers fall ill with the virus.   As the Youth we all have the responsibility to act .  Your donations will make a huge different to help those who made possible for us to be here today through a small act of generosity.     All funds raised by @GalaGonzález and #Amlul will be donated directly to the Asociación Geriátrica Ibérica  ( a non profit organisation of volunteers with more than 20 years of experience helping the elderly ).   “Abrazos Solidarios” is a project to help finance  all the current needs our grandparents and old ones are facing daily during this difficult times in Spain.
