We need your help to raise money for more sanitary equipment like:   - ventilation devices  - gloves  - EPI suits - masks - protection googles  -Delivery and good for those who love alone    And all the needed tools in order to assist patients and care givers .  Lets act fast! Thank You !

title: Sam Ehlingers COVID-19 Relief Fund
description: I am dedicated to helping families who have been impacted by the current global crisis and have created a GoFundMe to raise money to assist organizations that are doing incredible work in my community and nationally including the Boys   Girls Club of America the Central Texas Food Bank Austin Pets Alive and more.  Please join me in supporting these organizations. This collective effort to raise funds for those affected is permissible within NCAA rules and has been approved by the Texas Athletics Compliance staff.   All funds raised will be donated directly to 501(c)(3) organizations.

title: COVID 19 - Sosteniamo la Misericordia di Lucca
description: Progetto organizzato da  Round Table 51 Lucca  insieme alla  Misericordia di Lucca     Covid19 - Sosteniamo la Misericordi di Lucca AIUTIAMO CHI OGNI GIORNO E IN PRIMA LINEA PER NOI!   La  Round Table 51 Lucca  si impegna a sostegno della  Misericordia di Lucca  attivando una raccolta fondi di aiuto a favore di chi ogni giorno agisce in prima linea per garantire un servizio essenziale per la popolazione.  È un periodo difficile in cui i volontari sono dimezzati ed i mezzi di protezione per svolgere il primo soccorso scarseggiano. Fondamentale è un aiuto in tale direzione: il contagio da  COVID19  anche di un solo volontario porterebbe alla perdita di un servizio di così vitale importanza.   FAI LA TUA PARTE CON UN IMPORTANTE GESTO!   Il ricavato della raccolta conclusa sarà versato sul conto della Misericordi di Lucca al fine di acquistare i materiali di protezione per tutti i volontari; tuttavia la piattaforma consente di superare di  BEN OLTRE  la quota prestabilita e perciò di consentire al beneficiario lacquisto di più materiali di protezione!  Per informazioni e comunicazioni potete contattarci alla seguente e-mail:  lucca@roundtable.it   e verrete subito ricontattati!    https://www.facebook.com/roundtable51lucca/    #soteniamolamisericordia #insiemeperlamisericordia #unitiperlamisericordia

title: Take Time for Yourself Massage COVID-19 Relief
description: As you know I had to temporarily close my massage practice to help flatten the curve of the COVID-19 spread which I happily did to protect the community and myself.  Because I am an independent practitioner the unemployment benefits do not apply to me or protect me in the same way.     This fundraiser will go towards my ongoing business bills until I am able to open up again which I really look forward to doing.    GoFundMe will match $500 with a grant if I am able to raise $500.   All money you donate will go towards your next session with me.       I hope you all stay healthy and I really look forward to seeing you soon!

title: Support for Chop Tops Affected By COVID-19
description: Chop Tops has been a part of our great community for over 15 years. We have clients that have stood by as we moved locations opened locations and stayed with us when their stylist changed career paths.    Like most small businesses Chop Tops runs on tight margins and COVID-19 has severely impacted us. We will be recovering from the loss of income this month for a very long time. We will get through this as a family and a team. We have always overcome challenges and grown stronger and this will be no exception.    We are a team of owners managers support staff stylists social media marketers students teachers and parents. We miss each other tremendously. We miss our clients our sales reps our delivery drivers we have become a true family and we come to you now to humbly ask for support from our community.    If you are still able to work remotely and you are in a position to do so the most helpful thing you can do for us is to make a donation to help us through this time. Any money we raise is going towards paying bills and securing the long-term financial health of the business.   Thank you to everyone out there that has supported and loved our space over the past 15  years. Our clients mean everything to us and we couldnt do it without you.    Our highest five donors will get their choice of the following incentives that will be offered by the Owners of Chop Tops A Hair Company- (highest donor will have the first choice second highest will have the second choice...etc)   A  Danelectro guitar with one lesson by the one and only Jim Holopter  A Backyard BBQ Blow Out with the Popskull Rebels plus 10lbs of ALL the meats  A four-man “Hair Party” with fresh haircuts and shaves  A four-woman “Ladies Hair Party” with a deep conditioning blowout  A Sunday Funday BBQ parking lot party at our Westport location with burgers hotdogs beer and wine.    Again Kansas City thank you for your loyal support and friendship.    May we all be happy. May we all be safe. May we all be healthy. May we all live in ease.

title: Covid-19 #Small Business Relief for Grooves Salon
description: Grooves salon had been my baby for a long time and Ive been a stylist for over 30 years.We offer haircutscolors and some nail and waxing services. We are in New York State and with this Covid-19 pandemic we were mandated to close on March 212020. This of course is necessary for everyones safety in getting this under control for our families and yours.  I lost my main source of income with a couple days.  This is devastating and will take months to recoup from. The self employed are often forgotten during times like this esp. Stylists.. been worried about clientshow long this will lastmy booth renters and their families. I need some help to get through this. Any money donated will be used to maintain the salon expenses while we arent able to work. Thanksstay safe and peace and love???

title: Help Anthony Find a Home During the COVID19 Crisis
description: I want to start by saying that my friend Anthony is one of the most loyal kind hearted and humble people out there. He would never think to ask for help from anyone but hes the first to give you the shirt off his back. Because of this I am asking for help on his behalf.  Anthony faced a very sudden unexpected eviction due to financial circumstances brought on by the COVID-19 pandemic. He is currently searching for a roommate but given the current pandemic this is not coming to fruition quickly. He has been out every day on the front lines volunteering to bring groceries to families in need who are not able to go outside because of the health risk involved.    His online businesses which made up the bulk of his income have screeched to a halt due to the unforeseen circumstances. As a result he has no income while he tries to find a place to live. He is putting his health at risk going out every day to make sure others are fed while he has nowhere to go. In addition to this already stressful time today Anthony found out that his grandmother has been rushed to the hospital because she has symptoms of the Coronavirus.   This is a uniquely hard time for everyone. I dont think there is a single person not feeling the effects of COVID-19. I hope that during this time we can come together to give what we can and help each other make it through this difficult time. I believe that support from other people can really make the difference at a time when it feels like everything around you is falling apart.  I hope that you will consider giving what you can to a person who gives selflessly and never asks for anything in return.   If you know of anyone looking for a roommate in the Long Island area specifically Suffolk County Smithtown or Port Jefferson please let me know so that I can pass the word along.  Thank you and stay safe.

title: Support Peoria Himalayan Salt Cave COVID-19
description: My name is Nikki Wenzelspratt and I am the owner of the Peoria Himalayan Salt Cave in Peoria Illinois.  Due to COVID-19 Governor Pritzker has ordered all non-essential businesses to temporarily close their doors.  Unfortunately the bills keep coming in and there isnt any income to pay them.  As many of you already know it is tough being a small business in the best of times.  Please consider donating to the Peoria Himalayan Salt Cave during this pandemic crisis to help with working capital.    http://www.peoriasaltcave.com     https://www.facebook.com/peoriasaltcave/

title: Help ‘Team NOMADS de Corona crisis door!
description: Lieve en zeer gewaardeerde gasten    Wij van  ‘  Team NOMADS  zien dan onze bazen keihard worden getroffen in deze Corona crisis. Zoals bekend kan het restaurant na de nieuwe gepubliceerde maatregelen pas  1 juni  weer open maar zonder gasten op dit moment is het bestaan van NOMADS nagenoeg onmogelijk.   Wij dragen natuurlijk allemaal met liefde ons steentje bij aan de volksgezondheid maar de leveranciers salarissen en vooral de huur moeten wel gewoon betaald worden en we zien dat de stress daardoor enorm is.   Als jong en enorm gemotiveerd bedrijf met een prachtig concept waarbij de eigenaren  Thomas   Jaap  samen met chef Joey elke 6 maanden een nieuw land kiezen waarvan zij de eetcultuur keer op keer met de mooiste   lekkerste gerechten willen presenteren  denken wij met pijn in ons hart aan het feit dat dat zomaar ineens over zou kunnen zijn.    Daarom willen wij u vragen om ons te helpen deze klap voor onze bazen een beetje op te vangen en ze een hart onder de riem te steken. Wij willen als  verrassing  voor Thomas   Jaap er  als team  samen voor zorgen dat dit prachtige restaurant gewoon open blijft en dat  wij jullie als gasten kunnen verwelkomen en een prachtige avond kunnen laten beleven.    Wij gaan natuurlijk niet zomaar om geld vragen maar hebben er wat geweldigs voor tegenover staan!  In ruil voor uw donatie ontvangt u een  tegoedbon ter waarde van het gedoneerde bedrag om na de corona crisis heerlijk bij ons te komen dineren lunchen of borrelen!  Dit kan alleen als er niet anoniem gedoneerd wordt.   Wij zullen er als team voor zorgen dat u een geweldige beleving zal hebben!   Met uw hulp kunnen we na deze moeilijke tijd weer de heerlijkste gerechten serveren gezellige borrels organiseren op het zonnige terras en een gastvrije avond creëren vol verrassende culturen!    Zonder u als gast geen NOMADS.     Onze dank is enorm.     Team NOMADS  3    P.S. We zullen u contacten naar aanleiding van uw donatie voor de tegoed bon.

title: NY Nurses Against Covid
description: Hi everyone   As Im sure you have seen or heard nurses in nyc are running out of ppe very fast. We have resorted to using our own money and also becoming very crafty at making Personal protective equipment out of things such as plastic ponchos shower caps etc. We are trying to protect ourselves in order to be in the front lines of taking care of the patients! Please help us to be able to protect ourselves!

title: Help FeedMore during the COVID-19 Pandemic!
description: Want to join the Alpha Chi chapter in making a difference? Were raising money to benefit FeedMore Inc. and any donation will help make a positive impact during the COVID-19 Global Pandemic.   Feed More is the core hunger-relief organization in the region with the mission to fight hunger in Central Virginia and the vision that none shall go hungry. It is also a subsidiary of Feeding America a non-profit that Lambda Chi Alpha has long been partnered with. With more than 200000 individuals in Central Virginia experiencing hunger including 53000 children Feed Mores set of comprehensive hunger-relief programs delivers more than 18 million meals annually to families in need.   During the COVID-19 crisis it is important that we remember to help members of our community especially those who are at an increased risk of getting the virus and of food insecurity such as the homeless population of Richmond. There are also many members of the workforce that are being asked to stay home without pay leaving them without the means to pay for food. We hope that as a community we can all come together to support those going through tough times.    The measure of a countrys greatness is its ability to retain compassion in time of crisis. -Thurgood Marshall

title: Recaudación Biris Norte contra el Covid-19
description: Viendo el difícil momento en el que nos encontramos desde Biris Norte queremos ponernos a total disposición del Ayuntamiento de Sevilla y distintas instituciones oficiales así como a cualquier tipo de ONG o asociaciones de cualquier tipo de nuestra ciudad ante cualquier necesidad de voluntariado de cualquier tipo que sea necesario.  Estamos en una situación que nos afecta a todos como sociedad y creemos que toda ayuda para poder superar esta difícil situación es poca.  Animamos no solo a nuestros seguidores sino a toda la sociedad en general a colaborar en lo que les sea posible (siempre siguiendo las recomendaciones que se den desde las instituciones oficiales) para intentar paliar la situación o hacerla más llevadera para quienes más indefensos están ante esta epidemia.  «No estáis solos en esta batalla».

title: COVID-19 Mask Fund Raising  - II
description: Healthcare professionals are operating without  Personal Protection Equipment (PPE).  Hospitals fighting COIVD-19 have run out of masks. Healthcare professionals are making their own masks if they get sick we do not have a second line of defense against this virus.  This is a coordinated effort of 100s of people across Alameda   Contra Costa County and beyond to organize seamstresses and sewers and to provide them resources to make masks at home. These masks are being built as per specifications received from John Muir Kaiser and various county hospitals. First batch of masks has already been delivered. We need to scale up and make hundreds of masks to tide over next few weeks till the critical supply is restored. We have 40 plus and still adding seamstresses working tirelessly in making masks.  We raised  6k plus through our first campaign and the funds were used to buy 5000 masks( N95   Surgical Masks) in addition to  700 plus home made cloth mask.  Our team has been asked to  supply more of these masks as the situation is still out of control.  The local hospitals supply chain is not able to provide for the rapid requirement /demand as we wrap our arms around this situation . We need additional $6000 to duplicate our previous efforts and make these masks available to our doctors nurses and various other healthcare workers.   We owe it to them  they are not sitting at home but risking their lives fighting for us lets do our part!  We have an external auditor to ensure funds are handled properly. Any remaining funds will be used for COVID-19 related support activities.  Thank you! COVID-19 Mask Production - Fund Raising Team (Carol OKeefe Vish Kris Clara Nitin Lavanya Shurti Chitra) Read more

title: Support Home Base  and M1-5  Employees
description: Help us Raise Money for our awesome staff who find themselves out of work and struggling to pay their bills.   All monies raised will go directly to them.

title: Body Rest Massage Financial Help - COVID-19
description: We are sad to report that Body Rest Massage has taken a huge hit financially from the current Shelter in Place order to stop the spread of COVID-19.  We had to close our office on March 17th and will remain closed until the Shelter in Place order is lifted.    As much as we would like to say we can get through this without help it is becoming more clear with all of our overhead costs for the business we will run out of money sooner than later.  If you are still working please consider giving a little to help us stay afloat during this time.  Unfortunately this daunting time has left us with very little places to turn for financial relief.  We greatly appreciate each of you and whatever you can do to help even if it is just a few words of encouragement.    We cannot wait to get back to work once life returns to normal. We will get through this stronger then we went into it.  Please stay safe and stay well.  Blessings to you all.  Our Body Rest Massage Team  Donna Javier Kelly and Tricia

title: BEAT COVID-19 ~ For our Front Line HC Workers
description: For Surrey Hospitals care homes to be able to have more masks coveralls and goggles for our frontline health care workers.

title: Canoos LA Foodbank COVID-19 Relief Fund
description: UPDATE: We hit our $5K goal in less than 24 hours...huge thank you to everyone who pitched in so far! Lets up the goal to $10K and see what we can really do!  The coronavirus (COVID-19) has disrupted daily life for everyone in Los Angeles County but has been disproportionately impacting lower-income communities. School closures changes in work schedules and social isolation are putting extra strain on our most at-risk neighbors including struggling seniors hardworking families and children. The Los Angeles Regional Foodbank has established a special fund to fight hunger among those affected. Each 1$ donated provides 4 meals.  Canoo is proud to be a part of the Los Angeles community and we are determined to do our part to make sure that no one gets left behind as we weather this crisis together.  Please join us in our fight to raise $5000 for our community.   More information about Los Angeles Regional Foodbank: The mission of the Los Angeles Regional Food bank is to mobilize resources to fight hunger in our community. Since 1973 the Food Bank has distributed more than 1.1 billion pounds of food. The Food Bank collects food from hundreds of resources. With the help of 37000 volunteers annually and an agency network of more than 600 partner agencies we serve more than 300000 people on a monthly basis. The vision statement of the Los Angeles Regional Food Bank is that no one goes hungry in Los Angeles County.

title: Food aid for Costa Rican families - Covid-19
description: Like the whole world Costa Rica is hit hard with the Covid-19. Borders closed down no more tourism no more jobs.  Meaning many local families need help help with essentials like food and disinfectant. We want to keep them healthy and safe. Lets get these people through this disaster. Please donate whatever you can miss and we will buy supplies to get them through this. your support is appreciated.

title: Hickory Ridge Cinema Corona Virus Help
description: This page was started by Eli the marketing guy at the Hickory Ridge Cinema an independent community cinema in Brunswick OH.   Over the course of the last 5 years wince we took over the HRC we have been adamant that we would continue to improve the theater and keep it affordable for the community.  It is because of our work along with the community that has supported the business that the movie theater has been a part of birthday parties first dates school field trips proposals family   treasured films the list goes on...  If you know us you know we focus on not only helping the community but also helping each other.  During this dark time in our society the movie theater along with many other small businesses is at risk.  It is with this in mind that we have put together this GoFundMe page.  We post this humbly knowing that our families and this business are not the only ones feeling the financial impact of the Coronavirus.  However we ask that if  Hickory Ridge Cinema has been a part of your life at some point in your life you consider donating to this fund so that the theater can continue to be part of the community for years to come.  We cant do curbside movies or popcorn delivery but to show our thanks we can give you a popcorn on us the next time we see you We promise well remember our supporters.  The money raised here will help pay bills and operating expenses that will continue to be owed during the weeks   months ahead.  Any additional funds raised will be put towards theater upgrades.  And we had plenty of upgrades we were hoping to implement this next year.  We wish that everyone remains safe and healthy during this uncertain time.  With Love   Gratitude The Hickory Ridge Cinema Community

title: Help us  Inform  West Oromia about COVID-19
description: Dear Oromo People and Friends   As you are well aware with the pandemic of COVID-19 we are said to be living in an unprecedented time in a human history. One that is challenging and threatening to the existence of humanity. With over 350000 cases registered over 150 different countries and thousands of deaths to-date we shouldnt lose sight of the devastating nature of this Virus.  Ethiopia has already registered about 11 cases of the virus with unfortunately many more to be revealed in the future. We are worried about our people at the moment.  Yet again more scary is the fact that a significant number of our people are living in a complete blackout with no chance of receiving and sharing information simply because the Ethiopian government continued to shutdown internet and phone service. Oromo people in Wallaga has now become the direct victim of this policy and as a result become most vulnerable to the virus. God forbid but if and when the virus reaches that part of the region the consequence of the pandemic will likely register a tragic consequence.  Therefore in order to prepare for such time Kello Media decides to set up a task force that will proactively work to step in and up with the goal of filling the information gap created by the internet and phone blackout. We decided to:  1. Print half a million copies of flyers and brochures containing basic information about the prevention of COVID-19 to be distributed at public spaces in all of Wallaga.   2. Mobilize and cover basic transportation costs for volunteers to distribute the flyers to the public.   Kello Media is small start up organization which was established a few months ago by a group of young Oromo residing in Washington DC and in Finfinnee. We have now allocated small budget from our own locket to roll COVID-19 prevention campaign. But we dont have enough budget to finance this particular initiative.   We are looking up to you to contribute whatever you can so that we will be able to distribute half a million flyers and brochures to our people living in an Information blackout who are in a dire need of information on how to prevent COVID-19.   Please press the link below to contribute whatever you can.  Gargaarsi keessan lubbuu saba keenya akka baraaruf waan arjoontaniif galatooma.  Nagaa argadhaa   Kiya Segni  Kello Media Managing Director.

title: Raising Funds for The Yoga Garden during Covid-19
description: Due to the Covid-19 crisis The Yoga Garden is raising money to help support the mortgage utilities and subscriptions associated with doing business. We have worked so hard the past 2.5 years to establish our business in the community and unfortunately still operate paycheck to paycheck. If you have any means to help support us it would be appreciated beyond words.  We are so thankful to Gofund me for their #SmallBusinessRelief program.   Peace and Grace Caitlin   TYG Team

title: Covid-19: Support meals for Evanstons seniors
description: For the past 10 days Jennifer Eason and William Eason of Jennifers Edibles have been providing free delivered dinners to Evanstons seniors and those most vulnerable to Covid-19. They started with five requests and are now serving 52 people. They have a growing group of volunteers who shop for prepare and deliver the meals and theyre hoping to increase their capacity and serve 100 seniors every day for the next 30 days. For many of the people who have requested a meal William says its the only meal they eat.  The brother and sister pair have shut down the restaurant for all other business and are focusing solely on this effort to keep seniors fed during the Coronavirus crisis.  In order to serve 100 people each day for the next 30 days--thats 3000 meals--they need to raise $21000 or $7 per meal.   Can you help? ________  Required by GoFundMe: Im Nina Kavin.  I live in Evanston.   Im raising funds for Jennifers Edibles because Ive known Jennifer and enjoyed her restaurant and her food for the past five years and I admire Jennifer and Williams selfless efforts to support our community at this time of great need.

title: Help 109 survive the COVID-19 crisis
description: The Backstory   109 is a mission driven non-profit that was founded 5 years ago and this is the first time we are reaching out publicly for help. We have created incredible impact around the world since our inception and to continue operating we are setting our egos aside exposing our vulnerabilities and humbling asking for support. Thank you for your time consideration and above all else your kindness in these tough times.     Coronavirus is not the worlds first pandemic but its the first of this scale in our lifetimes. Its not often that we are aware were in a historical moment as its happening but this is one of those times — and the story is still being written.  None of us knows how this will end and its impossible to predict when it will feel over. The impacts are being felt worldwide by countries cities organizations and individuals everywhere.   And thats why I created this fundraising page for my nonprofit 109 World. If you have never heard about 109 we dedicate our lives to hosting experiences for people to join us in service to transform themselves and the world around them. On every 109 experience we partner with local grassroots organizations who are positively impacting their communities and environments. Volunteering with them gives us the opportunity to put our hands in the soil break bread together and truly gain perspective and clarity of our place in the world. Mahatma Gandhi described travel as ‘The Language of Peace. To experience different realities fosters compassion awareness and understanding of one another and yourself. At 109 we deeply believe that travel if designed with intention and in collaboration with the local community can be a powerful force for good.     109 in Marrakech in support of girls education    109 in Puerto Rico in support of victims of Hurricane Maria    109 in Mexico in support of sea turtle protection  So after 5 years we have supported over 400 alumni in adopting more sustainable and mindful ways of living and offered them the opportunity to give back to this beautiful world in a variety of ways from volunteering with clean drinking water projects women and girls right to education animal welfare refugee crisis food security and disaster relief. We have partnered with over a dozen incredible local grassroots organizations impacting their local communities and environments across 11 countries.   In these trying times we now find ourselves close to bankruptcy with only 1 more month of survival left. We have been forced to cancel the few services our nonprofit needs to lower our monthly costs so maybe we can weather this storm. But the reality is we cant do this without your help. 109 exists to help other nonprofits and grassroots organizations (both financially and in-person volunteering) around the world while helping transform the lives of our participants. And now for the first time we are realizing that as a small nonprofit ourselves we need to be asking our community for support. Without your help well need to close the doors on this dream of 109. Any support you may be able to offer will move mountains in terms of the impact we have created and hope to continue to create in the world.   Who will this fundraiser help?   Who is writing this text and creating this fundraiser is me Leticia Co-founder   Executive Director of 109 World. I have been managing 109 and finding ways to continue adding value to our incredible community and local partners around the world for the past 5 years.   I have two co-founders and I will be forever grateful for them and their dedication to 109 from the very start. As happens with so many of us though in 2017 they transitioned their careers and I found myself leading the organization solo. Going from a 3 to a 1 person team really hindered the organization and led to some really challenging times. I thought that was the end for 109. I didnt pay myself a salary for over a year put my personal savings into the organization led several events by myself worked countless hours and slept so few. Eventually I burnt out. Went to the hospital twice with abdominal pain that nobody knew what it was. Later it was “labelled” stress by a doctor who said something that stuck with me: “Leticia you are the only one that knows how to make this pain go away.” And he was right I knew I needed to ask for help. Thats when I decided to hire a partner-in-crime.   Early 2018 with no money and recovering from a really difficult year I hired Savannah Carlson. If you know 109 you know how bright of a light Savannah is. From day 1 she has always given 109% of herself to the organization. I have never seen anything like that - I knew I needed help but I didnt fully realize how helpful someone could be until I met her.     Working tirelessly together in a little over a year we curated and hosted seven mindfulness and volunteer retreats supported over 185 alumni and five incredible grassroots organizations. We built the biggest sea turtle sanctuary in Mexico; raised funds for an orphanage in Thailand; funded built and installed rainwater harvesting systems after the hurricanes in Puerto Rico; transformed a little cafe in Marrakech into a school for the local community (for boys AND girls); and raised funds to ensure girls were educated on their rights. We of course went through many challenges during this period but we persisted. This time is and feels different. The Coronavirus has halted all international travel and made it impossible for us to host our mindfulness and volunteer retreats — which has been the heart of our model and theory of change. In these uncertain times the only thing we are certain of is that we will no longer be able to run 109 without your help. Hence this GoFundMe Page #SmallBusinessRelief.     The Costs   Savannah and I are the only paid and full-time employees at 109. Our salaries are US$2500 per month and our other monthly bills total US$2339 (Google Mad Mimi PayPal Wp Engine QuickBooks Classy Donor Management Gusto Brian Frank Accounting Htmlsig Cloudfare Canva and Facebook/Instagram Ads ). Our total monthly costs are US$7339. Starting April 15th we wont have the funds to cover any of our bills anymore nor to pay ourselves any salary.  So if you are in a position of helping we humbly ask you to donate to this fundraiser. All donations are tax-deductible and 100% of the money raised will go to our monthly costs and to give us space to breathe and rethink how 109 can become a stronger and more innovative organization that can continue to create impact and add value to our community for years to come. We know we will need to pivot quickly in order to respond to our calling and we are so appreciative for any help or support you may be able to offer.     How You Can Help    We are going through this together day by day doing our best to make a positive impact on society at a moment in time when there are no easy solutions.  For 109 we are already having our lives affected by the coronavirus and being harmed by our countrys very necessary efforts to stop its spread. Without help our work will be lost if we need to close to wait for this storm to pass we may struggle to reopen into what could be a very unstable economy.  My heart hurts when imagining what might be. But I also have hope.  I hope that this uncertain time brings us together by showing us how connected we are and how much we depend on one another.  And now more than ever 109 depends on you on your kindness and generosity. If you can donate please kindly consider supporting this fundraiser. If you cant help financially please help us get the word out by sharing the link to our GoFundMe Page on Facebook Instagram your newsletter via email and or any other platform that speaks to you!  And please take care of yourselves and your community. We need each other.  Thank you for letting me be vulnerable.  From the bottom of my heart  Leticia

title: Melanie Metz Massage Therapy COVID-19 Relief
description: My practice was shut down to help prevent the spread of COVID-19.  According to governor Walzs executive orders 20-04   20-08  my business must remain closed from March 17th  until May 1st. I am happy to be doing my part to help flatten the curve and slow the spread of this novel Coronavirus.   Because I am an independent practitioner I am not able to collect unemployment as many others are in this situation. In the meantime I have business expenses including rent at 2 locations and personal expenses to cover while my business is closed.  GoFundMe will match $500 in grant money to help sustain my small business if I am able to raise at lease $500.   For anyone in the Minneapolis or Champlin MN area you will receive 25% off your next massage for any donation amount  you contribute even if it is just $1.  Please include your name in the donation so I can add your name to the discount list.  I will apply that discount at the time of your session.  I realize many others are also struggling and I am doing my part to help as well.  I will be donating what and when I am able to.    Thank you so much for your support!  Stay healthy and I hope to see you for a therapeutic massage soon!     MelanieMetzMassage.com    #SmallBusinessRelief

title: Fight CoVid19 Call for PPE supplies
description: Hello.  I hope you and your loved ones are staying healthy safe and well.   In times of uncertainties it makes people think of what we can do in their own little way to help those who are affected of CoVid19.   I as a Nurse am doing a fundraising effort to provide much needed supplies for our FRONTLINERS in hospitals in need in Metro Manila.  Being able to work as a Frontliner I know the risks that the entire team has to take. Working without proper PPE (gowns mask eyeshield as well as hand sanitizers) can put both the patients and the healthcares lives on the line too. I have seen a lot of plea from people across Philippines asking for donations for PPE to support our Hospitals and most still experience scarcity of supplies.   We are risking our lives for people coming in the hospitals every single day. I hope you can protect ustoo.   I am asking you to help us raise funds to provide supplies (e.g masks gowns sanitizers) in hospitals in need in Metro Manila. Instead of feeling frustratedand helpless especially for us who are away from home I want to reach out and use this platform to come together and do what we can do.  I have set up this online fundraising account to buy and allocate much needed supplies for hospitals we will be reaching out to. The page will also be updated so you will know where the funds are going and which hospitals will receive the supplies.     Thank you in advance.

title: Support Channel Islands Scuba CoVid-19
description: Help keep our local Dive Shop in business during the CoVid-19 event.  Channel Islands Scuba has been in business since 1988 and we pride ourselves on providing the finest Scuba Instruction Service and Products in the Conejo Valley and beyond. We want to be there for our current and future Divers when we can return to the ocean. Donations will enable us to meet payroll for our employees and meet basic financial obligations to ensure we can re-open our doors.  Donations will be provided with an equivalent value in air fills equipment service (labor) and / or rental equipment credit when we can re-open for business so please include your name so we know who to thank when you can come in next!  #SmallBusinessRelief

title: COVID-19 Support for Brandy Library Family
description: As many people are reeling from the effects of COVID-19 perhaps no industry has been hit harder than the service industry. Like many small businesses within the service industry our employees collect tips which are the primary source of their livelihoods. Being forced to close due to the current crisis has put a significant drain on their cash flow. As a company we are working hard to find ways to continue to support our team and to ensure we can return to full strength just as soon as the all clear has been given. Please help the family of Brandy Library by simply pledging what you would normally tip during a stay with your favorite bartender sommelier server etc. All gifts collected will go directly to our hourly employees to offset their lost wages. We appreciate your generosity and look forward to seeing you in our beautiful lounge of amber spirits very soon!

title: Endgame Bar & Restaurant COVID-19
description: Hello Friends and Family  Starting March 16th 2020 the Governor of the state of Washington Jay Inslee signed a mandate to close all restaurants breweries nightclubs and bars to for Washington State. This action is meant to help flatten the curve and ultimately spread of COVID-19 aka the Coronavirus. We have fully committed to comply to this mandate and have taken extra precautionary measures to ensure peoples health and safety.  To mitigate the situation and still generate revenue  we have focused on online delivery takeout and gift certificate sales. For transparency over 90% of our business revenue is generated from alcohol sales and unfortunately our new strategies are not generating enough funds to cover monthly expenses. So that humbly brings us to the point where we need ask our friends family and the community for help.  Endgame has always focused on creating a fun nerdy and inclusive atmosphere and in our first 6 months of being open we believe we stayed true that vision thanks to our awesome customers and community. All donations will go to expenses until we are able to resume normal operations with earliest date being April 6th for Washington State.  Austin and I have put everything we have into this adventure and we hope to continue to provide a fun place for everyone when all of this over. Please only donate if you are able to these are uncertain times for all us so we dont to have others to extend beyond their means. We for those who are unable to donate we ask to share our fundraiser with others in hopes of spreading the word.  Thank you for all the support  -Endgame Bar   Restaurant Michael Lamere   Austin Sines

title: Majos contra el COVID-19
description: Hola a tod@s. Debido a la situación que se esta viviendo de desabastecimiento en hospitales por la pandemia del COVID-19 queremos juntar dinero para mandar cosas tan básicas como botellas de agua a hospitales como La Princesa en Madrid hospital General de Segovia o la Paz en Madrid también  que lo están necesitando. Si!! Algo tan básico como botellas de agua. Esto en prensa no sale pero es un problema gravisimo y real. Ayuda por favor. Gracias.

title: Masks to Fight COVID19 - Univ. of KS Health System
description: As you know many hospitals have a huge shortage of masks and PPE.  Kansas City has a big problem as the  University of Kansas Hospital System  (KU Med) has limited masks for healthcare providers. Healthcare professionals are having to reuse one mask each and have no supply.  My sister-in-law works at the hospital and I want us to come together to help them during this crisis.  I am fundraising to buy 2200 masks shipped in three parts.   First from a vendor Changzhou Meditech Trading Co. on Alibaba in which I secured and have already ordered from . 200 masks will arrive at the hospitals warehouse on Monday March 30th which cost $166. They ship UPS and provide tracking and ship fast.  The second order from this vendor will be placed for 1000 masks to ship immediately the costs $625. They have been Verified onsite and the order comes with Trade Assurance. Obviously this is higher per face mask than wed like at .53 cents a mask. However time is of the essence.  Finally a third order for significantly cheaper masks from an USA vendor Thomas Scientific has been placed for 1000 masks to be shipped on 4/9 which cost significantly less. However with the time delay and shipping they will be delivered three weeks from the order date.   https://www.thomassci.com/Laboratory-Supplies/Laboratory-Exam-Gloves/_/CARE-3-Ply-Ear-Loop-Face-Masks?q=CARE%203-Ply%20Ear%20Loop%20Face%20Masks    Total cost is $867 but I am also chipping in.  Please donate and SHARE this within your community. As well I encourage each of you to support your local hospitals through grassroots efforts. Hospitals cant get around the red tape often involved in buying supplies themselves but we can by DONATE PPE to them.  Collectively we can make a big impact if we start focusing on helping healthcare professionals community by community.

title: Help On The Side Books survive COVID-19
description: Once upon a time I opened a bookstore...almost 3 years ago to the day. Since then we have been steadily growing despite numerous setbacks with my Lyme diagnosis and flare-ups. Fast forward to 2020...the bookstore was doing better than ever with tons of promise with numerous events and opportunities on the schedule...all to come to a screeching halt with COVID-19. Im swallowing a lot of pride posting this and asking for help... but I do need your help. I love Bradford. I love serving our community. I love my customers. Im a firm believer that every town needs a bookstore and Im scared of where On The Side Books will be on the other side of this shut down.  The funds will be used towards the mortgage and bills on the building so there will be something to go back to after this is all said and done. Every little bit helps...and if everyone pitched in a little bit it would make a huge difference for On The Side Books.  If you are unable to make a donation all I ask is that you please share this so it might reach individuals who may be in the position to make a contribution.   If you would prefer to support On The Side Books by making a purchase you can do so here:   https://bookshop.org/shop/onthesidebooks     Be sure to follow us on FB for updates and giveaways:  www.facebook.com/onthesidebooks    #SmallBusinessRelief

title: Support Pi Phi Kitchen Staff Through COVID-19
description: We are looking to support those in need who have done so much to support us! Angeles (Chef) Claudia (Hasher) and Cintia (Hasher) work everyday to make Stanford Pi Beta Phi a home to many undergraduate students. The care they put into cooking cleaning and supporting us is truly remarkable. Thanks to COVID-19 and Stanford having to shut undergraduate housing they have all lost their jobs for the foreseeable future. This is absolutely devastating in the current job market. Please consider donating to them to help get them and their families through this difficult time. Any donation is appreciated! The goal is to help in any way we can and show them how much we appreciate them. Thank you! :)

title: Support Luna Brand Management During COVID-19
description: As with every small business we find ourselves in a predicament where overnight our companys ability to make money has been severely impacted and our existing client base has almost evaporated.   In the 4.5 years since we opened we have served small businesses nationally helping with all of their branding and online needs (websites social media reputation management tech support etc.) Our work has been locally acclaimed and in 2019 we were named the #1 marketing firm in Converse TX. Our mission since day 1 has been to bring clients a brand they can be over the moon about.  But now we are faced with a perilous situation. Due to COVID-19 something we all could have never predicted or planned for we are struggling to financially support our employees who are without a doubt some of the greatest people to ever grace this Earth.   Our hope in starting this GoFundMe is to help our employees maintain the quality of life they deserve. Our company is 100% female operated and like so many others we have families and children to support and careers to keep dominating.    Whether it be $1 or $5 if we hit $500 GoFundMe will provide a small business grant to our firm and every dollar will go back to helping the women who have built Luna Brand Management.   Thank you for reading.

title: UK Citizens stuck in Australia due to COVID-19
description: Hi everyone! I hope youre all staying safe!  Myself my fiancé best friend and partner are currently stranded in Australia due to the impact of COVID-19. Despite being called home by the British Government flights are being cancelled and soon will come to a complete hault meaning we cannot get home. The few flights that are available are thousands of dollars which we do not have increasing every day and are likely to get cancelled as most already have been.  The only help the British Consulate have given us is the advice to “take out another credit card”. We are no longer able to work due to recent closures as a result of the coronavirus. Which means very soon we will run out of money and have no means to afford rent or food  I appreciate that there are many many people in situations more scary than ours right now but if anyone can help by contributing any money at all it would mean the world to us.  Love to you all and stay safe x

title: COVID-19  Aiutiamo chi ci mette il Cuore
description: AIUTIAMO CHI CI METTE IL CUORE Uniti contro il Coronavirus per il Reparto di Nefrologia dellOspedale Giovanni XXIII di Bergamo e per lIstituto di Ricerche Farmacologiche  Mario Negri IRCCS.  “Lessere umano è fragile e vulnerabile e vive in una relazione di cura in ogni momento della sua vita. In questo senso la cura è il grado zero della nostra umanità la possibilità stessa di esistere.”  Questa citazione è tratta dal libro Questioni etiche nel caregiving. Contesto biopolitico e relazione di cura di Monia Andreani (Carocci 2017).    “Curare”  indica il processo di diagnosi e scelta del percorso terapeutico idoneo per guarire una persona  “prendersi cura”  introduce in questo processo la dimensione della relazionalità.  Allora il curare una malattia diventa prendersi cura di una persona che in quel momento richiede aiuto.  Due anni fa ho chiesto aiuto al Prof. Piero Ruggenenti oggi Direttore del Reparto di Nefrologia dellOspedale di Bergamo per la grave patologia renale di cui mio padre era affetto denominata glomerulonefrite membranosa.   Con il Prof. Ruggenenti ho dialogato a distanza e subito ho trovato un uomo di scienza e di sentimento pronto ad instaurare una relazione di aiuto.   Oggi mio padre è sensibilmente migliorato grazie all importante ricerca  condotta dal Prof. Ruggenenti dal Prof. Remuzzi da tutti i collaboratori della Nefrologia dellOspedale di Bergamo e dai ricercatori dellIstituto di Ricerche Farmacologiche Mario Negri IRCCS che hanno elaborato nuove terapie sicure ed efficaci per il trattamento di queste patologie.   In tempi difficili come questi dovuti al Coronavirus raccogliamo fondi per chi lo combatte con il cuore. Diamo il nostro supporto al Reparto di Nefrologia dellOspedale di Bergamo e allIstituto di Ricerche Farmacologiche Mario Negri IRCCS per finanziare le 4 linee di ricerca per la terapia contro il Covid-19.     Anche una piccola donazione può fare la differenza.     Insieme ce la faremo grazie di cuore.     Per informazione sullIstituto di Ricerche Farmacologiche Mario Negri IRCCS    Per informazioni sul Reparto di Nefrologia dellOspedale di Bergamo                                  LETS HELP THOSE WHO WORK WITH  HEARTFELT PASSION      United against Coronavirus for the Nephrology Department and  Mario Negri Institute for Pharmacological Research   “The human being is fragile and vulnerable and lives in a caring relationship in every moment of his life. In this sense care is at the basis of any human relashionship it is the real essence of our existence.  This quote is taken from the book Ethical Issues in caregiving. Biopolitical context and care relationship by Monia Andreani (Carocci 2017).   To cure  includes the diagnosis process and the choice of the appropriate therapeutic path to heal a person while  to take care  involves the value of the human relationship into this process. Hence curing a disease and  taking care of a person overlap when they concern people who need help.  Two years ago I asked Prof. Piero Ruggenenti the present Director of the Nephrology Department of Bergamo Hospital for help as my father was affected by a serious kidney disease known as membranous glomerulonephritis.   I kept in touch with Prof. Ruggenenti only by email and phone and I immediately found a warm-hearted man of science ready to establish a scientific as well as human relationship.   Today my fathers health has significantly improved thanks to the important research by Prof. Ruggenenti and Prof. Remuzzi along with all the collaborators at the Nephrology Department and the researchers at the Mario Negri Institute for Pharmacological Research IRCCS who have developed new safe and effective therapies for the treatment of these deseases.   The Coronavirus is giving us tough times lets raise funds for those who work with passionate heart against it. Lets support in this way the activity of Nephrology Department of Giovanni XXIII Hospital in Bergamo and the 4 different researches against Covid-19 of Mario Negri Institute IRCCS.    Even a small donation can make a big difference.    Together we can do it many thanks from the bottom of my hearth.                               AYUDAMOS A QUIENES PONEN SU CORAZÓN  EN LO QUE HACEN  Unidos contra el Coronavirus para el Departamento de Nefrología del Hospital Giovanni XXIII en Bérgamo y el Instituto de Investigación Farmacológica   “El ser humano es frágil y vulnerable y vive en una relación de cuidado en cada momento de su vida. En este sentido el cuidado es el grado cero de nuestra humanidad la posibilidad misma de existir.  Esta cita está tomada del libro Cuestiones éticas en el cuidado. Contexto biopolítico y relación de cuidado de Monia Andreani (Carocci 2017).  Curar indica el proceso de diagnóstico y la elección del camino terapéutico adecuado para sanar a una persona cuidar introduce la dimensión de la relacionalidad en este proceso. Entonces la cura de una enfermedad se convierte en cuidar a una persona que en ese momento necesita ayuda.  Hace dos años pedí ayuda al Prof. Piero Ruggenenti hoy Director del Departamento de Nefrología del Hospital de Bérgamo para la enfermedad renal grave con la que se vio afectado mi padre llamada glomerulonefritis membranosa.   Hablé con el profesor Ruggenenti a distancia e inmediatamente encontré un hombre de ciencia y sentimiento listo para establecer una relación de ayuda.  Hoy mi padre ha mejorado significativamente gracias a la investigación autorizada realizada por el Prof. Ruggenenti Prof. Remuzzi por todos los colaboradores de Nefrología del Hospital de Bérgamo y por los investigadores del Instituto de Investigación Farmacológica Mario Negri que han desarrollado nuevos terapias seguras y efectivas para el tratamiento de estas patologías.  En tiempos difíciles como estos debido al Coronavirus recaudamos fondos para aquellos que luchan con el corazón . Brindamos nuestro apoyo al Departamento de Nefrología del Hospital de Bérgamo y al Instituto de Investigación Farmacológica Mario Negri para financiar las 4 líneas de investigación para la terapia contra Covid-19.  Incluso una pequeña donación puede hacer la diferencia.  Juntos lo lograremos muchas gracias.

title: Support The Clue Room: COVID-19 Relief
description: The Clue Room has been a part of the South Metro small business community for nearly 6 years. We have hosted parties and gatherings for families team-builders from over 200 companies in the DTC and donated to various schools and non-profits throughout this time. Now more than ever we need your support as we navigate these unprecedented times. Like many small businesses the Coronavirus pandemic has made keeping the business open extremely difficult. As a family-owned business The Clue Room needs your help! Please support in any way you can.  Feel free to check out our website to learn more about The Clue Room:  www.theclueroom.com  #SmallBusinessRelief

title: Support Sportball South Bay - COVID-19 Crisis
description: Hi Families   First off we wanted to thank you for your support during the COVID-19 crisis.  Every bit helps as we try to navigate through these trying times.  We also hope this finds you and your family well and safe.  Sportball South Bay is a family owned small business in South Bay by Coach Richie Amanda and baby Payton.  We are a multi-sport program for kids 16 months - 12 years teaching sports cognitive social and gross motor skills through classes at various preschools daycares school districts and parks.  Being in our 2nd year of ownership and still new entrepreneurs the COVID-19 pandemic has hit us extremely hard.  With school districts closed until further notice park programs being canceled for our Spring Season and preschools not opening at this point until May we are facing the risk of Sportball not returning in the same capacity we were before all of this.  The reality of this all could be us having to let our coaching staff go not offer as many programs in the area stepping away from some of our schools or on a worst case not being able to return other than to finish the classes that need to be made up at locations already paid for.    We were given an amazing opportunity to purchase Sportball 2 years ago and fulfill something that has always been a dream of ours; making a difference in the lives of the children and families in our community.  If youve taken a class with Coach Richie before you will hear his gratitude to everyone in all of our programs as we all never thought we would be doing something that we are so passionate about as a career and to think something beyond all of our control could possibly change that is heartbreaking to us all.   We are now asking for our communities help and support during these times.  Our goal is to be able to raise enough to continue to pay our coaches keep our family above water and be able to return to offering all our programs when life returns to normal again.  With the amount of time expected to be closed to keep our expenses paid we will have gone through all capital set aside for coaches pay and in turn when returning to our classes will not have the funds to be able to initially pay our coaches continue our licensing keep our personal expenses paid for ect. as during this time without programs running there is no income coming in.  Anything helps!    Every Wednesday and Friday we will still be coming to you live from our living room and offering you all a way to keep active have those little ones burn off energy and have fun while we are all going through this together.    It is a humbling experience asking for your communities support and I remind myself that this moment was beyond anyones control.  Something that I know I would have never imagined in my wildest dreams would happen.  When I say this I speak on behalf of our entire Sportball South Bay team that we are sincerely grateful for you support help and encouragement throughout this all.    Thank you   Coach Richie Amanda   baby Payton  #SmallBusinessRelief

title: Family of 6 Evicted During COVID-19 Epidemic
description: Nakia Johnny and Nakias kids were evicted from their apartment in Harrisonburgs Harris Gardens on March 24th one week after Virginia Governor Ralph Northam issued an eviction moratorium due to the global COVID-19 outbreak. While public health experts are warning people to stay home the property manager at Harris Gardens has cast this family out on the street and with no where else to go they face the prospect of separation and an increased risk of exposure to the COVID-19 virus (which is of particular concern due to Nakias pre-existing health conditions) at the only homeless shelter in town with available space. Please give what you can to help this family get back on their feet.   (I am a volunteer caseworker with Shenandoah Mutual Aid. I have been assisting Nakia and Johnny throughout this crisis and I have their permission to conduct this fundraiser on their behalf.)

title: Support Ten Thousand Villages through COVID-19
description: Over the last 15 years Ten Thousand Villages in Ann Arbor has helped struggling artisans in 30 developing countries worldwide by purchasing almost $5 million of their handicrafts for resale. As a nonprofit retail store our revenue is  the essence  of our ethical fair trade model that provides essential financing and development for Ten Thousand Villages artisan partners around the world. Through our extensive investment model and our commitment to artisan development we are able to empower families ignite social change and inspire and strengthen communities.  The recent forced closure of our store due to Covid-19 means we have no revenue  and we need your help to cover our rent utilities payroll and other expenses. Our staff and volunteers are our Ten Thousand Villages family and they need your support at this time.   Our artisans from developing countries may suffer the most. We want to make sure we have enough cash flow to start supporting them by purchasing from their artisan groups immediately upon reopening the store rather than scrambling just to keep the lights on.   We are asking for your urgent support to ensure Ten Thousand Villages can continue to pursue our mission of promoting dignity hope and a living wage for artisans around the world by selling their handicrafts.  Any amount will help! Thank you for your continued support of Ten Thousand Villages. #SmallBusinessRelief

title: Help Mask Vancouver Homeless Against COVID-19
description: We are raising money to help provide effective masks to the most vulnerable neighbourhood in Vancouver BC during this COVID-19 crisis. It is borderline impossible for the homeless in the DTES to keep socially isolated and maintain the mandated distance from each other. All the volunteers in the DTES deserve to be protected to stop exposure and spread of the COVID-19 virus. Everyone is close together due to limited space and overcrowded streets shelters and SROs...in other words if one person is infected with the virus everyone is going to be infected. We realize this is a state of emergency and need your help to take preventative measures immediately!  The Four Directions Trading Post took on the work of the DTES Street Market in the Summer of 2018.  It is a public market that operates year-round offering carefully crafted intentional and diverse collection of tented stalls and/ or “day tables” which are available to members/vendors of the community to use to sell their crafts merchandise (gathered from their wholesaler local donation sites and the movie industry) gently-used clothing DVDs books hand tools sporting gear and non-perishable items like laundry soap and make-up shampoo and pens.    The market exists to fulfill a public purpose which is to have outreach to our most vulnerable community and alleviate the financial stress experienced by individuals experiencing poverty.  It also showcases the communitys unique character and culture while serving its everyday shopping needs.       During the current COVID19 pandemic the City of Vancouver has insisted that we close the market so we have found opportunities for vendors and peer workers to earn much needed extra dollars to survive. They have been tasked with keeping the worst area of East Hastings Street free of needles and garbage offer hand washing stations and training on best practices for staying safe and clean. They have also been engaged to provide crowd control at the social service offices and the local bank.    The management team has been working daily and constantly to keep our peers supplied with gloves and masks. Were out.  We do not have access to what we need to keep everyone safe. Its clear that the most vulnerable in the community are stepping up to do their best for others.  They need your help.  It seems every other community but the DTES has preventative measures in place. Its imperative that we get ahead of what could be a true disaster. For those out there sitting at home isolated wondering what you can do to help this is the perfect opportunity. Every single dollar counts! Please help us help the most vulnerable by donating what you can. Thank you from all of us in the DTES!   http://fdtp.ca/    https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Downtown_Eastside

title: Help Boston Medical Providers Fight COVID-19
description: Social distancing is not the only way you can support our society at this critical moment.  We urgently need your support!  Our Boston hospitals and primary care offices are in urgent need of PPE.  Medical staff have been asked to re-use their masks for months! Some nurses even work without adequate protection.  N95 and surgical masks are in critically short supply.  Please join us to help our front-line doctors nurses and medical staff to stay safe while fighting COVID-19!  Our goal is to purchase masks face shields gloves and other PPE through business channels out of China and elsewhere.  Recently we have found reliable supplies fit-tested masks and confirmed their safety for medical use in caring for COVID-19 patients.  The first round of our campaign aims to purchase 5000 good quality KN95 masks and distribute them to primary care and hospital clinical staff around Boston.  $20 will buy 10 KN95 masks.  $110 will buy a room HEPA air filter to reduce infection risk in an exam room.    Any amount will help! We will keep you updated of any purchases and shipment with this campaign.  Please spread the word and help us achieve this goal!  ???????????????????????????????????????????????????????????ICU?????????????5000?KN95????????????????????!???????????????????????????????????????!  ??????????????update?????????!

title: RRCC Employee Covid-19 Fund
description: This fund gives members of Red Rock Country Club an opportunity to voluntarily assist RRCC staff who are experiencing work interruption as a result of the COVID-19 crisis. Funds will be distributed proportionally to all affected staff based on hours and wages/tips lost.

title: City Dogs Daycare Staff - COVID-19
description: We are raising money to directly benefit our wonderful and dedicated staff at City Dogs.  Many of our loyal customers have asked how they can directly support our staff so we have set up this GoFundMe in response.  We have set a goal of $5000 which is about 20% of our 2 week payroll.  As a pet service and supplies business we are still open during the DC shutdown.  As most businesses have experienced during this time our daily # customers served has been decimated due to the COVID-19 response.  Our daily number of customers served has been approximately reduced by 80% (or were only seeing 20% of the customers we normally see).  From our 2 locations out of 27 employees weve had to temporarily lay off 19 plus an additional 8 staff members with reduced hours.  We are working with our staff to make sure they are connected to unemployment and other opportunities for assistance and monitoring legislation being passed by the DC Council and US Congress.  We look forward to bringing them all back as soon as possible.  100% of these funds will be divided by the affected staff.  If youd like to support the business itself please consider buying a daycare package or coming to our store at 301 H Street NE and loading up on dog supplies.  Wed really appreciate it!

title: My dog nearly died then my job eliminated-Corona
description: Summary: On March 8th my normally spunky healthy adopted dog began vomiting. It seemed unstoppable. Two hospitals and several days later she survived but only after crashing being revived and then surviving a frightening surgery. Little did I know then but in less than just over a week later my employer would decide to terminate my employment (they chose to terminate about 30% of the staff in the organization on March 21st 2020 due to Covid-19). Sassafras is recovering but Im stuck with a huge bill. If you can even spare a dollar it will help.  The rest of the story (it is so long that I thought I wouldnt bore you if youd prefer not to read the whole thing): By the evening of Sunday March 8th she was severely dehydrated her heart was racing and she was still vomiting (even though I had withheld food since 3/7).  That night (3/8/20) at PetCare East in Santa Rosa (Emergency and Specialty clinic) they hospitalized her in the critical care unit after doing X-rays and lab work to try to figure out what was making her so sick. The following day (3/9) the Veterinary Internal Medicine Specialist performed an abdominal ultrasound and found an intestinal blockage. They immediately prepped her for surgery and when they started to sedate her she crashed. Her heart was stopping for 5 seconds at a time and it took them 2 hours to revive her. The atropine (cardiac drug) that is used in heart failure to get the heart beating again had the opposite effect on her. They notified me that she was in a very critical situation and the only hope of saving her was to get her to UC Davis Veterinary Teaching Hospital. PetCare Easts bill was $2452. It is on credit cards as my pet insurance should (though they havent approved yet) pay 80%. Fingers crossed!    I left work as soon as I got the call on March 9th and drove up to pick her up (1.5 hours away) and transport her to UC Davis. Upon arrival at PetCare East I was led back to see her she tried to stand and collapsed and passed out. We had to wait to allow them to stabilize her before transporting her to Davis. I had a friend with years of Veterinary experience ride with me to assist with the tracking of her heart and respiration rate. As we left PetCare East they told me that if she arrested I should get to an Emergency Clinic ASAP and to not stop to attempt CPR. It was a nerve-racking drive. When we arrived it was dark. I dont know what time it was as I just was trying to get her there alive I just know it was night now.  Unbelievably she was still throwing up. After many hours and exams they called in a cardiologist to do a detailed EKG of her heart. They said that they needed to do another abdominal ultrasound as well as a cardiac ultrasound before determining how or if to proceed. I left and after driving my friend home I arrived home at 4:30 am. On my drive home the Doctor that we had seen at UC Davis called to tell me the additional estimate of the fees to do the ultrasounds. I needed to call back and pay that for them to take care of her overnight and proceed with the ultrasounds in the morning. They also wanted the estimate entire estimate before the surgery department would even talk about prognosis with me.  In the early morning on March 10th I slept for a brief time and woke up at 6:30 to begin calling my dogs health insurance company (Healthy Paws). I started accumulating the invoices and records that they requested. I went to work and waited for a call from the Veterinarians at UC Davis. They called just before noon and let me know that Sassafras (my dog) heart looked anatomically healthy (the chambers valves etc.) on the ultrasound but she had a sinus node dysfunction for unknown reasons (could be the how ill she was or something previously unknown) and would need a temporary pacemaker implanted to do the surgery obstruction surgery. They felt that the blockage (foreign body) appeared roundish and maybe fabric. I kept trying to think of any toys or material that she may have ingested. I am super careful and vigilant with my dogs and toys. They wanted to get the surgery started ASAP but the prognosis depended on many variables including if the affected bowel was viable. The total bill at UC Davis was $6681.80 (though they charged $8450. and I have to wait 4-6 weeks to be refunded the $1768.20 overcharge.     Thankfully Sassafras made it through the surgery and was weaned off the pacemaker the next day. She was released from ICU on March 12th and able to come home on the evening of March 13th. Shockingly the obstruction was a peach pit! I have a neighbor that throws them off his deck into the bushes next to the sidewalk that we use. Ive pulled many peach pits out of my two dogs mouths but obviously missed one! I vaguely remember hearing her crunch on something next to those bushes about 6 weeks ago but when I swept her mouth I didnt find anything. Now I know that she must have swallowed it before I swept her mouth. :-( Sassys liver was highly inflamed at the time of surgery and the biopsy came back as inflammatory in substance no cancer thank God! Her urine is dilute and she got a urinary tract infection post-op. So we are watching her kidneys. We will need to follow up with the Cardiologist but they think that she is good and that all of these abnormalities were caused by how sick she was from the peach pit. They are really really dangerous to dogs. A kind RVT (Registered Veterinary Technician) friend sent me this link.   https://www.google.com/.../the-pits-about-peach-pits%3fhs..  .  I had my first follow up with my regular vet on 3/18 and they ran a urinalysis and prescribed an antibiotic for the UTI. I got out of there for just $61.35.  More follow-ups are scheduled with the Cardiologist and Internal Medicine Specialist. The good news is Sassy is thriving and back to herself. I am grateful for her life and also hopeful that she will have a full recovery. Then on Friday March 20th my job was eliminated due to Covid-19. No severance or anything. So even though I am hoping that the pet insurance will pay 80% of the nearly $10K bill the remaining bills are still daunting with no income. I hate to reach out for help during such a trying time but even a dollar or two would help right now. Thank you for reading this long story. I posted the bills for you to review also. If you want I can email you a better copy (Go Fund Me limits the size of attachments).  You can see Sassys spunk in this video -   https://youtu.be/hWVhLjdrRMw     THANK YOU for your good healing thoughts! Please feel free to share her story. She is the little engine that could!

title: Zarpazo al COVID-19
description: Ante estos momentos tan difíciles que estamos atravesando Orgullo Cazurro quiere aportar su granito de arena para hacer frente a esta pandemia.  Para ello hemos decidido poner en marcha esta campaña en la que el dinero recaudado será entregado al hospital de León para la compra de material sanitario u otros efectivos necesarios para frenar la situación.  ¡Ayudando todos venceremos! Se cazurro no ceses y ayuda.

title: Aide pour les familles au Maroc (sans revenues)
description: Salam alikom  Comme on le sait tous il y a plusieurs familles qui souffrent en ce moment à cause de confinement...  inchallah on les aidera avec ce quon peut pour les faire sortir de ces conditions!  Ta9abbala Allah menna wa minkom et 3wacherkom mabrouka!

title: Fight not Flight - Zoodoo Covid19 Crisis
description: During this COVID-19 shut down our dedicated staff are giving their time to maintain positive welfare for our animals while we try to get through these tough times.  Unlike other businesses those in the animal care scene cannot simply shut down their ongoing expenses when the doors close.    As a visitation funded park we need all the help we can get!  Your donation will help us maintain species-specific diets specialized care and medications / treatments during the Covid-19 shut down.     www.zoodoo.com.au

title: PPE for MIA Resident Physicians fighting COVID-19
description: Our world has been rattled by the pandemic of COVID-19. As health care workers our first priority is the safety of the community. To provide this care we need to protect ourselves and you all through the use of personal protective equipment (PPE) to curtail the spread of this virus .   We are a group of resident physicians at Jackson Memorial Hospital a public trust hospital for Miami-Dade County and the 3rd largest hospital in the United States. We along with other health professionals are at the front lines of the COVID-19 epidemic working tirelessly to provide the best care we can to our patients; this is our honor and our oath.   Currently one of the biggest concerns is the diminishing quantities of personal protective equipment (PPE) including N95 masks gowns gloves and face shields. Cases continue to increase exponentially and PPE allows health care workers to limit the spread further    As it stands Miami-Dade has the highest amount of cases in the state of Florida and the predicted trajectory is only upwards in the coming weeks. With a lack of protective gear we not only put the health of Miami in jeopardy we also put ourselves in danger of not being able to serve our community due to transmission.   We are fundraising to get the PPE that is essential for us to maintain the workforce to treat our patients in a safe manner prevent spread in hospitals and provide safety for the community.   PPE costs approximately $40 per box. We recognize that this is a difficult and scary time for many people- economically emotionally and physically. We will not give up and we are committed to the health of Miami-Dade.  Our team appreciates any support donation or sharing of this message. Any help you can offer is greatly appreciated and will go a long way in helping us keep our community safe.   Please please stay home if you can utilize social distancing stay safe and wash those hands!  As we work as a community This too shall pass.

title: Frontline Nurses Fight Against COVID-19
description: Dear friends  I hope youre all healthy and staying safe in these treacherous times. After days of contemplation I have finally decided to write this plea and reach out to you all for help. As many of you know my husband works at a North Jersey Hospital and is on the front lines of the fight against COVID-19. It is no secret that hospitals are struggling not only to keep up with the care of the massive influx of patients suffering from this deadly virus but also to provide for their staff who are the primary caregivers of these patients.   As hospitals and suppliers are struggling to meet the demands of the situation the ones who bear the major brunt of this extreme shortage are the nurses. Nurses are the backbone of any hospital and without the nurses working in full force no hospital would be able to fight this pandemic.   These nurses have been putting in long and stressful hours fighting COVID-19 while having to also care and provide for their own families and kids back at home including additional child-care difficulty now that schools are closed. Some also have spouses and partners who may have been laid off or had hours or wages cut because of the current job situation and they have to manage that as well while putting on a brave front here in the hospitals for the benefit of all of us.  I have therefore set up a GoFundMe page to collect contributions towards showing appreciation for the nurses this could be ordering meals for the whole team at the hospital while they are on shift to providing meals for their families at home to providing any urgent critical personal protection equipment (PPE) that may be in immediate shortage in the hospital or critical equipment such as Respiratory Protection gear such as PAPRs.  Humanity has never before faced a crisis such as this and hopefully never should again. The nurses desperately need your help now more than ever before. Im reaching out to you today to please find it in your heart to donate any amount you can to my cause. With every dollar my husband can procure the necessary support needed for his staff and keep them safe and motivated in this hour of need.  If you could please support my GoFundMe by making a donation and sharing it with your network I would greatly appreciate it. I know that money can be tight in these times but please know that even $5 helps me get closer to my goal! Let me know if you have any questions and Ill be happy to answer them.

title: COVID-19 Ventilator Open Source Project
description: The Problem:    Due to the COVID-19 virus in the coming months projections suggest the US could have a shortfall of over 800000 ventilators. The US is likely to need over 1 million ventilators to treat COVID-19 patients but only has around 160000 ventilators nationwide. Currently US manufacturers produce just 14000 ventilators per year and some ventilator manufacturers are ramping up production by 40% so in a year they can produce 20000 ventilators.  There is simply no way for current manufacturers to even put a small dent in the number of ventilators required.    The Backstory:    COVID-19 Ventilators Inc. was formed to tackle this challenge.  The design team has created and is building a prototype of an Emergency Ventilator the brainchild of CEO Tarik Yousef.  Yousef is a Columbus Ohio resident - an engineer by training and a small business owner manufacturing fine furniture. Motivated by the data and the pandemic risks were currently facing he pulled a team of medical engineering and software experts together to design a system that can be both manufactured to support Ohios critical hospital capacity challenges and shared for others to modify and source for their own local needs.    In less than two weeks the team worked to create a system that mimics traditional ventilators but at a much lower cost.   Once the initial design was complete Yousef connected with co-founders Liz Stump and Amanat Ahmad to set up COVID-19 Ventilators Inc. to rapidly build a partner network to secure manufacturing and production materials processes and facility space for the various components. The organization is currently pending approval for 501(c)(3) status.    The Solution:    The Emergency Ventilator has comparable functionality to more sophisticated models with high precision sensors to ensure patient safety and provide real time data and a computer learning algorithm that detects changes and adjusts in real time.  Partnering with medical professionals Yousef has developed a product that he says is “one of the only emergency ventilators being developed with a proper control interface allowing medical professionals full access to volume pressure settings and data monitoring similar to traditional ventilators.”    The Need:    This project is moving extremely quickly - the design process started on March 16 2020 and a functional prototype of the Emergency Ventilator was built and is in testing in less than two weeks.  To turn the prototype into a scalable reality that can save lives COVID-19 Ventilators Inc. needs funding to build a small batch of Emergency Ventilators that can be tested in real life settings as early as the week of March 23 2020.  The initial prototype is completing basic in-house testing however we need your financial contribution immediately to:   Support the initial investment costs of the prototype and non-profit set-up Complete the final components of the first prototype Build 10 additional prototypes for clinical testing and FDA approval  As we raise additional funds all money will be invested in future Emergency Ventilator production costs.  If funds are raised and not needed they will be directed towards other non-profits supporting COVID-19 community needs.     More information and for contact information please see our website at:  www.covid19ventilator.org

title: Lajuma Research Centre Support Fund (COVID-19)
