description: In the beautiful Soutpansberg mountain range of South Africa amidst aardvarks pangolins  baboons and leopards is the  Lajuma Research Centre ; a place where students volunteers and research teams from foreign countries local universities and local disadvantaged communities gather to conduct research and to work towards conserving the wildlife of the awe-inspiring Vhembe biosphere reserve.   However due to COVID-19 and the subsequent South African travel limitations Lajuma Research Centre is suffering financially and could easily run out of funds as all researchers and much of the staff have had to leave the reserve. On their behalf a group of students researchers and volunteers are asking you to donate whatever you can to allow Lajuma research centre to continue their operations through these difficult times. If you are able to donate you will be supporting the continued research and conservation of species threatened with extinction.   We thank you for your support of wildlife conservation and research!    To learn more click here for Lajumas website    Projects at Lajuma Research Centre:   Earthwatch: Conserving Leopards and Monkeys in South Africa     Primate and Predator Project

title: Hole in the Wall COVID-19
description: If we reach $500  we will be matched thanks to Quickbooks partnering with Go Fund Me! This would help us tremendously in re-opening! If we could get 500 awesome people to donate $1  we will give away 10- $20 gift cards! Be sure to leave your name if  you want entered! #smallbizrelief

title: COVID-19 Heros
description: As nurses we are at the front line of this pandemic. The emergency room and intensive care units are both severely impacted by this situation. I am raising money to put together care packages for the nurses that are putting aside their fears and worries to care for our community. St. Marys is a community hospital in Hobart IN and it services several surrounding towns. At some point in this pandemic our nurses might be required to work overtime and even not be able to leave the hospital. Should this happen I want to make sure our nurses have snacks and other essentials!  We are so grateful at the generosity of several who have already donated. The baskets will cost about 200-300 per unit. Both units have a large staff! Should we meet our goal we will expand to other hospital units and other ancillary staff.

title: HELP Mauritius BEAT Covid19 : Anou aide nou Moris!
description: Fellow Mauritian Diaspora   To fight Covid19 in Mauritius we aim to PROTECT our front line Health Care professionals (DOCTORS NURSES etc) by supplying them with as much PPE (Protective Personal Equipment) e.g. surgical masks face shields overalls etc as we can source.  Any surplus masks will be donated to the general population to lower contagion. This is the only way to bring a semblance of normalcy on the Motherland as soon as possible.  Why this action? If healthcare professionals get infected this is bad for them but also have a compounding effect - because they can become infection vectors to a large number of other people. In addition every healthcare professional is essential right now - any reduction in staff availability will mean fewer people receive the urgent treatment they need. Masks will also become a key way in which life looks more normal again. Examples of Taiwan Hong Kong and South Korea show masks worn do reduce risk of infection so as the shutdown lifts masks will be one of the ways of controlling the risk.  Everybody knows everybody in Mauritius family and friends so we are all concerned. It is simply a unique place in the world and especially for us. Nou tizil sa!   We need your help right NOW!   All monies raised will be directed to buying and delivering the PPE to healthcare professionals in Mauritius and if there is any excess giving away to other members of the population. We have already looked into multiple sourcing options from China (the situation is evolving fast) and logistics of delivery. Based on the amount raised we will choose the supplier based on availability minimum order quantity delivery logistics and price. Time is of the essence.  Glory to thee Motherland  O Motherland of mine. Sweet is thy beauty Sweet is thy fragrance Around thee we gather As one people As one nation In peace justice and liberty. Beloved Country  May God bless thee For ever and ever.

title: Intubation Boxes for COVID-19 Providers.
description: The Intubation Box is an inexpensive temporary protection device originally devised by Dr Hsien Yung Lai in Taiwan.   We (ER doctors and designers) have taken his gracious design and altered it for the American body habitus.   The Intubation Box works by sitting over the head and shoulders of a patient as they are intubated by a provider.  The box acts as a protective shield between the patient and medical staff thereby minimizing spread of Coronavirus (COVID-19).  After each intubation the box can be cleaned with a bleach or an alcohol solution.  The 55% isopropyl alcohol Sani-Cloth wipes that hospitals have work perfectly as well.    We have quickly created this website so that people who need Intubation Boxes are able to request one or create one themselves.  For more information please visit:    https://intubationbox.com/  .     Thank you and please be safe.

title: N95 Masks for Doctors in Bangladesh for COVID-19
description: Help us donate essential high-grade N95 masks to frontline health care workers in Dhaka Bangladesh so that they can help take care of us during these unprecedented times. You can help 1 health care worker for as little as $6. Every bit helps!   **** March 28th 2020***    ***CAMPAIGN UPDATE:  We just crossed our initial goal! Thank you so much to everyone who donated to and shared this campaign or even just sent positive thoughts!  It has become clear to us that we are all feeling the same urge to help in this situation. Incredibly we reached our goal within the first 12 hours! But were not stopping here!  Since the shipment is scheduled to go out next week we will continue to collect donations for this campaign until Tuesday March 31 2020. This allows us to send more than the original amount of 500 essential N95 masks in this first shipment. Several hospitals have reached out to us saying that while there are some PPEs available there is still a severe need for N95 Masks and so we are adding 3 more hospitals to the original list:  Dhaka Medical Hospital  (newly added)  Mymensingh Medical Hospital  (newly added)  Kuwait Medical Hospital  (newly added)  Kurmitola General Hospital BIRDEM General Hospital  Holy Family Hospital Anwar Khan Modern Medical College   Hospital   The response so far has been amazing and we ask you to spread the word so that we can continue to send more lifesaving medical supplies to Bangladesh during this time of crisis.   We are deeply grateful for all your help.  _________________________________________________________________________   Why donate to this campaign?   Hello  During this time of deep uncertainty health-care workers (HCW) all around the world are fighting hard at the frontlines to keep everyone safe. They are only able to continue to do so because these health care warriors are equipped with personal protective equipment (PPE) such as –    -  N95 Masks : These masks keep out 95% of microns including the coronavirus pathogens. They are essential for HCWs when performing the RT-PCR (coronavirus test) as well as when working in the ICU. You can learn more about these masks at   https://www.cdc.gov/niosh/topics/hcwcontrols/recommendedguidanceextuse.html   . These masks also have the capacity for limited reuse which make them invaluable in this current pandemic  - Gloves and protective gear.   There is however a serious dearth of PPEs for doctors and nurses in Bangladesh especially with the N95 masks. As a result they are having to make some heartbreakingly difficult choices between treating patients whose conditions they are equipped to deal with and sending people with respiratory illnesses home so that the other patients remain safe. While Bangladesh has received some donations from Alibaba and the Government is taking measures to make protective gear through garment factories to help combat the COVID19 its just not enough. We still dont have the necessary high-grade N95 masks in Bangladesh and the situation is getting worse. Every single day more and more doctors are getting infected by the virus and if they dont have the PPEs they need it will be impossible to contain the spread of the virus in Bangladesh.  In order to help alleviate this situation in Bangladesh we are endeavoring to work with a supplier in the US to obtain 500 masks that we will donate to several different hospitals in Dhaka. Its only a start but its essential and urgent. We will ensure that these masks reach healthcare workers on the frontline in Bangladesh. For this first batch we want to be conscientious about sending the masks to local hospitals with high daily traffic:  - Dhaka Medical Hospital (newly added) - Mymensingh Medical Hospital (newly added) - Kuwait Medical Hospital (newly added) - Kurmitola General Hospital - BIRDEM General Hospital  - Holy Family Hospital - Anwar Khan Modern Medical College   Hospital.    Your help   We are asking for a small donation from you every bit helps! The money we collect will cover the cost of   500 high-grade N95 masks as well as DHL shipping costs  .    Here are some suggested amounts to help you understand the impact youll be making:  $12 - will help protect 2 HCW  $25 - will help protect 4 HCWs  $100 - will help protect 16 HCWs  $500 - will help protect a whole team of HCWs in 1 Hospital  The news about the COVID-19 virus is terrifying but there are also stories of hope and heroic accounts of people coming together as a community. What strange unique and frightening times we are currently living in! Help us get these essential supplies to health-workers in Bangladesh so they can fight this invisible enemy for us. We hope that this can be the first in a series of drives we do to help in this crisis.     A little about us   My name is Marzooq Haque and I am an IT consultant based in Toronto Canada. My wife Dr. Saiyara Shama completed her medical degree in Dhaka Bangladesh and is now working towards practicing medicine in North America. We are teaming up with our amazing friends to make this project happen.  We have been hearing inspiring stories from our friends and families from all over the world about human resilience and people coming together to help each other. We felt compelled to contribute and combat this situation in our own little way. We hope we can make a little dent in this fight together with your help.      FUNDRAISING TEAM:    Marzooq Haque  - IT Consultant - UofT Alumni - Toronto Canada - Loves traveling and photography   Saiyara Sheikh Shama  - Medical Doctor - Dhaka Bangladesh - All about long drives and yummy food   Nuzhat Arif  - Designer Developer - Boston USA - Lover of empathetic design and beautiful furniture   Nabil B. Arif  - Regional Mobilizer of the UN Sustainable Development Goals through UNITE 2030 CC - Toronto Canada - Harvard Alumni    Abrar Saqif Hasan  - Doctor IMC alumni- Dhaka Bangladesh - all about food and travel   Anil Wasif  - Senior Advisor - Government of Ontario Toronto Canada - Policy Wonk - *Fundraising efforts are not affiliated with any government or political body in Canada or Bangladesh*   Tahmid Hasib Khan  - Founder EPPHAM - Toronto Ontario - TEDx speaker Columbia University Mailman Epidemiology Class of 2020   Acknowledgment   Special thanks to Mr. Abu Ershad for helping source the N95 units

title: BGBL Daly City & Eastbay Covid-19 Relief fund
description: BLACK   GOLD BARBER LOUNGE DALY CITY x BLACK   GOLD EASTBAY  To our friends family and valued clients  Weve been blessed to be a part of the Daly City community over the past eight years and fortunate to have been able to expand our business and open a new location in Hayward as well.   Like many other local and small businesses BGBL has been hit hard with the mandatory closures caused by the COVID-19 pandemic. This has been tough on us since we are all self-employed. However the health and safety of our clients community and loved ones are always our top priority.   Im sure none of us were prepared for this pandemic nor did we foresee it coming. Being “your own boss” is both a gift and curse. We take pride in our hustle and making our own money however we dont get the benefits of those who work a 9-5. It goes against our beliefs and pride to ask for any handouts but as we dont qualify for many of the loans and programs were reaching out to you for assistance. We understand that right now is a tough time for everyone but if possible wed appreciate your help! Please consider donating any amount big or small to help keep our shops afloat as we endure this tough time.   Wed like to thank you all in advance for you generosity.   - The Black and Gold Barbers

title: DriveThru Registration App for COVID-19 Testing
description: COVID-19 has been spreading rapidly.  According to experts in the absence of a vaccine or an effective treatment which could be months or even years away testing is key to stemming the tide of this dangerous virus.     Testing is finally starting to rise across the country and especially in California.   However one of the challenges according to my cousin Dr. Eva Poon who is a doctor in Los Angeles  is the protection of patients and the health care workers as they are conducting the tests.   With the shortages of PPE minimizing contact throughout the testing process is essential.     We dont want the testing process or facility to be a nexus of transmission.  Drive through testing is one of the most effective methods of minimizing contact.    But in the current process there are still a lot of possible contacts due to collection of patient information and paper signatures.    Although there is still a lot we dont know about the transmission mechanisms of COVID-19 a recent study published in the  New England Journal of Medicine   indicates that the virus can survive on various types of surfaces for hours or even days and can remain infectious in the air for up to 3 hours.      SOLUTION  The solution is to develop a COVID-19 drive through registration app.   Without getting out of the car the patient can fill out the information and sign directly using the app on his or her phone.     On the back end the doctors office will get the information and can print out labels for the test kit collect identifying information for the person and vehicle and track test results and patient call backs.      THE ONLY CONTACT WOULD BE THE ACTUAL SWABBING.    Not only will this make the test process safer but also more efficient and reduce errors due to paperwork.   We have already donated our time to develop the process flow database structure and high level architecture for the app and the back end.   We have also sourced a development team that can get this platform completed.  However we need additional funds to finish the project.     The breakdown of the estimated cost is as follows:  Code  Development Cost:   $5000.00  6-Months of Cloud Web Hosting:  $480.00 ($80.00/month)  SSL Security Certificate (Annual):  $125.00  6-Months of website malware monitoring:  $120.00 ($20.00/month)  TOTAL COST:  $5725.00   Any additional funds beyond the minimum raised will be used to purchase N95 and KN95 masks to donate to the health care workers in LA and San Diego.  The app and platform will be HIPPA compliant.  This COVID-19 Drive Through Registration App will be deployed by Dr. Poon and her fellow health care workers in LA that are volunteering their time to put together the community drive through test facilities.   Once developed we will be offering the platform free of charge to any doctors who would like to use it for their drive through test facility.  Please contact me if you are interested to deploy this in your community.  Time is critical to deploy this app and platform to keep our doctors and healthcare works fighting on the frontlines safe.  Please help if you can.   Thanks so much.       Q A   Q: Why cant the LA county fund this project? A: Unfortunately the government response has been slow.   Time is of the essence.   We cannot wait weeks or months to deploy this.  Q: Why cant the doctors pay for this? A: Many doctors are small businesses and they are also running into cash flow issues in this crisis due to the need to purchase their own supplies and protective gear.     At this time the extent and time frame of insurance reimbursements are unknown.  Q: What labs will be used for the testing? A: Each individual drive through center will need to select their test labs.   For Dr Eva Poon she uses Primex LabCorp and Quest.   All are FDA approved labs.  Q: If I donate can I get tested? A: No. Sorry this is just a platform to make the drive through testing safer and more efficient.

title: COVID-19 | Homeless Emergency Mobile Showers
description: Emergency shower truck deployment in response to COVID-19    We have temporarily suspended our services in ALL states due to this outbreak visiting so many sites with older volunteers is not good practice in this season!   HOWEVER we will NOT let this virus beat us...   Our plan is to have our shower trucks in central locations where people who are experiencing homelessness can access showers and hygiene products to reduce the risk of contracting and transmitting COVID-19 on a mass scale.    We will deploy this in: VIC – QLD – WA – SA – NSW    If just one or two of our friends on the street contract this deadly virus it would sweep through the homeless community like wild fire putting enormous strain on the already stretched health system and causing the virus to linger as they have no way to self-isolate.   Most support organisations have closed their doors or severely cut services because of the virus and this means there in little or NO access to shower facilities.   We are asking for the support of our generous community members businesses and private donors to implement our plan to reduce the risk of our street friends contracting and spreading COVID-19.    THE PLAN    ·       Deploy our trucks to open (park) spaces on the edge of the CBD ·       Trained operators on site and equipped with the necessary PPE ·       Providing hot showers toiletries and hand washing facilities ·       Educating on good hand / personal hygiene ·       Teaching how to implement social distancing and healthy practices  ·       In partnership with organisations who hand out packaged meals  We will work with health providers such as Homeless Health Connect who   will have medical professionals on site educating some of our most vulnerable about safe practices as well as doing temperature / medical checks looking for fever and other symptoms   If we act quickly and implement this strategy effectively we will greatly reduce the risk to our friends on the street to our families to our community and beyond.   These actions would also alleviate a huge amount of pressure on the hospitals and the health sector.    We need your help us with this - We need your help to secure resources and funding required    Most of our usual volunteers are mature aged retired people who are incredibly generous with their time and efforts but in this instance we are not able to put them in harms way as the elderly are more susceptible to this virus.   We need to employ and train people to drive and operate the shower trucks so that we can ensure a very high standard of operation cleanliness safety and consistency in the services.   Our mobile shower services are funded by donations from the public applying for grants and private business and as you can imagine we are seeing a massive decline in the number and amount of donations coming through due to the crisis and effects of it on local businesses and families alike.   However we are certain that there are many people out there who know how important it is that we activate these services as soon as possible to slow the spread of this vicious virus.    We need your help to run this schedule for at least the next 3 months and will review the need then.    I would like to stress the importance of making action a priority in order to prevent as much spread of this devastating epidemic that is sweeping our planet.   Have we asked councils and governments YES but this process is takin way too long and getting answers in this current time is hard.    There is no amount too small we REALLY appreciate your support    Where will the funds go:   ·       Fuel – Gas and Insurances ·       Professional Hazardous Cleaning Fees ·       Consumables (Gloves Masks Hand Sanitiser Cleaning Materials) ·       Wages for 3 months (activating services) in capital cities  We will review this in 3 months depending on the circumstances   www.onevoice.org.au

title: Help Honeypie en Hof Poppendamme Corona door
description: Lieve allemaal Hoe gaat het met jullie? Met ons niet zo denderend. Begrijp ons niet verkeerd. We zijn nog helemaal gezond in lijf en leden. Maar zakelijk gezien gaat het niet zo sterk op dit moment. Sterker nog; het gaat de verkeerde kant op. En dat is nogal wat om op te biechten. Maar we gaan het toch doen want eerlijkheid en open communicatie zijn altijd onze belagrijkste punten geweest in het ondernemen.  Uiteraard komt dit door het Corona virus. Het hakt er behoorlijk in. Zoals bekend kunnen wij geen gasten meer ontvangen in Honeypie en Hof Poppendamme. En het is echt heel simpel: zonder gasten kunnen we al op korte termijn niet blijven bestaan.  En daarom deze Go Fund Me oproep. We need help...  We helpen heel graag mee om mensen gezond te houden door de zaken dicht te houden. Maar helaas zijn er heel veel rekeningen die wel blijven komen. Rekeningen waar je niet onderuit kan. En die uiteraard ook betaald moeten worden om te kunnen blijven bestaan.  Hebben we dan geen gezond bedrijf kan je je afvragen. Zeker wel! Maar ondernemen is investeren en risico nemen. Hof Poppendamme was net twee maanden  geleden geopend en dan begin je financieel dus weer vanaf het begin. Er is nu een groot gat te vullen en dat kunnen we simpelweg niet.  Hoe het zit met kosten die vergoed worden door de overheid? Die vormen maar een klein onderdeel van alle uitgaven die je hebt als ondernemer.  Het verkopen van tegoedbonnen is ook niet de beste oplossing voor ondernemers. Dit omdat mensen hun tegoedbonnen daarna massaal weer gaan inleveren en dat het dan later alsnog minder omzet creeert. Het zou ons niet door deze zware tijd  heen helpen. Dit is helaas uitstel van executie.  We hopen dat meerdere (horeca) bedrijven in onze buurt ons voorbeeld gaan volgen. Er zijn veel meer bedrijven die met hun rug tegen de muur staan. Bij sommige ook kantje boord.  Middelburg en omgeving is prachtig. En alle bedrijven in en rondom Middelburg helpen  mee om het tot die fijne plek te maken die het is. Toerisme is daarbij ook heel belangrijk en we moeten het ook voor hen aantrekkelijk houden en geen lege stad worden.  We weten dat er mensen staan te popelen om te helpen. Want we kennen jullie allemaal al langer dan vandaag. Samen staan we sterk.  Help je favriete ondernemers de Corona door! Ondernemers laat ze ons helpen!  En geloof ons we geven liever dan dat we vragen.  We vinden het spannend en een beetje eng om dit te delen. Maar eerlijkheid duurt het langst dus  daar gaan we dan:  Aan iedereen die ons Honeypie of Hof Poppendamme een warm hart toedragen zouden we willen vragen of je een vrijwillige donatie wilt doen. Zo hopen we deze moeilijke periode door te komen en jullie weer te verwelkomen na deze Corona crisis.  Doneren mag anoniem. Doneren mag met je naam. En heel belangrijk: doneer je niet dan vinden we je uiteraard nog net zo leuk als  daarvoor.  Als blijk van waardering geven we wel een kleiningheidje terug.  -Bij een donatie tot en met vijf euro krijg je een bon om bij ons een mooie Honeypie of Hof Poppendamme Kleurplaat en Button te komen halen als we weer open zijn. -Bij een donatie vanaf 6 euro tot en met 15 euro krijg je een bon voor een gratis cupcake of brownie op te halen als we weer open zijn. -Bij een donatie vanaf 16 euro tot en met 50 euro krijg je een bon voor een portie scones met jam en clotted cream en eeuwige roem op de Wall Of Thanks in Hof Poppendamme -Bij een donatie vanaf 51 euro of meer krijg je een bon voor 1 persoon voor een Speciale Dankjewel Scones en Taart buffetmiddag die we dan gaan houden in Honeypie op een nader te bepalen datum en natuurlijk eeuwige roem op de Wall  Of Thanks in Hof Poppendamme.  We hebben vele volgers op facebook en instagram. Als we de krachten bundelen dan zijn we al zo ver! En uiteraard houden we jullie op social media op de hoogte van hoe het met ons gaat.   Denk gewoon aan de ondernemers als je thuis je eten klaarmaakt of je een lekker theetje inschenkt. Doneer een klein deel aan je favo restaurant of lunchroom en dan we komen er wel!  We zijn jullie sowieso super dankbaar en hopen jullie nog lang te mogen ontvangen.   We kunnen niet wachten om straks weer open te mogen en jullie allemaal weer te zien.  Blijf allemaal gezond en doe voorzichtig!  Groetjes Greg en Helen Bihi-Zenou

title: Mask OUT COVID19 Ontario OR
description: All Friends and Family    We are a group of healthcare workers and community volunteers  in the process of making cotton masks for clinics and healthcare facilities in our community and beyond in the event N95 masks become unavailable as COVID19 continues to threaten the safety of patients and healthcare workers.  If you want to donate $$ to purchase materials this would be humbly appreciated.   These masks can be worn over N95 masks to extend the life of the current N95 mask supply. While these masks do not provide the same level of protection as a N95 mask does they can help provide some barrier protection even without the N95 in the event we are unable to keep up supplies of N95 masks.      100% of donations will be used for materials. All manpower to make masks is donated by amazing volunteers giving freely of their time and talents. These masks are cotton and therefore are not meant to replace the N95 masks but are intended as an emergency contingency plan in case proper PPE is unavailable. We also plan to utilize these masks as covers for proper N95 masks to extend their safe use in clinics for health care personnel.    Be the change you want to see in the world- Mahatma Gandhi   #MaskOUTCOVID19 #Weareresilient  Dr. Daisy Miller Family Practice Ontario OR

title: Support Cecilia Tan COVID-19 Patient
description: This GoFundMe campaign is to help support my mums battle against a suspected case of Covid19.  My mum is currently in the Philippines alone and is confined in the Covid wing in a hospital in Cebu City. She started to have symptoms of cough fever and colds. She has also lost her sense of smell. She was suffering from nonstop cough and high fever which worsened to shortness of breath. She was then brought to the hospital.  At 1PM today we received a call from the doctor in the Philippines informing us that her condition has worsened. Her respiratory condition has quickly deteriorated and that she needs to be closely monitored in the ICU. She will be transferred as soon as there is an available bed.   The hospital is unable to establish if she is a COVID19 case. Test kits are unavailable in Cebu where she is in the Philippines and so they are unable to confirm.   It is heartbreaking that she is fighting this battle alone. Given that this is a highly suspect COVID19 case we are unable to be physically by her side at this critical time. As a son I cannot put into words how devastated and broken I am. I have never felt this helpless all my life. I have lost my dad at such a young age and I cannot imagine the horror and sadness of losing my mum too.   My mum is fighting for her life and we need your help. Her medical insurance has already been exhausted. We are in dire need of financial assistance to help support her hospital care. A day in the ICU would cost $1600-1700/day aud(50000 php).  She is a loving mother and my best friend.   This is a photo of me and my mom a few years back when she was admitted with cervical nerve compression.   I implore on your kind hearts for help in this dark time. Your financial support will definitely go a long way as my mum fights for her life. Thank you so much.

title: Million Lives: COVID-19 Global Support Fund
description: OUR STORY   We are an entrepreneurial group of Harvard Business School Owner/Management Program classmates from 33 different countries who have gotten our last Unit 3 cancelled after a week of class in March 2020 due to the global coronavirus pandemic postponing our graduation from the program. At least 3 out of 150 classmates have tested positive for the coronavirus and there has been overwhelming emotional support in our WhatsApp group. Just earlier this year in January and February 2020 some classmates procured and donated at least thousands of masks to help combat the coronavirus crisis in China. In the blink of an eye it has shifted to Europe and now US cases are rising dramatically every day to become the next epicenter of the pandemic. Other parts of the world will follow soon after.   As China resumes mask production we have leveraged our network and procurement experience to donate masks to the US and other parts of the world. Soon we realized its more than just our friends families and classmates. Many hospitals havent prepared for the pandemic and currently they are urgently short of medical supplies. We are here to channel the resources in the most efficient way. We want to help protect our frontline healthcare workers and restore their confidence for the battle theyre fighting every day.   OUR GOAL   Our goal is to save millions of lives by raising capital to acquire masks personal protective equipment(PPE) ventilators and other medical supplies for frontline healthcare workers starting from the US and expanding to other parts of the world. Priority will be given to current pandemic epicenters such as New York City. Please fill out this form to request medical supplies:  Million Lives:PPE Request Form    First $10000 committed will acquire over 20000 FDA cleared surgical masks to arrive Thursday April 2nd in NYC  +$30000 will acquire over 60000 FDA cleared surgical masks to arrive by Monday April 6th in NYC/DC/Brazil (GRU Airport)   +$60000 will acquire medical supplies to arrive by Monday April 13th to locations based on the survey responses  If we go beyond our goal we will acquire additional shipments to help new epicenters make it through the peak of the epidemic.    WHAT WE DO   We have direct relationships with FDA-cleared suppliers in China and other parts of the world and building up suppliers in other parts of the world. We are already in touch with many large medical health systems across the US such as Mount Sinai Health System Carepoint Health Johns Hopkins Hospital UCSF and UCSD Medical Group. We will work with our classmates and friends to donate supplies to larger hospitals as well as smaller community hospitals in underprivileged areas. Hospitals have cash flow issues due to cancelling non-critical surgeries but if they are able to donate/reimburse back the cost of the supplies then we can use the funds to procure the next batch of supplies.    OUR COMMITMENT   100% of the funds (aside from Gofundmes fees) will go directly to the purchase and delivery of medical supplies for frontline healthcare workers. Once the medical supplies are delivered we will list the donation amount and locations and post any pictures and videos.    WHO WE ARE    Seamon Chan  is Co-Founder and Managing Partner of Palm Drive Capital a global venture capital firm with 80 investments over 5 continents. The Palm Drive Team has been involved with nonprofit initiatives such as Welcoming America Mekong Future Initiative EDSnaps Committee of 100 the Milken Institute and The Billion Dollar Fund for Women. Palm Drive has procured ten thousand masks to donate to China US and Europe during the Covid-19 pandemic. He graduated from Stanford University and is completing the Owner/President Management Program at Harvard Business School as well as the Belt Road Initiative EMBA program at Tsinghua University Peoples Bank of China School of Finance.   Bruno Branco  is the founder and CEO of The Great Schools Platform a network of schools and EduTech solutions operating in Brazil. He is a well-known education entrepreneur and executive having previously founded two education companies that together reached over 5 million students and 1.000 schools countrywide. He is completing the Owner/President Management Program at Harvard Business School cohort 54.    Andy Steggles  a serial entrepreneur has founded and advised multiple software startups. In 2006 Andy started building the next generation of large group collaboration software and after selling and delivering the software to several organizations he partnered with a friend and colleague to create what became Higher Logic which over an 8 year period grew into a $100MM enterprise. Today Andy serves as the Co-chair of the Board at Higher Logic and spends his time split between family business and volunteering with various non-profits.   Sherry Hou  is founder and CEO of First Asia Corporation and one of three partners of Ellison First Asia LLC 32 years  as global importer and wholesaler. On board of HK Association of New York advisor of International Leadership Foundation  and member of Women President Organization. Partner in Banks and real estate business. She is completing OPM 54 at Harvard Business School.   Stephan Winkler  is Managing Director of Forest International Ltd. a sustainable forestry focused private equity group and co-founder and executive chairman of EFISA (Empresa Forestal e Industrial S.A.) a company pioneering tree plantation enterprises in Paraguay and Bolivia. He has extensive experience in investing and operating in challenging frontier markets. He graduated from Oxford University and is completing the Owner/President Management Program at Harvard Business School.   Luiz Arruda  is Managing Director and Partner of Avantgarde Communication a Leading Full Experience Agency that for over 30 years understood the power of experiences. Expert at designing powerful brand experiences that turn people into life-long brand fans and shape relevance worldwide. He is completing the Owner/President Management Program at Harvard Business School cohort 54.    Jennifer Lee  is Marketing Director of VillageOne a workspace connecting entrepreneurs and business leaders in New York City. She is a seasoned business news reporter/producer with extensive exposure in the US and Greater China. Throughout her time as a TV reporter she has been on the frontline covering the outbreak of SARS Ebola and H1N1 crisis. She is a Wharton MBA graduate of University of Pennsylvania.    Yuxi Huang  is a director in New York Capital Markets   Investment Services group of Colliers International one of the top four global full service commercial real estate firms. She graduated from Columbia School of Architecture in 2015 and has been focusing on cross-border real estate and finance practices in New York City. She actively participates in helping healthcare and education related non-profit groups and initiatives such as WHMTF and Pencil of Promise.   Advisors   Partners    Yi Ding  is a Cal graduate who is currently the co-president of Asian American Parents Association and the secretary of the Cupertino Education Endowment Foundation. He previously served on the board of the largest Federally Qualified Health Center in Santa Clara County. He has launched the A Million Masks SF Coronavirus Support Fund focusing on the SF Bay Area.   Arthur Kuan  currently serves as Chief Executive Officer and Director on the Board at CG Oncology a privately-held clinical-stage biopharmaceutical company focused on the research acquisition and development of novel immunotherapies including an oncolytic virus for the treatment of bladder cancer and a variety of other solid tumor types. Arthur is a Founding Member of Ally Bridge Group a global healthcare-focused investment platform and plays an active role in managing the funds portfolio companies. Arthur received his M.S. in Biotechnology from the Johns Hopkins University and his B.A. in Biology from the University of Pennsylvania.?   Hendrick Lee  is Co-Founder and Managing Partner of Palm Drive Capital a global venture capital firm with 80 investments over 5 continents. The Palm Drive Team has been involved with nonprofit initiatives such as Welcoming America Mekong Future Initiative EDSnaps Committee of 100 the Milken Institute and The Billion Dollar Fund for Women. Palm Drive has procured ten thousand masks to donate to China US and Europe during the Covid-19 pandemic. He has a B.A. B.S. and M.A. from Stanford University.   FAQ    Q: How will the funds be used?    To date many US hospitals have been unable to access these equipment stocks due to language/cultural barriers and many foreign suppliers require up-front payment instead of the usual 30-90 day payment terms. We solve both problems by aggregating the suppliers and underwriting the cost to bring the equipment to the US.  Our current primary goal is to get as many FDA-cleared medical supplies into the hands of frontline healthcare workers as soon as possible. 100% of the funds will go directly to facilitating the purchase and delivery of masks and other urgent PPE for frontline healthcare workers in the US. Please fill out this form to request medical supplies:  Million Lives:PPE Request Form     Q: Why US first?    The U.S. has become the next epicenter of coronavirus pandemic. New York City accounts for 6% of global cases as of March 25th. We hope that we can help the US hospitals first and expand to other countries with our efforts.   Q: How can we help aside from donations?    If you want to share sources of suppliers help distribute medical supplies help distribute this initiative or promote this initiative in the press please email: schan@opm54.hbs.edu   Q: Are donations tax deductible?   In the interest of getting these medical supplies into the hands of doctors and nurses as quickly as possible the donations are currently not tax deductible. We are working on a structure to run this through a 501c3 and will let you all know as soon as that happens.

title: Ayuda Covid-19
description: Estamos viviendo una situación muy complicada debido a los contagios por Covid-19 y tenemos hospitales sin todo el material que necesitan comedores sociales intentando alimentar a las personas más vulnerables hospitales de campaña que también necesitan material...  Por eso creamos está campaña para intentar recaudar dinero y poder donarlo a estas causas. Si todos ponemos nuestro granito de arena todo será un poco más sencillo.

title: Material COVID-19
description: Desde  Supporters Gol Sur  queremos poner en conocimiento que nos ponemos a plena disposición de la empresa  Fundación SAFA  el cuál está realizado material para nuestros sanitarios con impresoras 3D. Todo lo recolectado va íntegramente para ellos por lo tanto hacemos un llamamiento masivo a todo el beticismo y el pueblo español para ayudar a estos campeones que trabajan por la seguridad de nuestro personal sanitario y la nuestra también.  A continuación ponemos el proyecto:  Somos un grupo de profesores de colegios de la  Fundación SAFA   a los que se han unido otras personas con acceso a una impresora 3D.  Nuestros objetivos son:  1. Imprimir los elementos que a través de los diseños de Sevilla Maker y otras asociaciones provinciales ya están probados y siendo usados.  2. Ayudar a la comunidad a diseñar y homologar elementos nuevos.  3. Crear red con la comunidad educativa para obtener el soporte para comprar materiales impresoras o incorporar impresoras personales.  4. Detectar entidades locales o concretas que estén necesitadas y que no tengan fácil acceso a los EPI.   Mi nombre es Jose Márquez Vicente coordino el grupo de trabajo junto a Marta Gamazo García y Luis Salvador Gallardo González. Originalmente este proyecto nace entre compañeros de colegios de la Fundación SAFA pero en vista del crecimiento y las adhesiones que íbamos recibiendo hemos montado un grupo en el que hay profesores de diferentes centros y también profesionales de otros sectores. La. Fundación SAFA organiza y da soporte a todo el grupo además de garantizar la transparencia en el uso de las donaciones.   La recaudación de fondos la realizamos a título particular.  El empleo de los fondos será:  1. Para comprar material como filamentos acetatos gomillas etc necesarios para la fabricación de los equipos de protección.    2. Para incorporar más impresoras a la red. El grupo nace con el compromiso de continuar colaborando en otras acciones solidarias preferiblemente con la ONG Entreculturas por lo que garantizamos que tanto las impresoras como el material que se financie con esta campaña irá exclusivamente destinado a estos proyectos.

title: COVID-19 Rental and Expenses relief
description: The COVID 19 pandemia is affecting financially a number of our close friends and others in the community.  This GoFundme page aims to raise funds to support as many families as possible currently unable to pay their monthly rent food and utility bills.  The current restrictions to small businesses have put a big strain in the budget of families who have lost their jobs and are struggling to survive this pandemia.  We aim to raise $50000 as a starting point.  If a family is struggling to pay rent we will allocate $5000 to cover the minimum cost of rent for the next three months.  If a family is struggling to pay bills and food we will allocate  lump sum of  $2000.  Funds will be distributed as they become available and selection of families will be by expression of interest and evidence of hardship. At this stage we have two close friends that are in need. We would welcome other EOI.  Note about the fundraisers: We are a health care professional and an academic and we have no personal gain as a result of this initiative.

title: COVID-19 Protección Sanitarios
description: Todos los que estamos en casa sabemos lo importante que es esto para vencer a este virus. Un grupo de amigos estamos aprovechando nuestro tiempo y nuestros contactos para aportar nuestro granito de arena a la lucha contra el virus y #desdecasa estamos haciendo gestiones para conseguir comprar material de protección para los sanitarios que son la primera línea de batalla y por falta de material adecuado están infectándose mientras cuidan de los pacientes y salvan vidas.  Varios de nuestros amigos y conocidos son sanitarios en diferentes hospitales de Madrid y viven diariamente la escasez que allí tienen de material para protegerse. Ell@s como tantos otros profesionales en los hospitales luchan cada día con unos recursos limitados y nos hemos propuesto ayudarles.  Tenemos un proveedor de China que tiene disponibles en stock preparado para su suministro trajes de protección individual mascarillas del tipo N95 (equivalentes a Fpp2) gorros y guantes. (Todo con certificado CE)  Nuestra intención es hacer llegar todo el material que nos sea posible al consulado Español en Shanghai  donde será enviado por valija diplomática (sin coste de transporte) hasta España y aquí será repartido por las hospitales para que pueda ser utilizado por los sanitarios.  Ayúdanos a proteger a quienes nos protegen.  ¿Te apuntas?

title: Covid 19 fundraiser
description: Due to the current pandemic in Ireland Team Bennett have decided to use this time away from dance classes to try raise as much money as possible for St. James Hospital. We would like to thank those on the front line for their ongoing dedication and hard work to combat Covid19.  We are asking as many people as possible to donate anything at all to our gofundme page and help give back to these incredible workers. If we cant dance together lets try to do something as a team for those who are doing everything they can to help us and our loved ones.

title: Lutte contre le COVID19 au Cameroun
description: Bonjour à tous  Au vue de larrivée et de la progression croissante du Corona Virus au Cameroun nous avons décidé de mettre en place un collectif qui viendrait en aide aux populations locales.  Au travers de cette collecte que nous lançons nous voudrions avec cet argent: - Fabriquer de manière artisanale des gels hydroalcoolique - Acheter des masques + des thermomètres depuis la Chine et les acheminer vers le Cameroun - Mettre dans les zones de grande affluence des points deau avec savons pour se laver les mains - Établir un système de  ramassage des masques usés que nous récyclerons pour une 2ème vie   Pour cela nous avons besoin des autoclaves pour le traitement puis de machines pour stéréliser via les rayons UV les masques - Établir des banderoles de sensibilisation les imprimer et les afficher dans les 2 grandes villes Yaoundé   Douala dans les zones de grande influence comme les marchés. - Complément: en fonction de ce que ça nous coûtera pouvoir à la fabrication des machines de réanimation et à la fourniture des établissements hospitaliers particulièrement dans le besoin. Nous restons en attente du protocole test de Stephen la dessus.  Nous comptons donc sur votre contribution pour mener à bien ces actions principalement dans les 2 grandes capitales et pourquoi pas dans dautres villes qui nécessiteront une urgence.

title: GES - EMERGENZA COVID-19
description: Lemergenza che stiamo vivendo ci porta a doverci mettere alla ricerca di unauto e ad investire per garantire vestiario DPI e attrezzature sanitarie che ci possano consentire di effettuare il nostro  servizio di vigilanza e controllo al fianco della Protezione Civile e sotto le direttive della Centrale Operativa Comunale.   Al momento i nostri volontari stanno utilizzando i propri mezzi e servono continuamente dispositivi di protezione individuale per garantire la sicurezza di tutti.  Cosa chiediamo?  Un minimo contributo  anche solo di un euro per lacquisto e la messa in strada di unauto per la gestione dei nostri servizi sul territorio comunale.   Un grazie a chi deciderà di starci accanto.

title: Live Gig Support during COVID-19
description: Musicians all over the UK are currently without income.   As venues theatres and schools have closed I am a self employed person with zero income or income support.   This is an optional donation point for anyone wanting to donate money after watching my Facebook Live Gigs.  If you enjoyed it and are able to simply donate the price of a ‘virtual ticket to the gig hosted.   You choose the price!  My gig will be live on Facebook via my page Bronwen Lewis Music and requests will be taken there!   Thanks in advance for your support ??      https://m.facebook.com/BronwenLewisMusic/

title: Engel gegen COVID-19
description: PayPal:   https://www.paypal.com/pools/c/8nIyHruSxE    Wir alle erleben momentan welche dramtischen Auswirkungen COVID-19 auf die europäischen Staaten hat. Doch die afrikanischen Staaten trifft diese Viruserkrankung - obwohl sie dort gerade erst beginnt sich auszubreiten – bereits jetzt sehr schwer. Von unseren Freunden in Uganda wissen wir dass bereits jetzt die Preise für Lebensmittel und Hygieneartikel wie zum Beispiel Seife so hoch sind dass es sich eine normal verdienende Familie nicht mehr leisten kann Lebensmittel zu kaufen. Das öffentliche Leben wurde wie auch in den europäischen Ländern weitestgehend eingestellt sodass das nötige Gehalt fehlt um die Familie zu ernähren. Arbeitslosengeld oder Krankenversicherungen - Fehlanzeige.  Dies ist neben der ständigen Angst zu erkranken und kein Geld für die Versorgung in einem Krankenhaus zu haben natürlich mehr als belastend. Außerdem wurde der Betrieb der öffentlichen Verkehrsmittel weitgehend eingestellt sodass eine Nahrungsmittelbeschaffung extrem erschwert ist. Zudem erreichten uns Bilder von Nahrungsmittelraub. Der Druck von Seiten des Militärs ist deutlich spürbar.    Und Familien mit schwerstmehrfachbehinderten Kindern die zur sogenannten Risikogruppe gehören trifft es noch einmal umso härter. Durch die Schließung der Schulen sind die Eltern gezwungen ihre Kinder zu Hause zu versorgen und haben somit keinerlei Verdienst da sie nicht arbeiten gehen können – die Chance sich noch Lebensmittel oder Hygienartikel wie zum Beispiel Seife leisten zu können sinkt somit immer weiter. Und da gerade diese Kinder eine große Gefahr haben einen sehr schweren - wenn nicht lebensbedrohlichen Verlauf der Erkrankung - zu haben ist es umso wichtiger ihr Immunsystem zumindest auch durch Vorbeugen einer Mangelernährung so weit wie möglich zu stärken.   Das Angels Center ist eine seit 7 Jahren existierende Einrichtung für geistig und körperlich behinderte Kinder in Uganda. Die Kinder erhalten hier Physiotherapie Logopädie und werden – je nach Ausprägung ihrer Behinderung – auch unterrichtet und erhalten vor allen Dingen ganz viel Liebe und Zuneigung. Für mehr Informationen zur Organisation:   http://angelscentre.org     Die Projektleiterin Rosemary Nambooze hat einen 9-jährigen Sohn der mit dem Down Syndrom geboren wurde. Rosemary war zum Zeitpunkt der Geburt gerade in Antwerpen wo sie ihr Studium beendete und durfte dort erleben wie liebevoll man mit ihrem Sohn umgegangen ist. Zurück in Uganda setzte sie sich dann für die Rechte von Kindern und Jugendlichen mit Behinderungen ein. So entstand das Angels Center. Rosemary betreibt das Projekt mit viel Herz und versucht gleichzeitig Aufklärungsarbeit zu leisten und den Menschen in Uganda zu zeigen: Kinder mit Behinderung verdienen die gleiche Liebe und Anerkennung wie jedes andere Kind auch. Und genau diese Liebe und Anerkennung brauchen die Kinder in dieser schwierigen Zeit umso mehr!   Wir sind uns darüber bewusst dass im Moment auch hier in Europa schwierige Umstände herrschen. Das Ärzte und Pflegekräfte überlastet sind das unsere Gesundheitssysteme an ihre Grenzen stoßen und auch wir hier verzweifeln – auch wirtschaftlich. Aber alle von uns haben Nahrung im Haus – niemand von uns muss Angst haben zu verhungern. Wir haben ein funktionierendes Sozialsystem und viele ehrenamtliche Helfer die versuchen alle Menschen bestmöglich aufzufangen. All dies fehlt in Uganda. Menschen fürchten nun nicht nur aufgrund von COVID-19 – sondern auch aus Angst keine Nahrung mehr zu haben - um ihr Leben. Und vielleicht habt ihr ja den ein oder anderen Euro übrig um zumindest den Familien des Angels Centers etwas Geld für Nahrung zu spenden.  Wir sind ehemalige Freiwillige des Projekts und haben sowohl zu Rosemary als auch zu den Familien der Kinder engen persönlichen Kontakt – garantieren also dafür das euer Geld ankommt und auch wirklich dafür genutzt wird Nahrung für die Familien zu kaufen. PayPal:   https://www.paypal.com/pools/c/8nIyHruSxE

title: COVID-19 Aiuta animali e artisti del circo orfei
description: EMERGENZA COVID-19 aiuta il famoso Circo Orfei con i suoi 70 animali a seguito e tanti artisti che per colpa di questa emergenza sono senza lavoro dal quasi un mese. aiuta i tanti animali con un piccolo gesto e alla sopravvivenza dello spettacolo che sa donare tanta felicità al pubblico che lo segue

title: Recaudación para material sanitario vs COVID 19
description: ¡Hola!  Mi nombre es Susana Gómez y soy ilustradora.   Quería aportar mi granito de arena en esta  lucha contra  este dichoso virus llamado  COVID19  recaudando fondos para adquirir material sanitario y ayudar a todos esos héroes que velan por nuestra salud exponiéndose ellos mismos.  He pensado en sortear entre todos los donantes uno  de mis trabajos  en madera. Se trata de una ilustración a óleo que representa la libertad que tanto añoramos en estos momentos y que pronto llegará.   ¡Mucha fuerza para todos!

title: GRIFFIN HOSPITAL: COVID-19 Donations
description: Shelton Tangoeroos: Want to join us in making a difference? The Department of Culture wants to make a difference but we need your help!  The team has decided to raise money to benefit Griffin Hospital a local hospital located in Derby CT.  Our goal is to help purchase Personal Protective Equipment PPE  for the true heroes of this crisis.   Theres a shortage of masks gowns gloves and other critical supplies to protect our medical professionals in hospitals across the world. Every little bit will help  #selflessness  More information about Griffin Hospital   their need of PPE please visit:    https://www.griffinhealth.org/coronavirus-covid19-information/covid-19-fund-donations

title: Corona virus NHS relief
description: Do you want to join us in making a difference? Were raising money in aid of Association of NHS Charities and every donation will help in these hard times.   How to get involved:  Step 1: Shave or Donate (or both) Step 2: use #ShaveToSave Step 3: Share with everyone you can and help support our NHS  More information about Association of NHS Charities: Helping the NHS do more. NHS Charities Together: Supports and champions the work of NHS Charities. Give 1 million pounds every day to the NHS improving patient care and experience. Fund major capital projects pioneering research and medical equipment at our hospitals helping patients access the best possible care when they need it most. Play a key role in mobilising volunteers to support NHS staff brightening wards and waiting areas. Build an important link between our hospitals and communities.

title: Raccolta Fondi Emergenza Covid-19 by Daniela
description: Cari amici  In questo momento di emergenza storica in cui noi tutti siamo esposti ad una pandemia mondiale  ho pensato che loccasione del mio compleanno  potesse essere motivo per  unirci tutti a sostenere i bisogni che anche la Clinica San Carlo di Paderno sta affrontando per la crescita di affluenza di contagiati da Covid-19 .   48 anni fa sono nata qui e ancora oggi la Clinica San Carlo rappresenta per la mia famiglia un appoggio fondamentale.   È proprio questa personale gratitudine che ho verso tutti i medici infermieri e addetti della Clinica che mi ha portato a chiedervi di aiutarmi ad aiutare.  Per chi avesse voglia di farmi un regalo o desiderasse dare il suo sostegno   ad un Ospedale in questo momento di emergenza sanitaria questa è loccasione.   Non importa quanto ma importa farlo perché  #insiemecelafaremo .   Negli ultimi giorni la Clinica San Carlo ha potenziato ulteriormente la risposta alla crisi Covid-19:  n. 11 posti letto di Terapia Intensiva n. 70 posti letto di acuti e terapia sub-intensiva n. 34 posti letti per pazienti sub-acuti allestiti nel Vecchio Ospedale inattivo dal 2015. Il Pronto Soccorso continua ad accogliere pazienti provenienti dal territorio.    Questa donazione verrà esclusivamente destinata allemergenza Covid-19 ed in particolare contribuira allacquisto di strumenti necessari per affrontare lemergenza tra cui mascherine flussimetri per ventilazione o ventilatori polmonari e monitor.    Grazie  Daniela

title: ShiftMeals: A Local Food Response to COVID-19
description: Hey folks   In light of COVID-19  we are at once proud of our political leadership for making the right and hard decision to shut down all dine-in restaurants in Vermont and also deeply concerned for the tens of thousands of hard-working people that lost their jobs overnight. Were also concerned for the farmers that relied on restaurants to purchase their products year-round.   As of this writing  all of The Skinny Pancake locations are currently closed . We have built up a remarkably talented team and we have a powerful commissary kitchen capable of producing huge volumes of food. Like so many folks out there we care deeply about our community and we want to help with all of our might.  We are not here to raise money for our business . We are here because we are shifting gears as a company to address the impending food insecurity within this greater crisis.   Today we launch a program called “ShiftMeals: a Local Food Response to COVID-19.”  With thousands losing jobs across Vermont and state food banks inundated with people to feed ShiftMeals will provide food security for those in need while keeping members of our team employed. We will immediately do outreach to  laid-off restaurant workers musicians and other friends of foodservice . As needs arise we will also be donating meals directly to local food banks and outreach centers.  This week we have already donated hundreds of meals to both Feeding Chittenden and the Lamoille County Food Shelf.       Heres how you can participate:    1.  Donate.  A contribution here will fund ShiftMeals directly. 100% of money raised will go to producing meals for those who need it while also keeping our team employed. In collaboration with our local food network and the Vermont Food Bank we will be diligently using these meals to reduce food insecurity.  2.  Share.  Help spread the word of this work by sharing our efforts using #ShiftMeals  3.  Buy . You can purchase your own shift meal and well give one to someone in need. We are actively working on a ShiftMeal retail offering in the Buy 1 Give 1 model of Toms Shoes. Stay tuned for that to launch in the coming week.    The impact of COVID-19 threatens to harm our farming friends in the local food movement along with restaurant workers .  We are deeply grateful to The Vermont Community Foundation who has approved an initial $20000 grant for this program as Boston Beer Company who has pledged $2500 to ShiftMeals. Working with VCF The Intervale Center and The Vermont Food Bank we are focused on tapping additional federal state and philanthropic funds to provide as much food security as possible throughout this crisis. And thanks to the remarkable local food network in VT we have the capacity and sophistication to direct that funding towards our local farmers to keep the money local and help farms remain viable this growing season.   As a community we all need to do our part to reassure each other that we stand firm in our commitment to caring for one another . With ShiftMeals we invite you to please join us in sending that message loud and clear to our local food community.  Stay safe out there friends...    -Benjy Adler and the team at The Skinny Pancake   *If interested in corporate support through a business please e-mail  shiftmeals@skinnypancake.com  and we can work with you on a larger tax-deductible donation.

title: COVID19: Ayuda a la Investigación de Vall dHebron
description: Aida Domenech y Alba Paul ponen en marcha un crowdfunding con el lema “ SOMOS UNO ” destinado a recaudar fondos para la asistencia y la investigación en la lucha contra el COVID- 19.   En Cataluña la donación se centra en la investigación una parte muy importante en la lucha contra el virus  de la mano de Vall dHebron Barcelona Hospital Campus donde los investigadores están centrando todos sus esfuerzos en analizar el comportamiento del virus SARS-CoV-2.  Su objetivo es encontrar sus puntos débiles y poder desarrollar estrategias para prevenir tratar y curar la enfermedad. Una investigación transversal en beneficio de toda la sociedad.   La iniciativa que parte inicialmente con la Comunidad de Madrid y Cataluña como destinatarias no descarta ir sumando nuevas propuestas vinculadas a dicha causa por parte de otras Comunidades Autónomas mientras el estado de alarma de nuestro país siga vigente.    En estos momentos es cuando más unidos tenemos que estar.  Tenemos que ser conscientes de lo importante que es la prevención de la enfermedad; quedarse en casa y seguir las pautas que nos aconsejan desde el Ministerio de Sanidad es clave para poder frenar la curva. No colapsar nuestro sistema sanitario ayudará a que poco a poco podamos ir saliendo de este periodo de confinación.   Esta iniciativa es ambiciosa queremos que la ayuda llegue al mayor número de Comunidades posible. Estamos ante una emergencia global y solos no lo podemos parar ahora más que nunca  #SOMOSUNO .  Puedes donar y compartir en redes sociales usando el hashtag  #SOMOSUNO.   Si quieres recibir el certificado que te permitirá desgravar tu donación envía un correo a amicsvallhebron@vhebron.net indicando nombre apellidos y DNI.

title: Help Taqueria Habaneros team during COVID-19
description: Dear neighbors friends and future guests of Taqueria Habanero we as many other restaurants in the area have been mandated to reduce full service due to national health pandemic (COVID-19) that is affecting our society.  We have been serving the Columbia Heights Community for 5 (going on 6) years now and have flourished some deep connections and partnerships with many our customers who have continued to return time after time again.   Although we will continue to keep our doors open to serve Our clients we have had to make a difficult decision to reduce our staff drastically  In effect this impacts their livelihood and wages as they rely on their full time tipped positions at our establishment.   We have set up this gofundme platform as supplemental help for our servers food runner and back of house dishwasher affected by this crisis. Please note all proceeds will be equally distributed to staff members.   We also invite you to continue supporting our small business every order counts! We look forward to reopening for full service one day hopefully by Cinco de Mayo to share some delicious Tacos and Margaritas!   Be safe and in good health   Your friends at Taqueria Habanero   Estimados vecinos amigos y futuros visitantes de Taqueria Habanero nosotros como muchos otros restaurantes en el área hemos recibido el mandato de reducir el servicio completo debido a la pandemia nacional de salud (COVID-19) que está afectando a nuestra sociedad. Hemos estado sirviendo a la comunidad de ColumbiaHeights durante 5 (casi 6) años y hemos prosperado algunas conexiones y asociaciones profundas con muchos de nuestros clientes que han seguido regresando una y otra vez.   Aunque continuaremos manteniendo nuestras puertas abiertas para servirles hemos tenido que tomar una decisión difícil de reducir a nuestro personal drásticamente  En efecto esto afecta su sustento y salarios ya que dependen de sus puestos de tiempo completo en nuestro establecimiento   Hemos establecido esta plataforma de gofundme como ayuda complementaria para nuestro equipo afectados por esta crisis. Tenga en cuenta que todos los ingresos se distribuirán por igual a los miembros del personal.   También lo invitamos a continuar apoyando a Taqueria Habanero ¡cada orden cuenta! Esperamos volver a abrir para el servicio completo algún día ¡con suerte para el Cinco de Mayo para compartir algunos deliciosos tacos y margaritas!   Deseos de buena salud y felicidad   Sus amigos en Taqueria Habanero

title: Hop21 Ping Pong Bar Covid-19 Employees Fund
description: Dear friends and family  Unfortunately as most of you already know on March 17th we had to close our bar due to Minnesota Governor Tim Walzs order to temporarily close all bars and restaurants in Minnesota over the fear of spreading COVID-19. I understand and support this decision that has been made to ensure safety and good health of our staff and guests. However our 4 employees have lost their jobs overnight and must apply for unemployment which because most of their income comes from tips will barely be enough to survive on.   For this reason Im asking for your help. Any donations you choose to make will go to support our staff and their families. I understand that many of you – Hop21 supporters are possibly facing similar problems however Food and Beverage industry has been hit the hardest and tens of thousands of people have lost their jobs.  Now its truly up to you our most loyal and loving fans to support your favorite ping pong bar employees. From the bottom of my heart I thank you for your heartfelt support and generous contributions.  I hope to have the privilege of inviting you to my bar again soon!   Sincerely   Max Vinogradov Hop21 owner

title: COVID19: Ayuda a Hospitales Comunidad de Madrid
description: Aida Domenech y  Alba Paul ponen en marcha un crowdfunding con el lema  “SOMOS UNO”  destinado a recaudar fondos para la  asistencia y la investigación en la lucha contra el COVID- 19.   En la Comunidad de Madrid  el dinero recolectado se destinará a la Consejería de Sanidad de Madrid y los fondos se invertirán en el Servicio Madrileño de Salud (SERMAS)  dentro del  ámbito asistencial: Hospitales de Madrid Summa y atención sanitaria primaria. Priorizando la adquisición de equipos de protección tanto para sanitarios como para pacientes además de recursos de asistencia para los afectados por la enfermedad.   La iniciativa que parte inicialmente con la Comunidad de Madrid y Cataluña como destinatarias no descarta ir sumando nuevas propuestas vinculadas a dicha causa por parte de otras Comunidades Autónomas mientras el estado de alarma de nuestro país siga vigente.    En estos momentos es cuando más unidos tenemos que estar.  Tenemos que ser conscientes de lo importante que es la prevención de la enfermedad; quedarse en casa y seguir las pautas que nos aconsejan desde el Ministerio de Sanidad es clave para poder frenar la curva. No colapsar nuestro sistema sanitario ayudará a que poco a poco podamos ir saliendo de este periodo de confinación.  Esta iniciativa es ambiciosa queremos que la ayuda llegue al mayor número de Comunidades posible. Estamos ante una emergencia global y solos no lo podemos parar ahora más que nunca  #SOMOSUNO.   Puedes donar y compartir en redes sociales usando el hashtag  #SOMOSUNO .

title: Hayward COVID-19 Testing- Frontline
description: This fund me page was created to support the men and women on the frontline  and their families during their service to perform covid-19 testing to residents and any person that is experiencing any  symptoms.  100% of  proceeds will be spent to cover transportation  protective gear babysitting  and any arising needs.

title: Returning Citizens COVID-19 Support Fund
description: University of Michigan School of Social Work students with a passion for assisting returning citizens encourage you to make a donation to help the most vulnerable during this health crisis. As we stay at home to prevent the spread of the COVID-19 coronavirus many returning citizens are in need of assistance. Whether its lost wages delayed or limited healthcare access or sudden demands for childcare and homeschooling the returning citizen community needs our help.   Many reentry organizations are taking precautions and operating at a reduced capacity therefore resources are more limited at this time. Online community meetings have addressed new and exacerbated challenges faced by returning citizens during this pandemic. Accessing and affording basic necessities under Governor Whitmers stay-at-home order is not feasible for everyone. Its so important that we stay safe and look out for public health right now but the financial burdens for returning citizens are real.   100% of these funds will go to returning citizens across the state of Michigan who have lost income and/or are seeing increased living costs due to work and school stoppage due to the COVID-19 pandemic. This is emergency funding to help formerly incarcerated people in need with their rent food utilities and medical needs. The amount given to each person is determined based on how much we raise how much clients have lost and how many people apply.  We will send funds to the recipients mailing address or via online payment. If you are a returning citizen in need of funds  Click Here  to apply for support.   Thank you for your support.

title: Watermead Inn Covid19 Support How can we help?
description: To support residents NHS Key workers elderly or anyone that are isolated of Watermead and surrounding area who may need help during this difficult time of self isolation caused by the Covid19 epidemic.  we provide hot meal everyday essentials and toilet rolls on request.  All money raised will go toward food and other essentials to be distributed.  all money left will be donated to the NHS.  thanks for you help kelvin

title: Kitchen Creations #SmallBusinessRelief Fund
description: GoFundMe is launching the Small Business Relief Initiative to support our friends and neighbors at local businesses facing financial loss from the COVID-19 pandemic. As part of the Initiative the #SmallBusinessRelief Fund will be issuing $500 matching grants to qualifying businesses that raise at least $500 on GoFundMe. You can help by donating to the GoFundMe for my small business or by starting or contributing to a GoFundMe for your favorite small business. The matching funds from GoFundMe would really help us out during these difficult times. Thank you!

title: Help Malawi prepare for COVID-19
description: As everyone will be aware COVID-19 is progressing quickly around the globe and has now officially been labelled as a Pandemic by the World Health Organisation (WHO). The rate of new infections is rising exponentially in Europe and USA as well as other areas that are considered to be ‘more economically developed despite having access to world leading education health care and proper sanitation.  The virus has now started to emerge in Africa with several countries confirming multiple cases.    Malawi which was ranked by USA Today as the worlds fifth poorest country in 2019 is among the countries considered to be most at risk of high death tolls caused by the spread of the virus. The country is densely populated and access to proper sanitation and adequate healthcare is already a major problem. Education levels are also considered to be some of the lowest globally. Adding to this Malawi is landlocked giving rise to severe supply chain problems in a global economy where cash is king and prices for medical equipment to prevent the spread of COVID-19 have already risen beyond what is affordable for the Malawian government and people.   Dr Roshirl Najiaghdam a specialist in contagious diseases tropical medicine and a molecular pathologist along with her husband Dr Yashar Najiaghdam a specialist in internal medicine and cardiologist-critical care are currently based in Malawis capital Lilongwe - working from the Seventh Day Adventist hospital. They have been desperately trying to set up an emergency triage and isolation unit ahead of the imminent spread of the virus through the country with the primary aim of limiting transmission and minimising casualties.   Dr. Yashar commented: “ Malawi is not even prepared for the outbreak.  They say they are but we dont see any action from the Government. We dont even have a complete ICU unit here.     In stark contrast to the Malawian government Dr. Yashar is making every effort to coordinate with the WHO and to attract attention to the bleak outlook for Malawi in its current state of preparedness. So far the WHO has donated two medical tents from which the isolation and treatment effort can be based.  However they are still extremely short of vital life-saving equipment. Basic Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) such as masks and gloves are in extremely short supply and are vitally important to prevent transmission to doctors and caregivers crucial to limiting further transmissions and deaths.  Critically it has been publicised that Malawi has not a single working ventilator in the country meaning those who have underlying health conditions such as HIV are likely to fall ill with little chance of recovery without assistance. The country also lacks other proper ICU equipment necessary to challenge the virus head on.   To aid the people of Malawi and complete the facility that Dr. Yashar envisages with the necessary equipment a sum of $350000 is required.  Please see below the list of all equipment required.  Any donation of money or equipment no matter how big or small is greatly appreciated and will make a huge difference to a country that I call home and love dearly.   Swift action here is critical so that proper training and infrastructure can be put in place to better the chances of limiting transmission of the virus and helping critical patients.   Zikomo Kwambili Thank you very much  Riccardo

title: For Grady IDP clinic providers during Covid19
description: Healthcare professionals at Gradys IDP clinic are working tirelessly compassionately selflessly and smartly to care for persons living with HIV and identify those who may be affected by Covid-19. Like so many health professionals around the nation and world many are volunteering their time and working long hours. Help us show them appreciation and gratitude by nourishing them with food from local restaurants. If you are able during these difficult times for many please consider a donation of any size that we can use for meal deliveries.  We welcome any words of encouragement and appreciation that we can share with them. Post below or contact Karina. Help us care for those who care for our communities. Thank you!

title: Child Care Providers helping Medics Beat COVID-19
description: Being a child care provider in Bergen County New Jersey and taking great pride in raising the next generation it pains us to see how this COVID-19 virus is affecting everyone on personal and professional levels.  The physical and emotional toll this pandemic is taking on many of us is unimaginable.  The faster we bring this pandemic under control the better off our world will be.  But to do that the people on the front lines those who are risking their health day in and day out to protect us are in dire need of supplies.  These supplies will ensure that those whom we need to help us stay healthy and strong and continue their fight against COVID-19 and their fight for those who have been and continue to be so gravely affected.  Please donate no amount is too small.  Your donation will be used first and foremost to provide hospitals and first responders followed by at high-risk civilians with much needed protective equipment to help everyone bring this pandemic to a rapid end.  Your generosity is greatly appreciated IntelliChild Academy Team

title: Covid-19: Masks to Boston & NYC
description: Front-line health care providers fighting Covid-19 face an acute shortage of PPE (personal protective equipment) especially in NYC and Boston.  Please help fund 80000 KN95 masks - vetted and  CDC-approved   - to Boston and NYC hospitals this week a critical time as C19 cases grow exponentially and overwhelm health care systems.  Support of any amount is appreciated. The entire supply (provided at cost for a friends discount) is currently being covered by personal funds.    Per the World Health Organization the chronic global shortage of PPE is one of the most urgent threats to our collective ability to save lives.  (article here).     The procurement of this supply is a globe-spanning story of the power of personal and alumni networks spanning Exeter Tuck/Dartmouth Cornell and beyond.  Please see below individuals and organizations that have helped make this happen. It hasnt been pretty but it looks like its going to work. Well work on telling the story when things start to settle down. Stay safe and steady all.  With tremendous gratitude Lisa Cloitre - PEA 90 Dartmouth 94 Tuck 02  Sarp Aksel   MD - PEA 06 Cornell 10 Albert Einstein College of Medicine 15  **** Made possible by:   Louie Cheng     (Harvard 95 Tuck03 US Army vet) - CEO   Co-founder PureLiving China (masks) Sarah Millard (PEA 92 Wellesley 96 Tuck 02) - Co-founder PureLiving China (masks) Hunter Xia (Tuck 01) - CEO China Channels and FITBOX Beijing (import and distribution) Holly Landsittel (Dartmouth 97 Tuck 02) - GoFundMe savante Rob Bailey (PEA 89 Brown 93 MIT Sloan 99) - CEO   Founder Backbone AI (power connector) Russell Washington (PEA 89 DePaul 96) - Genius Connector of all the above folks   NOTE:  KN95 masks - comparable to industry standard N95 - have  provisional CDC approval   for use during the US Covid-19 outbreak. Please contact Lisa with questions about this effort or other organized local and national efforts to augment short-term PPE supply.

title: Support Court of Gamers COVID-19 Relief
description: Hey hon welcome in!  Its words that Ive said on a daily basis since I finally completed my dream of opening Court of Gamers running my own business. I tell the story all the time how the really beat up open close sign hanging in our front window has been under my bed since I was four years old and boldly claimed to my parents that I was only ever going to work for myself. Not exactly how it worked out but close enough for me to still happily flip that sign every single day.  Court of Gamers is a family. I cant tell you how many times Ive heard the words Coming here is like coming to a friends house. its what I strive for every day. Were a place to escape the world that is stressful and hard. The idea of losing CoG (As shes affectionately known) terrifies me to my core.  The last few days have been filled with tears as I have stressed over my small business. But I know Im not alone in this. COVID-19 is threatening small businesses non-profits and so many more. Which is why were running our GoFundMe a little bit differently than others.  We know you can only donate so much and money can only go so far. Thats why Court of Gamers is going to help others. A portion of your donations will go to help other small businesses most specifically a small Chinese restaurant. If youve been to CoG youve probably been to the wonderful Tang St. Theyre a second family to us and neither of us want to continue without the other.  Secondly were going to be giving a portion to Thrive Youth Center. Thrive is an amazing wonderful place. Ive been so fortunate Ive never needed their help but so many LGBTQ kids do. With colleges closing people are forced to go home right now and sometimes home isnt the best place or even worse not an option.  Court of Gamers has never been about me my store my life. Its always been about you even if you reading this has never been into CoG. It doesnt really matter. CoG has always been there for you a safe haven an inclusive haven. With your help and with the help of #SmallBusinessRelief were not going anywhere. Were going to help our neighbors in these trying times. We will see the other side of COVID-19  Thank you so much for taking the time to read this and thank you even more if you hit that donate button. May the days ahead be better than those behind us.  Sondra

title: Revo Soccer Doral Covid-19 Relief Fund
description: We have been serving our Miami soccer community for more than 8 years.   We have overcome Hurricane shut downs saturated supply of our services and many other hurdles but nothing could have prepare us for this.     We offer a variety of service such as kids academy leagues tournaments and birthday parties.   We need you to help us continue servicing you and ask you to please help us maintain our doors open once we are able to come back.  We will use the fund to cover some of our monthly expenses such as utility bill employees salary and rent.  We need to reach $25000 to cover at least half of our monthly expenses so if you have played with us please donate at least the cost of one game ($10).

title: #WhereUBean Barista COVID-19 fund
description: No one knew this pandemic would bring the world to a practical halt. The impact is far and wide and WhereUBean is feeling it too.
