title: Moms Making Masks: Help Us Fight COVID-19
description: Hi everyone  We are Maria and Sue best friends looking to help make a difference in the COVID crisis.   The PPE (personal protective equipment) shortage is real. Despite media coverage and the governments assurances that masks are being delivered our front line workers are not getting them. Every day doctors nurses PCAs and respiratory therapists are terrified to go to work constantly worrying about the PPE supply and what will happen when these essential items run out.  These healthcare providers are being forced to wear the same mask for long shifts only allowed to change them out a week at a time. While many of us get to stay home during this pandemic they are literally going to war... putting their own lives at risk to save others each and every day. We cannot let them go into battle without the proper protective equipment. These heroes deserve a safer way to do their jobs so that they can continue to save lives while minimizing the risk of exposure to themselves.  Were calling on the community to please help us help them. To aid ongoing efforts we are raising money to make filtered masks for those on the front line. 100% of the funds will go towards these masks and other essential equipment.  Other ways you can help:  - Please share this link with friends   family.  - If you have fabric elastic thread filters or any other material that you would like to donate please contact us. Every bit helps!  Thank you! Maria Bizzoco   Sue Monteleone

title: Shays COVID-19 Hospital Mask Appeal
description: Doctors and other medical staff like my father are going to be working against overwhelming odds in the coming weeks through the COVID-19 outbreak with minimal equipment to protect them.  This is a campaign to try to help all UK hospitals get supplies to help protect these heroes. Currently healthcare workers in some circumstances are having to share masks with their colleagues between shifts as there are not enough to go around. These people are in the front line of this extremely contagious virus without proper PPE protection as supplies worldwide are limited.  Shays father is a doctor at a hospital in Bristol. Last week we learned that at his hospital staff are working with minimal personal protective equipment. These are our front line heroes who are/will be in continuous contact with this virus without proper protection. As soon as medical staff begin to get sick the number of civilian deaths are going to escalate tremendously. These are people with families who are knowingly risking their lives to help us. Since this is especially close to home for us (as Shay is extremely worried about her father) we put a private call-out on Facebook to friends asking if they could help out. In 12 hours we raised enough funding to kit the entire hospital with branded PPE supplies: 800 face masks anti-viral gloves surgical masks hazmat snoods etc. They say that when everything we have sent is delivered they will have enough equipment for all staff members.   Practically overnight a community of friends came together and raised enough funds to kit out a small hospital. Think what a great difference that has made for the medical staff (and families) at this hospital. Imagine the fear of knowing they are on the front line for a contagious virus without proper protection? Now not only is this hospital going to be protected but we also had extra funding to begin sourcing supplies for Homerton Hospital London. We have already made a new contact within Guy and St. Thomas Hospital London so now we can focus on those. We will update this page when we become aware of hospitals that still need protective gear and what it is they are desperately in search of - this list is likely to change daily.   We are a group of event professional organizers with complex logistics experience experienced in making things happen instantly. We are actively using our supply chain skills to buy up any protective equipment we find from places that the NHS does not have the resources to tap into - and get these sent to the hospitals that need them. Everything we source is being sent directly to a known person within hospitals - this way we can directly learn what stock is urgent what they will be running out of but also that the supplies we are buying in have arrived safely. We aim to keep everyone updated with photographs of these updates from hospitals.   Furthermore if anyone is able to help with providing these supplies directly outside of this Go Fund Me please let us know so that we can give you a list of what is needed and the addresses/contact names to send them. We are happy to use this funding to help you with costs such as postage.  In less than 12 hours a group of friends managed to send out enough masks to kit out a small hospital giving the medical team at least some kind of respiration protection against Covid-19. Imagine what a larger group of people could achieve? Were ready and able to do this for more hospitals and get more PPE equipment to front line workers.  We still have time to get more protective gear to our NHS and private healthcare workers before the outbreak truly starts to peak. Anything you can spare goes directly to buying masks gloves and whatever else we can find thats useful. If you are able to contribute somehow please contact us and lets make this happen. Help our heroes to help us.  Lets get the NHS what they need  Mak Anna + Shay Islington Metalworks

title: Nsb Group X Covid19
description: Nsb Group uniti per la guerra contro il COVID19.Aiutaci a raggiungere lobiettivo basta poco una piccola donazione può fare la differenza. #salviamoci #italiaintrincea #nsbgroupcovid19

title: Dipendenti Asl Na1 Centro per emergenza Covid-19
description: In questo momento di crisi mondiale cè gente che non ha  i soldi per mangiare aiutiamoli con un fondo che permetta lacquisto di generi alimentari. Aiutiamo chi non ha nulla in questo momento tragico. Noi come gruppo ASL NA1 possiamo aiutare concretamente coloro che sono in difficoltà in questo momento

title: Kicking Corona with Soccer
description: Quarantined and Bored?    So are we!  Heading outside and kicking around with our soccer balls is definitely helping us pass the time.   Weve been thinking a lot about the kids at  William Wells Brown  during this time. 90% of WWB families receive free   reduced lunch. Extras like games and activities arent always available.  They are also  Quarantined and Bored.   We usually spend Monday afternoon visiting with them   playing soccer together but cant right now due to COVID19. They dont have a lot to do   would love to practice their soccer skills while they #stayathome   They return to WWB to pick up their meals each day and we would love to bring a  NEW SOCCER BALL  to be handed out to each child with their meal.  Would you please help us reach our goal of being able to purchase  *200 NEW SOCCER BALLS*  for the kids at  William Wells Brown?

title: Give Them a Chance to Make it - Fighting Covid-19
description: The number of people in Ireland with Covid 19 that will need intensive care and of other  medical assistance will increase day by day.  Would you ever choose between saving your  Grandparents lives or your Parents lives?            Would you ever choose between saving your  Parents lives or your Brothers or Sisters lives?   This is what has happened in hospitals in Italy.  Doctors had to decide which patients with  Covid-19  to treat and which ones not to treat.   And all of this because of shortage of intensive care beds and/or medical equipment and supplies  The awful Italian experience was that the older  you were the less chance you had to be treated.  SO THE OLDER YOU WERE THE LESS  CHANCE TO HAD TO MAKE IT.   We are Annaoliva and Vanessa Durigon .            We are Italian sisters living and running our own online business Shapemoda.com here in Ireland and we want to help Irish hospitals to combat Covid-19. Irish doctors and nurses will find themselves in a very unique overwhelming never seen before   emergency situation.  When this happened in Italy Italians were left     alone and they started to create funds to buy        intensive care beds medical equipment and  supplies to help doctors and nurses save lives.  Ireland has given us so much. And now through    this unbelievable period it is time for us to give   back and to do something useful.    We decided to open this fund raising with our   own donation of   € 3000 to help all Irish                hospitals face this Corona virus crisis.   We are here to ask you for your donations.           Please donate as much or as little as you can.       Every little bit will help the doctors and nurses  combat this deadly virus.  Save your Grandmothers and Grandfathers         save your Mums and Dads save your Sons and   Daughters.   Make sure that all of them will have a chance to make it.

title: O.B. CONTRA EL COVID19
description: Desde OB89 iniciamos esta recaudación de dinero para ayudar en la lucha contra el Coronavirus el dinero que recaudamos ira destinado a la compra de material sanitario y comida que será entregada al hospital sierrallana.  Animamos a todos los Gimnásticos y Torrelaveguenses a colaborar con nosotros.  Juntos somos más fuertes.

title: Feed Covid19 Night Shift Doctors
description: The Royal Free Hospital London NHS is made up of the most amazing people who are being asked to put themselves in the front line to look after our loved ones. It is wonderful to see so many initiatives to help the NHS however we are addressing a specific issue to provide support to the Acute Covid Medical Response Unit at The Royal Free.   We want to help our local hospital and specifically ensure that there is a hot meal available to the doctors who are on duty and working incredibly long hours. Here is a note below sent from one of the Consultants in this department.     Many thanks for so kindly having covered the hot food deliveries for our team of night time Doctors at the Royal Free Hospital in the last week.   This is invaluable help given the large workload faced by a team of doctors on the front line.    Usually we would have five doctors on any given night shift who would cover the acute medical admission and Inpatient wards. This team has been increased to 40 on-site doctors per night shift who have been pulled in from o  ther hospital and GP placements. They are on a rota of three nights on three nights off which is a very tough schedule. As you can imagine their access to no hot food in the hospital coupled with massively long hours was raised as an immediate concern to address. The hospital still cant provide hot food to the team of doctors and so we have relied on local communities to help in whichever way to allow for the provision of hot food at night. Having done the night shifts the time saved in procuring different foods and also allowing the team to take a meal together has proved to be one the best morale boosters in these times of greatest challenge facing our lifetime careers in Medicine.     I am most grateful for all your help in easing the stressful circumstances we are facing and will keep you updated with pictures and statements from the doctors for whom your kindness is resulting in direct improvement of their   well being    Best Wishes    Dr Amir Jehangir    Consultant - Acute Medicine   Royal Free Hospital   Please give generously so that we in the local community can provide the support system they need to cope for the coming months.  Each week we will provide funds directly to the lead doctor to ensure the whole team is fed after a long shift. We hope £25k will be sufficient funding for the doctors for 3 months.   We will provide the funds through a dedicated prepaid credit card that will be given to the lead consultant to use on a daily basis.   All donations will make an immediate impact and if we raise incremental funds then we will be able to extend the period beyond 3 months.  We would like to add our sincere thanks to Spielburger Restaurant (Hampstead) and Maido Sushi who have kindly offered to provide a number of meals free of charge to the Acute Medical Response Unit.

title: NCC Corona Fund
description: Dear Fellow Members  Acknowledging that these are difficult times for all regardless of your profession business or even in retirement we are hoping first this email finds you well and safe.    The point of this request is to reinforce our proclamations that “we are family” at NCC.  To do so is to recognize that our dedicated and awesome staff and support employees are most likely not in the same financial condition they were in just but a few weeks past.   Not to mention the expected income they were planning to earn along with tips during the annual club reopening in March.    To that we have opened this Go Fund Me page as some members asked that we all consider a donation to go to our fine staff similar to what we do during the Holidays.   We are managing this fund as a mechanism to benefit staff less fortunate than all of us.  The need to get this money to everyone is of course immediate.  As such we hope to conclude this find drive by April 15th or sooner if we make our goal.  Thank you in advance for your consideration and contribution and please be safe.    Russ Fisher                                     Bob Conroy  Russfisher1950@rcn.com      rconroy13@yahoo.com

title: Riojanos ayuda Material Medico Covid19
description: El personal sanitario y los hospitales están teniendo carencias de numerosos materiales y equipamiento.  No sólo están arriesgando sus vidas sin medios sino que en muchas ocasiones no se esta pudiendo ayudar a los pacientes como sería necesario. Apelamos a todos los riojanos a que ayuden en nuestro proyecto aportando la cantidad que les sea posible para tratar de acelerar las compras de los siguientes materiales: Respiradores material de protección gorros mascarillas ffp2 mascarillas quirúrgicas gafas pantallas protección batas impermeables calzas solución hidroalcohólica test camas completas guantes... Hemos creado un equipo de profesionales que van a dejarse la vida en conseguirlos gracias a sus conocimientos empresariales de idiomas y de compras internacionales. ¡El momento es ahora! Las compras van a ir destinadas al Servicio Riojano de Salud o donde en su momento ellos nos indiquen también a conseguir material para la red de impresores en 3d que están fabricando numerosos elementos. Si en algún momento no existe una finalidad para gastar los fondos serán transferidos a Cruz Roja para su uso en esta crisis. Sanitarios hoy nos estáis ayudando mañana seréis eternos. Esto es por y para vosotros.

title: Help Da Silvano de Corona-tijd door! Covid-19
description: Da Silvano  is een  Italiaanse  delicatessenwinkel gerund door ZZP”er Silvan Claassens te Middelburg.  Mijn motto en uitgangspunt is altijd geweest…..  “Proef het ware Italië”  Altijd heb ik willen werken met kleine locale bedrijven in Italië zodat het ware Italië geproefd kan worden. Ik wil kost wat kost deze producten behouden en kunnen blijven afnemen zodat de getroffen bedrijven daar waar ik de mooiste producten van afneem….. ook kunnen blijven bestaan!   Ik heb alles op alles gezet om mijn concept aan te passen voor de online menus en verkoop echter dit levert met de winkelverkoop samen nog maar 10% op van de normale verkoop. Kantoren die altijd hun lunch verzorgd wilden zien hoor ik al sinds begin februari niet meer.  Alle catering is van de ene op de andere dag gestopt. Ik kreeg een regen van annuleringen terwijl wel de kosten al gemaakt waren! Dit alles na de uitbraak in Italië van dit virus!   Mensen blijven thuis heel begrijpelijk in deze onzekere tijd.. Deze crisis heeft hierdoor een grote impact op mijn bedrijf. Ik zou er graag nog willen zijn met mijn winkel als deze crisis achter de rug is. Maar…. ook voor mij is het moeilijk ik behoor helaas ook tot de risicogroep!  Mijn Italiaanse delicatessenwinkel ben ik met veel enthousiasme gestart maar helaas eind 2018 ben ik geconfronteerd met zware hartproblemen (2 hartinfarcten en stilstanden). Dit heb ik overleefd en ben vol goede moed weer gestart! Alles is weer op de rit en nu overvalt ons allen deze vreselijke Corona-crisis!  Zolang het mogelijk is probeer ik de winkel draaiende te houden. Ik zie echter geen mogelijkheid meer dit vol te houden tot…. wanneer….??? De Italiaanse leveranciers leveren al sinds begin februari geen of weinig producten zodat ik al niet meer kan voldoen aan sommige vragen van de klanten. De huur en rekeningen lopen echter door en ik zou echt niet weten hoe ik dit verder kan oplossen met deze sterk verminderde omzet. Ik sta nu met mijn rug tegen de muur.  Ik zou het zeer waarderen als jullie mij willen helpen deze tijd te overbruggen. Ik leg al mijn schroom neer en vraag u om een vrijwillige donatie om straks als alles achter de rug is door te kunnen gaan zoals vanouds. Als blijk van waardering voor uw donatie krijgt u van mij als ik na de Lockdown weer gewoon kan doorgaan: bij een donatie van € 6 tot € 15 - Een heerlijke Italiaanse zoetigheid bij een donatie van € 15 tot € 50 - Een panini naar keuze bij een donatie van € 50 of hoger - Een traiteurmenu voor 2 personen  Bij voorbaat hartelijk dank!   U kunt altijd nog per mail  of telefoon 06 20900900 bestellen bij mij. Indien voorradig wil ik het graag voor u klaar maken en kunt u het op afspraak afhalen / of ik bezorg het aan huis. Ik zal jullie op alle social media op de hoogte houden hoe alles verder zal lopen en zal gaan.   Een goede gezondheid is de grootste rijkdom dit wens ik jullie allemaal.  Groetjes  Silvan Claassens Geerepassage 1 4331 MK Middelburg  06 20900900

title: Corona virus care home help
description: Care homes are in need of air beds and sleeping bags for staff to stay overnight for several days. These measure will help our loved ones stay safe and help limit the spread of this deadly virus. Ive set a small target.... enough to buy 10 single air beds and a pump to inflate them from Argos to donate. Please donate so I can order them and get them delivered.....

title: Veganes Essen für Berlin auch nach Corona!
description: Seit 2017 gibt es nun das MANA Restaurant in Berlin Schöneberg. Mit Hilfe unseres kreativen internationalen Küchenteams haben wir schon den Ein oder Anderen Fleischesser davon überzeugt dass pflanzliche Kost nicht nur gut für uns und unsere Umwelt ist sondern auch richtig gut schmeckt. Und die Hafermilch im Cappuccino mindestens genauso viel kann wie Kuhmilch ;)  Und genau das war immer unser Antrieb: Vegan essen muss nichts mit Einschränkungen und Dogmatismus  zu tun haben vielmehr heißt vegan für uns:  Abwechslungsreiches leckeres und umweltfreundliches Essen für das kein Tier sterben muss.      Was in den letzten 25 Jahren passiert ist hätten wir uns nicht zu träumen gewagt! Bei unserem ersten Treffen vor 3 Jahren waren wir noch voller Selbstzweifel ob Berlin-Schöneberg ein veganes Restaurant überhaupt akzeptieren wird und ob wir das finanzielle Risiko eingehen sollten das eine Restauranteröffnung so mit sich bringt. Aber der Drang den veganen Gedanken voranzutreiben war doch größer als jeder Zweifel.-  Wie sich gezeigt hat war die Entscheidung sich durchzubeißen die richtige. Seit unserer Eröffnung im Oktober vor 25 Jahren (nachdem die wunderbaren Freunde Anna Vicky und Phillip vielen lieben Dank!) dem Mana die nötige Gemütlichkeit verliehen haben kamen von Monat zu Monat mehr Gäste vorbei.    Das was am Ende übrig blieb wurde ins Mana investiert. Nach und Nach wurden alte und kaputte Küchengeräte ausgetauscht neue Stühle bestellt und das allerschönste: Das Team wuchs!    Inzwischen haben wir ein unglaubliches Team an großartigen Menschen um uns (DANKE an unser Küchenteam Chris M. Barney Maria Gustav Maria-Laura Yannick Davide Chris K. Hector und Blaise!) (DANKE an unser Serviceteam Carina Emma Niklas Jasmin Sadhana Suleika Lucas Milly Joschi Janne!) mit dem wir den veganen Gedanken auch weit über die Grenzen von Berlin Schöneberg heraustragen wollten.-  Und dann kam die Krise.  Die Umsätze sind eingebrochen und solange die Krise anhält ist eine Besserung nicht in Sicht. Die Miete muss weiter bezahlt werden die Strom- und Heizrechnung die Versicherungen die Löhne. Dazu kommen Kosten für Kassensystem sowie Tilgungszahlungen.  Für eine Beantragung von Zuschüssen haben wir zu viele Mitarbeiter (diese können in Berlin ausschließlich für eine Mitarbeiterzahl von max. 5 Mitarbeitern beantragt werden) für einen Corona-Kredit sind wir zu jung (wir müssten 3 Jahre alt sein).  Bitte helft uns damit wir die nächsten Wochen mit unserem Team überstehen und auch in Zukunft veganes Essen im Mana in Berlin-Schöneberg anbieten können!  Jeder Spender wird auf unsere Re-Opening Party eingeladen die wir veranstalten werden sobald der Virus keine Gefahr mehr darstellt.   Für alle Spender die uns mit 50 Euro und mehr helfen: Für euch wird es vor der Party noch ein exklusives Buffet mit veganen Köstlichkeiten geben.   DANKE  3  3  3   eure Tina Magdalena und Kaya und natürlich das gesamte Mana-Team

title: Impresión 3D - Emergencia COVID-19
description: Dada la falta de material sanitario en los hospitales hemos decidido poner en marcha la impresión en 3D de material de apoyo para profesionales sanitarios y pacientes.Por un lado estamos haciendo máscaras para intentar proteger a todo el personal sanitario de posibles contagios.Por otro lado estamos empezando a producir válvulas que permitan la adaptación de los respiradores y poder ayudar a salvar la vida de todos esos pacientes que están presentando grandes dificultades respiratorias.¡¡Necesitamos vuestra ayuda para poder sacar adelante el proyecto!!Ayudadnos a proteger a nuestros profesionales sanitarios ellos se están dejando la vida por ayudarnos a que nosotros conservemos la nuestra.Y apoyemos a todos aquellos que han tenido la desgracia de contagiarse por el virus… ¡no dejemos que “este bicho” acabe con ellos!¡Esta es una carrera contrarreloj pero JUNTOS PODEMOS HACERLO!Muchísimas gracias a todos.

title: Tutti con il Dott. Cavanna contro il COVID 19
description: LAMOP (associazione malato oncologico piacentino) supporta liniziativa del dottor Cavanna che insieme ad alcuni medici dellospedale di Piacenza muniti di saturimetro ecografia ed alcuni farmaci va casa per casa per trattare i sintomi del COVID19 prima che la situazione degeneri. Aiutiamoli a renderlo possibile con un piccolo ma grande gesto.  “Un gruppo di persone che condivide un obiettivo può raggiungere limpossibile”  GRAZIE

title: Corona Relief for Iloilo
description: My name is Maria Tina and am from Iloilo Philippines. I currently work as a nanny with a family in Jupiter FL but am in self-isolation at home and my family back home in the Philippines are in quarantine.  My home town is in total lockdown even with supermarkets closed so the people in my hometown are depending on the government for relief goods. That is not enough and I am planning to bring food products for my family and my wish is to give something for my people too.  If you would like to join me in helping send boxes of canned goods and emergency products we would be so grateful.  Most of the people in lockdown here have nothing and are poor with no one to help them really.  Thank you and God bless.

title: Masks Against Corona
description: As we come together to fight this global pandemic that is the Coronavirus we must not forget to support one another.   As the number of victims rise so to does the demand for Personal Protective Equipment especially  MASKS . Whether you are going to the supermarket on a grocery run caring for a sick family member an airline employee first responder we must all protect one another and do our best to stay healthy.   My husband (Robert Merino) and I along with our companies Tiny Elephant Gift Shop and Transit919 are looking forward to lending our skills and helping  produce as many masks as possible. We have converted our small businesses into face mask manufacturing facilities.     Please help us help our communities. Our doctors should not have to worry about PPE in a time of crisis nor a mother just going to get milk. All masks being produced are being donated free of cost.  Again  w  e are  NOT  selling masks but accepting donations.  All funds will be used for materials cost of electric bill for our machinery and shipping of masks. No donation is too small. We appreciate your generosity.

title: Clinical Study of Natural Therapies for COVID-19
description: We have a breakthrough natural product that is a powerful modulator of overactive immune signaling.  We need your help to get it into clinical trial for those that are at risk or are critically ill.  For the “At Risk” and critically ill Covid-19 patients the assault on the Immune System is massive. The pneumonia symptoms that the severely ill experience is a result of this massive assault where viral loads in the lung tissue trigger a Huge immune response in large part triggered by immune protein hormones called Cytokines.  My lab and other labs I have managed have studied these Cytokines in the autoimmune and the critically ill. The Italians recently have discovered in the midst of their crisis that a Cytokine based drug that inhibits Cytokine IL-6 has been a “Life Saving Intervention”.  The pharmaceutical companies are RUNNING after testing these drugs for those critically affected. The problem with these drugs is that they are not natural and that they can carry serious risks for the patient.   Have we as a community completely written off natural approaches? There are a number of natural products that actually block IL-6. One of these is curcumin.  Curcumin supplements have been widely used in the last decade. In 2015 Curcumin was the Ingredient of the Year for Nutrition World. The safety and adoption of Curcumin as a supportive aid has been wide-spread by the Integrative and Naturopathic practitioner communities.   Curcumin has been shown to be a natural modulator of IL-6. Curcumin: An Effective Inhibitor of Interleukin-6  (  https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/27719643   /)    The difficulty in using regular Curcumin is that it is VERY poorly absorbed and many formulations require WEEKS of loading doses in order to achieve a perceived benefit. Because most curcumin formulations require weeks of loading doses in order to have a therapeutic effect they are not good candidates for clinical study for Covid-19.   I left Pharma 12 years ago to pursue Natural Medicine. My company Ultra Botanica LLC has developed a novel formulation UltraCur that takes molecular Curcumin and utilizes a Protein scaffold to enable the absorption of Curcumin molecules into cells. In a survey of patients 70% of patients reported a significant benefit within a week and 50% of those people reported a significant benefit within 24 hours underlining the anecdotal observations of how quickly UltraCur is assimilated and provides relief of symptoms related to cytokine exacerbations.  It is the belief of the company that the use of UltraCur with asymptomatic or symptomatic patients at risk  could  significantly alter and improve the outcome and severity of the course of the disease.   In order to get our product into the main stream use we DESPERATELY need to conduct clinical studies to show its benefit. Theres no way to break through the high castle walls of Western medicine with a natural product approach unless you have clinical data to support it.   So my friends I beg you to help support what were trying to do! We dont need a lot of money to conduct clinical studies to test the benefit of UltraCür in at risk patients and in people that are getting severely ill.   Our promise to the world is that if we test as a helpful therapy we will provide our product at Cost to those that are critically sick.  https://adobe.ly/2Uipxb3

title: Highway Solos. Aiuta Osp.SACCO vs Corona Virus .
description: Nasce come progetto musicale a scopo benefico .  Ideato e coordinato da Francesco Corapi  (Chitarrista Compositore Speaker Radiofonico Collaboratore Metal.It  )e Guglielmo Malusardi (Giornalista Musicale Esperto di Chitarrismo ) con la collaborazione di Mauro Matteucci ( Elevate Records  produzione  mix  . master) Pino Magliani( discografico Elevate Speaker Radiofonico ) Gianluca Grazioli ( giornalista metal.it)   Highway Solos nasce con lidea di conseguire un obiettivo meritorio e benefico  attraverso un coordinato lavoro di squadra . Dieci chitarristi  un tastierista  un bassista  un batterista  che attraverso la propria arte  hanno dato dato corpo  allideazione di questo lungo brano nel quale si alternano in maniera  funambolica e godibile al tempo stesso. Il tutto in forma totalmente gratuita di slancio e con squisita disponibilità   Il lavoro dinsieme è stato realizzato in tempi ultra rapidi proprio per poter contribuire il più velocemente possibile attraverso la raccolta fondi dedicata  ad aiutare lOspedale Luigi Sacco di Milano nella propria battaglia contro la pandemica situazione attuale.   Auspichiamo a fronte di un impegno massivo corale  e altruista di ricevere una altretattanto  meritoria e generosa risposta da parte degli ascoltatori  ancorchè  non classificabili come appassionati del genere musicale chitarristicamente orientato.   MUSICISTI : Chitarristi in ordine di solo STEFANO “SEBO” XOTTA NICOLA DENTI SIMONE GIANLORENZI LUCA COLOMBO MATTEO BRIGO FRABRIZIO “BICIO” LEO MARCO SFOGLI DANIELE GOTTARDO FRANCESCO CORAPI ANDREA MARTONGELLI MISTHERIA ( keytar solo e tastiere ) ROBERTO FASCIANI (basso ) VALERIO LUCANTONI (batteria)

title: Help me support a friend and a victim of COVID19
description: Ive knowing Desiree for a few years now. I knew I would be friends with her from day one. I love this family. They are our family now too. My son Dre is best friends with her youngest daughter Eva.  When she texted me that she tested positive for COVID19 it broke my heart to hear someone so close to me go was experiencing this. We always think it wont be us it wont be me. Yet it could.  I ask that you reach in your heart and help me raise money for them. Desiree has lost her job. She has three kids to support. Her two oldest are in college and they were quarantined so they couldnt work either. Her daughter Eva is in third grade and I cant imagine what they went through without their mom.  Desiree is a single mom. This has never stopped her though. She has always been a strong and Independent woman in my eyes. The last time I saw her was two months ago when she was selling Girl Scout cookies with Eva.  She has been quarantined for weeks at the hospital. This hit their family so hard. Emotionally and financially. She made it though and I thank God for that. She is alive thats whats most important! I know that we can all do our part and show our sister in Christ how good we can be to each other. Thank you from the bottom of my heart.

title: bKL Architectures COVID-19 Face Shield Initiative
description: bKL Architecture is doing our part to be of service during the COVID-19 crisis by creating face shields that can be used primarily by healthcare workers during this pandemic.   We delivered our first batch to University of Chicago doctors on March 28th!  Our current stock of 3D printers can produce 50 face shields per day. We are aiming to double our production to 100 shields per day with four more 3D printers. We are also working on gathering more materials. Materials needed to create each shield cost only 75 cents. For every $100 donated bKL can make an additional 75 shields! For every $500 donated thats the equivalent of 1/8 of another 3D printer.   If you are able please consider donating any amount to assist us with this effort. All contributions will be used for additional printers and materials.  All 3D printers purchased using contribution funds will be donated to bKLs clients Chicago Public Schools and Chicago Public Library once the COVID-19 crisis has passed and/or PPE is more accessible.   Thank you for considering.   Stay well  The bKL Architecture Team

title: Wimbledon RFC needs YOU -Emergency COVID-19 appeal
description: Due to the Coronavirus outbreak the 2019/2020 season was cut short and Wimbledon RFC has been closed since 16th March 2020.  As yet we have no date for when we will be in a position to reopen.      From September to April our incredible facilities are used primarily by the wide range of inclusive and diverse teams at our club.  From April to September  we make the most of our facilities to generate income to support the ongoing running of our community Club.    With the recent outbreak of Coronavirus and the directive from the Government that sports facilities and places of leisure are to remain closed  as well as placing a ban on mass gatherings  we are due to enter the 2020/2021 season with the majority of our sources of income cut off.      The Club has already taken a number of drastic measures to cut its outgoings during the period of closure as well as making plans to access Government Grants.  There are however a number of immediately payable bills that without ordinary sources of income the Club needs YOUR help to pay.   This appeal is one off to ensure that we are in the best possible place to restart rugby at Wimbledon as soon as we are able to and go back to our winning ways.   We recognise that times will be tough for many of you but we hope our members supporters and friends will contribute if you can.

title: Help On My Grind Coffee During the COVID-19 Crisis
description: On My Grind Coffee has been serving the York Lancaster Dauphin and Cumberland Counties for the past 2.5 years. As a mobile coffee shop we primarily vend and cater at workplaces and events. We have donated to a number of nonprofits and charitable organizations over the years through working at fundraisers and giving back a percentage of sales. This is part of our business plan and philosophy.Now during the COVID-19 Pandemic we are asking for your generosity and support. We have had to shutdown our services starting March 16 2020.  All of the local events we were scheduled to serve at have been canceled or postponed.  Since most employees at the workplaces we typically serve are working from home or not working we have had to cancel those events as well.As a family we have been social distancing since members of our family have asthma and other lung issues. We are doing everything we can to not bring the virus into our household.No money is coming in from the business but many bills are still due. We will also need funds to purchase supplies when we do start back up.We hope to start serving the community again as soon as possible but right now the future is unkown. Any donation is greatly appreciated. Thank you!#SmallBusinessRelief

title: Steve Rhoads- COVID-19 Live Acoustic Fundraiser
description: Are you social distancing? Do you need something new to liven up your isolated life at home? Please join me TONIGHT [Saturday March 28th] starting at 7:00PM (EST) as I go live from my living room with many of your favorite acoustic classics!   I will be raising money via both VENMO [@steve-rhoads-6] and this GoFundMe page and donating the proceeds to the waitstaff and bartenders of local restaurants where I normally play who have been laid off due to COVID-19.    Please consider supporting these wonderful hardworking people who make my job fun and easy. It is important for our community to rally around those affected by these trying times.  Consider this a virtual tip jar!  VENMO: @steve-rhoads-6   GoFundMe:   https://www.gofundme.com/f/steve-rhoads-covid19-live-acoustic-fundraiser    Please share our efforts with your friends!  ** We will manually add Venmo donations on this page to keep an up to date live count of our fundraising goal!

title: Help American production of N95 respirators.
description: We are a veteran owned company that has a very pro America mindset. Chinese manufacturing is what has caused the US to be in this position and this is a huge wake up call for America. Our goal is to gain enough capital to start our own manufacturing in the US for the much needed N95 masks. We intend to source all raw materials from the US as well in order to ensure that our supply chain is not hindered by the Chinese government. When Covid-19 first broke out in Chine one of the first things that they did was halt all exportation of N95 masks which is one of the biggest factors in why in America we had such a large shortage. Major companies such as 3M couldnt even get their products out from their own factories in china because of this. This is one of the biggest reasosn why we need to promote production here in the United States.  Our ultimate goal is to ensure that hospitals and medical personnel are fully equipped with the appropriate PPE in order to ensure their safety and ability to continue working and provide medical attention to those in need. Nurses and doctors are on the front line of this battle and many of them are paying outrageous prices on Ebay just to get masks that their hospital can not provide them with. If our medical staff starts getting sick then they will no longer be able to provide medical assistance to those in need and hundreds of thousands of people will die. We are working on partnering with local hospitals to ensure that they never have a shortage of N95 respirators. We intend to Donate Hundreds of thousands of masks per month to nurses and first responders who are in desperate need of N95 Respirators. In the beginning of this pandemic I did not take it very seriously. It is something that millions of us did not take seriously and millions more still do not. As of yesterday over 400 people died from this virus in the USA and that number drastically increases every day. That is 4 times more than car accidents in the US. Millions of lives are at stake if we do not act fast and start manufacturing enough masks for everybody in the country let alone the doctors and nurses on the front line of this Virus. I have never started a crowdfund before because I never ask anybody for help. This is a different time and we need to act fast. We do not have time to wait on government financing. We need action now. The $100000 we are asking for will get us started in production with a machine that can potentially produce up to 50000 masks per day. We have already put in $20k of our own money and we have a location and all of the logistics figured out for manufacturing. If we fall short and are unable to raise the capital to start production we will use the funds to purchase as many masks as possible and donate them to hospitals that are in dire need. Thank you for your consideration.

title: Fighting COVID-19
description: Hi my name is Keelie Lorenz and I am trying to help raise money for my friends families medical bills due to her father fighting for his life due to the COVID-19.  Whatever you can donate    This is from his daughters post about him...“My dad is fighting for his life right now from COVID-19.   Im writing this behind tears. I didnt want to post this for privacy reasons and I needed time to process and cope. But he needs prayers now more than ever. I ask that you please read this.   To think that just 4 days ago I posted a stupid picture of my daughters “first pandemic” only to learn that later that night my dad would have to be put on a machine to help him breathe.   I havent been able to hug or see my dad in two weeks. He can not see his children grandchildren wife and those who love him dearly.   If you dont think coronavirus is a serious threat or real put yourself in his shoes.   If you are complaining about having to cancel plans put yourself in his families shoes.   Please pray for my dad. Pray for his strength and healing. Pray. Because that is all we can do for him right now.”

title: M4MD GRANT MATCHING Relief for COVID-19
description: Mad 4 My Dog like other small businesses is being heavily impacted by the COVID-19 crisis.  GoFundme Intuit Quickbooks and Yelp are MATCHING donations and giving grants to small bizes that raise $500 or more.  Anything raised will go toward paying employees who arent working paying property expenses and any other business expenses we will have to pay while we have extremely minimal revenue coming in.  This will just keep us above water until we can get back to our regular offerings and revenue.  #SmallBusinessRelief   THANK YOU SO MUCH... everyone is taxed now and only give if you can.  All small businesses are struggling and hoping we can just pick up where we left off when we are done!!

title: COVID19 EMERGENCY FUND 4 IMMIGRANT FAMILIES IN TX
description: Safety for Immigrant Womxn   Families amid COVID-19 Pandemic  Sueños Sin Fronteras de Tejas is calling upon our community during a very challenging time. We are currently providing direct support and service to a pregnant house-less immigrant woman and her family. For the last several months the woman and her family have been residing at the Ronald Mcdonald House at the Childrens Hospital of San Antonio where she has been supporting her son who recently received a transplant. On Friday March 27 2020 they were told by the RMDH administration that all families who resided in San Antonio needed to vacate the premises immediately due to strict “COVID-19 prevention measures.” Since this woman and her family are currently house-less they have nowhere to go or turn to during these  terrifying times  .   We understand that these times have caused hardship for our entire community. Still we are humbly asking for your assistance in supporting this family through our Emergency Fund that will help us provide immediate housing food resources and health supplies. Our fund is not only to support this family but other undocumented/asylum-seeking families that we are extending outreach to in San Antonio and along the US/MX border. As a grassroots collective that does not receive consistent funding we rely heavily on monetary donations to make our work possible and we are asking for your immediate support.    How the money will be used: - Direct Housing stipends for rent hotel Airbnb - Groceries - Diapers - Medical fees - Health supplies - Over the counter medications    Who the fund will support:   Many of the womxn we serve are single mothers who recently arrived in this country as asylum seekers have recently been released from CBP or ICE detention undocumented under the MPP program living in refugee encampments along the border survivors of domestic violence house-less etc. Over the last two weeks we have seen multiple cases where immigrant mothers have been taken advantage of by individuals and institutions under the guise of COVID-19 prevention. What we are witnessing is blatant racism lack of trauma sensitivity and cultural competency amid a global health crisis. SSFTX is always committed to advocating these womxn and children at all costs while searching for housing arrangements and other essential resources for these families.   Why we are asking for your support:  At SSFTX we believe that serving the needs of immigrant womxn and mothers is not an act of charity but a matter of REPRODUCTIVE JUSTICE. A crucial part of advancing reproductive justice is ensuring that marginalized womxn and families are in safe healthy environments especially during a public health crisis. The womxn we serve are living in highly vulnerable situations due to the cruelty and injustice of the U.S. immigration system and the lack of a safety net for undocumented people in this country. With COVID-19 cases skyrocketing in the most vulnerable of communities across the United States immigrant families facing discrimination are pushed further into the margins. SSFTX has been making grocery and diaper deliveries to the womxn we serve and conducting virtual wellness check-ins since the onset of the crisis here in San Antonio; however the needs of the families are increasing daily with the severity of this crisis.   The current dialogue and legislation around COVID-19 relief efforts by this administration leave out the voices of immigrants asylum-seeking and undocumented womxn thus creating an erasure of their lives and realities amid this crisis.   CALL TO ACTION:  If you are able please consider contributing to our fund to help our womxn and families. during these unprecedented times.   There are thousands of immigrant families and individuals who are without access to adequate medical care and because of their work arent able to socially distance themselves. All families and that includes immigrant families deserve access to testing care and financial support from the government to survive #COVID19. These families deserve to be #SafeAndTogether in this moment of global crisis.   If you would like to further engage in our advocacy efforts in keeping ALL immigrant families #SafeAndTogether please read our latest policy brief:   http://bit.ly/EndMPPCOVID19   and follow SSFTX on Instagram @suenossinfronterastx Facebook.com/SSFTexas and Twitter   https://twitter.com/SSFTexas    to stay updated with our advocacy actions.     En Solidaridad  The SSFTX Team Laura Emily and Eden
